title: The living fort
review: Fort was bombastic,must experience it.The possibilities of endurence of old people was shown in a good manner.

title: Unique Fort
review: The only live in fort to visit in India. Providing an unique experience of history and culture. Jain Temples are exquisite. Carving all around the fort will leave you spellbound. Palace museum is worth visiting.

title: Free fort good, paid for bit really poor
review: Careful - good reviews are for the lived in section of the fort. The Palace Museum (often called the fort) is a waste of time and money, and an expensive one! It looks pretty from outside, but there is little to see inside. No access to ramparts or views out except a small terrace at the top - where views are little better than from the many rooftop bars and restaurants. Overpriced, overcrowded, and underwhelming about sums it up.

title: The Marrakech of India !
review: This place is highly underrated. Indians pay a pretty penny to walk the quaint streets of Santorini and Morocco when they have an equivalent gem in their backyard. Windy streets, boutique cafes, street shops, smiling faces and 500 year old history come together in this fort !

title: Jaisal Fort: Confusing enough
review: Good and interesting fact: The whole fort is still alive and between the walls lives a city. The Part/Palace exists and seems very small from outside. The pieces which are on display makes one wonder whether this really was a palace at one time, or is it now turned into a small museum. Honestly, did not find anything in there which was impressive. The place is under control of the current royal heir and one can see that the place is not well kept.

title: Living Fort
review: The Golden City of India jaisalmer having Golden fort Sonar Kila. The whole fort made by yellow sandstone as well city. Stone polish used for painting. Lot of general house in city and inside fort function invitation painted for memories.

title:
Bewohnte Festung aus gelben Sandstein 
Fort made of Yellowstones sandstone
review: Crowded fort on top on the hill. Yellow sandstone with golden shine. Lot of small shops, but nice cafes also. Some of it offer a nice few over the old city ... and the far Dessert.

title: Golden fort
review: The fort has a gr8 view from the terrace top ,including restraunt view. The fort entrance is free but there is another mahal inside which has entry fee. Its a mini city where u can roam around & explore small shops ,artifacts & restro.

title: Overall okay but a bit pricy for what you got
review: The fort is okay, nothing really incredible... The audio-guide is a must as it tells you a lot of interesting things. The view is good tho. It's a bit expensive so not really a must,

title: One of best golden fort
review: One of  best fort in jaisalmer

title: Ancient and Golden Fort
review: Most probably the oldest fort in Rajasthan, its history dates back to King Jaisaldev, around 1000 years back. It shows the lineage till the current king - maharaja brijraj singh. King Jaisaldev, who allowed the people to stay in his fort.

title: Must visit in Jaisalmer
review: The fort is definitely a must see. The golden colour of the buildings really stands out, as do the intricate carvings on the windows and balcony. One thing that did spoil our visit was the large of motor bikes and scooters clogging the narrow streets. Local authority, please act to reduce this form of pollution.

title: Live in resort
review: This may be one of rare resort which is still inhabited by the local population. Gives one a good idea about the earlier times , lifestyles etc. has many hotels and restaurants inside the fort premises. Will need about 2 hours for a complete tour of the fort.

title: Fort
review: This is amazing fort.which has build without water.just stone by stone.beautiful window & the colour of stone yellow which looks like gold that's why its call Golden fort.

title: Tour today
review: Very different from anything else we have seen so far in India . Fort started over 800 yrs old . Stunning and a chilled City brilliant 360 degrees views over the town to the desert.

title: Well explained introduction to royal family of jaisalmar.
review: Using the audio tour guide to jaislamer Fort and museum, we have enjoyed learning more about their heritage and legacy. Smaller then other similar places in Udaipur and jaipur, it is still interesting and different. When in jaislamer don't miss it.

title: Jaisalmer was Golden city was really good
review: I love Jaisalmer City I staying in outside the Fort was calling Jaisalmer sons Guesthouse place view of the rooftop of the Guesthouse Safari was regret in judgement for experience

title: Jaisalmer fort
review: Wonderful trip. Only fort where one can find a full live city. Interesting markets and views. The guides are helpful. One can buy small items from the small shops and bargain too. The stuff is available at lesser rates in the market outside the fort area.

title: It’s why you came here!
review: The fort is the main attraction in Jaisalmer. Walking thru the gate, wandering up the stone road, making ones way thru the alley ways and experiencing the only fort in India that has people, over 4,000, living in it is unique.

title: Main Attraction of the city
review: The main attraction of Jaisalmer is its majestic Fort which itself is so huge that it accommodates some part of the city population.

title: Lovely
review: Great to be able to walk around.

title: Absolutely enchanting!
review: The fort was beautiful, magical, and stunning! I felt like I was walking around in a fairytale! The people in the fort were some of my most favorite! I absolutely loved being there! Pure magic!

title: The Golden Fort
review: The Fort is stunning. The steps are steep but when you reach the top the view is Awesomeness!!! The Fort has two ramparts on either side. The Brahmins lived in one part and they still do since generations and the Kshatriyas lived in the other. The kings domain was in the middle and he lived there with his many wives.

title: Ok
review: It was not wheel chair friendly and nothing much to see. The entire fort looks the same. I have heard that around 5000 family lives there in fort.

title: amazing secure structure 825 years old and throbbing with life
review: It is a beautiful fort built 825 years ago with an entire township in ite precincts. Highly secure in those tmes , even today from foot soldiers view point , it is impregnable design.  The very fact that for entire period of 800 years plus , it cintinues to be housing a living habitat  is astonishing. intricate street lay outs , huge double  parapet  along entire boundary  is unbelievable, given technology available that time for construction..

title: Beautiful architecture
review: Beautiful fort to visit. The architecture and the Jain temple are wonderful. Many restaurants and vendors. A must to visit

title: Old fort unique in it's own way
review: The Jaisalmer Fort looks stunning from outside. The RajMahal Palace inside the fort is mostly well maintained and contains interesting historical items like weapons, kitchen utensils, and many other royal items used by the royals of the fort are on display. Cannon Point is a must visit as it offers splendid view of the city from the top. I would recommend taking an audio tour or a guide for better experience as there is hardly any written description of places. You should also visit the Jain Temples and Havelis inside the fort. A unique fact about the fort is that it is one of the only few living forts in the world, i.e. a considerable portion of the population still lives inside the fort.

title: The living fort!
review: The most amazing thing about this fort is that its a living fort. There are around 4 thousand residents residing in the numerous homes here. Countless shops. 100+ hotels/guest houses. Numerous restaurants. Plus amazing view of the city.

title: Golden city fort
review: Jaiselmir fort,  can be described as the best living fort..

title: Living Fort
review: Its is one of the few living forts in India , everything is around the fort , it has very nice architecture and a must visit when in Jaisalmer

title: We spent an entire day at fort
review: We spent an entire day at fort just walking around and seeing the beautiful life inside the fort. There are cafes inside where you can just spend leisure time looking around the place. Amazing place overall.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: Looks grand from outside. Nothing much to see inside the fort. The surroundings of the fort are not maintained well.

title: A living fort
review: The difference between Jaisalmer Fort and others in Rajasthan is that this is a living fort. As you wander the narrow streets you’ll encounter lots of people going about their daily activities. You’ll also give way to many a cow in your wandering. The beautiful Jain temples are well worth a visit and din’t Forget to visit the expanded town with its historic villas outside the walls.

title: Family visit
review: The fort is very nice and beautiful place to visit. The architectural design is very nice. There few Jain temples inside the fort with beautiful and excellent sculptures on pillars and roof

title: Amazing Fort
review: If you want to go up to the top most point of this fort then its better to take an Auto which will take you very close to the top and rest of the distance which is not more than few minutes, one can walk.

title: Road To Jaisalmer
review: Visited the Jaisalmer by Road and it was a great experience. The road was Good surrounded by Deserts and Trees. The Jaisalmer Fort is very beautiful from outside as well as from inside. One say stay insides the fort and can have great experience. Shops are also inside and outside the fort.

title: Amazing place!
review: The forth is undoubtedly one of the particularity of the city. There are a lot of narrow streets and handcraft shops were you can buy any kind of typical souvenirs. It's not very big, so half day would be enough to visit most of it :)

title: A Living Fort
review: It was a surprise to see the fort is not merely a historic relic but is an inhabited one. There is a complete township that lives here. Several people live in houses inside the fort , and the fort is nicely lit during the light and its route is lined with many shops and eateries.

title: Living fort in jaisalmer
review: Its d only living fort. Good for a day visit. Stay in fort is not worth as mainly it is commercialised due to foregin tourists.

title: Beauty of jaislmer
review: Nothing to explain. Crowded inner side road  No space for sitting. Nothing maintained. Overall jaislmer city is good. Pleasant weather. Pure air. No pollution.

title: A living fort an unique experience
review: Jaisalmer Fort is the biggest attraction of Jaisalmer. It's golden coloured sand stone structure makes it unique. Also this one is a living fort where people living inside fort area that is quite interesting.

title: Visit to the Golden City
review: It’s recommended to go with an authorised guide, who will take you around the right places. Suryagarh Hotel had pre arranged a guide-Mr Raju , who did his best to cover the main sights at a very short time frame. The climb up from the car park area is a bit steep and hence its suggested to wear comfortable shoes/clothes/hats/sunglasses. The streets are narrow and busy with 2 wheelers/hand carts hence one needs to watch your path . Interesting to learn about the history of the land and the style of architecture used in the building

title: Nice fort with good views
review: It was a good visit but unfortunately some points were closed and we couldn’t visit it, the value for money wasn’t great and we have seen way better fort in Rajasthan. But as jaisalmer is a small town, it is one of the main attraction. You can still learn a lot about the history of the city.

title: Worth a few hours of your time
review: This is one of the main attractions in Jaisalmer. It’s perfect to explore during the heat of the day. You get an audio guide included in your ticket price. It’s 100 rupees extra for photos but I really don’t think it’s worth it because there isn’t a lot to photograph inside

title: Gold in the desert..!!!
review: This fort is huge and magnificent. It's a very big structure present amidst the desert city of Jaisalmer. The history associated to it is also of great interest. Also, inside the fort you can find the residents and market place. Therefore it's like a city inside the fort. A must visit place.

title: Don't miss this!
review: There aren't many living fortress towns left in the world (i.e., with occupied homes, thriving businesses,  hotels, restaurants, shops, etc.).  This one is not to be missed!

title: It's not a fort its a city
review: Go there but do not expect a fort-ish experience but a lot mere .. looks like some kingdom living but a modern kingmad may be

title: The site in Jaisalmer
review: Its a prime attraction with plently to walk around and see. Walking up is good if you have time and energy and can handle heat of the day.

title: Beautiful fort with fabulous views and shopping bazaars.
review: A great place to visit on a day trip. We stayed for a week in the fort and loved the relaxed, friendly ambience  and the amazing views from the walls. People from the fort welcomed us when we artived and wished us well when we left. You can stroll around the bazaars, relax in the rooftop restaurants or visit the fascinating Jain temples within the walls.  There are many rooftop restaurants  on the walls with panoramic views of the city and of the beautiful fort itself.

title: Un détour dans le désert
review: This fortress stands out in this city by its architecture. I didn’t go inside but the view worth a detour.

title: Beautiful place but needs cultural awareness for LOCALS!
review: Jaisalmer is a small city in the middle of a desert. The fort is definitely the landmark to visit that might be recognised from one of latest Batmans movies. Yet, despite of its beauty the place is more and more ran-down because of the locals that live there and don't really appreciate what they have. As a tourist I did not do any paid trips nor anything like this. The fort is opened and you can freely wander around which is really amazing to do. But as some of the reviews mentioned local community needs to become aware of this monument and take more care of it. Another thing that one might be bothered by are stranded dogs, which are everywhere and even if during the day they chill in the shade during the nighttime they attack passers by and are quite a bother. Regardless, one of the most beautiful man-made places in Rajasthan. Must visit.

title: Ancient Fort Inhabited by people and business
review: Surprised to find that nearly 4000 people live within the fort. There are 30 hotels and 40 eateries inside the fort. The view of Jaisalmer from the fort is beautiful.

title: Ashit Mehta
review: Extremely fabulous Jain Temples. Very great worship idols. Fort perse dirty. Good shopping area with plenty of bargaining. Enjoyed the visit but would have been happier if the place is kept clean

title: Great place to visit.  Avoid the high pressure sales people around this
review: We spent part of two days here and love the fort and all the beautiful structures.  We met a lovely gentleman who invited us to tour his old home-beautiful.   My daughter did lots of shopping.  You have to watch out for the people telling hard luck stories to get you to shop-I found out after a “pity purchase”, they use these tactics to get the foreigners to buy and many of these people are well off by Indian standard.  You can get some neat things from the legitimate shops here.

title: Amazing!
review: We stayed in the Fort! Which is the only fort in India you can actually stay in apparently. It’s stunning, every view from any rooftop restaurant is fantastic. The winding streets are so fun to roam and explore. Our favourite fort in India!

title: Well maintained Fort at Jaisalmer
review: Well maintained Fort at Jaisalmer.

title: Amazing
review: It is one of the best historical monuments in the world but commercialisation has ruined its beauty. Perhaps this the only fort where thousands of people live. Day by day the fort is loosing its originality. Government as well as the local public should take some serious steps to preserve this beautiful monument.

title: Tourist driver
review: In the Jaisalmer golden city today was desert festival and tomorrow it moving to desert village Sam tomorrow we will enjoy it come to visit Sam sand dunes

title: Can't go if bad leg or back
review: Beautiful golden fort but no way to avoid steep climb of many stairs to get the full view of the fort

title: Fair visit
review: Poorly managed fort , faded paint and rubbish here and there . Otherwise its a good  visit . Things at the fort sold at good rate after bargaining , and good leather product that I missed to buy which I m deeply regretted ...lol

title: Must visit
review: Good fort.. No need of guide.... Jain temple inside it is remain  close in afternoon...entry ticket is 100 pp

title: So much history
review: Entrance to the fort is from a busy street . Once you decide to visit this fort ,You have entered into a different world. I would recommend wearing running shoes or closed toe shoes. After  9 am cars or tuktuk are not lowed into the fort , as it is tourist time.Inside the fort there are approximately 3000 people that live there. You will find vendors of all kinds, jewelry , clothing, shoe etc. ( bargaining makes purchasing fun).A lot o f history  here, Jain temples, havalis,beautiful architect and just colourful people walking around. Streets are very narrow and motorcycles are all over the place, be cautious and walk to your left for safety .Number of people have cars, however they are parked at the entrance of the fort. Suggestion is to hire a government registered guide to give you a heritage tour,it will be worth the money .

title: Crowded but worth it
review: Once inside the fort, it’s okay but too many two wheelers allowed in which makes walking with young kids a bit stressful and dangerous.

title: Review of the fort
review: The best fort we've visited,the view is just breathtaking and the site seeing is also one of the birds eye

title: Not so great for tourist
review: This is a living fort which makes it a different one otherwise not so great as a fort. This is built using the golden stones so good for people having an interest in the historical and cultural point of view but very average with respect to tourist.  One can skip it if has seen other forts as Jaipur, Udaipur etc. The only good part is the view of the city from the top floor.

title: Visually spectacular, but needs upkeep
review: I had heard about the Jaisalmer fort all my life and at first sight it is indeed spectacular. The fort area also has its own charm and has many attractions despite the drawbacks such as the narrow roads. However the fort does need a major cleanliness drive, too much plastic sprayed especially on the hill where the fort is located. There should be a system whereby littering should be banned at the fort. Otherwise the fort is a must-see and was well worth the visit and wait.

title: Awesome Rajasthan
review: Sonar Kella

title: Desert safari
review: Jaiselmer is a small town with their own cultural beauty. The fort when it is light up in the evening is a sight to watch. You can also enjoy the camel safari in the desert.

title: Dont miss visiting this
review: This is one place that had me  wondering and admiring the beauty and the view it offers.one can see the blue city from the top as well see an occupancy of  about 50 to 80 families  who actually live there and go about their daily life ...try and peek in to the homes as you walk by,the women are so beautiful and one can feel history seeping through the walls.the only thing i didnt like are the wires and cables that snake their way through the beautiful houses and edicts

title: Colorful bylanes and shining gold of the fort..must see
review: We spent about 3 hours roaming around the bylanes of the fort and enjoyed being lost in the beauty of this fort. Still could not get enough of the beauty of this amazing fort. Raja ka mahal, Jain temples, various haveli's, hotel roof tops, antique shops everything about it was superb. Had a wonderful time.

title: Jaisalmer fort... What a waste..
review: With a great enthusiasm I along with my students visited the sonar killa..

title: The fort is outstanding and worth a visit with a beautiful view of GOLDEN CITY
review: Let me tell you something If you need a vibe of a Rajputana. Then this place is definitely for you and your family. The fort is a very good and covers a good space. Various weapons of the fort are kept inside. Moreover, the fort has a rooftop and a beautiful view of a golden city. The way to the fort is pretty Amazing and exiting. One could easily get lost in the culture of the city.

title: Brilliant place
review: Panarominc view of the city with fantastic food options and a lovely place to spend time during sunset

title: Living fort
review: Great heritage showing glorious past of Jaisalmer but at the same time very crowded since people live inside the fort itself

title: Up, down & all around
review: The sandstone Old Fort sits proudly on Trikuta Hill & is surrounded by 99 turrets. The most impressive views are from below or one of the many guest home or restaurant rooftops. The one feature that separates the old fort from all others is that there are 4,000 inhabitants living there. It's a charming place to stroll around. The highlight is the gargantuan gate as you enter the fort. There are some nice souvenir shops and cafes after you enter. You can spend $500 rupees if you want to tour the Haveli (mansion)...we opted to skip it.

title: Must visit
review: The fort is a marvel ,feast for the eyes, takes you back hundreds of years to another era.  The shops inside are the best..much better than the ones outside ..do take a guide to get a better n informed  view of its history

title: Best fort
review: I went to Amber fort, Mehrangarh fort, Red fort and this is probably the best. While all the other forts has their own history, this one is so alive. It feels like I'm travelling back in time with all the shops and actual inhabitants. Also has a great view of the golden city. Must not miss!

title: Forty
review: Very interesting fort that has wiggling roads and narrow passages, feels odd being in the middle of the desert. There is plenty to see, lots of displays that are really old, but are amazing.

title: Average to the core
review: We have recently visited Jaisalmer, and the fort as part of our Rajasthan trip. We have started our tour with forts in Jaipur and later Jodhpur. When compared to those, Jaisalmer fort looks pale and small. Also, the price of the audio headset (one can get an audio guide instead of a real guide at most of the forts) is overpriced as there are very fewer points. However, as there are not many places left in Jaisalmer, it becomes a must visit.

title: Very dirty and unkempt
review: This was a huge disappointment specially after hearing so much about the fort. The museums are badly maintained with no real artefacts to look at. It is a waste of time.

title: Sonar Kella
review: Jaisalmer Fort is also called Sonar Kella after the release of Satyajir Roy's famous movie called Sonar Kella. People can get awesome view of Golden city from the top.

title: A big Fort with a view!
review: Jaisalmer Fort, Golden city fort situated in city, its a living Fort as 1/4 of old city's population resides with in the fort.  250 ft tall, offers a great view of the golden city.

title: Impressive Fort, Informative Tour
review: The fort is the major landmark of Jaisalmer and is well spending some time inside if you are in town. It is an impressive structure and there are numerous places from which to get a great view over the desert and to watch the sunset.

title: Beautiful temples and fort
review: Must visit place ... beautiful architecture.and loved shopping within fort shops.

title: History/Rajasthan
review: Very Interesting place to visit, weather was right and we enjoyed the place, Amazing to see how this was built years ago, and it is also maintained nicely.

title: Historical place
review: A very good maintenance heritage fort in the centre of city ..jaisalmer..made of yellow colour golden stone..

title: Jaisalmer trip
review: Superb fort a ever seen. Golden colour attract everyone. The view of this fort is outstanding. We can see the entire city through the terrace. Cleanliness & maintainece is also attractive.

title: Good
review: Had a guided tour and was good. Guide was supplied with the package and explained most in Hindi.  Just be careful that they have network which means that they will only show you so much before they will ask you to pay further to tour you around other part of the area.  Being tourists area, things are very expensive so shop around away from the area.  Beware of being conned into buying by guides or hotels as they get commissions hence the expensive sells esp for non residents Indians and foreigners.

title: Golden fort
review: One of the few living fprts in the wprld if u r visiting jaisalmer must stay one night inside the fort ...it has many quaint little havelis which give u the authentic feel pf desert hiuses a must stay

title: Loved it!
review: Quite the steep hike to get into the fort. It's a huge fort and palace and rather uniquely has a town as well. Everything was well maintained and clean, and the shops and residences were lovely to wander around. Had coffee in a cafe high up on the wall with panoramic views. Recommended not to miss.

title: Rainy day
review: Made a fairly brief visit as it was pouring with rain, quite unusual in January.  The steps and street were very slippery and muddy and not pleasant to walk in when combined with waste products. The buildings are quite attractive but many of the interiors have been over restored.  Lots of street vendors selling tourist stuff. The Jan temple is interesting. The view by the lake is disappointing as so much rubbish is at the waters edge.

title: Public fort
review: It's nice fort with golden look every where.

title: Great audio guide, instructive
review: a litel small, some of the rooms were closed. Some parts withe allot of dust

title: Feels unique and different from rest of Rajasthan
review: It is one of the oldest forts in Rajasthan in which people are still living. It is built with sandstone, which doesn't need to be painted and hence the fort has the ancient look. There is also a Jain temple and a haveli inside the fort.

title: Nice Fort - Jain Temple
review: We went to Jain Temple First and then to Raja and Rani Palace in Fort. A beautyful view of Jaisalmer City But we have to pay extra 100 Rupees for taking pIctures from top even after we pay 200 for Entrance Ticket

title: A living fort
review: There are families and shops inside the fort.  It's ok to hireva guide for Rs.150 /- as there is a slight chance of getting lost and missing important places.  'Raja ka mahal' entry ticket costs you 100 rs per head. Can do shopping from outside of this fort as there are lot of handloom shops near by.

title: One of Oldest forts of Rajasthan_Yellow stone fort
review: Most amazing thing about this fort is that it is one of the fewest living fort in the world.Around 4000 people live inside the fort . There are some hotels inside the fort. I would certainly recommend you to stay in one of those hotels only. It is soothing leisure walk inside narrow lanes of the fort.Also, visit Jaisalmer in winter only,basking in sun during winters doubles the fun

title: Day trip
review: Good from far - far from good!

title: Golden fort
review: Or family found the fort very interesting with our guide.  We were very taken with the information particular to Jaisalmer and district.

title: Nothing much to see
review: Nothing much to see in the fort just a small area of the few Royal rooms which we couldn't see as the same was under repairs.

title: Fantastic
review: This fort is worth the long drive. Inside is a township for you to wander through there are some beautiful Havelis and a Jian Temple a must see

title: Unique
review: This fort is a unique fort where around 4000 families still live inside the fort. There are shops and beautiful jain temples inside the fort. The city view from the wall of the fort is amazing.

title: Dramatic, but expect crowds of people
review: A highly impressive desert fort rising from the local town.  It's very busy and such a shame it's been over-run by stalls selling local tat.  Far too many motorbikes whizzing around with local lads joy-riding but still well worth a visit.

title: Most beautiful palace we visited in India.
review: We had the best experience in Jaisalmer and would highly recommend taking the audio tour to get the most out of your visit. There were a couple "stops" that were unavailable when we were there due to restoration, but it was definitely worthwhile.

title: Good
review: Must be visited and don’t get carried away by the glass made of stone which is only found in jaisalmer. Only to make money they are being sold there.

title: Colours of sun
review: We group of friends visited the fort at around 10am and when we started moving around due to sun rays colour of the stone changed to golden colour which makes u r pics awesome and best part only this is the fort where u can see the public houses which was built inside the forte , and u can imagine the way people live in the past .

title: Good Visit
review: Really old and what a carving at sand stone.

title: In need of repair
review: Very interesting fort but perhaps not as good an example as others in Rajasthan.

title: The only living fort
review: It's a beautiful fort and most important is, it's the only living fort. But it makes it more crowdy ans difficult to maintain.

title: Family Holiday
review: The Jaisalmer Fort / Golden Fort Of Jaisalmer is one of the best Fort in Jaisalmer to visit .. Listen the history of the place which is very very interesting and a must see attraction once you are in Jaisalmer

title: Sonar killa
review: Very nice fort and it is only living fort in the world great experience. Walk through the small street view from canon point is great ,jain temple is one of the best I have seen . Very big use place. Must visit.

title: Nice experience
review: Staying in the fort was cool and a nice experience... We stayed at homestay called Rumi's homestay which was a nice place with a nice view of the city... The fort was small and you wouldn't be lost once you know your way. There are shops to buy things you need as well as amneties for food and clothes etc...  The fort looked super cool at night with the lights

title: Heritage Tour
review: The Fort is a world heritage and tourists from all over the world come to visit this. Unfortunately it is understood how people have occupied the places inside the Fort and living there permanently. The residents drive their motorcycles inside the Fort which hampers the movement of the tourists. Above all this kills the very feel of the place. It would be better if the govt rehabilitates those living inside elsewhere and return the grandeur of the Fort to it.

title: The Living Fort
review: One of the largest forts, this one is called a living fort because it still functions as the residence and place of business of a large part of the local populace. It has some unique features and the bustling nature of the fort grows on to you. Tragically as with other grand monuments Government apathy and tourist insensitivity and in this case resident insensitivity mean the grandeur of the fort is hidden under filth, crowds and poor maintenance. However if you have seen the Amer fort this one pales. It does have some nice features though and is the core of this city’s development.

title: Magnificent labyrinthine sandcastle fort
review: Really worth the trip. Beautiful, atmospheric, labyrinthine village/city inside the fort walls. Go early morning for a great chance to see locals preparing for the day. The light and views are stunning.

title: must visit place
review: it is a very big fort. So visit the place when you have  some time to explore. You will be amazed to see architecture of fort.

title: Heritage lost.
review: Too many families living in the fort has ruined to pleasure of experiencing the grandeur of this fort. Still worth a look of this golden fort.

title: A working fort with some charm
review: This fort dominates the skyline of the town. There are a lot of forts in Rajasthan. Is this the best? No. The prettiest? No. But it looks great at night on the skyline and is lit up so it looks attractive. Going at night though and there are a lot of dogs roaming around. I personally get a bit nervous with the amount of wild dogs that roam Indian streets and I love dogs but these ones look so flea ridden and malnourished you just know that one bite, scratch or lick on an open sore is not going to end well so best avoid the lot of them.

title: A Beautiful Living Fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is a gigantic living fort with, I guess, thousands of residents living as of now. Its beautifully carved old buildings and sheer size make it a number one place to visit in Jaisalmer.

title: Love the fort
review: Love the fact the fort is alive and kicking, beautiful and vibrant. Busy but not chaotic ️easy to get around and get lost and find your way back again. Not too much hassle from vendors and touts so much freer than most tourist destinations.

title: A living fort clad in yellow/clay color
review: This fort is made of yellow sandstone bricks. There are a lot of houses, shops and cafes inside it, along with various palaces and havelis. The entire fort appears like a maze of crisscrossing narrow roads. This place would remind you of the locations that you would have seen in 'Ek Tha Tiger' movie.

title: Crowded and noisy
review: Jain temples were great but the rest of the fort was not that great, because it is occupied....can’t enjoy it because of the constant motor bikes whizzing around you, and the smell. Best fort is the Mehrangarh fort in Jodhpur. Did not visit the palace inside the fort. If you are going, take a tour guide because it’s hard to navigate with all the little shops and people inside the fort.

title: Highly overpriced
review: We paid 1.100 INR for a crowded view and the fort wasn’t that impressive. If you have only time for one activity, have a look at the Jain Temples.

title: Different fort
review: I have been to many forts, but Jaisalmer fort is a very different fort because it is inhabited.

title: Save the effort: it's the poorest managed monument I've seen.
review: Expect to pay 600Rs (500 ticket +100 camera) but only seeing very few collections of historical items, an almost-not renovated broken little palace (I'm shocked it's once a palace), battling with the selfie sticks and immerse in the smell of bats. They put just a printout of some simple information in one room and called it folk music exhibition... Where have all these 600 Rs go? I'm sure only a tiny bit has been put into preservation and renovation. Patwa Haveli has so much more interesting things to see and much more well-preserved.

title: NAKKASI MAHAL
review: This Fort is also known as Sonargarh Fort or Sonar Quilla in the Golden Desert City, Jaisalmer. Jaisalmer Fort is situated in the city of Jaisalmer, Rajasthan. It is said  that it is one of the only few living forts in the world. It is also said about one fourth of the old city's population still resides within the fort. It is very really nice Fort.

title: Beautiful place!!!!!!!!
review: We were very surprised when we enter the fort. It is like being in a movie of the past. Everything is very interesting, where you look you find something beautiful.

title: Amazing
review: This fort is made up by limestone,  thats why it is also called Sonar quilla.

title: A living community
review: The fort is a splendid area to wander and feel a part of the community. The narrow streets are fun to explore, the Jain temples amazing but the Palace is overpriced compared to Udaipur or Jodhpur.

title: Family trip
review: Good family trip. Desert safari was amazing experience. Food both veg and non veg was tasty. Scenic view all over the way to different destinations.

title: It’s good to walking around
review: It’s good to walking around, just a brief walk is ok. It’s crowd and a bit dirty. There’re many burglars. People try to offer you overpriced products. And pigeon is pooping everywhere, need to be careful not to stop below them.

title: Golden treasure in architecture in the desert
review: Well preserved monument for the ingenuity of the residents of the desert.  This fort served as a protected residential areas with well-designed streets and buildings to contribute to its defensive strength.

title: One of a kind experience of a fort still inhabited by people
review: Sonaar qila as it is fondly called, lives up to its name. Made up of golden sand stone, the fort features a criss-cross of narrow lanes (which could be made cleaner) housed by people. Can you imagine there are close to 1500 houses within the premises. That is the beauty of this fort, where else would you get to see this.

title: Live fort, Jaisalmer fort
review: The only live fort in India. 4000 family residing on the fort.. it's like small Citi.. no ticket..24 hrs open.. no parking inside fort between 8am-8pm.

title: Nice but not so clean
review: Too crowded and all commercial activities tale away the charm

title: Magnificent
review: Wonderful historical place to visit... Too impressive to see the fort it takes 3 hrs to see the fort...

title: Fort + shop fun
review: Enjoyed this place lot of local shopping...people living in fort and havelis all great to visit. Auto ride is fun

title: The golden beauty!
review: As beautiful as real gold is, one must see the fort in the evening lights. A must visit thing for all the tourists out here.

title: Jaisalmer fort
review: Jaisalmer fort, also known as golden fort because it is made of yellow sandstone. It is situated in the main city of jaisalmer and you can easily spot it from any place in jaisalmer .it is believed to be one of the living fort in the world which accomadates one forth of old city's population. One of the locals there told us the story that the Raja of the jaisalmer was the only king who always stayed with his people but at times of war ,he wanted to shift his people to a safer place. One day while roaming around he found this place ,built this fort and people started living here. Jaisalmer fort is an huge fort with colourful streets full of various clothes,jewellery,tools etc.it includes some havelis. We visited one of these havelis. Entry charge was Rs. 50 per person. It's full of vessels, tools, radio, coins, clothes, people used at that time. You will get to see the whole city from top of these havelis. Do not take an guide. There's no need.

title: A great monument of old times
review: Even if the modern world has somewhat concurred the fort it still feels like you are walking in to the old time. If all the motorcycles would disappear we would really enjoy to wander around the narrow streets and browse the small shops and meet some of the 5000 inhabitants here.

title: A must visit place
review: It is the only living palace of Jaisalmer where the present generation of the king and his courtiers still stay inside the palace. The major attraction is you get to see a living city inside this palace where you get different kinds of shops, restaurants, hotels, etc. you should take a guide to know the amazing history of this palace. Visit the Jain temple inside to adore the beautiful Jain architecture of thousand years. Also do visit a rooftop restaurant “Machaan” to have a view of the entire palace when you enjoy the Rajasthani cuisine

title: Fabulous, living Fort
review: Our guide was a local journalist named Rohit Vyas - he knew everyone inside the Fort and was a trove of information -great guy too!

title: Jaisalmer place nice.
review: Jaisalmer famous for Golden Fort.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: A must see place - a world of it's own! Do not miss the Jain temple - the inside is exquisite! Go early, take an auto or a cab - parking is a major issue!

title: Its actually not a fort, just a shopping place
review: Its not like Jaipur or Agra fort, its a residential fort with a huge market inside. Its okay, even if you dont take a guide inside. There are small museums and temples inside and there is a ticket to visit each.

title: REALLY SONAR KELLA
review: We were very much excited to see the Jaisalmer Fort which is very much famous to Bengalees as Sonar Kella. When we entered into the fort we were speechless. Really it was Sonar Kella.

title: Sonar kella( Jaisalmer Golden fort)
review: This place describes the true heritage of indian culture and ancient and medieval india.Do visit this place  one of the best tourist attractions in Jaisalmer.

title: The golden fort
review: The nostalgic "Sonar Kella" does justice to its charm. It quite a hike from the outermost entrance till it's centre courtyard. The Jain Temple complexes are architectural marvel. The Royal palace are splendid. The view from the canon spots are eye soothing.

title: The Golden Fort!!!
review: This fort is different to the ones we visited in Jaipur and Delhi. Its a residential fort, housed under one roof, cafes, jain temple to list a few. Easily accessible by rickshaw, or a steep walk to get to the fort. Architecture the intricate handcrafted works are magnificent. There is an outlook to Jaisalmer city, recommended whilst in Jaisalmer.

title: Mesmerizing Golden Fort
review: The call it a Golden fort and they are absolutely right about it. The yellow sandstone walls of the fort coupled with sunlight give it a perfect golden look. The fort stands stall and you get a glimpse of it as soon as you enter the small city of Jaisalmer. It is the only living fort probably across the globe (people actually stay within the fort periphery). This gives a unique cultural feel of the whole place. Within the fort there are various Haveli’s and temples and also multiple cafes/restaurants. The view from top of the fort is breath-taking.

title: best fort of rajasthan, spectacular living fort, intricate havelis, shopping haven, cobbled way
review: Golden fort of jaisalmer is probably the best fort in rajasthan.. this is special also because it is a living fort which means families are still based inside the fort.. lots of rajasthani craftwork market is inside.. beautiful restaurants, havelis, traditional masterpeices are within the fort boundary.. fort should b visited once around 10 am for real golden view when sunlight falls on it and next during the night.. there are several hotels and restaurants inside fort.. it is nice place to walk in the night on the cobbled path..

title: Traditional
review: Fort is little mix of commercial and traditional ,in fort lot of shops,restaurants,

title: Ok but it could be better
review: Its a nice place to visit, with strong interior streets. They should prohibit the passage of motorcycles to the interior, which annoy people, generate a lot of noise and create a visual disorder for this monument.

title: Beautiful heritage site
review: This fort is really nice and big. Took a guide to know the history. There are still people who live inside the fort.. The juice vendors at exit give nice fresh OJ.

title: Australian in the Jaisalmer Fort - Fantastic!
review: Allow several days to explore Jaisalmer and the Fort. The Jain Temples within showcase splendid architecture unlike other temples in India due to the use of sandstone. Approximately four thousand people from three castes live inside the Fort. There are numerous hotels, ask to inspect rooms and bathrooms before committing. My friend and I stayed outside, and then inside the Fort which was much more preferable as the shopkeepers stay up late and the Fort offers a completely different magic with coloured night lights for late shopping. I visited an Australian expatriate who has lived inside the Fort for 15 years. She describes the Fort as being very safe and I have to agree that we experienced a very warm hospitality. I loved the Fort, don’t miss it on your journey to India and Rajasthan. Do stay at a higher priced hotel if you can afford it and enjoy!

title: History buff's paradise
review: Go post lunch... less crowded.

title: GOOD EXPERIENCE BUT NEED ENOUGH TIME TO EXPLORE FULLY
review: We spent an evening walking inside the fort at random without a guide. This is the only living fort in India with people staying inside it. The narrow lanes and the heritage buildings are visually very nice. There are a large number of shops for souvenirs and local clothing material - so if shopping is part of the plan, it is a good place. I think the experience would have been better if we had more time and a good guide.  The outside view of the fort is better than the insides. In the evening the lights on the fort walls give it a majestic appearance - it looks equally grand in sunlight in the day time. Definitely worth a visit and some time spent walking around the historical area.

title: Small fort
review: This is small fort. Actually this is a living fort means people is residing in fort except raja and rani ka mehal.

title: Nice fort
review: So cool to be able to explore all over the old fort. Looks wonderful lit up at night. Sunset dinners are a highlight

title: Disappointing
review: There is hardly anything to see here. It is like a tourist market. People live inside fort and has made it very dirty. Too much hassle from guides and shop keepers. I felt like waste of time. As suggested by our guide, please do not buy anything from shops inside fort. You get all those items from outside fort at reasonable prices. All the pictures you see in google search are very old ones. Now it looks nothing near to that

title: Disappointed
review: There is nothing in the fort .. very limited access to the palace and unmaintained. From cloths to bedding everything is dusty and kept shabbily. Infact the entry fee to the palace is expensive as compare to the exposure you get. 100 rs per person and 100 for camera  Within fort Jain Mandir is good to visit ..

title: Fascinating and special
review: Jain temples were a highlight.  Terrific views of the city.  History and architecture is enthralling.  Highly commercialized now.

title: Informative
review: While in jaisalmer it's good to see the fort at least...

title: Avoid this place during holidays and long weekends
review: This one of the fort which allows people to live inside the wall and operate their business. Most of the places have now been replaced by hotels, guest house, restaurants and souvenir places.

title: Must visit this living fort
review: This is an amazing place. People live inside this fort that makes it lively and happening. I will suggest to have a guide while visiting this place.

title: Majestic- the only living fort
review: Visit and stay inside the fort for a night to get a feel of history. It’s amazing , the hustle bustle, the life is just mesmerising.

title: Over rated -totally ruined by motor bikes
review: Really disappointed by Jaisalmer Fort - the traffic was hellish outside the fort but the fort being the main tourist attraction in town I figured it would be motor bike free inside. Not to be and had to be on the lookout the whole time for motor bikes in narrow lanes and the constant honking was horrendous. The palace inside the fort was nice but I reckon Jaisalmer is skippable and just go to Jodphur instead. The jodphur fort is motor bike and pushy sales assistant free!

title: Nothing much was shown
review: Only the jain temple was shown by our guide

title: One of the Best Fort Visit
review: One of the Best example of Indian- Rajputana Architecture.

title: Nothing different than the other fort's
review: Have too many eateries around. The fort as such 8s nothing different. If this your first fort you may enjoy. Else there is absolutely nothing specific to mention. Just another tourist attraction.go there

title: Good but too crowded and not clean
review: One can directly drive till fort gate.

title: Fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is a like a complete city. You can find multiple haveli’s. Some of them are converted into places to visit. You can find multiple products to buy for gifting purpose. Also u can find good antique products too. Make sure to bargain while purchasing anything.

title: Great architecture and history but spoilt by tourism
review: The fort is amazing and has incredible history which can be learnt through the various points of interest inside. However the place is really spoiled by the swarm of street vendors which are always trying to get your attention making it impossible to just chill and explore without being constantly harassed :(

title: Looks better from outside
review: The fort is situated in heart of city , it has parking all around . The entrance gate is over crowded and there is steep walkway to inside of fort. Few buildings and temples are state of Art but having other residents and commercial activities have spoiled the grace of place .. thus it looks impressive from outside then inside..

title: Pioneer of Gated community?
review: Jaisalmer probably pioneered the concept of gated community ages ago. In the bygone era, they had built a huge township atop a hillock. Jaisalmer Fort has a palace, temples, defense systems, residential houses,  shops etc., all surrounded by a fortified common wall. The city has been built with yellow sandstone and in the rays of the setting sun the city seems like built with gold.  Key tip: See the city in the evening sun.

title: Splendid palace
review: Jaisalmer Fort is  the main fort of the city. The golden colored fort welcomes you to explore the fort with beautiful  architecture, interlocking built technique without cement and sand stands robust putting the onlookers at awe. A well maintained  fort with great history and intricate carvings is worth a watch. Positioned atop a mound attracts all the visitors of the city from a distance. The yellow sand stone and the suns beam dances together making it more attractive .The initial settlements were around the palace slowly increasing the extant of the city to what it is today. Hotels and small shopping units with local handicrafts  and eateries surround the fort. A full one and a half to two hour should suffice the fort watch tour. A great place for the tourists.

title: Magical place
review: The Jain temples and the surrounding areas were quite extraordinary. There’s also a haveli (sp?) nearby which was beautifully hand crafted on the outside. Definitely worth the visit.

title: Fort
review: Interesting and so different to the normal. Living and shopping in the Fort is an experience worth having.

title: Wonderful
review: Beautiful architecture to admire and enjoy walk along narrow lanes. Lanes are filled with shops and fort has musuem, Jain Temple and lot of guides around to help you. Loved the musuem which gave insight into the way Kings use to live. Beautiful City view from the top.

title: Amazing history with amazing guide- Anwar(Anu)
review: At first as usual like a North Indian monuments are like go in & go out but luckily we met an amazing guide at the gates of the fort Mr. Anwar aka. ANU every guide knows him by this name.

title: Fort
review: A historical palace and the only living fort I have experienced.  It is a mini city inside with 4000 people residing there.  Nice fort.

title: Living Fort, free roaming
review: This place is fantastic, there are people trying to sell you stuff constantly which can get a bit tiring but the fort is just beautiful and the stonework is amazing. Loved it.

title: Good fort to know about history and culture of the place
review: Good fort to know about history and culture of the place - not very elaborate but good historical story behind it.

title: Historic but nothing much...
review: To be honest, when u have alrdy travelled othr forts in Rajasthan and othr places in India, there is nthng much to see in this fort....  Only diffrnce is that it is still a living and commercial fort... But everything everywhere inside the fort is overpriced. So cud nt buy anything... Things to see r the King nd qween palace, Dusshera chowk, terrace from whre u get a full view of the City, armory, and a few jain temples.

title: Nice view of the city and sunset
review: Breath taking view from the canon point. Have some good restaurants to chill around and have the great views of city and sunset. Must visit if you are in Jaisalmer.

title: amazing fort
review: Locals still live and work within the fort, but traffic is restricted so you'll have to walk up from the entrance gate. There's no entry fee, but having a guide who knew so much about the golden fort was great, as there's no information points/plaques. The ancient sandstone balconies and the thoughtful restoration and construction for new buildings make for a beautiful fort city. There's lots to explore inside, from shopping and eating along narrow streets to the many jain temples which are also beautiful and a little different. The masterful handiwork that must have gone into all the buildings is amazing!

title: Better from afar than close up
review: The Fort dominates Jaisalmer.  It is immense.  But the tour of the interior shows a landmark in need of more upkeep.  Rooms and furniture that should be impressive come off as in need of cleaning and polishing.  Faded and disappointing.

title: Excellent
review: Wow, walk back in time by 400 years. History in every corner. Hire a guide, it's well worth the money. The stone carvings are jaw dropping. This fort was made famous by Satyajit Ray s film "Sonar Kella", which literally translates as golden fort

title: Short holiday
review: Spectacular , awesome and will visit again.

title: Grand
review: Excellent live fort in sense thousands of people staying in fort today. Made from yellow Jaisalmer stones a must visit for every one.

title: Less is More Part 333 -  Jewel-like Joyful Jaisalmer
review: One of the six Rajasthani hill forts recognised by UNESCO Heritage. It looks the most compact since it is still heavily populated and lived in. Packed tightly within the walls are Hindu and Jain temples, shrines, the Palace museum, lively markets, city square, schools and countless dwellings - a veritable living museum and very interesting. It is also extremely picturesque and charming. But do mind your step because of the open drains and a generally laidback attitude towards garbage disposal.

title: Nice but not well kept!
review: As everybody knows, it is a living fort. Interesting it may sound but it is not very well kept. We visited the Palace inside the fort. The ticket is 100 per person and 100 extra for camera.You can get to the highest point here to get the panoramic view of the city from the top. You may take services of guide or can opt for audio guided tour which is little more expensive. The prime attraction of  Jaisalmer, one must this fort but we did not find it to match the other well kept forts and palaces of Rajasthan. One can also visit Jain Temples inside the fort, which we could not as they open for fixed time period. Inside the fort are lots of shops and few cafes and restaurants too. To sum it all, it is definitely worth a visit.

title: Best place
review: Jaisalmer is golden city.

title: Interesting
review: Unique in terms of the ways of using inside of the fort.

title: Just OK
review: Though the beauty of the fort is to see people living in the fort.But there is no description on the wall of different parts of the fort.This has made compulsion to take help of guide or audio system.Cleanliness of the fort around the outer wall is serious. concern

title: Only living fort in India
review: One of its kind fort in India where in people are actually living . The fort has full residentice, temples , shops inside it's premises. It's not dead as rest of the forts in the country. It is wonderful feeling to actually live inside the fort perimeter and walk on the streets inside.

title: Must see
review: Seeing a "living fort" is a different experience, not to miss

title: Descent place for a hour of visit, Not maintained very well
review: The fort looks really good from outside with the golden colored stones which are used. However from the inside there isn't much and also the items on display are dusty and not kept very clean. Just good for an hour of visit.

title: Good fort with village inside
review: Jaisalmer fort is the main attraction in jaisalmer. No entry fee for fort. Can take guide in 100 ₹. Guide is must and will start from 200₹. Good sunset point ia there. It takes 2 hours to cover full fort. Golgappa in fort mai  chowk is must have. Jain temple's closing time is 2pm in winters.

title: Incredible is not a strong enough word to describe
review: I loved the fort, wondering around soaking in the incredible, intricate architecture, the painted murals, the quaint shops. Felt like a movie set. I didn’t like how pushy the vendors were to get you in their shops so they missed a lot of my shopping. Other than that the fort I spent a couple of days in there losing myself to its beauty in both Day and night.

title: Jaisalmer Fort The Only Living Fort In India
review: Jaisalmer Fort is a very special place because the Inhabitants, Shops Resturants, All, Live inside the Fort. When you cross thru the Gate you realize that this for is the same today as it was 1500 years ago. The same Familes thru the generations still live in there family homes thru the centuries. This is a Real experience not to be missed. This Fort existance was built for the Silk Road. This for was a stopping point for the Silk Toad Camel Trains as they continued beyond. This fort is not a rebuilt Tourist location this is Real. That is why so many Tourists and Travelers love to come here. Take the time and meet the people and here there stories of their families that extend back in time. Stay in a Haveli inside the fort and experience life within. You will be glad as I was so glad that I did this.

title: Occupied fort
review: In contrast to other forts we visited in Rajasthan, this fort has locals living in it, which adds to the character and helps visitors visualise how the spaces are used. Steep walking and hot though

title: Golden fort for people
review: I had seen many forts but this fort is properly used by people,Jaisalmer Fort is a very special place because the Inhabitants, Shops Restaurants, All, Live inside the Fort. When you cross thru the Gate you realize that this for is the same today as it was 1500 years ago. The same Families thru the generations still live in there family homes thru the centuries. This is a Real experience not to be missed. This Fort existence was built for the Silk Road.This fort is not a rebuilt Tourist location this is Real. That is why so many Tourists and Travelers love to come here. Take the time and meet the people and here there stories of their families that extend back in time. Stay in a Haveli inside the fort and experience life within.Worth to visit

title: Worth visiting
review: A must visit place if u r visiting jaisalmer .Its gud to hier a guide so that u come to knw d history of d fort as well as d guide cud suggest u d best posesthe top view of d city from fort's roof  is awesome.

title: Rajsthan Tour organised by M/S Himalchura Travels & Tours, Kolkata
review: This is my 2nd interaction with them .Both were well organised. They never misleaded us.The best places were jaisalmeer fort & ranthambore forest. I have no hesitation to recommend my tourist friends to take the guidance & arrangement offered by them.

title: Golden fort of  Jaisalmer
review: The fort's massive yellow sandstone walls are a tawny lion colour during the day, fading to honey-gold as the sun sets, thereby camouflaging the fort in the yellow desert. For this reason it is also known as the Sonar Quila or Golden Fort....

title: Interesting fort
review: The fort has free entry but you would need to pay Rs 100 for Raja-Rani ka Mahal ( which is a bit on higher side)- it mainly has exhibits of their furniture, , clothing, arms, utensils etc nice view from the top with cannon.  We visited Jain mandirs from outside

title: Beautiful
review: The fort is a beautiful and lively place with vendors all around, and an environment bustling with activity :)

title: Good for a wander
review: This fort is the only one that still has people living within its walls. As such, it's worth a wander along the maze of little alleyways with lots of tourist shops along the way, as well as homes and temples. There are also great views over the city from various points on the wall. It's quite an easy walk and you don't need a tuk tuk to get you up the slope.

title: Jaiselmer trip
review: There are two mahel in this fort one is maharaja mahel n another is maharani mahel.very well maintain and fees for photo capturing of its mahel.

title: Only living fort in India. Must visit !!
review: Totally loved the place and wish had more time to explore the place especially the various eateries .pies at the German bakery at the entrance was awesome and the fort has a Moroccan or Egyptian feel to it with bustling markets n people all around. It's not to b missed !!

title: Golden fort-Sonar Kella
review: Must visit the fort and lean its history. Along with this, one must definitely watch the Oscar level movie Sonar Kella, directed by Satyajit Ray that brought numerous tourists to Jaisalmer after it's huge success at international level.

title: Must Visit PLace to relax and enjoy!!
review: The best stay was at Jaisalmer Palace. Although nothing much a bit of shopping but you will get variety of food there. The best part is that it is at a height and you can enjoy rooftop restaurant food. We stayed via Airbnb and stay was very comfortable. We had a great food and also enjoyed Sunrise from the rooftop which was an amazing experience. I would suggest to sitback and relax at jaisalmer fort for sure atleast for a day.

title: Expansive area, lots to see.
review: This is a huge museum, surrounded by narrow pathways (for pedestrians and motorbikes) in an intricate design that includes hotels, local housing, shops, food stalls, open vegetable & fruit markets.

title: Good old fort - quite a few portions still well maintained
review: Keep yourself 2 hours of visit to this fort. Preferable time of visit would be later afternoon.

title: There is nothing to see
review: The fort looks from top, however there is nothing in it to see, there is lot of traffic within the fort, ruthless riders. I would rather spend time visiting havelis.

title: Wow amazing fort with people living in it
review: The only fort where people actually stay. Small but very beautiful and amazing fort. The majestic walls and floor is just beautiful.

title: Golden fort , Jaisalmer
review: Very nice place to visit and full of sellers selling a lot of their wares ,new and antiques.

title: The only fort which has people actually living inside
review: When we visited The Jaisalmer Fort, we were taken aback by the fact that it is the only fort in India where people are actually living inside the fort. They have been living since generations and many people have opened shops for selling souvenirs and local handicrafts, duppattas and harem pants,etc.

title: Quirky fort
review: This fort is different as it is lived in and is full of the goings o  of an active community. You  an book hotels and stay in its walls eat on the ramparts of a roof top restaurant or wander it's narrow streets and wonder what stories and secrets it holds

title: Average Fort
review: I belong to historical city Jhansi and have visited multiple fort many times, I didn't find Jaisalmer fort extraordinary. By the time we reached there it's already late and Museum were closed. Fort has been occupied by the descendants of Maharaj's servants. It's very crowdy. Might be who have visited in daytime found it extraordinary.

title: True gold
review: Visit this place & you will get to know why this city is called golden city. Admire the city sitting in a cafe at the fort specially at golden hours

title: best fort in rajasthan
review: This fort is different  than others because people live here. It's more natural. You can see real rajasthan and culture and colours....

title: Jaisalmer
review: Only thing to see a small museum, except that nothing to see. Only small lanes with local shops. You can see same view everywhere from the top. Just visit it as its historical place.

title: Crowded but fun!
review: The fort is very interesting. Its the only living fort. The palaces, the architecture is just amazing! The history attached to it makes it all the more fascinating! It's Buzzing with tourists, locals, temples and hotels! There's quite a lot of antique and other local famous shops around. Great stuff. It could be a tad bit better organised though.

title: One of the best architecture in Rajasthan
review: This fort is present in city center, very near to bus stand. I had booked a hotel near the fort, which i find very comfortable. Start exploring the fort during mid-day, and in evening take any fort view restaurant for food/ dinner . In night, lighting of fort looks very good and peaceful.

title: Good
review: So good the yalo biladig  Jean temapal good I love  the pales I recommend you you cam in jaisalme dot mis

title: Don't go to the Jaisalmer museum in the middle of the fort.
review: The fort is impressive of course but fort museum itself has nothing special and the manager Raghuveer Singh Bhati was extremely rude and I would not recommend going to this place at all. They made us pay a very expensive ticket without even saying that 6 of the attractions were closed.

title: Big living fort
review: Yes as they call it.. it's a big fort where people are living. The fort has a Mahal and a Jain temple which are the 2 main highlights of the fort. Its a bit tiring if ur carrying children's with you but you can take a bike or a auto. Nice place to visit for couple of hours..

title: Fort good, palace OK
review: This fort is apparently the second oldest to be built in Rajasthan (chittorgarh being the oldest). Found this to be the only fort where people still reside (About 4000 people as per our guide). Hence one finds houses, gullies, bazaars,temples, ppl riding bikes etc. Maharaja palace is decent but there are better ones in Rajasthan.

title: Excellent Fort
review: The fort has many places to visit like Jain Temple, Cannon Point, city view point and Palace. Jain temple at 2 pm. Hence Jain temple early. Excellent carving on pillars. You will find  Hindu gods scriptures. Twin Jain temples and both are excellent.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: Jaisalmer Fort, is one of the oldest fort in Jaisalmer. we spent 2 days in our tour of Rajasthan. there is nothing to view just some havelis and jain temples. out side this fort, there is a shopping shops and food courts and vendors are there.

title: a BEAUTIFUL SITE, Needs much better traffic management
review: Yes this is a living fort, agreed but please can we have better management with the traffic and crowd flow? It is such a beautiful fort with so much intricate stone work but the constant pushing of crowds and 2 wheelers make it not so enjoyable. I was here on a weekeday and at certain spots, there was not even enough space to stand.

title: Too much walking
review: A great place for tourists with shops and restaurants inside but dayum there is so much to walk here that my feet are paining 2 days after also.

title: Golden Fort
review: The fort is huge and made of sand stone which look alike to desert sand hence called as sand stone. In olden days entire Jaisalmer city was located inside the fort. Half of the fort is occupied by the Rajputs and half by the Jains-Traders. Most of the houses inside the fort are converted into hotels/restaurants. There are 4-6 gates of the fort and none can be seen from any one gate. Roads are narrow and vehicles of the locals inside the fort are plying on those roads hence be careful

title: Very well mantain private castle
review: A castle-palace-museum of a private trust worth the visit. The audio guide included in the price is very well done and interesting in the English version. I hope one day will be translated in Italian as well to give to tourist the intere charme of the narrative. The museum is full of details, objects, photos. It's to visit

title: Don’t miss this!
review: A beautiful little self contained city to get lost in with some amazing rooftop restaurants and stunning architecture inside the Jain temples.

title: Jaisalmer trip
review: Nice n beutyfull.pls come n stay at mirag hotel host baa is very helpfull person n also food r very testy n helthy.baa also arrange desart safary that r memorble expirience .thanks to baa from hotel mirag.

title: Good experience
review: The best things i liked was the architecture & the view the whole city from the top.

title: Visit to Jaisalmer fort
review: We visited this fort recently. The carving intricate work on stone is breathtaking. It's a must visit. The stone is Jaisalmer sandstone. It is highest point in Jaisalmer & you can see whole city

title: Feedback
review: Oasis hotel jaisalmer, is a nice property in jaisalmer, rooms services and foods are good, specially thanks to Mr. Ashfaq who is a manager of the hotel, good experience to us, thanks.

title: Best fort
review: Its very nice fort very good old fort with feel of real desert and rajasthan

title: great fort
review: magnificent fort with one of a kind jain temple.highly recommended for travellers from around the world.

title: Underwhelming
review: Even though we were aware that this was a fort with people living in it, it was still quite disappointing. The constant vehicular traffic with narrow lanes was expected but the noise and the bottlenecks were not. The jain temple and the city views are definitely the highlight of this fort but some of the unexplored outer edges of the fort, which had decent views, were quite dirty. There are quite a few restaurants inside with good views which might be worth it.

title: Great few hours
review: Great place to visit for a few hours to look at the great fort

title: Living Fort
review: There are many people living inside the fort, It was really nice experience. It is small compare to other fort of Rajasthan. But is worth to visit.

title: You see one.. you see it all
review: For me its overstated. There is nothing except a few havelis and Jain temple inside.

title: Crowded
review: Disappointed with only fort in India that has people living in it.  Very crowded.   Dirty.  Shop after shop.   Totally commercialized. Sad it is also falling apart

title: Great Fort
review: I think one of The nicest Vollgases on a Small hill, in an extreme good Historie condition ! A relaxed place especially if you arrive afterfour and Havel nice drink at one of The coffee or Restaurants with a nice view !

title: Great
review: The only living fort of the country in the true sense. It may not have the grandure of other forts but it had life and soul in it. Definitely worth a visit. Thoroughly enjoy my stroll through the fort. A must visit place.

title: Family Trip
review: Nice palace for visit . Fort was really so awesome many families are living there .many cafe and restaurant are there you can take there beer and Rajasthani food . Jain temple also so nice palace inside of fort

title: Amazing
review: Wherever you go, just beautiful. Must to go is the view point. You can see the whole city.

title: Quirky, intriguing, alive!
review: Jaisalmer anyways is different from Jaipur/Jodhpur/Udaipur. It is far smaller both in terms of size & tourism enablers & that makes sense given the harsh weather conditions almost all year round.

title: Must see while in Jaisalmer
review: If at all possible I highly recommend staying in a hotel or guest house in Jaisalmer’s Fort.  It’s bustling with activity, shops, restaurants daily and the views out to the city are spectacular.  Rooftop restaurants for sunset are a must!

title: Living Fort with spectacular views of the city
review: Amazing living fort with so many interesting nooks & crannies. It’s got spectacular views of the city and is the most prominent attraction of Jaisalmer.

title: All time visit
review: One visit every time you visit Jaisalmer. Looks beautiful at night. Lots of shops to eat and buy good things are present inside the outside the fort.

title: Beautiful!
review: The Fort in Jaisalmer is absolutely beautiful and it’s very interesting that there are still many houses and people actually living there. There are many shops where you can buy souvenirs or restaurants where you can just have a coffee and enjoy the view over the city.

title: Nice fort
review: Very good fort... Carving is extremely good. The administration should give more attention towards cleanliness..

title: Sonar Kella
review: The movie made by Satyajit Ray had made this fort popular to the world. There is a rustic element wrt the fort which made it more attractive. The fort is a living fort with a people staying inside be the businessmen or the priests or others. However, the fort could have been maintained in a far better manner by cleaning - some of the fort area is infested with bats and its smell and also pigeons. However, there is a lot to see as well and hiring a guide would put it in an interesting manner. Overall a good experience.

title: Pathetic place
review: The fort is not at all like a fort but its a public place with some walls.

title: Work Hard too see Beyond the Crowds and be Rewarded
review: A spectacular site from distance and a chaotic, heaving maelstrom upon arrival. Narrow streets once populated by wealthy traders and worshippers now almost entirely filled with street traders, travel companies, touts and blaring motorbikes. If you take time to see beyond this, and the signs covering almost every wall then there's a character to be discovered. Get away from the main square, the temples and the crowds to wander the quiet back alleyways. Climb an unassuming staircase to find a cafe with spectacular views of the streets below and prepare for your return journey through the crowds.

title: Good
review: Nice Fort awesome city views from golden fort . We had spend a great time in Jaisal cafe. Highly recommended.

title: Gorgeous Fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is the best fort in Rajasthan. The Maharaja place and jain temple in fort both were awesome. Don't miss it.

title: Superb Fort
review: Perhaps the only fort in this world where people still live their life. Beautiful narrow streets with wonderful heritage carvings on yellow stones.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: A beautiful second oldest fort in Rajasthan with Jain temple inside. Also residential for earlier residents. Very narrow Gail with bike access allowed which spoils the heritage property. Even during approach three wheeler keep plying. Very artistic stone work with old cannon retained. A place for general audience in Raja Karan Mahal. A nice visit with the guide Lalit.

title: Special Fort
review: It is a special fort, built without water using stones only, known as dry masonry. The charges for the entry are quite high Rs 100/- per person.

title: Jaisalmer Golden Fort
review: A must view for visitors to Jaisalmer. Huge castle with an equally huge history. Approx 4000+ people still live there. Very chaotic with lots of sales people. Costs around 500 rupees per person +camera + tips for temples but then every castle and palace charges roughly this amount on average anyway

title: Good location to visit at Jaisalmer
review: I had visited Jaisalmer Fort with family. Very good fort at Jaisalmer . All Rajasthani items for purchase are available in adjoining shops of Fort . Must visit place , if you are at Jaisalmer

title: Best Hotel
review: Great Hotel.Professional staff,Well management.We love Chokhi Dhani Group.Manager and staff are very helpful and couresious.Again we plan to visit in January.Good management.Keep it up.

title: Nice Fort in the city
review: This is the last fort we visited after many in Rajasthan over a week! But every fort has its uniqueness and this one is like pretty much attach to the city and embedded.

title: Go if you have time
review: Ok place only

title: Nice but too crowded..
review: Nice fort with thousands of people staying inside. Felt it was too crowded but could by liked by many.

title: A Magic vision in the desert
review: The Jaisalmer Fort is just amazing.  We visited the fort around three hours and it was stunning. The most important place to visit is a Maharaja palace.  Try to avoid weekends as the place gets very crowded.

title: Nothing special
review: Half of the stops of the audio tour don't work and there is nothing really to see inside except the beautiful view on the top but that's it. The fort in Jodhpur is way better and worth the money and time.

title: Must see place
review: Jaisalmer fort is must see place while visiting Jaisalmer . Well maintained and historical place to see . We enjoyed our trip of fort and also visited fort nearby market

title: Chaotic with little attraction
review: Apart from a Jain temple and the palace the fort offers little for a visitor. A large number of people live inside the fort, navigating through the sea of two wheelers honking away is a traumatising experience as one tries to enter through the fort gates

title: Excellent
review: Not that much big but still got high ranked as a fort. Inside during can feel the real city heart and its locality. Completely safe to ride during day or night.

title: Jain Temples in Fort
review: The fort is one of the two forts in the world where people still stay and live within the walls of the fort. The other being in France,

title: Jaiselmer Fort Reviews
review: We Were Amazed When we Saw The Beautiful Jaiselmer Fort ..Great Art Work..You Can’t Miss This Place ..

title: Unique Living Fort
review: Jaisalmer for is one of the most famous forts of India. The fort is also called a living fort as there are people living inside the fort. It is recommended to take a guide to see the fort and visit all places of interest in the fort. We enjoyed our visit here very much.

title: A good place with hidden historic moments and a great view of the city.
review: Would recommend taking a guide service to learn more abt the history of the fort and the temples inside. Extremely good mind blowing architecture too

title: Sonar kela !!
review: 900 Years old fort, actually glitters like gold in Peak Summer. The Movie by Satyajit Ray brought this fort alive and made it the biggest tourist destination since 1974. The Fort is the first fort which has people living inside the fort. You will be mesmerized by the Muesium inside the fort and also when you see a couple of Jain temples inside the fort. The heritage and the deep routed culture truly reflects out of the fort.

title: An Amazing Fort...
review: It's very Apt for naming it as Golden Fort......one of the few Living Forts........ Exploring the Fort on foot....Shopping inside the fort....wow...it has be experienced on one's own.....

title: Nothing like riding your motorcycle through an Ancient fort!
