review: I love that Jaisalmer fort is full of markets and restaurants, it makes for such a unique experience. A truely epic view of the surrounding area. One to check out for sure!

title: Visit to Dessert of India
review: This was my 2nd visit to Jaisalmer. This is also called dessert caital of India. The jaisalmer fort is very famous one. It is built about 800 years ago. Now it is also used by people for leaving.  You can see entire Jaisalmer town from top of this fort.

title: It’s ckol
review: Nice little museums inside. Great that it’s basically a small city inside the fort. Easy to walk the walls or find rooftops with great views. I wouldn’t say it’s the highlight of Jaisalmer (that would be the desert), but still cool.

title: Quaint and unusual fort
review: The Jaisalmer fort is perched on top of a hill and is quaint and unusal. There are people actually living in the fort as the olden times. There are beautiful temples that one must see. The view of the city is nice

title: A grand fort but a bit commercial!!
review: The fort itself is grand & lovely to look at from outside but once you enter it’s too commercial....filled with vendors selling a variety of goods!

title: Best fort among forts in India
review: This is by far the best fort in India where people still live and isn't just a deserted destroyed building. Definitely worth visiting especially with a guide ($5) since the fort is too big and too many small roads inside to navigate by yourself.

title: Poorly Maintained
review: Very unlike other forts in Rajasthan. Full of bats , the pungent smell makes u run out of the place, some places are even not safe for kids, no care has been taken about it .

title: Must see place in Rajasthan
review: This is the only "living fort" in India with hotels, restaurants and almost 4000 people residing inside the fort area. The fort made of sand stone does justice to the name "Golden Fort" or "Sonar Kella", given to it. People can walk through the fort gate or can take an auto inside.  The entire fort area has many buildings and temples which is rich in architecture. There are many small shops which sell various items, but need to bargain with them. I would recommend you to take a guided tour .

title: 800-year old piece of art
review: A mini city within the fort.

title: Have a look from outside
review: A different fort compared to Jodhpur in the sense that people live and work inside the fort. However, you will be walking on cow and human feces most of the time. Dirty and smelly with continuous harassment from shopowners. Some good overpriced tourist restaurants and cafes.

title: Biggest and long.
review: Most popular fort in the world.and most beautiful places inside Hindu temple, Jain temple.the way are so clearly and clean. Easy time see in side of fort.... I love and like this fort..

title: Rock Solid
review: Very very old fort and very much popular, lots of crowds we see and everywhere you see in fort it is just rock solid. Must visit.

title: beautiful
review: This fort is unique in the sense that people are still residing inside it. The Jain temple inside the fort has great art work. The carvings on stone are awesome. Our guide (don't remember his name, I wish I could...) was very good, jovial and additionally a very good photographer.

title: Must visit. Very different from other forts
review: Inside the fort complex are private homes and the Jain temple. It was very different to the other forts in Rajasthan. We took a local guide. He was very good and had a lot of interesting facts to share. I would rate this a must do.

title: Incredible tour and city
review: This is a must see in Jaisalmer. It has about 5,000 residents in the fort with many shops. We preferred to stay outside the fort, but it is very easy to walk from town.

title: Fort with rent
review: This seems to be one of the only forts in this region that operates as part of the city. There are shops, restaurants, hotels, and residences all inside the walls. I'm not exactly sure if this is a good or bad thing. It is nice that you can visit whenever you want and not pay, the architecture is nice, and there are a couple nice shops. However, you will have to deal with constant sales pitches, mostly junk for sale, and scooters buzzing through. It makes it a bit more touristy than I would prefer. It is definitely worth seeing for the architecture, but the oversaturated nature of just walking around kind of hurts things a little.

title: Very nice fort in Rajasthan
review: That fort is only one fort in jaisalmer living people inside.osm nakkashi and view the desert of the fort  .number one beautiful fort in the rajasthan

title: Nice big ford
review: A nice ford to walk around and get lost in all the small streets. It has a great view over the city and is definitely worth going there.

title: Golden Fort
review: Referred as golden fort due to the color of stones used in the construction of the fort. Some of the walls have been repaired by using the same type of stones but can be identified by bigger size compared to older stones which are smaller in size. The fort is an inhabited fort, hotels, restaurants and shops are all inside the fort. The shops sell everything from turbans, puppets, idols to antiques. Restaurants serve Indian and continental for the tourists. Cars have to be parked outside the fort and need to walk in, autorickshaw is sometimes available where u can share it with fellow tourists. Inside the fort the main area is Dussehra square where kings had celebrations. There is raja and Rani's separate buildings. Rani's building have special windows to honour parda system that is followed in this part of the country. A must visit is Jain temple inside that has very fine architecture. Lot of wood fossil stone is used in the construction. View from the top is amazing, gives bird eye view of Jaisalmer. Museum inside has canons, guns, spears and daggers that were in use. Fort is the center of the city. It's a must visit but find suitable time of year as summers are terribly hot!

title: Amazing
review: Hub if city, lots of history and character,  interesting shops and rooftop coffee shops. You can walk everywhere and not get lost, worth spending a full day here

title: Good for city view and sunset and jain temples
review: It's good to take 2-3 hour walk inside the fort. Guide not needed unless you're interested in history. Local people will tell you the way. Jain temples here emit great spiritual vibes and also have nice carvings. Plan your day such that you can see the sunset around 5:45 and have a city view and dinner at rooftop restaurants.

title: Nice but ill maintained
review: This fort is unique one ,as this fort have the residences of the employees n relatives of the previous ruler .

title: Nice but not great
review: Its famous touristy spot in Jaisalmer and is always crowded and with its narrow gullies and hawkers selling everything inside the fort, it hardly gives you the feeling of royal fort. The only place i liked is the Jain temple inside.

title: Good
review: Overall good  and satisfactory. The fort trust charges Rs 100/-per head for Indian travellers and also the camera picture service charge is there.THE SONAR KELLA is all good.

title: Jaisamler fort very nice
review: Jaisamler fort is very nice land excellent view is good clean and very beautiful place jaisamler and golden colour is good great place

title: Nice fort with beautiful view
review: Fort is nice and require little walking from the parking. Although auto are available for INR 10 per head till main entry which is about 1.5KM. View from the top is nice, although we were urged to buy a INR 100 ticket for taking pic from phones.

title: It is a "must to see" attraction!!!
review: Well... Jaisalmer Fort is a "living" fort. Where it used to be the papace and house of nobles and Maharaj's servants is now the house of commom people and lots of shops and restaurants. There is also a beautiful museum and amazing temples for which you have to pay. Reasonable and fair prices though . Wonder slowly around and pay attention to the amazing architecture!!

title: Long walks to feel history
review: I think this is the only fort habituated with people.i would suggest to walk in fort to really enjoy its architecture... I remember passing by a house, I felt a wave of cool air, when I asked I was told that it was natural air, cooled because of the architect and materials used to build that old house... It was like air coming from AC in hot weather.

title: Well maintained
review: Huge fort, it's okay if u don't have guide, market is good to buy bedsheets.. bargaining is necessary

title: Nice fort
review: One of the best fort in india .iam first toor in jaisalmer i am wisit fort i like the fort and coridor and maharaja haveli .

title: Living fort
review: Really such a beautiful living fort in Rajasthan, very old house with great balcony with beautiful Jain temples from 14th century. We enjoyed alot to be here

title: Nice fort in yellow colour
review: Very nice feeling when you enter it .

title: Beautiful fort
review: The golden fort of Jaislmer is really so beautiful.....

title: Amazing City
review: If you are visiting Jaisalmer, you must visit the Golden Fort, which looks like a sand castle by far. This fort is the only one in India where people still live, a great place to explore, visit the Jain Temple and Museum, stop at a restaurant for a Chai  and enjoy the view of this amazing city.

title: Jaisalmer fort. Nice (by Abhirup)
review: Nice place. Bring college ID or any student ID. U will get consession in tickets.

title: look are royal
review: india's most propuler fort . very bigest in side many town. i see in here king queen place, most old 450since baa ki haveli. canoon point and nice city view in side and nice way are here . most attretion are photoshot in here are so beautiful. and i like this fort in rajasthan ...

title: Like stepping back in time
review: Visiting this fort is like stepping back in time. The temples inside are marvellous. The hustle and bustle very atmospheric.

title: Living fort
review: Such a beautiful living fort with old jain temple and places.its so nice to walk in old city with bazar hotels.nice old house with beautiful balcony. We enjoyed alot

title: Excellent
review: Golden fort in golden city. People reside in the fort. Many hotels & restaurants are there in Fort.  one should not miss it...

title: Impressive sandcastle buzzing with life inside
review: The fort is a breathtaking massive sandcastle rising from the sandy plains like a mirage from a bygone era. Inside there are 7 exquisite yellow sandstone Jain temples which you can visit for a fee. The fort is still inhabited. Inside the twisted lanes there are numerous shops selling embroideries, bedspreads, wall hangings, stonework and antiques. There are hotels, beauty parlors etc. We also visited the former rulers' elegant palace. The sellers are after every tourist's rupee constantly calling after you to buy something from them. This can be quite annoying, but it's normal to this place, as they live from tourists 6 months a year, when the season lasts. They will call you to come into their shop "Just to have a look" and then be very pushy to sell you something putting products in your hands. Remember that haggling is an "art" in India / I am not good at it at all /, so don't go for the first thing you see nor for the first price you hear. You will be looking up at the fort's impressive walls, left and right at the dazzling colourful embroideries ... but don't forget to look down where you walk, as there are cows inside the Fort and stepping into dung can be rather inevitable  it happened to me

title: A nice fort but a lot of trash
review: This fort is nice and it is more of a do it yourself dorr exploration than many around India. But this fort is home to many people and thus there is a lot of garbage. I recommend finding a good coffee shop (Kuku Coffee!!) And having a chai and simply enjoying the view.

title: Only lived in fort in India
review: This impressive fort is at the centre of Jaisalmer and is very much lived in.  Crowded with shops, people, cows and activity.  It is impressive for its location and fortifications as much as anything and well justifies the long trip out to the West of India to see it.

title: Golden city of India
review: Jaisalmer is one of the best tourist place of India, the golden city. Among the local site scene, the jaisalmer fort is the best tourist attraction which is also called as "Sonar kella". Traditional rajastani markets, architectures, paintings, weapons can make you lost into another world of kings and queens. Another sightseeing place is the fossils park where you can see fossils. Coming to the next the optional place for the tourist is "Kull gao" which is having a story in the history. and now the entire village is considered as a haunted. There is accessibility food, lodging and everything very easily. One can make a safari towards desert by camel and can spent a night in the desert camp and its completely safe. The best time for visiting Jaisalmer is winter time when one can completely explore more and more. I would strongly recommend this place to every tourist.

title: Unique Fort
review: The fort is literally a Golden Fort since the stones used to built is golden in colour. Very impressive from outside but inside cleanliness take a beating!!!

title: Very nice Sonar Fort
review: Jaisalmer Fort very nice very clean and very nice view and parking and gold colour and very nice public good public simple man good

title: Good
review: Good  yalo building  I lakes so much living fort  interestsig insaed Jan  temps so good  I leve  jaisalmer

title: interesting - good audio tour
review: interesesting fort - but a negative is that they still insist on charging 'extra' for photos - which is like a complete 'rip-off'. Guards stand around and 'whistle' at people taking photos. in this day and age with everyone having a mobile etc this is silly and does nothing to promote/inspire India's tourism!

title: Nice view
review: Jaisalmer the golden city. It has beautiful walls. Well organised. They charge for mobile camera too. Takes 1 to 1.5 hours for visit.

title: Living golden Fort
review: As the name suggests both living and golden the fort because of the yellow stone is the golden fort and the living fort as not only the royal but also the layman live together... Such a true blend of the rich cultural heritage and the present

title: Living fort
review: Second oldest and biggest fort in Rajasthan. Living fort with beautiful Jain temple. Very narrow streets with old house and real life of people

title: Relive the Grand Times
review: The fort is a beautiful example of the Rajputana grandeur and lifestyle and the intricate architecture of historic times. Guided tours are recommended, however, requires a lot of walking and climbing stairs. The best views of Jaisalmer can be observed from the terrace - and those are breathtakingly beautiful. Those who are scared from Bats, should avoid going there, and there are a few patches inside the fort that smell bad :(.

title: Not worth the effort
review: With so many magnificent places in Rajastan I would not recommend this one. Very little to see in the fort. A lot is recent renovation and has nothing of interest to see

title: Great Fort...
review: Must visit place in Jaisalmer....

title: Enchanting
review: Rajasthan has some of the most amazing forts which are well maintained and very tourist friendly and Jaiselmer fort is also one of those. It provides a glimpse into our rich heritage. The Jain temple inside the fort were worth a visit.

title: Very atmospheric
review: Liked it here. It's a bit like an Indian Carcassonne. Just wish it was pedestrianised as I find all the motorbikes annoying. Quite easy to spend half a day wandering around. We were on a trip so had some of the entry fees included such as the Jean temple.

title: Second fort of rajasthan people live inside
review: 900 years golden fort iam surprised when the hotel worner say me people live inside this fort thats really amezing i also stay here in the fort i like this fort

title: Epic Jaisalmer Fort
review: Spent 4 hours wondering around the chaotic streets and side alleys of Jaisalmer Fort.

title: Great
review: The golden fort of jaisalmer is quite big and living fort. You can see the palace,temples and streets and it's very beautiful.But I can not recommended to all visitor's not to stay because it will destroy the fort but I highly recommended.

title: great fort
review: One of the largest fort around the world. Located on the Tirukuta Hill, this fort was built by Rao Jaisal in 1156. This fort also called as golden fort. There is Jain temple inside the fort lots of shop for shopping. In this fort  still approx 4000 family live.

title: So good
review: This building very old old making by Yellowstone not using cement and universe is looking so nice inside living people Jain temples are so good I like it so much

title: Oldest shopping mall in the world!
review: The historic credentials of this place are not in doubt, however today it is basically a little conclave housing homes and shops. It’s fun to explore all the alleyways, there are a few hidden gems in there.

title: Nice
review: Golden fort is awesome there is many tourists form another's country and also ....indian Clint and you see the old maharaja things and mousam........

title: Bad small of bats
review: Vary vary bad smale of bats in Fort  not clean not a good experience  my wife got of problems with the bad smale

title: Main attraction
review: Must visit and get the essence of royal rajasthan here. A place to visit by photogenic people.enjoy ur time

title: Best fort
review: Best golden Fort it's seems like place of gold amazing fortified really don't know what to say more but it's great an beautiful jain temple in side Palace

title: Beautiful building
review: This building all the make by Yellowstone dare you not use to cement anything else that put in the stone to stone that are amazing places at all like in looking in the golden very beautiful I love it when people are leaving this for so interesting

title: Stinking and Dirty
review: The fort is beautiful and mighty from outside, made of golden sand stone. We visited in September, the climate was normal with cool breeze due to clouds. The Entry fee in the fort is 50 INR and 100 INR for camera. Starting from the first gate of the fort, large number of bats could be spotted on roof and these were everywhere in the fort, making the entire place stink badly. Only place we felt good about was the upper area of fort, which provide entire view of Jaisalmer.

title: Wonderful attraction
review: This is the beautiful ancient fort claimed to be more than 800  years old. It is totally surprised living fort. People lives here. It is really the Golden fort and golden city.

title: Good fort
review: We enyoybthis fort log it is amazing fort.

title: A superb structure
review: A superb structure. You need a guide to walk you through the streets of the fort. Many people live here unlike other forts. Great views. Walk around the streets outside the fort.

title: Nice fort
review: Nice fort with lovely yellow stone with fully carvings..

title: Simply the best
review: We loved the Jaisalmer fort,as it was so vibrant and bursting with life.The stone carving in the Jain temples is quite amazing. The fort is a must visit

title: Yellow fort
review: As other Rajashtan's forts and palaces, this is another fort that could not be skipped. The yellow stone glowed under the sun. Locals still live in the fort as well as guest houses and homestays. We enjoyed exploring the maze and meeting locals. En-route the fort, you can find many shops selling local souvenirs as well as inside the fort. There is a scenic viewpoint inside the fort where you can take panoramic view of the sun city. The locals will tell you the direction.

title: Waste of time
review: It’s not a fort. It’s a private hotels & private museum. If you have visited Mehrangarh Fort, you will hate this place. There only shops in this fort. Don’t waste money on guided tour here. If you don’t want to walk, take a rickshaw to the last point of fort & come down walking. Guides will take u to private hotels converted into museum to earn their commission. I pitty the situation, such a beautiful fort from outside & how badly it’s maintained from inside. Government should take some step & take care of heritage site

title: A very nice fort but not maintained at all
review: This is the main attraction of the city.But really felt bad seeing the condition and the way it is maintained.It is terribly dirty inside.And all persons staying there is a guide who will ask you for any amount as per their wish to explain you the history.We did not enjoy much.

title: Golden Fort
review: The only '' Living Fort in the world'' the place is amazing. I would recommend to shop carefully as touristy places are always expensive in terms of Shopping.

title: The golden city : Jaisalmer
review: This place has an amazing history. With the only fort where the public resides it has a lot of temples and awesome City view points. You can look at the whole city from different points. The king still resides here.

title: Living Fort
review: It is said that this is the only living fort in India. This means that the people still live and do business within the fort.  There are many tiny/narrow streets and alleys that are  filled with houses, restaurants, shops, temples, street vendors and havelis. The fort looks beautiful and is big. Many  rooftop restaurants  allow great views of Jaisalmer city. You can take a tuk-tuk to go up the fort but walking is recommended, if you can. Watch out for the traffic while you walk up and within the walls of the fort. Some of them not friendly at all. Also, watch out for cows, dogs and uneven road surface.

title: Amazing!
review: Jaisalmer fort is one of the few in the world to be a living fort. It is amazing to go on your own or with company and get lost in those narrow streets. I love how the people call you to have a cup of chai with them. Jaisalmer fort is the best one I have visited in India!!!

title: Great
review: First day of my visit Jaisalmer Golden Fort. It was huge monuments and local people still living inside fort. Excellant fort place.

title: Best of medieval India
review: A magical place, it's like going back in time by 600 years! A must visit in Rajasthan. Narrow lanes to old havelis, so much to explore!

title: Nice
review: Good location inside the ford. Near t'he entrance. Falafel, coffe and Lassi are so great! Nice staff,  place.

title: SHAMEFULLY DIRTY
review: Wonder how it is a world heritage site.

title: The Majestic Jaisalmer Fort
review: I was amazed to see the magnanimity and strength of the fort. You need a complete day or two to visit /revisit to understand the complete history behind this place. Go with the Audio tour for 400 INR for Locals. That is something which shall not be missed

title: I love Jaisalmer Fort...but beware of one major con artist....
review: Whatever you do, when entering the fort from the big gate, he is on your left SHREE ART PALACE. Right next to the Italian restaurant.  He will say dont tell ANYONE what you paid. (in reality because he is charging way more than others). Also he take your money and doesnt ship. Other posts warn you too, and even in the USA I ran into an Indian lady that knew. I said to her what a coincidence!  She said no, not really. In India shops stay in the same family for generations. So for years everyone knows DONT GO IN THERE. Tourists though dont know...so be warned. There are one or two other shops that start with SHREE and this is but this is Shree ART PALACE and its at the right side of the big gate as you enter the fort.  5 dot rating is for Jaisalmer fort. The shop would rate ZERO as they are con men.

title: Golden fort
review: Wonderful fort. Carving and architecture is very nice. This is only fort where people r living inside. It gives you wonderful filling. A must place to visit.

title: Tourist trap
review: Not a lot to see really. You can enjoy it more from a distance. As soon as you step through the gates you will be subject to touts and merchandisers trying to flog their goods for well beyond their actual price.

title: Beautiful sunset
review: The Fort is constructed in the classic style of the Royals by local craftsmen. Its a World heritage site. Its amazing with carvings on yellow stone.

title: Jain temple of Golden Fort, Jaisalmer
review: Its a renovated temple inside Golden Fort of Jaisalmer. Temple is small but well preserved. One of the rare Jain Temple where discrimination against visitors are least. However, one is expected to cover himself decently as what is expected while entering Basilicas of Vatican/Rome or Blue Mosque of Istambul. There is lot of eating joints nearby the temple. This Temple is located inside the Golden Fort of Jaisalmer, somewhat in right back side with respect to entrance of Fort. You do not need any guide to visit this temple. Though you are expected to remove your shoe, but you can keep the socks on. There is a INR 100 fee for camera but mobile camera is free. Just enjoy the superior temple stone architecture and soak the atmosphere. Any parking for visitor'vehicle is at common parking of Fort.

title: Ignore the tourist stuff and just have fun
review: The locals that bother tourists to get them to buy stuff are given fines. So the pressure is not bad. And I have to tell you the stuff they are selling is pretty neat anyway so worth the time to stop and look. The people of this town are friendly and honestly so. Of course they want to make money but they also want to meet new people too and learn more. Just like you do. This is rare in a tourist town. Take advantage and get to know the people and the culture here.

title: The review of Jaisalmer fort
review: This is a very nice place of interest in Rajasthan.. the fort was made in the ancient period of time...the scinic beauty is also very appealing...

title: Best place
review: This is very nice place people are very honest and cooperative. Must see if you are visit to the city.

title: Beautiful fort
review: One of attraction of Tourists in Jaisalmer for known as Golden Fort. About four thousand families are still living in fort complex. It is also learnt none could won this fort. Well maintained  showing our history with proud

title: Worth a look
review: This fort is a living fort (descendants of original families live there). Interesting construction. Two small temples. Markets stalls selling handicrafts and clothes. Looks very grand from a distance.

title: Know something more about Jaisalmer
review: Great to get an idea about life in the fort in ancient times. Take some time to chill in the balconies where wind blows and you get nice views of the city

title: Amazing
review: That’s a great word to describe the fort.

title: India’s only living fort - stunning!
review: Incredible! Beautiful inside and out. So much history yet still lived in today. Highly recommend despite the hungry salesmen.

title: The best
review: Famous view of the city. Maharaja palace is awesome. Must visit in the fort when in Jaisalmer. Highly recommended.

title: Yellow stone
review: Yellow stone is base of Jaisalmer city every where you will find this stone even houses are built with those stones fort having equipments of Rajas

title: The Golden Fort
review: Became famous because of Sonar Kella by satyajit Ray.Known as the golden fort this is the only living fort in Asia.All the major attractions of Jaisalmer are inside the fort and you need to walk a lot.The car parking at the bottom and after that you can walk up or take take an auto who will charge you around 50 rupees. After you reach the top of the fort you need to walk as the roads are narrow but since its a living fort you can see lot of two wheelers going around.It will take more than half day to cover this place and during afternoons it becomes very hot so carry your umbrella and caps and don't stay too long under direct sun walk under the shadow.

title: Amazing fort
review: This is the only living fort in India.So many hotels and restaurants inside the fort. Golden stone with best carving.Must see.....

title: Grand, cinematic, historic
review: I loved the Fort. It is really huge and fell very closer to that imagination I developed from watching movies. Typically the things to watch around are not much - there are a couple of palaces turned to museums. The rest is a shopping place. But you could imagine how the Fort would have functioned at that time. The view of the city is great from the top of the Fort.

title: Beautiful
review: Nice and amazing fort of Rajasthan different from another forts beautiful carving on yellow stones  , must visit in Jaisalmer

title: A unique experience !
review: Take a walk within the fort..pass through the various gates...and soak in the views of the rustic bazaar, temples and view of the town from the ramparts of the fort!!

title: It’s A Living Fort
review: It’s the last remaining fort in India which is lived in by many. It is vibrant & busy, but like the city but just in the fort. An impressive Jain temple to see as well.

title: Impressive and beautiful
review: Extraordinary place in the middle of a desert. You could spend days exploring all the streets, havelis.

title: Golden fort is a really golden !!
review: Jaisalmer fort was amazing fort.

title: Beautiful
review: An amazing maze of small streets, stalls and bazaar shops. I didn’t use a guide but one may have been helpful.

title: Best place
review: Jaisalmer fort is best place to see living fort, 5000 people living inside fort its really amazing to live inside

title: Beautiful fort
review: Jaisalmer is our first stop in India, once we landed (in a military airport), we went straight to the fort. We were immediately  mesmerized by the architecture. The carvings were so beautiful. The fort itself is not that large, but there’s enough books and crannies to get lost in. We had fun exploring around.

title: Too many shop
review: Honestly speaking the fort looks nice from the outside however when we go to inside the fort we could find too many shop and sometimes they can find you irritating.

title: New Year Gateway
review: The Fort is not properly managed at all as there are residents living inside including local people of Jaisalmer. No proper parking facility near the fort, neither they have proper information centre for visitors

title: BEAUTIFUL
review: It was great experience to visit this historical fort.only remaining fort which inside people living.....very big ......tooooo beautiful

title: Amazing
review: This fort is only living fort. People living inside... A great history of this fort..... Lots of restaurants and and shops in fort....

title: Interesting and bustling fort
review: We have been looking at the fort over a couple of visits and have found it to be very interesting. Visiting in August was a good move as it is busy even in low season. It gets chaotic with bikes, cars and tuctucs going in and out of the small streets. Cows are wandering around too which also adds to the congestion.

title: Living fort
review: Nice sand stone work.  So many restaurants  and hotels. Peoples were very nice and helpful. Good architecture work. Also you should see beautiful  carving.

title: Must see in town
review: If u are in jaisalmer you defintiely have to visit the golde fort which is looking like a sandcastle from far away. Very nice building to walk around and you should definitely make a break at one of the restaurants inside and enjoy the great view all around the city

title: Huge and Interesting
review: A grand fort with lots to see. You can spend half a day here.

title: living fort
review: this only living fort of india have everything homes market museum shops everything

You can spent 3-4 hours easily here. City view from the top.

title: Golden fort

Less tourist  due to .so far India. End and. The. Arcitact is. Were emprasive how. They built on this. Time  golden fort

title: Awesome........
review: Jaisalmer fort is the best fort in hole India. The people living in the fort. The Maharaja palace in fort is awesome.. I loved it.

title: It's alive!
review: An interesting experience as it's not just a monument, people actually live there – around 2.5K. It has markets, people's houses, cows of course :) Locals are friendly and love showing foreigners around (not talking about "official" guides here). Definitely worth visiting.

title: Vibrant living Fort
review: Initially appeared unappealing from outside.  But what a vibe it has inside, it's electric!  Lovely Jain temples - the architecture is fantastic.  The small lanes, bikes, people, little shops and studios make this fort an absolute delight to walk in.  It has an absolutely vibrant atmosphere and an eclectic collection of stores.  There is a beautiful tiny studio of the last remaning family that still engages in miniature paintings and the present artist has some remarkable works.

title: Best
review: Jaisalmer fort is the amazing fort in all rajasthan. Maharaza palace in the fort is best to see with family and friends

title: Yet another yellow stone haveli
review: There is no scarcity of havelis in Jaisalmer, and this is the best among all the yellow stone Havelis in Jaisalmer. It was amazingly beautiful, panoramic view of Jaisalmer from there.

title: Totally worth it!!
review: if you have a two wheeler you can ride up to the fort..its not just a fort but theres also a jain mandir..some restaurants and hotels , shops etc. The city view is too beautiful..the jain mandir has extraordinary carvings..

title: The most visited fort in India
review: The Jaisalmer Fort or the Golden Fort is the most visited place among tourists in India. Thia fort is the signature of Jaisalmer.

title: Living fort
review: This is the only living Fort.very big and beautifully carved.so many shops and restaurants inside Fort.i love this Fort.....surely visit again ....

title: Best fort
review: Best fort in Rajasthan very nice looking around inside people are living inside great palace many hotels and many restaurant inside of the Fort what is first in Rajasthan people are living inside what is 1000 years old still looking very good

title: Good choice
review: Jaisalmer fort is very good to see during your stay in city.  It is use to living area inside the fort but it does have speciality traditional to see the city peoples closely.

title: beautiful fort
review: beautiful sand stone fort,  where people are living still,  one of the great fort of rajasthan highly recommended....

title: A must see
review: Special about Jaisalmer Fort is the fact that it is not a museum, but a city in - or better above - the city. The narrow streets, the temples, the palace, shops and rooftop restaurants make it a living museum. Be aware of all the tourist guides and traders who attack the tourists when they enter the Fort. If you ignore them, you find peace after 150 meters, so you can enjoy the beauty of this place.

title: Golden fort
review: Really beautiful living fort with such a old Street and loving Jain temple. Really we like it alot  also old maharaja palace.

title: Golden Fort
review: Place is amazing from inside and outside. There are many good restaurants near to fort. One can experience traditional food at decent price. There is a water problem, I experienced it on my trip to Jaisalmer.

title: “GOLDEN FORT “
review: Jaisalmer Fort is actually looks like it is made of gold it’s all Yellowstone used in the fort . Now the families of rajputs and the Brahmans are residing inside the fort .

title: Interesting but hoped for more
review: The fort was interesting in that it was a living town, but there wasnt a whole lot going on relative to the other forts in India. The best part was the approach and how it rises out of the desert almost like an abandoned sand castle.

title: Sonar kella
review: Poorly maintained but still hasn't lost its charm.The only living fort,most of it has been turned into hotels.

title: Best
review: On of the best place to visit.its like wonder and dream.. Beautiful carving and amazing architecture..Must to see before die

title: Living Fort
review: Among all forts in India that one is still living. Among all this stunning architecture daily life is going on, there are divine services in the temples and shops offer their goods. Enjoy a rest in one of the hotels or restaurants.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: Let's have a quick review of Jaisalmer fort.

title: Mesmerising golden fort
review: After visiting forts in Jaipur and Jodhpur we were expecting similar experience, but this was a total different experience. It was bursting with all kind of shops and cafe and what not. When I was in Jaisalmer the best part was the fort view in the night from my hotel rooftop, the view was mesmerising. I tried taking pictures but was extremely annoyed by my dslr camera because I thought that the pictures are not doing justice to the real thing so I just captured it in my memory:)

title: Living - Golden Fort
review: Jaisalmer Fort is also known as the Sonar Quila or Golden Fort and one of the living forts in the world. The fort was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

title: Beautiful Fort in rajasthan
review: Golden stone with beautiful carving,  different from other Fort of rajasthan,  nice and beautiful vibes and amazing history

title: Family and friends visit.
review: Unique kind of fort. Well maintained . need guide to have a knowledge. will be better to have a guided tour . must visit for jaisamer trip. Food court at the gate of Fort serves v good food which is priced nicc.

title: One of the best forts
review: This is a live fort where people still live inside the fort walls...

title: A living fort with bunches of gift shop, restaurants and temple
review: I would never though that people still live inside the fort and doing business as it is in normal neighborhood. It is good to see their neighborhood.

title: The golden fort
review: Unlike most of the other forts, Jaisalmer fort has people still living inside it, which makes the experience all the more special. Entry inside the palace is chargeable but to the jagdish temple and the old cannon at the top is free.

title: The fort is more about the shops and less about the history
review: One of the largest preserved fort in the world, the Jaisalmer fort has less history associated with it and is more about walking through the small lanes and tiny shops. The fort looks lively because the people live inside the fort and it has a yellow color that glows at night. If you have seen other forts in Rajasthan, you can skip this one. It will not give you a peak into the history or the architecture. There is one temple and one cannon inside the tomb. That is it. Apart from that, it is the little lanes that take you to the top of the fort. From the top, you can view the entire city. If you want to take a good look at the city, visit the fort at night. And if you want to take a good look at the shops and the fort, visit it during the day. If you have less time in Jaisalmer, opt for the desert safari and give the fort a miss.

title: Best fort ever
review: The fort has small lanes in the inside.Tiny shops make the fort lively and colourful.One you reach the pinnacle of the fort you can see the most beautiful view of the city.

title: Family tour
review: Jaisalmer fort is one  of the world's largest preserved forts. The jaisalmer fort has a yellowish colour and glows like gold, thus earning the name of GOLDEN FORT. A must visit for the history and geology buffs,also for those seeking to admire the ancient, Royal beauty of rajasthan.

title: Nice fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is one of the beautifull fort. The jaisalmer fort has a yellowish colour and glows like gold.......

title: Different Fort
review: I had nevar seen a fort  like this live fort pepole are still leaving in having onw house inside the fort no body will belive this if you dont just vist there. 7 Jain Tempels are  2nd attraction .

title: Beautiful place to visit
review: An enchanting town, full of traditional Houses, Havelis, the fort (free of charge) is actually a little town, nice to walk through, we think it should be an UNESCO heritage place in order to preserve the houses and charm of the town. We had the best Lassy of our trip to India at a local place recommend by our hotel ( the Ranuka).

title: Visited Local Sight Scenes and Jaisalmer Desert Sam Sand Dune which is 45 KM far from the Jaisalmer city.
review: With the local cab with Mr Tharu Bhai driver I had my journey under budget with full co operation. He guided every where where I can be cheated by others bring tourist.

title: One of my favorite places in the world!
review: There is so much history and culture here. It is truly an amazing place. I would highly recommend a visit to anyone who is in the area. I hope to be able to return in the future.

title: More of business centre
review: Fort is not well maintained and full of shops,seems we have entered some shopping mall.

title: Just like any other fort but good to see if you are in Jaisalmer
review: Its good to see but you have to walk a lot. fort has 2 sections one paid one free for all. What we realised that if you go for free for all section then also its ok (you actually do not miss anything.

title: Tourist place
review: A must visit tourist place to visit. The history is very interesting here and the best time to visit is after 3 pm.

title: A not-to-be missed site!
review: During a recent visit to India, I had the privilege of visiting quite a few cities. However, one of my favorites is Jaisalmer. Be sure to admire the massive sandstone fort towering above the city. Within the fort, the streets bustle with those visiting the markets  and shops within the fort. The fort itself is magical in that it appears as a giant sandcastle rising from the earth. This is truly a not-to-be missed site!!!!

title: Stay in sand
review: Jaisalmer- The name itself reminds us of beautiful sand dunes and the magnificent fort. The trip was memorable because the beauty of the fort and desert left us mesmerised.

title: Unique experience
review: Last year in November, I went to Jaisalmer and stayed inside the Jaisalmer fort for 4 days. Jaisalmer fort is one of the largest forts and perhaps the only living fort in the world as people still live inside it and once you enter the fort you will feel that you have gone back in time. The inside of the fort functions like a small town surrounded by huge walls of the fort as there are hotels, restaurants, shops, buildings, temples and houses of people. Each and every infrastructure is made of yellow sandstone, which gives a distinct golden look to it. There are also many rooftop restaurants and hotels from which one can also get panoramic views of the whole city. There are no entry fees on visiting this fort. You will only pay entry fees if you chose to visit the Fort palace.

title: Truly Amazing Place
review: Not one to be missed if travelling to Jaisalmer it is a truly remarkable experience that transports you back in time. Staying inside the fort is something not to be missed.

title: amazingly constructed beautifully designed structure fort
review: jaisalmer was amazing ! increadable jaisalmer amazing thar sam sand and dune camal safari desert safari and all things to do was amaze.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: this is such a huge and outstanding fort in really good condition, with fantastic views of the city below.

title: The Golden city of Rajasthan-Jaisalmer
review: Jaisalmer is famous for its golden sand stones structures.It is famous for its huge palaces.must visit the city

title: Golden City & Fort
review: Jaisalmer Fort also known as Golden fort.Situated in the center of an old & historical city of Jaisalmer ,fort is of great importance.Fort use to be a hub for trade routes in ancient India.Forts has many historical places inside it.Fort also contains a city within,where locals have been residing for many many years.Fort has a lively atmosphere.Shopping inside the fort is an amazing experience.Thousands of tourists arrive each year in Jaisalmer to visit the fort.

title: This is the oldest living fort in the world!
review: Imagine being in a place that you know has continually been inhabited by people for the last 5000 years! There's some charm there, aint it. Jaisalmer Fort or the Golden Fort as it is called, truly rises like a mirage from nowhere in the middle of the Thar desert. It stands golden and shimmering in the sun. The fort has quaint shops selling multiple wares like jewelry, wooden artefacts, picture frames etc. There are too many alleys that run from the middle of it and each rounds up to a house, meaning the fort has people living in it for a while. Lots of restaurants and small hotels to choose from. Also, the hotels in the fort area are also some of the cheapest and the best! Dont miss this at all on your jaisalmer trip.

title: Great audio tour, well preserved + Shree Art Palace
review: We bought the audio tour at Rs500 total each. Great investment. Beautiful fort and well preserved.

title: The Living Fort
review: This fort is a living peoples fort cause they literally stay inside it and its really good place you will definately enjoy the visit to the place as you can do shopping, visit temples, and many more it got 4 doors and its good too visit in the living fort.

title: Great visit - brilliant audio tour
review: Beautiful fort in Jaislamer, very well preserved and great audio guide! Similar to Jodhpur fort which again was excellent! My only negative point would be, many of the guards on duty, must have been bored as it was empty, they kept standing very close behind us and making small talk whilst we were listening to the audio guide. Nice to be friendly but sometimes gets frustrating. Don’t miss out this place whilst visiting Jaislamer

title: Best place
review: Jaisalmer golden fort is so beautiful and me and my all friends fully enjoyed in jaisalmer I am visiting again

title: A city within the fort...
review: Probably the only fort which has a city within itself. The fort is bustling with houses, cafes, mini resorts that too inside the premises. Hundreds of people have made this fort their place of residence. The way to the fort is quite simple but one can easily get lost if you are not familiar with the lanes inside. It is recommended that you carry a guide along when you visit this place. The fort is laden with Hindu temples and Jain derasars. One can also witness the intricate working of some of the old havelis inside the fort. There are cafes at every nook and corner of the fort and rooms have been rented to tourists who wish to stay in the fort. The fort premise is vast and will take more than 2 hours to witness the marvels of the fort. Preferably go in the early morning and be back by lunch. The last point on this fort is the canon perched on top of the fort. The entire golden town of Jaisalmer is visible from the top. Its a very photogenic spot and a camera with wide angled lens would do wonders!!

title: Good place
review: Jaisalmer fort is a historic place. Go early in the morning to experience less crowding. The fort includes Jain and Hindu temples. A must visit place in Jaisalmer.

title: Carvings and havela in the fort are quite nice
review: lots of backstreet dealers, not sure of their quality.  FOrt is amazing to walk around especially the old ramparts, the canons etc.

title: Nice fort
review: I visited there in peek summer, temperature touching 48 but what I noticed, the temperature in fort was not so high it was nearly 25,no fan no air-conditioning, Amazing architecture. The stuff of king and queen are so impressive and beautiful.

title: Fort withold town within
review: What special about this place is that its a living fort with an old town within the fort walls. Its great just to wander about and enjoy the atmosphere as well as stop to see the beautiful Havelis.

title: Amazing and beautiful fort
review: Definitely every one must visit this fort.... Tuk tuk service is available in and around fort... Don't forget to bargain.... Very beautiful fort,mesmerising beauty..its truly a golden fort....

title: Ok not goods
review: Jaisalmer fort is just ok not good place for visited .another maybe you go patwon ki havali is good palace to visited.

title: Freaking amazing detail!
review: The detail in the different fort buildings is incredible. The only place we saw in India with this style and detail of architecture. Not so much the colourful jewels like some of the other palaces in Rajasthan but rather beautiful golden sandstone carvings.

title: Worth it
review: Amazing. Lots of little hidden restaurants in this place, most with amazing rooftop views of the whole city. There are little shops down each street. The detail in each building blew me away and some of the ashrams were really cool to visit. Definitely worth a trip to the fort if you can.It’s also very easy to get to as its in the centre of town

title: Golden world
review: this for has made by golden stone looking  very. Beautiful. Very nice city view from Fort. This is very nice to visit

title: golden fort
review: one of the most popular tourist attraction in jaisalmer made of yellow stone found abundantly in jaisalmer which glow like gold in sunshine. Though there was not much to see and also not much of extravagant life of royals to display, Visit to the fort was a different experience as comapred to other forts in rajasthan like bikaner, jodhpur, jaipur etc. It was mainly because of the architecture. We had a guide but if if you want to spwnd good time and really wants to see the things it better to go without guides as they makes things in hurry. Fort also offers a great view of the city. There are many shops inside for shopping but found it more of a trap.

title: Excellent -try to visit in early morning 6 am
review: Excellent historic Fort.

title: Golden Fort well worth exploring
review: Jaisalmer Fort, a.k.a. Sonar Kila, or Golden Fort, is an astonishing place built on the highest rock hill in the area. The fort has about 4,000 people still living within its walls, with shops, cafes, houses, and historic Jain temples.  The buildings are beautifully and intricately carved, and it's great fun to walk down the narrow lanes and imagine what life was like for the fort dwellers hundreds of years ago.  Jaisalmer is surrounded by desert and not many tourists make it this far west, but it's well worth the time and effort to visit.

title: Beautiful and very different to other Indian forts
review: If you're visiting Jaisalmer then you're obviously certain to visit. A beautiful "living" fort, with business and and locals living within its walls. Definitely worth paying to enter the museum part.

title: MAIN ATTRACTION OF JAISALMER
review: Jaisalmer fort depicts - Architecture, Culture & History of Rajasthan in totality. Its an living fort (people living inside the fort approx 5000). They even have a separate Municipal ward.

title: Excellent visit
review: One of the only forts in the world that is actually being lived in from what I'm told! Interesting to check it out and walk around. Many shops and restaurants to check out. The Italian restaurant is very nice in the fort and the look outs are great. The food is average in price but they do offer Indian as well. Spend a little time or just stroll through and you will pleased!

title: Impressive
review: The whole complex of Jaisalmer fort was very interesting since it included the palace, Hindu and Jain temples, market and houses. It is a very lively place. On one of the narrow streets we found a lovely restaurant / café with incredible views.

title: What Happens in Jaisalmer Stays in Jaisalmer
review: Very beautiful place. Seen first time a fort where people are still living. 60% Jaisalmer Population lives in this fort.Vey ancient museums and temples are treat to watch.

title: nice place
review: historic place, if want to see then must go early time. then u can see museum and any others old jain temples

title: Amazing fort
review: Well, walking in this fort look is a challenge is you don't want to get lost. But each place is nice, especially in low season because Indians shave more time to speak with me! Perfect!

title: Read some history before your visit
review: You will gain a lot out of your visit if you understand why this fortress is so important. Google now...!

title: The Golden City
review: Jaisalmer fort or 'Old Town' is colloquially known as the Golden City with good reason as the local sandstone and hence the fort are a mellow golden colour. In years gone by, when on the Silk Route this could have been part of the 'golden triangle.' Perhaps with a stronger claim than the present holders. Partition and the Pakistan Wars have ruined the tourist industry which is only recovering very slowly.  The advantage to the traveller is that costs are modest and the City is relatively quiet (save for the motorbikes.)

title: Golden at sunrise !
review: i reached jaisalmer in the morning and the view of jaisalmer fort was amazing, it was all golden during sunrise.

title: Living Beauty in yellow sandstone:
review: Jaisalmer fort is one of the only living forts in the world and its an artistic masterpiece. October to December is a good time to visit as it gets unbearable hot in summers.

title: A True Golden City
review: I loved this walled city. It is beautiful to look at from the outside and great fun on the inside. Myriad shops to get souvenirs from  roof top restaurants to sit in enjoying the view. Great atmosphere. I loved it and will be back in 2019 to explore further.

title: Village in an impressive fort
review: We were in Jaisalmer for 3 days and enjoyed exploring the fort each day. It’s particularly interesting because lots of people still live and work in the fort itself. There’s lots of small shops and restaurants many offering great views of the city. You could easily just do it in 1/2 day or a morning before it gets too hot.

title: Sonar kella
review: It is a great experience to visit a living fort . A living fort is a fort which is  still functioning ...  like  a town. We have travelled a lot and visited numerous forts . Unlike all others , this is a  fort where people live on a daily basis . Other than that , the grandeur of the palace , the architecture , and the golden color of the fort is unique and mesmerising.

title: Surreal beauty, architecture is splendid and walking around the fort is a treat to the eyes !
review: One of the most beautiful historical places in India is the Jaisalmer fort. It has been my first experience visiting a fort big enough to accommodate 3000+ people, with people living inside of it even today. There are tiny lanes adorned with shops selling super expensive eye catching  trinkets, but the architecture of the palaces, temples and even ordinary houses that have decorated windows with intricate sandstone carvings is absolutely breathtaking. One gets a very western feel inside this fort, -and looking at the beautiful cafes and the shops in the tiny lanes reminded me of Tallin’s old town..

title: A beauty!
review: Take your time to visit with ou without a guide.

title: One of the largest forts in the world.
review: When you enter the fort precinct some lovely buildings to see including two Jain temples.  The second one we visited had some remarkable carvings.  Inside the actual fort palace found some lovely rooms including one where you can see the Maharaja's silver throne.  Lots of climbing inside and well worth the effort going up to the roof.

title: Nice!
review: Walk back in time in this fantastic living fort. Lovely stalls but unfortunately also a lot of touts and unregistered “guides”. I prefer to scout alone so rejected their offers. A very nice experience with lots of viewing points and little alleyways to explore. I recommend.

title: Jaisalmer Fort in Golden City
review: Beautiful and lively fort, nice place for shopping and Jain temples must be visited for its stunning architecture. City views from the fort is great. Best time to visit is winters.

title: hawelis and more
review: Jaisalmer fort carries a lot of history and should be visited. consists of a jain temple, throne where king used to sit, various hawelis etc. also lot of sellers who are hawking old stuff which seemed genuine

title: a city within a city
review: The Jaisalmer fort is very unique. The fort area is new and restored and the king has allowed the locals to stay within the compound premises, permits cars, shops, restaurants and everything else to flourish. It feels like you are within another city altogether.

title: beautiful sight
review: Gorgeous fort in the desert.  Very laid back town with wonderful havelis and sights.  Definitely worth a visit.  Step out of the ussle and bustle of india and into the past.

title: Jewel of india golden city . adventures jeep ride . Camel ride.shopping.small streets. Nice peoples.exlpore forts .
review: Jaisalmer golden city . Sam desert.thar desert. Desert Safari. Adventures Jeep ride. Camel ride.longewala border.tonat temple

title: Picturesque with great architecture
review: nchanting shade of gold against speckled, grainy desert, Jaisalmer with its ‘Patwon ki Haveli’ echoes glory of the era of Maharajas and Maharanis. .

title: Awsome Fort
review: what a great fort very very nice place to see..superbly maintianed any one who so ever is intrested in history will defenatiely like it...i will surely recommend every one to visit the fort...too good

title: Interesting
review: The fort is a massive construction and interesting to visit. The audio tour was quite good and is important for tourists to do if you want to understand the history and gain a depth of knowledge about the fort and the occupants.

title: Really Golden Fort
review: Amazing fort in the rajasthan. We love this fort. Must visit the jaisalmer Fort. Highly..... Recommended

title: Golden Fort- Good for 1 Visit but...
review: Fort is beautiful but just carry lots of money as wherever you go whatever you do just pay for that. Entering fort or want to use camera or even want to use Mobile- Just pay them lots of Money. Is it fort or some Business making place.! If you do a guide from outside the guides which is inside fort will make you mad by saying why you did that from there, we are real ones. But actually all are same.

title: SONAR KELLA ( Golden fort)
review: It was like a dream come true. Several times I gulped the book, and several times I watched the movie Sonar Kella by Satyajit Ray. It was like a known place.. We visited all movie locations.. found out the shop visited by Ray.. Most beautiful part was the Jain temple inside the Fort. Night view of the fort from hotel was the best part though.

title: rising up out of the desert
review: it sits on top of a rocky bluff and overlooks most of Jaisalmer, but within the walls is an entire community of people, shops, cafes, hotels, temples, workshops, everything really.

title: Beautiful
review: Beautiful fort, great place to learn about the history and culture of Jaisalmer. extremely crowded though.

title: Small but very full experience
review: The fort sits on a raised platform dominating the city. As it is inhabited by 5000 people it is living and dynamic in character. People are friendly and willing to sell but are not at all pushy. Golden City expresses not only the sandstone but the wonderful carvings on every building. A gem!

title: pictursque fort
review: good fort, old monuments, good culture, good people, good food, nice place for shopping, must visit during winter, not so good during summer

title: Greate fort where people used to live
review: I loved this place. Only one fort in india where people used to live. Owsm fort owsm architecture and great view of city. I love this place.

title: Beautiful living fort within easy walking distance of our hotel
review: The temples inside are not to be missed.  Also the artisans inside the fort have every imaginable gift you might wish to take home.  Very nice people and a must see for Jaisalmer.

title: Really golden
review: This fort was made by king Jaish at 1156 by golden stone, most beautiful fort in India... Warth a visit after 2 pm. Its magical during 2nd half of the day

title: Lively Fort!
review: Generally, the first thought that comes to the mind wit the word " Fort", is dilapidated, lifeless, stone structures, with no semblance of life. But Jaisalmer Fort is an exception and a phenomenal one for that. For starters, the fort is " inhabited", yes, you read it right, there are people who are actual occupants of this fort and not merely from the perspective of being a tourist display. The Jain temples are a definite should-not-miss with the stunning architecture that is the hallmark of the place, the place redefines artisan skill and attention to detail. The ornate threshold, entrances to the sanctum sanctorum and life-like statues, purportedly made of a mixture of soil and milk as well as golden sandstone are a visual treat in addition to having a calming effect on the mind, by virue of the positive energy the temples exude. The desert texture of the fort inner walls are decorated with multi hued rugs, copper nicknacks and souvenirs and the cannonballs and guns are reminiscent of a bygone era. A fabulous experience!

title: Great place
review: The place has all the grandeur of Rajasthani architecture and it's history.

title: Fort of marwar, a golden fort
review: A good educational tour specially enjoyed by children. A GUIDE is a must. Must try walking through the narrow lanes of the fort

title: Fort of the Desert
review: Once you enter the main fort complex, the fort entry is located a steps further in. There is a small staircase that leads to the main entrance of the fort. You need a ticket to enter the fort and you might opt for the audio tour as well, both those things costed INR 500.

title: Great
review: This is the only living Fort in India.The Fort where around 3000 people staying even now.well mentioned and must see.Highly recommend.

title: A tourist tap but a genuinely pleasant and laid back one.
review: Been going there for years, the last time a few days ago, and always enjoy it. Yes it is full of tourist shops selling goods which can be described as ranging from tat to the esquisit. You can pick up a reasonable bargain if you discriminate and bargain hard. But it's about more than shopping.  The cool narrow streets with friendly locals is always an atmospheric place to wile away a few hours in banter and browsing.

title: Jsisalmer Fort
review: Jaisalmer fort looks magestic from outside. Inside there is not much to see, apart from the Jain temple, the rpoms of the King and Queen and the vantage point from where the whole city can be seen.

title: an interesting place to visit
review: The fort was interesting to see and to stay in a hotel in the area. Well worth a visit. Lots of interesting alleyways and shops.

title: must see
review: take a rik and go up its steep lot of hotels have come up and lot of shopping two temples inside must go and see with a guide it will be fun

title: Fun and different tourist town.
review: The fort is cool.  Made, remade, and redone again, of sandstone, much of it recycled.  Super narrow little walking paths loaded with residents selling trinkets.  Lots of eye candy here.

title: A living fort - interesting place
review: Enjoyed visiting this living fort. We had a guide who lives in the fort to take us around. He explained there are two castes here - the Brahmins on one side and the Warriors the other. The former are vegetarians while the later are not

title: Golden Fort
review: This fort is visible from main road & looks quite impressive. The best part of the visit to this fort is the TUK TUK ride from parking to fort entrance. We have to appreciate the skill of the drivers who drive the TUK TUK at speed within the narrow lane.

title: The fort made up of yellow sandstone ! Golden fort -Sonar Quila
review: Visited this attraction end of December 201. Jaisalmer is a yellow city mainly because of the yellow colour sandstone architecture all around. Sonar quila or the golden fort, call it by any name it’s a strong standing magnificent structure which is made up of yellow sandstone. It is a living / working fort with people living and working in here. You will find lots of shops selling wares or eatery shops on the way to the top.Incase you need to buy wares do not forget to bargain hard. Guides will be available around the section open to visitors but it is not worth paying them to go around and know more as it’s the just the same like in any other fort. Go around on your own rather than getting hurried around by guides without getting time to sink in the history. You can also take an audio tour.

title: loved this place
review: this is a must visit.A very vibrant fort with people living inside.The majestic golden colour glittering in the sun is an awesome sight.there are many points to see inside the fort like jain temple,raja and rani's palace,two canons where you can get a good view of the golden city.There are numerous shops.buy a small bowl made of this yellow sandstone it will remain with you

title: Just an opportunity for people to sell you things
review: I was extremely disappointed by our visit to this fort. It was beautifully and intricately designed but the experience was extremely unpleasant.

title: Sonar Kella - the only living fort in world.
review: The bonding with Sonar Kella starts in childhood for any bong kids.  And My dream was to go there since then when i didn't even know the concept of Bucket list .

title: Raja ka Mahal... The Jaisalmer fort.
review: One of the best example of fort design. The fort has very narrow inside roads which help to avoid the crowd. It has more than 5 Jain temples situated inside the fort which are the great example of stone carving.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: Great place to visit with historical significance. A city within a city, it offers city views as well as exposure to local culture.

title: Definitely worth a visit
review: We deliberated over whether to visit Jaisalmer, especially because we’d seen a lot of reviews suggesting it was overrun with tourists and hawkers.  We were pleasantly surprised that it was in fact relatively calm, and easy to wander around and explore on our own, without being approached constantly.  It’s an amazing and unique place - the architecture is very different from the other cities we visited (Delhi, Agra, Jaipur, Jodhpur, Udaipur).  The streets are crammed full of intricately carved buildings and havelis, and one of the main sights is a group of small Jain temples which are really lovely (though watch out for “holy men” asking for tips inside!).  We arrived at 1pm and left the following day at 3pm, and felt we had the perfect amount of time in the city (you could even do it with less time).

title: Jaisalmer fort
review: Jaisalmer is one of the best tourist place of india.the jaisalmer fort is the best tourist attraction which is also catted as " sonar killa ".

title: Beautiful golden
review: The overall scenery is amazing. It is all in sandstone, which gives the buildings a natural similar color. The complete fort is commercialised, with hotels inside the fort. Also many havelis are privatised so there's a ticket of 50 INR per person on entry. But the look is still great and worth visiting, best to stay in a hotel within the fort.

title: Living Fort
review: This fort has people living inside its golden boundaries. Lots of shops, havelis and restaurant exist inside apart from few famous temples.

title: Living fort with rich history
review: Its one of the few forts in India where people live. Its a huge fort and if interested in history, you should keep 3-4 hours to cover the entire area and various temples, Maharaja palace , various shops etc . Its best to take a guide as you may get lost exploring the fort as its quite huge and has small roads which can confuse you. The jain temple architecture is as good as Ranakpur or Dilwara temples with excellent carvings. There are many shops which sell local goods and these are reasonably priced.

title: Decent , but not the best
review: Jaisalmer fort is a decent place to visit but is overrun by local merchants and shopkeepers. The sand stone buildings are a sight to behold. but so are other fort throughout Rajasthan. Wandering cows and noisy merchants kill the asthetic beauty of the place.

title: Fort & Haveli !
review: Fort that resembles the beauty of original Rajasthan. View entire Jaisalmer city from fort. Collection of dresses, utensils and swords/guns/bows and everything that was used by thr royal family. Nice place

title: Jaisqlmer trip
review: Abhay hotel best place to stay in jaisalmer with best prices, hospitality provided by hotel was great. Jk bhai the owner of the hotel was very helpful. Our whole trip was mnaged by jk bhai..

title: Dreamy streets
review: I really enjoyed walking around the fort and getting lost on its tight streets full of shops. I was there for Holi with my friends and it was a great experience

title: Must visit place
review: If you are travelling to Jaisalamer in any season other than between 25 Dec to 05 Jan, don't bother whether you could book your accommodation or not. We visited on 9th Jan this year and found less than 50 percent occupancy in most hotels. I would strongly recommend that you hire a vehicle from railway station and scout around. With some effort, you will get amazing deals. We hired a number of vehicles and among them, found services of Taxi Driver, Bharat Kumar 9784952366 and Auto driver Shaktidan 9460310005 quite good. They will quote approx 20 pc more than the price and you will have to bargain. Rather than Sam, you may visit Khuri and stay at Badal Singh's homestay there. Sam is very commercialised. Camel rides, which were being charged @ Rs 700 before sunset, were available @ Rs 60 after sunset. Go through the ratings given on this forum for finding better places to eat. Wish you a happy visit.

title: Very good fort
review: Very good fort. A must visit if you visit jaisalmer. Very good carving and architecture. Can do shopping also.

title: A living fort, wwith wonderful architecture
review: Jaisalmer fort is a live fort, with more than a few hundred families living inside the fort and you can find all types of shops lining the narrow lanes inside the fort. While this takes away the historical attribute of the fort, it is still nevertheless a wonderful piece of architecture with many marvelous carved structures.

title: Different and enjoyable
review: Day 1 we wandered around, expecting a fort which was based on visits to other forts, fortified, with antique armaments and settings.  We could not find it.  Later we understood that this is a living fort, with a population residing inside.  Day 2 we made sure to leave our expectations outside and visit.  that was the day we enjoyed the diversity and life within the fort

title: Main focus for tourism
review: It's main focus for tourism but people needs focus on cleaning and managing... Old havelis are main concern

title: Go for the experience
review: We had planned to do a quick tour of the Fort, infact had told our guide we will double his fees if he shows us the fort in half the time.  We ended up staying there for 7 hours.  We stopped for tea at a gem of a place, The Pearl, and never left the place, due to the hospitable host.  At an amazing location, parapet that gives a grand view of the city below, we had tea/pakoras, lazed around, went for the evening aarti at the temple, walked around the fort after dark when most of the tourists had left.  Interacted with the residents, who were sitting on their front steps, even ate food that they so graciously offered us.  Came back to a wonderful meal prepared by the Pearl, they catered to our every need. After dinner were provided blankets, so lazed around some more and chatted up with friends. They  do have some wonderful rooms there too, next time I know where I will stay.

title: Great sight and a tourguide
review: We visited the fort in Feb 2018. Around the entrance tons of different tourguides approached us to try sell their services.

title: Hii
review: Nice gadiser lake jaisalmer is very nice city  i like this place this really very nice lookingin the night time

title: Visit at Evening/Night
review: If Looking for Eye catching View of Jaisalmer City Visit Jaisalmer Fort at Evening (Although its 24 Hours Open) : Visit Canon Point and have a Look to Lighting Jaisalmer City, Gadisar Lake and Jaisalmer Railway Station

title: Excellent Fort with lots of history
review: I was very excited to see the fort. It reminded me the great film "sonar kella" by Satyajit Ray. It will take around 1:30 hour to roam around the fort. It is main attraction of Jaisalmer sight seen. We captured lots of pics there.

title: A good fort.
review: This fort is made of golden yellow stones.

title: Beautiful
review: Beautiful fort. Well maintained.  Clean. Lovely Jain temple.  Spectacular views.  Good guides available.

title: Explore the alleys
review: The whole citadel is a warren of narrow lanes and alleys, and home to many people, so it's a very much alive historical monument.  The Jain temple is very beautiful and worth the visit.  For those who enjoy shopping , this has almost everything from rugs to silver jewellery , textiles of every range, and huge selection of camel leather goods. to see the sunset I recommend finding a rooftop cafe with a western view over the city.  Finally take your time and explore, there's so much to find.

title: Good fort
review: Very good fort. Carving and architecture is very good. Its amazing to see such kind of building built without modern technologies.

title: Must visit
review: Very awsum..jain temple inside fort is very attrctv..raja mahal rani mahal all r awsm..we enjyoyed it vry well

title: The detail is amazing!
review: It actually not that big. It only took us half a day to explore the whole thing which looked so much bigger from the outside. The details are amazing,  we got an Assassin Creed moment, and we had fun exploring the small alleys. Where it would lead us, what kind of shops would we find, etc etc. My gamer-self is extremely happy!

title: A true living fort
review: A very colourful fort with people going about their everyday business as well as those catering to the tourists. What was fascinating is the lack of rain this area gets and how precious water is as a commodity. The fort itself was fun to navigate with audio tour to assist.

title: Good
review: This very old building all the make a bhai yellow stones not using two sim and Sam soon as he is putting dystonic restaurants so beautiful I like it so much

title: Fort with people living inside
review: This is only fort where 5000 people r living inside, hire a guide in 150 and he was helpful to provide information about jain temple, raja n rani ka mahal, canon gun captured from britishers, laxmi temple, and did the job of photographer as well

title: One of the best forts ever visited
review: We visited Jaisalmer fort in Oct 2017,  the architecture of the fort is very good. It is one of the biggest and oldest forts (Around 800 years old). This is also among one of the few forts in which people actually live inside.

title: Spend a day
review: The fort area needs at least a day on foot. It is small enough to explore at own leisure. A guide is not needed. Stroll slowly, take in the awe. Grab a chai. Talk to locals. Sit under a tree and watch the city come alive

title: Visited a History
review: This is a huge fort which doesn't cover a height but covers a big area. There is a good number of people living inside this fort. You will be surprised while entering in the first gate of this fort. The view of this fort is as like the mixture of Red Fort of Agra and Mehrangarh Fort of Jodhpur. The walls of this fort is not coloured yellow but they are yellow. Small and beautiful streets inside the fort make it more awesome than anything.

title: an amazing Fort
review: I will be absolutely back! The Jaisalmer fort in Ratjastan,  is an experinse not to miss ! I spent  three relaxing days there, living close to lovely persons,interesting markets,  colors and music and spices and great views

title: Sonar Killa
review: Rightly called Golden fort, this fort just glows like gold in right light. Many points of interest within the fort. Would recommend to roam around fort with a guide and then just explore various parts on own.

title: Lovely, living fort!
review: One of the only forts in Rajasthan that still has a working population living inside, and we enjoyed it more for that. Smaller and less grand than most of the others, we found the intricate stonework of the buildings and the narrow streets and lanes enchanting! Lots of local people going about their business and fewer tourists because if its remote location out near the Pakistan border.

title: A different fort
review: Very vibrant fort with number of households selling lot of stuff.

title: Golden Fort
review: Jaisalmer Fort to the Bengalees like ours is SONAR KELLA, named by World Famous Film Director Sri Satyajit Ray.  Thus it is an emotional matter to us as well.  We were pretty keen to visit the fort, since last time in the year 1982, while visited Rajasthan, we could not turn up here in Jaisalmer.  The first impression of the Fort with golden colour is magnificent and attractive as well.

title: Jaisalmer fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is a living fort of 4000 families made of yellow jaisalmer stone and is a must visit. One can take an auto rickshaw for complete fort visit in case don't want to walk. There are restaurant inside fort with very stunning jaisalmer and fort entrance view. One can also organise private dinners for hiring this place if the group size is 15/20.

title: A vey big fort! You'll love to walk inside!
review: It's nice to explore the alleys of this fort and get lost inside. Eventually you'll find the way out. Many shops inside you can browse or view the city below from one of the viewpoints. Wear comfy shoes. There are also interesting cafes around where you can sip, relax and drink some lassi while enjoying and taking it all in. Lovely! And as always, beware of the touts!

title: Good living fort
review: This is the India only living fort. Fort is very beautiful. Fort is not very big. Jain temple inside fort is very beautiful.

title: Beautiful place
review: This fort is stunningly beautiful. I love that people still live here. Best stores without pushy sales people.

title: Nice fort
review: Nice fort. There is   meuseum with nice old collection.

title: Amazing
review: The stone carvings on the palaces, the Jain temples, the havelis and the common people's houses are awesome. Ask your guide to see the non-touristic quarters as well. There are some stone balconies you just have to see.

title: Nice
review: Jaisalmer Ford is leaving Fort inside lot of house hotels restaurants is incredible people are nice walking in the street making jobs Maggi for happy I like it

title: Worth the Visit.
review: This fort is amazing. You will get to know nuts and bolts about this fort's history by the guide who will be there at the entrance of the fort.
