Jaisalmer City view from the top of this fort is spontaneous. Only thing is they will charge you INR 100 for photography from either mobile phones or DSLR camera.

title: Special thanks to our guide Kamal [].
review: Special thanks for our sympathetic guide Kamal [] a retired army sergeant. He showed us very enthusiastic  the city of Jaisalmer with a good explanation and knowledge of local customs. Jaisalmer is a fascinating city with a beautiful fort and the famous Havelis with their beautifully elaborated façades makes that the city is certainly worth the trouble a detour.

title: Crowning Jewel of Jaisalmer
review: Before coming here, we thought we would just look at the fort from outside, click few photographs and be done with it. But fortunately we met Guide Rahul #naamtosunahihoga. Rahulji who stays within the Jaisalmer Fort guided us through various parts of the Fort and explained us the history behind the Haveli and the temples. It's a whole city in itself, complete with shops offering sweets, chaas, lassi, fruit juices, tea, hand painted t-shirts, souvenirs etc. The history of the fort is mesmerizing and so are the views of the new Jaisalmer town from the top of the fort. Don't think twice, higher a qualified guide and a rickshaw (as the climb up the fort can be a little too much for families) and enjoy the history of Jaisalmer Fort!!

title: nice place to visit
review: good place to visits, royal carving , superb view of golden city from top of fort , jain temple is must visit

title: Well maintained
review: The fact that there are a lot of houses as well as hotels in the fort dissuades you to see much of it. The view of the city is great fro the top.

title: Beautiful fort in the desert
review: Enjoy a relaxed wander and no stress from traders. Beautiful wares to buy if desired.

title: Interesting, but not much to see
review: The fort is massive and interesting since there are many people living inside. But there isn't much to see. The locals themselves are the guides, who may take you to their shops.

title: Common place with an Uncommonness!
review: Well, Rajasthan has been famous for its remarkable ancient architecture, however, the far off places, being less touched by the crowds are doing much better! And, for the very reason, Jaisalmer Fort has been able to keep up the good work of maintaining the soothing views to the eyesight.

title: Jaisalmer is an elegant oasis
review: Fashion shoot worthy rooftops overlook the city below woth stunning sunset and dusk views. Try and stay on fort if you can or on a road very near to take advatage of this spectacular city. Look for the womens cooperative selling beautiful cotton fabrics, located on the lower road just outside the fort gate.

title: Big but commercialized
review: This is one if the latest first of Rajasthan and being situated in valley it is visible from almost every corner of the city. The walls are made of sandstones and it perfectly resembles the sand around. It has small temples and shrines inside but due to large number of shops crowded inside the place looks a bit claustrophobic and dirty as well. The fort looks stunning at night with lights from all sides. There are even hotels inside the fort and is less costly. Shopaholics can even but stuffs from.inside shops as it is cheaper than outside.

title: Beautiful Sonar killa
review: Such a beautiful fort at the heart of jaisalmer city,  a huge fort build with yellow Stone, the best thing of this fort is this is living fort.....

title: Sonar fort
review: We saw the site related to sonar fort and the place. Amazing fort in Rajasthan. We have enjoyed a lot with family.Recommended to everyone.

title: Wonderfully preserved fort
review: Wow... Jaisalmer fort looks utterly spectacular from the outside, and once you are within the walls of the fort it continues to shine. Beautifully preserved and full of shops, dwellings, restaurants and accommodation you really get the feeling that you have stepped back in time wandering around the narrow alleyways.

title: Lovely fort. Lots of tourist traps
review: You must visit here. Walk along Ghandi choke up through the several gates to get you inside. Lots of trashy tourist rubbish on sale everywhere. Golden stone is wonderful when it is polished by Wear.

title: Avoidable
review: Nothing much to see, other than a good view of the city from its rooftop. Rajasthan has better forts and palaces in udaipur and jodhpur

title: Awesome old fort
review: I really enjoyed our visit to the Jaisalmer Fort.

title: looks like "SONAR KELLA"
review: The fort looks very big and beautiful from the distance , but the approach road for this fort is real mess full of litters and dirt. People still live inside the fort so the road is very crowdy , people run the bike at very high speed with honking  horns  , this might irritate you. Although the fort is very very beautiful from inside too. Must watch thing in Jaisalmer.

title: Beautiful place
review: Nice place with amazing jain temple. Some very old havali but most of them are shops. Definitely go there.

title: Jaisalmer fort
review: Its basically a town. Nothing much to see there. You can buy fancy stuff as souvenir. And also check out Dr. Bhang shop incase you are into that stuff

title: Nice fort
review: Very beautiful fort.. carving is extremely beautiful. Yellow stone gives a magnificent view in night.

title: Interesting place
review: Did a day tour with knowledgeable guide Vishal Singh, who lives in the fort with his family.

title: Great Golden fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is living fort people are living in side the fort very good jain temple  maharaja palace  canon city view point

title: A Bazaar in a fortified town
review: Well this is a shopping precinct for tat inside a medieval fort, beautiful from the outside but the experience  ruined really by stuff to buy everywhere. Most of the inhabitants seem to have turned a room or area into a way of making money.

title: Good
review: Lets say rajasthan is full of forts and this is its major trp. Every fort is unique and this one isn’t an exception.

title: A fort for commoners
review: it's the first time that I saw a fort with so many houses of commoners and also so many shops.  This was surprising but really nice to see the gesture of a true king

title: Don't Expect more from Jaisalmer Fort
review: Rajasthan mainly known for remarkable and incredible structures like fort. But if you have already visited Jaipur,Udaipur,Kumbhalgarh this fort will disappoint you. Even height of fort from parking will feel you nothing much special about the fort.

title: Beautiful
review: This fort is located on a small hill exactly in the heart of Jaisalmer city. There are many families living in it. Very beautiful architecture. Guided tour is a must and you will not regret when they will tell you stories.

title: Average
review: Go for Jain Temples (a must visit). Fort is only good for picture clicking from outside (for full city views) and inside palace view ticket is not at all recommended.

title: Nice place but inside rather poor
review: The fortrece is well situated in front of a desert and has a magnifique view around. But the inside and exhibitions is to be improved.

title: Not worth
review: I hv visited this fort, but there r 4000 fml r leaving there, where Jodhpur fort is so beautiful,but this one is not to good, government should tk sm disision to mantion this fort.

title: Beautiful desert
review: We stayed at sam dhani resort for the second time.In fact it was a very pleasant stay for 4 days.We will repeat our trip for three consecutive year in2019.Thanks to all staff of samdhani hotel for their courteous service.

title: Sonar Kella
review: A place immortalised by Satyajit Ray in every Bengalis heart as” Sonar Kella”. Beautiful fort with awesome craftsmanship architecture visible everywhere. Visitor can enjoy great view of the city from top of the fort. This Golden Fort is as beautiful and historical as the Jaisalmer Fort. And the stories of the 2 sisters and their love stories add to the charm

title: A Big Fort and an Accomodation of Locals
review: People actually live in this fort.

title: Embracing Jaiselmere - Indias Only Inhabited Fort - Great Experince
review: We visited the fort as part of our tour and it was definately one of the most vibrant places I have seen in India. From stores, shops, street food to musical outbursts by the locals with traditional Rajasthani instrumentals; it's a must visit for anyone in Jaisalmere.

title: Takes you back in the ancient times
review: Must visit when in Jaisalmer. Although most part of the fort is commercial establishment the Kings and Queens palace's are worth visiting, really take you back in time.

title: Going back in time...
review: Jaisalmer is a lively city inside a Fort. It takes you back several centuries, when it was a key stop of the Silk Road in the middle of the Thar desert. Walk around the narrow alleys, enjoy the life of the local people and "feel it"

title: Interesting incridable historical place
review: Yellow city Jaisalmer, lovely & beautiful fort ever.It

title: Sue
review: Jaisalmer is great , what a lovely vibrant place , not too big and so a lot less hectic. A must if going to Rajesthan. The fort again magnificent recommend a guide the stories are what change it from an amazing building feat.

title: Mind Bogglingly Big
review: This is where the tourists are at in Rajasthan. A UNESCO world heritage site this is an impressive fortress. Audio guides are available so use them. Use the human guides and you'll end up in a carpet shop and not wandering the many narrow avenues available to you - we found out to our expense.

title: Very well maintained
review: Historic informative to know about the legacy of jaisalmer,jowhar tradition seeing the king & queens quaters and seeing & imagining their lifestyles was good fun

title: Cradle of history
review: Reaching the fort is easily done through the city. It is better to do on a week day as the crowds will be less. There are lots of rental two wheeler shops available near the fort. Parking is an issue at the fort proper but there are a lot of bylanes around where you can park.

title: India's one and only fort with public residence
review: Jaisalmer Fort is situated in the city of Jaisalmer, in the Indian state of Rajasthan. It is believed to be one of the very few (perhaps the only) “living forts” in the world, as nearly one fourth of the old city's population still resides within the fort.[1] For the better part of its 800-year history, the fort was the city of Jaisalmer. The first settlements outside the fort walls, to accommodate the growing population of Jaisalmer, are said to have come up in the 17th century.

title: Very unsettling
review: The most beautiful outline of a fort  spoiled by buildings two to three  stories high some even with tin sheds as roofs..its just heart breaking to see a beautiful fort going down not in ruins ..but by an utter lack of thought to preserving such a national treasure..

title: amazing fort one of the historical place in jaisalmer
review: very good experience spent 2 hrs here along with tour guide. he has explain every thing on the same very dip.

title: Beautiful but overpriced!
review: Take care of the people inside, the sell there things at least for 3 times more than outside. Fort itself is beautiful!

title: Golden fort Jaisalmer
review: It is believed to be one of the very few (perhaps the only) “living forts” in the world,

title: Golden fort
review: Jaisalmer is a small city and the fort is located in the heart of it. This is a living fort and families are actually living in it. A beautiful fort constructed like an Indian map. Take a guided tour and be ready for all the stories. Restaruants and all kind of shops are there in the premises.

title: Loved it
review: We really liked Jaisalmer Fort and the fortified citadel around it. It is like stepping back  in time walking along the narrow lanes and checking the old buildings out.

title: Walking junket through Jaisalmer Fort
review: Jaisalmer’s unique UNESCO World Heritage fort is a living urban centre with narrow winding lanes. The Golden City was founded by the leader of the Bhati Rajput clan named Maharawal Jaisal Singh in 1156. We started our visit from the central square with a view of the royal palace façade. From here we wended our way through the different alleyways and appreciated the living conditions and daily household activities of the residents, all within the fortified walls. Of course, some houses served as cafes and souvenir/craft shops too! One cannot miss the temples and intricate havelis, all exquisitely carved in yellow sandstone. We really liked the ramparts and turrets with cannons, which were still accessible to the public. From this high vantage point, we were able to have bird’s eye view of Jaisalmer town and its surrounding desert landscape.

title: Just brilliant!
review: What a fabulous place. Buzzing with energy and taken back hundreds of years. Amazing architecture and stonework.explore the many alleys and have a coffee on the many roof top cafes! Pity about the lunatic moped/tuk tuk riders buzzing about but life goes on for them I suppose! Well wort the trip out there. Good for a full day walk about in my opinion followed by a trip out on camel safari!

title: Beautiful desert fortress
review: If you grew up on a diet of Arabian nights, or loved mad max, you'll like Jaisalmer. Astounding to think that this fort was first constructed in the 12th century and like a mirage, it still rises from the desert sands today. The winding streets of the fort are a joy to explore. Just follow one and it will lead you to a parapet, a bastion or a defence look-out post. The fort palace is another treasure to explore. Well worth at least half a day or repeat visits if you're in Jaisalmer for a couple of days.

title: Awesome
review: Fort itself is wonderful and is considered to be the best tourist attraction in Jaisalmer... In short words can’t express the beauty of this fort , once has to visit to see the beauty

title: Stunning architecture
review: Rajasthani architecture is mind blowing. You would think the carving was timber but its all stone. The intricacy is incredible, along with the internal paintings, timber windows.

title: Fantastic maze learning city.
review: Love this  fort.

title: Beautiful fort
review: The fort really is very impressive and worth the visit. We had a local guide to show us around which made it all the more interesting. Don't stay at the fort itself as the constant flow of water is damaging this beautiful structure! Leave it for the next generation to enjoy

title: Fort
review: Jaisalmer Fort was amazing because this is living Fort I think first Fort of the world there are people live inside I requirement to all of if you are in Jaisalmer Then visit this Fort it's really amazing and interesting

title: Golden city
review: Nice and beautiful  fort just like a real gold. History of this fort is so proud.good experience  in this golden golden fort.

title: Jaisalmer fort
review: The fort is a stunning place to visit. Full of beautiful ancient temples and structures. Walking the alleys is day time and at night is a must!

title: Small yet lovely
review: The fort is small (sections are closed) but it’s lovely. People still live in the fort with about 2000 families. The jain temples in the fort are worth the visit. Simply lovely. The temples close at 2 in the afternoon so be sure to give an hour for the temples

title: Spectacular "Shonar Kella"
review: Must visit once in a lifetime to watch a living fort. There are markets and hotels inside the fort. You can also check out for home stays. This is a grand place. Relive history.

title: Very beautiful
review: Fort charges 100rs each and 100rs for camera.

title: Jaislmer trip
review: Hotel is very good. They made all sorts of arrangement for us. Hotel staff are very polite .food was very delicious.u can find every type of food.

title: Good fort
review: Only fort in India where people are still staying!

title: Historical fort. Main attraction of Jaisalmer.
review: 100 rupees cost to visit the fort. Audio guide facility is also available. Around 4000 people still leaving inside.Nice market inside the fort. Few points inside the fort from where you can have glimpse of whole city. At night view of fort is amazing covered with lights. Nice place.

title: Jaisalmer Tour
review: Awesome place... a city within a city.... Jaisalmer fort has it all.... royal palace .... royal musuem... royal handicraft.... royal scenery.... its totally worth it... top 5 places on the list of places to visit in Rajasthan....

title: Nice place to walk around
review: I had a few hours to kill before heading out on a safari so decided to visit the fort. I was expecting another place similar to maybe Amer fort in Jaipur where its a large place full of history but other than that quite empty spaces. This is not what it is like at all. It is a walled town, still functioning and full of wonder. There were temples, shops, Haveli's, cafe's etc. It is quite noisey and busy in the square, yet when you head off to the side streets its quiet and so pretty. It was surprisingly clean compared to other functioning places I have visited in India and the architecture was beautiful. You can get great views from the gun towers and other quieter areas around the wall. A great place to visit if you have am hour or two. No cost to entry!

title: One stop for all kind of fort
review: The amazing markets and hotels is what makes the chaos inside the fort meaningful. We had a great time exploring different types of food and beverage shops.

title: Excellent
review: Worth the trip. Historic, charming and stay at a hotel inside if you can to really appreciate a living fort.

title: Living history
review: Amazing to see this, a living history, full of quaint shops and really friendly people. The food options were amazing. It's a easy city to get around without being hassled constantly.

title: Jaiselmer fort
review: A living fort. Some might find it crowded or dirty and maybe not worth a visit, but it surely has a character .. and if you want to explore the city and get a feel of it.. you should surely go here.

title: Must check out
review: Probably on the top of everyone's list......and for good reason.....temple, restaurants  and walking around fort.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: Excellent visit in a living fort with beautiful Jain Temples within. Surrounding town typical of a vibrant Indian city but less chaotic and manageable. City also has lovely havelis to explore. Our guide Anand (00918209954456) spoke excellent English (and Italian) and was very informative both about the monuments but also about Indian culture.

title: No one
review: Jaisalmer fort is the no one fort in Rajasthan .The maharajah place in fort is awesome. View of city is absolutely amazing. Highly recommend......

title: Beautiful Crafted Live Fort in India
review: One of the beautiful fort in Rajasthan. Only Live fort in India where still people lives. Beautiful palace inside fort. Must visit place

title: Wow
review: Except for the hassle to buy anything from the small shops, it's really worthwhile visiting!

title: Golden fort but not that great
review: We visited this fort and liked the Jaisalmer view from top but the fort is very small compared to the forts we saw in Jodhpur and Bikaner. The place was very crowded and the visit was very expensive compared to other forts I meantioned. They charged Rs. 400 for a single audio guide. A trip to this fort for two people with one audio guide costed Rs. 700 which included camera fee. The restrooms did not have any water and were filthy and stinking. We wondered where the money collected go as the fort also did not look very well maintained.

title: A fort filled with mixed bag of action
review: This fort is one of those fort areas where actual people have occupied the entire hillock. Its a mixed bag of action you would experience. Important ones are the amazing Jain temples with art work which is a class apart, next the haveli many of them with Natmal ki haveli & Fatwon ki haveli being the prominent ones. Best is the busy shopping streets where hundreds of wood, stone, lac are showcased. You need to take timeout for on particular activity i.e Painting, some shops offer you to do th painting under their guideline & you should experience this as its in natural colors. as you walk around the centre of the fort, one point to refresh is the RABDI ( Thick milk boiled with badam & kesar) is a good choice. Mr Naveen vyas is the third generation RABDI specialist and you should re-boot energy. Overall a good half day time spent.

title: The only fort catering to the age old customs.
review: Imagine people still living inside the fort premises since their ancestors were alive. The walls, the architecture, you name it ad it has all. Night view is just pure gold. Watch the grandeur of the fort from all angles and from any side of the city, you'll just fall in love with it.

title: amazing
review: have a local guide show you around the fort as the information is pricelss and they also exploain the alleyways around the fort

title: Golden coloured Fort
review: Mesmerizing and unique golden colored fort due to natural stone colour of this town. A must visit place. A nice place to see at night times from hotel roof top as it may be visible from almost all the hotel roof tops.

title: Good
review: Jaisalmer Fort is leaving for is very nice in the top of the city because of its Yellowstone very good cartooning impressing I like it

title: Fort Visit
review: Small portion of the fort is converted to museum. Nothing great about the fort.From the top you can have a view of Jaisalmer city.

title: Nice to do before/after desert-safari.
review: Basically it is, apart form the multiple (camel)-safari`s, the only thing you can do in Jailsalmer. As we were looking for a shop to buy some appropriate clothing for our trip to the desert, we were approached by an old inhabitant who offered to show us around. Since we`ve been long enough in India to know this man was actually on the hunt for his commission, we obviously knew the `money talks`-hassling was an intrinsic consequence of our agreement. It was fun though to walk around and buy the guy a Coke at one of the small bars while we were having some interesting conversations about India.

title: Amazing place
review: A must place to go. Don't bother hiring a guide. What you see is what you get and the joys of Google for info. Save yourself the 10 quid. Lots of shopping.. Lots of bargains as long as you can haggle

title: Magnificent historical monument which is also a thriving walled township
review: The magnificent architecture & craftsmanship of the palace within the fort is breathtaking. The palace itself is not very large in expanse, the construction is more vertical, with the living spaces, Darbars, prisons, armoury, etc., spread out at different levels. The palace is now a museum with an entry fee. While the oft photographed facade is beautiful in itself, photographs don't do justice to the artistry & symmetry of the construction. The fort is inhabited by the common people, erstwhile subjects of the Raja. The palace is located in the central square with the Chamundeshwari Mata temple also occupying pride of place in the square. The temple is that of the Royal deity of the Jaisalmer royal family. The symmetry in the architecture of the buildings in the square are something to behold.

title: Golden fort, nice palace
review: Worth a visit, 11th century fort , a living fort where common man still own part of it for generations. Outside each house u can see invitation card of last marriage painted .

title: Smaller fort with easy access.
review: As forts go by, this is small. You need about an hour to complete the tour.

title: Amazing views
review: The fort was amazing.

title: Don't Buy Electrical Stuff inside fort ! they r waste of money
review: Fort is huge.. lots of twist and turns inside the fort; quite a labyrinth.. lots of age old temples inside fort... since its a living fort, people haven't maintained it's cleanliness... its crowded and u have to be aware of motorbikes that pass you through narrow streets of the fort... lots of shopping options... plz dont buy electrical stuff as the material is low grade and won't work for even 5 mins !!! U hav to haggle a lot to buy other stuffs at their real price... fort has good cafes (Ba's Cafe/Mirage)...

title: Heart of the city
review: Nice fort in the heart of the city on top of a hill.

title: Poorly Presented and the staff surly and lazy
review: For the 500 rupees that is the charge for a foreign guest I expect more. The staff was un helpful and un friendly. Obviously need some management changes.  With the right management could be quite nice. The audio tour was not in sync.  I suggest the NYC Trust that runs the place get some pointers from Jodhpur.

title: Nice small fort
review: Fort is good and small , dunno why people are living inside the fort just like tughlaqabad fort in Delhi which is now ruined.

title: Best goladan fort
review: Best location of Garden  for Golden city I like it this far and golden city this is small city but very nice city this Fort inside little bit Home Is Crazy But what is very nice good location everything is ok

title: Good
review: Take a guide to know fort’s history. photography from top of fort is good.u can also buy Ethnic stuff from forts market

title: Mesmerising golden fort
review: After visiting forts in Jaipur and Jodhpur we were expecting similar experience, but this was a total different experience. It was bursting with all kind of shops and cafe and what not. When I was in Jaisalmer the best part was the fort view in the night from my hotel rooftop, the view was mesmerising.

title: A living Fort
review: One of the Oldest and living fort in India located on a small Hill top. The approach is not so clean. It has a nice Jain temple within the Fort premises and a nice hotel too . Satyajit ray the famous film maker termed it as Sonar Kella  ie the Golden Fort.

title: Living fort
review: Only fort where people are currently staying. Narrow passages, some beautiful temples. A couple of points inside the fort had a nice view of the city.

title: Living fort at its best
review: Beautiful experience of the old fortress. The JHAKROKHAS and the JAIN TEMPLES here are top-notch examples of stone carvings.

title: Jaisalmer fort
review: The fort, where around 3000 people staying even now.Must visit.Architectural beauty.Seven jain temples inside the fort

title: Fort Villa
review: An incredible place to stay.  I never felt more welcome and at home here.  Narish is an incredible man and goes way above and beyond to make you feel like family.  The best place I stayed in my month in India!

title: Absolutely stunning! Must go..
review: I am a kind of traveller that enjoys offbeat travels and hate touristic spots. But a visit to jaisalmer fort changed that and for good. I absolutely loved the architecture, views, history and our guide’s enthusiasm in doing his part. The guide was well informed about the fort and patiently told us all there was to tell.

title: Mesmerizing views from the Fort
review: Jaisalmer is a charming little place which you absolutely need to visit on any tour of Rajasthan. you can visit this place for 2/3 days tour in the location to enjoy the sun dunes which is like 50 kms away from jailsalmer. This fort is a living fort, where people reside. there are too many shops as well as there are too many restaurants with mesmerizing views. However these restaurants are very costly and mostly you would get the foreigners visiting these places. There is a place in the fort where we can get the complete view of Jaisalmer.

title: One & Only Fort with living people
review: This Fort is Most attractive place to visit in Jaisalmer. Don't hire any auto from the taxi stand as this is at walking distance only but must take guide's service so that you will know the history of this fort. Most amazing thing of this fort is that presently approx. 4000 persons are still living in this fort. Architecture of this fort is amazing. Don't book any jeep safari or desert safari from the office of the booking agents from here as the same are very costly.

title: Superb
review: Must visit place you should hire guide so that he will let you know the amazing history of it...people still live in this fort...should definitely roam on small streets so that you can see amazing carvings on the walls of their houses and windows...

title: please save this fort
review: this is the only living fort in india where people reside inside , unfortunately when this makes it unique in world it also makes it very vulnerable to damage...so better not to stay in the beautiful hotels inside the fort as it accelerates the erosion of fort walls which are crumbling due to drainage water and rubbish piled up below desert walls

title: Great fort
review: Very nice fort but needs maintenance. View of city from top is magnificent.. carving and stone decoration is good

title: Jaisalmer Living Fort is worth the visit
review: This is the only living fort in India where people continue to reside. There are couple of nice hotels in this fort for those who want to have the experience. This is a good half day visit to see all important sites within the fort and also for shoppers who want to pick some nice local items and costumes. The lanes are narrow and a good experience, but suggest you hire a guide who can help with the importance of the various spots in this fort.

title: =a city to be visited in the lifetime=
review: The city which connects by air now.Spicejet & Supreme Airlines have  regular dailyflights.

title: Hello love
review: Very nice family beautiful very nice looking I love for you India here beautiful nice all my friend coming here I really beautiful

title: Excellent all round view from top of the Fort
review: Its worth a view even though its not as well kept as other forts.The fort however has some excellent temples inside which are a must visit

title: Not as Expected!
review: This fort is not government managed and there are many private shops, museums , restaurants inside. I like the restaurants at the top with city view.

title: Mind Blowing Tour
review: It is really a beautiful place. Winter is the best season  to visit it.  This a great place to visit.... Wish to visit again.

title: History Revisited
review: It one of the forts where people are leaving & its very crowded that way, Still knowing the history is surely great, Awesome view when you reach at top. Try the Bombay bhel & orange juice once you come out of the palace.

title: The Golden Heritage
review: Can visit if you like history / ancient architecture, but except architecture, not much to see. I was sad to see the poor maintenance of historical articles (as you can found in Jaipur / Jodhpur) Though this is the only non barren fort, but it's misfortune of this fort as well. Very Crowded. Polluted, Stinking and with danger of stray animals.

title: Loved this place
review: This is a true fort which manifests Indian culture.  A small town inside the fort having all the basic amenities from market to temples.  Enjoyed roof top restaurants. Coffee at Sagar guest house I liked the most.

title: Poor condition of the fort
review: This is the only attraction in Jaisalmer city. One of the oldest forts in Rajasthan. But unfortunately people have ruined it. Only a very small portion of the fort is preserved and that is the only thing to see. You dont need guide for this fort at least. So better go on your own and explore. You can opt for the audio guide if required. City view from the top floor of the fort is the very good.

title: Lost in history
review: No words,just go and watch it, Watch a living fort, because 90% area of this fort still using by its own population,they r still living in it.

title: All time great
review: This is historicle fort has its own colors thats why it called golden fort of jaisalmer . The fort has very beautifull place of maharaja and maharani with super carving on sand stone ,balcones and city views, canons ...over all its beautful golden fort with many things to see .i would love visit once again.

title: A glorious living fort
review: This one is different. With over 4000 residents, this is a living breathing historic site, with temples within. Bring indian rupees as you will need to purchase tickets for specific sites within the fort that you want to enter. Pay for a guide, worth it to know the history of this amazing fort. The screens carved in stone are phenomenal!

title: Must see place
review: Well maintained and must see place of Jaisalmer city we have enjoyed a lot  with family . recommend to everyone

title: Good Place to visit
review: We planed to visit Jaisalmer with friends around 25 December 2016 and let me tell you this is best time to visit Jaisalmer. We love to visit, war museum, fort, sand village and we enjoyed a lot and the reason behind a great company and the place. I suggest to visit this place in Dec to Jan and don't forget to camel ride.

title: Silk Road revisited
review: Second visit after 20 years and still unchanged after 2000. Well mostly, it still feels like you could be in the Arabian Nights. We stayed within the fort. Hard choice as we travellers are causing some water disposal problems. Short showers if you choose to stay in the Fort. The Fort is not large but you can work to get list, although finding your way back is not hard. Hearing local music being performed by buskers as you walk into the main gate takes you back. There were a number of traditional weddings whilst we were there which were a special treat.  The Thar desert and overnight ++ trips on camels available from many places and people. Many food outlets, mostly cheap, and generally with similar menus. Need to find which are good at the time, as it varies - who is cooking tonight, mother or son? I reckon Jaisalmer is a must, and staying in the Fort the best. Just treat it well.

title: If you are in Jaisalmer, can visit
review: I have not a very high impression about jaisalmer fort. Jodhpur and udaipur forts are much better

title: Sonar Kella
review: We went to visit Jaiselmir fort with the satyajit Ray movie Sonar kella at the back of our mind

title: Not much worth to see it
review: Just a pond with limited water... water was dirty...no birds ...even we visited it in early morning... visit only if you are free enough from other good place in city

title: Plenty to see!
review: It was so enjoyable walking through the little streets of the fort. Beware of people trying to sell you items for much more than their worth. If they say one price, ensure they stick to it otherwise walk away. We learnt the hard way.

title: Adventure trip
review: Most enjoyable.friendly people.nice experience.will try to visit Thor & spent night in tent with all rides..folk song..dance & delicious buffet

title: Good
review: I love visiting the fort and the view from the top is amazing. Fully residential and commercial.Must visit...... Thanks.

title: wonderful palace
review: Amazing fort with sand stone sparkling like a gold great and unique fort architecture enjoy the view from one of the palace

title: A living fort !
review: The walk up into the fort through the 4-5 gates is the highlight. The palace museum is also very good but i would rate lower than udaipur city palace, amer fort and mehrangarh. If you visit, pls do hire a guide.

title: City in a fort - must see
review: Lovely city that is situated in the fort with bustling activities and plenty of local shops and restaurants.

title: Fantastic historical architecture...
review: Very ornate and detailed architecture... Does involve a fair bit of walking but definitely time well spent..

title: Awesome
review: I am sharing review about jaisalmer fort. Most enjoyable friendly people nice experience. It is only living fort in the world........

title: A Living Fort with a glorious past!
review: More than 5000 people currently stay in Jaisalmer fort hence it is considered to be 'the largest living fort in Rajasthan'.  It has 2 temples inside which is the only attraction. Overall an average monument.

title: Great Architecture
review: Must visit fort of India where people are still residing inside the fort in large numbers. is is having the beautiful jain temples inside.

title: The only living Fort in India
review: Worth hanging out here. Lots of history , artefacts and little knickknacks that you can buy for your home if you are 'ethnic in your taste' .

title: its Golden,
review: Beautiful , was the word when i first saw it from road while approaching Jaisalmer from Jodhpur. Its one of its own in India, Golden View, Golden Sand . Its Living Fort -People have their houses in this fort, so its a city inside, NO ticket to enter the city. Park your Car -U will find lots for it.  Best is to Roam around in the streets and to view Jaisalmer city from many Corners of the fort , Bastions you call those places, Canons At every Bastion. And you have many restaurants at these Bastions. Roam the outer walls of Fort, enjoy the view. I think no need to go to KING -Queen palaces, Better if you explore fort by your eyes. I really wish Jaisalmer Municipality quickly Repair damaged walls , sides , Embankments of the fort and keep this jewel alive forever.  What a beautiful place we have in INDIA. Love Love....

title: Best fort in rajasthan
review: An absolute treat, this is one of the best forts in rajasthan. The audio guides give a wonderful insight into the life and times of the Rajputana families. The architecture is beautiful and really eye catching. The views of Jaisalmer from the top are breath taking. There are some interesting handicraft shops and cafes lined outside the Fort which are worth a look.

title: Unique and beautiful fort
review: Great and unique fort with people living inside the fort itself. Nice to walk around, enjoy the view from one of the rooftop restaurants or do some shopping.

title: Rajasthan
review: Lovely place, Small temple near Arjun Kuan has melodious and energetic Rajasthani Aarti,  amazing experience with great music.

title: Supper...
review: Amazinh fort in the rajasthan.We love this fort and town.Highly....recommendits the best fort that we found during the visit.

title: Most Stunning & Gorgeous
review: Totally love the colour & material of the rocks used to build this charming Fort..We also spent the night here & lived at Maa Niwas which is a quaint & beautiful place to spend the night, must try the aaloo parathas here..Do get photos clicked in traditional outfits, shop for some Artistic t-shirts freshly painted in front of you, visit KuKu's for the food & view..

title: Shonar Kella
review: Must visit for Bengalis to relive the childhood memories of watching Shonar Kella, however the museum is a waste of time if you have already seen Mehrangarh and Amber. I found the artifacts rather primitive.

title: Only place to hangout
review: This is the only place to hangout in jaisalmer. Within fort complex, you can visit museum, jain temple, market, cafe etc. One can spend hours in exploring it.

title: Fabulous Place
review: It was bustling with life and happy people. Everywhere you turn is a beautiful view. Not for people with prams or babies but my 8yo loved it.

title: Fantastic Fort, second oldest in Rajasthan
review: the Jaisalmer Fort is amazing, it is well worth visiting with a guide, it is enormous and there is so much to learn about it. Over 3000 local people actually live within the Fort, including our guide for the day, who was amazing. the Fort as so many different things to offer including tranditional fort structures but also amazing town-scapes such as beautiful old merchants Haveli's

title: Amazing culture
review: It's the only living Fort in world amazing place to see ancient culture and fabulous achitecture building. Must visit place

title: GOOD
review: If you have seen Amer fort then, this is big disappointment. Four wheelers are not allowed upto the fort. You have to take the Auto.

title: majestic and imposing
review: Definitely imposing, and with great views ... if you can find your way about. I got totally lost on my first visit. Fortunately I had time to visit again with a guide and a couple of local friends which was a much more satisfactory way to see the temples, narrow walkways, small restaurants and special secret spots. Amazing that people are still living there. The traders are a bit over the top,during the day - much nicer at night.

title: A golden beauty
review: Standing tall overlooking the city of Jaisalmer this is a “must see”.Made of yellow sandstone,this fort is on a hilltop so offers great views of the city.Many families live within the fort and that’s why it’s known as a living fort.Wear comfortable and suitable shoes to enable you to climb uphill on the somewhat slippery stones.Spend an hour or more wandering the small alleys,shopping for trinkets ,hand made cushion covers,bedspreads and wall hangings.The fort has many restaurants within.It also has Jain Temples with exquisite carving inside.Be prepared to leave your shoes outside and buy tickets for your cameras..even the mobile phone ones.Make sure you see the palace inside the fort for which tickets are needed.

title: Amazing experience! History+culture+architecture - immerse yourself!
review: This place is must-see! It was the first place we visited when we reached Jaisalmer. It's hard to miss as it can be seen from any hotel rooftop in Jaisalmer.

title: Jaisalmer Fort - Sonar kella
review: Jaisalmer Fort or Sonar kella is a fort as well as a city. Several families staying inside the fort. It is a must visit place as a part of Rajasthan trip. The fort area is pretty big and a lot of walk require. Ensure to allocate enough time to visit the place while you plan.

title: Visit to fort
review: Very crowded place where you have the Museum and city view points. Lot of street vendors selling chats and local artifacts. The entry to the museum is 100/ per head. But It is similar to what you see in Jaipur or Jodhpur. Can skip the Museum.

title: Crowded but nice
review: A living fort with lots of people milling around. Museum is good but like in most tourist places in India you do get bombarded  with offers of various kinds.

title: Royal - King size
review: It's one great piece of architecture.

title: The beautiful golden fort
review: Beautiful piece of architecture. An amazing and a must visit place. Also, the local community people are pretty helpful and supportive. In all, a must visit place.

title: Too crowded!!
review: It is a living fort. And that is beautiful. But was too crowded and too commercial. Not for people who want to see a majestic fort. But for shoppers! They have made it a shopping mall!!!!

title: Royal family
review: The trip to Jaisalmer fort was awesome and was indeed a very good experience. It was lovely to see the place and I personally recommend you to take a guide. The Jain temple was beautifully carved and the raja and rani's palace was amazing . I really liked the place and a wonderful guide accompanied us and told us about everything there. So go there and feel the royal sensation spread throughout the air when you visit the Jaiselmer Fort.

title: Fort where people lives
review: It’s a nice place to visit, around 4000 people use to stay in fort. Half of the section is open for visitor where you have museum. Night view was superb it looks golden from the city and justifying its name as golden fort

title: One of the best experiences in Jaisalmer
review: If you are in Jaisalmer, do visit jaiselmer fort in the evening around past 3 pm . The best of all forts in Rajasthan, gives a view of the entire golden City from the highest point of the fort. In brief touring this fort will be one of the best experiences of Rajasthan.

title: Fort ALive!
review: People live in this fort and if that itself is not amazing, you'll be blown by how hospitable they are. In fact, many of them own shops and little terrace cafes all over the fort. The ambiance this adds hugely to the ambience of the fort. It is truly like no other fort in Rajasthan or in India. Try to find the best coffee or the best laal maans here. Go to the German bakery and eat your weight in simple sinful desserts. Go to Jaisal cafe and plunk yourself down on the floor cushions and enjoy endless cups of adrak chai and coffee and pancakes. Enjoy the sunsets from different cafes, and support the small traders by buying handicrafts and mocked up antiques. Visit the heritage temples inside- both  Hindu and Jain. Traipse through the lanes, bumping into odd shaped stone architecture and people going through mundane lives in a magical fort. Eat like there's no tomorrow. You could do so much worse and just stick to the fort tour though.

title: Brilliant
review: Being a Bengali, was a childhood desire to see the SONAR KELLA, (Satyajit Ray film). Its probably the only living fort in the world.

title: best place to visit
review: nice place to visit well maintained and must see location while visit to jaisalmer. location was good u can see the complete market

title: Fairy tale city
review: Jaisalmer was our hub on our trip to a four day desert camel safari.

title: Living fort
review: This is the first fort I visited where people live in the fort. Unbelievable isn't it? It has a beautiful Jain temple. Don't forget to see the fossil stone.

title: A living, historic fort worth visiting
review: Jaisalmer is not a location on many people’s itinerary as it requires a detour from Jodhpur or Udaipur, but it is well worth visiting, and combining with a somewhat touristy trip into the desert.

title: A huge fort
review: A huge fort, If you get a good guide and a reliable one you get to know a lot about the history which is very interesting.

title: Amazing fort.
review: Great walk, long and winding, people still living there, fully residential and commercial. Must visit.

title: Living fort
review: We spent about 2 hours inside the fort. Apart from usual things that a typical fort in Rajasthan would have, it is one of those living forts which has huge population ( more than 4000) as informed by our guide. The golden stone used to build the fort simply looks awesome.

title: Tour of Jesalmer, Dunes
review: We had experience of the tour of Jesalmer Rajsthan with Dunes. We enjoyed forts city of Jesalmer and Dunes Safari with Karan Desert Safari. We were accommodate in Hotel like for, It's on a top, we had a pleasant experience not in city But most probably Dunes with safari thriller ride, Camel ride, and specially foak dance and cultural heritage program, thanks to Karan-Rahul and their team

title: A grand structure in the middle of a desert!
review: I loved visiting the fort and the view from the top is amazing! The stone is carved beautifully. The structure stands on the top of the hill and you can see the entire town from here. Awe inspiring in a tough terrain and that makes it even more special!

title: Magnificent
review: we visited jaislmer on a shirt weekend break for a small tour. It was a good tour,  we visited pattwa kids haveli,  a rich architectural building  of 200 yrs back, liked very much the ancient life style, very informative, must visit for young people to learn about history

title: Truely Historical palace
review: Jain temples must watch as they are several hundred years old and very beautiful inside the palace

title: Beautiful fort ! A town in itself.
review: This fort is one of a kind in Rajasthan. It is huge and requires half a day at least to explore its nook and corner. Wonderful for photography.

title: Nice old fort. A must visit place
review: Jaisalmer fort is a living fort . It has many shops and houses  within the complex.  I highly recommend to take a guide otherwise  you will miss the finer details and the story. Moreover the guides know well about the places to take pictures.

title: The Fort
review: Huge fort with people living there so very busy and interesting. Well worth the trip out from Jodphur

title: Small version of Dubronovik
review: I have never seen a ecosytem inside a fort in India. It was very interesting to see people living inside the fort and also various shops. Fort is very well kept and really clean, except in the center

title: Excellent
review: A beautiful fort ,in the middle of the city not to far lovely location .a must for people to visit its the only fort which has common people staying in it good experience .

title: Living fort - a good experience
review: This is one of the few (perhaps) the only living fort in the world. The legend has it that one the previous kings of Jaisalmer decided to live along with his people and since then the king and his people have been living together. Thought the present king has now shifted to his own palace near the clock tower area.

title: Amazing fort
review: This fort is different from many forts in India as it is one of the very few living forts. The fort is bustling with lots of activities in and around, people staying, having shops, snack centers, cafes monuments, palaces, temples and much more. There are hotels inside the fort. The architecture of the fort is amazing and Jain temple inside the fort s beautiful itself if beautiful (check for timings of the temple). If you have guide well and good, but visit to the fort is very easy without a tour guide as well. In the night, it is illuminated and one can see it from the rooftop of the hotel as well. It is also known as the Golden Fort.

title: Good tourist attraction!
review: Best and probably the only place in Jaisalmer for a tourist attraction.

title: Vibrant living fort
review: This is the only living fort in India with 4000 residents and it boasts of beautiful sights like Famous Jain Temples, Museum, buildings and pathways. The exquisite craft workmanship is displayed in the array of small shops.

title: Don't miss it!
review: Amazing little streets, with stone carvings everywhere.

title: Loved this fort
review: Been to many forts but this one is different. It houses a small city inside and lot to explore. Better take a guide to understand the history associated. Best part is that it houses almost 5000 people with lots of shops, restaurants and hotels. Must visit.

title: One of the best historical place
review: It has been maintained well. One should book a guide to know more details of the fort and various details. In general Rajasthan is filled with very friendly people.

title: One of its kind!!
review: Enough has been said about this golden sand castle of a fort and yet it's not enough! Indeed, the unique thing about this fort is that it is unlike it's contemporaries whose abandoned lanes speak of a bygone Era. This fort is very much alive as it has people still living within its ramparts.

title: Living fort
review: It a living fort with around 4000 residents staying inside the fort. You can drive inside and with a motorcycle see the lanes and bylanes. From some of the points you get a stunning view of Jaisalmer and sorroundings. I was told by one of the residents that residents are not legally allowed to sell their property as the king had given them only staying rights, although can't vouch about authenticity of the information. Jain temple have stunning architecture, hire a guide for the palace, there is separate camera charge for palace including mobile camera, for Jain temple camera charge is Rs 30.

title: Different fort
review: I have seen many forts but this one is different, thousands of people still live in this fort, many people have converted their homes into hotels and restaurants. So, you have an option of staying in the fort.

title: Getting lost here is awesome
review: Aside from the many unattractive offers to enter shops within the fort, there is so much history, a safe community and very scenic views from every hotel terrace.

title: Fab Fort!
review: This is the only fort in Rajasthan to have not been invaded! It was beautiful during the day and evening! Fantastically lit at night. Not enough foreign tourists visit but I suspect it’s because it is very far out towards the Pakistan border. It was boiling hot in October and my ankles were swollen continuously so choose the season carefully! I hope to visit again! It was magical!

title: Must visit place
review: Try visiting fort in morning if you are looking to explore alone. Fort gets crowded and Hot in Noon time.

title: Incredible Fort Experience
review: This fort is not like any fort in Rajasthan that I've visited, and that's because there are people actually living within the fort. The fort is bustling with activity at all times, and there are hotels within the fort to live in as well. There are numerous shops that sell handicrafts, cafes at every turn, and local houses buried in nooks and cranies of the fort. The architecture itself if beautiful and the Jain temple is ornately carved. The temple is open only in the mornings and evenings. The fort is full of life, and the experience really is unique and wonderful. If you don't want to visit it for the architecture or cultural significance, then visit it for it's lively atmosphere, which you'll surely not find anywhere else. I wouldn't recommend a guided tour since this is a fort you should explore on your own in your own time.

title: Magnificent History
review: The forts of Rajasthan does not disappoint and so does this. Its a live-in fort, where descendents are still living inside though it may change soon. One will need at least 2-3 hrs if one wants to fully absorb the history. I strongly recommend that you take a guide who can tell you all the stories otherwise you will not know what you have missed.

title: Nice but crowded
review: One thing I liked about the for was the families still staying inside it unlike many other forts. However, this has also made the fort crowded. Gives a good view of the entire city from the top.

title: Fort with inside hotel and restaurant
review: Fort where you will find lots of havelI and houses and restaurant. But roads are not clean and having lots of cow dung, open drain, Guide take us for another have listed in which owner are sitting and they shows all old thing with history. Since you are in Jaisalmer you have to visit at least one haveli.

title: Nice fort
review: Good to see old history nicely maintained property. Nice view of city and area nearby. Must visit this place

title: The residential fort
review: The fort on its own is a place to visit. This is one of the very few forts globally that is actually residents for about 4000 people. A walk around the tiny lanes in this fort may help you more to connect with the locals there. The king and queen palace/residences, I thought were pretty silly. But it’s worth a watch. I wouldn’t recommend hiring a guide. Although, my guide was happy and cheerful, but the stories seemed too funny to be true.

title: Honeymoon
review: Mesmerizing ..... Words r less to xplain d beauty of fort ..... Everybody must visit once to feel d actual beauty

title: Beautiful fort
review: Must visit fort. Guide is required otherwise you won't be able to understand . Beautiful locations for clicking pictures.

title: A treasure of a place.
review: How this has only just become a world heritage site is beyond me. It’s is one of the most magical places we have visited on our trip. Warm, beautiful, friendly. Make the effort to head here and you will be rewarded.

title: Interesting and beautiful
review: Our trip to the fort was excellent, we felt like we were in another world.

title: New Years in Jaisalmer
review: 2100 kms road trip Delhi-Bikaner-Jaisalmer-Bikaner-Delhi. Amazing drive(with usual few ugly patches). Jaisalmer Fort is worth visiting, the fort apart from the amazing surroundings, has some great eating joints within. View from the top to the bhaang shop on the foot of the fort... PRICELSS!!

title: Needs maintenance
review: Fort in itself is historic and has a great work of art all around but the biggest problem is how it is maintained... coz is just surrounded by shops all around... shopkeepers will buzz into you to buy their stuffs... a tourist place should only b restricted to tourists only to maintain its glory but sadly tht isnt the case here... you will find yourself in the middle of chaos vehicles garbage and everything you can name...

title: Commercial fort
review: The fort is a part of commercial establishment as part of fort is leased to restaurants and retail stores. They avail guided tours however one does not need as audio guide is more than sufficient.

title: Just another palace
review: To be honest this palace looks good from outside than inside. It's a living palace and hence many shops and restaurants are inside.  When compared to other palaces in Rajasthan, I would rate this average.

title: Golden Fort
review: 1.Fort is Beat place to visit In Jaisalmer.

title: Amazing
review: Amazing fort, the sunset point is amazing at sunset and at night gives the whole panorama view of the city. There are so many different shops to visit and variety of products to buy. Different type of restaurants are also available for different cuisine. We went there 2 days in a row to visit every single corner of the fort.

title: Jaisalmer Fort takes you back in time
review: You must go to the only fort in Rajasthan where people still live. It is a unique experience to walk the winding streets. The architecture is amazing.

title: The fort with a magic of desert
review: Built in 12th century, this is the oldest fort in Rajasthan and possibly in India. Ballads and tales are in abundance as to its heroic past, including jauhar (mass immolation of women trying to escape disgrace by the approaching enemy).

title: Excllent fort
review: Fort is very good ideal time ll be around 1.30yrs take a young guide and visit so he ll be updated till date as old people ll tell only history won't say about latest things(like which all movies shooting done in and around fort)

title: Amazing fort !
review: The Jaisalmer fort is one of the major forts in Jaisalmer. It is also one of the few residential forts. Amazing place an its very huge.

title: The Golden Fort
review: This amazing living fort is another wonder of the world. It is preserved well in it's original shape and has numerous beautiful palaces like gaj niwas and badal Mahal. It overlooks the thar desert. I appreciate the efforts of UNESCO and Indian govt to keep it in. Good shape

title: Magic combination of histroy and locals - Only such location in India.
review: Jaisalmer fort is a rare combination where inside the fort premises,the locals are still dwelling.They are the ancestors who have served the royal family and later on granted to live at the same location by the royals at a later stage.

title: Wonderful fort with laid-back vibe
review: The best part about jaisalmer fort it's that several thousand people still live there and carry on their daily lives,  so it's not just a museum like so many other forts in India.  The cobbled streets,detailed carving on the buildings and the traditional rajastani architecture make it a fascinating place to wander and even though there are still many merchants tempting you to buy, their sales tactics are low pressure - the people in jaisalmer generally are more relaxed and you don't get hassled as much as in other parts off India, so shopping  is actually a pleasure.

title: Leaving Fort with Great Carvings
review: This is the only fort i have seen in which normal ppl still leaves who are there since decades. Fort has different havelies and temples inside, all are them having world best carvings specially jain temples. Its like a small city inside a fort.

title: Beautiful outside and from car park but poor maintenance inside
review: As seen in photos this is a beautiful and grand fort and is worth visiting. Unfortunately as it is Government hands the maintenance is not up to what it should. They should start charging all tourists say 100 rupees to enter and improve safety cleanliness and maintenance and give those people who live inside passes.

title: Incredibly excellent state of preservation.
review: Truly immense, magnificent fort, probably the best in India. Good english audio with ticket. Easy to navigate.with breathtakingly beautiful original rooms in classical romantic Rajastani style.

title: Only place to visit in Jaisalmer
review: Good place to spend 2-3 hours if in Jaisalmer. The Fort tour is worth ones time especially you hire a guide.

title: Nice living fort
review: Beautiful living fort - fun to walk around and shop. Beautiful museum with rich historical artifacts and narratives.  Little on the dirtier side but not much different than most of India.

title: Gorgeous fort but place is dirty
review: Unlike other forts and palaces in Rajasthan , the Jaisalmer fort is not maintained well. A lot of people stay inside the fort and it’s very dirty. You will find animals and dirt in the narrow lanes. The view etc is good however there is not much to see or do even if you take a guided tour. The market around this place is a better alternative.

title: Living Fort, a very Different Experience
review: I believe its the only living fort in India. Its very beautiful. Jaisalmer is a small city and the fort is major part of it. Many people still live inside the fort. There are houses, havelis, hotels, restaurants, cafes view points, cannon points, palaces, temples, shops, and much more inside the fort. You can spend entire day inside the fort. City view from fort is beautiful both during the day as well as in night. The best part of the fort is you can visit it anytime 24/7 and its absolutely safe. If possible carry a binocular with you. You can have a bird's eye view from the fort. The Jain temples inside the fort are beautiful. You can take guide for temples and palaces but it would be better if you roam without guide. Its very different from rest of the fort in India.

title: not too special
review: Its quite an interesting old building and the main attraction, but not so special. There are some nice tourist shops.

title: Amazing
review: Wonderful fort with lovely little streets. Nice to take your time to walk there and discover beautiful houses

title: A great living historical fort
review: The golden fort or say The Jaisalamer Fort, a nice place to visit after monsoon because in summers it's too hot there. No tickets for entering the fort.

title: Love the fort!!!!
review: Could spend a week here because everywhere you go the offer you chai and want to chat for 3 hours. See the fort museum, jain temple, wander the alleys. Just after the museum on the left there is a guy sitting in the doorway of his little shop painting. Exquisite miniatures. Stop in and look and be amazed.

title: Excellent tour
review: This is a great place to visit.  The fort has a fantastic audio tour, it explains everything and really enhances the visit

title: Golden Fort -  awesome outside &  OK inside
review: Jaiselmer  Fort also recognised as Golden Fort due to its  bueaty &  Yellow sand stone.

title: Tour
review: Good. Too narrow steps. Beautiful architecture. Donot go when u r tired. Palace with room after rooms. It is never ending architecture with intricacy.

title: Atmosphere is amazing! Like Aladdin
review: It looks like from movie Aladdin. Cute and cosy streets and beautiful temples. People are friendly! I have making new friend there with locals

title: Interesting
review: We visited during DiWali.  It was very crowded with local tourist but very interesting.  It is a must.  try and visit early in the morning before it gets to hot.

title: Magnificent
review: The fact that this is the only fort in the world to have its original villagers living there is a 'wow' in itself. Walking around the fort takes one to another world of our own people. The families are warm and friendly and many have shops selling clothes, trinkets and other artifacts. There are many cafes and restaurants inside the fort which serve both - continental and authentic Rajasthani meal. The view from atop the fort is breathtaking. Loving the exploration, we spent about 5 hours here. Must visit.

title: Jaisalmer city
review: Very good place ,

title: The only Fort I visited
review: The entrance has a huge door! Either you walk or take a tempo. There is a long way from entrance to area where the fort start. Our history is rich and we get to see when we go around to visit such places!  A must! Don't take a guide, each guide has it's own story, they fool you. If you are very interested you can take the headphone costing INR 1500 from the entrance, where you pay entrance fee! It would be genuine.

title: Very average
review: Though the fort look magestic from the outside the very essence of a fort is missing especially from the inside. Lots of market have covered almost the entire fort and different place inside require seperate entry fees.

title: Very Good Place to see
review: The place is very good and attracts all tourists visiting Jaisalmer.

title: The best place to explore
review: This place was wonderful- we wandered around the battlements and alleys of this wonderful Fort and loved every bit of it. The locals are lovely and friendly, the Fort is clean and easy to move around. People live in this Fort and it has such a nice feel about it. Loved this place - wish we could have spent days here staying in one of the local hotels.

title: Great Heritage
review: This is my second chance to visit the fort. It is one of the best example of heritage. Local authority and local people needs to focus on cleanliness of the area and try to provide more public toilets and dustbins. This place might have highest number of foreign visitors in India in the month of Nov and Dec.

title: Good
review: Old building very nice gardening very good Jain temple is inside the for very good inside lot of hotels shops very nice very nice

title: Pretty amazing...!!
review: It is India's only living fort with approximately four to five thousand people residing inside. The fort's massive yellow sandstone walls camouflage itself  with the yellow desert. For this reason, it is also known as the Sonar Quila or Golden Fort. The fort's dominant hilltop location makes the sprawling towers of its fortifications visible for many miles around. Inside the fort there are several cafes were you can unwind and enjoy the beautiful sunset.

title: Not so worth
review: Not so worth fort compared to other forts in Rajasthan.place surrounding is dirty and stinking .

title: Historical Fort known as Golden Fourt
review: This fort is made of yellow stone, hence it is called "Golden Fort". It is perhaps the single Fort in India where people are living inside. View of Jaisalmer city from the top of the Fort is amazing. A must visiting place in Jaisalmer.

title: Nice building
review: This is very old fort making by Yellowstone looking nice carbon is very good I like so much inside Jain temple so lovely amazing places

title: Golden living fort
review: Nice old fort depicts the artistic strength and fondness of kings at that time. Not well maintained since it's a living fort. Steps should be taken to preserve it.

title: Beautiful fort
review: For once a get to see a living fort instead of a museum or ruins. There are conventional guides and audio guides available. I would recommend the audio guides since it allows you to see the fort at your own pace. There is so much happening inside the fort, you might want to spend some time shopping, or at a cafe which you can do if you have an audio guide. There are not many sign boards or information boards so you will need some guidance to see around.

title: Someone needs to sort out this mess.
review: From a distance the fort is stunning but enter through the city gates and you are met with filth, street vendors selling their tourist wares on every available inch, and crowds of tourists. It’s hard to appreciate  the history while dodging the motorcycles that continuously  speed through the narrow streets horns blaring. The whole fort is badly maintained and you have to continually watch where you are walking less you trip over the open sewer or damaged sidewalks. Someone really needs to sort out this mess. There is a beautiful historical city hidden by a maze of electrical cables, dirt and chaos. Of our visits to the forts of Jodhpur, Jaipur and Jaisalmer this was by far the least enjoyable.

title: Golden city
review: This is the most beautiful place in Rajesthan and it is so lively.  But the negative point there is too much motorcycles and rickshaws, it is some time dangerous to walk in the street. Be aware of the cows as well and enjoy your discovery of the place.

title: A monument Magnificent
review: The Jaisalmer fort which actually at one time was The Jaisalmer is simply Magnificent. It's now inhabited by those who have been living there for generations. The Jain Temples and the King's Palace are the ones which must be visited by every tourist. Both have been beautifully maintained and capture one's imagination. The Cannon Point is popular for the grand view of the new city. A number of shops inside the Complex offer local handicrafts.

title: The golden fortress
review: This is quite a famous site to visit in Rajasthan - Jaisalmer is usually equated with this one fort. and this in not an overstatement! the town is now spread around the fort, so chances are that you will catch a glimpse of this sentinel from almost any place in jaisamler. The fort is constructed in the characteristic ochre sandstone, thus appears golden in the sunlight. It is also wonderfully lit at night...glittering like a solid gold bar on a hill top. Historically, this was a strategic site too, as it was one of the important points along the old silk route. The fort offers wonderful views of the town, has a vibrant and bustling market for handicrafts - particularly leather goods, small eateries, temples and palaces. certainly one of the best experiences to recommend in rajasthan!

title: Not just another fort
review: We pick an chose what forts to go to in Rajasthan, and the view of this from our rooftop looked appealing. Its a living fort- so you get to see where people go about their everyday business- which is a nice touch from a non inhabited one. We were approached by a young man that lives there to show us around. We took him up on the offer and in the end it was the right decision. It made what we were looking at a bit more meaningful and it kept a local in employment

title: A very different ‘fort’ it is !!!
review: I & my wife visited the “ living fort “ of Jaisalmer on 21st Nov,2017. It was really a very different kind of experience in itself.

title: Very historical and beautiful fort made of yellow stone
review: The Place is very beautiful and it takes around an hour to visit. Liked it. The entire palace is made of yellow stone and must visit.

title: It’s ok.
review: It’s ok. Not as impressive as the forts in other cities. Be prepared to be hassled, the streets up at the fort are lined with shops.

title: A fort to be visited.
review: A Royal Fort built atop a hill and in midst of common man’s place with high safety and with a beautiful city view consisting of Temples, Haveli’s etc.

title: Nice audio tour
review: Beautifull fort. We also go to the palace on top of the port. Price 500 including audio tour. It was worth the money. You see beautifull culture and history

title: The most unique Golden fort
review: Although most of it is occupied by local people, shops and hotels, the color of the fort is its charm.

title: Magnificent fort, shame about the erosion
review: Every inch of this magnificent fort is made from the golden sandstone of the region. Due to the arid nature of the landscape, this fort was pretty much built with an interlocking drystone wall method, which was fine in the time that it was built, when most people functioned in their homes with only a pot of water for the whole day for the whole family. Now, there are restaurants and hotels galore located within the fort, and combined with plumbed in water, that makes for a lot of run off, and the whole thing, fort and hill, is slowly collapsing. They are trying to rebuild the retaining walls with modern mortar methods, but it is a slow process. It was odd to walk up the steep hill through the entry gate seeing the bottom rows of stone actually damp – in the desert!! Crazy. And walking through the old town of the fort, there was water running through open drains everywhere. They are trying to cap the number of establishments within the old walls, but not having much luck.

title: A nice and small fort
review: Honestly speaking, compared to other forts of Rajasthan like MehranGarh, Chittorgarh, Amer etc., this fort is of a smaller stature and grandeur but nevertheless it has a unique history of its own. Plus its the only fort where the local population still lives within the walls of the fort just as they did hundreds of years ago. The ruler descends from the lineage of Lord Krishna

title: Awesome living monument
review: We staying in a guest house inside the fort and it was super cool. A lot of people say that the fort is sinking but we didn't see any evidence of that really. There's not a lot to "do" here, but it's pleasant just walking around. Don't bother with the queen and kings palace though, not worth the extra 500 rupees.

title: Fort with best architecture
review: Very nice fort, different from others in Rajasthan in that it is inhabited and houses a city within it, compete with houses of locals, restaurants and even hotels with roads and vehicles plying within it. It showcases some of Rajasthan's best architecture, many temples, a museum and great viewers views of the city. You can either make a half day visit to it or even stay overnight within one of the microtus numerous guest houses within the fort complex.

title: Small palace, but a living fort
review: The King's palace is one of the smallest compared to others in Rajasthan, but this is one of the few forts where people still stay. So ensure that you hire a guide simply to ensure that you don't get lost in the small bylanes and finish your visit in time.

title: The Jaisalmer Fort
review: The Jaisalmer Fort was built by the King of Jaisalmer (Jaisal Singh) in 1156 AD. The king has built this fort and offered all the citizen of province to stay inside. As the area of desert has neither water or other resources to live, the king established this township in order to provide all such living needs and generate revenues as well. The fort very large and still the residents are staying inside. The tour of fort takes 3 4 hours to complete. Inside the fort you can find hotels, hostels, restaurants, flee markets, temples and many things. The aerial view of the city Jaisalmer is panoramic.

title: Beautiful Fort
review: Nice fort to visit, lot of narrow streets full of shops, hostels and more. Different from all the other forts ive visited in Rajasthan.

title: Very interesting place
review: Our local guide was excellent and also lived within the fort. It's a walking adventure through the narrow laneways - watch out for cows - they don't give way - and their dung, also tuktuks, scooters & motorbilkes Some incredible building with great carvings and balcony's, some great handicraft places to visit too.

title: Very nice
review: Well maintained palace. You can get various view point especially from the top you can take all 360 degree views of city.

title: Sonar kella
review: A place immortalised in every Bengalis heart due to The Great Satyajit Ray's novel and movie Sonar Kella.  Beautiful fort with awesome craftsmenship visible everywhere. Visitor can enjoy great view of the city from top of the fort.

title: Nice living fort
review: Pretty crowded during daytime. But at night it looks really beautiful with all the lights.Pretty peaceful.Clean and tidy.Spent a wonderful stay inside the fort in Hotel Temple View, One of the best places to stay at Jaisalmer.

title: Plan half a day and take a guide
review: Having looked at it from literally any place in the city at night, we very much enjoyed visiting the fort itself. It is well worth spending a few rupees for a tuk tuk which takes you to the top to save some energy.

title: Attractive Fort
review: If you visit jaisalmer then you must see Jaisalmer fort. Without visiting this place your journey will be incomplete.

title: Over rated and underwhelmed
review: Great location, high expectations but turned out to be a down moment after seeing other forts. Basically occupied (squatters) by locals and has been turned into a town with small lanes and touts everywhere.

title: Awesome trip of fort jaisalmer.
review: Awesome fort. Nice view. Guides are good. Visit jain mandir also. Don't forget to take ticket for your camera . It charges rs100.

title: Great place to spend a day or evening
review: Its what people called a "Live In Fort" with over 4k residents the fort is a huge colony of people living together.  The fort has multiple hotels, restaurants you could choose from and also features the beautiful Jain Temple and has big market , although the prices that we were quoted for any item was exuberant and would suggest not to buy anything from here as you could buy the same kind on stuff from the market outside for almost 60% the price quoted here, foreign nations should specially adhere to this I would personally suggest. The fort is open 24/7 and offers beautiful views of the city as well, the small alleys are interesting to walk in. A trip to Jaisalmer cannot be complete without this.

title: Fabulous trip
review: Amazing palace to visit

title: Interesting palace
review: A really interesting place to visit

title: Transported to a different age
review: Great place... Mesmerising work of art... Well preserved. The huge rooms, the narrow alleys transport you to a new era. Adjoining is the place made famous by Satyajit Ray in this film 'sonar Kella'. The fort provides lots of opportunity for the photographer in u. Will take about a couple of hours. Time worth spending.

title: Truly amazing experience inside fort
review: We had a stay in a hotel inside fort, so got to explore it during day and evening as well.

title: Golden fort (Sonar kella)
review: Jaisalmer Fort is a World Heritage Site declared by UNESCO.Fort was built by the Rajput ruler Rawal Jaisal hence the city name Jaisalmer. The fort has four entrances called Ganesh pol, Rang pol, Bhoota pol and Hava pol. The main courtyard of the fort is called Dussehra Chowk below the Raj Mahal.Main attractions are Fort streets and markets, Raja and Rani Mahal, City view point, Jain temples.

title: Camel safari
review: Safari into the Mowglie desert for a nights stay where the stars were unobserved and the singing of the camel men was magic.

title: Ancient city still buzzing with life
review: Jaisalmer Fort is a living, breathing slice of medieval life. Centuries old, this place still thrives with shops, temples, restaurants, hotels and touts.

title: Very nice
review: Loved exploring the fort. Beautiful architecture, tons of restaurants, little hotels, shops...the prices were very inconsistent so try to have an idea of what an item should cost or what you want to pay beforehand. Having some knowledge of material qualities would be good too, so as not to get tricked (like we did).
