In any case, the fort is a nice place to hang out; there are also good cafes, and it's actually cooler in the afternoon when the streets sre shaded and a breeze is blowing. The Jain temples are worth seeing; we didn't go into the Maharaja's chambers because it was too crowded and expensive.

title: An Indian desert fort beyond compare!
review: A great tour at the Jaisalmer Fort today.

title: Excellent architecture, fantastic little streets and alleys
review: A great experience exploring the fort, with some of the most amazing architecture I've seen anywhere. Everything is an amazing golden colour.  Yes you get some hassle from vendors, but a polite no was enough.  A great place to get lost and discover little treasures.

title: Amazing craftsmanship
review: Beautiful old world fort that people still live in. We were lucky enough to have an incredible guide named Kamal who is a local and lives within the fort with his family. He even invited us in to his home for a cup of tea!!! Was so nice.

title: Beautiful of its own
review: Indian heritage restored very nicely. Every corner of the fort is a beauty in its own. Very well maintained. Take a guided tour and he will show you around . Jain temple is a must do when in fort. They also have a roof top restaurant which gives you the view of entire jaisalmer city. Golden city . Though a little crowded but fort has its own free parking. Lot to shop as well.

title: Brilliant
review: Amazing fort, steeped in history. The golden hues are something unique and special. I would recommend the audio guide for exploring the fort.

title: Simply Stunning!
review: This is a must see site in Rajasthan. Of all the forts I saw in the area this was my favorite, extremely magical and not too many tourists. Highly recommended if you can squeeze Jaisalmer into your itinerary.

title: Amazing fort bustling with life.
review: Jaisalmer Fort also called the Golden Fort is a world heritage site. Build in 1156,it is well preserved living fort. Made up of yellow sandstone, it is a beautiful sight in the evening. It is visible from many points in the city due to its height. We had to walk about half a km up a step road from the carparking, although some auto rickshaws are allowed to take you to a certain distance. Generally one thinks of a fort as an abandoned ruin but this fort is bustling with life. It is interesting to see the temples, the houses the shops and restaurants inside the fort. One must spend good two to three hours time inside the fort to get the feeling of the Architecture culture and traditions. On a Sunny day its very hot, so preferred time is evening time. The view of the city from the fort is beautiful

title: Magnificent Fort!
review: Be sure to use the free audio guide. It's a very beautiful fort! Really different from the other forts I have been to. It takes you 1.5-2 hours to finish.

title: Good Fort
review: This is called SONAR KILA in local language. It means golden fort in English. And why not.. this has been made with Golden Sandstone that is found in the region. The fort is living fort. lots of People stay inside the fort. It is therefore important to know the palace location and where to visit. The palace inside the fort has two sections Kings Palace and Queen Palace. Both are in amazingly good condition. Its had to believe they are 500 plus years old. There is entry ticket. Audio guide is also available. It will take you between 30  to 50 minutes to cover both the palaces. There is Jain temple on fort but that closes at 12 noon. You can walk around the narrow streets and can easily take 2 hours and lots of walking. My advice is that if you are short on time and do not want to walk much cover the palace and skip the rest.  I loved the palace. It gives you homely feeling and not like larger than life luxurious spaces that you usually see when you visit the other palaces. And yes if you are visiting the fort there is parking available inside. Do not park on the road.

title: Sonar Quella
review: Amazing and how beautifully the fort is constructed and all minute works have been executed. One of the main attraction in Jaisalmer and we took a guide to understand the history. I recommend all to take guide to explore more.

title: Awesome architecture
review: Fort build without using water :). Take a guide and he will show you each and every nook and corner of the fort. Golden fort with a golden history.

title: I loved this place.
review: I could imagine Indias answer to Aladdin running around these little streets.  Great views from the top and lots of little shops to tempt you in.  Bats hanging off the walls and ceilings as you walk through the cobbled streets.  Loved it here.

title: best in rajastan (so far)
review: better than delhi,agra,jaipur,jodhpur forts as this is not just a tourist folley but somewhere people live and work. No entry charge and you can easily fill a day walking around all the backstreets looking in temples ,bookshops, ramparts,cafes and viewpoints and the beauty of the golden stonework. The only downside is why they allow the constant stream of motorcycles whizzing about to spoil the ambience , pollute the walkways,and cause danger to tourists.

title: The most memorable forts in India
review: The early mornings, the bright evenings, the sunny walks and the late nights at the cannon, you just can't get enough of this place. Loved every bit of it, shopping, henna, eateries, everything was just perfect.

title: Golden fort
review: The only livable fort in India, I hope, is classically built. Its a small fort compared to Jodhpur's Mehrangarh fort, but very good to visit. If u visit in the evening u can get a beautiful glimpse of golden city and why its so called. We hired a guide for showing us the fort and patwon ki haveli. Overall good experience.

title: worth visiting
review: Its a good place to visit but please take guide to help to understand the place better its value for money. carving on stone is amazing...

title: Too crowded
review: It was noisy and the traffic outside put us off. Perhaps early mornings would be a better time to visit.

title: Good fort
review: A place with good information of the lifestyle of the king but it won't be much fascinating if you have visited the mehrangarh fort

title: Sonar Kella
review: Fort museum is very interesting . Guided tour was very informative. Also the Jain mandirs are situated nearby

title: Trip to Jaisalmer
review: Main tourist attraction in Jaisalmer. Good for history lovers. Must visit fort inside all the Palace, Temple and Gates. View of Jaisalmer by top point city seen Golden.

title: Great place to wander
review: Great place to explore and kick back in one of the many rooftop restaurants.

title: Awsome
review: The golden fort is a living township, with all the old world charm. Sure it is not super clean, but loose yourself in its little lanes, admire the carvings on its ornate temples, relax  and you will realize why many people keep coming back to it.

title: Nice visit
review: Nice place to visit... beautiful

title: Sightseeing tour
review: We enjoyed a lengthy walk around the fort and surrounding town with Lalid. Lalid was most interesting to talk with. His family have lived in the fort for 42 generations so an ‘insiders’ view of the only ‘living’ fort in India

title: Architecturally reach palace
review: the palace has beautiful stone crafted architectural elements and hanging stone windows. It is worth visiting for those who want to enjoy the detail of various architectural elements.

title: Living fort
review: Although we took a guide within the fort, it ended up more like a casual chat in midst of a busy market place. it was 20% history and culture and 80% haggling with the shopkeepers. not necessarily bad for the die hard shopper.

title: My third Fort in Rajasthan but still very interesting
review: This is a living fort with over 4000 people living within the walls. You will find a labyrinth of small alleys with lots of shops selling a range of Rajasthani wears. The fort has further tourist attractions it but  within it but is worth a wander even if you don't go into the rest of the attractions. The views from the walls across the surrounding area including the Tar desert is spectacular

title: ONE OF A KIND
review: The fort is very enormous and provides great view of the entire city.There are many shops in the fort and temples too.The fort has various hotels where one can stay.Restaraunts are also there to offer tasty food.

title: Make the trip!
review: Jaisalmer is far away.  From most things. But the fort is a gorgeous city, with lovely winding roads and the most knowledgeable, personable tour guides we experienced in all of Rajasthan.  If it’s not on your itinerary, it should be.

title: Must Visit
review: Nice to see the Fort. But commercialisation is killing it. Govt should sell it put operator for maintenance and upkeep

title: Excellent Fort
review: The uniqueness of this Fort is, people live in this fort.. suggested to visit with a guide (approx 200-300 rs)..For Jains, must visit the Jain temple located inside the fort area.

title: Really interesting fort
review: This fort is unusual in that it's a 'living' fort, as there are businesses and homes inside.

title: Deputation @ JAS
review: A World Heritage Site.Jain temples built inside the fort are example of explaminary architure of old days.The fort has numerous eateries, including Italian, French and native cuisines.

title: Living fort of india
review: Only few places to visit in Jaisalmer n fort is one of them. Two forts are connected to each other, king n queen fort. Some hotels n restaurants are there in fort campus. A great experience to have some food over there. Must hire guide to visit fort. Do some bargains for guide. Lots of shops selling stone n some traditional cloths, bed sheets n house Decore.

title: Clean it up and stop ripping of
review: Beautiful but the people are overcharging there and are annoying. Anyway a impressive place. The golden fort itself is just incredible.

title: Not much to write about
review: The Jaisalmer Fort is the only fort in Rajasthan that allows locals to live on property. There are 5-6 hotels inside the fort (staying in one of these is literally a "thing to do" when in Jaisalmer) and are quite affordable.

title: Worth visiting
review: There is a museum and Jain temples in the fort. Nothing else much. You can hire a guide for 150-200.

title: Amazing, worth staying in the fort though
review: Stay in the fort, great hotels and the people are so friendly there.  The fort is really nice and worth seeing.  Food is also available there, though we never tried it.

title: Historical Jaisalmer Fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is a World heritage historical monumental fort situated at the heart of the city at Jaisalmer, Rajasthan. It has a jain temple built inside the fort. this fort has a population of around 5000 people. There are many shops and restaurants within the fort which adds to the hustle bustle. You can see the entire town spread around from a viewing point at the top of the fort.

title: Please visit only if you have to
review: Went deaf owing to the honking of the two wheelers which are allowed right into the fort. the fort is also nothing much to write about. many guides available at 300 only

title: Impressive
review: Impressive, only a pitty they allow motor cycles in the narrow streets. They should better protect this heritage.

title: Best Fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is beautiful and when one sees it in the Night all Lit up, it is just Gorgeous. Most of the buildings are of sandstones, with beautiful carved designs. Avoid shopping inside the fort as the same articles are available at much cheaper rates in the city markets

title: Beautiful fort
review: Nice fort where it is nice to walk through. Very crowed as a lot of tourists are visiting the site. Nice jaïn temples.

title: Good visit for jaisalmer
review: Nice and big fort with people living inside gives a feeling of a city with shops and hotels operating inside the fort which is unique.

title: Labyrinth
review: Living fort of India also know as Golden fort with its colour of stone used for the construction. Wear basket to walk around in small streets of this fort don't forget to carry a good camera to capture beautiful pictures of havelis and temples inside this fort. Start your day early in morning so that you won't get fatigue because of heating temperature of dessert.

title: Nice place to visit
review: Jaisalmer desert is a must see location while visiting jaisalmer.  Very nicely maintained and the market around the Fort was the beauty

title: Quick visit
review: This is a living, breathing fort. Around 3000 people live inside. Worth a quick visit - possible to imagine what life would have been like in the olden days. Lots of things are similar - cramped confines, tightly grouped houses and a close community.

title: Carving on the stone is amazing
review: This fort is not as grand as other forts in Rajasthan but have few places to visit. Make sure to opt for a authorised guide (with a proper government issued ID) which you can find at official booth near parking. There are Jain temples inside fort which are really amazing. Than you have kings palace. Some guides may suggest that there is nothing to see but don't miss on this. It has a museum also.

title: A living fort on only hill in Jaisalmer
review: The fort is located on a steep hill. Rebuilt most of the part. This is occupied by people and families. Hence a bit polluted by vehicles.

title: The fort has been destroyed
review: The fort is like a bustling city with nothing of historic significance left. It is like a market filled with restaurants. It looks pretty from outside but is such a disappointment from within.

title: nice fort
review: good place but a bit crowded. But worth visiting. good view of jaisalmer from the top of the fort. good for shopping too.

title: One of the major tourist attractions in Rajasthan
review: Too crowded, bats & their litter scattered everywhere, stinking atmosphere, definitely not worth the entry fees charged. However the outside of the fort is much more livelier & attractive.

title: Jaisalmer fort
review: Awesome fort, nice historic place, architecture is really to look at, culture defined of Rajasthan. Nice view of city, blue city from top of the fort - must see.

title: Impressive structure
review: It looks amazing from the outside and the structure is hard not to appreciate. Inside is really just filled with tourist shops selling a variety of textiles and keep sakes.

title: City That Reflects Gold.
review: Amazing. Mesmerizing. Enchanting. Bewitching. No words to describe this architectural marvel. A must once in life visit.

title: Nice fort
review: Stayed in the hotel inside fort. It was wonderful walking down the streets inside fort, culturally very rich place. Even houses inside fort are very attractive so even walking down in the streets and gazing houses is fun. Very easy trip despite of hot weather.

title: Very good
review: Enjoyed the tour. There should have been an interpretation center where tourists can have an overview of the fort and what all should be seen and where these spots are in the overall plan. And their distances. RTDC is conspicuously absent from the scheme of things.

title: lovly stay in goden city
review: amazing golden city amazing stay at desert with nice hospitality

title: WORTH VISITING
review: Better to hire a Guide ( 200 rs Rupees) & than visit.

title: Historical and cultural tour
review: The unique sandstone buildings and enormous havellis are worth seeing.

title: SONAR KELLA ( Golden Fort )
review: Nothing new to say about Jaisalmer Fort ( Sonar Kella ) . It is famous for its Golden Stone which is appearing like Gold in Sunlight . It is famous for its Design also .  .

title: Amazing Fort
review: Golden Fort of Jaisalmer is the one of the best fort in Rajasthan.

title: Must visit
review: What an amazing architecture

title: ancient fort with the living heart
review: it is a beautiful ancient fort with its heart still pumping in the bodies of its residents. they have kept  it alive for all of us and the generations to come.

title: Great place, nice and chilled out, plenty of places to relax
review: You can find lots of hotels here and restaurants, at a very good price, most places have a roof terrace with great view. I like it here as people are friendly and there is a very safe vibe about the place, they even lock the gate at 11pm, so don't be late getting in.

title: Wonderful fort with terrible ambience
review: It's a fort where people live in and made it a mess. Very crowded with motor bikes plying, noisy, lots of shops inside making narrow roads narrower. It has got an wonderful Jain temple inside. Must take a guide to navigate through the fort roads. Must go top to see panoramic view of Jaisalmer city.

title: Fort
review: This fort offers a spectacular view of the golden city. and it has a lot of restaurants and it is the only living fort in India.

title: Great Place
review: Amazing place, great historic significance, love to visit again... Good part is even common folks live inside the forest.

title: execellent
review: Jaisalmer Fort Is One of the living fort of the Rajasthan...it is very beautiful in arcitecture..amazing City view from the canon spot.

title: A must !
review: One of the most beautiful places in Rajastan.

title: Historical Place but Over Crowded with Peoples
review: Very Badly Maintained Fort even after Rs. 100 entry Ticket for Indians. As it is residential fort for civil peoples, its maintained badly.

title: Magical Citadel
review: This fort is unique. The bright yellow stone gives with fortification the look of a massive sandcastle rising out of the desert plains, thus the name Golden City.  Massive gates covered in Bats and a myriad of commercial opportunities together with over 3,000 inhabitants within the interior, beautiful Jain temples make with fort worth a visit.

title: Very pleasant walk in the old city
review: A real pleasure to get lost in the narrow streets of the fort. Stopping anf having drinks on the numerous roof top restautant is really enjoyable

title: A never miss moument for all
review: Had been to jaisalmer fort this September beginning with my family.During the last visit we stayed in club mahindra and could not enjoy the fort much due to paucity f time.This time our driver arranged a guide for Rs 300 and he was with us for almost 4 hours. Along with explaining the entire fort to us he took us to teh other attractions also. Jain temple was inside the fort itself and is a marvelous piece of architecture too.He also guided us well throuh patwaon  ki haveli also.Ideally i recommend any one going to Jaisalmer to stay near the fort.There are places inside the fort also ( like home stays) where you can stay. The entire fort is beautiful piece of architecture in red sand stone.We had a great walk inside the fort.

title: Beautiful as the dessert that sourrounds it
review: Jaisalmer fort it is beautiful, unique and misterious. It is so far the most beautiful one in Rajastan!!!

title: Really awesome
review: It is unique and a really nice place. The way it is build is awesome. But best part is "shopping", what you get here is completely unique, that symbolizes the place and the memories will be with you forever.

title: tour
review: great place to sight seen it was  really historical fort I went there with my friends we had great fun there

title: fort gorgeous
review: fort impressive. filled with history. every house is the art of architecture. you can do interesting purchase. top opens with beautiful views of the city and the desert of Tar.

title: Nothing special about it.
review: It is like just another fort. I believe hardly any fort in India will deserve a 5 star as per my liking. Most of the doors/rooms are closed. Suggest to hire a guide who will charge only rs 100 and will help enhance your knowledge about its history. Cameras are allowed with additional rs100 payment - your choice. A few good snaps can be taken.

title: Jaisalmer Fort or the Golden Fort
review: Jaisalmer Fort is also known as the Golden Fort and is one of the largest fully preserved fortified cities in the world and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Built in 1156 on the edge of the Thar desert it lay on the Silk Road providing refuge and sustenance to early traders.

title: An ancient living fort
review: In this fort still thousands of people living there. All Rajasthani crafts are available at the best prices. We came across hotels, markets, restaurants, temples in the ancient place. Do not miss to watch such a historic place.

title: One of the tourist attractions
review: Though the area inside the fort is very clumsy..but as a Bengali and when you can connect with Satyajit Ray's film Sonar Kella you will love to see the shooting places..it is also a hub for shopping local good but should have good knowledge in burgaining

title: Golden Fort - Sonar Kella
review: Only living Fort in India where still 4000 people resides...Golden (Sonar) Fort (Kella) was named after Bengali Film Sonar Kella by Oscar Award winner Mr Satyajit Ray. From the Cannon top 80 % of the City can be viewed... Beautiful palace, houses and Temples are there inside the Fort... It takes almost 2 hrs to have a complete tour of the Fort...The Jain temple inside the Fort is almost the duplicate to that of Dilwara Temple.....One can take picture inside this Temple....Guide is must for tour inside the Fort..Our Guide Mr Pratap Singh was a very gentle and smiling guide, who charged Rs 200 for the entire Fort visit.

title: Living fort.
review: Built in 1156 this fort is still home to 2000 people and businesses over looking the town. It is built from yellow sandstone and has large round stones balancing on the fort walls to deter invaders of the past.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: This is a must see in your itinerary when visiting Jaisalmer. The view from the top is superb!!!  There are small lanes and alleys that sells handicrafts and artifacts.

title: Nice fort
review: Hire a guide otherwise it is difficult to explore and you will not know where to walk. He may ask if you would like to walk or take an auto. Walk till the top (do not take auto). It is a living fort meaning that people live here. Don't miss the Jain temple and a view of the Jaisalmer city.

title: Mudt to visit
review: I been there many times there and it's fell like that I'm from there or one of them people are so sweet and friendly

title: Beautiful Monument but so dirty
review: We visited this monument since its a world heritage.need to walk through very dirty lanes that we regretted of visiting this place. As a whole its really beautiful and Must See....CLeanliness should be brought to preserve this heritage

title: Golden Jaisalmer Fort
review: The king's and queen's palaces are worth it. The colourful Rangmanch is breathtaking. A very good view of the city and the last train terminus from the top of the fort!

title: Beautiful Fort indeed!!
review: Visited this fort with my friends.. beautiful fort.. a part of this fort is converted into hotels where you can stay.. the architecture and the way the fort is built is mesmerising.. cant believe that those days people could build such beautiful piece of art that people today would not be able to even draw it with a paper and pencil in hand.. it is better if you hire a guide when you going into the fort so that you get an idea about why this fort was built..

title: Full of temples
review: Fort is more of religious place than historical place...lot many of temples with beautiful carvings and scriptures

title: Jaisalamer
review: The fort is the only living fort in India,I would advise you to stay in the fort itself there are 50 plus hotels inside small budget to 3 stars hotels .The shops in the fort are good but you need the bargain. The carving is worth seeing.

title: Ok Ok! One time visit.
review: Just three cannons. The main problem being people occupying most of the fort area for living. Can chill in the evening and can shop for Female around the fort!

title: Nice
review: Nice place to visit for tourist. You can see the lifestyle of kings of Jaisalmer. The art and craft at its best. Amazing view of city from roof of the fort.

title: Fort
review: Nice as Indian we should know about places and our culture. In fact we were in past was rich in our culture and roots was so strong that we were very forward but surprisingly after independence we don't know where we are going.

title: Camouflage.
review: This fort blends into the surroundings,very clever design.About one quarter of Jaisalmer's population live here. A microcosm of Rajasthani life. Several Jain temples,very impressive,elaborate merchant havelis. Palaces,businesses,homes- it's all here!

title: Must visit
review: Good Jain temple are there to see.its a heritage site. Old temples.inside the fort easily reachable from city

title: Family trip via car
review: I loved Rajasthan and there tradition, fort a unique as people live there and selling things in streets. Good things on Bargain.

title: Nice
review: Real Golden Fort. Must watch our heritage and architecture.. Good market inside the fort like small small galiyaras.

title: @Jaisalmer fort
review: Heritage property not maintained well by the government and neither by any of the royal family...

title: sonar quila
review: This fort is the only living fort in the world.with people still staying inside the fort.there are numerous cafes and restraunts were we enjoyed eating and climbing their roofs for spectacular views.the sun enhances the beauty of the fort and giving it the golden effect.even the city if you see from the top looks all golden in the sun.hence the name golden city! the streets inside have their own charm.with artifacts and paintings in every nook and corner.though they are expensive than the market.but they give a certain character to the place.places you can see inside are jain temples,raja and rani ka mahal.in the evening it looks even more beautiful when lit up.

title: huge fort
review: its a small city leaving inside the fort . where kings area is very small . got to know about people leaving style and kings leaving style

title: Indiatrip
review: Actually is a good place. Free entrance.

title: Sonar Quilla
review: An awful experience with views of the full city the Raja s and the Rani s....it has been pleasure being in Jaisalmer.... Rajasthan would have been incomplete without coming here

title: Living history
review: Fabulous fort - occupied still and just teems with vibrant life. Jain temple was fascinating and an architectural gem . Loved walking round the narrow streets. Wonderful place

title: Must see in Jaisalmer
review: Lot of climbing (especially with kids) and tiring under hot sun. However once you reach the palace square your really feel it's worth. Jain temples are really beautiful and the locality inside is really interesting

title: Incredible thing to watch
review: This palace is an epitomy of Indian Architecture  and very subtly explains  the embracing royal character of Jaisalmer. Along with its a heaven site for photographers. Many  things tend to sway our mind with amaze.

title: Jaisalmer fort tour guide
review: I have recently visited jaisalmer with my family. Where I met Mr. Anu the Guide outside the fort. It was really happy to have such a wonderful and friendly guide who described every small details patiently and helped in our shopping also.

title: Like walking onto a movie set, only possible to appreciate by being there
review: If you ever have the opportunity to see and experience this, then go!! The whole atmosphere is outer-worldly, something you might have dreamed about. The little roads and alleys are full of charm form bygone eras, you can easily feel teleported into a time several centuries ago. he local people are more than just sales people; they will gladly talk to you and explain more about the history and culture of this mesmerising place. It is fantastic!!!

title: Architecture and city view
review: Fort is too nice, it includes shops, maharaja mahal(must visit for city view), Jain Temple, Tope View point.

title: Going back in time where history is alive
review: The Jaisalmer fort is a living fort where a fourth of Jaisalmer population lives in. The beautifully curved sand stone structures, palace, houses, fort gates, the narrow allies, the local art and craft trading in the fort -- all these take you to a by-gone era and it seems like time is not moving here. The local musicians play beautiful melodious music in very simple string instruments at different corners of the fort. The fort looks magnificent from far during sun rise and sun set. After sunset, the fort lighting creates a magical look. It is such a different experience that can only be realized only being here.

title: Awesome View in Night
review: I went to Jaisalmer and stayed there for a night. The fort is not massive or mighty but it has beautiful view of city.

title: A touch of history
review: It seems tough to move around but practically one can easily discover the must see places. The jain temples were very good and the palace is also wonderful.

title: Living fort of jaisalmer
review: Great place and great view of jaisalmetcity from fort.loved it.lots of shopping place inside fort.heritage and culture awesome

title: good visit
review: Well maintained place.  Good to visit with family.  The history is interesting.  We visited this place as a package tour.

title: Another gorgeous building with history
review: India is full of the most stunning architecture, such opulence and workman ship - these forts and palaces are indulgent!

title: Must see
review: The Jaisalmer Fort is simply a must see. The city around is awesome, but the Fort tops it with its old buildings and small roads.

title: Beautiful!
review: This fort is so intricately built with winding streets throughout - perfect for a meander and getting lost in. Free to go on. Great view from outside too and looks pretty all lit up at night. Each time I come I see something new and am astounded at the detail and beauty.

title: Nice View from outside
review: The fort is too congested inside..It's a market inside with narrow lanes..The fort view from outside is fantastic..

title: Very Basic Fort
review: The fort is quite basic and smells of bat everywhere.

title: Beautiful fort,breathtaking view from top!!
review: The fort is spread across a large area and there are monuments scattered all over the compound,hence one tip-DO HIRE A GUIDE-not only will he take you around each place but also will tell the rich history and different stories associated with the fort!

title: Magical!
review: Jaisalmer is a magical city all due to its fort. To sit in a restaurant at night on the fort walls, overlooking the city and the rest of the fort ... well, you would almost think you were in a tale of the Arabian Nights. This is one of my favorite places in India.

title: Great audio guide
review: They offer a great audio guide to explain the history of and some stories around the fort. However it feels like they could make more of the place by restoration etc compared to Mehrangarh, Amer Fort, ...

title: Nice place
review: Must visit in Jaisalmer. We had a view of the place both in morning and during sunset. Beautiful lit view of fort at night also

title: Old fort with mini city
review: Fort was good. It looked like a small city as there were around 400 houses with lots of shops. Jain temple inside the fort was great. This fort is the main attraction in the city.

title: Live  Fort with people  living  inside  with  Hotels  & restaurants  inside
review: The experience  of jaisalmer  fort  was  Unique . The  monuments  & forts we  usually see  are uninhabited . But  this  fort  has  living  population inside  with  Hotels & restaurants  , Shopping streets etc. Moving around in the  narrow  small streets in the  fort is  wonderful experience

title: Amazing structure
review: View of the fort from distance is something unique, I didn't imagine that it will be so enormous and standing above the old city. The fort is well preserved, with full walls and bastion with canons from where you can admire city and the desert till the horizon. There are many nice old curved houses, but most beautiful and big you can see outside the fort. The atmosphere of the fort is destroyed by the salesman that are attacking you from every corner. They are trying to get your attention on every occasion, asking you  question, that you feel you must answer to be nice and polite, but at the end it is always the same - they want to show you their shop or sell you some trousers... Very annoying...

title: Magical Look
review: I went to Jaisalmer Fort. It ranks amongst the largest forts in the world. The golden and yellow mixed sandstone offer magical look to the Fort. It is really amazing place to go.

title: Golden fort at Jaisalmer
review: The Jaisalmer fort stands majestically in the heart of Jaisalmer city glowing with its golden hued sandstones. Beautiful by day, the fort looks even more enchanting when lighted up in the night. It is perhaps the only living fort in Rajasthan with thousands of people living within its walls even today. This world heritage site has outer and inner layers of walls and many buildings including a Jain temple. From the top we get a fantastic view for a very long distance which would have served the defenders of the fort well. This fort was supposedly a customary stopover for every traveler in the ancient times who was traveling westwards

title: Very beautiful
review: We went in September to Jaisalmer and took 2 days to visit the city and surroundings. Since it was so hot in September, we took the time between 12-4pm off and went to sleep. The fort is very beautiful and also very interesting, together with the entrance fee you get the audio guide for free. Also, the sunset at Gadisar lake is stunning, and there are a lot of shops where you can buy camel leather stuff. But don't buy from the people in the fort, it's too expensive.

title: Golden History, living Fort
review: Jaisalmer Fort is a grand imposing structure having 99 bastions constructed from Sandstone which gives it unique Golden colour. It is living Fort within which many people are still residing, there are resident Hotels, Restaurants, Shops, etc. For tourists main attraction inside Jaisalmer Fort is Fort Palace Museum which has Raja ka Mahal (King's Palace) as well as Rani ka Mahal (Queen's Palace), Jain Temples, Hindu Temples. Fort museum is accessible from Dusshera Chowk. Autos are available from parking till Dusshera Chowk, but on heavy tourist rush, Autos are not allowed and we will have to take walk of about 8-10 mins from Parking to Dusshera Chowk. Shops and market selling colourful artefacts in backdrop of golden walls of the Fort are picturesque.

title: A beautiful 1-2 day trip.
review: An old fort with great views. lots of streets and alleys to walk around and shop for local merchandise.

title: Best fort
review: There are many forts in Rajasthan but if you are in jaisalmer do not skip this palace. An amazing fort with local market. Definitely you love.

title: An opportunity to visit a living fort
review: This is one of the few forts that is a living one so it's unique in a way . A must see while in Jaisalmer.

title: Magnificent!
review: Well preserved and well maintained.

title: Amazing Citadel
review: I lvoed this fort.  We took a guided tour which was helpful in knowng how to navigate our way around the fort which is a living city of around 3000 people.  Definitely worth the visit and seeing so much culture and history from the Silk Route.  If you take the guided tours - ou could skip going into the havelis - they are nothing more than glorified gift shiops and have next to nothing of heritage decor on the interiors.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: Well maintained living fort, carvings were good , Amazing views of the city from the top. Always hire a guide to get a detailed knowledge about the fort.

title: Interesting living fort, full of hustle and bustle
review: A beautiful place. But, it gets a bit smelly. Perhaps to start charging a small entry fee to pay a street cleaner to get rid of the odour and be caretaker. Lovely shopping and roof top views, neat Jain temples and ancient royal chambers.

title: Love this place
review: Fabulous fort , fort is one of the main attraction of Jaisalmer. A fort where people live it is also called as sonar Killa.

title: Up keep of the Fort!
review: The Forts in Udaipur, Jodhpur, Jaipur are preserved and maintained way better the the Jaisalmer fort!

title: Mesmerising Experience!
review: We visted this place in January...and Had a great time watching and feeling the great heritage of the great nation. Jain temples, miniature architecture was simply awesome.

title: Living fort
review: Top attraction in Jaisalmer.Have fun exploring the alleys of Fort. Skip the  tour guide and try to explore on your own at leisure. In case you are hungry multiple cafes and street food vendors are available. Must visit.

title: Nice Fort
review: Visited Sonar Kila last month... Stone carving is very good.. Jain temple inside is very really amazing , Worth to visit

title: Good Fort
review: We have visited the fort with families and it was a fun visiting , Entry fees is Rs 100 + Rs 100 for Camera Extra. One thing there are no explanatory Boards or write ups, you have to hire Guide of have a Audio Guide unless it is just a Photography Place.

title: Must visit place
review: This is the main attraction of Jaisalmer .It is a huge fort built with lime stone that is why it is look like a golden fort. It is also Sonar Kella because when the sun rays falls on it during dawn or dusk, the fort looks as if its built of Gold. It is a only amazing living fort in India. There are so many small restaurants, café, hotels, shops and also has a beautiful Jain temple

title: Sonar Quila is best
review: Nice living fort, only one in India. It resembles its name 'Sonar Quila'. View from top is very attractive. Carving of stones and architecture is very good.

title: Beautiful carvings
review: One can realise how beautiful this fort was centuries ago. Unfortunately, today, the place is not well maintained and full of shops. Some beautiful temples are to be visited within the fort.

title: Impressive highlight, but touristy.
review: The fortress is one of the highlights of our visit at Jaisalmer. The fort is inhabited by a few thousands(?) people and therefore very dynamic and worth visiting.

title: Mesmerizing Sonar Kella!!
review: The main highlight of Jaisalmer city is this Golden fort made of sandstones. This looks so beautiful from outside and is actually spread over a huge area. There are actual houses of people, hotels, shops etc inside the fort. I would suggest to definitely hire a guide if you want to explore the area properly, otherwise you might miss something.

title: Nice fort, not the best
review: Jaisalmer Fort was ok but compared to other forts in the Rajasthan region it isn't up there with the best! Worth getting the audio guide and not taking any of the guides from outside the fort.

title: Sonar killa
review: Best living fort with Jain temples and kings palace

title: A true jewel
review: Jaisalmer is a treasure. Worth visiting and staying for a few nights, to really get the charm of the city, and its inhabitants.

title: Fantastic
review: The road to get to Jaisalmer is a proper price for the Fort you will see, in the desert over the hill.

title: Amazing fort
review: Visited here at january. Fort was amazing all building was made with yellow fort best part of fort we can shoping here.

title: Tourism
review: A place one must see,has historical background and artistic designs,portraits,best to visit in morning hours and have a guide with

title: Awesome city with incredible people
review: If people see that you are interested in their culture,tradicion and religion they will definetly help you. We has many chats with nice people who does not see you as a human dollar (many indians see you like that, and they try to earn something anyhow). Awesome place

title: Fort
review: The fort is much like others inside but worth a visit. Quite a gauntlet of sellers to get to it however most are polite and friendly. The old city inside the fort though is worth a walk through with beautiful and intricate stone work. A gem of a place!

title: A must see
review: Amazing!! Entering the fort is lile gping nack in time!

title: Great !!
review: i also look fort 2 times. Really this fort are diffrent of all  india fort .i dont belive . Maharawal jaisal  made fort 1200 year ago. This fort are really amezing and great

title: Amazing fort
review: Must visit in jaisalmer. The view from fort of entire city amazing. Stonework at fort was amazing. Well maintained fort of Rajasthan.

title: The Fort
review: Surely one of the attractions for first timers. The view of the city from the top on a pleasant rainy day is quiet exquisite.

title: vintage, exquisite, awe-inspiring
review: take the audio tour, but maintain the closing time very strictly because staff is slack while dispensing the entry ticket, while very particular while closing time.

title: Worth visiting
review: While Jaisalmer highlight for me is the neighborhood, visiting the fort is one of Jaisalmer must visit for anyone. Good for sightseeing, taking picture and exercise your body.

title: Wrong picture of the Fort though! The fort is a must visit at Jaisalmer
review: If you are a history buff you would like this fort. Do take a guided tour and make sure you get a good one. There is so much to see in this fort including, hawelis, jain temples, Kings' sport throne etc and so much to learn about history. Beware the crowds tourists and locals alike. If you don't bother getting pestered by salesmen inside, then this fort is a good four hours of joy.

title: Evergreen
review: Best place ever with attractive fort and I want to come again and again  this place

title: The golden fort of Rajasthan!
review: This beautiful fort built of golden sandstone is mainly occupied by the local people that live within the fort. Though it is beautiful it could be better maintained.The fort houses some beautiful temples too.Many guest houses and restaurants can be found within this fort.

title: Real golden fort
review: It was the best experience ..

title: Medieval delight
review: One of the few forts with residents living inside. There are 2 main parts to it i.e. A Jain temple which is worth a look for its intricate art forms and the main museum which is well kept. The fort has the usual components which are the ramparts, centre courtyard, preserved rooms of the original occupants. The narrow bylanes make for an interesting view. The fort is big enough for you to spend couple of hours at the least.

title: Great experience
review: Great place to wander around, the old fort is like going back in time (especially at night) and an experience not to be missed!

title: Awesome fort in the world
review: This fort is located in the heart of rajasthan that is jaisalmer..

title: A living fort which makes it special
review: Although the Indian government are keen to move the residents out of the fort, it was they that made it special: the fact it is a living fort bustling with vendors, hotels, bars, restaurants all within the most spectacular historic surrounding with amazing views.

title: Fabulous Sonar Kella
review: We watched the movie when we were young and from then we dreamt of visiting Sonar Kella someday. The beautuful golden fort truely melt our heart. Our guide also did a great job. Highly recommended!

title: Average place
review: Needs a lot of improvement.

title: Love this place, cannon at the top is best
review: I have been a great fan of Indian Culture and Heritage and this place makes me an even bigger fan. Beautiful place to be, so rich in culture. Number of people are staying in the fort itself and you can easily find art and craft shops, a huge market in the Fort itself. It is a must visit in Jaisalmer and once you go do have a look at the canon placed on top of the Fort.

title: Amazing place
review: A fort where people live , I was   surprised also ,beautiful art work in palace,museum was also beautiful

title: Jaisalmer fort - must see if in Jaisalmer
review: Fort is in a good condition although some improvements could still be done. I recommend Museum even if the price is quite high for India (600 INR, including audio guide and camera). Audio guide is great!

title: Nice but super turistic (pretty horrible to avoid vendors)
review: The place is nice and clear, specially in the morning when you still can barely find some vendors on the street. If you go by mid afternoon it becomes a hell with people trying to sell you things at all time.

title: Fort and Fort Palace are excellent
review: We stayed in a wonderful boutique hotel in the Fort (Himmat Niwas). The Fort itself, with its winding cobblestone streets (more like alleyways), is charming and safe. The shops and restaurants are plenty, and one could spend an entire day exploring.

title: Excellent
review: Best fort in rajasthan. it is a living fort in rajasthan.there are hindu and jain temples there are very nerrow colourfull streets .

title: good but very touristy and too much harassment by vendors of all sorts
review: Quite interesting but different from what we had imagined after reading the guide :"a mirage rising up from the desert" ; we would have stayed longer and gone into shops but we found the pressure of the shop keepers and street vendors annoying. A taxi firm (near Hanuman circle - recommended by the guide too!) tried to cheat us on the price of trip too so we had enough!

title: Heritage fort
review: On our Road trip to Rann of Kutch in the Christmas holidays 2016,we stayed in Bikaner for one night,it's a beautiful fort in the middle of the city,we took our motorcycles till inside of Fort itself though it was difficult to find parking,its better to park your car outside the fort and take public transport from there,sharing autos are also available from there.

title: Best fort
review: This fort is located in the jaisalmer which is the heart of the rajasthan.

title: Best fort
review: This fort is located in the centre of the jaisalmer city...

title: Awesome place to visit
review: I visited there in march. It was an awesome place to visit. It is also called as golden fort bcoz it is made of yellow stones. I like the architecture most. I was able to view complete Jaisalmer city from some of view points in the fort.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: Its an old fort. Known as Sonar Killa, meaning Golden Fort. People still live in the fort. But the richness is not visible except the architecture. Its on a hill top with curvy paths leading to the fort. Our vehicles go upto one place and then we have either to walk up the hill or hire an autorickshaw. Condition of the fort is still good and gives a good view of the city

title: Beautiful fort! Help save it from damage!
review: Incredible place to walk around! Breathtaking views of the city and many streets to look around. Although the fort will not last too long as it is getting severely damaged. As there are many hotels inside the fort as well as local people there is severe water damage to the  sand walls. The government have tried to get everyone to move out but they make too much money off tourists so they will not leave. Please don't buy souvenirs here , buy them in town as this is encouraging them to stay. The government has offered to build them houses in the town but they sell too much to the tourists they don't want to leave. This will effect the tourism on Jaisalmer if the fort crumbles.

title: Good
review: This Jaisalmer Fort was really great inside many people living and also many restaurant hotel so beautiful this what I really like

title: Dank
review: Dank fort. Bigger on the inside than the outside. Easily navigable by foot.no need to pay for a rickshaw to take you in.

title: Good happy
review: Jaisalmerfort was so beautiful wonderful explain here I really like this fort all the world best

title: Amazing !!!
review: Sand castle is amazing but very touristic spot and too much hassle, nice to visit once and must try city view point.

title: Awesome experience
review: A very good fort to visit in Jaisalmer. The only living fort in India. There are around 5000 people staying in the fort. you can find ships,market all inside fort.A must visit place when you are in Jaisalmer

title: Amazing  fort view..
review: I'm jaisalmer fort view July with my friends..

title: Good
review: This very old old city making like Yellowstone and very good inside leaving the people there lot of shops hotels restaurants so beautiful there I recommend other people you come in Jaisalmer then you been this place

review: built with golden stone the fort is example of old Indian carving of excellence.fosil rock collection is unique.the local rock gets more and more shine and smoothness with daily wiping hence no artificial polishing necessary

title: Enchanting desert fortress.
review: Jaisalmer Fort is a must see on any tour of Rajasthan. This inhabited ancient fortress with its narrow winding streets, temples, restaurants and shops gives a very different experience than visiting the other great forts of the state.

title: The Best Fort
review: I have visited jaisalmer with my family and see  the best fort of jaisalmer which is covered by local brahimns houses and nerrow streets with small market.

title: Amazing
review: I was visited jaisalmer Fort ohh my God it is living Fort people are living in said Fort is it amazing &  beautiful I never saw before this kind of Fort it is so big & in said. Jain Tempe, museum, Laxminath temple, city view point.

title: Best fort in jaisalmer
review: Me and my wife visited this place and it is enjoyable. This fort is very old and located inside the city.

title: Wonderful place to stay in and walk the street
review: We stayed in Jaisalmer Fort at Hotel Victoria and loved every moment of it, one of the only forts you can stay in so try find a place inside the fort if possible

title: Best from the rest..
review: This fort is unique... thousands of people still living here..you can imagine how big it is..And jaiselmer city itself is a best city I ever visited in terms of creatures.

title: Spacious Fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is very special built by red stones there is so many nakkashi on stone that is now impossible to built now a days

review: The place is marvellous but the people living inside are continuously defoliating it  as there are shops all over the place, and no peace and tranquillity

title: The golden fort
review: A very big fort with a lot to see inside.. it houses the local people of the city.. It also houses Jain temples and Lakshmi temple.. a lot of shops present...

title: Lived in fort
review: This fort was fabulous as it is one of the few forts to be lived in. There are numerous temples, hotels , cafes and shops. The alleyways and by ways are great to explore and the views from the top are wonderful

title: Amazing  fort
review: Jaisalmer  fort is amazing fort.

title: Royal Treat
review: It is great place to see the view of the whole city. You can also visit the place but entry ticket is way costly . It also need  a 2-3 hours time to see the the palalce. Fort is basically a home for many local who have there old house still built inside the fort walls. A beautiful architecture to see inside.

title: Compact and somewhat quaint
review: Pros

title: poorly maintaited
review: 1. Old world charm - YES.

title: Absolutely stunning
review: We just fell head over heels in love with jaisalmar and the fort was one of the best we saw during our trip to India. We would  go back to Rajasthan just to go to jaisalmar. Get a guide it's well worth it

title: Must visit
review: One of the living forts in rajasthan. Must visit place. There are lots of temples inside the fort. Great views. Also good shopping destination.

title: Living fort with great views
review: It's a living fort, so you get a peak into the lives of people living in the fort as you walk by. There are lots of cafes and places to chill and enjoy the scenery.

title: A truly living fort
review: Besides the fort, it has many food options especially the one right at the top of the entrance gate to the fort. Many shopping options inside. Dont miss the actualy fort area inside the complex. I missed it on my first visit to the fort

title: Amazing
review: It is an amazing place. I love this fortreesss the views are Great. It is a place to be seen and enjoyed the city. The little shops are very cheap. People is lovely.

title: City within a city
review: Jaiselmer Fort is a beautiful walled area in the centre and at the top of the town. The locals living inside the fort It is one of the most amazing and exclusive experience. Charming indeed.

title: Interesting Fort with Full Occupancy
review: The Golden Fort stands tall in the Jaisalmer Landscape and is among the rare Forts which is heavily populated. It has that Old Fort looks with some modern kitchenettes as Restaurants.  The Top provides a good view of the terrain across the town. Interesting place.

title: Popularly known as Sonar Quila, the Jaisalmer Fort is a must visit if you happen to visit Jaisalmer
review: Jaisalmer Fort is a world heritage site and one of the largest fully preserved fortified cities in the world. It is situated in the city of Jaisalmer, in the Indian state of Rajasthan.

title: yes
review: the fort is very big and we enjoy the full tour. We all enjoy the fort and have a lot of fun. we really miss jaisalmer

title: Amazing fort
review: The fort is more than 1000 years old. Party renovated and people are still leaving in.

title: Unforgettable fort
review: The fort is gery huge and big with best architure design and it is the main attraction of the jaisalmer..

title: Amazing place
review: This place is not to be missed. So much to see. It is a really beautiful place with its abundance of history. It was a privilege to be there and experience the tour. My family loved every moment spent in this fort. Each fort had its own uniqueness.

title: Like a movie set!
review: Roaming around the Jaisalmer Fort feels like you're roaming around in the set for Aladdin. Known as the Golden City, the intricate details on the buildings were worth the visit despite the heat.

title: Awesome
review: It is fabulous place to visit in jaisalmer...  This is the main attraction of jaisalmer... It is very huge and located in the centre of jaisalmer..

title: Very good audio guide
review: If you go in to the fort be sure to go to the museum as this part has been very well preserved and will give you a real taste of what life in Jaisalmer used to be like. The cost of entry was 500 rupees. Definitely get the audio guide (which is included within the ticket price) as it tells you lots of information about each room and what your looking at which isn't covered on the information plaques. Must do while in Jaisalmer.

title: Not to be missed
review: This fort was one of the highlights of our trip to India. The Havelis are stunning. Fabulous views from the rooftops

title: Big Expectations, Small Outcome!!
review: It is indeed a majestic fort. The first view elevates your expectations. But more than 80% of the fort is been converted in high-priced hotels or numerous small shopping stalls. There is little left to see inside. Only the Kings & Queens palace are open for tourist. This has museum, armory, family tree, paintings of royals, etc. It is always very crowded and you can almost get suffocated on the overcrowded steep stairs. So be careful.

title: The fort
review: The jaisalmer fort is really very impresive architecturein rajasthan, rajasthan is famous for its historic place , forts, and desert.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: At 500 rupees per foreigner and an additional 100 rupees for each photo taking device it's a little on the expensive side for the experience. It's an interesting place to visit though, must do in Jaisalmer

title: Wow
review: Great huge fort. Very special full of little shops, temples, artists, restaurants. Beautiful fort. Recommended

title: A living fort, in shambles
review: A living fort, very poorly maintained. Very unclean, open drainage systems, defecation by animals out in the open

title: Sonar Kella - The Golden Fort
review: Possibly only fort in India with ordinary inhabitants....A beauty to watch - Glows like gold as it is made of yellow limestone rock...do not forget to buy yellow limestone artifacts/glasses/bowls. Some places inside the fort are messy as it is living quarters of people who mostly thrive on tourists - there are artists and artisans selling paintings or wares...the fort was made famous by filmmaker Satyajit Ray who shot a Bengali thriller here titled Sonar Kellain early seventies. Before him, it was almost a godforsaken place. It is a very lively and colorful fort giving you glimpse of how these folks really live...has many curio and gem shops...lots of good hotels in the vicinity for stay.

title: Must go.
review: Very dirty. Fantastic buildings. Very gentle people. True artisans are outside the fort.

title: Beautiful golden sandstone structure
review: Woow. This is the word that will be out from your mouth once you visit it. To know better you should hire guide. Definitely you can negotiate with them. The guide told us that almost 5000 people are still living in fort. That is unbelievable. This is the only Fort i saw where almost small village is still living inside. The planning inside was awesome. Many places are there also, like Rani Mahel. Jain Temples etc...The visit of Mahel is chargeable. Dont miss to visit fort if you are in Jaisalmer.

title: Largest preserved fortified city
review: It'll time travel you to another era, where people still live as usual inside the Fort. Hence it's accessible 24x7x365. It's something that is visible from anywhere in the city, hence will automatically urge you to visit the place. The view of the city from top is great. The view of Fort from the city is even better, especially at sunset. Don't miss the sunset from top, while you're at it. Whole of Jaisalmer is amazing in the sense of its hand carved walls and tiny streets, and Jaisalmer Fort is the best of whole city.

title: Adventure
review: On a nice warm day one can spend the full day here easily,inside the fort there are so many temples,peaceful places for photo ops, restaurants,shopping and the best part the architecture and the chance to see how people live inside the fort,we took a guide which was nice as he was really helpful and honest. Next time I would love to go on my own to get lost in the maze of amazing streets not knowing what fabulous treats are around the corner.

title: Best historical place
review: Jaisalmer fort is a best historical place in rajasthan.. We visited this place with the family and really enjoyed...

title: Best fort in india
review: We ever seen this kind of fort the work on stan, in the way of bild, maharaja mahal is an amazing things to do problem is only 1 that is leaving fort always shops are there pushing to sal the things only be careful from tham.

title: Architecture at its best!!
review: Amazing place!! Architecture of this place is just so amazing.. night view from top of this fort is something to die for! Restaurants in the forts are amazing.. holi festival is really amazing..

title: Ancient Architecture
review: Interesting architecture, showed us various aspects of life in a desert, informative guides, overall great experience

title: Unlike other Rajasthan Forts
review: Really 'thought' this fort stood out for me because it has many little shops and houses within the walls and feels like it's own small city within its walls. Good views up to the top and many good restaurants within it.

title: must see
review: an amazing fort with yellow stones with many shops which selling many rajasthani traditional cloths and "jutis" superb palace to see in jaisalmer.

title: Must visit location
review: Well maintained fort of rajasthan city.  Must see location while visiting jaisalmer city enjoyed a lot

title: Best fort in rajasthan
review: I loved the fort and there location.... This is the must visit location in jaisalmer... There local market was awesome...

title: Shonar Kella
review: Ever since Feluda ,lurked to visit this place.A fortified block present in a city of 2km is majestic.With a number of jaina temples,houses and Hindu temples this seems like a golden city made with yellow stones.

title: Good
review: Fort tour is good . Jain tample is very beautiful and amazing stone work is there. Parking facilities are there and local market is there

title: Family visit to Jaisalmer Fort.
review: Jaisalmer  worth the visit. Don't forget to take the help of a local guide. Your guide will explain the magnificent history about the Fort. You can see beautiful Havelis and jain temples inside. Also you can see the cannon on the top most point of the Fort. Also from there you can get good view of Jaisalmer town below.

title: Fascinating
review: The fort is a living breathing place, home to many thousands. It has incredible temples and stonework and narrow alleys lined with shops. The shopping -- if you have the right guide -- is off the charts. The quality of the textiles, stonework and Jewelry was incredible.  some young teens were begging outside so India's heartache brushes up against this majestic fort filled with entertainers, all kinds of businesses, art, and music. It is a mosh pit of cultures and history. Could have spent days there with a guide to really see and understand life there better. This is NOT your sedate, slow-paced, hushed historical fort visit. Sensory overload and blown away is how we ended the day. A day we loved and will never forget.

title: Beautiful Jaisalmer
review: Jaisalmer Fort is one of a beautiful forts of Rajaathan.It is one of the fort in which we still have inhabitants living in it.

title: Incredible palace
review: This fort is really awesome made with golden stones.

title: Living fortress
review: I got into Jaisalmer late at night so my first view of the imposing fort was at sunrise but I was surprised to learn later that the buildings scattered around outside the walls are only part of the town - there are actually about 5000 people living inside the fort. This is very cool to see - as you are visiting temples and seeing the views from the parapets, you are also walking by children playing, shops for both tourists and locals, etc. The fort admission is fairly pricey and the guides are pushy but you don't need one to get around.

title: A living fort
review: The color and miniature carvings just stand out. Do take a guide, its money well spent. You need to invest about an hour and it will be worth your time

title: Nothing on the other forts. Nice views from the top
review: Impressive yes, but after seeing many other forts - Jaipur/Jodhpur etc - it didn't have a scratch on those. Badly restored and the exhibits were dusty/badly displayed. Not worth the entrance fee but views from the top were decent!

title: Relaxation
review: The only living fort where locals still dwell. It's a dry fort as the construction was without any cement or concrete mixture and it's over 1000 yrs old. Beautifully built and has lot of architecture stored from the past. Best time to visit during winters.

title: Interesting living fort
review: This is a must-visit in Jaisalmer, and you can't miss it anyway, as it looms over the town. Beautiful golden sandstone structure with an old palace inside, havelis a bazaar and home to about 3000 people.

title: Golden fort
review: It  revels its name. Wonderful  must see place  in jaisalmer.raja Rani mahal both r good. Out side kila one famous kachori walk is there  so don't  miss  to eat  there

title: A living fort
review: This fort is a UNESCO World heritage site. It's different from other forts in India as people still live inside the fort. The fort is a mini town in itself. Hindus/Muslims, Brahmins/Rajputs live inside the fort in harmony.  The fort has temples, bazaar, watch towers etc. The view of the Jaisalmer town and distant Thar desert from the fort is spectacular.

title: Sonar Kella, Surya Gate and Gadi Sagar Lake
review: It was built in the 12th Century by Raja Jaiswal. Standing in the middle of the desert, the fort is a world heritage site and is also one of the largest forts in the world. It has a total of 99 turrets.

title: Most beautiful palace of India
review: This is the unique and beautiful palace. The 25% population of the city reside inside the fort. Made up of yellow stones. Its pride of India and jewel of Thar desert

title: Too big monument
review: We reached this fort around 1.00pm and were asked to get down far from the entrance due to lack of parking space, which killed our interest. Just watched from outside and turned back. Authorities must start battery operated taxi or auto service to cater to old or infirm people.

title: Largest living fort in the country
review: Though Jaisalmer fort is the largest fort in India where people still live, it is a bit of disappointment. It's become heavily commercial with shops and restaurants in every nook and cranny. The main palace building seems neglected and need for repair. Even with it's grand size and architecture, it was the least impressive fort we visited.

title: Rajwadi thaat
review: This is a superb place which built with stone art & superb rooftop art in room. The latwa haweli is amazing place for tourism.

title: Nice n Relaxing environment
review: Visited the place in December'16. The aura of this place is just great. Fort in the middle of a small city...With gold colour sandstone... Great history... And very well maintain. Must visit place n should hire a bike from the back side of this fort. You can take a bike ride inside the fort too. Overall a  great place and be on your wishlist if you are visiting Jaisalmer.

title: Wonderful Rajasthan Desert and Fort
review: Had been planning for the desert safari from long time and finally got the chance to travel Rajasthan.We reached Jaisalmer in evening and went to Sam dunes and stayed the night     dreaming about the fort . Finally woke up and went directly to the fort which has lots of ancient  Jain temples  . The fort is well planned and built with lots of scientific thought which shows how brilliant people were during that time.The complete city is built with Gold sand stone because of which it is known as Golden city.

title: Living fort
review: Incredible architecture of sand castle, it was my best experience to stay inside fort during my entire trip of india.

title: Nice view
review: Jaisalmer fort is interesting but not too much to view . You can finish the tour within 10-15 min. I travelled with family . Don't book you dinner in your hotel as their is dinner gala near desert Safari .

title: Rajasthani trip..
review: Just like other Rajasthan tourist attractions, this place called the Jaisalmer fort is one of the mesmerising monuments in the Rajasthani heritage. The hot temperature in the city escapes while you are roaming in between the walls of the fort.

title: Beautiful fort
review: We feel like a king at this fort. Very interesting story behind this fort . So I suggest we should have 2-3 hrs for visit this place

title: must visit forts in Rajasthan
review: I felt almost all the forts are worth visiting. The only reason we find difficult is, there are several forts in the distance of 10 to 20 KMs. in south India, we find at least 100 km between each fort. In Jaisalmer, we find 5 to10 forts or palaces in less than 10 km range. Every fort has its own significance. Only we need to plan sufficient time to stay here.

title: Good place to be. Entertaining too.
review: Every fort has a history attached to it and so has this. To be sure that you are told the history, take a guide. Negotiate for the price. The guides quote anything and everything. There's a whole small city that resides in the fort area and it is interesting. If you are visiting in summer, ensure to pick evening timings or morning timings. During the vacation times, parking could be an issue around the fort area, so plan accordingly. People are generally cooperative. Food eateries in and around the fort area are very average. You might not be satisfied with the offerings. Plan accordingly. The fort is a must visit. Also visit the Havelis, specially that of the private ministers of the king.

title: Must Visit only Living Fort of Rajasthan
review: Jaisalmer Fort is one of the largest fully preserved fortified cities in the world. Jaisalmer Fort locally known as Sonar Quila is one of the largest forts in the world. It was built in 1156 AD by Rao Jaisal was the Bhati Rajput ruler. aisalmer fort stands amidst the sandy expanse of the great Thar Desert.

title: Gem of City
review: Your Jaisalmer visit is not worth without visiting the fort. It takes around 2-2.5 hrs to see the whole fort. But you would come to know everything about the city, Maharajas and how they ruled over a city for long. A approved guide is must.

title: Good for an afternoon
review: Jaisamer Fort was pretty good but after a month of seeing other forts in Rajasthan I didn't think it was the best or most interesting. It's ok for killing an afternoon but if short on time head to the Havelis they are much more beautiful and interesting.

title: Perfect view and beautiful people
review: The Jaisalmer fort has many places to shop around and is the only fort where people reside. The fort is beautiful and should take 2 hours to explore completely,

title: good fort
review: fort was good but its highly populated. very hard to roam freely as  its looks like more market place rather then a monument.

title: A good walk into history !
review: i suppose this is the only fort in India which is inhabited with people. There are houses in the fort alongwith rooftop restaurants. but well it is quite a walk in the fort. so it is not advisable for a sunny day. there are temples along the way and small shops as well. so its all in all an entertaining and enriching walk in the fort.

title: Ruins of Glory
review: Trip down the Rajputana History .... must watch for visitors, unique feature is that the families of artisans and craftsmen are still residing in the fort since centuries.

title: The only living fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is famous for the only living fort in India. Very attractive in golden stones, with Many jain temples architecture or these temple is so old and marvellous that any time can be spent in 7 temples complex, which also have Kalpbriksha.

title: Holiday
review: Holiday of a lifetime hotel beyond any thing we could imagine absolutely stunning the staff can't do enough friendly and willing just can't fault it in anyway the food is amazing wish we were staying longer than 2 nights just fabulous

title: favorite fort i visited!
review: fairytale vibes. i am in love. really stuck out to me from other forts i visited. the energy is MAGIC.

title: One of the Leaving Fort in the World
review: Jaisalmer Fort is one of the Leaving Fort in the world where people still reside. There are various ancient Havelis worth visiting and must visit is Pataon ki Haveli.

title: Historical Fort
review: It was very nice fort with lots of historical importance and relevance. Old architecture, places for Queens and king, hot and cold water, air flow plans, gates and security system is amazing.

title: living fort
review: Jain mandir is the main attraction , good art work , must to visit , taste Gohtma Laddu outside the fort , you will get it in Jailsalmer only

title: Best fort of India
review: I was visit many fort but jaisalmer fort is my favorite part

title: Golden fort and golden city view
review: This golden fort has main attraction that the city view point. We can look beautiful view of golden city  jaisalmer . This fort and major buildings in the city are build by golden sand stone. The fort is crowded and occupied by many small shops.

title: Fort with an enclosed village.
review: It was interesting to see a settlement within the confines of the fort. The carvings and architecture of the place are amazing. The place is good, though could have been better with more artefacts in the display.

title: Of what remains
review: Well it is an imposing fort and a fort with living population in it .That must make its maintenance difficult. Having said that there should be no excuse for the unkempt and uncared look . The government needs to look after its heritage but I guess this indifference and apathy is visible at all our heritage sites except Taj . Nothing exclusive to buy either at the fort . The views from the top are enchanting. A one time worth visit .

title: Golden fort in dessert
review: Jaisalmer fort is small fort located in middle of the dessert. It is converted into a museum. 1-2 hours are enough to explore the fort. Fort entry is INR100 and Camera fee is INR100.

title: The Golden fort
review: Overlooking the Golden city of jaisalmer, the Fort made of Golden sandstone is a must visit.. Beautifully built and maintained.

title: To not be missed!
review: This place is incredible: we had a walk through the streets and we really enjoyed the atmosphere. There were lots of shops but also travel agencies which offer different camel safari packages.

title: Amazing A Living Fort.
review: Amazing to me because there is a whole town/village living & functioning inside of these fort walls. Its a lot of walking so you will need comfortable shoes. Its the fort as well as all of the little lanes winding in & out of it full of life. We spent half a day exploring. Wonderful to see people living their daily lives around all of these tourists. Doors are open so you can see daily life carrying on cooking , cleaning etc, etc. Great photographic moments. Must Do!!

title: Fascinating
review: Spent a few hours wondering around the fort. So interesting and historical too. Plenty to see and lots of photo opportunities. Not to be missed on your tour

title: Its magic fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is stunning. We visited the fort in around 2.5 hours and it's worth to spent 2.5 hours here.

title: Golden Fort
review: This fort is also referred to as Sonar Fort or Sonar Kila. It is built in yellow sandstone in 12th Century. The fort looks all golden colored.  This is a living fort with people still staying within it.  The fort is a mini town with all amenities and facilities of a small town like bazaar, temples etc.

title: Golden Beuty
review: Its was amazing for us to visit the famous golden fort of Golden City Jaisalmer. It was so pleasant to walking the narrow path inside the fort & observe the great architecture which have great historical value.

title: Place is average but fort looks awesome as background
review: We stayed inside the fort but its like any other old city with houses & shops along congested lanes. Palace inside the fort is very average and entry fee is very high. Infact one of the spots inside palace had very bad smell as the toilets were nearby.

title: Beautiful
review: The fort is beautiful! But all the people trying to sell things and trying to offer guidance and everything is really annoying! Especially if you are woman they try really hard to get something from you. All the staring is awful!! It can be part of Indian culture but it's aggressive.

title: Golden fort
review: The fort looks good from outside but crowded inside as many people stay indie the fort premises.

title: View the desert from the top!!!
review: This fort looks like it rises out of the sands, as the colour of the stone and the sand are one and the same! Visit it early in the morning to avoid the worst of the heat if traveling in the Indian summer.

title: A Unique experience!
review: This Fort is a must visit for anybody who is traveling to Jaisalmer. Within the fort, there is a well equipped museum, and it may be helpful if you have a guide with you. Although there is also an option of taking an audio tour in various languages. On reaching the top observation point of the fort, you will enter a vantage where you can see the entire city. The museum is clean, the architecture of it, helps to keep it cool and you'll see some pretty cool artifacts like battle armor, weapons, palladium, old clothes from the kings wardrobe etc.

title: A large living fort
review: This was my first experience of a living fort (a fort inside which people still reside). The fort is huge with intricate lanes going across houses/shops.

title: Amazing place
review: The Jaisalmer Fort is famous the world over. If you wish to learn about the history and culture of Rajasthan, then coming here is an absolute must. Once you come here, you too will be spellbound by how well everything is preserved and in what grandeur the Rajasthani Royals were used to.

title: A fort like never seen before
review: Visiting a fort that is living...Even today its populated inside, unlike all fort that we have seen. The best part is that the people have maintained the beauty of the fort. Coming to the fort its exceptionally beautiful & well maintained. The lighting in the night makes it looks awesome.

title: Amazing!
review: It's a fantastic maze of windy streets and character. This is not at all like the other forts of Rajasthan that require entrance fees. Just go and enjoy a leisurely walk around. Get lost and soak it up.

title: Jaisalmer Fort, One of several best forts in Rajasthan, India
review: Jaisalmer is called City of God, due to abundance of yellow colored soil and marble around this city.

title: People belonging to different religions/caste live with peace within the fort
review: Built in yellow sandstone, the Jaisalmer fort is a living fort. Families belonging to Hindu religion, Islam religion, Jainism religion and also of different castes like Brahmins, Rajputs etc. live within the fort with peace and maintain brotherhood.  There are temples, bazaars, watch towers etc. with the fort. Do visit the terrace of the fort. The views of Jaisalmer town from the terrace is awesome.

title: Simply a Must visit!!!
review: Amazing fort with 4000+ people actually living inside. Has a beautiful architecture and one can spend 3-4 days just walking around. Also has a local market with local artefacts. Better to stay in one of the hotels inside the fort to experience local culture.

title: Good view of city
review: The guide gave us a good tour of the fort, indicating the best things to see. The aerial view of the city was very good. Saw some nice architecture of windows. The history of jain temple was explained patiently, and the architecture of the temple is magnificent.

title: Jaishalmer fort
review: Jaishalmer fort is the pride of jaishalmer..fort is incredibly beautifull..in daylight look like all fort wrap up yellow piece ..awesome fort must come

title: Mesmerizing desert fort
review: Jaisalmer is a beautiful experience, as their are amazing sand dunes which are beautiful and added to that is this Jaisalmer Amar Sagar Pol fort which will surely take you down the beautiful history. You can imaging all the splendor and the beauty that it used to hold. I strongly recommend one to visit this place only in winters not in summer as it summers it can be a traumatic experience with the temperatures soaring very high.
