title: Self tour of the fort
review: We walked around the fort ourselves with no guide. It's free entry because there are people living in the fort. Looked into the shops, had lunch, wandered the maze of the streets. There are also some lookouts that have great views of the city, you just need to find them!

title: populated fort
review: A populated fort. Very beautiful. Try to get accommodation inside fort. Spend 2 days to walk in narrow lanes and feel history of this great fort. A good local market is around for shopping.

title: Too little time
review: We didn't get to see all of the fort yet what we did see we loved. Reasons to return

title: exotic beauty
review: the fort is a sprawl of beautifully decorated old and new structures, some  occupied by shops, restaurants, inns and homes. the Jain / Hindu temple is exquisite and should not be missed.

title: Beautiful Place
review: Such a wonderful place to explore both during the day and evening. Very pleasant indeed. Try and get to the look out to see it at night if you can, equally as breathtaking

title: Very fine architecture
review: A piece of art, very fine architecture and excellent view of the town. You also get a history of the clan.

title: Amazing fort
review: Me and my friends visit this place (fort) it was so great and beautiful .it's look like golden fort because it's make from yellow stones

title: Shonar Kella - The pride of Jaisalmer
review: The pride of Jaisalmer and a World Heritage site stands tall on a hill in the middle of the city. It is one of the largest fully preserved fortified cities in the world. The royal landmark is visible from all points in the city and shines like gold. Inside are shops wrapped in vibrant colors, art and craft goodies and numerous vendors looking for tourists. This beauty is a must visit in the Golden City of India. Involves a lot of walking, so comfortable shoes are recommended. Cameras are allowed. Beautiful view of the city from the fort and fantastic museums inside.

title: The free part is mendatory but ...
review: This was our last fort to visit in Rajasthan. Is it interesting? Yes. Does it worth the INR 600 / pers. Entrance fee? If you are in a tight budget, no since you can visit most of the fort for free and you should do it! Jaisalmer is a beautiful city, so relaxing after crowd and noice of Jodhpur, Udaipur and Jaipur! DO browse in the Bazzar below the fort main gate! But paying for what you cannot see for free is a waste of money in my opinion.

title: Very nice and free
review: It was very nice to get lost between the small alleys of the fort. Lot of handcrafts and local culture. The architecture is astonishing and really enjoyable

title: Not to be missed
review: Like many other Forts in Rajasthan, Jaisalmer's is a must .

title: Beautiful Fort
review: Me and my friends visit this Fort it was so beautiful and so great and also very clean

title: Good experience
review: Its a nice experience to just wander through the fort. tour guide takes you inside the rooms which would entail a cost and would take about 1 hr. The fort area is well kept and not very crowded from either tourists or locals.

title: Amazing living fort
review: Mind boggling walls, ramparts, gates & entrance. Killer two wheelers trying to do you in. A labyrinth of alleyways with stores cheek by jowl, selling 'pashminas', kitsch, souvenirs, temples, restaurants, hotels..everything squeezed in. Definately different & interesting. Unlike boring Amer fort.,

title: Great fort
review: A lovely place to walk around, and free too unless you wanted to visit the museum. It was possible to walk around most of the battlements. Lovely to see the people who still live within this fort.

title: Living fort
review: The only living fort i have seen. The streets in the fort are busy with two wheelers. The grand entrances and jain temples are really worth seeing. A tour guide can help you understand about the fort better. From the top of fort you can see the entire jaisalmer.

title: Great from outside Shabby inside.
review: The fort is no more. It is inhabited by people and full of shops. The old world charm is there, but not really a go. Still then this is the fort that Satyajit Roy used in his book and film 'SONAR KELLA'.

title: The fort is awesome
review: The jaisalme fort is the best place to visit in the jaisalmer....

title: Beautiful fort if a Jain
review: The fort is just in the heart of the city which can be reached by the autorickshaws which can take you to the fort in just 20 rupees/ pp from the Gadisar lake or the Patwon ki haveli. The fort has no entry fee. There is a bit of slope while just entering the main heart of the fort. There are total 9 jain derasar/temples in the fort which are just amazing to watch. all he temples are almost 400-600 years old. The idols even old for around 2000-2200 years back. Also there is a market in their selling the traditional clothes of Rajasthani style for both men and women. Also the place has nice restaurants or fast food shops. Amazing to visit here.

title: Charming but in need of some upkeep
review: Worth the time and effort to walk around with stunning views. Remember to bring a deposit or passport for the audio guides!

title: A must explore
review: I entered the port with much less expectations, but to tell you that it's more than worth a half day trip.

title: A truly great experience.
review: I had the opportunity to visit many Forts during my one month tour of Rajasthan and this particular Fort is different to the others.  Walking the narrow streets of the Fort, with a population around 3,000 people, you have the feeling that the Fort is still alive and functioning as it was many hundreds of years ago.  It was quite an experience to view from the top of my hotel at night with all the walls and towers floodlit. Has to be my favourite Rajasthan Fort and it is well worth a visit.

title: Jaisalmer
review: Fort is so beautiful and great experience. Everything is authentic and so nice to walk around. People are friendly.

title: Beautiful fort
review: as there are many fort in rajasthan most have some entry charges but this fort was free i really loved it whole fort was looking like gold there are many shops also available there we can spend quality time there.

title: The golden fort
review: Walking arround fort is quite relaxingand the sunset is good too. There are many shops. It was having nice architecture. No enterace fees and some people also live inside the fort. It took us something 3 hrs to explore fort.

title: Beautiful
review: It is a fort where people live inside so authenticity is the key word. I like the color of the stone, golden and warm. There is a huge beautiful Jain temple- worth a visit.

title: Real gems
review: Fort is real gems of jaislamer with very nice construction. View from top of fort is amazing. Many shops available there.

title: Just ordinary
review: If you have seen other popular and big forts of Jaipur or Agra, you will find it very ordinary. It's very small and only limited portions of the fort are open for public viewing. Though it looks very grand and mystic from outside especially in the night light but i was very disappointed.

title: Lovely palace
review: First palace which i saw in jaisalmer in evening Wonderful architecture of fort. Best part of fort is You can eat anything from shops.

title: Huge fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is a township in itself. Its huge. There is residential area, shops, temple etc everything inside the fort. Do not forget to visit a hidden library near temple which has old original jain scriptures in it! This fort is a must visit place in jaisalmer

title: beaitiful Fort
review: We found this so interesting and full of unexpected treaures,even shown how to tie a turban on a head,the extras like this made it a huge overall treat.

title: Good Place to See in Jaisalmer
review: This is the only place need to be seen in Jaisalmer. Its very large sized Fort. V big and includes small village. One should also visit Jain temples inside the Fort along with Guide and understand the details of those temples and history of it. V interesting place to see in Dec-Feb.

title: Live fort
review: i am a tourist who loves to visit places where we can touch and feel history. Jaisalmer fort has the added attraction of being a live fort---- they have a fully self sufficient city inside the fort- complete with schools colleges markets temples etc.

title: OK
review: People actually stay in this fort. so its difficult to appreciate the historic beauty of the fort when there are noisy autos zipping by or clothes hung on a string.

title: Nice Fort with beautiful view over the city
review: The Fort of Jaisalmer offers a beautiful view over the city and lots of nice little and unique paths. You don't need to take a tuktuk, which is offered immidiately after your arrival by the tons of guides waiting for you, to go upstairs. Take the chance to walk and have a look at the nice shops that are offering handcrafted goods from India

title: A living fort - mesmerizing but needs sanitation help!!
review: This is an amazing fort with tons of history and life - particularly as its a living fort.  Given the age, a large part of the fort and the living areas are in high need pf maintenance.  One needs to ensure you are looking down while exploring to avoid stepping into open drains etc.  Highly recommend getting a good guide to help explore the fort.

title: expect only souvenir shops
review: The inside is only filled with souvenir shops and hotels. The fort is best viewed from the outside on a rooftop somewhere.

title: THE JAISALMERI FORT.
review: The heritage and culture of Ours. Fort represents the beauty and abundance of of the era. AS IN SAYS THAT "GOLDEN CITY OF INDIA : JAISALMER

title: Archtectural marvel, interesting narrated tour
review: This fort is a fantastically preserved historical site, beautiful court yards, interesting history, well preserved artifacts.

title: Huge Sandcastle
review: Imposing fort with many shops and Derasars (Jain Temples). Easy to get lost in the maze of alleyways.

title: THE BEAUTIFUL GOLDEN FORT
review: Its a huge fort with 03 main Gates. Though the Fort shines Golden in the sun shine but would advise to visit it in shade as one needs to walk a lot. Its the first fort where you will find sooo many shops and hotels inside the Fort itself. Do visit the Jan Temples inside.

title: wow, what a place
review: This is a living fort, which means that people live in the fort, not just a museum.

title: People live here
review: I was astonished to hear this that people actually live in this fort. Its like a big market inside the fort.

title: lived public
review: good fort beautiful  view night time with colorfully light,

title: A mini town within the fort
review: Built in yellow sandstone, this fort is a living fort.  There seemed to be a mini town within the fort. People of different castes and religion live in different parts of the fort in harmony.  There are bazaars, temples, stores etc. within the fort. It was an entirely different fort.

title: Wonderful Architecture!
review: Really impressive and romantic, like from a fairy tail. Just walking around, taking some pics. Is also possible to eat there and buy some souvenirs.

title: Nice construction, but not maintained..
review: very Nice construction.. but the look is spoiled by running electricity wires in the view.. people, cows, shops around.. does not make it feel like a heritage place...

title: Jaisailmer fort
review: A real gem in the dessert. Loved this place. Felt like something from morocco or Africa. Beautiful fabrics line the high walls. Traders sell jeweller, leather, and metalwork. If your planning on buying some gifts I recommend this place. Great views of the surrounding areas from the roof top restaurants at the top. Once inside the fort the shop keepers don't haste you. They seem to be more educated and better off.  Several wouldn't haggle at all and were happy not to sell. Outside the walls expect to be asked for 4 times the value. If you like temples there's several Jain temples to see.

title: Beautiful   only from outside
review: This fort is meant to be seen from outside in the day and the night.   on the inside it is absolutely not worth visiting . crowded and narrow streets with vendors all along. if you are travellling by car be prepared to walk a lot uphill into the fort which is very tiring. it involves walking up a steep road with bikes speeding both sides.. i suggest to rent a bike on the day that you are visiting the fort. will save a lot of energy and time..  i rented a bike.

title: Wonderful living fort
review: Very interesting and enjoyable place to visit. A must see for anyone lucky enough to visit this area. Wander the alleys and discover little nooks and shops in lovely historic old buildings

title: Must visit in Jaisalmer
review: It is the main attraction of the Jaisalmer city. The fort is made with sand stone. Must visit for everyone.

title: Oh that vibe!
review: Where else will you see  a city inside the fort? Amaing place to walk around, mingle with locals. Look at the stunning view of the city.

title: Golden City of Rajasthan, Indeed.
review: I have been to Jaisalmer three times in my life so far. The best time to visit Jaisalmer is during November and spent a diwali festival week with local. It will be chilly but it will be worth walking around town and experience the thousand year old traditions.

title: Nice architecture
review: Whole Jaisalmer was filled with this kind of buildings. It was having nice architecture and my kids loved to see all these buildings. Nice experience

title: Walking through history
review: This fort is a wonderful change from the other forts in Rajasthan. No entrance fee, you are just free to roam, meet the people who still live inside the fort. It took us about 2 hours to explore most of the fort, but you can probably spent all day if you want to visit the "palace", the havellis and all the shops and restaurants.

title: Not really worth
review: The fort is not worth as such

title: You wont get a feel of visiting a Fort, you can find shops every where in the fort
review: One thing we linked there was the city view from the top, but other wise there is nothing like you are visiting a fort since every where in the fort you find shops.

title: Heritage place
review: good fort, but living conditions within have made it a little cluttered. had good stories of the kings and the families who made jaisalmer and prospered it for us to witness these today

title: No words
review: One of the best food that I have seen and everything just mesmerize you and you don't wanna leave the place

title: A fort that is "alive"
review: Walking around the fort is quite relaxing and the sunset is good. It's a bit hot during daytime but the path in the fort is shady. There are many souvenir shops. Should be able to find something interesting.

title: A beautiful and only living fort
review: Fort Jaisal is the only living fort in India which houses about 5000 families in it. This has beautiful Jain Temples and palaces inside. The Jain Temples are so exquisitely carved that they make your jaw drop. The palace is also good . the view of Jaisalmer from the top of it is great.

title: A living citadel
review: There are many forts to see in India but the Fort in Jaisalmer is different because it is still a functioning community with shops, hotels, restaurants and places of worship, as well as museums.

title: Very well preserved and renovated
review: A fascinaTing tour around the old city.  M.y guide lived there and knew just about everyone.  Well preserved in manager places with intricate carvings in the screens.  A mix of Hindu and Moslem art. Great bazaars with the different religious sectors and heavenly street food.  THe temples are well preserved as well s being  mainly in use.

title: Great fort views
review: Family tour and I enjoyed our complete day around the Jaisalmer Fort. Not having an entry cost reduced expectations and set up the foundations for a relaxed day of shopping and sightseeing. We walked quite slowly and had enough time to enjoy the full day. A wonderful and memorable journey. And thank Mr. Sharma his help full guide

title: Must seen
review: Fort is still inhabited by around 4,000 people.this fort also has temples, cafes, houses, sunset points everything inside.Entry ticket is 100 rs per person and mobile camera charge is 100 rs.

title: A Fort with life!
review: Instead of the usual historic fort/palace visit, this fort offers much more. Yes it has a palace, Jain and Moslem temples, havelis; it also has about 3000 residents living within its walls. Granted, the majority of activities revolves around tourism, the maze of narrow streets crisscrossing throughout, provides an enjoyable opportunity to explore and meet the very friendly inhabitants. AND....it's all Golden! This might be one of the sites that could benefit by banning all motor bikes.

title: Beautiful
review: It was a very beautiful fort ! We really enjoyed a lot. There was a lot to see and learn about our culture and tradition.

title: Example of Beautiful Art - Sonar Fort also called
review: My same day visit to Jaisalmer Fort was exciting, This is very beautiful fort. It is also called as Sonar fort. Sonar means Gold, color of the fort is golden so its called Sonar, A world heritage site,known as 'Sonar kila' for its yellow sand stones.One of the largest living fort always flooded with tourist at day times.Beautifully carved Jain temples inside , spend good time over there.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: A live fort with more than 4000 population staying....jain derasar,temples, havelis, museum, art shops, palace, old homely heritage hotels, the view point to view the whole city, eating joints. At night also the lighting makes the fort resemble Sonar Killa.

title: Awesome place...
review: Its a good place. And offers a lots of insights to the maharajas of jaiselmer. You get an awesome city view from the top.

title: Memorable visit to Fort
review: 5 friends and I enjoyed our complete day around the Jaisalmer Fort. Not having an entry cost reduced expectations and set up the foundations for a relaxed day of shopping and sightseeing. We walked quite slowly and had enough time to enjoy the full day. A wonderful and memorable journey.

title: The golden fortress (a true UNESCO World Heritage Site)!
review: A great historic monument built out of yellow sandstone. Looks very beautiful because of the golden appearance of the yellow sandstone. There are also private hotels & occupations inside the fort, which is a kind of drawback. The Jain temple inside the fort is also beautiful and worth visiting. One of 2 greatest attractions of Jaisalmer, other being the Thar desert.

title: The best fort
review: This one was the best fort i have ever visited.People still live there and you will get a feeling of the ancient times :)

title: Royalty
review: This place shows how royal india was. and how the Maharaja helps their sevaks. Must visit this place.

title: Town within a fort...
review: Very lively old fort that is still inhabited by around 5,000 people and probably as many tourists.  Motorbikes, pigs and people all compete for space in the crowded, narrow streets, which is part of the fun for many of us.  An India experience that really shouldn't be missed !

title: Living Fort
review: Wherever you go in jaisalmer you will keep bumping into this fort. It's the only living fort I.e. people live and stay in this fort. Apart from mandatory museums this fort also has temples, cafes, houses, sunset points everything inside. Guides are a huge scam here - avoid at any cost. Since it's a living fort the cleanliness and hygiene levels are not really top notch. But overall a good experience which will appeal to the history buff in you!

title: Architectural beauty
review: History and interiors are interesting. Don't forget to visit the Jain temples which are unique not just in architecture but also has carvings of Hindu deites.

title: did not like the fort
review: this is not a fort actually..all houses, hotels, restaurants occupy the entire fort..not clean as well

title: Jaisalmer Fort, City within
review: Great Fort to visit, as most of the of the parts are occupied by local people. They are the real attraction inside the fort. So lively and full of time. For a memorable experience, just come and enjoy.

title: Great fort
review: Me and my friends visit this fort it was so great and beautiful  (golden fort)

title: A living fort!
review: This is one of the few, if not the only, living fort in India. It's golden colors and it's lively nature make it a very interesting visit. Our tour guide walked us throughout the fort and told us all about the history of the Havali's within the fort. If you are all about shopping or souvenirs, the famous and comfy Indian trousers are very cheap here and of great quality (about 300 rupees). Do mind the animals, the cows here are grumpy and might stick you with one of their horns, so just be cautious and aware when walking through the narrow streets. After visiting upwards of 15 forts, this is still my favorite!

title: Very royal
review: Have been to all the forts in Rajasthan, museum is just okay but the fort is the most unique one with people staying in it!

title: Good visit..... But....
review: This fort is good to visit but very crowded.

title: Visited approx 9pm
review: Please visit between 10am-5pm

title: Good
review: Nice fort. Little bit dirty. Live in side fort public and many restaurants and Hotels.

title: A walled city
review: Great architecture and narrow street wandering probably completed in an hour or so of meandering. The details in the Jain Temples was amazing.

title: A beautiful property spoiled by allowing people to reside inside
review: The fort doesn't look like a fort at all. The residents has spoiled the entire fort, shops, restaurants and hotels has spoiled overall property. Only beautiful part about the fort is jain temple inside the fort.

title: NW India tour
review: Yet another amazing and must do Fort/Palace complex, with more time needed.  Again, the workmanship is amazing for that period.

title: Wonderful Fort
review: Visit to the fort takes one to the old era of desert life. The brass & iron canons are treat to watch. Don't miss the Jain temples inside the fort.

title: A Large, Living Fort
review: This is such a major sight in Jaisalmer that you will and should visit. The fact that people still live here gives it a lot of dimension. The fort seemed to be the busiest as you enter and then around the Jain temples. However, the farther in you go, the more sparse the crowds become. It is so fun to walk down the little streets and stumble upon different shops and interesting architecture. The fort is also a great place to come for a vast view of Jaisalmer, especially during "golden hour" as the sun is setting.

title: Disabled-unfriendly and just okay
review: I found it just average compared to other forts in Rajasthan. The carvings are great, of course, but rest is just fine. And since it is not at all a place for the disabled, our experience wasn't that great as my mother could not accompany us here.

title: Fort kept to its Nature Looks
review: One of the best forts seen so far and still untouched. During the walk through the fort you feel its alive and all natural.

title: Beautifuk
review: The fort is beautiful.

title: Wonderful atmosphere
review: We were taken by tuk tuk to the top of the fort. It was quite a hike up the hill especially with the traffic, motor and tuk tuk non stop. Cows as well. 100 rupees only.

title: Sonar Kella...
review: Made famous to the world by the legendary Film Director - Satyajit Ray, 'Sonar Kella' or Golden Fort in Jaisalmer is treat to the eyes. Found it among the best forts in Rajasthan.

title: The best stonecarvings
review: The carving in the temple in the fort are the best I have ever seen. I find it surprising that this monument has not e higher rating than it has. Yes it is a long way to get here, but the Hindu carvings and the statues are no less than amazing more than 600 years ago, these carvers have delivered the most stunning sight. No less than 6666 statues. I would go as far as to say this is better than the Taj Mahal. A must see on a trip to India

title: Sonar Kella
review: Must see the Golden Fort,Satyajit Ray,The acclaimed film Director ,has filmed this fort in his famous movie "Sonar Kella".

title: Need to do
review: Take your time to walk around the small alleys. And visit Kuku's coffee at the west part of the fort.Corgeous sunset

title: The "Golden Fort" at Jaisalmer
review: The "Golden Fort" at Jaisalmer is an extraordinary building that appears to grow from the living rock of the sandstone hill it stands on. More than jut a Fort or Palace (it is actually both) there are still around three and a half thousand people actually living within the walls. Things to see include the palace itself, the famous Jain Temples and some wonderfully elaborate Havelis. Many of the buildings inside the walls have now been converted into hotels, hostels, restaurants, cafes etc. A fascinating place and well worth a visit. Plenty of local shopping nearby.

title: Great place to stay and discover
review: A treasure of India

title: An impressive living fort
review: The very imposing golden fort on a hill, this is a last living fort in India.  The impressive palace, the Jain temples, the elaborately carved and beautiful hawelis, the market along the streets  are all fascinating. Well worth the visit!

title: Sonar Kella
review: The fort is one of the largest fully preserved fortified cities in the world.It is a world heritage site

title: Sonar Quila in the Golden City
review: October 2016 : The largest living Fort perhaps which is a city in itself within the golden city of Jaisalmer. The museum inside is pretty nice. It goes without saying that the views from the Fort is simply majestic.

title: Stunning Place
review: The place looks splendid at night. The mighty walls surrounding the fort when illuminated at night gives the view of a lifetime. The fort's museum remains open till 6pm. The entire city is visible from top of the fort.

title: A living fort
review: 3000 people live in the fort and it is really nice tov isit. Despite the fact that quit a few of the exhibitions are closed. Inside and outside the fort many shopping places are found with beautiful handycraft. Obviously you have to deal

title: Not much to see
review: It is not maintained properly.lot of people still reside inside fort premises,jain temples inside fort and market are most liked by tourists.you can see belongings of kings in fort museum.it is not maintained as compared to many other forts I visited in rest of Rajasthan.i am posting photo of jain temple,which i liked most in entire fort.

title: Me rohan
review: Nice place to visit . See inside of fort by walking or take rickshaw . Walk around, there are couple of view points and kings and queens palace to see . They close at 5 pm so plan accordingly.

title: Jaisalmer visit.
review: Visiting jaisalmer in February is a great experience.

title: A fort which is alive and thriving
review: This is actually a living township. You must visit the Jain temples. We were lucky to have a guide who was very good at sharing insights. Do visit the market and walk a couple of lanes to the turrets of the forts where the canons are for a good view. All in all, a very good visit, can easily visit on foot from any hotel close by and spend more than a few hours.

title: A fort with a difference
review: Just when you think you've seen everything the forts can offer, this one is different as it has more domestic artefacts, which give an insight into how the people really lived.

title: Forteresse
review: Such a good time walking around in the fort , Jain temples, wonderful Havelis , temples and nice roof tops with views on Jain temples and city around !

title: a wonderful Experience
review: This is a fort of one of his kind, people still lives in the fort and the whole fort is under king of the fort no government undertaking is there. Primary attractions inside fort are The mahals of king and queen, jain temples (very beautiful) and the firing point.

title: A real living fort
review: Found this, by far, the most interesting fort we visited.  It has over 3,000 people living inside with small businesses, restaurants etc. Temples, small hotels & hostels, all without the feel that things are packed in tightly.  Our tour guide was very good, he soon latched on to the fact we enjoyed history & photography and took us to the "old town" part of the fort.  His knowledge was impressive.  Don't miss this fort, one of the best.

title: Wonderful Old Heritage
review: This fort was very nice and we enjoyed walking through the by lanes and the view from the top was wonderful!

title: Wonderful old fort
review: Jaiselmer is a "living" fort meaning that thousands of people live and work inside it. Allow yourself some hours to roam around the clean, cobble-stoned maze of narrow alleys. We found our way up to the top with huge views over the surrounding countryside. Also, take the time to visit the beautiful Jain Temples with their intricate stone carvings- 200 Rupees for foreigners. We stayed 2 nights in an old haveli converted into a guesthouse and felt quite safe and comfortable walking about the alleyways by ourselves. Comfortable, except for the men on motor bikes riding with their ear splitting horns blasting. Thankfully there are no cars in this old fort so very worthy of plenty of time to explore.

title: Golden fort
review: Must visit if you are in jaisalmer. This is known golden fort because of stone colour is golden.

title: Must see place !!!
review: Fort is really worth visiting and one should spend good time there !!!! Very nice architecture and how they used to live in olden times.

title: Different from other forts...
review: Wake up early, take some bhang cookies and walk around this living fort! All the colors, views and food places are really amazing!

title: Beautiful
review: Really lovely fort to walk around with shops and restaurants inside, great views from the top aswell!

title: A historic day to remember
review: My two friends and I enjoyed our day walking around the Jaisalmer Fort. Not having an entry cost reduced expectations and set up the foundations for a relaxed day of shopping and sight seeing. We walked quite slowly.

title: Review of history!!!
review: well carved sandstone with mesmerizing and breath taking architectural scenic beauty.... Felt like running back to the history of architectural era!!!!

title: Beautiful
review: Peaceful city compared to the others in Rajastan, not crowded, nice little streets, shops and corners.

title: Ancient fort
review: This fort is the main attraction of Jaisalmer. People still live in the Fort. One can experience true Rajasthani culture in Jaisalmer only. Be sure to take a Government approved guide when you visit the Fort. It's important as they explain the palace very well.

title: Beautiful fort
review: beautiful palace with intricate carving. the palace buildings are quite cold as compared to the temperature outside

title: Grandeur of a bygone era!
review: Visit to Jaisalmer fort was a great experience. Guide Sikandar Khan was very polite and descriptive with the explanations.

title: Beautiful "living" fort, different experience from others
review: Jaisalmer Fort is magnificent and easy to admire. It is a unique experience to see a "living" fort, and fascinating to learn from a tour guide whose family has lived in the fort since the 14th century.

title: Excellent
review: Would really recommend the audio guide so you can take it at your own pace and really enjoy the fort. There is so much to see and so much to take in. Despite being a hot day when we went there were lots of cool spots, due to the design of the building. An absolute delight to visit.

title: you must pay a visit
review: If you are in Jaisalmer you must walk around the fort w all the Havelis, small shops, cows and the best no cars....

title: Great place for exploration.
review: Since it is a living fort, you can go around the whole day and pass your time in the different restaurants and temples. People are friendly. The Jain temple is a must see. Had a great time. Hope you too have one!

title: rajputana shaan
review: please visit ones in a life in suncity ( jaisalmer ),

title: Awesome
review: Go for the audio tour for sure. That is the best way to get all relevant information about the fort. Do buy the mortar pestle made out of yellow sand on the way back, it works really good.

title: A living fort on the far west
review: Jaisalmer fort is a living fort and is situated very close to the thar desert. Most of the fort is now occupied by peaple now and offers a spectacular view of the thar landscape.  Along with the fort there are various havelis one can visit during their stay.There are shops near the fort which offers desert safari's which include night camping at the desert

title: The golden fort
review: This palace with a history of more than 800 years old still has 6000 people still staying in it. It has hotels in which Indians are not given room as told us by a local guide. Don't miss it for anything if in Jaisalmer. It has shops inside, but same things are cheaper if bought from patwon ki Haweli market. Visit as soon as parlance is open for visitors as it gets too hot in noon. Do not have music and light show.

title: Excellent City Tour
review: It was a great time of watching jaisalmer fort . I enjoyed a  lot there and also was good experience for just walking inside the jaisalmer fort.

title: So so fort
review: The outer look is impressive but for some lines of water flowing downhill. Maintenance could be much better. Our guide was somewhat funny character making funny sounds. Exhibits could be restored to give better looks. Bikes blowing horns and racing through passages are irritating It's not OK for physically impaired. Guides have some fixed stories that don't seem authentic like the bed being short so that if occupant is tied to it he could lift bed and walk with it to fight.A SOUND AND LIGHT SHOW could be added attraction

title: well maintained fort
review: good place to see while visit jaisalmer . can see the real local culture of jaisalmer .well maintained fort

title: Golden fort
review: Our friends and me vist  jaisalmer fort its look beautiful  and very clean place

title: The Golden Fort
review: One of the greatest tourist sites in the country. Absolutely impossible to recreate the history, geography and culture of  the town: symbolized by the  Fort. Majestic, awesome, combining the past with the present. A mesh of history and people, religion and commerce, architecture and culture. I can spend a day roaming its lanes and peeping through walking the ramparts. The small curio shops add color and mystic to the place. Simply unforgettable.

title: India's only living fort
review: Old fort founded in twelfth century. There are few thousand families living inside the fort. Fort is a bustling area with numerous hotels, restaurants and shops. Cars are not allowed inside the fort. Only autorikshaws (tuktuk) are available. There is no ATM inside the fort. Entire area inside the fort including palace can be explored by walking. Rooftop of palace must be seen as it provides excellent views of the Jaisalmer city. Guides also show the place where  famous bengali movie Sonar Kella was shot. Walking on the streets of the fort gives a altogether different feeling.

title: A well preserved tradition
review: This fort made in typical Rajasthani style with Jaisalmer stone is a heritage site and a must visit for all. The whole city dwells inside the fort. There are nice shops and boutiques inside.

title: Awesome Golden Fort
review: This Golden Fort is as beautiful and historical as the Jaisalmer Fort. And the stories of the 2 sisters and their love stories add to the charm. For the film lovers, this is the place where Satyajit Ray's Sonar Kella was being shot. Just cannot have enough of this mythical golden fort.

title: Living fort at india
review: People stay inside the fort. So, you can actually experience some local culture here. Very  good visit. From the walls of the jaisalmer fort , you can see why the city is called the golden city. The house of the King and Queen are awesome , specially the carving on the stone. Inside there is a jain temple, there can be much more stone carving works can be seen.

title: Compulsory
review: An amazing construction so beautifully built, currently being fully reblocked bit by bit. Go up to the top and go to the Shanti Peace Restaurant, Mr Happy makes great food and he and his brother make you feel most welcome. One of the most authentic breathtaking places I've been to. I wish everyone was wearing full desert garms!! Super super cool

title: Good from outside
review: This Fort has a very good view from outside. But its like a small city inside. Around 4000 families stay inside which doesnt give u a fort feeling. You'll find a good city view from top of fort. lot of roof top resturants and shop are available inside.

title: Traditional fort a must itinerary in Jaisalmer trip
review: I was largely excited by the huge fort architecture. We had a good guide, who explained seamlessly and in details. This fort showcases the skill set and Architectural design knowledge of the people who lived 700 years ago! This fort is at the city centre and easily approachable. This site is suitable for all ages people. Try to find a genuine guide, who can deliver the exact historical informations. Photography is charged in certain places of the fort.  I would rate the maximum rating for this fort.

title: The living legend !!!
review: mostly, this is the only living fort in India.. where absolutely living town with 400 odd families still living inside the fort... It offeres many viewing points... shops with local flavours... The best part is so many houses / hotels have rooftop eateries which offeres great local food with fantastic views...  Worth seeing the fort both in daylight and then from outside  for a view in evening lights..

title: one of the few forts in which people live inside
review: Fort is one of its kind in India. Fort is huge as some villages are settled inside. All were doing some kind of commercial activities inside.

title: A Fort with 5000 warrior families
review: You cant believe it until you saw it...its a fort...nope its aliving fort....5000 people living there...done all the modifications required...even saw marriage function...surreal...

title: Very nice
review: Very morden place...... I am so happy to see her again. I am sure you are the two of my heart is the best way to go you.

title: Nice Jain temple inside
review: Fort is overall good, don't visit to Jain temple inside, timing is go before 1pm. don't forget to take guide it only cost 200/ for this fort and patwon ki haweli.

title: Fort filled with shops and points of interest
review: The whole fort is filled with little shops, restaurants and points of interest. The interior of the fort is all made up of sandstone where it got the name from; "golden fort". It is a great place to spend an afternoon when combined with the bazar that you find outside of the fort. You can also eat and sleep here if you do desire.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: Fabulous fort. A must see! This is a living fort. It is wonderful to wander the streets and alleyways talking with the locals and looking for bargains. We never felt ill at ease or threatened in any way. (We are two women travelling alone) and had a fabulous time in Jaisalmer. Highly recommended!!

title: Fort and palace beautiful
review: The fort is huge! The palace is utilitarian but still beautiful as a remote desert kingdom! History is interesting

title: Absolutely loved it!
review: The fort was the main reason we came here, and we loved it! It was pretty busy in the morning and got more quiet in the afternoon  (in the heat).

title: Good but messy
review: We went during desert festival. Fort is untidy although it has good history. Local people who resides in the fort make fort dirty and it becomes difficult to walk due to traffic.

title: "A living Indian treasure"
review: We really enjoyed our time wandering aimlessly down the narrow cobbled little allies and losing ourselves within the high walled inner walls.

title: Great fort
review: our group travel in jaisalmer we see jaisalmer fort it was superb make by rav  jaisal it's look like golden fort beauce it's make from yllow stones nice and highly walls it was superb and very clean

title: Definitely worth seeing but expect to be hassled.
review: This fort is truely magnificent and should be seen. We had a very good tour guide although it became apparent he was hoping we would buy at all his friends shops. As we visit India every year this starts to wear thin. Unfortunately for jaisalmer tourism is down so we felt the pressure to buy everywhere.

title: total disappointment...
review: I was totally disappointed to see this Fort. It looks beautiful bt only from outside down t city.

title: Decent fort
review: Visited this fort on a Sunday morning. Not crowded and interesting how the fort is actively used. There is almost like a village inside the fort with peoples houses, shops, temples etc. watch out for the motorcycle which are fast in those downhill roads inside the fort

title: Awsome Fort
review: I have seen many fort ... But this was amazingly amazing.

title: The Golden fort at all times
review: The Jaisalmer fort is very big, living fort. The review here is only for the Museum inside the fort and not the entire fort. The fort looks golden because of the yellow stone used to built it. The museum inside the fort, is mesmerizing. The audio guide inside the fort is a must to understand the fort properly.  The staff and the securities within the fort are very polite and friendly (not like the one in Jodhpur Mehrangarh fort and Jaswant Thada). Takes around 1.5 hrs to visit the museum properly with the audio guide and taking sufficient photographs. The entrance fee is Rs 100 and audio guide is Rs 400. The terrace offers a fantastic view of the jaisalmer town.

title: The Golden Fort
review: Superb work of art. Built in 1100s, nothing to beat the design, the filigree work, the blend of stone wood, fossil pieces to keep out heat during summer, and the cold during extreme winters.

title: Worth a visit
review: If you're in Jaisalmer you have to go here. People are very friendly and it's a lovely place. Lots of history. I recommend.

title: Beautiful......book accommodation inside the fort!
review: Hindu weddings, cows, tuks tuks, motorbikes.....it's fabulous. The views are stunning and the colour of the fort against the sky at sunset is worth it alone.

title: jaisalmer fort
review: the place is must visit place of jaiselmar , it is landmark place of jaisalmer , quite enjoyable . liked the place

title: Lived in Fort
review: Another great fort on our tour of Northern India. this one is lived in by 300 people and has lovely views plus the houses have lovely paintings when someone from that house has got married, with the date. Really interesting.,

title: Wonderful stonemasonry and spectacular views
review: Jaisalmer's fort is still a living city and so there's fascinating architecture everywhere. Tourism is the main income, still people are very friendly and sincere. They are understandable proud of their heritage and we hope they can maintain everything the way it is.

title: Ok ok
review: Its worth a visit. Too much of commercial attitude.  But still worth a visit. I went there with family and its has a lot of foreigners visiting the fort. I have seen better forts in rajasthan

title: Good for Sight Seeing.
review: So we had been roaming around the fort area at Jaisalmer. The whole area is very beautiful. There are different points at this area one of them is at a height where there are very old war machines. This place where you can click a lot of pictures and pose around. There are a lot of cafes as well but dont forget to visit the little tibet cafe at the fort area.

title: Beautiful Fort!!!
review: I visit this monument in Feb 2017 and i fell in love with the history associated with this fort. Well built architecture, sandstone and every single detail is very good about this fort.

title: Desert festival
review: Go to Jaisalmer for the Desert festival

title: Good piece of history and insight to society
review: The fort displays many facets of the Jaisalmer society of those years along with the skills of the artisans of that period. The large cannon and its association with the demolition of a competing authorities (from the nobility) to the king was special. The art work plus unusual structures like concealed lockers etc are worth going through in detail. The view of the city and the Lake from the view point near the cannon is breathtaking. It is called Golden fort and the city, Golden city because of the golden colour of the sand stones used in construction in the locality. The various temples inside adds value.

title: Another spectacular Rajasthan Fort City
review: $-5 hour tour including visit and chai at guides house (Madhu) within the fort.

title: Very commrcialized though worth visiting
review: The fort is closely associated with 'The Golden Fort' of Satyajit Ray. There are some places to visit especially the Jain temples but the whole environment now becomes too much commercialized.

title: Excellent Fort
review: The Jaisalmer fort is the excellent fort, very nicely built and a good historic place. Can see each and every area of Jaisalmer when we go on top of this fort. Mainly known for Jain Temple. The art work plus unusual structures like concealed lockers etc are worth going through in detail. The view of the city and the Lake from the view point near the cannon is breathtaking.

title: Beautiful and serene
review: Jaisalmer fort is the only fort in India which is still inhabited.hence u gt good food good shopping experience inside the fort..dont forget the royal canon placed at the top..view from there is amazing..perfect place to visit with your friends n spend a nice sunset or a beautiful sunrise..and not an effort at all just a walk of few steps..enjoy

title: Sonar Kella Jaisalmer Fort
review: There is a famous bengali story written by Satyajit Ray- Sonar Kella. All bengali child grow up with a ambition of once visiting Mukuls house. My dream came true this Jan 2017 after reading the book about 3 decades back.. it was so beautiful and nostagic to visit the temples and the fort which has immense historical value as well a cultural value for every bong.. A must visit for all tourist visiting Jaisalmer.

title: College trip
review: The residential fort of India and the civilised one..... beautiful palace reveals India's history...it was a good experience ....really mesmerizing 1

title: One of a kind 'Living' Fort in India
review: Jaisalmer Fort is one of a unique kind of living fort in the world as people still reside inside the fort.More popular as the 'Sonar Kila' - from the movie by same name by renowned film-maker Satyajit Ray, this is quite different from other Forts of Rajasthan.Built by Rana Jaisal four centuries ago this is an outstanding example of yellow sandstone architecture.Immensely popular with foreign tourist as well as locals.

title: Nice but commercialized fort
review: There is alot to cover in this fort but sad part is all of it has been taken over by the locals and has been converted into a market, which is again a unique experience.

title: Great one
review: Great one. There's still people living on the inside, and there's hotels and shops or restaurants but it keeps the grace and the charm of an old city.

title: Fort of different kind
review: Most part of the fort is occupied by people.Jain temple is good and view of city from the cannon point is incredible

title: not good place to visit
review: as there is lot of traffic and residents in side fort, it is not convenient to visit freely. also there were lot of buffaloes and other animals on the road. also roads were not clean.

title: Feels like...  1400s!
review: Except for the motor bikes and cars...  a visit to this takes you back straight to the 15th century or so...  the narrow streets, the dirt, the people ...  the experience both shocks and amazes you.  Definitely worth the visit, including the Jainist temples which are so lovely!

title: Good nice experience
review: It's a nice fort, wonderful architecture, nice colour, but very congested fort since its a living fort. Would have loved it more if it was more organised and well maintained one like Junagarh fort of Bikaner

title: Tour of fort
review: Very interesting to see a living fort

title: Beautiful architecture
review: The Jaisalmer fort is a beautiful fort, with a lot of narrow streets, which are surprisingly cool, in contrast with the heat outside.

title: Beautiful!
review: Huge, magnificent, interesting, we walked in the fort for 2 hours and enjoyed it tremendously!

title: Breath taking!
review: No words to describe this amazing treasure! It is well worth seeing this, some several thousand live and work within the fort today!

title: Gem in a desert
review: Most interesting place. The entry ticket includes the audio guide, so private guide not necessary. We were very lucky to arrive in Jaisalmer at the start of annual desert festival and were able to watch the parade from the fort.

title: Great fort to see
review: One of the great forts i have seen. It is amazing that this fort is well maintained. The museum inside the fort is really good.

title: Mesmerising fort with rich history
review: Very interesting and beautiful fort. Our guide was very informative and explained us about the history and royal family in detail. The view from the fort is also nice. Only thing i felt once you get down the fort it seems very crowded as its still inhabitated by people. Otherwise very nice experience and well maintained fort.

title: Worth the visit but take a guide along
review: There is quite a steep climb from the parking lot to the entrance of the fort museum. Therefore, you may like to hire a tuk-tuk to take you for that short distance. I recommend engaging a guide who can show you around so that you dont miss the main displays. The artefacts on display are similar to those you see in other forts in Rajastan but yet it is good to learn a bit more about the local culture

title: my fav place in the world
review: This is the most magical place in India.   For a first visit to experience the real India there is no better place.   I have been here for diwali - the light festival and it really is a true indian experience.   The boys in the hotel took me out to the desert on the back of a motorbike to a firework sale and we had the best night in the fort experiencing the joys of festival.   A  mass of beautiful heritage buildings that are now protected but the Indian government.  It is breathtaking.  I stayed in the fort on the first visit which was heaven.    This was then banned to stop people building hotels into the 'museum'   Sadly I think this has now been overturned and they can build again   Rather like knocking down the shambles in york to build a subway.   But I was so happy to have stayed in it that feel rather part of the problem.   Anyway - dont worry that it is a long was to get there and rather ruins your perfect three weeks Rajasthan adventure.   It is simply the best bit!

title: Fascinating look at history
review: This is a great fort to visit if you want to get a feel for the history of the area . Be prepared to walk a fair way and be open to all aspects of life here . Wear comfortable non slip shoes !

title: Days worth to spend with friend
review: Hello guys,

title: Living fort
review: This fort is famous as living fort. People live within the fort premises and there are hundreds of shops. It gives you a feeling of small city enclosed in fort walls.

title: Good!!!
review: It is a good fort..city is beautiful...inside fort there are lot of crowd..There are shops..Some of handicraft and some are restaurants...overall I say about this fort is good!!!!

title: A vibrant living fort
review: We loved this fort and the life it 'breathes'. As most reviewers have stated, this is an actual living fort with houses, shops, guesthouses and restaurants.

title: First impressions when you approach Jaisalmer
review: First impressions when you approach Jaisalmer are pretty impressive Like most forts in this part of India it is massive. All the more exciting as it is inhabited by all sorts of tourist paraphernalia - shops, hotels, temples and hotels.

title: Good one time visit
review: It's different , in the sense that 4000 people still live inside this fort , not royal family but their workers and generations . Looks very big , the tour is however short , maybe 45 min . It is a must visit if you're there .

title: Wonderful!
review: So interesting and educational- fascinating - get he English audio guide and you will learn so much. This is really worth a visit

title: Best fort in india
review: Soner kella is a deferent fort in whole india. It is only the leving fort. The view of the fort is to good.

title: Nice place with good view of entire locality
review: Nice place with good view of entire locality. Good shopping areas. Though place is dirty due to straying cows and dogs. Overall a must visit place

title: Best of my India trip
review: Very attractive desert city with big historic fort where there are lovely hotels and guest houses are built inside. Walking on the small alleys of the fort, You feel being transport back to the time of the Silk Roads. Best 3 activities to do: 1/ stay in a fort hotel and have a meal on the balcony with city view; 2/ discover souvenir shops in its many side alleys, and 3/ take a camel desert safari, have dinner cooked on the sand and sleep under the stars. Also, don't forget to visit the photogenic Gadasar Lake during sunrise or sunset. You will come back with a lot of nice memories and hundreds of pretty photos to impress your Facebook friends :)

title: An experience to remember
review: I have been to this place with family. One thing to take care of is that there is lots of walking involved, a challenge for older folks. The taxi are not allowed after a certain point so you will have to take a rickshaw up to the fort. There are several shopping places in this fort as it is residence for few thousand families. My suggestion will be to take a tour guide at Rs 200 for a group. They will walk you through the fort along with story telling. You may like to visit the museum which in the fort, it is priced at Rs100 per person. The place is not recommended for people with knee problems as there are many stairs and uphill climbs. A must visit place otherwise.

title: Magical!!!
review: Jaisalmer Fort, a World Heritage Site, is one of the largest desert forts of the world and the second oldest in Rajasthan.

title: One of the best places in Jaisalmer
review: The fort houses around 5000 people, and is a place to look from in and out. the temples inside with their art on them is a must to see, and would amuse you.

title: One of our Favorites
review: This is the "Golden City" and like everything else the fort is built from marvelous yellow gold sandstone. Unlike other forts in India, this one is set in the middle of the old village. It is not huge, but well worth the trip to this far western area of Rajasthan. Go!

title: Huge
review: This is a huge fortress with all the hustle and bustle of a town inside .

title: Captivating step back in time
review: Jaisalmer Fort is the first Fort I have visited where thousands of people eat, sleep and go about their daily business just as they have done for literally hundreds of years.

title: Must visit
review: Maintained very well. See everything on fort. Don't miss Jain Temple. Autos are available from parking so senior citizens and children can also visit.

title: Golden fort
review: There is a lot of things inside this fort like shops, museum, temples,and most important and good thing like that people stay inside this fort.

title: How does it feel to live inside a fort?
review: The Jaisalmer fort is perhaps the only fort which houses almost 5000 families within it. The intricate carvings on walls, the small stone pathways, narrow staircases, bird's eye view of the city atop the fort makes this place worth a visit. The story of Maharaja(still residing within the fort) and his family provided by the locals makes up an interesting background narrative.

title: Jaisalmer Fort - Sonar Kella
review: If your are visiting Rajasthan then without visiting Jaisalmer Fort it will be incomplete. This Fort is a living fort and not like other forte. People living inside this fort and you can also stay with them. There are several accommodation available. You may opt for Desert Haveli Guest house. Staying inside the fort is a different experience although many experts has actually opposed this culture. But since it is a living fort then where is the trouble unless we as a visitor not doing anything wrong with the history. This is the fort where famous Bengali film director shoot his film Sonar Kella (Feluda Series). You can still have a glance at Mukul's home inside this fort. No peacock, unfortunately because of the population living inside. There are few eage eye view points from where one can see the Jaisalmer city. Roof top restaurants are many and you should enjoy delicious Rajasthani foods. Shopping...yes there are good shops for clothes and famous Jaisalmer stone made items (must buy). Local people are very friendly and bargaining is allowed. Enjoy your fort stay.

title: Nice fort
review: Nice place to visit with family. Good attraction point of jaisalmer.  Good view of city. Love to visit again with friends.

title: A old heritage fort !!
review: A yellow city known for  yellowish jaisalmer stone and fort is also look very scenic. This fort has small windows of carving in stone to protect hot wind and sand due to height.  Very logical architecture excellence monument.

title: Amazing & peaceful experience
review: Worth a visit. No need of guide as lot of signs boards available. Lot of cafes available for quality food. Amazing heritage art market inside the fort. Time will fly just roaming inside fort.

title: Best in the morning
review: Myself and a few friends travelled to Jaisalmer for a few days and found the city itself to be captivating. However as usual the fort is now dominated mostly with sovenier shops, tourists and restaurants (which is fine, people have to make money!). We found the best time to go was for sun rise. Empty alley ways, seeing the residents wake up and start their day and be sure to walk around the fort edge by the towers. Stunning views of the rest of the city as it radiates gold in the morning light. On your way out as the hustle commences grab a chocolate couissant at the main gate, you will not regret it!

title: Golden fort (Sonar Kella)
review: All time attraction for Bengals tourists courtesy Lt. Satyajit Ray. Move around places in Fort, although AUDIO @~400/- is not for learned people. Unauthorized Local Guides were found to have no knowledge about the fort or the history. Nice place to visit.

title: Also called Sonar Quila (Golden Fort), it's a UNESCO world heritage site - Beautiful Fort, Must Visit!
review: Known by Locals as Sonar Quila (Golden Fort), Jaisalmer Fort is a UNESCO  world heritage site, which is built on the sandy expanse of Thar desert. Fort has 4 gates Ganesh Pol, Rang Pol, Bhoota Pol & Hava Pol,  made of massive yellow sandstone walls. The complex of Jaisalmer fort is expansive. Also is one of the rare Forts which is still habituated. As explained by our tour guide, it houses about a quarter of town’s population, about 5000 families , businesses stay & operate respectively inside the fort. Several beautiful buildings inside such as Palace, Havelis, Houses, Temples carved from yellow sandstone, that gleams during sunset, giving impression as if the Fort is made of Gold.

title: A "live" fort
review: This is a "live" fort inhabited by the descendants of the people that assisted the Royals during their reign. It is interestingly different from other forts where such habitation is not usually seen. A good guide gives you the details on the history of the fort. Overall, a nice visit but probably not as memorable as a visit to Amer Fort in Jaipur or the City Palace in Udaipur.

title: interesting place
review: historical just a one word about this fort. amazing architecture you can have a good view of city from there . must watch

title: nice
review: nice palace a little bit too crowded but impressive. The audioguide is a great thing although it could have been faster.

title: Not clean and full of stray animals
review: There is a whole new world inside the fort. You can see auto-rickshaws and bikes being driven inside and also people residing inside the fort. There're also hotels and eateries inside. The tiny shops are cute and reflect the culture. However, the fort is not well kept. It is dirty.

title: Good fort in jaisalmer
review: Jaisalmer Fort really looking beautiful wonderful experience Golden Fort Jaisalmer thank you so much

title: A Captivating Fort
review: The world's largest fully preserved fortified fort as we all are aware, stands tall in Jaisalmer. The beauty of this fort can't be justified unless you visit it. Heritage havelis, rooftop restaurants, antique canons, shops , artisans , all the time hustling and bustling. This is the life of Jaisalmer. It's a must visit . It has a captivating history and a mesmerising view of the city.

title: Only habitable fort!
review: Maintained and curated fascinatingly well. Do hire a guide if you want to understand the history and the architectural marvel this fort is. One of the most kickass forts after Amer (Jaipur) and Golconda (Hyderabad). Worth the pain as it is a massive property.

title: Nice way is not so good
review: I was show there nice fort but there was out side look not nice . I was out side get bad experience because many hokkers

title: a must visit
review: There are so many forts, temples and palaces to see and this one was incredible. We really enjoyed the tour with our guide who again was very knowledgeable.

title: Interesting Fort.
review: People still live in the Fort. They are living in history.

title: nice fort and good city view
review: great view of city from top of city point view. it is the best part of this fort. there is famous jain temple and museum.

title: Nice place to visit
review: Nice place to visit very well maintain as compare to other fort . good place we enjoyed a lot with my familiy

title: MOST BEAUTIFULL THING I EVER SAW!
review: This has to be the most beautifull thing i have ever seen! All the handcrafted buildings and our guide was one out if this world, inviting us to his home where his wife started making some chai. All in all amazing!

title: Great
review: Worth seeing

title: Fort where you can stay inside
review: Interesting fort where you can stay inside. Lots of good restaurants around with a good view of the city are all around. Must see sculptures of Jain temple.

title: Living Fort
review: This fort is very different kind of fort where you will see people still living in historic homes which still have the old historic look and carvings to it.So its more like a village inside the fort rather than a fort which was completely occupied by the kings. All the homes inside still are historic in style, but personally, I did not like the way most of the pathways were kept dirty and all kinds of hotels, shops and what not inside a place that could be maintained for its history and beauty.

title: A very interesting place to visit
review: Magnificent historical site that held our interest throughout the visit - could have spent longer than the couple of hours we had

title: Nice fort, spectacular view.
review: Not to miss, if you are visiting Rajasthan.

title: Jaisalmer fort experience
review: Needs to be maintained and kept more caringly .The fort is being privately managed ,so lacks professionalism

title: A living fort has its plus and minus
review: A living fort has its plus and minus

title: Amazing heritage but disappointing to see it neglected
review: We spent a good 1.5 hrs exploring the fort..there are such Jain amazing temples to see..every street has a pretty house and intricate carvings. Unfortunately its dirty and has open drains which are such an eye sore..and take away from the experience.

title: Amazing fort
review: Favourite city in Rajasthan of what I visited.

title: regidence fort
review: i am visiting golden fort this is a very big and large and regidency fort nice view of city and tourist monoment i like it

title: Huge fort with variety of options
review: If go to Jaisalmer, you can see this fort from every corner of the city. And 90% of the restaurants are rooftop, just because of the view of this fort. This is so big that there are 4-5 hotels inside it and a number of restaurants. Also around 4k people live inside this.

title: Amazing visit
review: Just loved this Unesco site!  Inside the walls of this Fort around 4.000 inhabitants   Most of them live in houses "havelli" which have been inherited from their families over the decades   If you enjoy visiting "havellis", Jaisalmer is the place to go

title: The best of the Rajasthan Forts
review: Although less grand than Jodhpur and Jaipur the Jaisalmer fort, with its soft warm sandstone, and powerful ramparts, is charming and impressive, from within and when seen from the surrounding desert.

title: Hyped
review: I visited this place after visiting Amber fort in Jaipur and Mahranghar fort in Jodhpur. In comparison I found Jaisalmer fort to be fish market. It's just like a crowded mall. Unhygienic and stinky. These people ask RS 100 extra for camera. Security personal will harrass you in case they see you clicking pics from cell. Will ask you to give him RS 100 bribe to take you on tour as guide. I didn't like this experience.

title: Very beautiful fort
review: the jaisalmer fort was so beautiful and very clean i really like this fort only two fort in world there are people living"there are so many view point ‘sunsat and sunrise’..and also rani ka mahl and many tempal inside....

title: Jaisalmer fort.. Must visit place
review: Beautiful place.. People live in the fort and you can get room here at very reasonable price around Rs. 1000/- in the fort you can wander in the beautiful small streets with shops restornts tamples.  homes are part of fort and very sweet and  beautiful.

title: must go
review: This place is a must visit, very pretty fort with scenic views. Make sure to get a guide or audio guides to help understand the history of the place. The place is huge make sure you are able to walk. There is a pass for camera needed so get that.

title: Jaisalmer fort
review: Fort is quite good.

title: Beautiful, but beware of scam
review: As many places in India it is charmful but there are a lot of local trying to take advantage of tourist

title: Living fort.
review: It's the only fort where people live. There are homes and shops inside this huge fort.  The Jain temples are a must see. Do hire a guide to see this fort properly.

title: Fantastic Experience. Residential Fort !
review: It was great to observe residents and their lives in this fort. The palace, the city views, the bylanes, the Jain Temple, the markets all make for a wonderful Rajasthani experience.

title: Huge but very smelly
review: It's a huge fort with a lot of history attached to it. However, since there are people living inside and there are markets inside.

title: Nice fort, needs more maintenance
review: Its a nice fort with great city views from the top. The guides are nice and helpful, and provide you with ample opportunities to get good clicks.

title: Nostalgic fort
review: The city life within the fort makes the visit complicated. The expanding population and shops has robbed some beauty from this classic fort. But definitely this is an interesting destination. One must visit when the early rays of sun touches the yellow sandstone. Then it looks really like the golden fortress.

title: A place to see
review: It is advisable to must visit and with a guide. I think this is better than Jodhpur fort , which is full of historic details.

title: Declining state, but amazing
review: well this fort has its own charm unlike other forts in rajasthan. rampant establishments has caused problems related to drainage, surroundings, but it still has its own charm. the view from fort is out of this world. keep exploring , as there are parts which see very less tourist flow, you can wander in your thoughts in peace, sitting at vantage points.

title: One of the most beautiful forts in Rajasthan.
review: The fort is such a beauty. The kings and queens palace are different and unique in their own styles. The trip throughout the fort is very easy and doable by elders. Guide is not a must as fort, rooms and things inside with notes are self explanatory.

title: A living breathing Fort
review: It's quite amazing to wander this Fort in which people still live out their lives. The Jain temples are a bonus.

title: Living Fort
review: This is one of the living forts, where people stay inside the fort. Its huge and offers a good view of the city. Must Visit

title: 3rd gate on the left!
review: Having passed through Suman, Ganesh and Hawa P(h)Old or gates we enjoyed viewing the intricate facade of the fort.

title: Nice place with good view of jaisalmer city
review: Nice place with good view of jaisalmer city.

title: Sonar Qila!
review: Beautiful to look at from the outside but pretty filthy up close inside! The fort looks absolutely gorgeous in the night when it's lit up to emphasise it's yellow colour. The problem is it's probably the only fort in India that is still fully inhabited. That means narrow roads, noisy two wheeler traffic. cows and cow dung, overburdened sewage system that pretty much means a lot of filth! A living breathing fort isn't a great idea after all. Meanwhile, there were a few quaint things about the place. Each house had a Ganesha painting with dates commemorating the wedding dates in their family. Also even the new houses had some fantastic craftsmanship on their balcony jaalis which was reminiscent of the old fort balconies.

title: Extraordinary fantastic fort
review: Personally I like jaisalmer very much and about fort it has that same old fort feel as any other fort in rajasthan. There are some impressive architecture buildings inside the fort but be wary of the salesman.

title: Awesome
review: The only working fort in India that is inhabited by locals.

title: Only Fort in India with local residents and markets
review: One of the top most attractions in Jaisalmer located at the city center. Build with local yellow stone with triangular external walls, this Fort is the only fort in India with local residence and markets. While entering the Fort you can witness the massive gates which explains the history while walking on stones. Every corner of triangle within the fort has something to be seen including Jain temples which are hundreds of year old, Patwon ki Haveli, Maharaja Palace and a Big Bazaar to shop interesting stuff.

title: Sonar Kella......
review: awesome golden color fort, this is the first fort i have experienced where normal civilian can stay......amazing

title: Must Visit Fort of India
review: This is a great Fort of it's own kind where almost 70% of the area is full of hotels, restaurants and other businesses. From the top of the fort you will find the panoramic views of whole Jaisalmer city. It's the main attraction in Jaisalmer city. A must visit fort in India. The museum and the Rajputana Armoury is of great attraction. First time we could come to know that the rulers of Jaisalmer were from Lord Krishna families, i.e., from Yaduwansh. But the Fort Palace has full family tree of the Kings of Jaisalmer, showing evidence of the Lord Krishna Route.

title: living fort......
review: The only working fort in India that is inhabited by locals. The palace and temples are a must to do tour. The view is amazing from the palace top. Do take the audio guide.

title: Fort of Jaisalmer
review: The Jaisalmer fort is knonw for its miniatures,architecture and Bazzars.The fort is also called the Sonar Quila and is regarded as 'The Pride of Jaisalmer'.There are numerous wells inside the fort that are a regular source of water for residents of the fort.

title: Fort
review: It is a living fort where the public is residing within its premises.

title: Historic and Grand Fort with a bird's eye view from the top
review: The Fort visit will take between 1 and 1.5 hours. There are narrow passages to hop from one part to the other. All the portions accessible to visitors are very-museum like. Old weaponry, paintings and the history of the Rajputs and other rulers are engraved and decorated on the walls. From the top, one can view the whole Jaisalmer City which is not the big. For more and accurate historical facts one can hire a guide but personally I think that is not necessary as most of the information is written and documented well.

title: beautiful living fort
review: An interesting place teeming with people, shops, temples and intersesting views. Good shopping but bargains are found.

title: Go for a wander.
review: Hopefully you have left a enough time between camel treks to wander the streets of  Jaisalmer Fort. Small winding streets reward you with fantastic Haveli and chance meeting with locals keen to say hello and were do you come from.

title: Remnants of a past Heritage
review: Jaisalmer Fort or the Sonar Quila is a unique experience in itself, the last living fort of India. Current generations of earliest settlers still living inside this great fort, you see a wonderful mix of traditions mixed with modernity. So we sipped tea sitting right beside a great cannon while accessing free WiFi offered by the restaurant. Rajasthani colorful head gear selling right besides mobile covers in bazaar that seems to be everywhere inside the fort.

title: One of the Gem fort of Rajasthan
review: Jaisalmer fort is also known as Sonar Quilla and its one of the largest fort in the world with the living population of more than 5000. Fort has some great piece of architecture and carvings on the stone which shows the mastery of artist of that era and their expertise in stone carving. Fort has Jain Temple which is also a great tourist attraction which remains open until 3 pm and Vishnu temple which remain opens till 1 pm. Fort has many home stays, cafes, and viewpoints from where you would see the Jaisalmer city. if you are there around then don't miss the sunset.

title: Cuddly
review: It was wounderful learning experience for us. We 8 members visited fort, sam, safari camel and jeep. Stayed in swiss tent.

title: Awesome!!!
review: It is perhaps the only Living Fort in the world. It is colorful n vibrant!

title: Old and Gold
review: The fort was one of the few in India with a township within it. It is best to take a tour. There are some good eateries before you enter the first gate so don't miss those as there is not much within the walls. It is a nice visit for about an hour.

title: A mini town
review: Jaisalmer fort is located on the top of Trikura hill, which is a small hill, in the center of Jaisamler town.  Made is golden sandstone, this fort is still inhabited by people.  The fort has houses, temples, bazaar, shops etc. From the top of the fort, the view of Jaisamler town and distant sand dunes is wonderful.

title: Awesome
review: Live Fort, I like it very much...

title: Most exciting living fort!
review: Jaisalmer fort was one of the most interesting experience! After the tour of the main palace building with an audio guide we went to explore the many streets and markets of this living fort. It is dotted with small temples, cafes, stores & beautifully decorated houses of locals! A day well spent overall.

title: Holiday Visit
review: interesting fort. had a good guide. lots of interesting places to see within the living fort. beautiful temples especially the jain temples.

title: Disappointed
review: This fort was more like a market. Could be skipped. Just another fort. Nothing special. Instead visit patwon ki haveli

title: One time visit
review: Entry to the fort requires a ticket. Items and photographs on display would take u back to the 1900s. The fort is similar to any other found in Rajasthan.

title: Remnant of a glorious past
review: Three to four thousand people, apparently descendants of the raja of Jaisalmer now have made the fort their permanent residence. The walls are decorated with the colorful laundry drying in the sun & slopes below are littered with garbage thrown down while sewage pipes run down the slopes. Cows are all over feeding on whatever they can. Two wheelers zip past you honking incessantly inside the fort while you try to get a grasp on the history of the place. I can go on but I don't want to...

title: A walk down the royal lanes
review: Get the feeling of walking down the royal lanes with little shops and locals. View from top is very vast and you could see the hustle bustle of city.

title: Visit
review: Interesting , museum you can skip

title: Ancient fort
review: A beautiful architecture sample. Rich in culture. Lavish life style. The fort is co maple telly taken over by localities. Very difficult to drive.

title: Old and heritage fort
review: its good to see the king and queen palace , i was wondering how well maintained it is . the cost inr 100 rupee per person and thats fine too

title: monumental treaty
review: it cherishes the memories of old times of India...this monument  have many things to explore and we need more time to handle that

title: Awesome
review: Tres belle...you have to see it to believe it people are friendly and helpful too. Food is different and tasty. The whole ambience is worth the trip. You bring back fondest memories.

title: Jaisalmer fort
review: Very nice fort it is first  fort in India where  people  live in side  and this fort is known  as golden fort.

title: Sonar Kella.. a walk back in time
review: Pretty much exited to visit the fort which is famous today because of Satyajit Ray. Loved the entire place.

title: Very cool!
review: Fascinating old fort located in the centre of Jaisalmer! This was one of my favourite places to visit in India.

title: Nice fort
review: It is one of the Important attractions to visit in Jaisalmer and should not be missed .. try to engage a guide who may be available for Rs400-500/- for visit to the fort  and haveli , as you can get lot of insights about the fort and their royal families . Pay for a camera ticket as there are many good spots and views which you would like to get clicked , during the visit

title: Amazing to see the only living fort.
review: The Jain Mandir inside is a must see. An exhilarating experience to see such grandeur. The view of the city from the fort is breathtaking. The narrow pathways are crowded with vehicular traffic. Far too many guides pester the tourists.  No 1 site to see in Jaisalmer.

title: Sonar Killa
review: Good for one day excursion. Jain temple is must visit in the fort.
