title: A great day in the Fort.
review: A fascinating place, full of adventure, shops, temples, cows, visitors, locals, excitement and enjoyment.

title: Royality..!!
review: Jaisalmer Fort is one of the largest fully preserved fortified cities in the world. It is situated in the city of Jaisalmer, in the Indian state of Rajasthan. It is a World Heritage Site. It was built in 1156 AD by the Rajput ruler Rawal Jaisal, from whom it derives its name. The fort stands amidst the sandy expanse of the great Thar Desert, on Trikuta Hill

title: Amazing visit to the Fort
review: This fort is the one of those forts In which common people still live. The yellow stone carvings throughout the palace is stunning. Must visit.

title: The living fort
review: The beauty of this fort is that it is inhabited and lively. You walk around a walled city with all its vibrant colors, activities, tourists and local people. Not to be missed.

title: Nice hotel
review: I enjoyed my time and have seen many things. The owner is helpful and they have good food. I liked the view of the city on the rooftop. We also used the kitchen and cooked our own meals. It's a family business and I felt comfortable. Rooms are clean and calm. The prices are good and we had an amazing trip in the desert. All in all I had a nice time.

title: Nice place
review: Nice place for monument lovers.its nice to have Rajasthan flavours of monarchy. Family trip can be done.

title: Amazing Place
review: Its very amazing place to see the architecture of rajasthani culture. All street markets are good enough for purchasing.

title: Good
review: Good fort but in side very dirty

title: Paradise Lost
review: Sonar Kella we always wanted to visit after watching the famous Roy movie. But was really dissapointed at its current state of affairs. Heard from our guide that 5000 people live in the premise ...it shows in its depleted state. Needs immediate cleanup and maintenance. The Jain Temple was very impressive ... so were the decors on haveli walls.

title: Nice place and must see when in Jaisalmer
review: There are actually people living in the ford, which makes it different from others fords I have visited. The views are great, and it is a nice place to do some shopping. The prices are very cheap and if you are interested, they offer special lassie!

title: Immense and beautiful living fortress
review: The old Fort rises out of the Thar desert in glowing yellow sandstone. A mix of massive fortifications and beautiful carvings it deserves it's world heritage status. Great just to walk around and soak up the atmosphere but don't miss the Maharawal Palace and the exquisite Jan Temples. Loads of shops in the fort - friendly in their efforts to attract the buyers.

title: A must see
review: The least engaging if the three northern Indian forts I visited (Jodpur, Jaisalmer and Jaipur). Give the audio your a miss and just have a walk through, lots of construction and mess.

title: Sonar Kila the Golden Fort
review: A Fort which shines in golden colour due to its stones.

title: too much to walk
review: Its good but too much to walk and its like other palace, if you have time then must visit, Jaisalmer did not have much to offer

title: Visi myself/ notneed AGuide
review: You don't need any tourist guide if you have the basic knowledge about the Jaisalmer fort history.

title: must visit.
review: best fort . it is very beautiful . we loved it. 6600 jain god statues and few temples. museum. and lot of shopping options on top.

title: Golden fort
review: A beautiful Fort situated on the highest peak of city. Beautiful architecture and the only fort where you can still watch people living there and can enjoy market in it.

title: Visit after sunset!
review: We went there on our first evening in Jaisalmer and opted for a guide to take us around the fort area. It's less crowded and you can spend more time around the place. We walked up to the canon to get a view of the city with its twinkling lights!

title: Good
review: Nice place to visit ...wonderful historical monument. Beautiful jain temle..guide was well mannered and explain about building in detail

title: Great Place and well maintained
review: Second time i have been there. Unique blend of historic fort and community life as people still live inside the fort

title: It's alright
review: It has that same old fort feel as any other fort in rajhastan. There are some impressive architectural buildings inside the fort but be wary of the salesman. Whatever any salesman in India tells you, usually they multiplied the price by 3. Which means you should do math and divide by 3. There is a nice Jane temple there, but I didn't bother to go inside. Just took pictures of that temple from the outside. As always I recommend shoes you don't like, for there are a lot of animal droppings in this fort. Besides that, the view is great for an aerial view of the city. If you get a guide the lowest you should go is 600 rupees, be nice for they will take you around the city and fort.

title: Extraordinary, fantastical fort
review: I really like Jaisalmer. We stayed inside the fort which given our lack of tolerance for cold and noise, was possibly an error. It is a town that relies on tourism, so expect more hassle (mostly good natured) than in some other cities in Rajasthan. The Fort is extraordinary and you can explore the ramparts on your own. We did not visit the palace having been advised that if you had already seen other palaces in Rajasthan, it wasn't worth the time or money. The streets inside the fort are full of house, shops and restaurants and a couple of Jain temples. There is a newer town outside the fort which is easily navigable on foot.

title: Good
review: Jaisalmer fort is a must visit if you are visiting Jaisalmer.

title: Golden fort
review: I came to Jaisalmer with my friends the fort was so nice and stone of Jaisalmer is gold and sand stone is good architecture is so nice

title: Fort with a market.
review: Decent place but it is commercialised into a market place. Doesn't feel like a fort.

title: Living history
review: It is a rare thing to feel such an ancient, historical, place alive with the pulse of living people today. The warmth of the yellow stone reflects the warmth of the people trading in the narrow streets.  Activities that have been carried out for the best part of a millennium. Unfortunately we were unable to go into the city palace for the most modern of reasons. Mr Modi has carried out his war on cash without sufficiently preparing his country for it. There was no cash in any ATM in town and extraordinarily the museum, a government run institution, did not take credit or debit cards. A less than heroic own goal. Walking around the fort itself is a joy and the Jain temple well worth visiting. The new fangulation of motor bikes rushing and hooting everywhere is a bore but there are good restaurants to escape to. A wonderful place.

title: So lively Fort - you can just get lost there...
review: It was rightly titled “Sonar Killa” (Golden Fort) and was opened to the world when people in thousands from all over the world started coming to visit this  and it is continuing every day.  The fort is so lively that you would love to be lost in the small allies where most of the population live.  It gives you the opportunity to see from very close angle the traditional Rajasthani day to day cores.  The allies are so narrow that you brush yourself with other visitors and the local population.  No entry fee and you can enter the fort any time.  Besides a small museum (entry fee required + camera fee), there is a small Jain Temple whose inner architectural marvels are worth to see.  The whole fort area can be covered on foot; I must confirm that you will not get tired like any other fort in India.  There are several colorful shops of Rajasthani dresses, handicrafts, leather goods and souvenirs all along .  Everyday, it is like a fare there.  There are several view points on the top of the fort wall where you can see an old canon.  These are the places to have a nice view of whole Jaisalmer town.  The best time is early morning in order to view the excellent sun rise from there.  If you want to see only one fort in India, this is the place to be.

title: Stunning
review: The best part of this fort is getting lost and walking around all the little winding lanes. It is also worth while to walk around the outside along the ramparts. Very few other tourists seem to take the time to do this.

title: Nice Historical Monument
review: The fort is beautiful with great historical importance. There are some really interesting spots to visit inside the fort. Also you get a very good view of the whole city. The Jain temple is also very beautiful. Must visit if you are in Jaisalmer.

title: Very good view of place
review: I came to jaisalmer the fort was so nice and stone of jaisalmer is gold and Sand stone is good for carving and architect so nice

title: Beautiful fort
review: The fort itself is amazing & breathtaking. However i disliked the noise and the traffic inside the fort. The shopkeepers inside the fort are mostly very pushy.

title: Fort with some history. its really gold colour when sun rise in morning.
review: Fort with some history. its really gold colour when sun rise in morning. lot of people are staying inside fort, which is really spoiling it and its heritage.

title: Over Crowded and mismanaged Fort
review: Though it looks quite charming at night from outside, but when we visited in the morning, its was pathetic; too many autos plying with noise and smoke and too many people. Garbage was lying around freely outside the main wall of the fort.

title: Historical surprises!
review: Did you know that the present raja is descendant of Lord krishna? Not only the fort is so beautiful, it is full of surprises. The entire clan of descendants of warriors and priests still live in sudeep the fort area. Rich in culture and history a must visit.

title: Nice fort with some cool shops
review: The first isn't too big but it's a nice walk and there are some nice shops around. The temple is quite small and not much too see there.

title: Get that scenic view of Jaisalmer
review: You should visit in the morning as there will be less people and less sunshine. There is a museum here with articles of Maharajas.

title: Mind blowing
review: This palace is awesome. Provides heritage of our india. This type of place make feel proud to we indians. Nice place must visit.

title: Mirage
review: On first sight, the fort seems to emerge out of the Thar desert in the middle of nowhere, a must visit for all.

title: One of the most beautiful fort!
review: The golden dazzling fort you gaze in awe! It is unique, majestic, mind-blowing. I can just sit staring at it all day! As the sunlight melts on the golden stone, it glows with more royalty. I can write much more, but you can't relate till you have a look for yourself...Go visit Jaisalmer!

title: Dirty!
review: There is nothing much to see here...no need to waste time! People stay here and its dirty! Jodhpur fort (Mehergarh) is better..there are two Jain temples which are worth seeing if you go there

title: Too large fort but nothing much to see Inside!
review: The fort covers almost 20 - 30% of city, its a huge fort and very old too (built in 11th century) ! Kings & Queens palace is worth watching inside the fort! Its free of cost! Many temples are there for ones divine satisfaction.  Many local shops are there which offers local specialties. Lots of cafe and hotels are situated inside the fort for peoples hunger. View from top of fort is too Worthy!

title: Sonar Killa , A historical Place of Bhati Rajputs
review: It is one of the attraction point of jaisalmer where one can see the history and fort and havelis of pre-independent india prior to moghul capture and architecture purity of Hind-Shilp Kalla , which is rare and unique.

title: Winter trip n brief of fort
review: Jaiselmer fort is second oldest and largest fort of india.its 850 yrs old( 1150 AD).20℅ rajput n 60℅ bhramin still stays at fort premises.ticket100 rs/ prsn 100rs camera charges.small area open for tourist.Maharaj Brijraj stays in his new palace he is 43 yuwraj of maharaj jethsingh.local artist spread in area.satellite view of mahal beautifully textured on stone ... picture added.work on stone is amazing one can't differentiate from carving at wooden.one can view large baran land from fort.in 1975 train, mode of travel introduced.its last station of Western railway.feel the feel of rajwada ...visit city

title: place to visit
review: clean place

title: Jaisalmer fort
review: Amazing fort steeped in history with people still living inside. Incredible temples and excellent shops selling luxury goods at Indian prices

title: Beautiful place
review: Its a nice place to visit but with young children you might get annoyed because you need to walk alot. Overall its a nice tourist attraction.

title: Beautiful Fort!
review: This architecturally stunning fort has numerous shops on several of the very narrow streets.  No cars or auto-rickshaws are allowed on the tiny streets, but there are plenty of motorcycles zooming around, so be careful!  (They'll let you know they're coming by honking...too often!)   It's nice to wind through the streets and look at the beautiful Indo-Islamic architecture of the fort.  The Jain Temple is exquisite and worth a visit.

title: An architectural treat
review: Beautiful piece of architecture made famous by Satyajit Ray's Feluda series - Sonar Kella. Only fort that still is the residence of many people.

title: One the best preserved forts in India
review: Amazing place. Well preserved fort in Rajasthan. One of the best in India. Nice sunset. View over city amazing

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: A magnificent structure rising out of the Go,den soil , visible much before you reach the town! Its a living entity, inhabited by generations of royal  family office bearers etc. Today it is a fortone of a kind, that has inhabitants running all kinds of restaurants inside, offering many traditional and international cuisines, its rich in history, heritage, and vibrant with lical flavours.I enjoy the walk on the cobbled stone streets, the old world charm, quaint antique shops, delicious french, greek, Italian Cuisines. The color of the stone is Golden Yelliw, glowing to gloryalways, a must visit for all roads lead to the fort.

title: Yet another rajput fort
review: Nothing spectacular about this fort if you have visited others in Rajasthan but still worth a look. Part of the fort is still used by families of descedents of the preists and soldiers of the Jaisalmer kings.

title: Best Fort in India
review: WOW !!! This is a must see place in Jaisalmer. It would have to be the best Fort in India. A living fort with people still working and living in it. A fantastic place to see by day but even better to see by night when you get a sense of what it must have been like to live there a thousand years ago. An awesome view from the top and a bustling market below to keep you busy.

title: Must visit
review: Picturesque landscapes can be captured from Palace. A palace tour with local guide is fun. Many places to be visited in palace. Best time to visit is afternoon as you get best views of city from palace top also sunset.

title: Very ordinary ...
review: Not so good to be a typical fort visit as the fort is residence to many citizens.

title: Amazing Jaisalmer
review: Very beautiful live Palace where people still lives in fort, Kudos.

title: Beautiful fort and wonderful views of Jaisalmer!
review: Highly busy in the peak season so go early to avoid crowds.  You will be bombarded by locals offering their "tour guide" services.  If you want a guided tour, best to book through your hotel to ensure they are a government certified tour guide.   Leave time to explore the many shops and neighborhoods within the walls of the fort and bargain heavily with these vendors!

title: Golden City Jaisalmer Average Fort😷
review: I am sorry to say but this is Fact that as Rajasthani, in my knowledge this is Poorest Fort I ever seen.. Why?

title: Heritage
review: Too crowded - marketplace like chaos. Choose guide correctly, the stores inside are highly priced & recommended to be avoided

title: Grandiose yet small, liked the place though
review: The Jaisalmer Fort, sits on top of a hillock, hence is an ubiquitous sight from any rooftop of the Jaisalmer dwelling. Interestingly this is a "Living fort", for there is a colony of about 4000 people living there, mostly Brahmins as I understand from the Tour guide we engaged, who happened to be a resident there himself. Since it is a living fort, the places to go around are minimal like the museum and the view points (Canon points) from where one can enjoy the vast view expanse of the monochromatic "Golden city". Being a living fort, needless to say, there are restaurants, lodges and hotel along the walls of the fort offering rooms / tables with views. The shopping area is filled with hand made garments, wall hangings, handicrafts. Anybody visiting this place will find it difficult to resist a purchase of any of these items, at least for a souvenir. Overall, it was a feel good experience.

title: Shonar Kella
review: This is the fort used by Shatyajit Roy in his movie Shonar Kella, which carries a lot of value to me.

title: Another of Rajasthan's grand Forts
review: First : Its a living fort. People actually live within the boundaries so its crowded. But that shouldnt deter you. Get a guide at the Fort ticket window and NO one else and go visit. Its a fantastic experience. BE CAREFUL on the purchases of various items. Dont be misguided by the guide. Enter a couple of shops, bargain and then buy. All of them will claim theirs is genuine and has magical properties. Non sense. Just trust your instinct and AVOID the shops outside the fort - some of them claim to be government owned, which is not true.

title: Breathtaking view from top/ poorly maintained fort
review: Jaisalmer Fort is one of the largest fully preserved fortified cities in the world. The fort's massive yellow sandstone walls are a tawny lion colour during the day, fading to honey-gold as the sun sets, thereby camouflaging the fort in the yellow desert. This is the very reason this fort was the centerpiece for the esteemed writer, Satyajit Ray's novel "Shonaar Kella" (The Golden Fortress).

title: Spectacular views and quite a maze
review: I enjoyed touring around Jaisalmer Fort but it's quite the maze.  This added to the charm as you never knew what's around the corner. It took me a while to find the exit.

title: Ancient monuments
review: I just only very good place for travel but also provide some in good amount tourism facility whether is it very good

title: Amazing living fort that gives a glimpse of the originality
review: Jaisalmer fort or " Swarn Mahel" is the only living fort in the world. The fort has separate rooms of king Queen and their kids along with houses of those who worked in kings palace, army, cabinet, priests and many others. Every one used to live in the fort. Again the carving in the fort is just awesome. The fort has many Jain Temples and they are really centuries old and still the carving and the statues are just superbly done.

title: JAimsalmer fort- must stay
review: Impressed by the guesthouse’s location – right at the heart of the fort – and interiors. happy to stay at fort which has a very pleasant view from our window.

title: A true exercise in frustration management
review: The fort and palace are without a doubt spectacular as are most sites in India.  We were in awe walking through these places.  The photo opportunities are endless.  However... it is completely congested with Indian tourists.  Fair enough, this is their country and they love these sites as much as anyone.  But there is a serious lack of courtesy that will run you over every chance it gets.. you will be pushed and jostled.. you will have people cast you aside to gain access to an area before you do.. you will have people walk into your photographic moment over and over... you will be inundated with the raucous chaos of talking, yelling and screaming the entire time.  The 500 rupee fee includes an audio tour which I wish the locals would take advantage of.. but they don't .. at all.. so you are left trying to hear your audio tour above the unreal volume of noise around you.  It is not a peaceful place.  By the end we were fast forwarding chapters just to escape the madness.  Sadly disappointing time here..  I lack patience yes.. maybe for you this will not be a problem.  The fort is spectacular.

title: The Golden Fortress
review: our interest in the golden fortress was initiated by Satyajit Ray's film. The fort was extremely beautiful but a bit crowded and polluted

title: SHONAR KELLA
review: My greatest interest in visiting this fort was Satyajit Ray's film. I had been told that it is disappointing to go into a fort and find that it is filled with shops and residents and rightly so. It was impossible to climb 120 steps to look at the kings palace so i gave it a miss and took a look around the Jain temple. Helped by my young guide I managed to scramble to the top to take a look at the breathtaking view of the GOLDEN CITY. Nostalgia hit when I saw "Mukuler Bari" shot in film Shonar Kella by Satyajit Ray. Unfortunately in spite of the sense of gratitude that the locals have for the Director the place is near broken.

title: Royal fort
review: Jaisalmer Fort one of the main attractions and cultural heritage. Lot of stone carvings that are worth watching and Jain temples going back to 1300 and 1500. Do visit

title: A wonderful construction!
review: Jaisalmer Fort is one of the few forts that still has people living in it.  The construction is mind-blowing, tall walls, huge doorways.  There are several Jain temples within the fort, we visited one of them.  The intricate designs and architecture is truly a piece of marvel.

title: Just a simple Fort nothing special
review: If you have visited the forts in Agra, Delhi and Jaipur you will feel this one has nothing special and it is a little bit disappointing. Ok, people still lives inside it and that's a plus, but there isn't much to see.

title: Very beautiful and amazing piece of engineering
review: The best part of the fort is that no cement or water is used to built this fort as there was scarcity of water in the region. All blocks have grooves and they fit very well. Moreover, it was an entry to India in ancient times so multiple cultures are reflected in this fort. Truly remarkable!!!

title: Sonar Quilla
review: One of the best inhabited forts to see in India.Good panoramic view of the City.The Raja Mahal, Rani Mahal all are well maintained. The Jain temple is worth a visit. Better to have a guide along with you. Only issue is the vehicular movement and one has to be careful while roaming inside.

title: Nostalgic Feeling - A Great Place to Visit
review: Brought back memories of Satyajit Ray's Sonar Kella. Visited with family.. A great tour around the fort.

title: Golden Fort
review: Jaisalmer Fort in my opinion is a bit over rated. It's a living fort i.e. there are some 5000 people who actively live within the boundary walls of fort, and this might be the reason why it's not highly recommended. It's a small fort with tourist section further small and you are surrounded by all kind of touts posing as 'Guide'. There are vehicle inside (and they honk at tourist walking) and place can do with some good level of cleaning (Swach Bharat Abhiyan seems to not have reached here).

title: Waste of time!!
review: Filthy streets inside the so called fort.

title: View of palace
review: Its average.. Desert safari is very good....The guides around the palace can help you with great deal of information

title: Worth one visit
review: It has some exquisite kaarigari inside but you definitely need to take a guide with a bike to show you the insides. Has some cheap hotels inside to experience life in a fortress.

title: Amazing experience of Golden City
review: This is the first and last living fort in India. If you are in Jaisalmer then you should have to visit this palace to know about royal life and history and dont go without a guide. Its made of different kind of stone which glow like gold because of sun light reflection.

title: Excessively crowded
review: Visted the fort durig our stay in Jaiselmer. Compared to other forts in Rajasthan, the difference is that about 3000 people stay within this fort and have converted their homes into hotels and restaurants. It was excessively crowded though. Has a jain temple inside the fort which is worth seeing.

title: One time visit
review: While going to the fort the streets were really filthy , but if you are visiting Jaisalmer one time visit is moire than enough

title: Nice place
review: Nice place in  jaslmear ...my first time journey , nice fort and all public place are good enjoyed with my friend

title: A must Visit
review: Worth visiting. The complete city is visible from the fort walls. And the golden hues in the evening lend an enhanting air to the fort.

title: Average
review: Not good as the people living inside like crowded market.Motorcycle/Autorikshaw/Fast food trollies and congested place.

title: Much hyped about place. Not worth much
review: Jaisalmer fort is said to among the largest fort in the country but it is not just maintained much. The shopkeepers sell the stuff at much higher prices. The entry to the fort is at Rs.500 p.h but of not that worth at all. The fort area is neither well maintained nor kept clean though so many tourists visit this place. Huge disappointment.

title: One of the best Forts in India
review: Must Visit in Rajasthan! Do not miss the Camel Safari and at least an overnight stay in Desert. Jaisalmer is one of the best historic places in India one must visit.

title: Great place
review: Spend a few hours at the Fort and shops.  We had a wonderful day walking in and around the Fort. Loved the city !

title: mesmerizing
review: sheer beauty of the "karigiri' done ages ago, stood the test of time.. the place inhabitated by royals of Jaisalmer since ages... Treat to your eyes, especially if you r history buff

title: Outside view is nice but there is not much to see inside the fort
review: View of the fort from outside is good, but there is nothing much to see in d fort. View of the city from fort is amazing. Many shops are there so u do not get that feel of the fort.

title: Must visit for a life time experience of a living fort
review: Rare fort where people live. Whole experience was as if we were staying in the fort and part of its life.

title: Main attraction of jaisalmer
review: A beautiful and wide spread fort. The only type which is still inhabited by some couple of thousands people. It's lively, wide, and beautiful. A must visit in jaisalmer.

title: Beautiful! A living city inside the fort!
review: It was amazing to see a whole city living inside a fort, had never imagined that before! There are people owning houses and havelis and living there for generations.

title: Living fort...beautiful outside!
review: Bikes all around...noise...pollution...crowd...stalls...takes away the beauty of this heritage site. This is all inside the fort and all over. Not for people who would want to enjoy the silence of history.

title: A Must visit
review: This a must do if you are in the city, the history and overall intricate architecture makes this place stand out from the other forts I have been to previously.

title: Nothing much to see
review: I was kinda disappointed after watching the fort. The roof top view was bit OK. But the entry compound was all messed up. Patwon ki haveli is much better option to see if you want to visit either of two. There are some good restaurants with a good view of the Fort. Yes, the outside view of the Fort is worth watching. There is a Germen bakery inside which has good pancakes and cookies, though.

title: Beautiful Fort with brilliant architecture
review: It is one of the few living forts. It was amazing to see all the architecture and beautiful alleys. Take a tour guide with you who can explain everything.

title: Excellent Fort and Jain Temples - Its a rare "Living Fort"
review: Engage a guide to help explain the intricacies as well as to guide you through the alleys. This is a Living Fort i.e people live inside the Fort as the ruler apparently gifted the properties to the people living there at the time of Independence. The Jain temple complex is excellent and the view from the vantage points is also great.

title: Great experience
review: It's a historical place.. Rajasthan fort are famous in world .. wonderful architecture .. awesome and Rajasthani famous ford has made by the king .. one the famous fort is this one jaisalmer fort

title: Nice Place 👌
review: I liked the view from the cannon point and it's an out of the box place.. Crazy. Fun. Authentic. Lovely.

title: An amazing fort being desecrated by irresponsible inhabitants and ignorant govt..
review: To every bengali this place is cult.. the immortal film made by Satyajit ray is the chief reason  bengalis throng here..

title: Jaisalmer tour
review: Worth seeing.the entire town is also of same yellow colour giving a golden look.

title: Beautiful heritage property, completely commercialized
review: Beautiful place but heavily crowded place , ill maintained and surrounded by innumerable budget hotels.

title: Not much to see
review: It looks impressive from outside but there is not much to see. There are people staying in the fort. It has not been maintained well. Jain temples inside the fort are nice.

title: Living fort
review: Main reason to come to this town. Seeing people living and working inside was unique. Take a tour guide to navigate the alleys to visit shops and temples. Good views of the surroundings from the top. Try to stay in one of the hotels inside the fort for a unique experience.

title: Golden Fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is a must visit place in Jaisalmer.

title: A very good attraction but would have been better if kept more cleaner
review: This is the famous Jaisalmer Fort or Sonar Kella. From a distance this fort looks majestic but when you get into it is not all all clean. The main reason being people living in the fort. Perhaps this is the only fort in India where people reside inside it. It would be good if you take a guide to visit the fort but beware do take guides who have proper identity cards. It will take about 2 hrs time to complete visiting all the important places.

title: Must Visit
review: Jaiselmer fort is very easy to climb and u get a good view of the city from top. Fort is well maintained with guards located at vital points.

title: What a Mess inside the fort.
review: This property is not at all maintained, you have local people staying inside the fort, restaurants and shops, you have bulls roaming around and then huge crowd of tourist. There is a jain temple to visit and then some part of the fort is kept for tourist purpose like the Maharaja Mahal (too over crowded). There are handicrafts shops inside the fort but then they are highly over priced. Can be visited for few minutes, but nothing special inside the fort its all mess crowded and dirty.

title: Lived in Fort full of alleyways to explore
review: This ancient Fort which is still lived in is an amazing place to explore. A must see while in Jaisalmer. Watch out for the numerous Hindu wedding invitations adoring the outside walls of locals. The Jain Temples off the main square are also a must see.

title: Majestic but cluttered
review: As a fort goes - majestic.

title: The oldest living palace in the world
review: This fort defines Jaisalmer. Its grand, its golden and its living... with more than 5000 people living, dwelling inside the fort - its like gling back 800 years back in time..

title: Good to visit in Jaisalmer
review: Once you enter the Jaisalmer fort it's a feeling like none other. It's like visiting a village inside a fort! My wife talked to some women in their homes asking if they are inconvenienced by living inside a fort! The reply was they are now used to it... :) And with all smiles!

title: Excellent
review: Highlight of the town. We were very lucky to stay overnight in the fort. Expect lots of tourists as it very popular. Many restaurants tho choose from. Loved the architecture, narrow streets and atmosphere. Highly recommended

title: Beautiful & Interesting
review: This is an occupied place and has been since 1156, so people complaining about the residents "spoiling" the fort are asking it to be something that it really is not and never has been. We were on a half day tour with a guide supplied by the hotel.  The fort is impressive and has a lot crammed inside.  The king's/queen's residence is definitely worth the admission and the audio tour is free and also very well done (and I'm not a fan of audio tours).  Unfortunately our guide did not take us to the Jain Temples, which I really wanted to see, telling us that the Havelis outside the fort were what we really wanted to see. We also were pushed to shop for textiles and silver, neither of which we were interested in buying, and of course we were led to the shops for which I'm sure the guide would have received a commission had we bought anything. I guess my point is  to make very sure, if you work with a guide, to make sure you work out in advance that you're getting to see what you want to see and not what the guide feels like showing you.

title: Good fort
review: Its only living fort in world. you can stay n eat there. beautifully made good atmosphere. people are friendly

title: Beautiful fort and Jain temples inside the fort
review: Beautiful fort where more than 3000 people live inside this. Loved the view point were we can see whole city and Jain temples inside the fort are beautifully constructed. Don't miss to visit this place!

title: Fort with grand history . . . but needs maintenance.
review: Only residential fort I have seen with more than 3000 people living here. We can see lot of artwork along with historical temples. Negotiate with a guide so that he can show you the important places, otherwise its too huge to be covered.

title: A Beautiful Place with no SYSTEM!
review: A sight to behold from afar which gets completely menacing when there with the throngs of people and no system. The inside was a mess with huge human traffic and the piercing blaring of motorcycle horns squeezing through the crowd. They place was not maintained well and touters were to be found at every corner. My suggestion would be to enjoy it from afar or only head there during off-peak times.

title: a good place to visit.
review: A good place to visit and shopping for the cultural artifacts and for city view.

title: Jaisalmeer
review: U can see the jaisalmeer fort which is known as Sonar Kella in bengali by walking from hotel Surja

title: Nice one
review: A very big fort ..

title: One of the main attrection of Jaisalmer
review: The fort is in the hear of the city made with Yellow stone. 80% of city can be viewed from the fort. Night view of fort is awesome. City has pleasant weather during December month. So don't carry too much warm clothes with you like we did :)

title: Spoilt by over commercialisation!!!
review: This fort is highlighted as being a "living fort" as it is still home to a large number of people and businesses which is really its downfall.

title: A knowledgeable guide is worth it ...
review: We asked our driver to get us a known guide. Mr Jai singh was soft spoken and knowledgeable about the history of the fort.

title: Stunning Gold coloured fort
review: We spent a few hours checking out this fabulous fort positioned, as usual, high on a hill.

title: Historic and bustling fort, required stop in Jaisalmer
review: If you come to Jaisalmer, you have to see its main fort.  Rajasthan has many unique forts, this one because there are stores, hotels, crowds, hawkers, motorcycles and cows all inside the fort walls. IMO not as impressive architecturally or structurally as Mehrangarh fort in Jodhpur, but its that bustling activity that makes the experience different.  The center has a museum, guards there were pretty rude / aggressive (got on my case for snapping photos with my cell phone and wanted to see a camera permit.  seriously? for a cell phone?).  The golden hues of the sandstone in the fort and city views  was pretty awesome, worth it just for that.

title: Amazing
review: The living fort was my first such experience and it was awesome to visit such place. Unlike other fort you are free to go anywhere and explore the place fully.

title: Yummy food and lovely people
review: A living fort offering exciting stories and equally fantastic food. Don forget to visit the Jain temples. Their exquisite architecture and designs are jaw dropping

title: Jaisalmer fort
review: This is the only fort where public live inside the fort. You should take a guide but bargain good. Nothing much to see inside.

title: A Living Fort which embraces you in time
review: Rising from the plains of the Thar Desert, like a golden mirage, Jaiselmer with it's commanding fort is truly awesome.  The Fort is still occupied and lived in and one can stroll through history.

title: Majestic fort on the hill
review: A must visit in jaisalmer with this mighty fortress.

title: Sonar Quila
review: Beautiful 850 years old Sonar Quila/ fort built of yellow stone has excellent carvings and provides wonderful views. It's living fort with temples and people living in the narrow and charming lanes.

title: Majestic Fort
review: Built in 1156 AD by the Rajput ruler Rawal Jaisal. Famous for the Satyajit Ray film sonar quila. Enjoy the walk of the city inside the palace

title: Best Fort of The World . THE SONAR FORT.
review: It was built on a Trikut Parwat (Triangle Hill) Name Meru . This is the only one Living Fort of The World.

title: Amazing place
review: Amazing mind blowing, grand place to visit in jaisalmer. Specially the panoramic view at night from top of this palace. Must go at night time..

title: Amazing fort!
review: Don't miss this living fort, like all the forts in Rajasthan it is full of history and of course the views are wonderful

title: Far below expectations.
review: Completely taken over by the locals this fort looks like a shopping street.If you are searching for local artworks/handicrafts this is the place.No historical structures are to be found here.

title: Must visit
review: Excellent place to visit. Take a tour guide to get a good detailed visit of the place.

title: The living fort of Rajasthan
review: Jaisalmer's Sonar Fort is the only living fort in Rajasthan. Most of the fort is inhabited and only the King's and the Queen's palaces are open for the tourists. The fort has a unique construction by making use of an interlocking system in the yellow stone. The fort tells the stories of the various generations and provides a great view of the complete city from the top.

title: Grand Fort!!
review: The fort is huge, very typical of rajasthani forts, does make you wonder... how on earth did the ancients built these things :D

title: Very good place
review: Fantastic fort. Very historical place. It has its own charm. But fort is not maintain well. Lots of local residents are staying in the fort premises which is spoiling the historic view. Jain temple in Fort is surprising. Love the place

title: Very nice place
review: We visited here in Dec 2015... Good place in middle of the city... Nice architecture and old beautiful havelis around... Area around fort offers good & reasonably priced shopping... Just look for small local shops...

title: Dream come True
review: Impressive, sturdy fort standing dramatically on a mound amid barren landscape and everything is made of yellow sandstone which dazzles like gold all around in sunshine. Thousands living inside and cacophony of traffic, cattles, shopkeepers, guides and tourists make the bazaars a lively cheerful place as one climb along the cobbled stone gradient. Havelis, temples inside sport intricate artworks all around. The King and Queens palace is now a museum.Its serpentine alleys reminds me the medieval charm that one can get in Varanasi and Puri.

title: Not at all clean
review: I visited in late decembers.  So it was season time and it was very much crowded and dirty. I would  recommend  to alteast keep the place clean.

title: Lived in fort
review: Interesting to walk around - very crowded during the day - but was nicer in the evening. Lots of shops and restaurants. Only problem is the number of motorcycles entering the fort - can be quite dangerous for visitors.

title: The Sonar Kila
review: A living fort - which means people are living and carrying out their lives inside the fort!

title: Live fort
review: One of the best thing about this fort is that it's a fort where normal people are still living. It's one of its kind fort. I have been to many forts but haven't seen any fort where people are still living and considering it as their own rather than government taking control. It has many great cafes and restaurants. One can spend and entire day in this and still feel that there is lot to be seen.

title: Rajasthan's Jewel
review: This spectacular site is one of the oldest living forts in the world.  As you enter the gates you will be blown away by it's magnitude and presence.  Take your time and wander through the streets and Havelis and don't miss the Jain Temples but make sure you do this site with a local guide.

title: Good place to visit in the evening
review: The fort is very interesting. The place is not very clean though. The residents in the fort seem not very fond of tourists visiting the place. We visited on proper Diwali days still there was lot amount of garbage that was not removed from the lanes and particularly food garbage was spread around in the areas.

title: You could miss this fort.
review: Since it's a living fort, by living fort I mean it shelters 4000 ppl. This fort is not well kept.very dirty. And too crowded. I

title: Super Rick History and solid good people around
review: Ganesh - 09001720715 is your man. He has a Tavera and I insist you must look for him incase the above number becomes inactive...its a small town you will catch hold of him easily...He has gone out of the way to help us when we missed our train to Jodhpur without a single penny....

title: Huge fort
review: Huge fort in the middle of the city.  One can practically spend a few hours in the fort complex. Many cafes, restaurants and bakeries also within the complex.

title: Feel good holiday
review: Jaisalmer is an old city so donot expect all modern facilities over here but that's where its charms lies. It takes you  to a lazy, laid back lifestyle of a small town where people are happy and proud with the heritage, culture and history of their old city.

title: Fort in a city
review: This is only a kind of fort that's located right in the middle of the city and surrounded by a dense population of shops and hawkers. The visit is not as pleasant as it should be but it has the rich history worthy of learning about.

title: Mesmerizing and Majestic
review: Plenty of places to stay, eat, and shop for crafts inside the fort. If you have an Indian DL, you can rent a moped or a motorbike and go around inside the fort.

title: Live Fort
review: I am from jaipur, so visiting fort was nothing new to me. but this is not like other forts. It is a 900years old live fort. still more than 5000 Families are living inside. It is in itself a complete city which include houses, shops, hotels, restaurents etc.

title: magnificent fort
review: worth walking around, the size of this fort is impressive and it's nicely maintained. it's also nice to stop by at a cafe before the sunset somewhere high up on the fort wall to chill and enjoy the quietness.

title: Sonar Kella
review: Because of the sand and stones available in plenty, it is called Sonar (gold) just as Jodhpur is called the Pink city due to the abundance of pink stone.

title: A sight to behold
review: If you're in Jaisalmer as a tourist, you cannot help but see this massive fort from wherever you are

title: First living Fort ..awesome place to visit
review: Beautiful historical place.Had lots of time to explore and photography  good thing about is people live inside Fort Jaisalmer. small and big house. shops ,handmade things to be purchased. The city view from top is amazing.

title: Not so well maintained
review: Unlike forts in jodhpur or city palace in udaipur, here there are local people staying inside the fort. The fort is not so well maintained. There are jain temples inside the fort which are quite good

title: Rajasthan tour
review: Nyc place to visit in morning time b4 11am...do bargaining in everthg..even in hiring guides whch try to fool u out...

title: Fort and museum
review: This is very good fort, but if I compare this with Jodhpur fort I feel this is not up to that expectations. Jodhpur fort is far good in terms of history and museum.

title: Must visit during Jaislmer visit
review: The Fort looks very attractive from outside. Better to visit upto the Stage where residential area begins. Max You can go inside couple of lanes. The purchasing is costly inside the Fort shops.

title: Family trip
review: Good place to visit this winters... Very majestic fort must see......Take a licensed guide...... About 200 RS....

title: Average Fort
review: It's a Privately Owned Fort, his current king stays in Gurgaon (Near Delhi) , they actually looting people , 100 Rs ticket , 100 Rs Camera, Private Guides and no facility inside the fort ! A small portion is fort rest of the area occupied by local people, there are some 4000 family stays in the fort Brahamns and Rajputs majorly

title: happening and busy
review: great architecture

title: Only living fort of India
review: You can't say its a fort.. its a whole city inside fort.

title: Not a heritage property
review: This fort is not a kind of heritage property anymore instead it is more of a local market which includes many small shops.

title: A different Era!
review: This will surely take you back to a different era. The shining sand stone makes it alluring and the busy streets and the market will make you shop more. The history behind this fort is a great read and the intricate designs and carvings on the sandstone will astonish you. The craftsmanship is superb.must visit. It is visible from many streets and hotels. Some families still live in a part of the fort. But there are lots of bats to look at collectively.

title: One of a kind
review: You would come across numerous forts in India, but none like this one. It's probably the only fort in India where the life goes on as usual. People reside in houses build inside the fort. There are shops, restaurants and hotels, all within the walls of this fort. What's more intriguing is that almost all such buildings inside the fort are beautifully built in the traditional style.

title: Go back in time or at least imagen that you did!
review: A awesome place to walk around and pretend that you are in a time where trading between east and west hold place!

title: Nothing outstanding about this fort
review: There is no place in this fort to move. The courtyards inside are dirty since people stay inside the fort boundaries. Tourists can give it a miss, if they care about hygiene and comfort.

title: Spectacular
review: Totally worth visiting just for the fort alone. It evokes medieval vistas of times long past. Enjoy the shopping as well!

title: nice place to visit
review: nice place to visit during jaisalmer visit  well maintained in compare to other forts of rajasthan . love its

title: You you cannot miss this visit.You come for it.
review: Spend at least a full day. The sun around the clock offers you various scenes and landscapes which overwork the photographer.

title: Almost a residential fort
review: Made of yellow sandstone,  it houses the hain temples.  The entire Fort is occupied by some people as their residences.  Walk around the fort,  visit to jain temples and seeing various shops is what is possible.

title: "wonderful Heritage of Jaisalmer India”
review: it is totally surprised living fort. People lives here. It is really the golden fort and golden city.

title: Alive and breathing
review: Unlike all other forts in Rajasthan, this one has people staying within the walls which makes it accessible at time of the day and night. We did not visit the museum as such but took a stroll around the fort, talking to the locals and it was quite an experience. People are friendly and you have a beautiful view of the city from a couple of points. Just do not eat in those eateries. You would be well off having a good food outside the fort.

title: A living fort !!!
review: Jaisalmer fort is one of the few forts in the world that is still inhabited by people. The fort looks majestic from outside and inside the fort you have the Maharajas palace, Jain temples and many good souvenir shops. We took a stroll inside the fort in the evening hours and it felt great to walk past old homes and havellis. It was really amazing to see how one out of every 3 homes in Jaisalmer looks like a havelli. We could take the help of guides to get more details about the fort.

title: The lanes laid behind, they have stories to tell
review: The fort was an amazing place as. Hen took me to this top part which no one knows and we sat and watched the sun go down. The lanes are the beauty and imagine how much they have to say

title: Fascinating
review: Beautiful mesmerising amazing and fascinating place I loved what I saw and will definitely comeback soon

title: An experience in itself
review: Worlds only live fort and it really is worth .

title: Sunkissed Jaisalmer Fort
review: Though visited in December, it was quite heated up at Jaisalmer, the golden city. The attractions are the king's residence, the queens residence along with Hindu and Jain temple inside the Fort.

title: Living Fort
review: I've seen forts in different cities all over india and Jaisalmer Fort is one that stood. Not sure whether its called Live-in fort or Living fort but its active and alive!

title: History history n history
review: The town is all jaisalmer, fort is on the triangular huge rock or mountain. Jaisal plus meru named jaisalmer. The various palaces inside. ..over 200 steps which doesn't feel to climb that many at all...middle of the city...

title: It is one of its kind.
review: I saw many palaces. This one is very unique, big and people can live inside as many hotels are there inside.

title: Going through the living fort was awesome experience
review: Very clean, nice to see many  temples and shopping centers inside. Patwan House was good to see. Infornt of it had tea which was very good.

title: Rajasthan tour
review: One of the most historical place.and was a stoppage for the businessman  so called silk route.and this fort was made king Jaisal to protect the businessman.

title: Feel like in a fairy tale.
review: Walking through its alleys and among its temples you will feel like in a fairy tale. The most beauty village I've ever been. It's simply magic.

title: Fun and feel of local culture..
review: U must do is hire a guide at the gate only... to better understand the area... it has lot of history to know.. secondly u can do a lot of Rajasthani shopping (but prizes very high so u shd have max bargaining)

title: Nice fort
review: One of the finest fort and you can visit the place leisurely.All the artefacts are intact even after so many years.

title: Keep it in the least priority items of your itinerary.
review: Its just a tiny fort in the middle of the town. Keep it in the last items of your itinerary. We visited this fort as we had to spend half a day doing something.

title: nice place
review: nice place to see . one of the best fort of rajasthan well maintained must see puppet show  . recommended to others

title: Awesome day at jaisalmer
review: Enjoyed a lot at this fort good place and most important thing is this fort is a life of jaisalmer very good and well maintained by rajasthan tourism good work will be back soon

title: Fort
review: Not so much interesting  fort. Entry  Fees too much high. Bikaner fort good one to visit. No good guides. Not well maintained. So much crowd. Too much noise.

title: One of best forts in the world!
review: Grt fort..and the only live fort... great planning ..photographer's paradise... guide is must..and best thing is u can drive ur bike into the fort..

title: A really beautiful walled coty
review: My family and I didn't initially have Jaisalmer on our radar, but some friends told us how great it was, so we headed there for the first part of holiday break. The city Palace is where we started our tour, and we had a great guide named Jeet, who was fantastic. We ambled the streets along with tribals, cows, guides, and other tourists. The visit to the Jain temples was really lovely, and after visiting the larger one, we say in the quiet one adjacent to it while Jeet told us about Jainism. Lunch was at a beautiful rooftop cafe where I enjoyed some wonderful Rajasthani stuffed tomatoes. We found the city full of shops and sales folk, but none were pushy. It was a great place to learn a lot about the history of Rajasthan and to enjoy the feeling of the old walled city.

title: Amazing view of city and inside fort.
review: The unique thing about this fort is that there is dense colony inside fort.

title: Not all that great
review: the fort outside view is great..thats it. you can explore the narrow lanes in the fort by walking and see numerous havelis inside and do some shopping for skirts and t shirts.otherwise nothing much interesting .

title: Good place
review: Started our tour with a guide named Poona (mobile number 070239 87658). Was appalled to note that he asked for a mere 100 rupees for 2.5 hour of estimated tour. Anyway, we agreed and he took us around through Jain temples, King and Queen's palaces. Told a lot of stories and interesting information and was patient with our questions.

title: Excellent Fort
review: Go in the morning before the sales people arrive. Take a coffee/tea on one of the small hotel terraces and watch the sunrise.

title: Its Gold indeed
review: The place is a fantastic place to watch remnants of history. The structures are massive and excellently crafted. Watch the roofs of the grand masonary.  The place , in some places, smells of bats. It is not known why charges for entry is so hefty  and why archaeological survey of India is nowhere to be seen. Photography even with mobiles are charged. .

title: Must do during Rajasthani trip.
review: Nice small city in the middle of the desert. Very clean and with friendly locals used to see tourists.

title: Just another fort
review: it is just another fort which is badly maintained. the revenue from tickets goes to local royal family and if you have seen other forts in Rajasthan you can give this a miss.

title: must see
review: its good beetter take a guide who will explain you the past histroy of the fort, its the only fort having  living people

title: Amazing views and it's free!
review: The fort is really quite beautiful and I would highly recommend a visit if you are in jaisalmer. And you can't go wrong when the admission is free

title: Sanjay Vasu - Guide Extraordinaire
review: Sanjay was our guide to Jaisalmer for the better part of 2 days. We have travelled a fair bit and I would say he is the best local guide we have ever had the pleasure to get to know in any city or town we have visited. He's a very relaxed, knowledgeable and devout man.  We learned so much from him about Jaisalmer, India, Indian politics, cricket, Hinduism, and day-to-day Indian life. He was also very easy to trust - he took us to buy silver from a family that lived within a km from where he lived and it was a very interesting conversation (and yes I bought a beautiful and unique piece of old silver that I love). He also was very clear about the only place to consider buying Kashmiri pashmina and he was absolutely right - the product was wildly and obviously better than anything else we had looked at in other cities.  He also had clear recommendations about other cities - he guides all over India. We would engage him if we return to India and would involve him in planning the trip.  His email is sanjayvasujsm@gmail.com. Mobile 091.9001282300.

title: Nice
review: It is a spectacular fort as any other fort would be. The walk to the fort is pretty nice and enchanting. You will need to hire a guide to know the background.

title: Nice fort. A good place to visit
review: View was great. Don't book any person to guide you book an audio guide, it's more interesting and helpful.

title: Charming!
review: This is a fort in which people still live. There are hotels, etc. also in this fort. Small lanes, lots to walk and beautiful panoramic view of Jaisalmer city make this a must visit.

title: The ultimate Fort
review: What a sight! We enjoyed the sunset from a point opposite the Fort and could not imagine what a Fort city would look like. This place is huge, once inside you feel like sightseeing a town. There are picturesque Hotels and many Havelis, endless shops and privat houses. Everything is well organized and quite clean, a real joy to see!

title: Awesome
review: Take your time to have a close look at this huge architectural beauty. It a living world in itself.

title: Amazing Place
review: A must visit place in jaisalmer. Also known as golden fort of jaisalamer. View is best during the sunrise.

title: A Living Fort
review: What makes this fort different from the others in Rajasthan is that it is inhabited.  Walking the streets of this lively place gives you a much better experience than visiting forts that are not inhabited or merely museums.

title: It's unique
review: Something which is unique is that so far during our trip in India, this is the only fort where the people still live in, and most of them are selling something for the tourist. Other thing is that they make the wedding invitation by painting it on their wall (front door) so that people are able to see & attend it.

title: Living fort
review: There are people still living inside the fort. You can walk up or take an auto and a guide. For shopping try to not to purchase from the main central market. At the same stuff is cheaper as you move inside the fort.

title: Nice fort
review: Fort is different from other fort of Rajasthan. In this people having homes also and shops. Jain temple is beautiful. Nice city view from top.

title: Mini City
review: The fort is a mini city in itself with lots of shops , restaurant and people living in there. It is like any other fort in Rajasthan with beautiful city view from the top. It also has a Jain Temple inside for which tickets have to be bought (only for the camera). The only problem were the so called guides who kept on offering their service every minute...

title: The most remarkable fort in Rajasthan
review: There are plenty of shops inside and the fort offers a great view of the entire city. Tourists should walk around in search of gems.

title: Unique audio tour
review: We decided to take an audio tour of the Jaisalmer Fort when a fellow traveller couple recommended it to us. We were in Jaisalmer for two days and it ended up becoming the highlight of our stay there.

title: Very interesting place
review: W took a tour guide for a fair price.

title: Where Reality Meets Fantasy
review: A wonderful experience. The Fort is a living Fort with a thriving community within its walls is an architectural wonder. You can walk the narrow clean alleys with shops and restaurants everywhere. The people were very friendly and not too pushy. Shopping well amazing if that is your thing.

title: Go for sure!
review: Get an Audio Guide at the Maharaja and Maharaja s palace. It's a bit pricey but worth it. Also check out Hari Om Jewellers at the exit of the palace.

title: Good fort but a bit crowded
review: The fort is good, but its crowded as there are people living inside it (nearly 5K they say). A tip, take a guide with you, there are lot of guides there but go for the Govt. approved/authorised ones. The fort is built of sandstone and would have been a golden sight in its hay days.

title: A Great Huge Fort
review: The Jaisalmer fort is also known as the Sonar Quila or Golden Fort. It was built about 1000 years back in 1156 AD by the Rajput ruler Rawal Jaisal, from whom it derives its name. The fort stands amidst the sandy expanse of the great Thar Desert, on Trikuta Hill and has a great architecture.

title: This fort is a wonderful place at Jaisalmer..
review: Very nice fort , and like a living fort.. Township inside. The collection is good and worth visiting. takes around 2 hours to complete. The staff is very supportive.

title: Unique living fort
review: 5000 people live and work in this historic structure. We loved wandering around the shops as well as the palace and temples. Lots to handicrafts to choose from.

title: Real gold
review: Building made if gold, sun makes it look beautiful.

title: Muy buena
review: To live nowadays within an ancient fort is an extrange experince, study the arquitecture, the techniques used to build it, the security systems, is very interesting, and then have a camel ride, like going on a wave, that feels good!

title: Excellent place to visit
review: Great place to visit for photos, architecture etc we did not hire a guide but I would recommend that you get one as it will add to the experience by getting more information about the place but having said that we did enjoy our visit which lasted around 4 hours make sure you have plenty of water

title: Experience the awesomeness of living fort
review: Try to walk along the fort rather than taking a taxi or auto rikshaw. You will love the old age architecture and tbe shops decorated with local souvenirs. From the top of the fort you can have a bird eye view of entire Jaisalmer city. Inside the  fort there is almost 500 years old jain temple and the carving on the stones used in walls and roof are just mesmerising. Also do notice the use of Habur stone in flooring. For the photography enthusiasts, keep the battery of your camera fully charged and memory card empty as you will find many spots inside the fort to click a perfect picture with golden brown background which you may not want to miss.

title: Living Fort & Ancient Bazaar
review: Given Jaisalmer's history as an important trading town along the ancient silk route, the fort still retains it's bazaars, and are a beautiful reminder of the timelessness of Rajasthan.

title: Golden fort
review: Very nice fort golden look best view in night  time near  by there is many  place to eat and drink so if you  want best view then go near  fort restaurants to enjoy.

title: Truly mesmerizing
review: I had the 360 view of the area from the top of the fort and it was a hot say and i really enjoyed it as the breeze was cool.

title: Golden Fort
review: In Rajasthan each city is called/marked by a specific colour. like Jaipur by the name pink city. Where majority of construction is in pink stone.Similar is Jaisalmer city. The stone used here is golden colour. The fort/palace is also of golden stone. It is a huge fort encircling a old town itself. One requires about two hours to roam the entire fort. The best season would be between November to February end. Otherwise it will be hot there. The art work, the decorated walls, are worth watching. It shows the richness of the then rulers.

title: Living fort
review: It's a living fort, lot of people and chaos. Shops for tourists, however doesn't give a proper feeling of the fort since there are houses and people living there.

title: Average...
review: Near about 5000 thousand people are living in this fort, there is nothing much remaining historical there. too much pollution is there. The view of city is nice from top of the fort.

title: Historical Place
review: I like this place as it is a historical place . Interesting fort to go with family & friends .

title: Great architecture
review: The jaisalmer fort has a great architecture and worth to visit if you are in jaisalmer. Everywhere one can find extraordinary sandstone work.

title: Must see
review: The lovely carved fort is a must watch, wonderful view and so beautiful, the jharokhas windows when you go inside acts as a photo frame.you are lost in the historical era, early morning visits will mesmerize you.

title: Royalty revisited
review: This was my favorite fort in the tri cities of udaipur, jaisalmer and jodhpur.

title: Truly, " The Sonar Kella,"  of Mr Satyajit Ray.
review: This 'living Fort'  really and truly shines in the morning, night and day. It really gives the impression that its made of gold. But of course, its not. Its made of solid stone and its beauty in stone  can be seen even when you go inside the by-lanes of the living quaters.

title: Lovely place to visit
review: For architecture lovers, this is a must see place! You can get lost on beautiful streets inside of this fort, you'll find a magic place full of history, beautiful people, a good variety of souvenir shops, good places to eat or have a tasty lassi with a fantastic roof top view.

title: Lovliest fort in India
review: You might think it hard for a fort to be lovely, but Jaisalmar is an exception to the rule. There are intricate sandstone carvings throughout the palace, and lovely places to sit and admire the view.  There are government tour guides at the entrance who really press hard for your business, but we opted for the audio cassette guide in English, which turned out to be quite good. The cool thing about Jaisalmar fort is that it's a living city with inhabitants. In the city, the streets are narrow and paved and you see intricate sandstone carvings on every building, every street.  It's like a beautiful sandstone medieval European city in some respects,but quintessentially Indian at heart. This town was an important stop on the spice and silk trade routes, and the wealth of the merchants is evidenced everywhere.  It's well worth a whole day of wandering.

title: Best place
review: Good heritage, too much parking fees,  no need of guide, try german bakery out there,it is awesome, area near fort is bit creppy but all in all one day is enough  for jodhpur.

title: amazing architecture
review: A photographer's delight!! The lovely carved fort is a must watch, wonderful view and so beautiful, the jharokhas windows when you go inside acts as a photo frame.you are lost in the historical era, early morning visits will mesmerize you.

title: heritage fort
review: do hire a guide to understand the history and the importance of the fort. One hell of a place to get some beautiful pictures clicked.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: Nice to see with Museum and can we say Golden Fort with Market.

title: Fort Jaisalmer
review: it was nice visit ,it is really awesome place. it was my first time i enjoyed a lot. dresses and other things are also really awesome.

title: Best in class fort in golden city
review: Best fort in all view as you can see people living together since 15th century and first fort in silk route of INDIA

title: Good place
review: Nice place :) had fun... Clicked a whole lot of pictures.. nicely made a review of Indian tradition :)

title: Mesmerizing to walk around
review: Mystique and highly atmospheric. Beatiful stoned and nice views. It really feels from a different time if you would count away all the touts and tourist shops and restaurants.

title: Nice place to visit-Must go place for JAISELMER GOING PEOPLE
review: I visited the place in september. It was too hot there in the daytime but ya it was cool also during the night. There was entery fee of rs.100 for visiting this fort.

title: Historic and impressive
review: Jaisalmer Fort is impressive with several beautiful Haveli homes inside, the palace, and the Jain temples. Take a tuk tuk to the top to avoid the climb.

title: Tour of jaisalmer
review: Amazing historical monument,  fee per person is 100rs.

title: A must, interesting temples, views and people
review: The fort only has one entrance so you can't get lost. Just walk around and see in the small streets how the people live there. Many great views from the walls. Many temples and beware of the many guides who are no guides at all. Many shops of course.

title: its nice
review: Its nice but if you have seen Udaipur, Jodhpur or Jaipur forts there is not much to see in Jaisalmer Fort. Yes, you need to walk a lot.

title: A mini city in itself
review: Jaisalmer fort is one of the unique living forts in India. People stay within the fort till date.  Apart from houses, the fort also has shops, temples and market places.  The fort is the glory of the Golden City of Jaisalmer.  The fort is built in yellow sandstone.  From the top of the fort, the views of the distant desert areas is spectacular.

title: awesome architecture
review: love for heritage and architecture. needs govt to maintain more for tourist attraction and lacking maintenance. good engravings on stone and fine work

title: Its really majestic. .......
review: This is one of the fort where people still lives.Jaisalmer fort became famous after the movie SONAR KELLA by the gr8 SATYAJIT RAY.The view of city from fort is just awesome.Donot forget to see the jain mandir inside.Take a guide to feel the taste of history.The guide charges 150/-.

title: Good but not a great fan of ancient architecture and places
review: Good but I am not a great fan of ancient architecture and places. Tried to explore from one room to other; one floor to another but the interest didn't increase.

title: Beautiful - a living fort
review: Rs 100 per person + Rs 100 camera + Rs 200 guide. Will take you about 90 minutes. Guide will show you kings palace and queens palace - both are museums.  Plus Jain temple. But the fun is in exploring the living parts of the fort. And don't miss out on shopping in trinket shops - bargaining is must. Shops near the jain temple and kings palace are expensive. Explore shops in other areas. Bargain. Carry lots of water. Near the parking lot is thakur ji restaurant - good food.

title: Magnificent fort central to poulation of Jaisalmer
review: Well preserved fort with thriving interior of residents, hivali's, hotels and markets. Plenty of entertainment wonderful happy people. Well controlled limited access by vehicles and rickshaw.

title: Personal visit
review: Must visit place in the Citi. Don't forget to take guide. Available for 150 to 200 rs.

title: Good Fort to visit
review: The fort is a good visit..its smaller as compared to other forts but provides excellent view..and if you the right guide he is able to provide some great historical stuff..

title: The only Live fort I have visited so far
review: People still have their homes within the fort and it's an amazing experience. You can reach inside the fort either by walk or in a tuk-tuk.  There are multiple attractions inside the fort:

title: Yellow stone and sand fortress
review: Spend your time in the narrow streets, visit the old palace and the amazing view from the roof, feel the faith in jaïn temples and hear songs and music during ceremony, enjoy Jaisalmer Fortress

title: Fantastic place for visit and stay in
review: The buildings, the vibe of this place, all the people who are living inside of the fort, everything's fantastic! You'll find temples, lots of great places to eat, many stores for shopping, great roof top views and very beautiful things and happy faces for photo shooting,

title: Commercialized fort
review: Fort looks attractive from outside. Saddest part is its completely commercialized. Local residential stay inside the fort, due to which fort can not be viewed completely. Tourist losses their interest.

title: History alive
review: The fort is all the more impressive as few thousands actually still live in it. Motorised traffic should be forbidden.

title: Very informative
review: A great insight into the past. Beautiful and clean. Very friendly people. A must see. I stayed here for 5 days.

title: A must see
review: Ok,  I was here in 1995.  Since then their has been a lot of development with hotel resorts all over the town.  But the town in the fort remains unchanged for 100s of years.  In 1995 I ate Mexican food at a roof top restaurant and I returned 20 years later with 3 kids to the same one.  The self audio tour is best.  Unlike other larger palaces and forts,  here I don't recommend any tour guides.  Best to do a self tour of the palace inside (my kids enjoyed the audio tour) ,  see the views, meader and do a selfie at the cannon and shop till your heart is content.  Relaxing.

title: Underwhelming
review: For such an important site much of the Fort area is dirty and badly maintained. Hassling by guides and shopkeepers is common and museum charges inflated rates for foreigners but still won't take card payment.

title: Very good location to see
review: It's very good location in Rajasthan when you come to Jaisalmer my advice to you must see as it's shows culture and art of old Rajasthan...

title: Good experience..
review: Visited this place on the way to jaisalmer desert. Nicely maintained and huge.. They light it up nicely

title: Living historical fort!
review: This is one fort in India, which is still housing people inside its boundaries! People making a living out of business of selling handicrafts and souvenirs for tourists. Temples were also thronging with locals. The negative points were - free run of autos / bikes and cattle inside this complex.

title: Massive fort - lots to see
review: This is one of the biggest forts in the country and also one of the best maintained. get up close with the intricate stone work on that time. Spectacular city views can be seen from the top of the fort.

title: Loved it
review: Amazing place... Stunning architecture . Beautiful people . Photographers dream . Shopping Mecca . Silver Jewellery to die for . Vistas of Desert and Dunes . Golden Havelis . Intricate stone work . Special insight into a 'living museum' . Put it on your itinerary!

title: Great original fort city in North India
review: We visited many towns in Rajasthan but I liked this one the best in terms of it still being a fort city much like it was 200 hundred years ago. Plus it is in the desert and you can take camel ride, see forever, and enjoy the views/landscape.

title: Epic place to winder
review: Beautiful lived in fort, vibrant with activity and amazing architecture. Magical place to visit and great views back down to the desert area. Worth the trip into the desert to find this gem.

title: 4000+ reasons to visit this living city fort
review: Magnificent fort city housing the Palace, residential areas, commercial places, temples and picturesque viewpoints. Only wish that the sanitation requirements are looked after by the administration.

title: worst experience
review: poor maintenance of fort, very bad smell all over the fort. and worst thing you have to pay extra money for photo's you want to click over here

title: MAGICAL
review: I chose the tour I went on because it took in Jaisalmer (the fort is one of my '1,001 buildings to see before you die). I wasn't disappointed. The way the fort rises out of the city is just breathtaking. It's also a living fort, with many businesses and homes there.

title: A living fort...fascinating and beautiful
review: The Jaisalmer fort is one of the best ones we have visited for so many different reasons- the golden sandstone used, exquisite carving in the palace, the palace tour is very well organized so you don't miss anything, lots of beautiful temples in the complex and lastly, the fact that it is like a small walled city with narrow lanes, and stores and restaurants inside. One can easily spend hours just walking around here. Interestingly most houses look similar with the carving- but on closer look one can figure out which is old and which is new! A couple of things which hopefully the administration will fix before things go out of hand- open drains all over (the fort was not designed to accommodate so many people and businesses) and too many cows everywhere resulting in cowdung in the lanes!

title: A must see place
review: The jaisalmer fort is well preserved monument. It need a full day to see the fort and havelis around. Dont forget to enjoy a cup of coffee at the fort

title: Must visit
review: There are 4 sections to cover - Museum, Jain temple, Cannon and market area. It would be good if you can hire a guide since they tell you a lot more than what eyes can see. We spend just 200 bucks on a govt. registered guide and it was worth the money.

title: Jaisalmer fort
review: The best fort in Rajasthan, the golden ,yellow colour is magical in sun. The Jain temples in the fort are decorated with fine artistic work which is extraordinary

title: A great experience.
review: The other forts we visited in Rahjastan were not inhabited. This was a living breathing fort and very special to visit. Easy access, in the centre of town, and people going about their  everyday lives. No restaurants obvious in the fort so take some water or drinks with you because finding somewhere to sit and refresh was challenging.

title: Also called  Sonar Quila or Golden Fort - a must visit place in Jaisalmer
review: The Jaisalmer fort is unique in that it still is one of the few forts in Rajasthan where there is a bustling bazaar (market) and a number of homes where people live inside the fort. So even if you are not much of a history buff, it will still enchant you. The fort is big and the best way to explore would be to hire a knowledgeable guide who can guide you through the narrow bylanes of the 'Quila' without getting lost. There is a nice city view from atop the tower in one of the alleys which you should not miss. The museum, at the center of the quila is good but if you are visiting it as the 3rd or 4th fort museum in Rajasthan then you may have already gotten used to seeing most of the artifacts. This fort is highly recommended.

title: Great fort
review: Certainly the main attraction of the city. Not the most opulent for sure but impressive none the less.

title: Jaisalmer fort
review: It is a very old fort of 550 years old built by JAISAL.MANY POLS CAN BE SEEN.WE SAW  tanks there.thre are many beautiful temple's inside and at many places you can see the whole of Jaisalmer .it  has  beautiful hotels .there are  shops also  so  don't  need to go any where else for shopping  .

title: Good
review: Entry charges is Rs 100, in order take photos inside again Rs 100.  Audio Guide Rs 400. There where no description anywhere in the palace,  you have to hire guide or take audio guide if you are really interested.

title: A fort open for public living!
review: One of the most important places to visit in the Jaisalmer.

title: Smelly , dirty and in shambles.
review: Very badly kept place with people living inside. A shame . Badly managed and a waste of time. a rela shame on India that when tourists will come they wouyld get to see clothe s hanging from houses inside the fort. Excreta of animals on the way. Guides harassment all the way. Rickshaws which are available for going up charge heavily.

title: Live-in fort!
