review: This fort is occupied by local residents, shops and tourists. Nice place, but very crowded during Diwali holidays. Our guide took us through lanes which were not crowded and we got to meet local residents on the way. That was special!

title: Sonar Kella
review: For Bengalis, this is the Sonar Kella from Feluda. Good place to explore, full of shops and residences inside.

title: Enjoyable, but much of it is shops.
review: I had a pleasant walk in the Fort. There are some great view points. I liked the old cannon spots. The Jain temple was not accessible when I went there because they were holding a Jain Flag festival.

title: Different type of fort visit
review: Very interesting as unlike the other Indian forts we visited this one is actually a small walled town. There is the usual fort  museum to visit but it just as much fun wandering around the narrow streets within the fort walls where the everyday business of living, buying and selling takes place.

title: Live fort
review: The place is a boon for photoholics like me.. well this is spoken of as a live fort that has restaurants and people residing in of the actual families that use to stay here..

title: Golden fort
review: Our guide managed to fenagle a tuc tuc past security which was welcomed by us as it was a very hot day and with toddler in tow was a lifesaver. The Fort itself is worth a visit for its winding little roads but the view was somewhat lacklustre. It's better looking at the Fort lit up at night.

title: Not to be missed
review: It has people, descendants still living. It's a full bustling township unlike many other forts which are restored and just tourist spots. A Walk up and down the lanes, gives you a picture and makes you realise how it would have been years ago living within a fort. The best view of the city comes from the top of this fort.

title: Must visit
review: This is a must visit during your trip to Jaisalmer. There will be lot of guides please there I cards before hiring genuine people.

title: REALLY AMAZING... BEAUTIFUL...
review: This fort is beautiful and amazing in many ways.  It is supposedly the only living fort in the world... meaning that people still live in it like they did.  Inside the walls it is little alleys that surprise you at every turn with shops and markets and restaurants and hotels and temples and open areas for public to meet.  There is a buzz within the walls and people stream in all day.  Cows wander about among locals, tourists and touts and motor bikes an the occasional brave moto rickshaw.  the shops offer everything Rajistan and in particular, make sure you buy your wall hangings and rugs from here made out of traditional Muslim and Hindu outfits... just amazing... didn't see the same range anywhere else.  Everything is reasonably priced with a little bartering... its no cheaper outside the walls or inside the walls.  definitely visit some roof top restaurants close to the fort walls for the view. visit the Hivalis outside the wall and the lake... all easy walking distance.  but mostly spend time walking the alleys within the walls... beautiful and vibrant and alive and buzzing and full of so much history.

title: an amazing fort
review: Our guide showed us inside the city of the fort, we found this most interesting. The buildings are drynamic full of wonder, history and eastern charm. It is the first time we visited this city and found the experience fascinating.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: It has very intricate carving and has a museum inside.. Good experience.. You should visit Jaisalmer during winter time.. Try to stay in some boutique hotels near the fort.. Most of them has a very good view of the fort at night.. Fort closes at 4:00 PM.. Please keep that in mind when planning for a visit

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is of course nice - like all other monuments in Rajastham. But our main aim of visiting Jaisalmer was "The Desert"  The fort is nice. Each fort in different cities of Rajasthan are different - with different attractions and histories.

title: A beauty - Both in intricate work and view from top
review: I found the intricate work on the yellow sandstone which is the core of the fort to be really astonishing. I have rarely seen such artistry on wood, these guys did it on stone. My personal favorite is the view from the top of the fort... A 360 degree view and is really good. Photography needs a prior ticket.. so in case you have not taken prior ticket you'll be charged a ticket there itself by the security person.

title: Great views from top
review: Try to spend night at Hotel located in fort on top. You will love it. Superb night life and lively decoration n lighting of fort.

title: Please recall our late West Bengal Director Mr Satyajit Ray who through his movie "Sonar Kella" (Golden Fort)
review: Indeed "Sonar Kella" (Golden Fort) by Late Mr Satyajit Ray invoked much curiosity amongst people of West Bengal who proceeded to tour the spot year on end. It has a lot of history with families living and trading wares within the Fort Walls. The paths are narrow and has shops on either ends. There are eateries available with much to see

title: Wralth of desert merchants
review: This fort is different than ones in Jaipur, Jodhpur, Agra, etc. You can really feel the richness that the desert merchants brought with them to Jaisalmer to build this fort. Has unique architecture, different from all others in India.

title: This fort is so beautiful so nice looking and golden colour
review: I recommend this palace come and see very nice enjoy Jain temple also very nice and beautiful and queen Mahal is also very good

title: Good
review: Nice to see the fort made of golden sand stone. Though there are lot of Chaos inside and nothing much to see inside.

title: some beautiful buildings
review: The amazing stonework and interesting lively streets make meandering through this area very interesting

title: Fort with limited attraction
review: It was very crowdy so not possible to watch it closely. Very few attractions have remained. Ok for one time visit.

title: Beautiful fort
review: Well maintained fort with cool items from the history. The view from the roof top of the Jaisalmer city is amazing.

title: Golden fort visit
review: Main attraction of Jaisalmer. Have many spots to see inside the fort. Also one can find entire city living inside the fort. Marvelous structure made by man in dessert, must try. If someone does not able to walk on slopes, there are rickshaws available which will take you directly inside the fort area.

title: Best of Jaisalmer
review: Very good palace of Kings and Queens inside this fort.

title: Nice fort for a walk among historic buildings
review: Jaisalmer fort is mostly impressive when you're inside (from the exterior, it's much less impressive than other forts like Mehrangarh). Walking in the narrow streets of Jaisalmer fort is a true pleasure, discovering nice historic buldings at almost every turn. At least three hours should be devoted to the Fort, more if you visit each place in it and stop to eat.

title: Nice historical place with musieum
review: Very good museum, carving work. We have did this trip with guide who has explained all the history of complete fort. Very good place for shopping as well.

title: "Sonar kella "
review: The great film maker Sattyajit roy 's hit movie "Sonar kella "'s shooting was held in this fort.It has become more popular as a tourist destination after this movie, specially among bengalis. The whole fort is made out of yellow sand stone . This is a living fort,almost five thousand people reside inside the fort . luckily we met one good guide. His name was "harish ji".He showed us each and every corner of the fort very nicely. This is the main attraction of jaysalmer. Lots of hotels and restaurants are there in the fort.

title: Excellent fort
review: Really nice fort, lot of jain temples. Make sure to visit them (carvings are one of the best) and understand the history. Make sure you have a guide who explains the temples to you and not only the fort.

title: A town within a fort!
review: Jaisalmer fort is a living and thriving town! It is the only living fort which houses approximately 1000 families! A lively market selling trinkets, bed sheets and other touristy stuff surrounds the palace of the king and queen.

title: A fort spread across a vast area with a town inside the fort..!
review: A Must visit place in Jaisalmer, if you have time keep a day & energy for Fort.

title: an experience
review: great experience well worth a visit and try to go to the co-operative for some wonderful silks and bedcovers

title: Must to visit
review: This fort is a must t visit for in India where villagers still live inside the palace, has host of jain temples inside.

title: Good View
review: within for there are people who stays, we have restaurant, road side stalls also available. jain manidr is good.  view from top is good. good place to visit.

title: Fantastic place ... worth to visit for
review: Just too fantastic place worth to visit for in Jaisalmer

title: Jaisalmeer Fort
review: First living fort I have been to. It was amazing. Whole place burdtlingbwith activity. Museum was crowded. Not felt like being there for long. Best time to visit is early morning befote sunrise and walk through the streets Bedford the crowd and the honking bikes arrives. Good place to bargain and buy.

title: A Residential Fort
review: There are many hotels, restaurants, shops, temples inside this fort. A lot of people are residing in this fort. Beautiful Jain temples are at one corner of this fort. There are many canon points, where you can see whole golden city.

title: Must see monument
review: Don`t miss the room with dutch tiles! It's a very beautiful palace, but in need of some conservation works.

title: Jaisalmer Fort Tour
review: This is the only inhabited fort in the world. Though, it is liveable, it definitely needs attention on the conservation of the historical monument.

title: Sonar Kella
review: Excellent in one word.View of the town from fort is excellent. Satyajit Roy's film Sonar Kella was soothed  here.

title: Good to see n must visit. .. Sonar killa
review: Must visit this sonar killa... the fort of gold... the only fort with people living inside the fort.

title: sonar kella.... fortress of gold
review: A childhood dream come true.. no words to explain what I felt.

title: Fort visit
review: History tell itself the story. Nice scenic view from balcony. Pleasant atmosphere. This is the best time to visit. The gold city itself show its richness.

title: The Goldn Fort at Jaisalmer...A fortified City
review: Jaisalmer Fort is the largest fully preserved fortified cities in the world. It is situated in the city of Jaisalmer, Rajasthan. It is a World Heritage Site.

title: Jaisalmer Fort - a small City
review: Without guide you can't understand what to do or what to see. Very crowded because it is not just a fort for tourist. This is a small city (around 4000 people live here).

title: Sonar Kella [ The Golden Fort ]
review: A huge mesmerizing Golden Fort in the desert of Jaisalmer , perhaps he only Fort with a living population . Walk able [ approx 2 km ] from Jaisalmer Railway Station . Excellent craftsmanship along with a beautiful view of the town from the top . The maintenance though is not that good by the authorities . This is where the great Director Satyajit Ray shot his Epic Movie Sonar Kella. Lot of food joints inside the Fort along with Shopping options like [ Handicrafts etc ] . Overall a joy as experience .

title: Fort with good view from top
review: This is one of the main attractions of Jaisalmer apart from the Safari. The fort comprises of all nearby areas ( with markets, temples, residential places, ATM etc ) and this is the centre of Jaisalmer. The City palace is also inside the Quilla area.

title: Nice Fort... Have seen better
review: The Jaisalmer fort is nice, but if it's to be judged just on its fort status then it was just Ok. For anyone interested in seeing an amazing fort Kumbalgargh fort half way between udaipur and jodhpur is far more impressive. The unique factor of this fort is that it's one of the only livi forts, where locals actually live inside the walls.

title: Beautiful place
review: Very nice place. Personally it Is number 1 sightseeing in Jaisalmer. Leave a morning or two to be able to see properly.

title: Beautiful architecture
review: It is worth to visit this fort. It is different to all the other forts what we saw in rajasthan. The architecture of the buildings are amazing. And has to be seen.

title: interesting toup
review: do take a guide and understand the history.. its pretty interesting how they still live in the fort. the views from the top of the fort are amazing. it gets pretty windy up there so take proper cover

title: Superb, almost medieval.
review: Fantastic experience walking on the narrow streets. Feels like ancient times even though it's beginning to have too many souvenir shops and pizzerias. Great views of the city below.

title: A definite must visit. Wonderful construction.
review: Wonderful Architecture. A lot of History.Many worthwhile oexhibits.The only exceptional place to visit in Jaisalmer.

title: Golden reflection and memories of Satyajit Ray
review: The fort is very ill maintained. The only attraction about the fort is the golden impression when sunlight reflects on the Jaisalmer stone. Tourists should be aware of the self-claiming guide who  are mostly intended to cheat the tourists. The fort is very suffocating and dirty. The authority have charged entry fees Rs. 100/- per person but in the fort there is no maintenance. Numerous of Bengali tourists visited this place in the interest of Satyajit Ray's famous film 'Soanr Kella' and to observe 'Mukuler Bari'. However in the fort, no memories of Satyajit Ray and Sonar Kella was being preserved. A very dirty and empty room have a nameplate 'Sonar Kella museum'.  A destroyed, dirty staircase was indicated as Mukul's house and that's all about Ray.

title: Good place
review: If I have to rate among the forts of Udaipur, Jodhpur, Jaisalmer. I will keep Jodhpur first then Udaipur and then Jaisalmer. The cafe's and restaurants around Jaisalmer fort are very good.One get plenty of options on the fort road.

title: The last living fort!!
review: The Jaisalmer fort is a unique settlement that aloud us to experience life as 500 years ago literally.

title: A beautiful fort.
review: The fort was very beautiful. Marvelous architecture, and very nice options for shopping. Do book a guide to get a gist of of its history and beauty. Awesome;-)

title: Fort where people still live
review: Can you believe that there are over 3000 families still live in this fort?

title: Bat Cave
review: The fort is living Fort and is not maintained at all. It is full of bats and the smell of their poop. Having said that the Fort is made of yellow sandstone and is quite glorious. You must visit Jain Temples inside the Fort apart from regular Maharaja and Maharani Palace, which is full of intricate carvings and their leftovers from past eras. It is the best thing to see in Jaisalmer city, but Rajasthan is full of historical forts and this is not the best one.

title: Beautiful Fort, Great Views from the Ramparts
review: The fort is obviously one of the "must see" locations in Jaisalmer.  Key highlights are the Royal Palace and Jain temples.  Aside from that you can take in city sights by following the signs to the "city views" that are put up around the main square in front of the palace.  Keep in mind that the walls of the fort are crumbling due to erosion caused by the fort's sewer system, so limit water use while inside.

title: Lovely  experience
review: We had a lovely  time spent in this hotel... its immense with luxurious rooms. Ambience  n service  was too good... food  was  awesome.

title: Main Beauty of Jaisalmer, Rajasthan
review: Mind Blowing Historical Beauty in Jaisalmer. It shows the Glory of India.  During the day stay in there, so many others spots which kept our mind is Sam Sand Desert

title: Must see!
review: The city in the fort is great! The tiny alleyways were fun to wonder through and the architecture was outstanding. Jaisalmer itself have been one of the best Indian cities I have been too.

title: Unique experience
review: Very narrow lanes, there are many hotels inside d fort, but vehicles r not allowed in. The fort n it's structure is not at all maintained

title: Indian Milestone on the native Silk Route
review: Visiting an Indian Heritage site has to be with a guide, but it attracts a bargain capacity too. A lot of stores get un-heard without a voice guiding you.

title: Strictly a one time visit
review: Average maintenance for the cost you pay. Very intricate work on the walls. The city view is beautiful. Please ensure you do not get fooled into buying "govt approved fossil stone mugs". Its a lie! :)

title: Excellent
review: Good place to see the whole city from one place..be careful with road vendors..take a guide so that u can get all the information clearly.

title: SONAL KELLA
review: Sonar Kella is must visit place for Bengalis. Go.... visit.... and enjoy.....

title: nice to stroll around the small paths of Jaisamler fort
review: this fort is different to others because of the number of people still residing there. incredible craftmanship of havelis at almost every turn. one of the joys is to give yourself an extra half day to just wonder around and explore where the small paths lead you to. wonderful stores for buying embroidered linen, craftwork, etc. special mention to Belissima for their work with young widowed women. just near here there is also a sign for real italian coffee, try it for a break on the roof top for a nice view and good coffee. Jain temples within the fort we a highlight for us if you like good stone craftmanship.

title: Excellent
review: A very tidy clean fort with lots of shopping opportunities; very easy and safe to walk round with good stalls and not too harassing as in other places. The fort itself is well maintained and historically interesting.

title: Fort with Folks
review: The Jaisalmer fort is the main attraction of the Jaisalmer city. It stands tall on the Trikuta hill built by Rajput ruler Rawal Jaisal.

title: Not worth it.
review: Hasn't been restored well. Not worth the price either.  You have to pay for a tuktuk  to reach the hill and you can then start your journey. Wasn't impressed.

title: Audio Tour of Fort Very Interesting
review: I found the guided audio tour of the palace Fort very informative, and it enabled me to move at my own pace through the structure. The view from the roof of the fort is beautiful, and the staff were helpful and not pushy.

title: Amazing place where families are still staying
review: Nice place to see go to city view point to take amazing pictures. Things are good but needs grid bargaining skills.

title: Big live fort
review: Very big golden live fort. Many still live within the fort area. Lot of historical things to witness. Worth visiting with kids.

title: Great view of the city
review: As the title says it all, it has a great view of the whole city. We didnt get a guide from outside but after we enter we found a guide just for 50rp. You should get a guide cuz it has stories needed to be heard once you are inside the fort. It was one of the highlight in my trip to India.

title: Sonar Quila/ Fort of Gold
review: One of the few living fort we had visited during our Rajasthan trip. Not as well maintained as some of the other forts but it gives a nice perspective how the real people actually used to live in medieval forts. Panoramic view of the city of Jaisalmer from the city from the fort was breathtaking especially during sunset. The fort and the city really gets covered in golden hue during sunset which earned the place a mystic name 'Golden Fort (Sonar Kella)' famously given by India's greatest movie director ever, Satyajit Ray. It was his movie 'Sonar Kella (Bengali)' made the fort famous among tourists. Was sorry to see the pathetic state of one of the major places where most memorable scene of the said movie of the shot (the house of Mukul, the chief protagonist of the movie).

title: Golden Indian Heart ........
review: Very Very big fort...enrich with Indian history ,,,,but place is not at all clean  due to local staying peoples who are more concentrating on business not for maintain Indian and own image....ppls are non co operative if you not hire local guild....

title: Walk through ancient history in this amazing place from the old Silk Road
review: Jaisalmer Fort is a must visit place in India, located in the far north west near the Pakistan border. It is an incredibly important site historically as it is located about midway between ancient Chinese centres and Venice. This is where all the camel trains used to stop, refresh and trade on there trips between East and West. This ancient fort is in great shape with all facilities for a most enjoyable stay and with wonderfully diverse and interesting places to visit and explore..

title: Fort worth doing, museum a bit expensive
review: The fort is obviously worth doing if you've got time - but there are better forts in different cities (Marangarh in Jodphur is the best we have been to - even though it's expensive).

title: A visit on ur trip once
review: One time visit to this fort is enough for lifetime as half of it is closed.

title: Desert Lore
review: A majestic palace with great history. Needless to say kohinoor of jaisalmer. Little crowded but good. Do walk over to one of the narrow path ways north - NE wards to get a view of city - both day and night. Full moon night preferred for enhanced experience

title: Quilla with human
review: Jaisalmer fort I had seen only fort where most of the area is covered by the residents. Good place to walk around and see the culture of rajasthan.

title: One of its kind Palace
review: Jaisalmer Fort is unique then other forts in Rajasthan as it is a live fort where people are still living... you have many hotels, restaurants etc. inside the fort.

title: Amazing
review: A very good historical fort of Jaisalmer & this fort have large area acquired also near by 5000 people still living in this fort. Please visit if u historical place lover.

title: Golden Fort
review: The fort has massive yellow sandstone walls, which were built over many years. Many families still live inside the fort and the alleys & walkways are a complete market in itself, with curios and traditional art being the most favoured items on sale. We also saw a wide range of precious. semi precious stones in many shops - must be one of the few places with such diverse display. Most fascinating shopping experience.

title: Visiting "Sonar Qila" - a World Heritage Site!
review: In the Northwestern corner of Rajasthan, not far from the India-Pakistan border, you will find the "Golden City" of Jaisalmer and its magnificent "Jaisalmer Fort". Built in 1156 by Maharawal Jaisal, this is second oldest fort in Rajasthan and a Unesco designated "World Heritage Site"! Besides those two excellent reasons to visit the "Golden Fort", locally known as "Sonar Qila", within its huge ramparts, bastions and walls, nearly 4000 people still live (this is the last living-in fort in the whole India), what adds colors, sounds, scents and flavors to this fully preserved fort. Take your time, hire a professional guide and stroll along this fantastic labyrinth of residences, shops, temples and "haveli" palaces. If you still do not find enough good reasons to go, just remember that the fortified city of Jaisalmer was the last refuge and way-station for all caravans on the legendary "Silk Route" from India to Persia (or back), before crossing the nearby awesome "Thar Desert". Let Jailsamer and its enchanted Fort bewitch you! Centuries of history, legends and mysteries await you! Enjoy!

title: A home for bats and nasty smells
review: Sonar kella may have interested many tourists after Satyajit Ray’s film but in reality it is not so good. Inside the Sonar Kella there is a small kind of city which is very dirty . The museum is not very big and the liting system is poor. The roof of the museum is very low in height and is made of wood. There are not many items for display. Surprisingly there are no cannons for display in the museum. Bats are hanging in some place or the other. There is always a nasty smell in the art gallery. There isn’t much armoury for display. Sonar Kella is a better to be avoided spot.

title: must see
review: Lot of rich history. the guides ae mostly useless. Distorting history. The place is not very clean. even outside is dirty, with lot of cow dung and clumsy shops. Administration should take care of such nice and lovely  historical places

title: Guide tour
review: Had a guided tour with Raoul , who seemed to know a lot and was able to show us round. This was great for our first visit.

title: Fort Trip
review: The fort is a living breathing marvel which has life of its own. With people residing in it, the charm of the fort is undeniable.

title: Golden Fort
review: very big live fort

title: Nice place
review: Good place. Must visit when in Jaisalmer. Requires a long walk. Not recommended for people with leg problems. But on request the security can arrange to drop on two wheeler till top.

title: Good place
review: it is interested place who like to see historical places , it is good place , attracts eveyrone , Hire guides also for understading place very well.

title: Living City within the walls
review: There might not be many forts around the world where an entire city exists with all its inhabitants. It's amazing to see how people are living in the same old houses, dating back 500 years (ofcourse with slightly modified interiors). The people who are living there belong to the families that inhabited the houses at the very beginning. No new comers allowed. No property can be sold and bought.

title: Nice though.
review: Well if you compare this fort to jodhpur fort I must say jodhpur fort is more beautiful then this ..

title: Amazing view of jaisalmer city.
review: There are many view points around the fort. It gives an amazing view of jaisalmer city. It gives an idea on the advantage the fort had as the people on the fort had a panoramic view of whats coming..

title: Rajasthan's only livining fort
review: The tour of the fort is great experience as it is still inhabited by people. Apart from the museum, the palaces and temples one can have a thrilling experience walking through the narrow lanes of this 860 years old fort, visiting the local shops, talking to the local people. One can find local handicrafts, clothes, jewelries at the numerous shops inside the fort. The Jain temple is a work of art that will spellbound you with its architecture and stone carvings. If one is interested, one can also find antiques at thorw away prices in some shops..

title: Sonar Quella
review: Seems that the Jaisalmer Fort had nothing to showcase other than the fact that Satyajit Ray made a film here. Since local people are allowed to stay inside the fort area it's too crowded and too dirty.

title: Epitomizes everything that's wrong with Rajasthan tourism. Extremely tough, for senior citizens.
review: it's a 'living' fort. Which means there's a whole township within the fort. This, by itself, makes it  quaint and interesting. But the muck and the chaos makes it quite unpleasant. There are hordes of riskshaws and guides that swarm all around you constantly. Travelling with senior citizens is an absolute no-no!There's a Jain temple, which we avoided. The palace inside, we were told by friends was nothing much to go by. All in all, quite a disappointment since this is about the only real deal in Jaisalmer - would one go all the way there just for this? I think not.

title: A live fort !!
review: This is only fort i have visited in India, which has common people living inside the fort. It is fun to explore the various walking streets, temples, king's palace- all inside the walls of a centuries old fort. Do spend half day here, it gets very hot in the afternoon, so plan a morning visit.

title: Walk through history
review: The Fort is like a time travel to Jaisalmer a few hundred years ago.

title: Like time matching
review: Jaisalmer Fort is like time a matching. When we visited there, we feel like we went back to that time.

title: Very interesting fort
review: Must visit place.One of the few living forts.With lots of history to learn,Slightly tiring but must visit place at Jaisalmer

title: Don't miss it!
review: A great place to visit particularly if not staying in the Fort itself.  It offers an opportunity to see how the locals live within the Fort.  There are many shops selling all sorts of local crafts, and the merchants love to say "Looking is free!"

title: Massive and must see
review: I personally liked the Bikaner, Jaipur Amber forts as well as the Mehrangarh forts better, this is still impressive and must see given the sheer scale of the fort and the fact that it could hold several thousands of people within its ramparts and was successfully hold off a 9-month siege

title: A movie set
review: From the first moment you see it you will be in awe of its magnificence. The cobbled streets, the gates, the climb all add to its charm. The narrow streets of the fort and the old city are a maze and amazing. Beautiful architecture as well as the Havelis and the Jain temples.

title: Good Heritage Place
review: Good heritage place.For maintainig the same,some portion of it given to shopkeepers.You can enjoy the view of the city.Lot of scenic points in the fort for taking photographs.Nicely maintained Jain temple is also there.Overall worth one time visit.

title: Lifetime Experience! Was Waiting to see this!!
review: This is one of the few living fort in India. It is huge and tourists may get confused inside. So I would prefer taking a guide.

title: Fort - open for all to stay
review: The only living fort in india, also known as sonar killa. Everyone will roam freely and found the best architecture and interiors inside the ford. All the houses and havelis inside the fort give the ancient feel. We stayed at Hotel Siddhartha, from outside one will find it ordinary but when you enter and stay inside the hotel you will feel that this is the best place to stay. Jain temple is inside the fort and the viewpoint with a cannon is awesome. You definitely want to visit there again and again.

title: A living gem.
review: While all the forts and palaces we visited in Rajasthan this had the added reward of still being used, inhahibited. This gave it a real life and vitality. The vendors are cheerful and didn't overwhelm me quite as much in other areas visited. A highlight for us was a visit to silversmiths; a business run by the same family for many generations. Their prices were considerably better than what we find in Australia and unlike much available at home was all crafted by hand.

title: so nice place nd palace
review: nice place and palace to good journey

title: Well Maintained
review: The most prominent and important sightseeing places in Jaisalmer. The fort is situated on a small hill, which could be accessed through auto rickshaws. The fort is well maintained and worth a visit. The artifacts and collections are well preserved and makes it a memorable place to visit. The palace tour takes about an hour.

title: Interesting few hours
review: The fort was worth spending a few hours exploring and the recorded tour was worth listening to. I didn't realise you needed a seperate ticket to show for the photos - i had paid but suspect the ticket guy kept the money. Just became a hastle every time a security guard sae my camera and asked to see it.

title: Royal feel undoubtedly Rich Indian heritage
review: It was undoubtedly the 2nd best thing after sand dunes stay in Jaisalmer. We started to cover the main sights we planned and we started with this fort.When we came out seeing the museum and the fort we all were simply amazed seeing how grand and well established was our INDIAN kings and their heritage. It was worth it's time. Better take camera ticket to avoid the best moments inside the fort.

title: A living Fort
review: The only fort where you see a living and vibrant life with restaurants, inns, hostels, houses, temples etc. Should surely try and stay within the Fort, there are multiple options at every price point. Shivas cafe and bas cafe are good. Great food at these places and also at vyas kitchen. Don't goto visit the palace museum, at 100rs entry fee, it's utterly worthless, only empty rooms to see. Patwa haveli outside the Fort is much better maintained, beware of the handicraft shop there. Try the dosa corner outside the Fort. Jaisal Italy is average food and very expensive. Try doing your own Sam dunes experience by hiring a car from hanuman travels and then calling up shaukat Ali Camel Driver, five him 500rs per camel and he'll take you for a two hr sunset dune ride, you can visit puldwara, bada baag etc on the way. The tent based safari which they sell to all tourists is pathetic. Hanuman travel also has a free bus ride to Tanot mata temple, everyday at 2pm from hanuman circle. Try eating at chandan sree as well

title: Nice fort.
review: Small city inside fort. Touristic but nice. Have a lot of guest house inside fort with good price from 100Rs.

title: Nice
review: It's a  beautiful fort to visit with very nice nd beautiful shops inside it.

title: Fantastic fort
review: The palace is very impressive. The fort is very beautiful and it's fully build with yellow stone. We can see living style of maharaj's.

title: Interesting fort but beware of guides
review: Our trip to Jaisalmer was everything we expected, but we felt that the guides were mainly interested in taking us to shops where they would receive commission.

title: Hotel Roop Mahal
review: this hotel's manager was very honesty& kindly. he arranged for camel safali . the fees was conscientiously . and camel safali was sowonderful.

title: royal
review: its is only living fort in india very old  n beautiful there are lot of shops in the fort itself but quit costlier at price

title: The oldest continually inhabited fort
review: Yes people have been living here for over 800 years. You won't find that anywhere else. Inside it is smaller than it looks.  I booked a room inside the fort to get the full experience.

title: Fort where villagers stay. Also, King with his family
review: Thus fort can b seen from anywhere in the jaisalmer (from main areas)...it has an entry fee and takes around 40-45 mins to visit the entire fort...50rs are for entry n guide will charge u another 50rs (if u want to)...u can also visit jain temple just few steps from fort and is in the vicinity only...

title: Big Kila of Raja Maharaja
review: I visited this place in last month I felt this place is all song construction of Raja Maharaja after coming here we fell that how there Lifestyle was how they were living how they were protecting their awards or there societies from there enemies as I went here there was this winter season going on but we felt very hot and surprise that in this kind of sort situation also how that killer was built up and how the other arms and animations replaced as they are hats off for such a great people thank you very much

title: India Tour September 2016
review: We booked a hotel within the Fort walls to experience what it would be like and were not disappointed.  Living in the Fort is like being transported back in time. The narrow streets with businesses each side, the temples and the beautiful buildings all around added to the experience. If you can arrange accommodation within the Fort , the quality of the accommodation may not be as classy as some outside but the 800 years of history within the walls makes up for it.

title: Beautiful architecture
review: The place has nice architecture..be aware of guides..and shop keepers. The place needs to be cleaned...parking is 50rs for no parking facility.

title: Stunning
review: A really breath-takingly beautiful fort with great views to the surrounding desert. It's a shame there's so much hassel from shops to buy things, but if you find a quiet rooftop cafe you can just sit and watch the world go by.

title: Sandstone, steps every turn led to another revelation and history
review: You can walk this on the cobblestones to the top or you can take a Tuktuk once inside the old fort you can choose to do "your own thing & explore" the palace & Jain temple or take a guide. We took a guide well worth the cost who explained the history and each of the rooms we entered into the palace. At the very top confronted by a stunning view over Jaisalmer. The Jain Temple an intricate temple of carvings is well worth the explore. The living city you could spend hours exploring although I think one could loose themselves easily.   There are lots of shops selling beautiful Rajasthani wares, like pillow slips, hand painted cotton fabric, or hand beaten silver... take your time to explore

title: Good to see old heritage still maintained
review: Large area well maintained in olden traditional style. Jain temple is very good. A good guide helps a lot.

title: Good thing to visit but not like other big forts of Rajasthan
review: Small a good Fort...

title: Beautiful
review: I visited this place which is called the golden city and which a beautiful construction built 800 years ago

title: Good fort with people living in!
review: Given that this is a tourist place... I would expect it much better maintained... Especially coming from other tourist places in Rajasthan! But it is really good experience for people who are not used to smaller streets.

title: Shonar Kella
review: If you come to Jaisalmer, you must visit this fort. This small city grows up base on this fort. This fort has the attachment of popular detective series - Feluda. The story and cinema " Shonar Kella" is based on this places. Be aware of footpath shopping here.

title: Nice...
review: Diffrent from many other forts in india . We found it little strange that people are actually living inside it when it's not like that in other forts .

title: Awsm
review: The fort is very nice. And the parsi temple is best. Very awsm sculpture in there. The museum also very interesting.

title: Jaisalmer fort.. golden Fort
review: It is a beautiful fort and the living fort . People still reside here. It's made of yellow stones found in Jaisalmer and thus is also called the Golden Fort . It's huge and architecture of rooms is awesome. The living style of  maharajas and queens is clearly seen here. It's better if you take a guide there .

title: Fantastic
review: The Palace is very impressive and I am so glad to see that there is preservation happening there. They have audio tours in several languages that come with admission. You must pay an additional 100 rupees to take photos. And you are required to put a 2000 rupee deposit on each audio tour. The audio is informative. The flow of the tour gets a little crazy in spots. My biggest complaint is that some of the stairs are very large steps and there are no handrails so you have to hold on to the wal...and the wall is absolutely black from fingerprints. The tour will take you about an hour.

title: Amazing fort
review: This is a worth visit .. Very nice fort .. Best thing in jaisalmer... You come to know the way kings used to live n connect yourself with the history

title: Eccellent
review: I aware about Queen Harish through India got tallent show..but on 23rd night in Sand sam..I had seen live in our MES builders programme. .oh its excellent...after that I am a big fan of queen harish...and my daughter also enjoyed too much ....Queen Harish may god bless u and go ahead and fill dance in our soul...our best wishes with u....you r like "RASOGOLLA"... traditional sweet of our Bengal...If u came to Bhutan..or Siliguri...pl cont through my email .Thanks .

title: Fabulous place
review: The Jaisalmer fort is a historical fort also known as golden fort. Golden fort is world famous fort. In fort there is a museum, palace of king and queen and homes of local people.

title: A breath taking view of jaisalmer
review: Worth seeing the fort in early hours of the day. follow the signs to cover the entire palace.. The yellow stones are the best attractions of the fort.  Those having breathing problems please take a mask with you since the smell of bats is very strong inside.

title: Most beautiful fort i have seen
review: Of all the forts this one is the best. Surprising ly it houses thousands of people inside. Every corner has something new, the commercial isation takes a part of the beauty away, but imagining that era 400 years ago just makes it fabulous.

title: Stunning architecture
review: What an amazing place. People still work and live within the tiny winding streets - which are great to explore. There are some brilliant cafes to find which offer striking views.

title: Interesting place to visit and walk around
review: Its quite interesting to walk inside the fort. The small lanes are filled with small shops, temples, some beautiful architecture, people's homes, guesthouses and restaurants.worth a visit.

title: Worth the view
review: Take a guide and notice how they take you such a route that you cannot do it yourself next time :) Remember Rs. 300 - 500 they charge. Take a tuk tuk pay 120 for fort 200 including the havelis. Not all well maintained and very much over keen to fleece all of them

title: Massive fort livened up with rich Rajasthani history
review: Jaisalmer fort , also called the Sonar Qila, is a must visit attraction in the city. A massive fort, it is the only fort in India which is still inhabited by residents (~5,000 people live inside the fort). The tour of the fort easily takes 2-3 hours and having a guide would enrich your experience while visiting the fort. There are lot of historical artifacts on display and you can just gape in amazement imagining the lives of the Rajwaras. There is also a place where Ranis did the johar and even an underground tunnel - which definitely gave me goosebumps.

title: Wright Place Golden Fort
review: Good place if you visit the unique Golden Fort of Rajasthan. Museum situated in this place of Raja Mahal at fort

title: Beautiful place
review: Beautiful place and free entrance. It is nixe to walk between the streets and feel like century before.

title: Sonar Qila !!
review: Go visit the fort as there is not much in the city to go around. The fort is made of yellowsandstone like the whole city of Jaisalmer. Take a guide, it is not much expensive but good to take for information.

title: its lively fort
review: good to experience the living fort...everything is there hotels ,houses, shops ,food ,music , dance and many more.....

title: Fantastic
review: After lots of travelling in busy cities it was really nice to be able to walk through the quiet streets of Jaisalmer. The residents were friendly, it's kept relatively cool by the houses and it's an interesting way to spend a day

title: Awesome
review: I have a very good experience in this only living fort in India. So this one is completely different from other forts of India.

title: Marvelous piece of architecture in Golden City
review: This fort is built in yellow sandstone and is still inhabited by people.  People belonging to different caste and religion dwell in harmony within this fort.  The fort also has temples, bazaar and food outlets.  From the top of the fort, spectacular views of Jaisalmer city is seen.

title: Very nice fort
review: This fort is really so beautiful. And also antic fort.so many people living in side.also hotel  restaurant shop .you can see jain temple Maharaja palace and maharani place.

title: Okayish
review: Jaisalmer fort gives good city view. preferably hire the guide otherwise you might get lost in the way. Also I found it little commercialized place..

title: Awesome
review: The Best experience I had in India. Padam picked me up from te station at 5:00am and this is just The

title: A nice place to walk around.
review: The fort in Jaisalmer is very nice, but compared to other forts in India it is okay.

title: Good architecture but dirty area
review: The fort is fort cum residential town. The fort area is a open public place however there are Raja and Rani Mahal with entry ticket costing 100/- each. Good if you want to know what, where and how the king/ queen used to do things.

title: Imoressive fort raised above the centre of the city
review: Enjoyed walking into the fort area. Did not visit the fort itself but the inner walked area I'd quite nice to walk around and check out the shops and cafes and viewpoints. Unique in this respect as there is quite a population living inside the walls.

title: A beautiful location to visit and stay
review: On arrival in Jaisalmer I asked the rickshaw drive to take me to the fort. I was lucky enough to stumble across Surya hotel, right in the walls of the fort. Stunning views from the rooftop and a stone's throw from the winding streets, palaces and temples to be found in the fort. If you go to Jaisalmer staying in the fort area is a must.

title: It is a Fort City
review: I couldn't believe that so many families continue to stay in this fort. An evening walk through the street is mesmerizing.

title: A magnificent fort reduced to a Mohalla
review: Jaisalmer Fort, one of the largest fortifications in the world and what could have been a wonder of the world has most sadly been reduced a mohalla occupied by local inhabitant, making the historical fort a commercial place with hotels, restaurants, houses. The modernity has badly washed away the rich architecture and heritage of the place. Though, it can be argued that it would have been a huge waste not to utilise such a huge area for dwelling and commercial purpose, but then such a historical and unique monument is an absolute rarity and must be preserved as such. Extremely sad to see the state of such a historical beauty.

title: Awesome Place - Jaisalmer Fort
review: It's one of the largest Fortifications in the World and it's A UNESCO WORLD HERITAGE SITE and it's called as the Golden City and it's one of Rajasthan's biggest Tourist destination. One must visit this place through the Camel Ride in the surrounding Thar Desert it's really awesome.

title: Beautiful
review: I had a planned trip so the only attraction i visited in jaisalmer is this beautiful golden fort  And i loved this place. The ravishing and marvelous structure stunned me .

title: Nice fort, good history, best guide
review: The fort was mostly the usual, old artifacts, big rooms and a history to tell. Standouts attractions are the cut work in stones on the entire fort, the Jain temple and the old shop having collection of some of the rarest stone types you could ever see. But most amazing was our guide, some Purohit, who kept the 2 hour stroll in sun interesting.

title: " Really interesting Golden fort"
review: I love the Golden fort. It's have lots of things like temples and place.

title: Very artistic fort
review: One of the best fort. The architecture is very different. guided tour is must. Its nice to see a people living inside the fort. Very historic place.

title: Wow
review: Stunning place. Hot weather but low humidity. long way to get here but worth it!  The fort itself is filled with places to see. And the view from the numerous restaurants on the edges of the walls is beautiful.

title: Sonar Kella
review: Jaisalmer Fort, known as "Sonar Kella" in Bengal because of Satyajit Ray's movie of the same name being shot there,is the only living fort in India with over 4000 people living there. Sonar Kella means golden fort. The whole of Jaisalmer, including the fort is made of golden sandstone and is rightly called the golden city. It holds a special place in the heart of people living in Bengal. And it is truly magnificent. Words are not enough to describe its beauty and glory. That can only be experienced by visiting it.

title: magic fort!
review: I've seen lots of palaces and forts in India but this is one of the best! Audioguide perfect and free!

title: Only the leaving fort in the world
review: Golden fort is the only in world leaving fort.and in jaisalmer you find most beautyfull stone carving more batter then wood.beautyful dessert camel safari and pleasent night stay in sam send dunes.

title: Ramesh Chander
review: Sonar Quilla.. Yellow stone build. A must for every visitors. Still inhabited by early residents. Lot of eateries offering over looking view of yellow city. This is a desert city having shifting dune under 50 Kms with desert camps

title: Ancient fort with loads of history...
review: Beautiful fort and super view if the town when u reach the zenith of the fort. My suggestion is to hire a guide who can tell u a lil about the fort and the story behind. They charge rs.100 for the fort as well as the Jain temple inside the fort premises.

title: Exceptional experience
review: This fort is unlike any other fort in India, in the sense that it is occupied by commoners as opposed to being royal property/museum/hotel. Everything that Jaisalmer has to offer, can be found inside this fort, be it shopping, sight seeing, local food, culture, you name it.

title: Exploring jaisalmer . First stop and a must visit..
review: A magnificent fort..inhabited by people and restaurants... The desert safari is good and must do.. Look around the haveli.. Enjoy food and culture

title: Jasilmair
review: Very beautiful place. The Golden city is the nickname for Jasilmair. In the Fort you will see the combination of religious beliefs and the Hindu art

title: Nice fort but too much hassle
review: The fort is lovely from the outside and in. A shame that there is so much hassle going into the fort. Shops are everywhere. They should make the whole place scooter free!

title: Golden fort
review: Its been a long wish to be here. Read about it in childhood in Feluda's adventure. Its a fort where common people also live. You can get room in different hotels situated inside the fort. S you can feel how it like to be inside a fort area as a resident.

title: Beautiful Monument but too commercialised
review: We went to Sam dunes in Dec 2015 and visited Jaisalmer fort during the stay. It is a beautiful monument with well preserved heritage, in fact it is a living fort (a township where the descendants of original inhabitants still live). There are shops, temples, houses, restaurants and markets inside; which is different from other Indian forts I had seen. You will be amazed if you are a cultural enthusiast. But if you are an avid shopper and have time, do pay a visit to market outside, en route to Patwon ki haveli which is at walking distance from from the fort.

title: Nice place
review: If u r in jaisalmer, u shud visit this place. U can buy aome typical rajasthani stuff for friwnds n family.

title: One of a kind
review: GOOD,the streets are narrow but very easy to walk,the people are friendly,good shopping outside the fort.had some hot dosas and Cold lassi.you get great stuff made of camel skin which can be bargained and take them as gifts.

title: Nice views
review: The fort is just 1 minut far from the market, there are excellent views from there, you can see all jaisalmer from the top. However there are a lot of little boutiques and people trying to sell their ites, too much touristic.

title: Very nice view spots! :)
review: I suggest you to find a perfect spot with a nice view and tasteful chai and just enjoy and relax! Cause there is nothing too much to see, but it is still one of the must see places in Jaisalmer.

title: Great from the outside; very dirty inside
review: The iconic "Sonar Kella" or Golden Fortress as described by Satyajit Ray in his movie with the same title. Made of yellow limestone, its pretty big. You have to leave your car outside and take an auto as the lanes inside are very narrow. In some places you can barely walk. This fort unlike other forts in Rajasthan has hundreds of families living inside.

title: Sonar kila or jaisalmer fort ...must visit
review: Good place to visit. A whole village is there inside this fort. Jain temple is also part of this fort . From here you can see whole city. And when you are in city you can see the whole fort outline. Shopping can be done here. Restaurants are there ,basically a small city in the heart of jaisalmer.

title: Stunning
review: The best example I have seen of a living Fort. We stayed in a guest house within the fort and spent many hours walking the narrow streets and taking lots of photos. Its is touristy though so expect every shop owner to try to get you onto their shop, a polite no normally works and they tend to recognise you after a couple of days.

title: Maze
review: Beautiful fort and view of the city! A lot of shops where you can buy souvenirs and clothes for the camel safari. It's nice to walk around and get lost in the narrow streets which are not on maps.

title: Fantastic Fort
review: Great place to visit with your friends and family.. The view of Jaisalmer city from rooftop is marvellous. cheap and best hotels inside the Fort..

title: Second Living fort in India
review: Most of the people went to Jaisalmer to see this fort. This is one of the living fort where people lives with their families. Some of the part is considered as meuseum. But once you visit this fort, it will give you a feeling of king. There is a entry fee too.

title: Goldan city is most popular
review: Jaisalmer city is really golden city and sonar fort musiam is so nay and fort in all old antic aitam it's really most popular this fort I am a visit again

title: Historical Fort + Market
review: OVERVIEW: A great structure, which was maze-like. It was quite the adventure.

title: Trip down the culture lane
review: This fort is the only fort in the world to have people still live inside it. I visited there at night and the quiet and peace inside it was the perfect lullaby. The people we met could all speak fluent English and guided us throughout the entire fort and one kind lady told us about the culture if people in Jaisalmer.

title: Awsome place
review: it is just a awsome place the yellow city. fort is full of antique stachus and war items is has very big manual old tanks and musium is just mind blowing.

title: Breathtaking View
review: The palace is located on a hill, as they all are.

title: Little golden fort
review: The fort is in the centre of the town. People live within the fort, making it very different to other forts. The fort is small and fun to get lost in. Not much else to do other than the temples.

title: Beautiful, must visit
review: Really enjoyed wondering around this beautiful place! Residents are friendly and merchants not too pushy. Lots of beautiful things to look at for shoppers, lots of beautiful architecture, and exquisite views. We didn't go into the museum or the three big havelis but weren't missing out according to someone who did.

title: Golden Beauty in Thar desert
review: Among all the forts we loved this one the most because of it colour.It is made of yellow sandstone and because of this it is very cool inside the fort.Since we visited end of the year it was very windy and the climate was awesome.People live inside the fort and there are many shops where you can buy decorative items.you can enter the fort without paying anything.The view from the top is fantastic.It is listed under world heritage site.Jaisalmer is a lovely and very relaxing place with a great small-town feel.You can buy ethinic silver jewellery,scarves ,shawls,bags,jholas,pendants,earrings etc. Best time to visit is winter.Summers are unbearable and climatically bad.

title: A Living History
review: One of the amazing places one would visit in Jaisalmer. The fort is reminiscent of the glorious past it holds. Narrow meandering walk-able streets and local shops alongside - gives a perfect feel of the then era. You may spot locals in their traditional attire and wonder how was it then...

title: jain temple and museum inside!
review: this is one fort in INDIA where i seen people living inside up there!

title: Visit
review: The fort has its charm but like many heritage sites in india it's neglected and is very dirty at places. The administration should take care of its assets.

title: A Heritage Fort
review: What strikes you first, at this fort is it's old traditions (warrior clans). Though modern day ethics may not be in agreement with what happened in those days, history remains as it occurred.

title: A real lived in fort
review: The amazing thing about this fort is that it is still lived in. There is nothing sterile and museum like - it's a bustling commercial community within the walls.

title: Gigantic and Historic
review: This place is amongst one of the world heritage sites in India. The only place where people are living - common man. This fort is filled with shops, restaurants and homes. Its huge, disappointing to see that its not well maintained in-spite of being world heritage site.

title: Main Attractionn
review: Jaisalmer fort is one main attraction to visit jaisalmer. that is very huge we went 2 days to cover full fort to see. in one day is difficult to watch complete. talk with local residence and some shopping. it great time to spend....and the food we ate in one cafe is awesome, and the quotes was also good on wall in cafe....

title: Good
review: Good to see in one time very nicely made in hight.  Small but crowded  fort. Small decorrated shops  with full of people    i enjoyed lots  and will come once again to visit jaisalmer

title: Experience the Historical Architecture with modern living
review: One can experience the Historical Architecture with modern living to visit Jaisalmer Fort. I personally dont like to see residents are changing or modulate the architecture outside and inside of their living area of this fort.

title: Amazing stay
review: In a city centre. Chokhi Dhani the palace hotel really a very good hotel to stay.  Very good friendly staff. And warm welcome feel me royal.  Very delicious food  specious room  good ambiaion  and a swimming pool is telex to me.  Definitely. I will visit once again .  Keep it VB up

title: Fort is nice
review: We love walking In fort.we visit in Jain temple and we love to shopping  inside the fort.view from the fort of city amazing.

title: Worth a visit
review: IF you are looking to explore the older parts of Jaisalmer, and a historic touch, then you must visit it. It's wonderful how people even live inside the fort, ad there are shops, temples etc. the view form the cannon point is beautiful. All the buildings are in one color, and the stuff they sell ad wear is so colorful, and the contrast is amazing! The Jain temple also has some excellent carvings.

title: One of its kind..... worth visiting more than once.
review: Worth visit in winter only .... preferably during Oct - Feb so that we can enjoy SAM and other sightseeing in the sun.

title: Golden Fort - An Unique masterpiece
review: Built on 1156 AD, this fort built of golden sandstone is one of the largest fortified city with fulltime habitants. This massive structure is a true masterpiece. The fort looks awesome from a distance standing tall amidst the Thar desert. At night the illuminated fort looks heavenly. The fort is about half a kilometre long and 250 metre wide built on a hillock at a height of 250 feet . Once you go inside a lraf of history will unfold. The fortressed toen have houses, shops, temple, ruins and a 3 star hotel as well. The major places to see is the royal palace, Lazminath temple, havelis. One must come here to see something you never fond anywhere in the world. Must experience in your lifetime.

title: Very beautiful fort but poorly maintained
review: Get the audio guides, they are handy and informative. The fort itself is free to enter but the palace has an entrance fee. From the top of the palace, you have a great view over the city.

title: Mi favourite fort in Rajasthan!
review: After visiting all the major forts in the region, I have to say this one was the most different from Udaipur, Jodhpur and Jaipur. The streets are quieter and barely any traffic - which is much appreciated!!

title: Must see
review: One of the largest living fort in the country. Very beautiful and one of the must see place. However, it becomes very commercialized.

title: Impressive fort
review: Fort was great but loads of touts. The Jain temples in the fort were nice but they try and suck money out of you at every turn; pay for the ticket outside, the priest looks for a donation inside, not allowed to wear shoes so you have to pay someone to mind them! Our guide had the typical set up of bringing us to a craft shop where you are pressured into buying stuff and they her commission.

title: A visit to a glorious heritage: Jaisalmer Fort.
review: A unique 250 feet tall living fort built by sandstones, honeycombed with narrow, winding lanes, lined with houses and temples

title: Nice on the outside, commercialised on the inside
review: The fort is quite a large and impressive structure from a far, one of the main attractions to Jaisalmer. Inside is windy narrow roads with really interesting architecture and some nice views from the walls. There's also a fair share of cows wandering about. However after 5 mins you quickly realise it's pretty much just shops and cafes. The people working there aren't as pushy as other places in India, but when you've seen one souvenir shop you've seen them all!

title: A Living Fort
review: The Jaisalmer Fort is located in the centre of the Jaisalmer city.  This is a living fort which means it is inhabited by people. It's the only Fort in India where people can be seen still staying inside the fort. The fort is made in yellow sand stone and has magnificent architecture. View of the city from the top of the fort is spectacular.  There are temples, restaurants, shops etc. inside the fort.

title: Too much hassling
review: Looks amazing from a distance but once inside you get constantly hassled. Once we found our way high up on the wall it was much more pleasant with great views over Jaisalmer and the surrounding desert.

title: Gorgeous with lovely temples and ahops
review: Lots of hawkers trying to bring you to their shops for a look and beggar children and ladies to get past to get In but worth it. Lovely temples and gorgeous little shops and lanes to wander around.

title: Great spot for pictures
review: Take the best sunrise and sunset pictures from restaurants at the top of the fort. Also would recommend to stay in one of the guesthouses inside of it.

title: The golden glory
review: the jaisalmer golden fort is one of best fort forever i been well carved golden sand stone ,,Big huge gate and very good looking fort wall i seen they are people are livening in this fort Royal castle are so beautyful,each house of fort give us story of their past,i enjoy my walk arround fort wall

title: Amazing historical fort - must visit
review: Enjoyed every moment inside the fort especially seeing life inside the fort in today's world. Take a guide as it will help you understand the place and its minute details. Would have loved to stay inside the fort for a night.

title: Rajasthan Royal palace
review: As you get down the train in Jaisalmer station  ,you are able to view the palace The view after getting down makes you feel that you need to go to this palace immediately. Fort depicts lot of happiness around . Jaisalmer Raja's had  given his people to stay in this palace and Raja stayed in separate palace . This makes us feel how much the Raja had taken care of his people

title: History, Heritage
review: Liked the place, it was just okay, not too great. Liked the doors and windows and facades, some of the paintings inside. Overall an okayish place

title: Jaisalmer Fort – breathtaking sight
review: Breathtaking sight: a massive sandcastle.Its sandstone walls are a sight to behold. This fort saw many a battle in its heyday and is now a living fort. About a quarter of city's population still lives inside the fort. Do remember to visit the magnificent Raj Mahal Palace, the Jain temples with intricate carving and the lovely Laxminath temple inside the fort.

title: Walking thru the Jaisalmer Fort
review: While in Jaisalmer ,walking through the Jaisalmer Fort was an excellent experience.The temple inside the fort are well kept up and display excellent architecture.Must visit attraction.

title: Jaisalmer
review: As our Traveller entered the vicinity of Jaisalmer, the landscape changed. We stopped at Pokhran to have some evening snacks and tea. The sun was preparing itself to bid adieu to us. Being from the eastern part of India I was not accustomed to seeing the sun so late into the evening. The sky looked awesome; purple, orange, crimson all mixed. In that glow, the setting seemed straight out of a Texas movie.

title: Beautifull view and architecture!
review: Lovely view, nice streets for walking through (lots of shade) with a lot of shops, restaurants and hotels. Would recommend going to the free cannon view points, it's not really needed to go to a restaurant for the view.

title: Must see
review: I went there with my husband and I enjoyed over there. I saw museum and had lunch in Fort restaurant. It was a good experience we had.

title: Sonar kella
review: Really golden fort...sonar kella. Its a fair inside the fort...temples,souvenir shops,food stalls,hotels and what not.dont forget to bargain while buying from the shops and also with the auto drivers. Offers great view of jaisalmer. Sunset time is the best. But needs a bit more maintenance in terms of cleanliness.

title: Great views
review: Walk the fort by yourself, don't go for a guide. We walked relaxed and discovered the fort ourselves. And visit the fort itself. The view is breathtaking

title: Easily lost!
review: Great walking through all the winding little streets and closes, finding little vantage points of the town below and great sunset vantage points.. Loads of shopping opportunities but be beware these guys are amazing sales people!... Even if you don't want anything, you'll somehow before you realise it have bought something!

title: The golden fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is the only fort in the world which still houses thousands of families. The jain temples inside are mesmerizing. The architecture is truly a treat to watch.

title: Sight seen
review: Awesome.  It's a nice historic Fort. Good architecture. The fort is one of the best seen. We stayed in Hotel Tokyo Palace. This is the best hotel in my Indian trip. I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: "Well maintained &very clean "
review: One of the most splendid fort we have seen so far in rajasthan. We were surprised to see that people are still living here. We were told that this is the only fort where that many people are living. Even though it was very clean  and well maintained. View from the roof is great.

title: Beware the Camera Fee Collectors
review: Moderately architecturally interesting; nothing lavish or exceptionally well preserved. Worth the hour to walk thru? Possibly. The roof top view, being the highest building in the fort, is pretty cool.

title: A Fort with a heart
review: Everybody knows this is the last fort you will see at the western end of India. Its also called the Golden fort due to the stones that have been used to build it. When the suns shines on it, the fort looks like a Jewel. But this is not the best part . This is the only fort in which, people still live . Around 5000 people . There are active shops, a water management system, library , Mandirs, and what not. There are hotels too . I had a super time venturing around the lanes of the fort . It's fun to explore it without any guidance. If you love forts, this one is promising to be the most amusing.

title: Top city choice
review: Fort had some population and it get health and wealth condition, easy approach from any corner of the city, tickets not so expensive. and museum have good history speaker posters that blows all in it.

title: Do visit, take the audio tour
review: Fabulous history and great architecture. Highly recommend the audio tour, avoid the local guides. It is fascinating that in a place like Jaisalmer where the weather is so hot and arid always they built something as fabulous as this. The view from the top of the fort is excellent.

title: This fort is simply magnificent!
review: The jellow stone of the fort is just magnificent. It is a must-see if you are travelling around Jaisalmer.

title: A truly golden fort
review: I visited this fort last year.  It is said this fort is made without using water.  Fort is situation on high altitude.  You can see entire Jaisalmer,  if you are on the roof of fort.  You can get gauds near  the fort.  Architecture of fort and its golden color attracts you to click couple of pics. People of Jaisalmer give you heart touching hospitality. Best time to visit is from October to March. Don't go between May to August.

title: An impressive historic site that should not be missed
review: They reckon this amazing place is sinking each year, so you might not have too long to visit.

title: Dancing in June
review: It is quiet this time of year. It is also very hot. Wandering around the narrow streets, enclosed by high walled buildings gave a peaceful feel about the place. It also gave a cooler feel.

title: Good
review: Good place but many people are living in the fort. It's must see place in jaisalmer. The view of golden city form fort was excellent.

title: Very good
review: Nice golden fort and verry verry old in side mini city never look this kind of fort

title: The Golden city fort -another day another fort and all unique
review: We did a wonderful trip around Rajasthan and every day it seemed we were in another city with another incredible fort, with fascinating stories. A guide a must have to hear fables and understand the workings of the fort and the people who live and have lived in it. Don't miss.

title: T
review: The Golden fortress, indeed true to its name, hv been to Rajasthan previously but never seen anything like this before... it takes less than couple of hours to cover this entire area.. the palace museum and jain temple and there are settlements with in the fortress..

title: Jaisalmer  fort
review: Jaisalmer is very nic palace very nic tourism palace and very nice hotels in jaislmer and very testy food

title: My new favorite place
review: The Jaisalmer fort has outstanding architecture and I was amazed by how well the fort is preserved. In the fort one can also find multiple panoramic view points. Next to the beautiful architecture of the homes in the fort itself, the fort also houses various temples that are definitely worth visiting. Foreign tourists need to pay an extra entrance fee but I don't believe anyone would regret visiting the fort and its temples. It almost feels a bit magical!

title: golden fort
review: as depicted by the name , the fort shines like gold in day light and one of the most beautiful fort that you can see in rajasthan . you can also hangout at the cafes inside the fort and see the view of the city from the window

title: Family tour
review: Jaisalmer fort is historical place where we can acknowledge the  history of India. We can see the whole city view from fort.

title: Good and big place
review: Good and very big fort. This is the only living fort in india that is in this fort general public reside. That is why you will doing lot of Restaurent and hotels in fort. Overall fort is good .

title: Good fort to visit
review: Main attraction if you are visiting Jaisalmer city. You need around 5 hours at your disposal if you are visiting this fort. Suggest take decent and knowledgeable guide who can escort you.

title: Gulguli
review: Killo jordar hai ....in local language...as dey say....killa is awesome.... historic place....had an awesome experience...

title: Huge Fort
review: it was marvellous and huge. You need enough time to visit the fort at ease. I had visited in Feb, 2015. the local people over there are so kind and helpful.

title: "Cool Historic Place"
review: Amazing Experience......

title: Nice !
review: Nice place for sightseeing at Jaisalmer. Hire a guide and see around all the places. Do it on foot and eat at the Italian restaurants around it.

title: Amazing Jaisalmer Fort
review: Jaisalmer Fort has been built from yellow stones by it's ruler and looks like golden coloured Fort,  hence it is also known as Sonar Killa. Visiting this Fort is a memorable moment.

title: Golden Fort
review: Very splendid and marvelous construction, embedded balconies, overlapped terrace floors are very amazing things to remember.

title: Nice fort!
review: It's a nice fort to visit if you are around in Jalsalmer. Many citizens live in the fort. The museum is interesting, the building itself and the views from the fort are awesome.

title: Fort View
review: Intricate designs made of sandstone. The guide was excellent and gave us a full description of the history of the Maharajas.

title: GOOD EXPERIENCE
review: Amazzzzzzzzing I see golden fort. Excellent. Inside many home and many shops.. but very nice. Nice city view.. I love jaisalmer fort.

title: Indeed a Golden Fort
review: As soon as I step inside the fort I forgot about any unpleasant experience encountered in the adjacent streets, like the lack of a sewerage system in Jaisalmer...

title: Really Beautiful
review: Fort is really beautiful and really big. so carry your water bottle and camera with you. Then starting roaming and enjoying.

title: THE GOLDEN CITY FORT
review: jaisalmer the golden city have a beautiful fort made of sandstone. visited the fort on 01.01.2016 the guide hired by us gave full detail of the fort. visitors are advised to bring camera and water bottle as much time is required to see the fort.

title: local's hub and temples inside
review: There is an entire village residing inside the fort. Too many locals and shops inside. that makes fort very busy. there are many temples inside. Some of them have good carvings on walls.

title: Beautiful fort
review: This is a well maintained fort. Amazing views as it is situated on a hill. the walk may be a little tiring but its worth it. There are elephant rides to help you, but long queues for them.

title: good
review: all forts are same but you can see that entire village is inside fort

title: Best Fort in Rajasthan
review: Wow what nice work on sand stone wondering that is how build it and only problem Is that this is leaving Fort if people not leave then this is best Fort in world

title: Hill top fort - Simply amazing
review: Jaisalmer fort can seen from anywhere around the city. Its huge and almost accommodates a small old town inside. The best place to see the fort from outside is after sunset. the lights around the fort walls make the fort glow. Anyhow all the touirists visiting jaisalmer would visit this place without miss. But not many would have witnessed the night view. Don't miss it.

title: Cool historic place
review: I recently spent a month in Jaisalmer and enjoyed walking around the narrow streets of the contained city inside the fort. You can find almost anything there! Highly recommended.

title: The grandeur of Jaisalmer
review: One of the most popular attractions in Jaisalmer as can be understood from the name . Features really beautiful architecture , taking us back in time . Definitely visit this place if in Jaisalmer . It would be preferable if you visit in winters for a better weather .

title: Golden City,
review: It is just beyond one's imagination that even in this highly inhospitable climatic conditions, our ancestors lived such rich and meaningful life. The Jain temple within the Forte is THE BEST I have seen all over India, and believe me I have seen most of them -Dilwara to Ranakpur and others. Nothing can beet the golden bricks which can be of use only in Jaiselmer!! In twenty first century we cannot stand the weather there, but hundreds of years ago people learnt to make merry in may be worst climatic conditions. God bless them. A Must Visit place this Jaiselmer is.

title: Another architectural beauty of Rajasthan!
review: From my hotel (Royal haveli) the fort was pretty much walk-able, I found myself walking thru the streets while I was heading towards the entrance. It took me 1 hour to have a complete round of palace, I liked it. Unlike many other forts in Rajasthan, people are living inside the fort premises.

title: Imponent Fortress
review: A big imponent fortress. A lot of people are living inside its walls, but to be true there is not much see but the construction itself. You must visit it anyway. Don't get lost.

title: It's really worth visiting
review: It was our family outing on weekend. Can not explain in words. In Bengal this fort is called SONAR KELLA means GOLDEN FORT. it's true. With sunlight it's look like a golden fort.

title: Must go there!
review: You must go there to see how the people live inside the fort. Try to go in the morning to the Jain temples and later to the sunset point.

title: Romantic fort
review: Its was nice experience to visit jaisalmer fort. So romantic and nice shop to visit .

title: Living fort
review: This is the only living fort in asia  shops are so good but little costly. Be aware of roadside people advertising their hotels n restaurant even for shops they are commission agent

title: History by day...mystique by night!
review: Nice fort. Good history. You take a three-wheeler to the heart of the fort (unless you have the whole day and you can walk all the way).

title: The Golden Fort
review: Known as the golden fort it spreads over a huge area. Made of yellow stone it gives a feeling of gold when polished. Presently there are 2 main attractions inside the fort - The fort museum and Jain temple. This fort also presently house about 4000 families.

title: Cool fort
review: Amazing place with lots of history!  Definitely worth a visit in jaiselmer.  GET A GUIDE!  you'll appreciate the place more.

title: Beautiful Living Fort
review: This fort is a living fort and preserving the heritage of India. One can room around by bike as it is pretty big. Have many things to explore along with shops to do shopping. Also, having options to dine out local cuisines. If you are in Jaisalmer then this should be your first place to visit.

title: Traveling back in time...
review: Jaisalmer Fort has o lot to offer! From old town and Rajmahal Palace to Jain Temples and famous havelis. You can spend hours walking around and never be bored. The best thing you can do is to spend a few nights within the Fort walls instead of in one of many hotels outside the Fort. Waking up in the morning inside the Fort is like traveling back in time a few centuries. It is priceless!

title: Romantic if only a little dirty.
review: I've been here twice in the last 7 years, both times staying inside the fort.  My second time was during the hot season and the bright yellow stones in the fort made the heat quite intense.  Also many stores and restaurants are closed during this low season.

title: beautiful !
review: should visit with family in winter break only, as this open and one needs to travel a  lot to viist all the rooms, temples  market areas inside the palace

title: The best fort in world
