review: This fort best in the world bcoz this fort residense fort,they are 5000 people living in the fort,in fort there are nice view of the city.i enjoy lot in this fort ,there are many historical temple an shop on this fort.i enjoy the moment were wind and resort.

title: Stunning architecture
review: Loved the fort, we stayed at a hotel in the fort and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.  Lots of restaurants, shops etc.  we stayed in April and it was extremely hot 46oC on our last day.  Thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience.  Tuk tuk were readily available to take us up and down and reasonably priced 100 rupee

title: Grand- Takes you back in time
review: It's the only Fort which is still inhabited by people. Though all parts are not well maintained (some of it has just collapsed) as it faces excess pressure on its infra.

title: Don't stay in the fort until water issues have been resolved
review: The fort is so interesting as it's still inhabited unlike most of the forts in Rajasthan. The palace museum has a good audio guide too that I'd recommend getting. In it they describe how the water usage in the fort is damaging the foundations of the fort so it is wise not to stay inside the fort walls until the irrigation issues have been solved

title: what a amazinggggg fort on hill called trikut moutain
review: in golden city jaisalmer  the one place where people mostly want to walk is called sonar killa .there was 2 palace beautifully desgned by art one of queen palace another is king palace

title: Expensive for what you see, nothing inside !
review: The fee is 500 Rps, there is nothing to see inside, it is more beautifull from outside, and there are no furnitures or anything...better to visit the avelis!!

title: In very bad state
review: People residing inside the fort have ruined the charm of the fort. everywhere garbages. gutters flowing. smelly.

title: Great fort !!! But the area around is not clean
review: A huge fort ....perhaps biggest in India..can be seen from all around Jaisalmer.

title: A live-in fort with a different experiance
review: This is perhaps the only Fort in India where there are housing colonies and people habitats. Best time to visit is during sunrise. You get amazing views of the city. Take a walk throughout the fort and spend some 3 hours here. Visit the Jain temple inside.

title: palace made of gold
review: hello every one.i  love this fort.its a very nice fort.inside this fort many hotels and restaurant which made it more interesting.

title: Must visit is you are in jaiselmer
review: This is a must visit if you are is jaiselmer .the beauty is the fort houses around 3k people and has many shops and guest houses inside.You can take auto if you can't climb the fort

title: Beautiful
review: Unique mud colored fort still inhabited . accessible through three wheelers probably the best way to reach . 1 to 2 hrs trip. Also has exhibits of yesteryears . Not too big like some of the other forts . The fort complex also has some hotels resturant s market temples .

title: amazing beauty of jaisalmer
review: jaisalmer fort is really heritage look, i like so much, i was visit this fort, in side of fort so many people are living,so many hotels in side of fort, i was visit this fort with INDIA TOUR DRIVER agency best driver Mr.Raj kumar, he show me so many amazing thing of this fort.

title: Amazing Feelings.
review: The fort actually contains a small living city complete with shops.about 3000 people residing within its walls. It’s honeycombed with narrow, winding lanes, lined with houses and temples – along with a large number of handicraft shops, guesthouses and restaurants. You enter the fort from the east, near Gopa Chowk, and pass through four massive gates on the zigzagging route to the upper part. The final gate opens into the square that forms the fort’s centre, Dashera Chowk . Not to be missed when in Jaisalmer.

title: Well restored fort - you have to walk in up a cobble street road
review: Enjoyed our time in the fort visiting the Maharajah palace and walking the old streets - no time for shopping though - our schedule again!!

title: City Tour of Jaisalmer along with Jaisalmer Fort
review: City Tour….

title: A beautiful palace
review: It it a beautiful but huge palace, and you need several hours to get an idea about it. Guides are available near the entrance and you have to pay a small amount of money to hire any of them. A must-see place for visitors if you are in Rajasthan.

title: Great fort, still inhabited
review: The fort is a sight to see from a distance, covering the top of a small hill. It is still fully inhabited. The havellis are beautiful. Long walks. Take a hat and plenty of water. Shopping is a little expensive. You can get better-priced handicrafts in Jodhpur

title: Huge n beautiful as it is
review: Lovely fort ...takes atleast 2 days to see all withing....many hotels to stay in .....but best are few....travelling incomplete without seeing this

title: horizon view and quiet chill-out
review: Cool little place few dozen meters above the low-height city of Jasalmer, once settling in some top-floor restaurant or cafe, you got an amazing almost 360 view over the whole city of Jaisalmer and to the horizont. Being no.1 atraction there and inside walls surrounded by typical shops, its still very quiet and calm and shopowners are not so pushy. With a Masala Tea pot you can read, play boardgames with your friends or make friends with locals whole day overlooking beautiful dezerts surrounding outskirts of Jaisalmer.

title: Must Visit....
review: It's a must visit place, i have seen this fort in many bollywood movies so it was my dream to saw this incredible fort. It looks very nice in the night.

title: superb place
review: Its a superb place to visit in Jaisalmer. Its a largest inhabited fort in the country. best historic place to visit

title: A must in Jaisalmer!
review: Its a largest inhabited fort in the country, once settling in some top-floor restaurant or cafe, you got an amazing almost 360 view over the whole city of Jaisalmer and to the horizont. There are inside walls surrounded by typical shops,  but not good prices. Need several hours to get an idea about it. Guides are available near the entrance at good prices.

title: Interesting place
review: We saw the king's palace. It is a very vibrant place. In fact the whole fort is the only living fort in the country with lots of shops, houses and hotels in it.

title: Avoidable
review: Apart from cliché’s like only living fort, largest fort, etc. it is thoroughly avoidable.

title: Golden Fort
review: Rich in history and great for shopping. Some nice restaurants, temples and souvenir shops as well. Must visit

title: Heritage culture history
review: This place is huge and the best part is you will find people staying inside the fort area basically this fort is a fort which is till date used by people to stay. It's a amazing way all the way to the top. This is the best place for sunset view.

title: A MUST in Rajastahan!
review: You can skip some forts in Rajasthan - but not this one!

title: Was ok not that bad
review: well i dint find this place so intresting. but still its a must go place if you are in jaiselmer. but if again i get a chance to visit jaiselmer i wont like to visit this place again

title: Interesting
review: Great experience to go there. I was told this is the only living fort in india, in the sense a whole lot of people and shops live with in gates of the fort. It is nice to walk down isles and gullies which small shops and temples and restaurants.

title: There are better forts to visit
review: Compared with other forts in Rajasthan (Jodhpur, Agra, Jaipur) this fort is very commercial... More like an extended shopping arcade than an architectural landmark.

title: Don't miss this!
review: This was busy when we visited this fort - lots of tourists from local and overseas.  But things worked out.  Lots to see and we enjoyed the visite.  Don't miss this.

title: Worst experience
review: Poorly maintained, not clean at all, only looks beautiful at night from outside. This was the worst fort that we out of all the ones that we visited in Rajasthan.

title: Main attraction
review: Jaisalmer fort is paradise for history lovers and shopping lovers. Need half day to complete the entire fort.If you do shopping it might take longer.

title: Nice !
review: The fort has people living inside , with shops, restaurants and small hotels/guesthouses except for a section where the museum is housed. You could spend some time browsing around the touristy shops inside the fort and then see the museum which is ticketed. Good for spending a few hours of your trip !

title: A great experience of 20th century life living in a Fort
review: This is a experience of beauty and the feeling of  days gone by, You can imagine a bussling  population living in the fort in old times as it gives you that feeling  when you meander through the back lanes  and  see the well maintained havelis. Jaialmer fort  is worth a visit

title: Amazing to see people still living in this Fort.
review: We were here during Holi and glad we made that decision. One of the amazing sites to see in Rajasthan.

title: Great fort with great history
review: We took a guide to visit this fort.   With other sites to see our trip last around an hour and a half with our spending much time in the area surrounding the museum.

title: A living fort , people still reside inside the fort, some very beautiful temples and a vibrant area
review: Visited the fort, visit started with the jain temple, a beautiful place with exquisite carving, another old Vaishnava temple was very interesting , got to see the morning Arti , the kings and queen palace was another place to visit inside the fort, the most interesting part was that people are residing and owning property within the fort walks,

title: Alive
review: Generally a Fort is a tourist attraction only. This one is different. It;s a huge one and thousands of people stay inside it. The cabs drop you at the main gate and from there you either walk up or take a tuk tuk. The lanes are narrow and congested and there is not much of cleanliness. It has a history and it is worthwhile to hire a Guide to understand it in detail or otherwise you may miss some details. Since there are a number of attractions within the Fort, one need to spend good amount of time there. There are lot of shops within the premises selling camel lather goods and local handlooms and stone stuff. Be careful not to get carried by the big promises made by the sellers.

title: truley a heritage
review: great artifact and wonderful display of rajasthani architechture.we enjoyed a lot and the markets are cheap.

title: Nice fort
review: This only fort where people are still staying in Jaisalmer fort. One Jain temple in the fort. The construction of temple is very artistic. This is one place to see in Jaisalmer

title: Historical Fort
review: Fort of Jaisalmer is good place for visit on nominal charge basis but maintenance of Fort is not so good. Guides are also available very easily on nominal charges of Rs.100.00 approx.

title: Amzing
review: 11th century structure making us proud of our heritage still going strong. I believe their oldest fort in Rajasthan.

title: The Golden Fort
review: If you visit jaisalmer the main atraction is the fort. You have to visit the Jain  temples. There is a city view point which provide a nice view of city from fort.

title: Nice architecture but dirty
review: Among the many forts that i have visited this is only fort which has people living within it. It has beautiful view especially at night when it is lit with lights.

title: Diffrent
review: Memorable one . directly took this place to the past amazing collection and maintained well. Must see

title: Nice experience
review: Would recommend to go to a living fort and experience the difference. The fort also has a museum to visit.

title: A small but well maintained
review: This fort will not take more than an hour to visit; much smaller than forts in Jaipur and Udaipur. The fort used to house the kings of ancient India

title: Grt
review: Good place for history lovers. You will get see many things from the past. A small town within a fort. Its really amazing.

title: Relive the past
review: With a living fort, you can experience how life would have been centuries ago. It is a great place to explore. Keep half a day to walk around and immerse yourself in the glorious tales the walls seem to tell you.

title: Visit the Fort with a Guide
review: Please hire a local city guide to understand the Fort and it's Glory ! We came across one Mr. Pramod from Arravali Safari and his knowledge was great. He's also a talented hobby photographer , which made our Fort visit very comfortable and easy for us to get our pictures clicked.

title: the bastions and this golden forts one of a kind.
review: jaisalmer city of sand and special sand stone used in building the small fort go to top of the fort to get a 360degree view of the whole city is magnificient.

title: So beautiful
review: We've seen half dozen forts around Rajasthan now and this one wins. Sure, there are quite a few shops in certain areas which admittedly detracts from the authenticity but we wandered round the fort at sunrise before any of these opened and it was cool, calm and oh so beautiful.

title: Review
review: A nice place... Must visit..... Historical place... With a in pak border too close.... A jungle.... Sand dunes.... Sand race......... Desert safari.... Camel safari nd a nd lot....................................................................................................................

title: Interesting yet filthy
review: It was such a good feeling to be able to visit a living fort. However it was filthy. Broke my heart to see it in such a filthy state. Plus the people kept staring and passing lewd comments.

title: "Marvelous fort"
review: The fort is build with yellow sand stone. Its really looks like golden fort.from the top of the palace you can have a splendid view of city.

title: superb!
review: the beautiful stone carvings and the intricate jharokas are amazing! walked through the city listened to the guy playing on the stringed instrument on the way! tried light bhang outside the fort!(no effect tho!) all in all wonderful experience!

title: Part Of Indian History
review: This fort is beautiful. Visible from every part of the city. Looks magnificent as yellow stone wall shine in day light. Because of this fort jaisalmer is called Golden city of India.

title: Unique experience
review: Such a great place to wander around in for days and days, and at night too. interesting to see the local people going about their businesses in the sometimes very narrow alleys. Discovering new cute places every day. Great views in all different directions. great sunsets! !

title: A visit to the past
review: Stay at the fort to experience a turning back in time at the only live Fort for common people in India.

title: A good experience
review: The fort is a wonderful experience. The sight of the city from the top is really good. There are not many information notices put up and that is a little disappointing.

title: Awesome Sonar Kella
review: It's awesome experience to be in childhood fantasy of Sonar Kella...The night top view is fantastic.

title: Golden gem!
review: What's great about Rajasthan is not only the Kings and their history but the diversity in each n every thing whether it's language culture traditions etc . As it's a colorful state the forts too are different due to proximity of stones to each fort which makes a yellow a red of Jodhpur (mehrangarh)and this Golden fort of Jaisalmer.  it has a different infra then the other forts  and it can be clearly seen. It's a fort with people residing within from time immemorial.. Several stalls n market establishment are also settled within.

title: A must see
review: We've been traveling through Rajasthan and there are a lot of forts to see, but definitely this one comes on top of the list! The fact that people still lives inside the fort makes it come alive, it's really a wonderful experience to walk inside and get a look of the city. We did a tour with a guide which was great except for one thing... At the end of the tour they take you to a haveli (don't remember the name now) and tell you the story about it, that it's basically a museum but the entrance it's free and that the family that runs it lives by selling handicraft work. Well when you get inside its just an EXPENSIVE big SHOP. The guide tell you the story before so that you feel obligated to buy something.

title: A truly golden city
review: Jaisalmer fort it's magical, full of life since more than 3000 people still live within its walls. The architecture is splendid and full of details between the fort, the Jain temples, etc. Make sure not to miss this place in your trip around Rajhastan, it's like watching living history.

title: Jaisalmer Ford  - Asia's bigest ford
review: This is really Asia's Bigest Living ford , people are living inside the ford and you can see the beauty of Jaisalmer from this ford.

title: The Jaisalmer Fort
review: wow....royal......yes.....jaisalmer is really royal..the ppl the city and ofcourse on the top the jaisalmer fort was simply awesome...the fort was huge and beautiful.....the outfit of the king shown was very large and we also met the present day king...so the fort was made to impress the whole world.....thnx mr.shakti singh..

title: Incredible place!
review: Full of history and the allure of something secretive.  I kept coming back each of the four days I was there.  Worth the visit!

title: Okok
review: Fort was just ok ok . It could have been better off no crappy shops were there. They should not have given it to the shops m all. It decreases the charm. Just look at Mysore palace or gwalior fort they are amazing

title: Nice
review: Nice place to see.... India is crazy but I love and enjoy almost everything.

title: Really interesting
review: As one of the only remaining forts that people still live in, this was really interesting to see. Not only every day life in the Fort, but also the architecture and streets as they would have been 500 years ago.

title: Sad
review: Of all the sites we visited this was the most poorly maintained and dirtiest. Perhaps because its a living fort--there is garbage and dirt everywhere and water seepage is ruining the walls. Sad to see--the authorities shoul sit up and take stock before this historic piece of architecture goes to pot.

title: Must visit
review: Only living fort in India.  I was happy to see the place still functioning and to get a sense of what a living fort is like.  However, more effort could be enforced to ensure that strain on the sandstone is monitored.  I wonder for how much longer the fort can contain its original characteristics before its overuse and poor drainage may sadly compromise the very thing that attracts visitors to the city and provide its people the livelihood.

title: I see our glorius history
review: "wow,fantastic" this were the words spoken from my mouth when i saw Jaisalmer Fort in jaisalmer . it is a  rich heritage site whom no one should miss when he visit Jaisalmer. Jakkaaasssss carving on yello stone. good place for photography. this is the only fort in  india in which local people are still living with their family. very good site for photography.

title: Definitely worth the long train trip
review: Too few travellers make it out to Jaisalmer in western Rajastan, 80 km or so from the Pakistani border. But that's a shame. The Amber Fort of Jaisalmer is very beautiful and takes up much of the city. Many hostels are located within the city-wall, so if you get the choice make sure to stay there.

title: Large World Hertiage Site Fort
review: One of the largest World Hertiage Sites Fort.  People are sill living within the walls of the Fort.  Contains two areas within one for Vegetarians and one for non veg.

title: Scenic and Historically-Rich
review: It may be expensive, but it was a good experience. The audio guide is recommended, as it provides a lot of interesting stories and historical facts, including explaining about Jauhar (ritual mass suicide), the love story of Mumal & Mahendra, how Jaisalmer has changed through time, and also explaining relics on display. The views, especially at audio guide locations 20-22 are incredible.

title: Good historic place with unfortunate future
review: Jaisalmer fort was a dream place to visit since my childhood, its a must place to visit in Rajasthan. The only thing which upset me regarding this place is that its in the hand of local people who are not doing much to save this monument for future generation. The best time to visit this fort is just before sunset, when you can see beautiful colours on the wall of the fort.

title: Fort with people living inside
review: It is unique since there is a mini city inside the fort itself where people are still living inside the fort. It is the only fort in Asia made without use of cement. All the stones are interlocked to hold the walls together.

title: Nothing that you can miss
review: The fort is a living fort and so has all the filth like the rest of Jaisalmer. The palace inside is very basic. Excepting a couple of old guns and swords, and a silver throne, there is nothing. And a entry charge of Rs. 100 is not justified.

title: Active
review: It is amazing seeing a Rajasthan fort that's still in use. I haven't seen that yet here. There are many shops in operation. It's almost as if you are looking at how this fort should be

title: Wonderful...
review: Forts always have a lasting effect....

title: Worth visiting
review: This is a fort in the heart of city and people are still living in this so a living city. However you can give a miss if you have seen any other fort in Rajasthan as you will not find anything new.

title: Was just like watching a Raja Rani wali movie
review: Very big palace. Nice long walk with lots and lots of shops inside the Fort. The guide was good and explained each and every detail of the Fort.

title: RICH HISTORY
review: Amazing experience with amazing guide. the gold city is full of people who have goden hearts. loved it.

title: Charming settlement inside the fort...
review: The fort complex in itself is something that can be maintained better but the fact that you have people living inside the fort walls took me be surprise. Lot of cafes, old world Rajasthani handicraft galleries and marketplaces, Hindu and Jain Temples and obviously homes of people who have been living there for centuries. While it is nice to have a settlement inside the Fort, I also feel that this causes a problem in the upkeep of the fort, with garbage thrown outside the fort wall, open drains and crumbling infrastructure of the main complex. I would recommend to go during early mornings or late afternoons to beat the heat and walk around the place and get lost in the old world charms.

title: Impressive
review: We spent two hours walking through history and what a magnificent living place it was.the entrance is impressive and the many side streets are a mass of bright colours and friendly shop keepers. We got to see the whole town spread out below us and what a pleasure it was to see a slower quieter pace of life than other cities in India !!! A must to do on your travels

title: Just another Fort
review: This is another of those several forts in India. Did not find anything special about it, other than Approx 30,000 ppl living in it. I guess having residents in the fort area is the reason that it is dirty and not well maintained.

title: beautiful
review: lovely buildings and well kept considering so many people in here.

title: City inside a city !!
review: The fort houses shops, temples and dwellings etc and is a complete city in itself. The architecture inside is beautiful. Guides are available on reasonable rates. Does not look as grand as some of the other forts in Rajasthan.

title: Magical but unfortunately very turistic now
review: It's a magicals place at sunset or sunrise! Incredible fort in the begining of desert!! You will find hundreds of tourist shops but the atmosphere is very nice and magical. Very romantic at sunset!

title: Alone diamond in the desert
review: If you go in the north of india you should go in jaisalmer. its fort is something unique, all around you have flat desert and then you see that fort standing out of it. it is lovely to get lost in the fort and see some real life of inhabitants.

title: ''A gem in desert''
review: One of the only living fort in the world where people live. We were very impressed !!!the narrow street remind you the old maharaja times. I would call this the 8th wonder of the world. Feel very lucky to stay in side the fort.

title: FORT
review: NICE fort...One of the best of rajsthan..it's a must seem fort in jaisalmer and one of the living fort..where people leave with families inside fort...

title: Good place
review: It is one of the rarest forts which are inhabited till now. Good place to look a time some old jain temples. Must visit if you are visiting jaisalmer.

title: Anon
review: V nice.it was a wonderful  experience  to see people staying in the fort but it's v sad that it's v dirty

title: A fascinating experience
review: This is a 'still living' fort: people is actuating living within the walls. Very interesting, a photographer heaven....

title: The Golden Fort (Sonar Kella)
review: >> Fort where Bengali Movie named Sonar Kella (Golden Fort) was shoot

title: Very nice
review: Wao its very nice fort of jaisalmer. there is so many antic items of maharaja. this fort is so old now this fort is living fort.

title: Good one
review: The visit here is easy as it is walkable distance from city. The fort has good views of Jaisalmer city and has a good history for the king and Queen. You must take a guide for rupee 100 to knw more and he will also click your pictures too. Will give it four star as it is occupied by General public and only a part is under government which is a museum. But still a good visit. Thanks Jaisalmer

title: Beautiful views, Busy Fort
review: The Jaisalmer Fort is a cool one. Not much in terms on artifacts unless you pay extra to access the museum, but the views are beautiful. We climbed up to the highest point on the wall in a couple areas and we could look above the roofs of the surrounding city. The paths running trough the town of the Fort allow for some cool exploration too.

title: Fort built y gold
review: Jaisalmer Fort may be made by their founders but it is really made by Gold. if you wanna feel please visit in morning where rising sun will show this practical.

title: Beautiful historical place
review: Must visit to see the rich rajasthani History. Intricate work and havelis inside. a lot of small shops to find artefacts.

title: Old World charm
review: The old Jaisalmer city is encompassed within the walls of the Jaisalmer Fort. All the houses and other constructions are in mud colour and hence Jaisalmer is sometimes also referred to as the Golden City. It's a very interesting place to walk around especially with it's many quaint restaurants / cafes and souvenir shops. Do try the local food - quite amazing. The old Fort itself is worth a visit to get a feel of how the royals lived in the earlier days. However, do keep in mind that the weather can get quite hot specially in the daytime and summer months. Not a bad idea to carry a cloth hat and some water. Also, there are areas where the slopes reaching to the higher parts of the fort can be a bit steep.

title: Rajputana in it's last breaths!
review: On my way to visit The Jaisalmer Fort just after Mehraangarh Fort at Jodhpur, I was quite depressed in seeing the tour arrangements at Rajasthan's one of the largest Districts.

title: Incredible living fort with so much to see
review: Stayed at the outstanding Killabhawan Bhawan within the fort. It's just am amazing experience. You should stay a minimum of 3 days 2 nights.

title: Majestic
review: We had to walk a lot to reach the top, hence we stopped at a roof top restaurant, the name of which I have forgotten, and the view from there was just breathtaking. We were surrounded by the fort and we could see the city stretch out in front of us.

title: Awesome view of the city from the golden fort
review: Being a living fort, you can see locals residing inside the fort. The fort in itself has many building complexes which are now filled with handicraft shops. There was a costly (I think 100/- per person) portion of the fort which seemed avoidable. The views from the fort walls were wonderful. Don't forget to click pics in Rajasthani topis (hats).

title: Disappointment
review: I was looking forward to seeing a living fort but the dirt and constant haressment spoiled the experience. The small streets would have been lovely to walk through if the drains had been covered and dirt cleared away and not crammed with street stalls. The jain temples were a haven a peace and cleanliness amongst chaos with lovely carvings. The hour that we spent was more than enough.

title: People's Fort - Golden fort, golden city & golden people
review: Fort belongs to people of jaisalmer rather than to any single king or queen (rare to see) & thts what makes it close to ur heart...even the king's darbar was in public chowk...streets are full of local merchandise. Fort palace has a johar kund where around 8000 women have sacrificed their lives. It was 2.5 johar. Two times men died in war & women jumped in johar but one time women jumped in johar but men came back winning...so 2.5 johar...Golden fort, golden city & golden people

title: It's crumbling - Not worth visiting
review: Sorry state of affairs at Jaisalmer Fort. We were greeted by two guides who then started fighting amongst themselves and kept following us till about 200 meters inside the fort. Had a tough time getting rid of them. General Public has taken over the Fort and it seems like an crowded market place. Didn't even feel like spending more than 30 mins. Went to the City View Point - which gives a breath taking view of the city. Remembered watching Satyajit Ray's award winning Sonar Kela - wish I had not visited the Fort and seen the sorry state of affairs....

title: Drool time
review: The only residential fort in the country, makes one feel proud of one's past. All facets are well maintained. The restaurants are a must visit in the evenings..a visit to the government authorised Bhang shop is a must!!

title: The only living fort of world
review: The experience of walking around the streets of a living fort is incomparable with any other fort. Its small shops,people with smiles and some real good cafes makes this a great "to do" in jaisalmer

title: Golden fort
review: It is called a Golden fort because fort is of yellow colour and the house and building inside the fort area. It look really golden in colour. From parking to inside you may take a auto ricksaw which run inside the fort up to the main area. Some of the fort area is closed for restoration purpose. inside fort are having things related to king and royal family, clothes weapons etc. and also having a good history. take one guide with you because it is old and some place inside are dark, which require assistance. must visit the terrace of the fort from where you can see whole of the jaisalmer city, which is a good experience. there are also some canon placed all over for must visit them.

title: sleeping in that wall of the fort is tremendous
review: incredibly interesting, great views, lots of steps, outdoor eating waiting for the bats at sunset great place to walk around an dget lost in

title: A Grandeur and Visually stunning experience - A unique Rajasthan Marvel
review: This fort is seen far before you enter Jaisalmer City, a massive structure built in yellow sandstone, looks like a sudden mountain over the plain. Just stop sometimes there and relish the beauty of it.

title: Good place but badly maintained
review: With people living inside the fort for hundreds of years, the fort within is dirty and stinking in many places. You cannot see this fort without a tour guide. Take the help of an authorized tour guide (ask for his badge). A detailed tour will take about 2 hours. See the fort firth thing in the morning or right after the heat goes down late afternoon. But be prepared to see cows blocking the pathways, biked & scooters darting around you and smell unpleasant odours in places.

title: "Nice historical monument"
review: We went to visit the citypalace.it was well maintained. I found it a bit expensive. The entry fee is a bit high.the rooftop have a great view of  city. Best to go there for sunset time.it has  good Collection of old photo

title: A poorly maintained great fort
review: We visited this fort just after visiting the Mehrangarh fort in Jodhpur a day earlier and it was just the opposite of an awe experience we had in Mehrangarh. Jaisalmer fort is very poorly maintained, most of the fort premises is occupied by local inhabitants and hawkers.

title: Nice
review: Really beautiful!

title: Big!
review: One of the biggest forts that I visited in India. Its a living fort with cows walking around and children playing cricket in the street. Amazing views from the parapets. Give youself plenty of time, its  amaze, you will get lost!

title: Interesting slice of life
review: Winding alleyways abound and easy to loose your bearings, but small and so a nice adventure. Jain Temples interesting and beautiful architectural point of interest all over.

title: One of the best forts in rajasthan.
review: The fort is awesome there are people still living inside the fort. It is little crowdy and messy though.Go without any large backup as there is lot of walking and stairs in the fort.

title: Nice fort
review: Very good place Jaisalmer  fort and sand is very good there is camel ride and so many tent  for stay better you spent hole day in sand and return to city no use stay in tent take taxi up down no return taxi available also museum is very good for defiance

title: Awsm
review: A fort different from the others in rajasthan, nice yellow stones ,USP of jaisalmer...loved the city

title: Golden monument
review: Although this fort is small as compared to other forts of rajasthan but u must have a visit and experience the stay at hotels in the fort. It looks golden from outside as it is made of sandstone.

title: Beautiful architecture
review: Well the architecture & the carving on the stone is awesome. Must visit place. However couldnt enjoy much because the guide cheated us, saying many things as not important, & at last took us Rasthalli for shopping, though we were not at all interested for it.

title: Appreciate the way into the fort
review: The best view of the fort is from the outer gateway, from where the masonry towers above you on several sides. The route into the fort is cleverly designed to thwart attackers and is almost more impressive than the buildings you see inside the walls. Several important parts of the fort are currently in restoration, so most of the fort area is best appreciated from the outside. It's great just wandering around the narrow streets, though expect to be pleaded with to go into almost every shop. The Jain temple is one building well worth a visit and whose interior is special.

title: Not as good as other forts in Rajasthan
review: Rajasthan has a lot of forts and Jaisalmer does have one as well. It's a beautiful fort, but main attraction of Jaisalmer is the desert and camels, and not the fort itself. It's good to visit and look around while you're there, but it's not something to blow your mind away. But as you'll probably be here for desert excursions anyway, it gives you something to see and experience on your pre-tour day.

title: Nice fort and great attraction!!
review: Nice place, went in January, it was cold and brizzy. Enjoyed Sand festival very much. Fort was so colorful. one thing that need to restricted the shop owner!! allow the traveler to choice their shop. There must be fixed rate chart for guiding. But it was outstanding.

title: Good fort
review: Best fort in india in side musiem is good and old palaces.

title: Centre of the city and most beautiful place too
review: Great place to start your visit. There are so many shops where you can experience and buy new things. Many viewpoints are also there inside the fort from where you can enjoy the city view, sunset, and sunrise. Jain temples are must visit.

title: Good to visit once
review: A routine Fort that we visit,no doubt its very huge and still is maintained, one of the must see attraction if you are in Jaisalmer

title: Beautiful
review: Loved this fort and it is defnitely worth a visit, beautiful views from the top, the sellers can be a nuisance, just ingnore and enjoy the feel of the old India.

title: beautiful
review: the place is really beautiful. especially when you get up early and walk around before the crowds of tourists arrive it's really peaceful as all the touts are still sleepy and leave you alone with only a "good morning". there are loads of restaurants with good food around too.

title: Jaisalmer fort(Sonar kella)
review: For me it was culmination of year long visit to various cities of Rajasthan ...Visiting Jaisalmer fort( Golden Fort or Sonar kella made famous by a Satyajit ray movies by the same name) was a long pending desire.  The fort and the locale were made famous by the international exposure in the movie.

title: Absolutely stunning!
review: A wonderful place full of history and beautiful architecture! A photographers paradise!  3,000 locals still live inside this fort, so it's interesting to watch them go about their daily lives!  You could easily immerse yourself in the culture of the fort for hours!  A 'must do' in Jaisalmer!

title: Unbelievable
review: Stunning view, unbelievable. 500 yrs old still people listing inside. Everything can be found inside.

title: Living museum
review: Our guide called this a living museum--lots of shops etc but good view from the walls over the town.

title: Magnificent
review: Beautiful fort. Best to visit in morning hours, guides available at main entrance, recommend to have a guide to learn and use best use of time. Its a active fort means people still live inside the fort. There is lots of traffic. You can have panoramic view of the citi from top.

title: "Fort- Still Alive"
review: Truely said - it is a living urban place. Around 3k families still residing inside the walls of this fort. It is one of its own kind "Heritage site". There are shops, temples, houses inside it. Although there is not much to see and hear about it but yes if you are in here then it is a "Must see". As far as cleanliness is concerned inside and around the fort, can't give much rating. But it's worth see and feel the beauty of this fort.

title: Well worth the visit
review: Had a guided walk around the fort, rather steep to begin with but then levels out. Mind the cattle roaming the streets and the motorcycles that speed around the very narrow lanes. The drainage system may appear a little medieval as it runs along the sides of the streets but this adds to the experience. Make sure you visit the Jain temples but try to visit without wearing leather goods as these need to be removed. You should be able to get around the fort in just over an hour but start early as it gets hot in the sessert sun.

title: Best fort in india
review: Rajasthan tour will be incomplete if you have not seen the jaisalmer fort it's second largest living fort after chittorgarh fort. Around 5 thousand people are living inside in their inherited proparties. Best place to walk around, stay and for traditional food, n shopping. Everything is in gold color. Truly a gold city.

title: Gorgeous architecture
review: Great walking and clicking pictures at different locations experience. Good stores within to buy leather items, patchwork items, handicraft etc.

title: You must see this fort
review: Don't skip this fort (or Jaisalmer) if you are touring the Rajasthan region.

title: School tour
review: Too good for historians and history lovers . I am a kind too . Must visit  . This place is  just a little dry so keep water with you

title: Beautiful architecture
review: Worth a visit. It is ok to take an auto up if you do not want to walk. But do not engage any touts. The fort has audio guides.

title: truly amazing
review: Clean and homly place. People are so nice. hardly any beggars. Plus they leave you alone to enjoy the tranqility.

title: Inpenetrable, beautiful and the most impressive fort I have ever seen
review: Definitely worth a visit and the queens palace within is also worth visiting.  It is one of the only forts still inhabited by 3000 people.  Do not buy any trinkets from the ladies just inside the fort.  Their silverware is all fake and breaks immediately

title: Very Nice Fort
review: You must get a guide for viewing the fort. The guide which we got was very interesting person and he explained the history of fort in details and help us take nice photos as well.

title: Very Small Area of Fort to Visit.
review: Its hardly takes 1 hr to visit this Fort.

title: living fort
review: it is unique fort which has monuments of past and people living. it smaller compare to other rajasthan forts but significant historical value. I stayed within fort and was quite an experience.

title: Worth the trip
review: Nice fun especially the Jain temple. The foid at the restaurants is very good. The best thing about the Fort are the home stays. Imagine staying within the fort.  Discovered this great place opposite the jain Temple called Shreenath palace.  Very clean neat and tidy and so very quaint. Next time we stay there.

title: Golden Fort
review: It is one of the few Forts which is inhabited. It has good eating places including outlet of German Bakery. Worth visiting.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: One can go around and have a look into the shops and the fort as it will not take more than a few hours time. We didn't go inside the fort as we had visited quite a few forts in the previous cities on our trip. But definitely a place to have a look and if you have time to kill.

title: Golden Fort
review: Its a beautiful fort. Te only fort which has not just palaces but people living inside the fort premises. Its totally spread in 3.5 km and the way it has been built it looks really amazing.

title: Have you visited a fort earlier?
review: I had visited quite a few forts earlier before I visited this one. After visiting the Kumbalgarh fort, this one was a disappointment. Even though its very small it took us 4 hours to finish. We spent quite a lot of time at the Jain temple which is worth every minute of your time. Explore the intricate lattice work and the interlocking architecture. The rest of the fort can be visited as a part of the itinerary. There are a few shops selling precious stones and sandstone vessels. We bought a sandstone casserole to make curds and it is quite useful. There are quite a few restaurants to eat around serving various cuisines. We ate Rajasthani thali at a nearby restaurant and it was quite good.Overall a decent experience but you wont miss much except the city view and the jain temple. Visit as part of city tour itinerary.

title: Interesting piece of history
review: Its a glorious piece of architecture but what makes it different from other forts is the fact that people still live here. There are shops inside the fort and you can even book a hotel to stay within the fort area. In the night, the golden lights around the walls enhance the color of the fort. No wonder, Jaisalmer is called the golden city.

title: The only fort converted into a village
review: The only living fort in the country!

title: Stone house
review: I srart from hotel araud of all fort and go in side waw very good fort .and very good peauple how living in fort maharaja palace also good

title: Majestic
review: Nice live in fort with lot of food outlets and zig zag streets with wonderful view of city. Need to visit in day as well as at night to relish the view

title: From The outside
review: The fort in Jaisalmer consists of a rempart all around the old city.

title: It was amazing fort in world
review: We stay in jaislmer for one night we see jaislmer fort it was amazing fort was very big and old history in fort it was good

title: Loved it
review: The whole fort in yellow stone looked wow. The fort has around 4 thousand houses in amazing architecture. You feel so sad that the present day constructions are so pale in comparison. Where did we lose the sense of our architecture.

title: Nice Fort
review: Must visit this fort if you visit jaisailmer. this fort view of complete city. Great view of complete are.

title: This is one of the majestic forts from Rajasthani fortifications
review: It is quite good place to visit but once you visit Meharangarh Fort.. you wont like anyother fort. Although this fort is not that well maintained but its still majestic and a good one time exoerience.

title: Mesmerizing beauty in gold
review: This gigantic structure of sandstone is something you can view as soon as you enter Jaisalmer, and you can view it from anywhere and everywhere in the city. The hue of this monument is spread to the entire city making it literally the golden city of India. The Maharaja Mahal and Rani Mahal in the fort is such a piece of beauty to be at, and with very minute details it depicts the life of the rulers of that time. The topmost point in the fort with the oldest cannon and the entire city overlooking you, will make you feel on top of the world and is definitely by far the best place. The view from that site is something that you are gonna carry forward all your life because its something you cant forget.

title: A must see
review: Visited in February 16 with family

title: Excellent audio tour
review: The golden fort is certainly a must see whilst I'm Jaisalmer and as the city is quite small its pretty hard to miss.

title: An amazing place to visit.
review: The Fort is an amazing place to visit - we stayed there about 4 hours.

title: Good
review: I found that fort is not clean. They should keep it clean and repaired. Since they get paid from traveler and its a tourist place so need to be very good looking

title: Inhabited Fort
review: The only fort which is inhabited by locals and given by the king to its subjects. From Musuem to temples, and shopping in an around the temple.

title: Only fort in the world where people still leaves!
review: The Jaisalmer fort aka Golden fort aka Merugarh is located on Meru hill in Jaisalmer. The unique things is that it is only fort in the world where people still leaves inside it. As a tourist, you can see magnificent architecture, historical museum,  a temple, local handicraft item's shop. I will recommend to take a walk from Gopa Chowk to Fort. And the best thing you should stay in a hotel or guest house in fort.

title: Don't bother with a tour
review: No need to book a tour, this is a great place to wander through by yourself. The narrow streets with locals trying to sell their wares make you feel like you're walking through the Aladdin movie.

title: The Living Fort
review: We had cycles given to us by the hotel, we left early avoiding traffic and cows.

title: A wonderful location to visit
review: This is more a city, than a fort but none the less, quite spectacular.

title: a must see
review: This is the only fort which has people living in through generations. It is a pity though that it has not been maintained that well with dogs and cows dirtying the street.

title: stunning
review: Amazing living fort!  This fort is full of homes, shops and hotels with all the hustle and bustle you can expect.

title: Shame it's not maintained...
review: Jaisalmer Fort has a rich history and being the only living fort, its a shame to see its heritage not being maintained. Pollution not only in terms of litter and plastic garbage but also the visual, with modern day signage etc...

title: Must visit.
review: This place is a must visit when someone goes to jaisalmer. This fort is at a height as compared to jaisalmer so it is visible from every corner of the city.

title: the 'real' thing in jaisalmer!
review: It has lot of history and stuff like that but the approach is quite dirty and depressing.  Once inside, you are likely to meet lots and lots of people of all hues, nationalities and behaviour. Better to keep adequate time to visit the nooks and corners of the fort.

title: Must Watch!!!
review: This is one of the fort which is famous for its architecture and yellow stone.... Some great views and history of this fort

title: Great for history, architecture, views or just leisurely stroll
review: We were staying at Club Mahindra. The cabbie they arranged on our first day to get us to the fort asked if we wanted a guide. We agreed. It was the best decision! The guide, Sandeep Kewaliya (9783955004) is a local with knowledge of not just the fort, and all tourist points, but also the intricacies of the local culture and sub - culture. Crucially he is a patient, unhurried man. This was imp as we have a photographer, a history buff & a 5 year old in our family. Very varied needs! We so enjoyed sight seeing with him that for the next 3 days he was our go - to guy for all arrangements, like outstation cabs, & offbeat desert safari.

title: Take the hike up the hill
review: This fort is well worth the effort to visit, it is a great mix of old and new living side by side and gives a true insight as to how life must have been five or six hundred years ago.

title: A wonderful experience
review: What a fabulous living fort. A stroll though history.  This place is almost as it was centuries ago.marvellous and interesting.

title: Great history, and a fort with a difference. Get a guide.
review: Jaisalmer fort is different from, say Mehrangarh, in that there's a thriving community living in it. There's plenty of guides available outside and they're quite cheap as well. Really worth getting one who can tell you about the history of the place. Do visit the Hari Om jewellers shop at the end of your tour of the fort - they're quite unique. And there's also a lane right beside the fort which has shops selling paintings, leather bags etc Good quality and not expensive. I quite liked the whole place.

title: Oozing with atmosphere and friendly locals
review: The densely inhabited Fort is unlike the more imposing monuments such as Merangarh, Jodhpur.  Most residents would understandably like to lighten your tourist purse somehow but the style is easygoing.  The narrow streets have much charm and the outlook from higher points along the walls is great.  We watched one predator kite (no doubt with plenty of glass in his string) cut down five others in succession one evening as the sun went down.

title: Good place to wander
review: Enjoyed wandering around fort and loved the vibe. Lot's of nice stores to visit along with a Jaine temple.

title: Very intricate piece of architecture
review: Huge fort with loads of history attached. Well maintained with intricate architecture. It is a must go for all tourist.

title: Golden Fort - A city within, with great history & architecture,
review: The fort is located on a hill above the town. It is interesting to walk through the picturesque narrow streets with shops, where you can watch the locals living there. Its stunning to see that the fort is a small city with hundreds of families, shops etc inside.

title: It's a golden fort but need to improve in cleanliness
review: It's a main attractions amongst all city sightseeing. ..one should visit this place.

title: Memorable moments
review: Very well made and maintained fort hatts off......

title: Go in the late afternoon to get the place for yourself
review: Well, obviously you cannot go to Rajasthan and not visit this Fort. I visited twice, once in the late afternoon and the next morning.

title: Even though this fort is small it is 1 of the most beautiful in the Rajasthan area
review: We stayed in Killa Bhawan which is a hotel inside the fort which made our stay & opinion of the fort even more amazing. The Jain temples inside the fort are exquisitely carved - so much detail. There's also a sunset point that you can go see the sunset with a beautiful view of the entire fort. Highly recommend this fort, the Jain temples, Hotel Killa Bhawan & the city of Jaisalmer

title: The name sonar qila is befitting.
review: Jaisalmer fort , the only living fort is worth a day's trip. Has a lot of history & architecture. Do take a guided tour, but ask about for rates as different guides give different prices.

title: The residential fort
review: This fort is a residential fort with over 5000 families living in it. You wont be able to find the places to look for without the help of locals or a guide.  You will be lost amongst the houses and numerous restaurants and it hardly looks like a fort from inside. We went to the top where cannon was mounted and it offered an amazing view of the entire Jaisalmer. You can click great pics here.

title: "A city within the city"
review: The Jaisalmer Fort is surrounded by a clay-colored fortress wall, which, when it is illuminated by the sun, golden effect. Therefore, Jaisalmer is also called the "Golden City". The fort is located on a hill above the town and is reached by four goals. Within the fort, the palace can be found, which is also such. T. accessible. It is interesting to walk through the picturesque narrow streets with shops, where you can watch the locals living there at the daily activities that take place mainly outside the building.

title: Golden Fort - A city within
review: I was stunned to see that the fort was a small city with hundreds of families, shops etc inside. It is beautiful!

title: Heritage fort spoilt badly
review: Such a beautiful architecture but maintenance is so poor and terrible.Can you imagine food stalls shops bikes autos plying inside any fort?Yes this one has so much of dirt and filth everywhere.Please do not go to witness a monument which is protected and is so badly maintained.Could not stand and we walked out of the area in no time.

title: best fort in the whole of north india
review: jaisalmer is the top destination for forts for a region, because they have such diversity and such majesty in their architecture. The photos do it enough justice so google them. Go early morning and after 3pm - lots of crowd in the afternoon (feb)

title: Interesting Fort
review: The living fort of India, with shops and hotel all over the place, Nice view from the top. You can see the golden city of Jaisalmer from here.

title: Must visit
review: Jaisalmer fort is the best fort of the golden city.

title: Very Interesting
review: The fact that this is the oldest inhabited fort makes it worthwhile to visit.  There are 4000 people living in it.

title: not as expected
review: out of all frustration, our guide was the best part of this visit, he kept  us entertained so it was worth visiting once

title: sadly, badly ruined by tourism
review: Visiting the fort after 10 years was a great disappointment. Every inch that can be made into a shop has been made into one, and the visitors' route through the fort moves past every one. Even the havelis, with their beautiful architecture and interesting history have been junked-up with fake-seeming displays and shops in their courtyards. Not worth the drive.

title: A true fairytale fortress in the desert
review: It's a long drive out to Jaisalmer but it is worth it.   This is one of the oldest continuously inhabited medieval fortresses in the world and one of the most beautiful, with its pink sandstone construction.  It will be one of the best parts of your visit to India.   We liked going to Udaipur, then past Ranakpur to Jodhpur and on to Jaisalmer.

title: Needs work to survive
review: This fort could learn much from the fort in Jodhpur. Little or no historical artifacts. Being inhabited takes away considerably from from the opportunity to view. Cannot see how it can be saved with auto rickshaws and scooters buzzing the streets. From the outside you can see the damage piped water is causing to stability along with garbage thrown over the wall.

title: Beautiful fort
review: Visited Jaisalmer fort as we were in the city and it doesn't offer much. Visit to fort was good. We had our guide Bhupender Singh Ji, he made the tour fantastic. He could play table sound from his mouth and was extremely good at it.

title: Ok to see the Jaiselmer fort
review: Seems to be Ok to have one time visit on this Fort, Though it was historical one one could enjoy this fort.

title: Living fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is a living fort - it means that people still live in the fort premises. This serves as an interesting siteseeing point, but also adds to the dirt on the fort. Most people in the fort seem to have open shops in the front part of their houses and will call out to you as you stroll along the narrow bylanes. If jaipur is the pink city and jodhpur the blue city, jaisalmer seems to be the yellow city. The fort has a golden yellow colour of the sandstone. a must-visit here is the Jain temple which has stunning carvings inside.

title: Ordinary on the inside
review: Not sure if this is the right rating but i had high expectations which were not met. The fort looks gorgeous from far away but when you are in it, there is not much to see/do. And with people living inside the fort, it has not been maintained well.

title: one of the good places.
review: jaiselmer fort is one of the best places.some hotels are there in fort.worth staying there.roof top,s are the best.

title: Beautiful!
review: An excellent experience of staying inside the fort. They just need to ensure to not get the place dirty.

title: Golden mesmerizing beauty from outside but no so great from inside
review: The fort looks majestic from outside but when you are inside there is not much to see.Crowded as local population is staying inside the fort. Not well maintained from inside but a must visit place in Jaisalmer.

title: Living Urban Center- Noisy-Clam, Giant-Midget
review: It's majestic and grand from outside but when you enter inside and explore you will find it very compacted and noisy. It has narrow lanes with different colours of life .

title: Well organized audio tour
review: The fort museum audio tour should be first stop before walking the fort. It may seem pricey but the information about the history, cultural background, and even the present day situation of the fort are well organized and presented. We spent almost 2 hours doing the tour which also allows you to go to the highest point in the fort for a great 360° view of the surrounding city and country side.

title: very different
review: this fort is not what you saw in all rajasthan like in jaipur,jodhpur .

title: Fantastic!
review: This living fort is gorgeous.  We stop every few minutes to gawk at another amazing carving, another golden bastion. It is quite relaxed inside, no auto rickshaws or cars. Every rooftop restaurant has an amazing view.

title: Lovly
review: Perfect place to visit....creative historical....and fort is belong to maharajas ....those were royal and as well as full of life...and strong people..

title: Golden fort
review: A golden fort so called because of the yellow sandstone, is the major tourist attraction, and does not disappoint.

title: Terrific, Grand
review: One would be mesmerized to see the beauty of this fort from outside. It would appear that this would be the best fort in Rajasthan all the major cities of which can boast of a fort. Unfortunately the fort didnt turn out to be the best. I did spend a night in a hotel located inside the fort. Its definitely worth seeing with the city view and museum offering great touristic value. But inside it is filthy for the simple reason it is a living fort with population.

title: A living fort
review: This is a unique fort in the sense that there a hotels and people still living inside the fort area. We also stayed at a hotel in the fort area. There is a small part of fort which is converted to museum, but the entry fee of Rs. 100/head was a bit expensive. But a nice experience with a good view of the city

title: Interesting, but over-run
review: The fort has some unique passages, alleys, and shops. Definitely worth a visit to the top to see a few things, eat, drink, and shop.  However, the down side of the for is the grotesque presence of motorcycles and auto-rickshaws--the place is over-run with them-- all constantly blaring their horns and nearly knocking over pedestrians in the narrow alleys-- it makes the visit slightly unpleasant.

title: Beautiful architecture
review: Although the fort is now totally commercialised, if you wander deep enough you can find some really stunning lanes and buildings. The architecture and stone carving is amazing. Nice to spend a couple of hours here checking out the view points and laneways.

title: Majestic Fort
review: the fort is made of sandstones without any cement or water. They have used intercrossing of bricks to make this fort. It is a golden mesmerizing beauty. The view from the top of the entire golden city is breathtaking. More over guides here are very cheap. Our guide charged us just Rs.100. the fort is inhabited by Rajput and Bramhin families. No one pesters you here for shopping or anything. Must visit place.

title: Yellow sandstone wonder
review: Beautiful carvings in yellow stone are a hallmark of this city. One of its kind of fort with dense population. The fort needs some keeping up and work on cleanliness and maintainence. The king's family which seems to be making good rental income on the property by charging high ticket prices could take leadership in this aspect.

title: Living in the fort
review: Truly a beautiful combination of buildings in a state of constant construction; unlike other forts this one is owned by individuals, handed down through the generations. In retrospect  I would have chosen accommodation outside the fort, to be outside the tourist bubble.

title: Nice place with great information.
review: Must take a guide, if want to know in detail. Mr. Madhusudan is a Govt approved guide with very very detailed knowledge. Avoid any shopping reffered by the guide, you may end up with high price paid.

title: Family holiday
review: The fort has lots to offer temples , old houses, lanes and lots of things happening every where. Its a photographer paradise .

title: Fort is very nice.
review: This fort is very bigger among the forts I have visited in Rajasthan but the passage in the fort is very very narrow, there should be proper guidance to enter and exit from the fort to avoid any accident and congestion

title: Unique place
review: I visited this place a year ago. This ancient fort impressed me a lot. It is a museum under sky where people still live! It is especially magic at night. I recommend to visit this place, take a guide and wonder around. Don't forget to take a camel ride in the desert!

title: Stunning
review: Like nothing you have ever seen before.  Truly a monument of the ancient world not to be missed.  Stone carving is out of this world.

title: Great Fort! Must Visit!
review: Make sure to take a guide. Else, you will get lost in this huge fort.

title: Nice place
review: Beautiful place with lots of nicely decorated houses and temples. But don't buy anything, everything seams to be really very expensive.

title: Great from far not so nice inside
review: We were spellbound by its beauty from our hotel with such a great view but had a very hard time once we entered inside. It was filthy all over and totally unorganized, roamed around but had to return dejected.

title: Consider giving the fort a miss
review: The Jaisalmer Fort is gorgeous from the outside. It's free to enter and the view from the top of the fort gives you a beautiful view over The Golden City.

title: best fort i ever saw in my life - its a beautiful city
review: Its a huge fort and lively fort.

title: Dive back in time
review: The fort is a rare jem, reflecting the remenants of perhaps the only living forts of India. Many a tales have emerged from its rampart walls, which are historically rich and soaked in timeless tradition. The fort was built in layers at different times by its various royal occupants. Currently, its home to many locals who cant buy into the property, but can continue to live in it due to a legacy being carried forward for  many years. The fort houses the highly eclectic Killa Bhavan hotel, which is considered by Harpers review to be amongst the150 most romantic places on earth. Apart from the aforementioned, the fort has an ancient Jain temple as well which is a must see. The various gallis (narrow streets) of the fort allows you to relive the ancient yore. The architecture is organic at its best and makes for amazing photography, with ample sunlight creating a rich array of textures on its various walls and surfaces. This is indeed a place to bask within Jaisalmer, where travellers will be able to whisk the air of years gone by, as if it was yesterday. Raise a toast to India's rich cultural heritage.

title: Back in time!
review: Jaisalmer fort is one of the largest fortification in the world!It is also called Golden fort because of its color. it will take you back in time,history of kings of Rajhsthan.

title: wonderful piece of history
review: this show the mind set of indian king who are still prevailing in our politicians in now a days all work and money is spent on fort and palaces. one side entire city and at other side these forts.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: Whole fort is made of yellow stone.It actually looks golden.The Jain temple inside the fort is very beautiful,lovely stone carving.As per people it is the only fort in India where people live inside the fort.If you are in Jaisalmer then must visit to Jaisalmer Fort.

title: Needed more time
review: What a fantastic place,  we only had a short time here and would've liked a lot more.   Bustling chaos outside and serene and calm inside.

title: Golden Fort
review: This fort looks good  from Far and Golden in Color. Cannons are placed in the edge in many locations offering a great view. A good place to see when on a trip to Jaisalmer however this place is very crowded unlike other Forts in Rajasthan.  Tourism Department can takeover and maintain the fort better. However there is no entry fees to the Fort and one can just go around the place.

title: Impressively daunting overlooking Jaisalmer.
review: Walking up the fairly steep path leading into the fort you look up and realise just how big  the fort really is.  It is huge.

title: Astonishing beauty
review: Nice place to visit... with all the Jain sculptures. Lot of shops are there for shopping. Don't look to the local giude's choice alone. Yourselves could find many shops..

title: Nice Fort in world
review: A best fort in world but only problem that is leaving fort if you look the view of city and jain temple and also Maharaja Mahal

title: Huge but Crowded
review: Jaisalmer Fort seems to have been taken over by the hundreds of families that live and work there. It's a living fort, and that makes it unique. However, it also makes it congested, and vehicles, especially two-wheelers are constantly zipping up and down the fort, which can be a bit annoying. The fort offers great view of the city below once you climb to some height - especially if you can get to the ramparts. The palaces are not very opulent - more functional, but there are some great displays of weapons and artefacts. Worth seeing, as it has history associated with it, and views of it from afar, especially at night, are beautiful!

title: Best place for party
review: I celebrate my friends birthday in ghost house dj room I love this place I recommend this place for food and fun & dance

title: Unique Fort
review: Nice atmosphere,many small shops,restsurants,guesthouses.You have to visit the Jain Temple(dont forget to remove  your shoes defore entering)

title: Impressive fort containing Indian life bustle
review: This fort is not only an impressive structure,  it also is still habitable. While walking around the fortifications you will see shops and restaurants and people going about their lives. As with all forts there is a lot of uphill walking, and the streets can get crowded. It is worth it though for view at the top.

title: Shonar kila
review: Made of limestone it actually looks like a golden in the sunlight ...Shonar kila !  Beautiful carvings, lots of shops to do buy local stuff. The two wheelers zipping by can be very annoying. It interesting the see the location where Satyajeet Ray's movie 'Shonar Kila' was shot 40yrs ago!

title: A City Inside a Fort !
review: The title says it all, yes there is a population living inside the fort from the time of the kings rule.

title: The golden fort
review: The first thing that stands out for this fort is the fact that people actually inhabit this place even today. It is like a walled city which includes homes, shops and market place. But for me this is the very reason that I did not like it much in comparison to maybe the Mehrangarh Fort or the Amber Fort.

title: Over populated and proper guiding facility available
review: Walked up to entrance , but seeing the crowd and the irritating , pestering by local guides decided to return . Sleep climb .

title: Excellent views, excellent architecture, good people.
review: Probably one of the main attractions in Jaisalmer so definitely worth going. Locals seemed quite friendly and willing to help, even when you refuse to buy anything.

title: Very good historical palce
review: If you are in jaislmer than visit to jaislmer fort

title: Good to view from outside only.
review: Visited the fort on 14 January, this fort is good to be viewed from outside only, people live inside and it does not look like a fort once you enter. You will see autos/bikes roaming around and will have to wait for a while even to take a picture. There are lots of drains inside the fort. The only good point inside the fort is:

title: Living Fort
review: One of the very few living forts in India. Huge, beautiful and looks great from outside, particularly at night. But is not so well maintained. Local people are helpful. One has to be cautious of the shopkeepers dealing in saaris and pots who seem to have a close group for fixing the prices of items which are on higher side.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: The fort houses the residents of Jaisalmer mostly the natives of Jaisalmer. The fort also has one Lakshmi Temple and the Jain Temple. The fort has a museum. The entrance fees for the museum for Indians is Rs 100/-. A lot street vendors selling lot of articles and food stuff. One visit is worth.

title: Interesting, lots of people still staying inside this fort
review: It's amazing how lively this fort can be but it is sinking by one inch every year so it's better for travellers to stay outside the fort to preserve this monument.

title: the royal feeling
review: The building is itself royal to watch. The interiors are still intact and looked as if redefining the old era. I felt like princes there. It feels grand. simply grand and beautiful. The views from the windows and balcony are mesmerizing. A must go place for people visiting jaiselmer

title: good place to visit
review: good place to visit

title: Fortified
review: Brilliant fort, very lively, the jain temples stand out, carvings r minute and detailed. A must visit

title: city with in the fort
review: since you have residents all around so cleanness and quietness is taken for toll. But still an amazing fort with large bricks works.

title: There it rises from the dessert
review: Aweosome fort and the fact that you can live inside and walk the narrow streets, especially at night time, gives you a nice ancient feeling.

title: Golden fort
review: Large honey gold colour fort situated in Jaisalmer city. This place contains market, fort and temples. This market is full of handicrafts.Camel safaris is available at nearby sam sand dunes.

title: Nice Walkable Fort
review: Enjoyed stopping here for a quick visit.  No cost to visit.  Easily walkable with quaint alleyways and shops.  No need to do the museum.

title: Disappointed
review: Historical Place but turned into commercial. Much residents in the Fort destroying historical value of the Fort.

title: Heart of the city
review: This fort is in the exact Center of the Jaisalmer , city of gold and can be viewed from any part of the city . For exploring in depth you need at least 2.5hrs , Don't miss the Bhel or other fast food items on the fort. Walkable fort for everyone. Museum is the best part.

title: The most amazing place I've seen in Rajasthan
review: Jaisalmer (with it's inhabited fort) is just amazing. Small alleyways, Jain and Hindu temples 500 year old havelis (small hotels), and roof top restaurants at every corner. It has seen a lot of tourists but it doesn't seem crowded or touristy. It's a small peaceful town (for India), and you can easily spend a couple of days walking along its streets and just enjoying the food, the people, and the views. It also has great shopping, with a lot of good textile shops (if you have time, you can have something tailor made at very low costs, but don't expect top tailors).

title: Too overcrowded for my liking (Only living fort of India)
review: As per people it is the only fort in India where people live inside the fort. As will happen, lots of encroachment, poor drainage and poor hygienic condition. It gave me a feel of old Delhi narrow roads.

title: `highlight of our trip
review: After the grime of Delhi and Agra, this was a welcome treat, a jewel in the desert. Strong sandstone walls that look like they have stood for a 1,000 years and could stand for 1,000 more. the architecture is outstanding along with the views. We went to a rooftop restaurant where we could actually sit with our feet over the walls (something health and safety would scream about back home, but if your sensible it adds to the charm) during dusk flocks of bats came out to play making this seem even more magical

title: Best Rajasthan can offer!
review: I have visited almost all famous cities in Rajasthan and I found Jaisalmer the best of all- mostly because of Jaisalmer Fort! The fort premises has narrow lanes with antique shops and beautiful houses on either sides. Ideal for exploration!

title: Photographers delight
review: Feel it . Else there is not much to offer . India's only live fort go there not to watch it but to feel this .  Fort has nothing much to offer but place called city view is a must with biig canon .

title: Fascinating History loosing its charm
review: Date of the visit : 7th Jan

title: Commercialized
review: The only 2 things about this place are the Jain temple and City Palace. The whole place is commercialized with shops everywhere. Hotels everywhere with over 3000 people living in the fort. The jain temple is very beautiful with great scuptors everywheremade out of yellow limestone. The city palce shows off the history of jaisalmer and the fort. I would say that this is a good fort but not best with junagarh fort in bikaner ahead of it

title: A unique living fort
review: A huge, magnificent fort which is full of life. An official tourist guide is recommended to put the various places of the fort into perspective. Wonderful view of the entire city from the top of the fort. The fort looks absolutely lovely after sunset, with the halogen lights giving the sandstone walls a golden appearance. Staying in on of the accommodations available inside the fort is also recommended.

title: Jaw dropping
review: Simply beautiful. So much to take in and see. You cannot leave the city without visiting this Fort. An experience you will enjoy and remember forever

title: A must do
review: The only inhabited FORT CITY that I have visited. Not sure if there are too many of them around though. The fort is a charming place interspersed with small shops, restaurants, eating carts, vendors selling bric a bracs. This is like takinmg a step back in to the history with bits of modern life thrown in. Lots of by lanes to explore giving you many photo-ops with hidden gems.

title: About Sonar Kella
review: The fort is beautiful and enjoyable. This is historically important also. One famous film director Satyajit Roy edited a film "Sonar Kella" after suiting in Jaisalmer fort. Later this was world famous. Only bad things are that many people are residing inside the fort. Many autos and bikes are moving inside with huge noise and pollution. Government can stop this one inside the fort.

title: Good
review: It's really sad that beautiful place in such conditions. So many jain temples but no body follow rules.

title: The golden fort
review: If you're in India and in Rajasthan you must go to Jaisalmer. a beautiful city with a lovely golden hue from the sandstone. The fort is the only living fort in the world and is very unique. Its dotted with hotels and restaurants and shops. And the surrounding desert is a great place for adventure seekers.

title: Good
review: Really Nice Fort,Great Piece Of Architectaral Work,Can Be A Place Just To Roam Around With Friends....Gives Peace To Mind And Body

title: Back in time
review: This fort is the only living in fort in the world. It will transport you back in time. Beautiful fort. Must visit and keep one full day for this fort atleast.

title: Lovely visit to historical site
review: The audio guide was very informative and the fort is not to be missed. Not much else in town to do but you can spend some time here soaking up history.

title: Edifice of a bygone era.
review: The fort is more of a city with houses shops temples inside the fort complex. This is central attraction. I found the Jain temple housed at the best temple. The view from palace top was beautiful with yellow stone buildings all around. An edifice with a story of a bygone era when this town was an important stop enroute silk route.

title: Sonar Kella
review: Jaisalmer Fort is renowned as Sonar Kella after the famous movie shoot by Satyajit Ray. The fort looks spectacular from outside but not so from inside since this is a living fort. When you enter this resembles a market, dirty and in stark contrast to other beautiful forts of Rajasthan

title: A hyped fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is very grand at outset. A world heritage site. For me the grandeur ends there. The inside of fort is ill kept and ill maintained. Its a living fort. Instead of this being an attraction it has turned an eyesore. There are shops spilling on to pavements, garbage all over, crowds , dust etc. The entry to the kings palace in pricey Rs 100/- and is not value for money.

title: Was very good
review: We was been jaisalmer in January 2016

title: Janta is inside and King is outside
review: This was the first fort I have seen where thousands of people are living inside and king live out side the fort. Fort has museum inside which is has ticket. Fort is not well maintained but you can how people live inside the fort.

title: Crowded and busy.
review: This fort is, uniquely, inhabited and is very crowded. Did not enter the Jain temple but did visit the Palace museum. Again, the narrow, winding staircases and low doors make it difficult to navigate. The hordes of tourists did not help too. Maybe it was a bad time to visit the fort.
