title: Excellent attraction
review: The finest fort with yellow stone and it's a living fort with people living inside with shops temples etc. Old mahals havelis and  intricate stone works are fascinating. There are hotels inside the fort and havelis where families are residing for generations.

title: Vibrant historical masterpiece
review: Jaisalmer fort is a must visit place. This place though is subdued in history but still retaining vibrancy of life. One can enter into fort passing through four gates. Though gates are in the same passage but these have been constructed the way that you can not see one gate from the other. People are residing inside the fort and there are few shops too. We stayed inside the fort and the view was breathtakingly beautiful from the rooftop of our hotel. It seems like sitting in heaven especially at night. From the city fort also looks beautiful. It was really a lifetime experience.

title: amazing view with beautiful architecture
review: the fort gives a beautiful view of the city, the Jaisalmer. it is a fort with people still living inside its premises, gives you an insight of how people used to live in olden times.

title: Enjoy from afar
review: The fort looks great from a far, but unlike the other Rajesthani forts, it is inhabited by locals. Therefore extremely chaotic and dirty. There are people, cows and motor bikes everywhere. You can walk up to parts which give a great view of the city but this will involve trapsing through littered alleys.

title: Architectural Marvel
review: It is incredible as it is a residential fort, which allows one to visit a tourist attraction as well as experience the local culture. The only downside is the cleanliness around the local area.

title: Must go and live in it.
review: Awesome. We lived inside the fort and had an amazing feel of Royalty. The architecture is phenomenal and every inch is worth looking .

title: Great shopping
review: Walk around the fort with a guide to learn the history. Buy some silver jewellery or fabric. Ask a local where the best take away samosas are. Watch the eagles chase the pigeons around the top of the fort in the late afternoon.

title: Beautiful Art of Design
review: The design on the fort are very good one can see that art of designing done by the artist when there was no machine and computers.  The place is well maintained and lot of people visits the place. On can see the entire Jaisalmer city from there.

title: So rinsed.
review: Must have been a fantastic place to visit 100 years ago. Architecture is fantastic and it's really interesting to walk around. But the constant harassment by over priced traders is exhausting. We ended up walking around the fort walls and enjoying the quiet looking outwards.

title: Take a hotel within the fort
review: Spend as much time as you can walking the lanes and alleys of the fort. Hire a guide. It is an awesome place!! Is a "living" fort and open 24X7 since 3k people live within it. Visit in the night and walk around when it is peaceful.

title: Huge fort
review: This fort is humongous and very well built. Its architecture is beautiful and the view from the top is amazing.

title: Other forts without people living in them are better
review: Long drive to get there but not sure it was worth  it.  Having people and very aggressive merchants in the fort in distraction. Even more serious in that plumbing leaks are causing the entire fort to sink and no one seems to want to do anything. In general,  the city was also dirtier than other tourist locations.

title: Huge fort
review: The fort is great. A really nice place to visit. Theres a great indian/Italian restaurant on the right hand side as you enter the gates that has a great view of the fort.

title: Nice inhabited and commercialized fort
review: Visiting Jaisalmer and not going to the fort is like being at a place and not seeing the heart. all the hustle bustle happens here - the shoppings/ eating outs and definitely the touts - do beware of them

title: View from top of the fort is great
review: View of the fort from outside is more beautiful than the inside. Fort also looks very nice from sunset point.View from top of the fort is great all the houses are made from golden sand stone. Fort roads are crowdy also annoying  are the bike running inside the fort. My kid got hit by a bike with minor injury. Pleasantness of the journey specifically broken by guides and tout in the city of Jaisalmer.

title: Jaisalmer Fort visit
review: The fort is situated in too crowded place. Poor housekeeping in and around the fort. Street cows are roaming in the fort complex freely. Diesel run auto are plying up to fort main door. They make Lot of air pollution.

title: Excellent
review: The overall experience was nice. It is indeed quite big, and mostly very well maintained. You must take a guide (usually INR 200 to 300), to experience it. Luckily the guide we had was very experienced and explained all in good details.

title: A fortified city!
review: It's claimed to be one the very few remaining living forts in Rajasthan and indeed the moment you enter it you can feel the difference.

title: A Must Visit Place
review: This place is one of a kind. once you enter the place you can see a small girl doing fabulous stunts on the left side. You walk a bit and enter the fort. There is a big chowk in the center its called manek Chowk. If you are going to visit any of the jain temples there (really beautiful) or the forts  (didnt like it much) then please take a guide or study about it in advance or take a book from home cause otherwise you wont understand the meaning of it all. At the fort u will notice many people buying those rajasthani hats. buy them if you like but its better you buy one of the umbrellas as it will get really sunny. If u visit the fort there means you go inside you have to pay for your ticket and camera ticket. If you are elderly or differently abled or claustrophobic or just not in the mood to visit then dont visit it. not worth going inside as there are really small rooms and small passages and high steps. There are so many tourists in there that the place stinks too.

title: Not worthy to visit
review: Nothing to see ..... Dirty , over populated , garbage , construction going on . Not at all place to visit . Protocol of yellow stone is not followed and people start construction with red bricks which gives shabby look .

title: Old fort but engaging
review: Good experience...worth a visit. it needs more cleanliness. Should open at night. Way to fort is clumsy

title: Historic and lovely
review: The Jain temples are over-the-top amazing. Sandstone walls glow in sunlight.  Great shopping (I love the miniature painter who paints trees on antique postcards, and the spice guy who will give you recipes and lore)- but buyer beware - many fake goods. After believing everything I heard at the supposed widows coop (in photo) I learned that there's no such thing as baby camel wool; the scarves I bought are all angora and/or cashmere; they are still lovely and were affordable, but I don't appreciate being lied to. But overall more honest people and fewer scammers than in Agra or Delhi, no aggressive touts, and fewer beggars as well. A low-key little tourist town.

title: Nice place to visit
review: Experience the energy within the fort and families resides within the  fort. Explore the market and the streets and the views of city from the canon points.

title: worst experience , very dirty, people urinated at various places
review: worst experience , very dirty, people urinated at various places. not worth the visit,

title: Nice property
review: Fort, palace and the city inside the fort walls can be thousand times better if it were maintained properly. There are people living inside and with people comes all kind of dirtiness, garbage etc. It is sad to see such a nice place go down the drain. Views from the fort are really good. All of Jaisalmer can be seen. Still a must visit.

title: Must see
review: A must see destination like many forts in Rajasthan. Amazing architecture and design. Great place for photoshoot, photographers would love what they can capture from here.

title: The Heart of Jaisalmer
review: The visit of Jaisalmer's Fort is a must! The history and the architecture of the fort is very interesting, a visit unforgettable!

title: good
review: the fort is good but very crowded and can be visited once.this is the only living fort. try to go on weekdays as weekend is very crowded.

title: Stunning fort bustling with life
review: Northern India is full of beautiful forts with stunning views and incredible architecture, but what makes the Jaisalmer Fort worth the trip is the life that continues within it.

title: Good view from outside
review: once can enjoy the fort view from outside. The fort inside is now become a commercial place and the only place to view is one of the palaces from the fort. There is an entry fee to the palace as well chargers for photography.

title: it is only living fort in rajasthan
review: this is the only living fort of rajasthan or may be india... its makes u imagine tht how people use to live in a fort in ancient times...

title: Nothing great about the palace.
review: Not very grand or has any special architecture. Very small as compared to other fort in Jaipur and Jodhpur. The entry is very dirty.

title: Jaisalmer fort....
review: A very different fort from others in Rajasthan. The main difference is that people still live in this fort. The museums are preserved well, the narrow lanes are full of shops.

title: Seen better
review: It's your run of the mill fort, nothing which stands out. The forts in Jodhpur and Udaipur are much better compared to this. But if you are in the city for a whole day it's worth a visit

title: So many things to see at one place
review: It was really a nice place and easily spend 2 hours enjoy seeing so many things...Sadly we got a fake guide who didn't explain well...Later we explored our self and read things in wiki...Do not miss the view point which was our best one among all.

title: Great architecture
review: This fort is spread across acres of land and is the living fort where the family of descendants are still staying and running business. From the top of the fort you can get the bird eye view of entire city. This fort is maintained as museum and has the historical collections showing the rich heritage and culture of Rajpuatana kings and their kingdoms.

title: Vacation trip
review: Nice place but not having good restaurants... small city no malls or big brands seen... pansari bazaar and markets in and around the fort like the one near bhatia bhavan are good... street things are good and cheaper too... bhang shop is worth a try... even an out for chat known as "I Love Waterballs" is superb. Overall good.

title: Beautiful Piece of Architecture
review: The Jaisalmer Fort is one of its kind, where people still live inside the fort. It has to be explored either on foot or by cycling.

title: Golden fort
review: The fort is huge with an impressive facade. The localites reside in the fort and the museum for which there is a ticket is owned by the royalty. The museum is well maintained and is definitely worth the visit. Lot of nice cafes and restaurants of varied cuisine are inside the fort. The view from the top of the fort is breathtaking.

title: Outstanding
review: I was very impressed with the living fort of Jaisalmer. It was a nice experience walking in the fort.

title: Magical desert fort.
review: The fort is great, though very commercialised these days - with many more indian tourists than in the past. The people work hard to attract you to their wares, but they're not pushy - friendly with good sense of humour.  The real jewel in the crown though, is a desert safari. Get the right one and it's pure magic!

title: Live fort
review: This is big fort in the real thar desert of rajasthan. This is amongst very few Forts in world having peoples resides inside. Fort is still maintained where you can visit only limited part of fort as measure part is occupied by residents. From the roof of the palace you can have mesmerising view of Jaisalmer city.

title: Sonar Kella or The Golden fort
review: Beautiful fort --which looks like golden in color. The fort is different from the other forts as this fort has people living inside the fort wall. It is a whole city inside the fort. Very unique. The roads, shops and havelis take you back to olden days. This fort is particularly appealing to the Bengali community as the famous Satyajit Ray movie Sonar Kella (the golden fort) was shot here. A must see fort for all fort lovers

title: Nice fort
review: The fort is located at a hill top and makes it a must visit for getting a full view of the Golden City.Do catch a glimpse of the fort in the evening as well to truly complete your fort visit.

title: Golden fort...as the name says
review: Great place to visit.. Gives panoramic view of Jaisalmer city...make sure you take govt. guide who can tell the historical importance of the fort... Becomes crowded as the day passes, so try to be there early...the fort has museum inside it..costs rs100 for entry...also it has a couple of Jain temples, good architecture and carving (600+ yrs old)...lots of shopping places inside and outside to the fort. The fort has the Kind palace (which is now a museum) and about 300 houses where villagers used to stay earlier. Now also families live there but the place has become crowded.

title: A living fort
review: Its a living fort that is what is different about it , but not very well kept . Could be one of the options to visit

title: Not so much as hyped about
review: Jain temples were good.

title: Great place but lack of maintenance
review: For Bengalis it is nostalgia to visit Sonar Kella. But the place is great however very crowded with minimal maintenance. Must visit if you are at Jaisalmer town

title: Grt Experience
review: stay at jaisalmer fort, awesome view. amazing experience. i recommend stay at surja hotel in jaisalmer fort. loved the place .had a grt time.

title: Sonar Kella
review: Good heritage. Must see for Bengali peoples. Though you may a bit   surprised because peoples are residing inside the fort. They are selling crafts item in huge price margin. In off season auto ply inside the fort. Take the help of auto if you would like to avoid 2-3 km walk to enter into fort

title: Not as great as Jaipur or Jodhpur
review: This is a decent fort .. Not so great as Jaipur or Jodhpur Forts ..  and it is in a very crowded place .

title: Golden fort of the golden age
review: It is visible on the hill top from most of the places within the city The availability and wastage of water within the fort will put many of the cities to serious introspection. One needs to rethink that one is in the prime desert or wet land.Climate was chilly in the night and pleasant through the day in December.

title: Nice place n can njoy dinner on top of fort
review: Amazing ...... Without Jaisalmer fort ur journey is worthless. U can go there easily by walk n no need to take auto for visit in the fort. Can also njoy dinner at fort in so many small restaurant . n it is open 24 hours except king palace.

title: Old Living Fort
review: While there was nothing exceptional about the Fort, it is an old living Fort with ~3000 people living inside. The panoramic view of the Fort, as well as the view of the City from inside the Fort are good.

title: Awesome
review: Nice place for visit because this is only the fort in india where the people are living...i think it is enough about the fort but this the nice place to visit. In this fort the mentality of the peoples are great.....

title: One time to experience
review: Good for one time...exploring few monuments is kind of fun for once..dont forget the top view of jaisalmer from fort...............

title: Can be maintained better
review: Its the main highlight of this city but sadly the fort is not well maintained primarily because its a living fort and everyone is doing everything inside. The fort is only a fort for tourists. For everyone else in Jaisalmer, it's their home (the ones who live in it).

title: A great place to stay and wander
review: We loved wandering through the tiny alleys during the day, and even though the shop owners are all asking you to come inside, none are overly aggressive like I've seen elsewhere.  We stayed in a hotel on the fort wall (Paradise Hotel) that provided great views of the whole fort and surrounding areas. The only downside? I got pooped on by a bird while walking through one of the temples (hardly the fault of the fort).

title: Ok, beautiful to see
review: Had food and coffee at restaurant near entry of fort something Italy , was wonderful. The fort has a few shops and a museum entry 500 rupees and 100 for camera including audio. Audio was good but did not find museum that exciting. Should have just visited and taken some photos in the fort which is free to enter

title: Must visit in Jaisalmer
review: Unlike other forts, this fort has entire city staying in. Amazingly Jaisalmer fort has city population living inside, gives experience of fort and people cultural heritage.

title: good living fort
review: Good living fort of india,have a lot of things to see.The Jain temples inside of fort are extremely good

title: 12th Century living marvel
review: People (too many, in fact) still live within the fort's triple walls.  This largest of India's medieval forts has a 900 year history and well deserves it recent award as a UNESCO World Heritage site.  The ramparts fairly grow out of Trikuta Hill.  It includes two Jain temples that tourists can enter.  And the Brahman side, past the women's castle, provides a quiet respite from the noisy tuk-tuks and motor bikes around the haveli areas.  We had a quiet lunch at one of the rooftop restaurants on the Brahman side.

title: Not a typical fort. Locals stay inside
review: This fort is far better from outside than inside. The king's place has been converted into museum. But this is not maintained well. The fort itself wasn't grand due to the scare resources available in this region. One would appreciate the fact that the fort has been built without using water and mortar. The locals live inside the fort itself. Can visit once.

title: Worth a visit deep inside the living fort
review: Worth a visit, taking a guide is worth, he will get you around very well. Make sure you go deep inside the living fort area to get a real feel. We went there twice, once during the day and then also in the evening to see it during the evening.

title: Beautiful fort... unlike the rest of the country.
review: If u r driving u can go to the bada parking and walk to the entrance of the gate. Its a bit of a climb before u get to the fort square. The mahal is very homely but has one of the finest designs I gave seen during my 20 years of travel. Jain yemples are also beautiful. You can hire a guide for 150/- who can give u the history. Its a 800yr old for... one of the oldest. Take an auto to the square if u cannot climb. Many gems stores - dnt buy any thing ... enjoy the fort.

title: Golden fort like gold but stone
review: Very big fort no like chitorgadh but OK .clean but business .water posebal Avery sope .many hotel in fort many restaurant .many temple .city palace good that have jain temple all temple golden stone bay jaisalme fort and jaisalmer

title: Must visit place
review: You will find it attractive because of its architecture and its location.

title: Nice Place
review: Its a good place to visit.

title: fort with city inside
review: This fort is occupied with homes and shops. I did not feel like i am visiting a fort.

title: experience the royal rajasthan
review: very big fort must take a guide so that you can understand the history behind each and every place. Little congested, must carry water bottle.

title: living fort
review: its the only living fort in india. the view from the fort is great. you may have to avoid a few cows and goats and other animals but in general a wonderful experience

title: Gorgeous forts
review: Beautiful forts with lots of history. We went with a tour company so the educational aspect we got added to the experience.

title: Indian pride,a world heritage site
review: One of the largest fortifications in the world. It's also known as Sonar Quila or Golden Fort. A must visit during your trip to Rajasthan.

title: unorganised & unmanaged
review: since we were planing to visit jodhpur and jaisalmer how could we miss jaisalmer fort. lets start from the time we parked our car. Unlike jodhpur fort jaisalmer doesnt provide you with guide. They do have badges from the suthority but it isnt collaborated with the fort authority. So the drama started as soon as we got off the car. We felt as if we were attacked by the mob. I was tired of saying no to guides. But they are terrible and someone become like your shadow. I was so irritated I had to scream at 5 different places to different groups to leave us alone. At one point I was thinking to hire one so that rest of them leave us alone but then I thought why to give in. We were initially planning to hire a guide but then looking at everyones forceful actions I decided not to hire anyone. The fort has nothing great to offer if you have visited other forts in Rajasthan. Totally over rated extremely expensive entries and also very dirty. The only thing worth watching in the fort was the Gangaur mata idol which is made of ivory and worths around 2 mn dollars. Its extremely beautiful. But the only thing thats worth watching was left totally unattended and the view wasnt clear as the curtains were on.

title: Chaotic Experience
review: Whatever little charm there is in the fort is ruined by a complete lack of organisation in managing tourists. Be it in fighting through crowds to buy entry tickets to queueing endlessly to navigate from room to room, the experience is not worth what is on offer in displays and views.

title: Interesting "lived in fort" worth a visit
review: Very interesting to visit the only large "lived in fort" in Rajasthan. Well maintained and lots to see. I would recommend hiring  a good guide without which the uniqueness of the fort and the various temples and structures would not be understood. Has nice scenic eating options too. You can easily spend 3-4 hours. Lovely views of the town from the terraces.

title: Average
review: Not much to see in the crowded  part of the city. Not much encouragement from the guide as well. All the expectations were shattered to see a tattered palace

title: Different from other forts
review: Its nice to spend a couple of hours.the jain temple inside is super pretty.good shopping places inside.

title: Only fort people living inside
review: Next to dessert safari fort is the main attraction. It's claimed to be the only fort where people live inside. There are few hotels converted from house. There is museum, temples , Havelis and beautiful things to see in the fort. There is hardly any climb and comfortable for any person. In certain hours auto rickshaw available to take you up the fort.

title: Half day visit - go in the morning
review: We went in the afternoon for a visit. We had seen most of the fort within a couple of hours. The cannons provide nice views of the town. It was really interesting to see a lived in fort - I really enjoy it. But for me it wasn't the highlight of my trip.

title: Trip
review: Great sculptures n architecture. Amazing place n must visit if you're in Jaisalmer. The peak of Jaisalmer

title: Not as nice as Mehrangarh fort at Jodhpur
review: We came to Jaisalmer after Jodhpur so the expectations were still very high.. But the Jaisalmer fort is beautiful too! There is an amazing German Bakery just at the entrance.. DO NOT miss .. Cheap and YUMMY! There are good amount of shops inside the fort which are pretty decently priced too.. The Jain temples are beautiful..RIght outside the fort there is the govt. approved Bhaang dealer.. yes it works :) enjoy!

title: Great living fort
review: the fort is very different from jodhpurs and Jaipur forts.  It has a Great Wall but inside it is a city full of great small streets.  The most real of all the Rajasthan forts we visited.  Loved it.  Stayed at a hotel in the fort and walked around after 9 pm when all the shops were closed.

title: Wear your walking shoes !
review: Wear your walking shoes and enjoy the by-lanes and interact with local people. The Raja and Rani Mahal can be missed and nothing great especially is one has visited Udaipur and Chittor

title: Amazing
review: Well worth a visit and enduring the oppressive heat!  Visited as a couple on a 6 month backpacking trip in 2001

title: Good but not maintained
review: We visited fort in December 2015 on Sunday morning. It was extremely crowded. There was also lots of pushing. Jain temple are beautiful. But fort is not maintained. But I would recommend to visit

title: #World only living Fort
review: It was a amazing experiance to take a vist to the fort. 'The best thing is that people still living in this fort which makes it completly diff frm other forts'. Wherver u will travel around d city d fort will be visible to u. Dont miss to go to d roof of d fort nd i personaly suggest to hire a guide dere bcoz dere r variouss facts nd beautifull history which u r not aware of dat....

title: Remarkable!!
review: I have seen many forts before, but Sonar Qila is unimaginable because of its distinct feature that it is still inhabited. It is a live fort where you do not have to imagine and see through the empty ruins. a lovely place to spend your morning and evenings and the best part is it is open 24/7.

title: expected more
review: The fort looks majestic from a distance, particularly at night. However it lacks the grandeur inside. Only a small part of the fort is actually the tourist place, rest is dedicated to families who are staying in the area.

title: Beautiful
review: Dont forget to see the thousand peacocks carved on the sajja of the maharaja's palace in the fort. jaisalmer fort is really shines like the gold during sunrise and sunset..

title: living in a 800 year old fort is special
review: The fort is 800 years old. It is the only fort built by sandstone in Rajasthan. There are many shops, restaurants and hotels inside the fort. You can choose to stay at a hotel there. They usually are few hundred year old with history. Getting up in the morning looking over the city out of your window is something special. feel like living in the history. Make sure you visit the city palace around late afternoon. The sunset view is amazing.

title: Average
review: Steep path to the fort, better take an auto rickshaw up to the entrance of the fort!

title: very well maintained fort
review: Its fort which i like in other forts available in rajasthan. Rajastahn is place where you found many forts. But well maintained are very few. Golden buggy(gold make cart) is special attraction of this fort.

title: A fort full of life
review: Jaisalmer fort is one of a kind as it is still inhabited, A walk through fort, is more like a walk through old times, its a scene from history coming alive. The view of Jaisamer from fort is fabulous. I would recommend a stay in fort, for a wholesome experience of Jaisalmer.

title: Very attractive Sonar killa
review: Had visited inn month of December, so was very pleasant to walk through.

title: Place which is really worth to be seen
review: Fort in Jaisalmer is very incredible place - fort is not just a tourist attraction, but is also the place where people live. That's why this place is so alive. You can see narrow streets, people selling handmade products, women making loundry outside and kids playing around. There is a lot of restaurants offering seating on the rooftop from where you have a wonderful view to the city.

title: traditional fort lit with gold color
review: Jaisalmer is a beauty with Golden rocks, the entire city is made gold colored or yellow colored bricks/rocks which enlighted the place.

title: Very nice fort but being ruined
review: This is well built fort.  Beautiful, also well maintained.  However, people own their homes, shops and hotels within the fort.  As a result, it is both well maintained from the outside and being ruined on the back side.  I took a stroll through the backside of the houses on the fort and all trash was thrown out there.

title: Too Crowded
review: Jaisalmer is a small town which receives more visitors in winters than it can accommodate. As such, it's overcrowded and suffocating.  Avoid going there during national holidays

title: Beautiful!
review: It's unlike any other fort that I have seen before. A living fort, it is definitely worth going to. There are a lot of cafes inside, try not showing inside as it is kind of overpriced inside.

title: Sonar Qila - Visit early morning
review: A Fort with plenty of Temples and shopping avenues inside. Jain temples are very good to visit. May also visit museum.

title: Classy Dessert Town Fort with people living in
review: One of the main attractions of this great heritage town of Jaisalmer, thats right in the midst of Thar Desert. The fort is golden, made of stones that doesn't need lot of water for construction.

title: Worth a visit
review: If you are in Jaisalmer, this fort is worth a visit. The intricate carvings in the building were very nice. But the  way to fort, may be they were a part of fort in olden days, were inhabited by people and small shops. So it was cramped, and we couldnt go in with a vehicle. But a lot of bikes and auto rikshaws were going in high speed around us, making us scary to walk. The shops sell a lot of handicrafts and local goods, but we should know how to bargain. Knowing Hindi can come in handy here.

title: Unclean and Unorganized
review: The fory is not clean. You can find papers and uncleanliness all around the fort. It is not well maintained too.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: It is very good fort.All the temples are gems.Our guide was not having enough information about the spot,he even didnt show us Maharaja/Maharani Haveli in the fort

title: Unique
review: Loved it!!! One of its kind with people living inside the fort,, flooded with shops,  hotels and restaurants... Definitely worth a visit

title: excellent fort
review: we had a walking tour of almost three hours in fort it was almost like a small village with all kinds of facilities.and jain temple inside was also very attractive.

title: Not all parts are open to public
review: This Fort is known to be world's biggest fort but only 10% of it is open for public visit.Not worth the money and time spent.

title: The History Becomes Alive
review: The place is one of the few attractions in Jaisalmer, Very Well Preserved and Maintained. Has mighty history attached to it

title: Big and amazing!!
review: I went for a road trip to Jaisalmer with friends and visited the fort. Jaisalmer fort is huge and like a small village inside. You need to park the car a walk approx. 200 mtrs to enter the fort. The place is mostly crowded in December as many tourists come to this place in winters. The fort looks amazing from the entrance and has been preserved well. The fort in many restaurants, houses, shops built inside it and houses hundreds of people.

title: What Jaisalmer is all about besides camel rides.
review: This is what Jaisalmer is all about besides camel rides, Jaisalmer would be just another city if it wasn't for this fort. Nice restaurants, temples and shops down small alleys. This place breathes history and is beautifull to be in and around for one or two days.

title: Ray's Sonar Kella
review: Being from Bengal, the land of Satyajit Ray, I have some extra feelings about this Fort. On seeing a number of places, I could realise the vision of Ray, as narrated in his famous film. It is also felt that real Rajasthan lies here.

title: Take a walk in the lanes
review: A unique Indian fort where people are staying inside the fort. Take a walk in the lanes to see old buildings. Don't expect too much from the fort as such. The museum can be avoided if you have seen some already at Jodhpur/ Udaipur.

title: Fort with 3-4 place
review: One should visit with Guide, cause inside it is in approx 4-5 attractions. Museum , Temple etc. time consuming place one can go by auto if doesnt want to walk. nut it is walk-able for normal person.

title: Masterpiece in Architecture
review: Considering the scarcity of water, the construction of this Fort is indeed a work of masterpiece. Its a long walk from the first gate. Once inside, it is city in itself. People are still staying in the houses. To understand the architecture, hire a guide who would tell you the story behind each section. The Jain temple, inside the fort, is a marvel of architecture. Do visit till the top of the fort to have a great view of the Swarn Nagri (Yellow city).

title: Historical place
review: Nice place to visit to know about the historical thing's well managed and beautiful view of full jaselmer from top of fort.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: After the opulent forts of Udaipur, Jaisalmer Fort was a total let down. It did not have many items on display if historic value. The fort has families living inside and also businesses. Very strange. Also, the fort doesn't feel clean and hygienic. It has a peculiar stink. You have to pay for parking, for taking an auto till the starting point of the tour of the fort. You also have to pay for entry, camera etc. Not worth it for this property. I wouldn't recommend it if you have been to Udaipur properties.

title: Great service
review: Great service, great experience and great ambience.

title: Good place
review: Nice place to have city view.

title: nice place
review: Good Architecture and very well planned fort.... rich in history and has a view of complete Jaisalmer from Top

title: can be visited for one time
review: There is jain temple in this fort, which is worth seeing. Brass items in this fort are very chip, pottery of Jaisalmer stones are also beautiful and cheap. Fort is highly populated as people are residing inside the fort

title: Expensive and apathy from staff
review: The fort is good and worth your time. It is nice that people still stay within the fort. There is general apathy by staff. Do try to get there early to avoid the crowd.

title: Sonar Fort
review: One of the best forts that i visited on the trip to Rajasthan. Superb history connected to it....great construction and many stories connected to it. The museum inside the fort is also very good and worth visiting. Do hire a guide to get the maximum information. The fort is still habilitated by some brahmins and Rajput families. Wonderful place to visit...almost spent twice as much as time as we were supposed to.

title: Live in Fort
review: Interesting fort - however since it is a live in fort, it is dirty at places and also quite crowded with vehicles also moving about all over the place. The Museum is quite nice and worth a visit for sure.

title: Super..
review: One of the few forts in the world where people reside.. 4000 residents make it almost a town in itself.. Great eating joints inside and good atmosphere.. Must visit..

title: The biggest fort ofcourse!
review: The fort is considered as the biggest,  that's true! Few canons are placed inside the fort. This gives the idea how the protection been done on those days...

title: Offers some great photo ops
review: It is said to be the second biggest fort in Rajasthan. However, there is just one palace that is open to tourists. The intricately carved pillars, balconies and verandahs offer great photo ops. One gets a view of the entire city from the terrace of the palace. The rest of the houses within the fort precincts also exhibit wonderful architecture. However, the squalor in the fort area kind of belies the Swachh Bharat billboards that abound in Jaisalmer.

title: Living History
review: Amazing fort that is still inhabited. To get away from all the chaos and take the best pictures, go just after sunrise and before 9am when the city wakes up! Also the chai stand near the palace and the main square makes amazing masala chai for INR 10. A must try.

title: comercialize
review: fort is good in itself.but its full of other hostels.

title: Living fort
review: I liked the part of the fort in the first gate it's like you walk through a gate to the same place it was like I was still in the city on the inside but on the outside it looks like a fort that is non-living.

title: One of the biggest fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is one of the biggest fort where you can find houses of people and hotels inside the fort complex. The places to visit are king's palace, queen's place, jain temple and also two view points from where you can see the entire city. Hire a guide for a great experience otherwise you might get lost and miss on important things to see.

title: Big fort with less attraction
review: Its one of the biggest fort but exist as a residential colony dotted with shops for most... only a small section remains as Palace and Museum. Compared to this Jodhpur fort (Mehrangarh) is wonderfully maintained and exhibits a lot and charges Rupees 20 against Rs.100 for this... Government authorities should put some efforts to make this more attractive. Made this as part of customary visit once when we drop in to Jaisalmer for Sand Dunes and Camel Safari. If anyone does not find time it is better to skip the Palace/Museum instead spend time at visiting dunes and other places around Jaisalmer.

title: A City within a Fort
review: The fort really functions as the old part of the city with shops, restaurants and hotels. There are some great views from the walls of the fort.

title: Amazing
review: Jaisalmer Fort or Golden Fort is one of the most beautiful fort that I have seen in my life. This fort looks so amazing during the night. In the day time it looks awesome. It will take at least 2 hrs to complete the visit.

title: Good view
review: The fort is open for visitors. Ticket for Indians cost 50. They provide guides as well as an audio tour. The place could have been better maintained but it's a must visit place if you go to jaisalmer.

title: Nice
review: Really nice place..picturesque site.. colourful.. city view from top is awsome.

title: Not very Interesting
review: The beauty of this fort is completely ruined. Not very much of the original fort was left. People are living inside the fort. There are many hotels and restaurants inside the fort. I have stayed one of these hotels inside the fort. But some part of the fort are still untouched by the people till now remains as it originally was.But I dont find this fort very attracting as compared to the forts in Jodhpur and Jaipur.

title: amazing architecture but lost the orignality
review: all the fort is converted to various museum sort of display which makes the place loose its originality.

title: Beautiful Royal Fort
review: Its a beautiful fort, must visit when in Jaisalmer to get that feel of Royal Palace. The fort is very big however some part of it is still used by locals whose families has been staying there since King's time. I would suggest taking guide for 100-150Rs to get easy and faster tour of the fort with appropriate information. Fort also have house/shops setup selling traditional items. Dont miss the view of the complete city from its roof area.

title: Old and clean
review: The fort and the buildings are really old. The locals have kept the fort area task clean. Love the colour of the sand stone.

title: Roof of the Jaisalmer
review: Good place.You should have a guide if you want to have better knowledge of the fort. On the top you can easily see all the city including far deserted areas.You can easily identify almost all attractions of Jaisalmer from top of the fort.

title: Like a sandcastle rising from the desert
review: The fort is the only inhabited one in India, but it is full of tourist shops and people trying to sell you there stuff as you wonder past. It is pretty to look at from both the inside and outside of the fort, but the constant attempts to get you to look in people's shops gets a bit tiresome.

title: Marwad visit
review: Visit fort still for about 2 hrs. by auto.Fort still maintains old customs like the whole fort is invited for marriage by sticking invitation card outside the house.

title: Shopping Fort
review: Perfect for Shopoholic people. There was less fort and more shopping shops. You need a guide to know about the fort and the way to roam. You can see whole Jaisalmer from the top of the fort. Jain temples are very good.

title: A delightful fort
review: This fort is a delight. Very interesting and well laid out for the visitor. The audio guide is a must.

title: An Impressive Fort
review: A very large fort a huge portion of which is occupied by the local residents and used as shops, hotels or residence. The place is not clean and not well maintained. Otherwise a very impressive monument which can be an important tourist attraction.

title: Lovely place to wander in
review: Just taking a stroll in the old fortress or watching it from a terrasse outside is a very simple pleasure.

title: Just another fort..  The shining golden stone is different though
review: I have been to many forts in our country,  in North in central and in South..  Every fort has a unique history obviously but also a uniqueness in the way it is made and architecture.

title: pretty big
review: its a big fort with a very good Jain mandir (Temple) to see Jain culture. Many ppl are still staying in the fort. nice view of the city from top

title: A great experience - Guide recommended.
review: Visit to the fort was undoubtedly a great experience. However it all depends upon the guide how he turns & keeps your "interest on" during the entire tour.

title: People Dwelling Inside Fort, To Be Experienced
review: Visited during the Navrathri Oct, 2015.

title: Poorly managed
review: The fort is over crowded and poorly managed as people still live inside. The quick tour of the Fort is enough with good view of the city and beautifully carved Jain temples. you can also experience local shopping as the price are quiet reasonable the choice is wide.

title: A labyrinth of narrow alleyways
review: Virtually traffic free, it's wonderful to meander around this densely built and compact area. Every tout will try and attract you to their roof-top restaurant; but just do your own thing

title: Worth a visit
review: Beautiful old fort with good views of city, interesting Jain temples and architecture. Well worth a couple of hours visit and walkabout. Hire a guide as you enter.

title: Not as enamoured as others
review: This fort looks amazing from a distance. It is one of the few living forts remaining. We walked around without a guide and it was easy enough to navigate, like any other popular tourist area you are constantly asked for guide services or to visit shops.

title: Golden City's Golden Fort
review: The fort in Jaisalmer is one of its kind where the people live inside and the kind lives outside. Golden City's Golden Fort reminds you of rich culture and genuine people. The fort gives you huge shopping/ window shopping opportunity for tourist. Prices are far better than Jaipur.

title: The Golden Fort
review: Jaisalmer Fort also known as the Golden Fort is now a UNESCO World Heritage site. It was built in 1156 AD by the Rajput ruler Rawal Jaisal.  The fort stands amidst the sandy expanse of the great Thar Desert, on Trikuta Hill, and has been the scene of many battles. The fort is located in the very heart of the city, and is one of the most notable monuments in the locality.

title: UNIQUE
review: this fort is not like the others one in Rajasthan

title: Shops/ restaurants inside fort
review: No charge to enter this fort - as the shops and restaurants have invaded the inside fort area. Quite a nice change although it would be so much better if it was maintained and kept clean. Worth a walk around, and a visit to one of the cafes with a nice view.

title: Good experience
review: Of the many forts we visited during our trip to Rajasthan this is perhaps our favourite.  It is a "living" fort in that people still live and conduct their lives and businesses within the fort.  It is more than a museum and as such is more authentic.

title: A Different Experience
review: Not sure what a living Fort means, we were curious to explore this. Vehicles are not allowed so one has to explore the narrow lanes on foot. There are old Jain and Hindu temples to visit - the intricate stone carving in Jain temples is truly amazing. There is a viewing point (where the gun is kept), and you can get a good view of the Jaisalmer town and beyond. Its worth exploring the place lazily in a 2 hrs visit. Taking a guide is recommended - you can get a guide for the entire City tour which last 4-5 hrs

title: awsom
review: this fort was have somthing unique thing which can give us many surprise this fort have awsom views .

title: Not worth the visit
review: Being the only fort in India having habitats living in it. It is really not worth going. TOO crowded very badly maintained. Very bad two wheeler traffic going up & down. It is avoidable completely.

title: Fireworks
review: Went up to the fort for Diwali fireworks and got some of the most amazing city views. Beautiful day and night. There's also a nice bakery at the entrance. Following the twisted paths can lead to more isolated enjoyable streets. Basically, get lost.

title: Fort is beautiful from outside but Fort from inside is disappointing
review: While the fort is undoubtedly beautiful and looks majestic from anywhere in the city both in the day and the night - when one goes inside the fort , it is dirty and messy everywhere. There is barely any place to walk inside the fort as there are auto's , bikes , cows and animals all around. It is extremely commercialized and crowded.

title: Not as expected!
review: This is a very famous attraction in Jaisalmer, but we weren't much satisfied as expected, may be because it was overcrowded and we couldn't give it much time.

title: Must visit
review: One of the most beautiful forts in India and the only living fort with half of the city still living inside the fort. The fort had homes and markets and anything and everything inside the fort itself. Do visit the canon point to get a birds eye view of Jaisalmer city.

title: Ok, But to expensive
review: Would not recommend to go inside. It's to expensive and nothing special to see

title: In sad state- filth everywhere!
review: The most disappointing part of Jaisalmer, ironically, is Jaisalmer Fort. The historic structure has been ravaged by hotels, restaurants and filth!

title: Lot to explore
review: The Jaisalmer fort is magnificent. The view from the fort is as awesome as the view of the fort from the city. There are lot of things to explore within the fort - Temples, Palace, Canons, Restaurants and hotels.

title: A Living Fort - mixed feelings !
review: This is a living fort - there is an entire community of people living within the ramparts. The subject of the maestro, Satyajit Ray's "Sonar Kella" (The Golden Fort) movie, looks stunning at sunset. The Jain temples inside are intricate and awesome.

title: Avoid peak season
review: No traffic or parking management. If somebody is having physical disability, it would be a nighmare. In peak season, there is just one ticket window for all the tourists. As too many tourists are allowed inside the palace situated in fort - it becomes suffocating.

title: Good living fort.
review: A little congested. But good architecture. The fort is so huge that it may take a whole day if all the areas are visited.

title: Unless you wish to see Jain Temples, It is not a place to visit. There is no Fort.
review: Apart from the Jain temples inside the so called fort, there are lanes and by lanes. Shops, Homes of people who actually live there. So you have Auto Rikshaws, Scooters, Motor Bikes moving around. If you are not keen to see Jain temples, it is not a place worth visiting.

title: Golden Fort!
review: A key visiting place when you are in Jaisalmer. There are also many hotels inside the fort which can give you very good view of the city from fort wall. So, don't forget to look for that option. A good amount of walk us needed to see whole fort, including jain temple which is inside the fort. Market inside the fort is cheaper then the market in the city, so if you want to buy something local do not forget to get it from fort market. A good negotiation will give you best price for your item, so do not hesitate. Overall a good experience. Also taking a guide to know the history is advisable.

title: A beautiful fort in ruins gone to cows and garbage
review: The Jaisalmer fort is the heart of the city can is visible from all round but unlike Jodhpur or  other fort cities this is a fort with people living in it.. The fort is badly maintained and in ruins. there is garbage in every corner,cows and two wheelers roam in and out freely and nosily. Besides with people living in the fort in some of the lanes you feel that you are strangers walking into someones homes... If these people can be rehabilitated and the fort maintained as  others in the country it would be a priceless piece of history... As of now  except for the Beautiful Jain temples, its not worth the time and effort...

title: Golden city Fort
review: The ancient fort of Golden city is very beautiful as one can view the Jaisalmer city from the top of the fort.

title: Beer at Height...cooool
review: Excellent way to relax after bit of a walk uphill to the city veiw point atop the fort. The moment you reach there and take few deep WOW breath...you notice a neat clean and wonderful small terrace top beer bar (not exactly a bar mind you) but a wonderful location for 4 R's - refresh, relax, rejuvenate, rekindle,

title: May be a one time visit.
review: The fort in itself is grand. The Jain temples with the walls are very impressive. Beware of the ppl selling things there. Everything is over priced. Get a government approved guide to help you see the place and understand the history.

title: Wish comes true to stay in a living fort...
review: marvelous architecture, no cement or other material to make this fort (nick and notch joining of stones). From top of the fort you can see the random view of city. beautiful temples inside. friendly people. you can watch cannons also. its awesome to sit on the roof top restaurant and enjoy the cool breeze specially if its month of November or Feb to march (for me in summers as i am local resident now). jaisalmer is a city to explore by walking. narrow roads. lots of beautiful houses with great architecture in these narrow roads. anyway worth money  to stay in fort.

title: Wow place badly maintained
review: This ones a big big fort and gives an idea of the great empire and other good times that the place have been part of. Golden color of the fort is admirable architecture be it in day time or night.

title: Must visit fort
review: A fantastic and mighty fort in the heart of Jaisalmer. Its recommended to have a guide to understand the history associated with this fort. In a comfortable pace, this will take at least 2 hours to visit.

title: REAL TIME ANCENT GLORY LIVING !!
review: Probably the first fort any where still the city lives...beautifully done and established ans visible in the city of Jaisalmer only..Sonar Kila...the Golden Fort in the Golden city

title: great place
review: i think one of the  biggest fort in the world. Famous as Sonar kila Fantastice place, i wish i could born in that time,

title: Jaisalmer fort is scenic with good view from above
review: Jaisalmer fort is scenic with good view from above. Jain temples near the king palace is very artistic and the designs carved on the walls is awesome and calmness prevails inside.

title: A Golden Treasure - Victim of Apathy
review: The only living fort of the world "Soanar Quila" or the Golden Fort is decaying fast because of the apathy of the owners. Only owners can and should act to restore this golden heritage to its glory days and be the pride owners!

title: Please avoid staying inside the fort
review: There are many hotels inside the fort. Although over use of the weak drainage system inside by travelers has left this fort in danger. Please avoid staying inside the fort to save this monument of our country. We stayed in a hotel outside the fort and was a nice stay. Hotels and agencies try to coax you to go for their desert safaris saying they are offering the best. Go around and check for the best price you can get.

title: Historical
review: What an amazing place. Full of history an fairly well looked after. It's a working fort so sadly a lot of illegal buildings added on Be ready for the filth and dirt with open sewage everywhere. But get past that and it's worth a visit.

title: Great Fort
review: This is one of the good forts that you can visit in India. But you got to have time to visit this fort completely. I had one and a half hour and I was not able to see half of it.

title: Awesome fort..
review: Awesome place and must visit place. Once we reach there guide surrended us. And we took one guy and went to see the fort.. simply those guide ask us to hire auto. Please dont hire a auto. How ever they won't allow auto to inside the fort.. even it s not so far. Easily can walk. And specially don't buy anything inside the fort. Specialy appearels. U will find the same thing near haweli with almist 40% less rate(oly appearels). Must visit place.

title: Not as exciting
review: Huge fort but township developed inside. Hence crowded and dirty. The lanes offering Rajasthan shopping stuff were good, can't comment on prices. Parking too expensive at 50 rupees. And a little steep climb for those who have issues in that.

title: Great golden fort
review: One of the biggest attraction in jaisalmer, more than a fory it is a resodential complex for locals, you need a guide for sure as it is very complex in terms of walk visit.

title: Amazing! Beautiful Sandstone
review: Beautiful Yellow Sandstone. Still a living fort. A Fabulous museum with great architecture. A bit of climbing to do but well worhtwhile.

title: Great Views
review: The fort is one of a kind n massive with scenic views of the golden city of Rajasthan.....also got lot of shops selling local goods. a must visit @Jaisalmer

title: The Palace was a highlight
review: Strolling through the lived-in fort and dining in the countless rooftop restaurants with astounding views was fun, if not a bit congested with tourist shops, but the palace was really the best part, and we almost missed it! The audio guide was definitely worth it -- it was one of the most informative I've ever heard and outlined the fascinating history of both Jaisalmer and Rajasthan in a way other tours on our trip didn't. Don't miss it!

title: Fort with life
review: This is a fort with people living in there. A nice change fr all the other forts I've been in Rajasthan.

title: Normal fort
review: Nothin great about the fort.. It's a fort with a great view.. Jodhpur fort is far better and maintained than this fort...

title: Conservation of heritage
review: An interesting insight into the remnants of the lifestyle of the royal dynasties of Rajasthan, India !

title: sad
review: the fort is such a jewel but so sad to see the condition. there is crazy traffic, not maintained , and just too busy. has lost its glory .

title: great
review: Golden Fort in Jaisalmer is the only living fort present in India. I have seen it in a Bengali movie. When we entered the fort it felt alive with markets, houses, restraunts, domestic animals moving in the street, people riding motorbikes and going for work. It was all very different than all the other forts I have been to. There is even a palace inside the fort it’s very beautiful and reminds that just like the Mughals even Rajput’s have a an amazing sense of beauty which is seen in their palaces. It’s called the Golden Fort because it’s made by stones that are yellow in color, so it gives an appearance that it’s made out of gold. Overall the Golden Fort is a live version of how people used to live many centuries ago.

title: Yellow sand stone fort
review: This is a living fort.  There is a walk up to the fort but well worth it.    This fort is part of an old trading route and has links with the dynasties of Rajasthan.

title: Wonderful
review: The fort is quite big and beutiful. One visit is worth. Right time to visit is  Sep to Mar. Take a camera along as u will find enough shots to capture. Go on top of the fort n have a view of the entire city.

title: Great fort
review: The place is amazing.. it is one of the forts where almost 300 people stay. Do take a guide or the audio devices to walka round the fort.

title: Walk the streets
review: I spent a month in Jaisalmer. I am a Street Photographer and spent most days going to Fort for sunrise to take photos from the fort of the amazing sunrise. I spent many hour walking the narrow lanes exploring. It is a photographer dream place.

title: Interesting fort , impressive carvings
review: Take a guide who'll show you all the little nooks and crannys of the place and all the stories associated with each of the exhibits and paintings.

title: Congested
review: Congested, it is one large lane of shops selling trinkets for tourists and eateries. Unlike other forts people have not vacated this place and continue to make their living inside. You have bikes, auto rikshaws jostling for space along with tourists and pedestrians on the narrow pathway inside the fort.

title: Mr Richard Dartnell
review: Nice views of the fort from inside and exterior. Considering there was two wheeler traffic in the fort the drivers were considerate of us tourists. First time I have visited a fort with local and Regal inhabitants.

title: The tranquil Jaisalmer fort
review: Time stops at Jaisalmer fort. From our guest house we could see the vast fort and we expected boredom. However, we decided to take a walk till the top and what we saw was unbelievable! The fort is carved with yellow sandstones and the evening sun adds the honey yellow color to the stones. The legend says that once the entire village used to live inside the fort but now the fort is commercialized and one can find all kind of traditional Rajasthani mercantile here. Those who loves colors and minimalistic photography will love Jaisalmer Fort.

title: A perfect Fort with a clear view & history
review: Its the perfect place to be. Nice view of the fort from inside & outside. The history of the fort is good to know & view from the top is awesome.

title: A Beutiful Fort
review: The Fort is very big but is not very well maintained. A large number of people live in the fort and there seem to be many later constructions by these people which is spoiling the beauty and historical purity of the place.

title: Impressive
review: A bit expensive but with the audioguide there is a lot to learn and see in the palace!

title: Golden fort
review: Huge fort where currently approx 4000 people still live. The temples within the fort are the best in jaisalmer. The view of the city is also good. But the place is pretty congested with everyone trying to sell you something

title: Maybe by the time I got to Jaisalmer I'd been all forted out!
review: This fort was OK, but forts in Jaipur, Delhi and Agra were better.  It also cost 600 rupees, making it almost the same price as visiting the Taj Mahal.  Not worth it, in my opinion.

title: A most crowded fort.
review: The fort is very beautiful at night rather than the day. The main attraction of this fort is its a living fort. As it is a living fort the maintenance should be at its best, but as usual the result s disastrous. The shops and hotels inside the forts are beautiful and staying inside the fort is also thrilling.

title: Enjoyed but over priced admission
review: I really enjoyed just wandering the winding streets more and felt that the cost of the entrance fee was too much , considering what we paid in Jaipur Bikaner and Agra . Otherwise worthwhile visit and fab photo shoots can be done without having to pay to go in .

title: Buzzing with life
review: This is one Fort, where life goes on as usual. The town of Jaisalmer as we know it is situated in and around the Fort itself. What one has to make an effort to see is the Maharaja Palace and Maharani Palace. A good one hour spent going through the life and times of the Kings and Queen, though there is much that can be done to better maintain the palace and museum.

title: Nice view of the city
review: A must see. Great collection of coins, clothes, weapons and evening old documents. It gives you the Ariel view of the city on top.

title: Grandeur!
review: Beautiful place, however could have been maintained well. This being a living fort, cleanliness is far fetched. People have done well enough to spoil the walls and the surroundings. Must take a good guide to get the flavor of the fort.

title: Outstanding
review: No words to describe the beatiful fort.. truely amazing worth visiting once in your life time.. the kings must have one of its kind life to stay and rule here..

title: Must watch in jaisalmer
review: Its a beautiful fort, do take a guide to understand the history of the fort.

title: only living fort in the world
review: I was offered a lift on a two wheeler as I did not fancy walking up the fort, amazing views from the top of the fort, amazing havelis on the way, lovely jain temple, amazing history

title: Nice Place
review: You get good view of the city, Fort exterior is good. One can explore the fort interiors,  people stay inside the fort. One can take two wheeler and roam inside.

title: Unique Experience
review: Staying, eating, sight-seeing and shopping all inside the Golden Fort was a unique experience. Visited City palace along with several temples and got some breathtaking views from different ends and rooftop of the hotel.

title: A Giant Sandcastle in the desert
review: From the outside this fort reminds me of the sandcastles we made on the beach as children but on a giant scale. It looks magnificent. Many of the better views are from the outside. The fort is quite high up and a great vantage point to view the surrounding city. The sandstone is a really lovely colour that changes to many hues at different times of the day. Difficult to compare to some other Forts in Rajasthan as this is a living part of the town and not a just a museum for visitors. Well worth exploring the winding streets and a fascinating place to visit. The Jain temples inside the fort are well worth a visit. The main thing to do is wander through the streets and admire intricate carvings on the havelis and the painted designs on many houses

title: not maintained
review: its not maintained, pigeons droppings feathers, stink in some parts......if mainatained properly it would give a better affect....roof top view is good....the authorities should restrict the entry of domestic animals near the fort.

title: I fort I saw a puddy cat
review: This place is top notch, make no mistake.

title: mesmerizing view of city
review: must visit fort at sunset and sunrise time to take different glimpse of city.

title: Key stop for visitors
review: The fort commands the town and is both a history site and home to a significant portion of the population with most of the residents have long family ties to the fort.  Filled with shops (be ready to bargain and be prepared to walk away from a deal).  Great views from the top.

title: Crowded Fort with not so good upkeep
review: Jaisalmer Fort is touted as the main attraction of the city but sadly it is not so well maintained as other forts in Rajasthan. The fort is the only fort which has residents living in and hence it has transformed into a typical Indian town with crowds, traffic and filth lying around. The exhibits and rooms inside the fort are not that well maintained and hence do not reflect the glory. Touts and unofficial guides are roaming about everywhere.I would strongly urge the necessary people in charge to do an urgent clean up.

title: Nice place
review: Enjoyed the monument visit. Best place for those who love knowing about history and related things. Loved it.

title: Fantastic fort, must visit in Jaisalmer
review: This is the only living fort in India. A fantastic and mighty fort in the heart of Jaisalmer. Its recommended to have a guide to understand the history associated with this fort. In a comfortable pace, this will take at least 2 hours to visit.

title: My first visit
review: I will visit this place if the time permits, it's so huge and traditional, must visit place :) :) :)

title: Good one
review: This is one of the good historical palace in Jaisalmer.  Me and my friends was watched this fort in August 2015...  This is situated on hilltop. Awesome view of Jaisalmer  from this fort.. This fort is also known as golden fort Jaisalmer made by bhatti rulers of Jaisalmer.  Thank you

title: Unique
review: Jaisalmer fort is one of the 5 heritage forts in Rajasthan. It's absolutely amazing and the fort and the carvings inside are fantastic. Every one who visits jaisalmer must visit the fort.

title: Maharaja's Place....
review: this is the place situated in the height...from where the king can the entire surrounding...surround by the his courtyards house...which includes the Jain Temple...with three side canon...its a marvelous place to visit. for window shopping nice place...

title: Dirty place
review: Absolutely horrible and dirty place. Would not suggest to go here at all. Really filthy and needs a lot of improvement.

title: Nothing unique about it
review: There is nothing unique about this fort. The usual big structures that you can experience throughout Rajasthan. The only USP is that its a living fort where people are living with their families.

title: Na
review: It was nice to be here, However it is not organized as many forts are organized in India. It shows the culture of raj but should be managed well in order to attract more tourist

title: A must see
review: A very good example of how rich the rich were in India (and probably still are). Be aware that there is a very long steep entrance.

title: The best place to visit in Jaisalmer
review: A very unique and fabulous art work

title: Small and dirty fort
review: We went there with high hope but the fort has nothing much to see and it's so dirty inside . Place is over crowded and so many small shops which make money and at same time making the place more dirty .

title: Truly a magnificent fort in dessert representing ancient civilisation.
review: Jaisalmer fort is one of the five heritage forts in Rajasthan, India. It's truly impressive and the whole ancient town inside this fort is fantastic. Well worth to visit it, including the Jain temple inside the fort. The brilliant carvings in whole temple are stunning, a world class site.

title: Living Fort
review: You will not feel that you are visiting a fort because the local public stays inside the fort however the sandstone golden structure is very attractive. After visiting other grand forts in Rajasthan which are majestic this does not give you the feel of grandeur but it is different experience to  see a living fort !

title: Alive!
review: The Jaisalmer Fort is the most liveliest place in Jaisalmer and houses numerous hotels in its premises. The place is teeming with tourists, shops and locals. One would wonder as to where is the fort in all this ? But a little walk inside shows the Jaisalmer fort that stands tall as evidence of ancient times. It's in good condition and well-maintained. While the fort looks similar to most other forts in Rajasthan but history separates each fort from the other. And most importantly the heritage of the King who reigned back then. One of the best parts of the Jaisalmer fort is that once  you reach the top of the fort which is more like a terrace (if compared to urban times) then one gets a bird's eye view of the whole of Jaisalmer. It's beautiful!!! You can also buy camel leather bags and other paraphernalia within the fort which is available at competitive prices. Very close to the fort is the National emporium which is a government recognized for buying Rajasthani clothes. Enjoy!

title: A bit dificult to get to, but by far our favorite!
review: We are incredibly happy to have made the decision to travel the extra way to come to this amazing living fort.  The architecture was amazing and the people couldn't have been nicer.

title: Must to visit
review: Must to visit. You can take tour by yourself. they just tell you stories which r okay..

title: Good
review: Very good service. They provide all fecility. Jip. Camle. Tent...good. they are very good people... and support me... when any people go to Jesalmer to contect him...

title: jaisalmer fort
review: with a population of around 4000 it is few of the inhabitated fort in the country.though the eterior is great the interior is not that good and clean.

title: A giant sandcastle
review: The fort is really cool - it looks like a giant sand castle, and from the top you have a great view of all of Jaisalmer. Good audio guide. Well worth a visit.

title: The Must watch Fort Of Jaisalmer Highly recomended
review: The trip cannot be completed with out visiting this magnificent and huge structure. The Fort is worth watching gives a mesmerizing view if Golden City. It is well maintained. Take the Audio tour its excellent . The rooms and other monuments maintained in fort are worth watching it gives glimpse of old art and artists hard work and beauty

title: mesmerising
review: one of the best historical locations in india.....this fort is built without using water in that time ..this is the best part.

title: Jaisalmer fort,a beautiful suprise
review: I loved  Jaisalmer.One of my most favorite city in Rajasthan..And is all because of the fort.The small streets,the art work,architecture,the small shops.Amazing.

title: Fort And Jain temple
review: Well worth a visit definitely pay to enter the Jain temple the carvings are stunning I walked as much of the walls as possible not that clean to be fair but still a world class site.

title: Fort
review: Amazing fort , jewel at the door of the desert. ...tickets are 500rp with audio guide. Country 1h30 min fort the visit.

title: An amazing place.
review: The more I travel, the more I realise how much I have still left to see!  This was an amazing City and very welcoming, it is packed with history and it was fascinating to learn how little I know about the world!  It was fantastic - and we had a brilliant guide!

title: one of the very few living forts in India!
review: The fort is one of the only living forts in India. Meaning there are people who live inside the fort and also trade. The hain temple is must see place if you live architectural beauties.

title: one of the best fort in rajasthan.
review: jaisalmer fort is the biggest fort we had ever seen around thousands of persons living inside the fortified walls. seen palaces , hotels market jain temples everything inside the fort , it was a amazing experience.

title: Jewel of desert
review: After 17 years I once again visited Jaisalmer fort,nothing has changed... Btfl palace...history is also remarkable.. Always hire guide to understand history of king Jaisal...Visit between November & February.. Use autorikshaw to reach top of the fort..enjoyed there..ticket rates nowadays very high in Rajasthan..spend & enjoy..

title: architectural beauty
review: guide services a must (either a guide or audio-visual). the jain temples inside and thee fort premises both are truly spectacular.

title: SUPERB
review: To view the time limit should be.

title: Heritage property but not well kept.....occupied by public, filthy
review: Doesn't look like a fort as public has occupied the entire fort premises, with crowded surroundings & filthy upkeep!!!

title: OK OK
review: you dont have many places to visit so this is going to be an imp place to go u will enjoy the overall view of the fort bt nthing so good inside

title: History comes alive
review: It's a great experience to visit only "Live Fort".

title: Monuments are meant to be preserved
review: Beautiful fort but to make into shop,massage parlour,cafe etc it's sad. To add to that autos and bike...phew. More than history its turned into a shopping bazaar. Built a mall for these traders please...

title: The well maintained fort ..
review: In the cold winter of January, we visited this fort. The most beautiful and well maintained fort I saw during the visit of Rajasthan.. It's worth visiting . They have installed lift also now to go to the top of fort which is very helpful for aged people and others also to save the time of climbing. While coming down by foot you can see the fort at your leisure. The view from top of Jaiselmer is awesome. At the entrance you can buy the typical Rajasthani clothes and ornaments,but you have to bargain a little, but worth buying this articles

title: Fort
review: less of a monument and more of a commercial place. You have small shops inside selling everything  and there is a tibetian restaurant also having good food. The museaums inside are all paid and the security people are very unhelpful and u may have to hire a guide but you ca negotiate the rates with them.

title: NICE
review: Nice must go u will get good timepass . all family members wll enjoy there surely good exp nice photo sceans there

title: different fort
review: we ahve seen many different forts but the specail thing about the fort is that around 4500 people are living in the fort. they are doing business over here. in peak season its very crowdy. you get the guides who can show you the fort. if you like to see the old heritage you will like it , i found it average fort

title: Charming but nothing exceptional
review: Jaisalmer fort looks rather imposing from afar. From the inside its nothing spectacular. Is over if those rare living fires which actually have outdoor living inside. But there's better forts to be seen in India and Rajasthan itself.

title: Not clean and well maintained
review: It was a very dirty place. We visit museum. Though they have entry fee, place is not well maintained. Mostly all places there was a dirty smell.

title: Sonar Killa
review: Gigentic Rampets

title: an amazing place to spend the day
review: Be aware that this is still a living fort. So although you can walk through the palace by means of a tour, at a cost of 500 rupees, there are some areas of the fort you cannot see simply because they are people homes.

title: You cannot miss the fort in Jaisalmer
review: This is the best landmark in Jaisalmer and you can spend two full days exploring the fort, its inner streets,shopping areas, restaurants!

title: Good experience
review: Good experience to see historical fort and to know about its history. Too commercialised as people stay and lots of shops too. Cleanliness should b maintained.

title: Worth seeing historical place
review: Facinating place from heritage view point.  Entry Tickets charges high. Camera Fee extra.  But maintenance is questionable as compared to income received by authority from tourists.  Governement shall take interest for beautification / maintenance of heritage prooerty to fetch more tourists.

title: Fort made of sand stone.
review: jaisalmer fort is a great place to see the history of jaisalmer. its made of sand stone and the color and texture of the way is amazing. best to visit in evening for nice photos of sunset

title: The only Living Fort
review: You want to see the living Fort, this is the place. Even better, you have options to stay inside the Fort and see it up and close.

title: Major Tourist Attraction
review: In Jaisalmer this is the major tourist spot. But compared to other forts of Rajasthan this is not that standard. Very cozy walk ways and things are not well maintained.

title: Nice place to visit.. avoid going on weekends
review: Fort is just like another city... shops on the roadside, restaurants, coffee shops, bikers honking and rushing through the crowds.. avoid going on weekends.

title: Unbelievable!
review: An incredible must see site! Spent hours walking through the fort and taking pictures of the incredible architecture

title: Living Fort
review: Jaisalmer fort or Golden fort is living fort nowadays also. You can see the houses, shops in the  fort. You can see the golden city here.

title: The golden fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is a beautiful work of art with the amazing carving on the golden Jaisalmer stone. There are still families staying within the fort, so cleanliness is an issue. Also do be careful while walking, lots of cow dung everywhere.

title: Strategic Location known as Golden Fort
review: Being at a high on the hill the fort commands its position in those historical periods. The fort is not well managed with number of people staying within the fort. Thought it was a good idea of the ruler then to carry his own people with him but the people over the period of time have lost those human values and therefore it presents an ugly scene with narrow lanes with heavily crowed place its look like a a settlement of rehabs. Certain sections of the fort are excellent made out of sand stone with fine joinery work from one stone to another with no binding material in between.

title: spectacular fort
review: fort is very large having Jain temples, Laxminarayan temple, museum, canon and many people who live inside the fort. Everything is beautiful, every in the fort is beautifully made. one thing really annoying in the fort is bats, and their smell. also called Sonar Fort is the heart of Jaisalmer

title: "golden historical visit "
review: a beautiful historical fort with magnificent view,easy path to contribute with local people lovely kids .

title: "good place to visit "
review: center point of jaisalmer with a perfect view ,a attractive place for peace of mind. lots of nice children around there to talk with you .

title: Jaisalmer: a living fort
review: Jaisalmer Fort is an amazing, living fort, with more than 4000 people living and working inside. The architecture, the temples, the shops, and also the ruins are just out of a fairy tale!!! There are many small stalls that serve tasty snacks as well. The entrance has a steep path up the forst. If you need, you can take auto-ricksaw to go up.

title: A town within a city
review: Yes, its a living fort with approximately 30% of jaisalmer's population living on it. from the outside it does look huge and long. Once inside, you tend to forget that you are in a fort because its so huge and sprawling. there are musuem, palace, temples, houses, shops and what not.  the gates and the walls of the fort are splendid.

title: Pretty messed up place
review: Very different. People stayed inside and the Maharaja stayed outside. So the fort is fully occupied inside. Two wheelers are a big nuisance. Smoke, noise, safety ...Lots of shops and narrow lanes.

title: very nice place
review: historical place ,nice to see the constrction of houses and town.very old jain temples are also heritage property.

title: Historic Place
review: This is the only fort where the people still reside. Its like taking a walk through history, wherein you see the arts and artifacts of the ancient times which are even maintained today.

title: Time well spent in the Jaisalmer Fort
