review: The Jain temple, the Palace and the other smaller temples, including the small shops selling handicraft items are amazing to visit. Please make sure you take a Guide when visiting the fort. Also it is interesting to see this Fort, since it is unique with people living inside still

title: Sonar Kella!!!
review: Every Bengali knows about the fort in Jaisalmer, courtesy The master Satyajit Ray. Great experience...

title: Lively fort
review: It does not get bigger then this. The amazing thing about this fort is you will find people living well within the fort.

title: Must visit in Jaisalmer
review: The fort was built by King Jaisal so the name jaisalmer..the fort still is inhabitants with majority portion occupied by restaurants and shops. You have to pay 100 rupees ticket per person and per camera. It's better to take a guide, guide charged us 150 rupees.( beware, don't go for shopping with your guide, they may have links with shopkeeper and you may end up paying more) The fort is beautiful and well maintained. The stone work is one of a kind. The roof top view is mind blowing, where you see the golden city jaisalmer! Here maximum were is done in yellow sand stone or fossil stone hence the name. In short,do visit.

title: historical place
review: its on a small hill. one has to leave the vehicle and climb the hill. one could take a auto for this. the fort is mainly about the king's palace. the fort has been made by yellow stones, thereby getting the tag of golden fort.its a must for all who visit jaisalmer.

title: Must Visit
review: Only Living fort in india. take your time. atleast 3-4 hours to spend in this fort. nice photography options.

title: Cool
review: A lot of people compare this place negatively to other more well preserved forts in Rajasthan but this place is worth the visit. Easy to get around though people live here. No need for a guide and we didn't find the touts any more annoying than anywhere else and there is no charge to get in unless you want to see the museum. Close enough to walk from lots of the hotels. Small town of 68000 so hard to get lost. It is at the end of the road so getting there is a challenge.

title: Interesting fort with an insight into the lives of the occupants
review: Unlike a lot of forts in Rajasthan the Jaisalmer fort takes you through many rooms of artifacts and furniture which makes it quite an interesting visit. However the best aspect is the roof terrace from where you have 360 degree panoramic views across the city.

title: A Good Fort but not Excellent
review: The Jaisalmer Fort is Ok. My raqting would be a 3 out of 5. There is nothing much to see. Just that the expanse of the fort is large spread over 5kms. But you can get to see only a part as the remaining areas are residences of the servants of the king. Built in 1156 the fort is a residential colony in itself. The servants of the Maharajas have usurped the areas over last hundred years. The fort is dirty and the winding staircases are Ok. Just a silver throne and some weapons in the armory. Nothing more. The Raja of Jaisalmer was a traitor and surrendered to the Mughals. He ruled with the blessings of the Mughals. Thre is no proper parking area and the touts and guides tend to loot you. The shopping complex inside is costly. Old duplicate stuff is sold at fancy prices.

title: Interesting buildings inside - good to visit early in the day
review: We stayed in a hotel with the fort so started our tour early . Later realized  that was the best time to walk around the place and soak in the fort atmosphere ,see the sights.  There is the museum inside, a Jain temple  which one can see. Also just walking around is nice . Several shops seeing colorful stuff are there, if one is interested.

title: Too dirty n filthy.. Nothing great
review: After seeing forts in Udaipur n Jodhpur you wont like this. Too dirty n filthy. Too crowded, locals staying in fort, shops n food carts in  every small corner..

title: Do this Fort properly for best results
review: The architectural and aesthetic values of this Fort are magnificent. Absolutely worth the effort to get to Jaisalmer. It's a photographer's heaven.

title: "GOLDEN FORT"-jaisalmer fort
review: it is spread around 5km of area ..many people stay inside the fort ..you can enjoy shopping ...yellow stone for jaisalmer makes the city- golden city ...nice view from the top...nice structure of temple inside the fort ...

title: Must visit place in Jaisalme
review: Only fort in the world where people still live inside. Like all Rajasthan forts, built in similar fashion. Must visit place.

title: Not worth
review: Very crowded, smelly and poorly maintained. Only for history lovers and monument preservation architects. The fact that its the only living fort  fascinated us to make a trip but did not find it worth the time and money.

title: Offers great photo ops. But, poorly maintained and palace smells of bats.
review: If you have done forts in other cities like Jaipur or Jodhpur, you may very well pity the condition of this palace. Situated at a great vantage point palace is poorly maintained. It is surrounded by bats on all the sides and smells of bats. Royal collection is limited and it seems to be always crowded. Hope the palace is maintained as good as how Patwon ki haveli is maintained.

title: Wonderful art work of stones
review: This fort has wonderful art work. Especially the gunghroo work and care given to each details of windows and walls cannot be seen in other places. The staff there has been kind enough to explain the nuances of each work to us. Otherwise, it was difficult to capture so many details in one sight. The only drawback is that the palace is converted to a hotel; so not many places that can be seen.

title: A must visit place
review: If want to know how in ancient people keep watch on enemy attck n want to see the rich history of rajput's, then this place must be include in your things to see.

title: Good place
review: Take a guide or audio guide which will make the visit interesting.

title: Fort is beautiful but museum's not worth it!
review: The Jaisalmer fort is incredible, it has such beautiful work and streets, and everything around is so pleasing to the eye. However I have been to many forts and fort museums - and the fort museum isn't worth it! If you're on a budget - save your money and pay to enter the Jodhpur fort museum instead.

title: Amazing
review: My favourite fort!  This is built without mortar and you can only admire it's size and beauty.  Well worth a visit

title: Living Fort
review: All i can say about the golden city fort is that till date you can experience how people might had lived here from 860 years  . . It just amazing crazy fort with all boulevard styled streets temples canons views sunset sunrise food shop . . .. i am lovin it

title: AVERAGE FORT
review: well if u have been to Amer in jaipur and mehrangarh in Jodhpur then probably u wont get flabbergasted seeing it. Overall its another good fort in Rajasthan and must visit during jaisalmer stay.

title: very good living fort
review: this palace is very nice historical palace.. it night time is showing very nice by lighting... must visit every visited

title: Romantic Golden Fort, Jaisalmer
review: We visited Golden Fort, Jaisalmer by end of Oct, 2015. This fort is very different from rest of the other Forts in Rajasthan by its characteristic features of Color, Structure, Span and Position. It provides very romantic moments while roaming within. Though many areas of the fort have been pathetically polluted by in-house living human beings. Plastic water tanks, air conditioners and many other installations drastically diminish the aesthetic and ethnic sophistication of the fort. The overall golden color gets affected being masked by several other unwanted items and establishments of odd contrasts. Govt authorities should immediate impose norms to save this gorgeous and majestic Fort of our country.

title: Nice fort, shame about its maintenance
review: Fort is unique in that it's part of the town - people love inside it, has shops and restaurants. Would be much nicer if cars and bikes were banned and the govt cleaned it up a bit.

title: Time travel
review: It's an amazing fort, one of a kind. People still live in the houses inside the fort. Beautiful small streets with shops selling old artifices and souvenirs. Visit to this place was like going back in time.

title: sandstone fort - but what a story
review: This fort is less impressive as the other forts in Rajasthan. But it has some gems and a nice story to tell.

title: Really interesting and beautiful
review: Great visit , fascinating fort and history. Would recommend the audio tour (included in the price of the entry ticket) as it was really informative and was just the right length/ amount of information.

title: Greaaaaaat experience
review: Guys dis is the place to be. Feel the real desert with some really good people. The fort has a great history and is still living

title: Wonderfuuuuuuuul
review: This is a great place for spend some hours enjoyning the restaurants, shopping, street music, architecture and the best: the sunset.

title: Rajasthan the place to visit
review: we spend two days in jaisalmer Rajasthan it was the first visit we had a guide  who was great and local knew everything about the fort and the down town .he recommend few places for dinner and lunch which was very good and cheap. he speak  English Italian and hindi his name isAnand Shripat phone number 91 9694350737. A good guide to have when travelling to Rajasthan  Anand has  a good sense of humour that will make your stay very pleasant. we Recommend him to any traveller to this area.

title: Such an amazing place
review: This has been may favorite fort in India, not only is it visually stunning but it is amazing that people are living in here and that we can stay in here as well. The views are stunning and the alley way and temples are a lot of fun.

title: Awesome
review: Awesome fort, and great fun to walk around the alleyways and check the various viewpoints,  also a good selection of shops and cafés, definitely best thing to see in jaisalmer, cannot be missed!

title: living fort
review: Does not seem to be popular.  Drove near it, but was told its full of private people residing with the Fort area, so did not go for a full viewing

title: Amazing fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is a very well maintained fort, and provides a glimpse of royal rajasthani life in the past. The architecture is beautiful and well designed.

title: the amazing fort
review: The sheer magnificence of this living fort is breathtaking. it rises from the hilltop as if it was moulded into the yellow sandstone. I was absolutely taken by this fort and Jaisalmer and I will return again to explore the desert area and its surrounding villages. The medieval pathways within the fort wind throughout it and often you are never sure where you have been and ended up. it takes a few visits to really feel you have explored it and even then it's much more extensive than I managed to find my way around. The sandstone is beautiful with a depth of colour that sometimes look like gold - footsteps wearing into the old pathways.

title: Amezing
review: Very nice.. stones are golden in colour. Special fossil stone available here. The whole city golden in colour as it totaly build by same colour of stone. Overall a very good experience. Fort musium was amazing..

title: A Living Fort
review: Really interesting visit to the museum despite some exhibits having been removed. The audio guide gave enough information to keep us interested with some lovely tales. We noticed a human guide did not relate these stories to his group! This is one of the only forts that is still lived in in the world. It is very interesting wandering around seeing people still living in houses that have been there for hundreds of years. The trades people were not too pushy and there are some nice souvenirs to be bought. Wonderful views from the ramparts.

title: Grand..Majestic..Charismatic
review: The first thing that anyone will notice of Jaisalmer Fort is it's sheer size. It's quite baffling how in such a scorched place like Jaisalmer with scant water, human being can build a citadel as grand & awe inspiring as this one. Unlike Amer Fort or Mehrangarh Fort, Golden Fort or Shonar Quila (as named by Satyajit Ray) is not entirely dedicated to Tourism as families whose lineage once stayed in the Fort still continues to live within the Citadel. So be prepared to find Chaddis Banyaans etc hanging from certain section of the Fort.

title: Sorry to see Sonar Kella in occupied state - Not worth a visit
review: This Kella has being occupied by local residents. some families are staying in it. Some has opened up hotels. Some shops etc. not maintenance at all. Better to see it from outside from some roof top restaurant. Not worth a visit. But the market opposite to the fort is excellent if you want to have some camel leather stuffs or some antique stuffs etc.

title: Golden fort of the desert city
review: If you are in Jaisalmer this attraction should be in your things to visit list.A fort with great history.You can also hire guide in front of fort in cheaper rates like 50-100rs.

title: Lovely golden monument
review: Great looking fort. It stands apart from other forts in the state of Rajasthan because of its golden hue as opposed to the regular darker brown.

title: worth a visit
review: Its one of the splendid fort in Rajsthan .The surrounding around the fort are also lovely .Enjoyed the visit and definitely other tourist  must see it

title: Visit to Jaisalmer
review: We had visited Jaisalmer Fort on 18th Oct15, as part of recent Rajasthan tour. The Fort is majestic and is unique in the sense that it is a mini town with about 1000 inhabitants and innumerable shops (I was told) inside and therefore overcrowded. Despite this, it is worth visiting the fort. The upkeep of the fort needs improvement.

title: Too good
review: Very good fort awesome must visit ,photogenic views very good fort visited with my kids ,take a guide then u enjoy more .

title: Jaisalmir fort important tourist spot
review: This fort called sonar kella Famous bengali film made by satyajit Roy. Now this is a big area where the people are staying generation wise.mukul is a character of the film in sonar kella.his house is almost broken

title: It had everything
review: Great architecture,and meandering laneways.Food and coffee everywhere,even vegemite toast.My wife loved the shopping, mostly scarves and clothing.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: Since its quite a big fort,  we weren't able to take a tour of the entire fort.

title: a wonderful experience
review: fascinating place to visit. the living fort with a busy population within its walls is amazing. The whole place has a golden hue and the historic element is illuminating. The people were colourful and the richness of the décor and intense detail worth the trip.

title: majestic
review: How fascinating and majestic the life on fort would have been

title: Golden Fort at the desert city
review: Complete Jaiselmer fort is made of golden sand stone, which radiated golden radiance to it. Its  one of its kind fort in the country and world. Unlike other forts in the county this fort cum palace is very artistically carved. Now the fort is inhibited by local tribes and have lots of cafes, shops inside the fort premises.  Fort is easily accessible by local transport and taxis.

title: Majestic Yellow Sandstone living fort in the desert city
review: The only living fort that looks superb in its yellow sandstone presence! Views inside the Jain temples are fantastic. Walk by the narrow alleys within the fort studded with souvenir shops and local residences. Many Bengali tourists frequent this place [ I guess Satyajit Ray's classic thriller 'Sonar Kella' attracts lot of such tourists], so you might even find occasional Bengali restaurants.

title: Interesting But A Bit Hyped
review: The view from the top floor and the canon area are breath taking. Otherwise it is just like the other Rajasthan forts or I would say it is inferior to other Rajasthan forts.

title: Ancient fort..Modern neglect
review: A marvellous living fort. Should have made a wonderful experience but the appropriate word is FILTHY. One cannot believe how the government is promoting this fort. For once I was ashamed at the reaction from the tourists. They were more busy seeing where they are stepping and not at the beautiful buildings in the fort. Cow dung, human excreta, overflowing drains and the stench in the hot conditions are unbearable. They need to move out the shops and vendors to parts of the city which is quite well laid out and clean. There are supposed to be 300 original inhabitants who have a right to live there but it's now so crowded I think a time will come when they will have to close it down. The fort itself is well preserved and the view from the top is great. The most impressive and CLEAN building is the Jain temple which is a must see.Very useful to get a guide to show you around the fort and the impressive Havelis in the city. Charge only Rs 300/- for a whole half day tour of all this. Pick late November till early January for your trip if you want to see Jaisalmer and the surroundings in all its splendour

title: Excellent fort
review: A very rare fort which has a lift :-). Very neat compared to other forts in Rajasatan surely worth going.

title: Golden Fort of Golden City
review: This medieval fort of yellow sandstone is the most popular tourist spot in the town. A lot of people also reside in the fort. Tourism is the main source of income for the people, so most houses also double up as shops. The streets in the fort are narrow but give you an old world feel. The Mahals in the fort are worth a visit. Many Jain temples in the fort complex. The tourist guides here know many European languages. Satyajit Raj made a movie about this fort, large number of tourists from Bengal visit this place. My Mother-in-law who uses a wheel chair could see most portions of the fort and its different attractions.

title: Lovely fort
review: One of the best living forts in the world. Definitely go see. The shops are so cool, they sell everything under the sun.

title: Beautiful place to be at..
review: Prefer to go early morning or at around late evenings.. The fort has a lot of roof top restaurants and the food is simply amazing. Also, the city view from the top of the fort is simply breattaking.

title: Sonal Quila - The golden Jaisalmer fort
review: Jaisalmer fort was built by Rawal Jaiswal in the 11th century with yellow sand stone. It is also popularly called as Sonal Quila after Satyajit Ray’s movie. At one point, the entire population lived in the fort. Today around 4000 people are resident. There are many ornate havelis or mansions in the complex. One of the best living forts !!

title: Living fort and must visit in Jaisalmer
review: This is the only living fort I have seen by far with around 4000 people staying in fort. various shops and small cafes with roof top views are very approachable and nice food.

title: The nicest fort in Rajasthan!
review: We have been on a long trip and this fort is the best, it's really nice to see a living fort with shops and restaurants.

title: Nice History
review: It was a great experience climbing atop this fort and seeing the view. A great scenic experience, were able to see the train Palace on Wheels which we were told comes to Jaisalmer every Sunday.

title: A live fort, wanting of maintenance
review: The Jaisalmer fort is a majestic golden fort, typical of the golden landscape in this area. The fort is in the middle of the town close to the market place. The fort museum has good collections and is indeed a wonderful experience once you get into the demarcated portion The intricate work on the walls are awesome as is the case with forts across Rajasthan. You get nice view points of the Yellow City from this fort.

title: Poor maintenance felt bad
review: If you have visited udaipur, jodhpur palaces, then avoid it. It is in very bad condition no proper maintenance and its smells very bad every where. Though the city is only 4 kms. No where its looks good and other tourists places too in city. But Sam sand dunes is perfect.

title: Sonar Quila : glitters like gold
review: One of the largest fortifications in the world and a world heritage site, this fort is notable almost from all of the Jaisalmer city.

title: Core Attraction
review: Amazing experience. Very well maintained. One should walk through the lane of the fort to get a complete view of the fort. Don't go for shopping along with Guide, the price will be just doubled!

title: Great heritage site but needs more maintenance
review: The jaiselmer fort is an amazing cultural site. The view of the city specially at night is too beautiful from the fort. But the cleanliness and orderliness of things in the fort roads needs a lot of improvements. The parking of the fort smells like a urinal, so your first impression is bad. Then u have to bear smell of cow dung here and there . Even though they say there is scarcity of water in rajasthan, water is littered here and there. The shops are good and offer a variety of products specially endemic craft products but then there is a shop at every step, there is a hotel/restaurant in almost every house. All in all its too commercialized and heritage has not been preserved in its natural raw form. Giving a good rating only due to magnificence of the fort and its architecture.

title: Different from other forts
review: Being a fort where people live, we had a good time roaming around the narrow lanes. It almost felt like we had gone back in time.

title: Good to visit the fort but over priced
review: We did not find it worth paying the ticket as it was over priced . we had already visited so many forts and there was nothing new

title: Good Place to visit
review: It is a wonderful place to visit.Good to visit during Oct to March. The fort has lot of shops and temples inside it.

title: Very nice fort
review: Very good fort and havali nice and jain tample and very nice golden city

title: Golden Fort of Thar Desert
review: This Fort is called Golden Fort (Sonar Quila) because its primarily built of Sand Stones of Yellow color which shine under the bright Sun and you feel as if you are looking at a  Fort made of Gold. Its spread over a vast area and today thousands of people stay inside the Fort. In fact there is an entire village that's inhabited inside the Fort and in its surroundings. The Fort has multiple layers of defense - despite that it was attacked several times by emperors of Khilji and Moghul Empire. Its situated on top of a Hill, which is not very high but still this Fort can be seen from a distance. as you approach the City.

title: Great fort in the heart of Thar desert
review: Great golden fort standing on top if Trikuta hill. You will seen the majestic experience when seen down hill. This fort unlike others have homes and shops inside the fort.

title: Deteriorating
review: I've visited the fort many times now. Its condition continues to worsen. You can see the water damage from a kilometer away. Trash is still everywhere inside the fort and at its base. Jaisalmer should look to cities like Gangtok to develop a waste management plan. Only a few of the fort lights are being powered, evidently because no one is paying the electric bills. This is puzzling as Jaisalmer is surrounded by windmills and oil fields. Construction inside the fort is still largely unregulated and private owners will make alterations to the perimeter walls to meet their needs. The fort in Jodhpur is so much better maintained.

title: Living fort in the Thar Desert
review: This living fort is better than a museum. People live here, they sell food here, there are restaurants. And there is a lot of restauration going on.

title: A living fort and pathetic state of maintenance
review: This is a fort where people live inside it. As a result, they have constructed shops, restaurants, hotels and small market places inside. Not sure what the Archaeological Survey of India is doing towards the upkeep of the fort. Believe me, in a couple of years, the fort would cease to be a tourist attraction.

title: Great effort in the toughest of conditions..
review: Really really appreciate the palace and the fort.

title: Very nice
review: Its the only fort where people actually live. Its nice to walk around in the alleys and just absorb the feeling of a true desert fort. You have a beautiful Janis temple inside aswell. Dont miss out on the various viewing points that you find here and there.

title: Living Fort
review: Only living fort which is 30 metres overlooking Jaisalmer.  The only fort in the world that has a population of over a thousand ppl living within its walls.  The people, vendors, food, etc within this fort's walls are something to talk about.  A must see in Jaisalmer!!!

title: The  Fort
review: Withing walking distance from other attractions  of the this is a huge fort, with all sorts of shopping and eating inside. People actually live inside the fort and they are quite helpful to provide guidance.Many guides were available but since we had time we did not hire any , the locals were of great help. You get a good view of the whole city and also the windmills.

title: Old Palace in a Living Fort
review: The Palace itself is cool, though it's a little confusing to get to and you can get easily lost in the streets. There are a lot of street vendors and hawkers, so stay focused on getting to the sights if that's what you want. The Palace is nice - and the audio tour guide is very good. Nothing spectacular, but a nice little trip.

title: A must visit!
review: The Fort is truly awesome and inspiring in its grandeur. It stands majestically in the town center. It has an entire city inside where people still live. The architecture is magnificent.

title: Must see!
review: I would recommend spending a night or two at one of the guest houses inside the fort as both the fort and the view is amazing. There's also a kind of a temple complex I would visit.

title: Few living fort -nearly 4000 people living in
review: Beautiful inside outside.

title: Average
review: Once you visit jaipur udaipur and jodhpur palaces/forts, jaiselmer fort looks very average. Its not maintained well and was smelling very bad. However Jain temples inside the fort are beautiful and must visit.

title: I dont understand why i have to pay 100 rs per person to see the fort museum
review: The whole fort is occupied by people living inside the fort. The only portion remaining for tourist is a museum.

title: Amazing architecture.
review: Unbelievable architecture carved  out of sand stones. Intriguing palace stories, conspiracies. Superb view of the Jaisalmer town

title: awesome
review: one of the best forts in rajasthan, awesome, looks like real GOLD. a must visit the craftmanship is at its best, location the BEST and the maintenance as of now is too gud.

title: Awesome
review: The first time i have visited the fort i was in awe about all the details of the architecture, everywhere attention to details will please the eye and i ended up walking in the fort, talking to people and taking pictures for over 7 hours and have been back again later specially at sunset and sunrise for amazing pictures, in Jaisalmer the fort is a must see for its history and beauty.

title: Only fort with inmates
review: Wish our Govt takes effort to keep these heritage property clean beautiful architecture .. in the museum got to  see the ancient luxury living .. our ancestors were more creative ..wa wa  i loved the fort

title: Heavenly feeling.
review: Very nice harritage of India.I feel that why I can born on that period.Time has minimum with me I will plan to stay more day in jaisalmer .

title: Just another fort
review: Entry fee is much high. There is a nearby place which has got much better view. Ask local people to know the direction

title: Desert fort and bazaars!
review: The Jaisalmer Fort is the old city itself! after climbing up the main gates you can wonder around the old streets for hours and really get lost. All alleys have beatiful old havelis and houses on each corner, with nice little shops selling articrafts and textiles giving a sense of color really typical of rajasthan! We didnt pay the entrance fee to the inner palace, since after visiting several in Rajasthan we realized there is not much to see inside, and the real fun is actually wondering around the streets, bazaars and temples of the old cities.

title: Nothing much..
review: Among those few forts which is still inhabited. But not much to see.

title: Amazing
review: Amazing place to visit, but it is a bit like a maze! Well worth a visit and also check out the Jain temples as well.

title: Interesting golden trip
review: Jaisalmer is indeed the Golden City. Majority of the buildings are constructed with sandstones. It is free admission to the Jaisalmer fort. Within the walls live 4000 people and there are rows of shops and residential areas. I had gotten an opportunity to talk to some of the residents and admire their artworks. Did not explore much as there is a charge of Rs.200 for entering a temple or Rs.300 just to go up to the balcony. One unique custom which I had came across in Jaisalmer City, the wedding invitations are painted on the walls of the house. In this invitation, you will see the Lord Ganesha, the date of the wedding and inviting one and all, the girl's name and then the groom's. Although the trend of distributing wedding cards began as late as some thirty years ago, this trend's popularity has not faded. The younger generation considers it an integral part of their culture which is indispensable.

title: fort is amiazik to stein fort shiva guest house and kujan haveli
review: rely nice parsan in hotel s ool hotel is good bat i am ste in shiva cefe is rely nice oolo kujan haveli is nice hotel and good wiv in ool cite and i do camel safari is nice

title: Unique feel
review: The only fort with a thriving market and community living inside the fort walls...unique and historic. The jaisalmer  sandstone glows gold in the sunlight.

title: Crowded
review: Too many diverse activities and noisy. Cows, three wheelers, bikes et all. Not my taste for this cacophony.

title: Central Attraction of the City
review: Popularized by Satyajit Ray after his movie Sonar Kila, it is a  fortress which is still inhabited by about 4000 people. Many of the residences have of late been converted into hotels, which though not very comfortable offer a great view of the city. The palace of the King converted into a museum is the only place worth visiting, from where a panoramic view of the whole city can be enjoyed. Parking is available outside the fortress from 8 am to 8 pm and inside it for rest of the time. It takes about two hours if you do not like to rush things.

title: A must visit
review: The fort is the star attraction of Jaisalmer trip. Very well maintained fort. The carvings inside temples are excellent and make this fort a must visit place.

title: Fort
review: If anyone want to to enjoy the camping then THIS IS THE PLACE...!!!

title: The sonar kila of jaisalmer
review: A good place to visit. The architectural grandeur of Jain temples situated in fort is worth seeing.The fort is situated in the heart of city, made of yellow sand stones, mesmerizes tourists.

title: Okay!
review: it is an okay fort. i mean if you are travelling to Jodhpur and Jaipur this one can be missed and travel can be planned only for the desert Safari.

title: Palace is good
review: The palace is being restored and I found the audioguide included in the 500rupee entrance price really worthwhile.

title: Alive Fort
review: They used to call this as living fort because common public around 2 lakhs are living inside the fort just like a colony.

title: Beautiful Golden City
review: The fort is small, and you can walk around it with relative ease. From the top you can see the entire city--but be weary of people trying to sell you fake fabrics, etc.

title: Good fort
review: Went on a road trip from Chennai to Rajasthan, its a must see attraction and ride along the desert to reach the fort is mind blowing experience. so go and have it, highly recommended.

title: Gigantic beauty.
review: Well, the beautiful view of the entire Jaiselmer city can be seen on top of the fort. Though it is the only place to see in jaiselmer except Desert and Camel safari in desert. Must visit place but it is somehow very commercial place people living inside. When we visited there was a funeral so some part of the fort was blocked. Over all , you can visit once in your life time.

title: Interesting place to see!
review: Try to visit this place with a guide otherwise you just walk around with not really an idea except the Jain Temple.

title: Good Fort must to Visit
review: jaisalmer fort is the one of the best fort which needs to be visited atleast one in life time

title: Beautiful!
review: I was transformed into another world all together the moment I entered the fort. It has such an old world charm to it.

title: Living Fort of Rajasthan
review: It is the living Fort of Rajasthan. People still actually live there and have properties right inside the Fort. Made of Yellow stone with museums for better understanding.

title: Ideal to visit during winter
review: Plan your visit to the fort anytime between October to end of January to escape scorching heat. The fort requires at least a day visit if you are in Jaisalmer. It is also visible from the city centre. Apart from the smell of pigeons and bats in the fort, the visit is very rewarding.

title: Heritage place but not well maintained
review: Only living fort in India, but is not very maintained. Jain temple is worth going. View from Cannon Point was amazing

title: Nothing much to view
review: It has a very small meuseum and that too is not properly maintained. It smells a a lot in the fort. If have visited Jodhpur kind of fort, this can be avoided

title: Great place to stay in
review: Really cool place, with great architecture and shops. Makes you feel on a movie set. Lots of great views and vantage points all over.

title: Best Fort
review: On of the biggest fort i have ever seen in India, Very powerfull and attractive to see the architecture, one can also  do marketing while moving.

title: Lively, beautiful fort and bazaar
review: Great place to visit and pass time. Should go there to watch the sunset, chat to the locals and share a chai as well as appreciate some seriously stunning architectural masterpiece blended with tradition and religion.

title: Golden fort - strike gold with history
review: Jaisalmer fort is a one of its kind fort in the world. Carving and architecture is very intricate. Jain Temple and laxminath temples are must to see. Visit of palace and museum will certainly proud a historygeek.

title: Incredible india
review: I can only say...... incredible india!!!

title: Huge !!
review: Huge fort with a lot too see. But not very well kept. Lot of bad smelling areas due to presence of bats .

title: Sonar killa
review: Fort good and jain tample  very good and museum very good raja in time all Good very good fort and living fort

title: Golden Fort
review: The fort has inhabitants unlike other forts of Rajasthan. The fort has many small restaurants and small markets where one can shop for handicrafts etc. From the fort, one can have a beautiful view of the Golden city of Jaisalmer.

title: Jaisalmer Fort - A Half day Program!
review: Jaisalmer fort is the only living fort in Rajasthan and true to it's name - it is a Golden Fort. Magnificent from the outside, alright on the inside :)

title: It 's huge fort and lot to see. Jain temple is very good with excellent work of Indian architecture.
review: The good thing about the king that he has gifted the place to live for those who has worked for him. This is the service to the people who worked for Raja. The whole Jaisalmer is made of yellow stone and that is the reason Jaisalmer is called as golden city. Memories for Jaisalmer visit are awesome.

title: Good fort
review: good to visit Raja and rani mahal. This fort is  a crowdy place with living people inside and lots of hotels and eating joint insides.

title: More of a  village market than a fort
review: Not much to see on this fort.. too many stores and with people living inside the fort, looks more like a village market than a fort.. One can skip this if there's not much time..

title: Overall Ok... Entry tickets are costly,
review: Overall Ok... Entry tickets are costly, Beware of Guide they will misguide. Auto will go till top from main gate of Fort. Fort is full of shops and temples. Entry tickets for indian is 100 INR, Camera charges are extra...  Jodhpur Fort is better than jaisalmer.

title: "one of the best fort"
review: i went there early morning when it was not too crowded. i really like the arcitecture of stone  &it has a great view of whole city from the roof. but i think the entry ticket is a bit high for what it is.

title: Visited the fort- Sonar Kella
review: We visited the palace and the artifacts were really thought provoking. The place is the only other fort apart from chittor to have people living inside it.

title: Is this a Fort...????
review: We visited this fort with lot of expectations to see the grand style of Rajpoots but got shock of life to see the two and three wheeler speeding within the fort..families staying within the fort were washing their linen in public...too much of filth spread across all the places...It was a like a small town within the fort area...You find all that stuff here but the fort.

title: good residents fort
review: The Jaisalmer Fort is just excellent.most part of the fort is covered by residents and some of them are converted into hotels, only museum to see in the fort

title: Famous fort
review: This is a famous fort.....not maintained properly...very strange that people are staying inside this famous fort...only a section of this fort is maintained.....fort looks great from outside...a must visit for history lovers..

title: Living fort
review: This is the first time I visited a fort which is described as a living fort with my family. This means there are houses inside the fort and people actually live there. Once you are inside the fort, it is easy to think you are inside a small town rather than an old fort. The fort is like a separate town altogether. You have shops, houses, restaurants everything! Unfortunately this somewhat takes away the charm of an ancient fort like for example the mehrangarh fort. It can get noisy and crowded inside the fort and you have have to watch your step lest you step on cowdung or some construction materials. The architecture of the Jain temple inside the fort is superb and so are the Kings and Queens palaces. Having a guide with you will help and you'll learn what the various places are for. You'll learn the history of the canons and how the soldiers defended the fort against attacks. It is possible to spend hours walking around the various lanes inside the fort. Our guide told us that some of the people living belong to the same families that lived so many years ago. If the fort is kept a little cleaner and well maintained, it will definitely be a priceless jewel in the crown of Jaisalmer. Don't miss it.

title: Loved it
review: It is an experience to stay within a fort - though not advisable for elderly people ad you do not have elevators here. But children will enjoy themselves.

title: Must visit site in Jaisalmer
review: If u r in Jaisalmer then Jaisalmer Fort is must visit place but if u r interested to know the background of the fort, do take personal guide with you. They don't charge you much.

title: Residential Fort..!!
review: This fort is must visit when you go to the city of Jaisalmer, you can enjoy the city view from top of the fort and can also see the gadsisagar lake as well, most part of the fort is covered by residents and some of them are converted into hotels, only museum to see in the fort

title: Expensive and Steep climb to the top.
review: Expensive ticket rates for an undermaintained fort and museum..

title: Skip it if you have something better to do
review: If you have been to any of the forts in India, you better give this a miss. Spend time around outside the fort for photography or the market at fort gate to purchase local items. If this is your first trip to any fort or someone in your group is pushing you to go inside, do take the Guide. You will find them easily at the fort gate. He will tell you few things about the temple inside or about the fort ( that you will anyway not remember) which will make you feel at least worth of some time . Ask him about the selfie place inside the temple.

title: Skip it if you have something better to do
review: Nice View from fort but its long to walk and with kid its really boring. Long way to walk and have to carry water from starting no in between shop or cafe for food and water.

title: Must visit, in Jaisalmer
review: A must visit place in Jaisalmer. Superb views, inexpensive food and lodging, and "Patwon ki haveli" cannot be missed!

title: Nice fort
review: After jodpur the palace was a bit of a let down . The audioguide was not great . And the palace a bit under whelming . The fort itself is great . Winding small streets lovely temples . The locals can get a bit much trying to push everything on you . But i guess they ate desperate in low season so you can't blame them . All in all very beautiful and romantic . Well worth a visit if on Rajestan

title: The Golden Fort
review: Rising from the heart of the Thar Desert like a golden mirage is - the city of Jaisalmer. This commanding fort etched in yellow sandstone stands, with all its awesome splendor, dominating the amber-hued city. It also reminds the famous movie 'Sonar Kella' by Satyajit Ray.

title: Like a living Fairytale
review: Like a living fairy tale from medievaĺ times.

title: Expensive and not so clean
review: This is the most expensive fort we visited in Rajasthan. Entry fee was Rs100 per person and they charged another hundred for mobile camera.

title: Beautiful
review: The fort is one of the few forts in India where people actually live and work inside. You won't need more than an hour to see the main attractions in the fort but you can spend some more time visiting some of the rooftop restaurants or by lanes for some shopping!

title: its Okkkk
review: Its an okkk place,if for any reason you cant visit this place then dont worry,it has a museum which is a chargeable entry,and nothing much to see and they also charge you for photos you take on your phone.

title: Spend all day
review: Really you could wander around the windy tiny streets discovering new things for a few days. Great shops temple restaurants cafes inside.

title: Gr8
review: Very nice A Living Fort in which more than 3000 people lives inside the Fort. Handicrafts are there restaurans are there..u will get guides there as well.. A must see. Architecture of the Fort is incredible...I really like yellow stones...One more this I came to know that this Fort was made with such a technologie..which did not rquired water and cemeny while Fort was being built....Amazing

title: The Palace
review: The fort was built by Rawal Jaiswal in 1156. Jaisal conspired with the Sultan of Gaur to dispose his nephew Bhojdev from his territory. The other important event of the fort was during 1276 when King Jetsi strengthened the fort against the invading Sultan of Delhi. the 56 bastions were manned by 3,700 soldiers. After eight years of invasion, the Sultan's army destroyed the castle.

title: fort is like Venice in the desert
review: Desert Boys Guest house is not expensive,and feels like a real movie set...Very friendly staff.Most guest houses have beautiful rooftop restaurants.Ancient narrow streets are fun to explore the fortress,which is 1000 years old!The citizens are friendly.but don't buy anything at Surya Art House! They cheated me out of $500 USD.I can't speak about other vendors...

title: a wanderful palace
review: This is the  fort for which you can not miss on any cause, if you haven't seen it you have seen nothing in Rajasthan.  The thing i like the most is people were living within the fort, there were also shops, restaurants and more.  The architecture is very beautiful and the view from the fort is amazing, specially the sunset. Wishing to be back soon.

title: The hub of jaisalmer
review: The Jaisalmer fort is one of the busiest and the most famous tourist attractions. A good day can be spent here. The location is perfect; It has the local market area a mile away and a lot of eating places too. It even has a temple inside. A beautiful sight in yellow by day and by night. The restaurant Jaisal Italy has good food.

title: Nice but expansive
review: It was a nice palace, very different of the other in Rajasthan but very expansive. 500 roupies for one person, and a lot of rooms were closed... but it was a nice visit.

title: The City of Gold Palaces
review: It is a true Golden City, The Palaces made up of Golden Stone or rather made up of yellow coloured Fossil Stone in the desert city of Jaisalmer. This Fossil Stones has the Characteristics property to make the building Cool in the Hot Summer in desert. It is so beautiful as if the City is made up of Gold Palaces. It looks more Gorgeous in Twilight. A complete City is built within the Fort boundary. One could be mesmerise with it's beauty.

title: Excellent View from top - Jaisalmer golden city
review: Fort is very good look from outside and when we go inside the fort, seen that their is so many homes and small hotels inside the fort.The fort is now a more commercial stree with hawkers, vendors and Bat smell everywhere. View from top of the fort is very very very good , every think is all most same color golden that why its called as city “Jaisalmer golden city”

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: Jaisalmer Fort (also known as the Golden Fort) is one of the largest fortifications in the world and absolutely breathtakingly beauriful .  It was built in 1156 AD by the Rajput ruler Rawal Jaisal, from whom it derives its name. (Rawal Jaisal's son was Shalivahan II; Manj and Bhati Rajputs are descended from him.) today it is a world heritage site  The fort stands amidst the sandy expanse of the great Thar Desert, on Trikuta Hill, and has been the scene of many battles. Its massive yellow sandstone walls are alight  tan colour during the day, and as the sun sets it turn into a honey-gold .

title: Jaisalmer Fort is Small
review: This Fort is very small compared to the ones that you find in Rajasthan... This fort has people living in the same campus which makes the place dirty and congested.

title: Smallish fort well worth the trek
review: Towering above Jaisalmer, the fort is the highlight of the desert town, despite being over run by hawkers. Within the city wall on the winding trek up to the fortress, the narrow streets are lined with hawkers and tourist shops. Once inside the fortress, the number of guest houses, restaurants and shops seems amazing for such a tiny space, but this doesn't distract from this being a wonderful place to visit. The views are stunning and there are several temples and the palace to visit.

title: the golden fort
review: a must see while you are here. a good guide will be good on you first day to show you the highlights but the second day do it yourself as you will see a lot more local art and craft and to do your own shopping.

title: Nice for a short visit
review: The golden fort was quite the site from a distance however unfortunately it lacked the wow factor other forts in India had for me. The interior is filled with touristy shops and restaurants boasting city views. It felt like it was very small when we were wandering inside of it. It is however a must-see in the city, and it was interesting that people still live in this fort. Do not pay to enter the fort!

title: Beautiful!!! Full of life and colour.
review: Jaisalmer Fort is truly a special place, it is the only Fort in India that has people living and doing business  on the inside. There are remarkable views of the city from the rooftop restaurants and architecture in the fort that makes Jaisalmer a cut above other places in Rajasthan. Another good thing  is that vendors do not constantly pester you to come to their shops. A kind "No thank you" and they will leave you to be on your merry way.

title: Overrated but still quite nice
review: Well we were in Jaisalmer for 2 days and I must say that I wasn't sure that the city will be so small.

title: Very poorly maintained and small
review: Very poorly maintained. Full of dirty smell and it is not worth visit. I wont consider this as a fort.

title: Must Visit!!!
review: The colourful feel of this place is very good. The best is just walk to the fort and explore the road side outlets. Try out the handicraft shops, dolls shops and variety of good outlet/cafes.

title: worth visit
review: this  beautiful fort is a crowdy  always.we can see some part of the fort only.some part is local people lives.some part shops.inside of the fort has very good architecture.on the top of the fort view is beautiful.

title: Not great
review: It's not good to be in summers. Everything was close . No food and guides mob u . They fight for you. It's scary. We got stale food . Changed 5 hotels. It was ok to view the top. Could see whole of d city

title: Impressive fort
review: Actually a small district within a town. Narrow streets, beautifully decorated havelis, restaurants shops, bazaar.Facades carved in stone and painted. You feel like travelling back in time. You should go to fort walls to enjoy  panorama of Jaisalmer, good view is next to big cannon (local peraple will show the way). Jian temples within the fort definitely worth visiting, as well as old maharaja palace (but ticket to the latter costs 500 RS).

title: lovely to see a working fort
review: We went for a wander here when we were staying in jaisalmer and really enjoyed it, the shops were wonderful and it was a really nice place to go for a wander. I especially loved how the fort was still lived in and you could see how a fort like this would work, my only problem was the amount of rubbish that was strewn all across the fort as this really took away from the area.

title: good looking with yellow stone
review: nice the golden fort,

title: One of the few living forts, but be prepared for the filth
review: You can walk around 200 metres ramp way, or take an auto for 30-50 Rs from the fort entrance to the inside. There is nothing much inside, other than few temples and museum. Be prepared for the filth everywhere since people are living in the packed neighborhood, also be prepared for the constant haggling by the local guides, vendors, etc. Overall a decent place to visit, one of a kind though nothing spectacular.

title: Only fort in which people lives
review: Only fort in which people lives. Place is like historical place. Inside few temples are there to visit.

title: The prime and must attraction !
review: This is the main attraction of Jaisalmer along with the desert safaris! Being the only living fort in India, where people still live and have shops and business. It is quite interesting to see the different sections of the fort along with some of the havelis and temples.

title: step back into history
review: Really loved the place... the whole fort and all the places inside it are rich with history. We hired a guide who was knowledgeable, friendly and helped us navigate the rather large fort. The top of the fort (the rooftop accessible from the museum) offered great panoramic views. I had a certain image of the golden fort for many years having seen references to it in the books, etc. and I must say that the fort lived up to my expectations.

title: Stunning! Amazing! Beautiful!
review: This was all the driving worth! I spent almost 2 months allover India, but I have to say that Jaisalmer was the most beautiful city/fort.

title: jaisalmer fort
review: another must see in jaisalmer

title: An awesome Fort
review: A must visit. A lot of historical facts. Wear a cap or carry umbrella as the sun is very hot. You could also buy some caps / hats at the entrance to the fort. Carry enough Drinking water. The fort has people living inside it. There are some shops inside to pick up souvenirs. There are a lot of small temples inside the fort, and it was fascinating visiting them all. Be prepared to take of your shoes / slippers a number of times.

title: Truly impressive, mostly!
review: A grand, grand edifice and so, so old!  I went for a wander through the streets of the town within the walls and also walked along the battlements for about a quarter of the length of the entire complex.

title: awesome place
review: i went jaisalmer is call golden city is really nice and very quite small i enjoyed so much here you dont need tuk you can do all by walk then you meet local people i hardley recommend this place to stay longer

title: Cool place
review: We stay jaisalmrer five night it was great to see arround so small city

title: Best Place in Rajastan
review: The Fort is a real Golden Sand Stone in The middle of the Thar desert,  about 120 km from Pakistan. The artificial Lake is a pretty Nice Place for relax in and picturing, as well as the Fort, with its huge entrances. I Rather suggest to get on a roof top to enjoy a breathtaking sightseeing, and to walk through the Small ways of the town.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: A very unique historical site.

title: ethnic
review: this fort is just like a time machine.... will take you back to the rajputs time of rule.... jain temples and museums are well maintained...

title: Wow !! Kings and locals live together inside the fort
review: Wonderful piece of architecture. How to keep cool in summers without using ACs is worth noticing. Carvings can just keep you amazed.

title: Best ethnic place to visit
review: This is an awesome place if someone is fond of visiting historic places. This place has creative ancient interior all around and takes you back in the century of Rajputs. The best part is it has mind blowing locations for photography. If someone is curious for knowledge, then the local guides can narrate the story behind various parts of the fort. The best time to visit this place is in winters and in pleasant weather.

title: Great panorama view on the roof!
review: Again one of the so many beautiful historic buildings in Jaisalmer/India... Great view from the rooftop!

title: Wonderful place to wander for the afternoon
review: The Jaisalmer Fort is  a great little touristy area with shops, stalls and restaurants. We enjoyed walking around and would enter a shop when we got to hot and sweaty. I recommend visiting GURU Health Care Massage Center. The massage was incredible and the brother and sister who run the place are kind, interesting people. We sat in their store for maybe an hour afterwards chatting about India with them. They are originally from Kerala and the brother, Sree Kumar, is accomplished at the Kerala martial arts called Kalaripayattu.

title: Alive fort
review: This fort is unique of all the ones I've visited because it still has people living inside the walls, some even building homes within the actual walls themselves! It's nice to see the domestic scenes, instead of just the usual souvenir shops and tourist restaurants. There are still a few temples, still in use, and it's wonderful to watch people get decked out and worship. My favorite fort in India, so far.

title: Pleasant walk in the only living fort
review: Took the service of a local guide to tour this magnificent fort. It was like walking in  a town inside another. The city's view from the top of the palace was breathtaking. On the one hand you can see vast stretches of dry land and on the another Jaisalmer city.

title: Good
review: Fort is huge with around 3K people residing inside it. Its said that its base is getting degraded and the fort is slowly submerging with sand, i wish some measures can be taken to avoid loss of such a must visit tourist place.

title: Beautiful from a distance
review: The Fort is awesome to look at from a distance. While in it, there are simply loads of hawkers and small stalls selling you stuff at a premium. The Jain temple inside the fort complex is a good attraction. Hire a guide for about Rs. 300 who may have a few intersting stories to share.

title: Medieval treasure in need of tlc
review: One of the most impressive hill forts of Rajasthan. An endangered site sadly due to unrestricted water use caused by the high number of guest houses and eateries in the area.

title: Travel back in time.
review: Lovely and golden. Beautiful place to stay and take a walk around.

title: Unique place
review: I visited the Jaisalmer fort during May 2015. Jaisalmer city is relatively a small place with the fort being at the centre of the city. And since the fort is on a slightly higher altitude it is mostly visible from all parts of the city. Also once you are at the top of the fort, you get a good birds eye view of the city. It is always advisable to take assistance of tour guide as the place is big and chances are you may end up spending a lot of time looking around the fort. Main issue with the place that it is not at all maintained. Since, so I have heard, it is the only fort in the world with people staying inside, it tends to be crowded. Though there is not much to see inside the fort, a visit is recommended given its unique characteristics and beautiful view.

title: A majestic fort built with locally quarried huge stones
review: We visited this ancient fort of mammoth proportions built by Rajasthan's king who ruled many centuries ago before Mogul invasion and occupation of India. The fort is like a small town by itself and supported a small population. We were told that the Maharajah created employment for his citizens by building this huge structure made of massive yellow stones. Do not miss seeing this fort if you are visiting Rajasthan. Guides are well informed.

title: Nice golden city
review: Golden fort is really nice to walk is very small city to relax and you meet  some local family I stay jaisalmer one week I was fully enjoy I hardly recommend you stay longer golden city

title: The beauty of Indian Architecture
review: This fort is one of a kind with excellent ancient hindu architecture. It was built by King Jaiswal and that's where it gets its name from.Also known as Sonar Quila, the setting sun truly gives a golden touch to the yellow sanstone of the fort. Climbing the hill to reach the fort was a pleasure by itself as we found local folk singers, dancers and magicians on our way up. It is a must see for anyone who tadmires ancient Indian architecture.

title: A very congested place
review: Visited this fort in December'14. A very nice fort. One can see the whole city of Jaisalmer from this fort. There are several shops of India arts and crafts. But the place is very congested and to some extent dirty also. A must visit for all the tourists to Jaisalmer.

title: the airy fort
review: the fort takes the tourists to an other world. half of the fort is still inhabited by the descendants of the kings, but even the remaining half takes hours to explore. it is magnificent and amazing.

title: fort visit
review: Excellent place to visit.. You should spare time & visit..no visit in hurry..some of the portion is closed for visitors for safty & security purpose...worth seeing our heritage..

title: High expectations- but total waste of time
review: The fort actually seems to be somebody's house, until you enter the place where the Maharaja's palace is situated. The surroundings outside the palace entrance- there are houses, shops, etc. which don't make you feel like you are visiting a palace. You get a feeling of visiting some old house. Not worth the time & effort.

title: Good view of city from top, good bargain shopping.
review: Not to be missed when travelling to the city, the narrow alley way are fun to roam around and explore on your own. We probably runshed it, otherwise plan for 4-6 hours up there including lunch or dinner.

title: Beautiful Architecture
review: worth a visit. A delight for history lovers, as the place has lots to say about the beautiful past. Need a lot of time to see.

title: World only Fort where people still live
review: OMG !  People living in a fort...  in this era.  Cant believe it.  Jaisalmer Fort is also known as Sonar Quila.The mega structure merges with the golden hues of the desert ambience and the setting suns in its most colourful shades gives it a fairy tale look.   The fort contains 3 layers of walls.The setting Sun turns Jaisalmer of Rajasthan into a beautiful golden brown which is a spectacular sight. This is the world's only living fort of Rajasthan and about a quarter of city's population live in the fort of Rajasthan and it is an experience by itself.

title: Nice walk half day
review: Is very nice fort and different from every other as there is people living there. Very Nice and free... Hundred times better than red fort in Delhi.

title: worth to visit
review: Very nice and long walk all around... lot of people around, but you can find spots where to peacefully contemplates the beauty...

title: Great View
review: The fort has a number of gates and it is 'one living fort' where people actually live in. they have their houses in their!

title: A lived-in fort
review: Imagine a city within the fort!... Take a back-pack, wear comfortable shoes and carry water... you can take a long walk within the fort, watching locals, tasting delicacies and shopping handicrafts.

title: Amazing City and Fort
review: Jaisalmer  Fort is unique fort in the world in the sense that whole city is residing in the Fort, not like other forts in the world where Ruler lives in the Fort and people live around in walled city. As Jaisalmer was regularly attacked bu Mughal/Muslim rulers ,dacoits etc. They made it in such a way that they all could live safely in protected walls.

title: The fort with living life
review: This fort is colorful. This fort has life. Small road and crowded community inside the fort. It's worth to see people live their in the fort, even most of them run little business for tourist. walking tour in the fort, you will be attracted by gorgeous sand stone houses.

title: Truly awesome
review: This is a awesome Fort it is the only living Fort in India... The shops are there in the Fort... There are hotels too in the Fort .... It is a must visit for every one

title: Sonar killa
review: such a great experience to see golden fort in jaisalmer,it is really golden fort when sun are rising. it is one of the most fort in jaisalmer and also only one living fort in india.the way and people are well.

title: The living fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is one the biggest living fort in India. Once you are inside the premises, it is better to take a certified guide who charges a very nominal fee from you and take you to all the must see points inside the fort. The architecture of this fort is just unbelievable. They had made the walls without using any kind of cements etc. While you walk through one door to the another, you will see the market where they sell some authentic Rajasthani things. There a huge market inside the fort too. There are various museums which display lots of things about the history of Jaisalmer. This sight should not be missed by one while visiting the place.

title: Impressive crown
review: Overlooking the city and the desert, the view from the fort was

title: Just Live it!!
review: Initially We thought how horrible will it be to ruin the fort and people living here, no protection of the monument. But once we visited it was wonderful experience, its very different as compared to tens of other forts visited.

title: Beautiful Fort.
review: Jaisalmer Fort is a beautiful surprise ! If you love handicraft items with colorful schemes than this is a heaven for you. Each shop is diffrent in style & items.If you have a patience than bargain & than purchase.   The walking experience in small lane of fort is very exciting. Must visit !

title: Must see fort
review: Best fort in India! So,amazing people are still living and building inside the fort, so easy to wander for a. Outlet of days in here. The city is so friendly too!

title: Sonar Kella - the 'golden fort'!
review: Jaisalmer Fort doesn't need any description, as its a world famous site. However, I feel this site should be declared as heritage and maintained accordingly. Its okay for people staying inside such a marvellous place, or not, is a matter to be decided by the authorities with proper rehabilitation. So many shops, eateries and vendors doesn't add to the Fort's rich cause, in my opinion. Fantastic view of the entire city from the top is something I liked about this place. I believe better maintenance and imposition of some kind of regulations may add to the beauty of this great place,

title: Super
review: Wao... that fort is realy amaging and old .maharaja and maharani palace is sooo big and very intresting so mustvisit that place.

title: Golden fort of Golden city of India .
review: Worth seeing Fort made of Golden marble . It looks very beautiful . We need at least two hours to visit this marvellous monument . Neat n clean &  well maintained . We can capture the beauty of this place in our cameras after paying very little fee for it . Yes cameras are allowed on little payment . We should plan our visit during little cold days .

title: Golden fort
review: It is very old fort but people are staying inside the fort . Local people are seen in fort rather than tourist. It is the only hill area in the region.

title: Amazing Structure!!
review: This is one of the best places in Jaisalmer after the sand dunes I love. We were thrilled with seeing the amazing structure built.

title: Must watch...awesome architecture..
review: one of the live fort in India...very well crafted...architectural beauty...you will find lot of attractive design on the walls...

title: no fort like feeling
review: there are so many people living there that is is no longer a fort we understand in true sense, only climbing up and down that is all it is about and no fort like feeling

title: Old, majestic, dirty, living fort
review: It's magnificent built is not justified by the occupants in it that are making the place dirty and smelly.

title: Grand!!
review: The fort looks imposing from a distance, and once inside you cant help but marvel the beauty. The stories surrounding the fort are even more interesting, get to the higher grounds and you will get a beautiful view of the city below.

title: Golden city with beautiful stone work
review: Lovely and breathtaking stone work in yellow stone. Worth seeing

title: Great to get lost in
review: A community of 3000 live in the fort and its a great place to get lost in. Entry to the fort is free but it's worth paying to get into Fort Palace - make sure you also pick up the free audio guide as it notes areas you may walk past. Set aside two hours for the tour.

title: Wonderful
review: Must watch . Jain temples and fort visit can be planned on the same day. Few more sites like 'chhatris' one can add for sightseeing .

title: nothing great , better enjoyed from outside
review: its only living fort in india that all ...nothing much to say , its looks more beautiful from outside , inside it is crowded , dirty and full of thugs

title: Amazing living fort!
review: This fort is quite impressive and we really enjoyed walking around and exploring all the narrow little streets. There are lots of little shops, restaurants, points of interest, heritage homes, and temples inside. Once could easily spend an entire day exploring.

title: Jaisalmer fort
review: Nice place. the fort has residents and lots of options for shopping. A full city view and a trip with a local guide is must ot know about all the history and details about the fort..

title: jaiselmer
review: It is lovely and one of attraction of Jaiselmer..must visit the fort..it gives memory of old tradition of rajputana families.You can shop number of varieties,many fast food is also available.You must have time alteast 3-4 hours then visit.

title: THE GOLDEN FORTRESS
review: The fort is not just impressive its jaw dropping. this also happens to be the name of an award winning indian film made in the 70's by master filmmaker Satyajit Ray showcasing this very fort. this fort is however a one of a kind, made of yellow sandstone. This is also a  living fort, so to speak with nearly 1500 familes residing in it.

title: Wonderful.
review: This is a most beautiful and impressive place, a sight not to be missed. It is intricately designed and full of interesting nooks and crannies. India is truly a wonderful country and this adds to it over and over again.

title: Living fort, beatifull to wonder around
review: Amazingly intricate palace with great views, lovely winding alleys in living fort.

title: Great Holiday Historic Destination
review: ONly other fort where people stay. as i is known a living fort. rightly name as Sonar killa by Satyaji Ray. awesome place to be in

title: Splendid Fort
review: Our guide informed that this was the only live fort in Rajasthan meaning thereby that people still stay within the fort along with their shops and various occupation. But we also observed families staying within the Mehrangarh fort in Jodhpur though not in such large numbers as in Jaisalmer Fort. Here it is a veritable mini township with narrow alleys and various shops and establishments with the liveliness associated with any breathing place. The fort has various pols (gates) one after the other located at every 180degree bend while entering the fort, though there is only one entry/exit. View of Jaisalmer is astounding from the ramparts of canons placed at strategic locations. It is sad to note that due to inhabitation within the fort, water is getting seeped in the foundations of the fort, which in the long run can have grave effect on the structure. Nice place to soak in the atmosphere.

title: Majestic fort...can be cleaner!!
review: This fort is the one of the main attractions in the city. The view of the city from the fort is amazing...truly a golden city. It can be reached easily as it's located in the middle of the city. In fact, it is visible as soon as you enter the city. There are a few havelis as well inside the fort. People actually live inside the fort...that was something unique to see. A number of restaurants offering a roof top view are present. The only thing that i didn't like were the filthy streets...you don't expect that from a world heritage site.

title: Live Jaisalmer Fort - Oh Really!!!
review: If you are in a Golden City of Jaisalemer, this is one of the main attraction that you will see. We stayed hotels near the fort since we wanted to see some Live cultural event at the fort. Since its been claimed as only "live fort in Rajasthan" which got our hopes high, but it turns out to be that by meant LIVE = people living there. Not the royalty.

title: Nice View
review: View from Fort is nice, entire city looks Golden. The way to Fort is through market so one can also shop around and try street food.

title: A must visit if you are in jaisalmer
review: You feel very patriotic once you visit jaisalmer, cuz u are very close to the famous indo pal border of longevala, where the 1971 war was fought. this place is a must visit, this is called the "sonar kela", which means golden fort in Bengali as the famous movie sonar kela was shot here and it actually looks golden in the evening sun, You will see old spheres, guns etc kept for public display, these arms are atleast 2-3 centuries old now. A must visit for all history lovers

title: Amazing View
review: Do take a guide to unravel the mystery of the dwar. Beautiful, scenic & worthwhile. Must visit & spend some time by the lake.

title: Royal grandeur preserved well
review: This is one of the elegantly preserved monuments of rajasthan & having survived the tests of time, this palace reminds us of the golden era of the rajputs. There are many shops around it selling handmade jewellery, shoes (mojri) and traditional dresses. The palace still contains the dresses worn by the kings, kept on display and don't miss the crystal shop behind the palace which has a huge collection of artifacts, sandstone products and crystals collected from different parts of India. This shop is quite famous across the nation and in Rajasthan. The entire tour requires lot of walking so do carry ample water .

title: magnificient fort but not so magnificent commercialisation
review: great place but poorly very poorly maintained.  cant say much.. loved the temples and palaces... but then it was all crammed up by the new buildings and motorbykes and all ....

title: Golden Fort
review: Fort is totally occupied with Local resident people, Fort is loosing its glory. One of the biggest and oldest fort is loosing its life because of heavy drainage system, Foundation of the Fort wall is loosing its strength day by day, Government of India must do something to save the life of the Fort.

title: Interesting
review: Very interesting and enjoyable day inside the fort. Well worth a visit and see a town living inside the fort.

title: Sonar Kella of course
review: After seeing Satyajit Ray's movie of that name it is everybody's desire to visit Jaisalmer for its famed Golden Fort.

title: Truly a Golden city
review: Such beautiful carvings, architectural wonder of it's kind, the fort is almost 400 years old and built by stone without the use of cement and bricks... It is called Kilha because public lived inside the fort and this tradition continues to date.. People still live inside the fort.. but actually not very nicely maintained from inside, a lot of litter on the roads and corners as you walk upwards to the canon point.. However amazing view of the city can be witnessed from above..

title: awesome
review: awesome desert . it describes the rajsthan very well. the music here is very good. the food iwas delicious.

title: Magical beauty
review: A living fort sonar kella it was magical go with a open mind Very interesting and enjoyable day inside the fort  view of the golden city will surely make your day. One of the most spectacular sights is in Noon when the its beauty looks is at its peak where it looks and seems to be carved out of Gold.enjoying sunset from a rooftop restaurant is highly recommended.the music here is very good. the food was delicious. Jaisalmer is a long way from most places but its worth the trip.

title: Sonar Killa
review: Satayajit roy's sonar kila may introduce  this beautiful fort to world.. even before popular with indian tourist... heart of Jaisalmer city..

title: Golden Fort - Good to see from out side then in side
review: Jaisalmer Fort is one of those forts including Chittorgarh where people are living inside and that make this fort dirty.

title: Life-time experience
review: Made of yellow sand-stone this is the Golden Fort (Sonar Kella as in bengali) in true sense. Awesome sight both at daytime as night as well when it is lit. Most bengalis have grown up with memories of the legendary Ray film....Sonar Kella. Great experience to see it. it hosts a full city inside. Authority however should be more cautious about maintaining cleanliness considering its heritage.

title: Meh gross
review: The fort was not what I imagined inside. It was filthy, smelly and overcrowded. Unfortunately went on a very hot day, making the experience even worse. Go first thing in the morning, or late in the day. Views of the fort from outside were much more enjoyable.

title: living fort
review: winters being the best time to go there keep aside half a day. the audio guide tour is definitely worth it . helps steer clear of the  many stories the guides cook up.....restaurants inside the fort walls can b avoided. the view from the fort terrace is amazing...our hotel rang mahal was well located to see the beauty of the lit up fort at night....brings in a sense of pride seeing such a well made fort.....

title: Magnificent!!!!
review: One of the largest fortifications in the world.

title: Sonar killa - must visit in Jailsamer
review: Its a World Heritage Center and is a living fort - almost 1/4th population still lives in the fort.

title: Very interesting fort; worth your time!
review: There are so many different and interesting parts of this fort and very much worth the time to explore.  It is helpful to have a guide to explain the history.

title: The only fort in world where citizens living inside it  have postal address
review: The golden fort or Sonar Fort as called,

title: Royal Wonder
review: Here is a fort, soaked in architectural brilliance and regal beauty. You can feel the echoing sound of kings and queens, who ruled this wonderful places centuries back.

title: Must Visit
review: A tour of the Jaisalmer Fort is a must when you visit Jaisalmer. There are lots of options to eat, rope walking shows near the entrance and the bird's eye view of the golden city will surely make your day.

title: Not worthwhile
review: From Delhi it needs approx 800 km. Trust me: this fort will disappoint you! Very tiny inside. It´s not really a "must have". Also the city isn´t  it worth too. Skip it!  Rather go to Mehrangarh Fort in Jodhpur

title: Beautiful attraction
review: Great visit to this attraction. The forts in Rajasthan are all unique and I would definitely recommending visiting this one.

title: One Word - Amazing!!!
review: Perfect getaway for an extended weekend.It boasts of two elegant and majestic mahals: Raja Mahal and Rani Mahal. Raja Mahal is bigger than Rani Mahal. They provide a splendid view of modern Jaisalmer city. Spend a good time in the fort by walking around the markets inside and you will be surprised by the rich heritage it offers. The fort has some amazing collections of arms and ammunition. There are houses (more like service quarters of then businessman) inside the fort which actually can give u a clear picture of the life of people under the dynasties. Buy stuffs (my personal favorite being the turban), but don't forget to bargain. Carry a nice camera and you will come back with memories of a lifetime. A must visit place!!

title: Living fort
review: The main attraction in jaisalmer is this fort .As soon as you come out from your transport you get a glimpse of this magnificent fort and there is a urge to visit this as early as possible.

title: Grand and beautiful
review: The mirror of our rich cultural heritage, the Jaiselmer Fort was a good place to visit. The tour guide told us it is the second largest fort in Rajasthan, but I have not confirmed it.

title: Sunset is a must!
review: Everyone who comes here must presence sunset in one of the many available rooftops bars/restaurants.

title: A piece of history and culture.
review: Jaisalmer fort is well preserved and visited by a lot of tourist. You can find B&B facility available inside the fort, if you get a chance then try to stay inside fort. There are few temples inside fort, architecture of all buildings and fort itself is mesmerising and will take you to the glory of it's past.

title: Beautiful
