review: We had a wonderful time at this awe-inspiring and beautiful Fort well assisted by our Guide. Even though we didn't have much time but we were able to get lots of information about this fort through him. The fort top views were absolutely magical and the fort is very well maintained too. Hope I would be back here in the future for a longer duration and enjoy it in much more detail.

title: Giant Sand Castle Fortress- AMAZING
review: It literally looks like a giant sand castle that hovers in the center of Jaisalmer. It was my favorite functional fortress in Rajasthan. You literally can sleep in a cheap guest house in one of the pillars of the fortress, have a drink at sunset on top of another pillar, and climb around the fortress walls. Touring and walking around the fortress is all free except the museum inside the walls. I did not go though the museum.

title: The Golden Fort
review: This fort is still lived in by about 3000 people. It is a triangular shape. Looks like a giant sandcastle with over 98 towers. Streets narrow.

title: amazing fort !
review: one must visit Jaisalmer fort to know history & traditions of rajasthan. you must stay in fort area to have amazing look of fort in night. several small hotels/guesthouse to stay at night.

title: Great stone carving
review: We have planned family vacation in jaisalmer. Amazing fort which is also called golden fort n golden city as whole city architecture made up from yellow stones. Magnificent view of city and royal architecture and facts about king Jaisal

title: Golden Fort
review: Only fort which is still inhabited by people from old city. you would find plenty of hotels and restaurants also operating out of this fort. Worth a visit, superb view of the city from the top. Would recommend hiring a guide for half day city tour.

title: Very interesting
review: A great place to wander around with heaps to see.  People still live in the fort.  Beautiful havelis and working temples.  Of course the usual sellers of everything imaginable but not overly pushy.

title: Artistic and Antique Ancient Fort
review: This is my first journey to Jaisalmer, where I saw the beautiful Architect and got mesmerized. The people there is also very friendly and they live their own traditional lifestyle. Each and every architect is unique and it says us the hard work of many people. A must place to visit in Rajasthan!

title: Enjoy the walking around the fort
review: Stayed 2 days in Jaiselmer and found it too short. There is so much to visit and walk in every corner of the Fort. Step on and off each time one discovers something new.

title: Great structure but lacks cleanliness
review: Excellent place to visit. The for is built on top of a hill and people still stay here. Excellent architecture but the place lacks cleanliness. If maintained, it will be more fun to visit. Lots of shops inside but be ready to do a hard bargain.

title: Living history but it's Crumbling.
review: Very pleasant place to walk around for a day and look at architecture. There is no entrance fee since it's a living fort. Unfortunately it seems this place has turned into one big tourist trap. With hawkers and venders at every turn hassling you. It's a shame when you want to just be at peace and enjoy. Also it's looks like the fort is in need of

title: Does not live upto expectations
review: Jaisalmer Fort is the centre-piece of any tourist vist to Jaisalmer. A special feature of the fort is that a lot of people have  lived inside the fort  for centuries and continue to do so.That having been said, the fort is not well-maintained either inside or outside.. The outside (near Parking) is especially dirty. The Fort also houses 2 more  important  attractions ,, Jain Temples and Patwon Ki Haveli. So in a sense a visit to te fort conveniently covers several attractions.

title: Depressing.
review: It's sad, how little effort they are putting in to maintain this heritage site. It filthy and dirty and a complete turn off for an otherwise beautiful place like Jaisalmer. The fort in itself and it's architecture is really mesmerising but it is so poorly maintained and so dirty that you hardly want to spend 10 mins visiting it. Just sad.

title: Worth the trip
review: Jaisalmer is a long way from most places but its worth the trip.

title: Past glory and rich heritage
review: One of the few living forts in the world, you must get inside the fort and see the narrow lanes, religious places and palace. A formidable gold colored fort which is crowed with houses. If you explore the fort wall, at some places you will see that the stones that were used to construct the fort were taken off.

title: Rajasthan at its best
review: We loved this beautiful golden sandstone fort and its 4000 milling, bustling, exuberant inhabitants. More than anywhere else on our travels in Rajasthan, this was the India we were hoping to find. We had excellent accommodation, ate delicious food both traditional and innovative, and found plenty of impressive culture in the Jain temples and havelis. Lots of Indian tourists celebrating a national holiday added to the friendly chaotic atmosphere, and we were so pleased we'd made the six hour journey from Jodhpur to spend a few days in this remote and exciting city.

title: The only living Fort
review: Two highlights of the fort.

title: Rich Indian Heritage
review: One would find ancient architecture having taken care of security measures and also that of climatic conditions. Well preserved by some group.

title: A city within a city!!!
review: This structure of this fort is very intimidating.One look at it and you know why the economy of Jaisalmer is heavily reliant on this fort.The Hindi name for this fort is "Sonar Qila"(the golden fort) and true to its name its made out of yellow sandstone,much like the rest of the Jaisalmer.The fort has narrow lanes and bylanes and there's relentless mushrooming of shops of all kinds.Restaurants,textile shops and shops selling camel leather goods form the bulk of them.As a direct result of all this,its quiet congested.Bad cellular reception is another feature.

title: A piece of history
review: I loved the trip to Jaisalmer just for the experience of roaming around the fort. So be prepared, it is a living fort so its not clean and well maintained. It's like a little village all cramped up inside a fort, with tiny lanes and cow dung everywhere but overlook that and revel int he architecture and the story. The lives that these people have lived, the wars these walls have seen. For me, these mattered a lot more than the fact that it was not super clean.

title: Crowded buildings and trash
review: Ok, to its credit, this is the only fort with a small city living within it. However, I don't find that as a good thing considering the trash build up, difficulty in maintenance, and the ever present water problem that damages the sandstone fort. There is ongoing work that has no solution. Yes, you should visit and walk around but you will find that it just isn't as great as it certainly could be.

title: SONAR KELLA
review: This one is called "SONAR KELLA" in Sarna Nagari (Golden City). This Fort was mentioned in a famous  begali Suspense/ detective story named FELUDA. Really this Fort  is looks like Golden Fort.

title: Amazing
review: Peoples living on fort in old traditional home , and very fantastic food available on fort , huge view of city from the fort

title: golden fort
review: Jaisalmer town is beautiful and golden send tone house's and Haveli in side fort there is many house to stay and food facilities museum is OK not the best as jodhpur fort.

title: Nice fort
review: i think one of the best fort in Rajasthan  this best fort  for visitor who  visit jaisalmer .One would find ancient architecture having taken care of security measures and also that of climatic conditions

title: heritage and beautiful
review: jaisalmer fort is so beautiful and heritage property of golden city jaisalmer. royal look of jaisalmer city view top of fort is also memorable. canon fitted at the top of fort is looking so beautiful and like [royal look] of fort.hotel also very good and cheap food is also testy.overall very beautiful for travel.jaisalmer city view from the top of fort is marvellous.

title: A must do when in Jaisalmer
review: The fort is very nice to walk around, and easily accessible on foot from a lot of the hotels in the area. There are many small and nice shops.

title: over populated and overrated
review: one of the only forts in india that is inhabited with people everywhere you go.. the place has narrow lanes with shops and guest houses on both the sides.

title: Picturesque viewing from outside
review: Quite picturesque viewing from one of the lookouts on the outskirts of the town. A lot of interesting narrow laneways inside the fort but many crowded with shops and cows. Found the many wedding announcements painted at the front of houses interesting. There is no admission charge as the fort is a living city. Lots of various patchworks for sale.

title: Great architecture
review: A beautiful fort showing the architecture of the time.  The city around the fort is clean with vendors gently selling their wares.  I loved this city in the desert.

title: Golden Beauty
review: Impressive fort build of yellow sandstone, also know as golden fort or sonar killa. Only fort where people live inside the walls. Fort is full of narrow streets with houses along the street. Inside its like a regular city with people living their everyday lives just like in any city. Resident have opened up shops in their houses selling items like clothing, paintings, postcards, decoration items and souvenirs.

title: A fort that is worth the visit
review: A town within a fort. Special because so many people live within the fort. A lot of tourist shops but still a good atmosphere and great views from the top

title: Jaisalmer Fort – A city in the Fort
review: It’s a huge fort which has Palace, Jain Temple and many hotels, restaurants and shops inside it. You can hire a three-wheeler; he will drop you inside the fort at the entrance of palace. One can even have a view of Jaisalmer city from the palace terrace and balcony. Both the guides (audio and person) are available at the palace.

title: A must do
review: The most amazing fairy tale castle right in the centre of the town. It is filled with narrow alleys, tempkes shops and peoples homes passed down over centuries. The stone work is extremely intricate and there are plenty of great photo opportunities. Take a stroll and get lost, it is not that big that you won't find your way out! Enjoy the sunset views.

title: Unbelievable experience
review: I had some idea about the only working and living fort in Rajasthan, but never expected such an amazing experience! The buildings are ancient, but full of life, laughter and emotions.All the people were extremely friendly, asking us to go and visit their homes. I am so happy that I visited this place

title: Traveler's Destination !! "Picturesque "
review: The Jaisalmer fort is the attractive in most of its elements. Those who are in serious photography, should stay @ hotels within the fort. They can have explicit composition of Street, Golden city below the fort, The colors of the shops and the architecture at its best.

title: Touristy but picturesque
review: This huge fort is home to a city.  Within its narrow winding lanes are houses, temples, shops, budget hotels and restaurants.  Entry to the fort is from the east, near Gopa Chowk.  One gets mobbed by the many hawkers, vendors and touts as you to make your way into the fort at Suraj Pol.  You pass through four enormous gates the last of which opens into the square called Dashera Chowk.  The yellow sandstone give a golden glow to the ramparts in the evening.

title: Average place to visit
review: Though surrounding of this palace is much better than this place. This palace is not as good as other palaces of Rajasthan (Like Udaipur city palace, City palace Jaipur), Apart from few ancient articles there is nothing to see. this is vacant palace. some of the areas of the palace are quite good, from the top of the this palace you can take the aerial  view of entire Jaisalmer city.

title: A nostalgic encounter with Feluda
review: Nice, lived in fort in Jaisalmer. Area of about 3 sq. Km. A bit congested due to old narrow streets and cows. But the Jain temples and the other artistic building were quite mesmerizing. The roads are cleaner than before but I think the municipality needs to take a bit more care to nourish the aesthetic value of the fort. Lasty it a very nostalgic encounter with satyajit Ray's feluda "Sonar kella" the places where the epic movie was shot. Overall a very nice experience.

title: Have not kept up with the maintainance
review: There is nothing much to see or do in jaisalmer but since its a historical place we did go. Being on a wheelchair did get my heavy automated chair onto an autorickshaw which is just to do the climbing bit coz no cars can go up. Its a walk through the fort which i did on my wheelchair. Its suppose to be the only fort which has people n imean all sorts of people living there i would say higher class slums. There are few temples its beutiful architecture and as u go by the lanes lots to buy like cheap shopping of scarves etc typical rajasthan types. A few good shops selling authentic stones and silver jewellery like big jhumkas n all which my friends found a bit too expensive. I did buy a clay pot with the fossil stone as i was told that curd made in that was ver good n thick have not tried it though.

title: good for street shopping
review: highly touristic place

title: Worth a visit
review: We were told by the guide that this is the second "living fort" in Rajasthan. The first happens to be Chittorgarh fort (near Udaipur).  The approach to the fort is congested. The bikes and rickshaws having a go at your ear drums on the narrow passage ways right into the fort is annoying.

title: Worth visiting heritage monument
review: Said to be built by Raja Rawal Jaisal, a Bhatti Rajput ruler, in 11th century on the top of trikuta hill, Jaisalmer Fort is situated in the heart of the golden city. Worth visiting monument for its glorious heritage..

title: Simply awsome walk around a living breathing fort
review: Great place to stroll around, photograph and enjoy,. lots of great handicrafts and interesting eateries. well worth a full day.

title: Old fort with people residing inside it
review: The fort was easily accessable, and have a interesting story. Our local guide was far to talkative, but gave us a good enough impression of the fort

title: lived inside the fort
review: for bongs the reasons are obvious but otherwise it is in ruins. the other forts in rajasthan are more well kept.

title: Living History
review: As others have already mentioned, this ancient fort is one of the few worldwide with local people still living and working within it's walls. Sure that along with visitor numbers means a lot of the ancient feel is lost, but it's still good to visit while it remains in a relatively decent shape.

title: Amazing from the outside
review: Jaislamer Fort is amazing from the outside, and looks like a really good Sandcastle. Once you go in, you can see that people live inside the fort and there are a lot of shops. It is quite quaint on the inside as it is a living fort. It is surprisingly small on the inside though.

title: Only some part is interesting
review: Only the part which hasnt been given to local people is interesting....otherwise its highly dirty and scarry.

title: The Jaisalmer Fort
review: It was the 1st of April 2015 when I along with my college friends landed in Jaisalmer at 12 noon by Jaisalmer New Delhi Intercity Express. My roommate friend Mayank bhaiya was our host on this Rajasthan trip.

title: the only attraction in Jaisalmer
review: Ok, so this much talked about fort .... might not be what you imagine it to be. it is an experience to be a part of just to see that yes, it is one of the only forts thats lived in by commoners. it has hotels, restaurants, shops and the works inside its premises - so that makes it seem less like a fort.

title: One of the Best place in Jaisalmer
review: Visiting Jaisalmer then you need to visit Fort.It is the heart of Jaisalmer. All the happening are in fort only.Better to book a hotel inside the fort only. Though prices of goods in the fort is high compare  to outside market but its fine as the view and experience you will get is awesome.

title: Historic Fort
review: It is a fort in which there are residents. It can be kept cleaner. The Jain Temples inside the fort are beautiful and need careful tour.  The fort is very big and needs at least 2-3 hours to go around.

title: Unique
review: I have always wanted to see the renowned "Golden Fort" and was duly rewarded. It is majestic on the outside and quaint on the inside. I don't think I would have liked to live there in a hotel, but liked how people actually have made it their home for hundreds of years. It lives and breathes history!

title: Lived in fort
review: The fort is a great example of a lived in fort in India.  Unfortunately the tourists using excessive amounts of water are causing a great deal of damage to the foundations of the fort being made of sand stone.  if you want to stay in the fort then go forthwith as the Hotels may have to move outside of the fort in the near future.

title: Deserts are Beautiful
review: And so are the forts. What amazing view. It will mesmerize you... The best season to visit Jaisalmer is winters. The top of the fort is just amazing and you get to see almost all of Jaisalmer....

title: Magnificent!
review: One of the largest living forts in the world! The most amazing thing is that people still live inside the fort. The fort comprises temples,shops,restaurants and is a mini-city in itself. Better to explore the fort with a guide who will tell you about its glorious history. You can get the view of Jaisalmer from the roof-top of the fort! A must visit place!

title: Lively fort
review: The fort in the heart of Jaisalmer, the "Sonar Quilla", is the golden fort as it reflects golden color when seen from a distance during day. It truly looks stunning from a distance.

title: A place not to miss
review: The fort is amazing. The history behind various parts of the fort is interesting. You can see the fort from each corner of Jaisalmer.

title: Too crowded & dirty
review: The most overwhelming aspect of Jaisalmer Fort are the crowds, the honking vehicles & the rubbish inside the fort. For a heritage structure, definitely needs a rethink. Try & avoid staying inside the fort if you can, to help preserve it.

title: A beautiful place to be!
review: The fort is just a great place to be in and wander round. The architecture is beautiful, but on top of that you get some stunning views out over Jaisalmer and it's just a lovely place to pass the time people watching... Or being watched by people!

title: golden fort or sonar kila
review: its a beautiful fort and the only one with local people residing inside the walled area.The architecture is beautiful and the view of Jaiselmer city is mesmerizing from top.Many divisions are made to display the objects of historical importance,cleanliness as such is maintained and an entry ticket has to be take.Must visit.

title: Growing out of the sand plain, like a mirage
review: Jaisalmer Fort is a spectacular sight: A massive sand castle, growing out of the sand plain, like a mirage. It was founded in 1156 by Rajput ruler Jaisal and was further strengthened by subsequent rulers.

title: Interesting
review: Put simply, the fort is inhabited, not by some ageing royal family but is a bustling, thriving home to people, shops, temples, cows and hotels. The views are stunning but apart from that it has little to recommend it.

title: JEWEL IN THE DESERT-------
review: Jaisalmer fort as it said SONAR KILA means Golden fort is an excellent historical monument,made of local yellow stone this fort gives you a nice travel experience in this desert city......nice carvings and architecture at jain temple is worthy to see---though there is a dense residential area in the compound of fort but you will not desperate after visit---there is a local tale in Rajasthani language for this fort---"ghadh dilli gadh agro gadh hai bikaner bhalo chinayo batiyan sire to jaisalmer" means there are forts at Delhi Agra and Bikaner but at the top is Jaislamer constructed by Bhati rulers---must see when you move to this desert city---thanks---SUMER SINGH SARAN-

title: Glorious view from top
review: The view from top was breathtaking. One could see the complete of Jaisalmer. Must take a guide to tell you more about the historical relevance of the fort. The fact that people stay within the precincts of the fort require that more stress on hygiene and sanitation needs to be given by the civic administration

title: Trip down memory lane
review: The Royal palace is not big. But the surprise is unlike other forts which look like haunted places this fort is bustling with a colony staying inside! The Patwa havelis are breath taking. You can get to see the interior of Haveli. There is a museum inside the fort that is informative.

title: Perfect view of golden city cn b viewed from fort.....!!!
review: To make evening perfect. U should have a cup of coffee on city view restaurant or a cigarette sitting on one of walls of fort. Art work on walls of houses in fort is mind blowing.....

title: The City of (Sonar Kella) "Golden Forte"
review: Its a review only for forte but I like to say about all . I am here for 2nd time. And believe me I come again . The forte is Centrally located in this city so you no need to hired a car. You jst walk. Also The actual fun is in Jaisalmer you need to walk. The only think is require that, to Remember your hotel name . Its a small city and you need to walk all corner of it you also jst have some direction from local people so can enjoyed all local sight seeing also. During your walk  see the culture of Rajasthan the golden houses and  have some smells of local cuisine. The people are good and cooperative if you have some trouble they will help you .So Its a great experience.

title: Special because it is a "living" fort!
review: This is a must see - it is one of the few forts in Rajasthan that actually is inhabited by locals. Also lots of restaurants and hotels. Nice to just walk around, mix with the locals, have something to at and enjoy the view.

title: Interesting, quirky fort.
review: Jaisalmer  Fort is great to walk around and get lost in the small streets that run though it. There lots of beautiful shops to look at and test your haggling skills as well as many rooftops restaurants to stop for cool refreshments.

title: Jaisalmer-the Golden Fort in the Rajasthan Desert
review: Far away in the desert sands of Rajasthan's Thar desert, stands an imposing fort with many bastions all around.This is the Rawal Jaisal's fort which stands up amidst the surroundings on a hillock.A city thrives inside the fort.........

title: Visit the haveli
review: Excellent architecture with proper ventilation .The haveli built in yellow marble and the internal roofing with the mirror glasses gives you excellent look

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: One of the living fort in India...u can see people, business and other activities inside fort. As many as 5000 families live inside....bit busy on the entrance coz of guides and shops..

title: a romantic place
review: A nice place for just lazy walking around, watching sunset or sunrise. You have to know at least some spots for that though.

title: Good Fort
review: Good Fort but surrounding area is very dirty and nothing much to see in this fort

title: Experience
review: The fort becomes live with the audio narrative arrangement. There are many attractions inside the fort, which is otherwise not known in general. The best part of the fort is 900 years old stone curvatures which steals the imagination of modern era. Also, inside the fort, it is like a small town, where about 5000 families are already residing. This is not experienced by me earlier.

title: Holi  at the fort
review: It was a very great experience to see a living fort, which was built more than 600 years ago and today having more than 500 families residing there

title: My favourite fort in Rajhastan
review: just spent a few days wandering around the narrow streets with all the different houses, havelis, temples, restaurants and stores and loved every minute of it. The entrance to the fort is free but there is a fee to enter the royal palace and the biggest temple.

title: Excellent fort with garbage all around
review: No doubt its an excellent fort and a must visit if you are in Jaisalmer. But be ready to deal with the dirt and drainage as the city is very small and its entirely covered with dust and dirt. Very poorly maintained and you would feel like heaven once you visit a place like this fort when you are in Jaisalmer. There's a lot of scope for shopping and many eateries inside this fort as people live inside this fort! So you don't have to worry about anything when you are here. This fort has a wonderful view from Patwaon-Ki-Haveli and I'd suggest travellers to spend most of their time here as there's nothing else worth seeing in this city.

title: average experience compared to jaipur & udaipur
review: it is a residential area basically with a no. of buildings having yellow stone and carving. not much to look for except a small jain mandir inside. this jain temple is worth watching if u r not  going to mt. abu & dilwara temple

title: Amazing carvings
review: Architecture of the Jain Temples is one of the best you will ever see. The carvings will stay in your head for long. Must visit.

title: Well preserved Fort
review: The fort is quite intriguing and has been converted into a museum. It is owned and maintained by the Royal family of Jaisalmer. It is well maintained and artefacts are displayed well giving a glimpse of old royal customs and culture. Cleanliness is a priority and facilities are excellent. Worth a visit surely!

title: Jaisalmer Fort,Rajasthan,India............a winter destination
review: Jaisalmer Fort is one of the largest fortifications in the world. It is also called the Golden city. It is situated in the city of Jaisalmer,Rajasthan,India. It is one of the world's Heritage Site. The Fort stands amidst the sandy expanse of the Great Thar Desert. Major attractions are:- Royal palace, Merchent's Havelis, Laxminath temple,Jain Heritage and few sand dunes.It is connected by Train from delhi, Jaipur, Gujrat. Air is only upto Jodhpur.It is best in January-February. You can do window shoping here mainly of traditional and artficial jewellry, carpets, shwals, stones etc. But do not forget to bargain.

title: Inside the fort
review: This is the only fort where around 2000 ppl stays. There are lots of hotels and good market place inside. You can also get some really nice restaurant there. If you want to be in Jaisalmer for more than 3 days, you should be stay inside the fort.

title: Do not miss!
review: Stone lacework, secret passages to allow wimen to observe without being viewed,

title: Nice area to spend a good part of half a day
review: Once you get past the drug/safari/tuktuk offers you enter the fort

title: The Golden Fort
review: Popularly called as the Golden Fort owing to the use of the yellow sandstone blocks in its construction. The must visit attraction of Jaisalmer for history buffs, foodies and photographers. History buffs would find a lot of amazing and interesting information in the fort to incite and feed their curiosity buds regarding the history of Jaisalmer. There are a lot of temples and houses in the fort complex, and people still live in the houses in the fort, so you will find the place crowded all the time. There are a various food stalls inside the fort and the food is worth trying, especially the "Masala Chaas" sold by a vendor just after the fourth gate of the palace in front of Maharaj's mansion is just awesome. There is a lot to capture by your lens inside the palace. It is a good place to spend around 3-5 hours. Visit to Jaisalmer is incomplete without a visit to this fort.

title: Highlight of Jaisalmer and worth the visit
review: The fort is definitely a not to miss place. The access to it is free and the place is humming with life. Restaurants, coffee shops, small shops, a lot of cows and a certain feeling about how people used to live in that area. Inside the fort there are two things with entrance fees as far as we could navigate the intertwined alleys and each side of the walls or the view points as they call them has a very nice display of the city and it's yellow houses. It's illuminated by night so don't mind catching the sunset there, it feels like a genuine relic of history which was generous enough to let people inhabit it still.

title: Stunning
review: You can easily spend a few days exploring all the nooks and crannies around the fort and the stonework within. Whether you sit at one of the viewpoints overlooking the town or just walk down the alleys and go to the temples it is a beautiful part of the town.

title: A Salute to Indian heritage
review: The expansive fort spoke about the excellence in architecture, details of technical excellence in craftsmanship, the work of art rendered in stone across its entire length and breadth. The vision of security, overseeing the populace and preserving the highest ideals of culture must have been foremost in the minds of the rulers who ruled these lands. The most touching sight was the hand-print of the 17 queens on the entrance of the fort - these belonged to those queens who committed 'sati' alongwith the funeral pyre of their royal husbands. One needs a devoted guide/voice guide to be able to understand this cultural heritage deeply. This massive structure in stone is not cemented at any point - you've got to see it to believe it.

title: very evocative fort in a city the same color as the surrounding desert
review: Rajasthan has many justly famous forts.  Jaisalmer stands apart because of its amazing evocative setting and creative use of materials.  The fort doesn't stand as HIGH as, say, Jodhpur's, but from a distance seems more to melt into the desert.  You can stay in havelis IN the fort.

title: Excellent
review: I spent three days here and was glad I had it on my itinerary. Being one of the very few forts that has a community residing within its walls makes you feel like, one has to imagine, you've gone back in time when people actually lived within forts. Being in the desert also give you the opportunity to do a camel safari. Not to be missed!

title: No Rajasthan trip is complete without a visit to Jaisalmer
review: And no Jaisalmer trip is complete without a visit to the Fort.

title: Great Experience
review: Popularly known as 'Sonar Quila' i.e. Golden Fort is a must see destination of Jaisalmer. This yellow stone fort is a unique of its own type. It may not have the size and grandeur of Mughal's forts but having a fort in the heart of Thar desert is no less a wonder in itself. This is also the only fort where people are still residing. If you are visiting Jaisalmer Fort, don't forget to visit the stone shop, i.e. Light of the East, run by Mr Parekh, a very interesting personality in himself. He has a unique collection of very rare types of stones, worth seeing and worth purchasing too.

title: Take a trip back in time in this ancient fortress
review: Jaisalmer was certainly a highlight of our trip to Inida.

title: Good view of the golden city
review: Awesome experience from the top of the fort and they have cafe and bar on top of it and it is a great experience.

title: Beautiful World Heritage Site
review: Fort is well worth a visit.  There is lots to see as it's a living fort with about 3000 people actually residing inside the fort.  There are temples, houses, restaurants,  markets, shops and of course lots of cows. Great views of the town and surrounding desert from the walls.

title: A huge and interesting Fort
review: Jaisalmere Fort is a huge bustling town fort.  Unlike other 'heritage' Forts in Rajasthan, this one is a living working Village fort full of small allies, small shops and Jain Temples.  We had been warned that many stall holders are not local people and they could not be trusted. But we found that although that may be partly true the artifacts and silk wall hangings & bedspread were far cheaper (with very little haggling) than at the "Artisan" shops.

title: Better than Gold " The Golden Fort "
review: Jaisalmer is the starting point of desert  and all those beautiful things that desert accumulates in self . The trip starts from the golden from   it is one of the best forts i have ever seen . Golden fort only only looks beautiful but it is also giant .

title: Nice but crowded place
review: The jaisalmer fort is an awesome place to go once in he western part of the country. However it is very crowded with the localites itself which makes the place a little noisy

title: Amazing!!! One of a kind..
review: The only fort i guess which had people residing behind the fort walls. A must visit for fort lovers.

title: Holi
review: Liked the Fort this is the only living fort . Fort dewellers are excellent host . I was here for Holi and the fort dewellers also involved us in the holi celebrations .

title: Poorly maintained fort
review: This fort is one of the most poorly maintained fort in Rajasthan as it has many families still living inside. The families have shops which sell knick knacks and local stuff. The infrastructure looks like it is crumbling and with the continuous lack of maintenance, it can only get worse from here. There is a view point from where one can see the golden/yellow city. The structures here are made of sandstone and there are intricate carvings. There are beautiful Jain temples in the fort which are worth visiting.

title: One place to must see in Rajesthan
review: Have been to the Fort twice. It's fabulous - except for traffic that keeps honking. People should b told not to honk - commercial vehicles must be banned in tourist hours.

title: Golden Fort
review: Within the fort itself is the Fort Palace, which includes the Rang Mahal, an interesting stamp display, and excellent rooftop views. Take a audio guide. Roof top view is awsome.

title: Needs more cleanliness - A massive fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is truly a masterpiece but its sad that its not maintained like the forts of Jaipur and Jodhpur. There are people living within the fort which probably makes its difficult for the govt. This fort needs more cleanliness.

title: Lively!
review: The fort itself is nice, the maintenance not so. It is really a living fort, not so clean. Cows and cowdung everywhere......

title: A city within city
review: This place is just amazing but crowded. You cannot drive , so park and walk up the old historical walls and gates. Once you enter the city, you can take any path to move around and see the city life inside the fort. Its a city within city. Get to know people, talk to them, see the old buildings, monuments, temples and some view points. People are very friendly and you can have you food any place (but one is special, another review on that, Check that special one!)

title: It  is a unique and fabuluse fort enjoy it with tour by jennifer
review: Jaisalmer is one of the golden in Rajasthan . In the middle  of city their is one fort it,s called golden fort its also have second name (sonar killa ). jaisalmer is built in 1156 by the rajput ruler jaisala .The lower of the fort,s three layers of wall is  composed of solid stone blocks, which reinforce the loose rubble of trikuta hill.the second wall snakes around the fort , and between this and it,s third ,or inner wall here the warror rajputs hurled boiling oil and water .

title: Living and wonderfully alive fort
review: This golden fort is a fully functioning and living fort and a walk in the for is very interesting. Do walk around at any time of the day or evening and meet the natives. They make for interesting conversations. Browse the shops but bargain well for a buy. Admire the windows and doors of the homes and do spend some incredible time in the quarters of the Raja and Rani.

title: very nice
review: This is a beautiful killa in the heart of Jaisalmer. It has an entry charge but it is worth every penny one pays. It has the history of the killa well kept . The view from the killa is gorgeous and one can see the whole city. There is a lot of small joints around the killa to eat the street food as well as hotels.nice place

title: A living Fortess
review: The Jaisalmer fort is one of the few forts where commoners still reside within the walls of the fort... A very beautiful fort made of yellow stone.. Take some time to walk through the narrow lanes of the huge golden fort..

title: Fantastic viewed from outside.
review: From outside the walls of the fort look really fantastic and magical. Inside the narrow winding streets are lovely, but it is very much given over to tourist shopping.

title: A- MAZE- ING
review: This place is so fun to just get lost in. It is like a giant maze of narrow streets(or walk ways)full of selling stalls and restaurants, with the odd ally way to a spectacular view point where canons used to be. The colors and smells are exactly what I imagined India to be like. The prices are so low it is hard to think they make a profit at all. Spectacular for feel and views. I would say do not miss it. If possible print a map of inside the walls if you want to see the whole thing for sure.

title: i liked the live-in fort
review: This is a live-in fort.

title: A unique experience
review: The uniqueness of the experience, of visiting a fortress in which people actually live, is the USP of this place. Walking in the narrow lanes lined with shops thrung with tourists and inhabitants adds a unique thrill to this place.

title: Have to visit!
review: Its a amazing experience to be here! the fort is essentially a boundary which  encapsulates the mini market. The fort is just awesome and is built with golden stone and looks nice.

title: History and Art!
review: Do hire a guide to see the fort properly otherwise you could miss some of the attractions. Guides charge rs 100 or so per group.

title: One time visit
review: This fort is a photographers delight at night from a distance...However since most of it is residential area / hotel area only a part of it is preserved for tourist..One can go for guides or roam around alone .....Gives a glimpse of royalty that existed though not that marvellous like th eforts of Jaipur, Udaipur or Chittorgarh...

title: Sonar killa or golden fort
review: It is the only 'living fort' as they call it ! There are descendants of the erstwhile office bearers of the king Rawal Jaisal  who continue living there .

title: Sonar Qila or 'Golden Fortress'
review: A unique experience of seeing a contemporary bazaar & densely populated residential area populating an ancient fortress! One hears that descendants of the serfs & servants of the former rulers are the ones who have occupied three-fourths of what was the fort and its precincts! The labyrinthine alleys are a tourist's nightmare (from unauthorised guides/helpers) as well as exotic pleasure (myriad shops, eateries & memorabilia). The ex-royals have become restricted to what was once the servant's quarters -- turning it into a themed abode of personal hospitality (admission by permission) where they play host to earn money and maintain that portion of property. The Museum is exceptional as it is protected from the hordes residing in the rest of the fortress. This was the place where Oscar-winning film director, French Legion of Honour awardee, Satyajit Ray shot his famous, "Sonar Kella" film in early 80's. Probably, contributing to the name, in localese!

title: nice and unique fort, but shld be more maintained
review: It is such a nice and different fort. I wish the government would take more interest in maintaining it. Because ppl stay in the fort it is quite dirty.But the yellow colour of it is really nice. And the work donr looks like wooden walls, but are actually made of stone

title: Architectural and Historical Gem
review: Its the only living fort in the world making it a architectural and historical gem. The fort has 40 per cent of Jaisalmer population living in, thus giving you a glimpse of how it would have been in the past. However, the fort badly needs restoration or else we will loose it. You can walk around in the narrow lanes of the fort without getting bored or feeling lost. The local make all efforts to keep the lanes as clean as possible however at times you can see cows moving around freely there. We have come at 11 in the night. Being a female traveller I was a worried that how safe it will be. It surely gets a little deserted by 9, but its safe. Still, a responsible travelling is always better.

title: It is the thing to see
review: Small passage ways leading to quaint shops and beautiful views from the walls. There is no point in going to Jaisalmer without visiting it. You may have to be a bit harsh with some of the traders trying to insist that you visit their shops, and be careful of prices as these vary hugely for the same item.

title: Nice for a wander
review: I liked the laid back atmosphere (and free entry) of the fort! There were plenty of small shops and eateries but zero hassle from owners which was a pleasant change! I especially recommend the little German bakery close to the entrance which did fantastic cakes for 40-70R which tasted just like they would at home! It is extremely easy to get lost inside so could do with being signposted! The views over Jaisalmer are fantastic!

title: At the golden fort of Jaisalmer
review: The fort is really an interesting place. I went there twice. The first being on the afternoon that I reached Jaisalmer. It's really a small city inside the fort with  shops, restaurants, the Jain temples, exhibitions, what not! The wall walk and city views from the fort are great. If one is lucky, one can get a really good view of the sunset from a few of the roof-tp restaurants, particularly those near the Jaint temple.

title: A Fortress Breached from Within
review: This is a beautiful fortress that unfortunately is being destroyed by the descendants of those it was built to protect. Half baked restoration work, illegal top story room additions, over commercialism, open sewers from thousands of residents and allowing motorized vehicles and just a few of the many problems that are leading to the decline of this beautiful piece of history. If you visit and I recomend you do, choose a guesthouse outside of the Fortress and do not purchase from the vendors within the walls of the Fortress.

title: Excellent audio guide
review: In sharp contrast to the Jain Temples, the audio guide here in is informative and entertaining. It helps to bring the palace alive.

title: Sonar Kella!!
review: Saw this fort for the first time while watching a great Satyajit Ray thriller. Truly this fort is magnificent and looks great from a distance. Truly majestic.

title: The Golden fort!!
review: Worth spending a day!!

title: A live Fort - very badly maintained
review: This is the first time I am seeing a live fort - meaning, that the fort is inhabited with the descendants of those who were originally in the fort.  Very badly maintained and absolutely dirty and sticking. A lot to see, but, unfortunately, the filth is not condusive to stay inside for too long. Good part of the fort is commercialized into a hotel. The architecture inside was beautiful, all built with sand stone. The museum was interesting.

title: Wonderful Experience
review: Unlike Udaipur City Palace, the audio guide was very descriptive especially love story of a couple in a painting. View of the fort from inside and from outside was splendid. It is living fort (people still live within the fort walls); Do not go for any local guides. Audio guide is worth it and not expensive. We picked puppets for souvenirs; Avoid Car (in case if you are not used to narrow roads); you have many good sites around the fort too; try the chaat shops within the fort...

title: Worth a visit but it is busy and noisy don't stay the night!!!
review: A beautiful fort and unlike most in the area, this one has 3-4,000 people living inside, however here lays the problem, the fort was never designed to have this many residents and especially the tourists staying on top.  This fort looks so much better looking in rather than looking out, my tip is stay outside and have a meal looking at the beauty, rather than staying inside looking at the squalor.

title: Day and Night
review: We tried to visit it during night but everything was closed at 8:30. One should go a little earlier for a sunset view i guess. We tried to eat in one place, the food wasn't good.  During day it was better, crowded, we visited the temples and walked around these narrow streets, where you can find lots of souvenir shops.

title: Living Fortress.
review: Great piece of art & architecture. Detailed work is un-parallel. Really Beautiful. One of its kind. Must see for all.

title: Living fort!
review: This is (apparently) the only fort in the world where people live inside the confines of a fort. The fort is huge and of a beautiful golden colour, which looks all the better in the sunlight. It is very easy to get lost in the numerous lanes. There is the Jain temples and museum. There are many restaurants and shops. There is no ticket to visit the fort and it is open till night. Very good views of the entire city can be enjoyed from various points.

title: Amazing Fortress and town
review: 20,000 people live inside the fortress, which is bustling with life, shops ,markets, historic haveli houses, restaurants.  The Palace of Maharwal has the most wonderful archiitecture, and lattice carved windows.  It also has small, wonderful temples worthing seeing especially the Jain temple.

title: Fort is awesome
review: The Fort is very good and well lit during the night. It is the only fort where people continue to stay there.. There are many hotels in the fort and they all say that they have the best view. I do agree since they are on the fringes of the fort.

title: Amazing working fortress
review: Made of the golden stone for which Jaisalmer is named after, this fort is a complete, alive citadel within which people live and work. Amazing! Unlike any other fort in India.The royal palace is beautiful, with incredible stone work inside and out and a maze of rooms and corridors. Just stroll around and do not worry about getting lost, sooner of later you will find yourself in a place that you recognize. You can stroll in the tiny streets where people live, make and sell their products. Watch your steps!

title: Excellent
review: This is my first visit to jaisalmer. it's very historic. it has good history. so much walking. nice big canon on fort.

title: Life within the walls
review: Walking through the crowded narrow streets and experiencing life within the walls.

title: A living fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is a living fort - common people are actually living inside the fort. Most other forts in Rajasthan may have a small section where the Maharaja is living, or maybe the entire place is given over to tourists.

title: Forts are the attractions of Rajasthan
review: Every fort in the state of Rajasthan is unique in nature with covering the local traditions & preserving the old age remembrances. This is one such and surrounded with shops selling curios & artefacts which every tourist will be attracted.

title: Not clean
review: If you already been to Jodhpur fort than you can avoid as its not clean and not maintained so nothing new if you already visited any other fort in Jaisalmer.

title: Residential fort
review: The fort is probably the only fort on the country which is a residential fort. There are various shops in the lanes of the fort where one can shop and also people stay in the fort with their families. This is the only unique thing about the fort. The build and architecture is as per the other monuments of jailsalmer.

title: One of its Kind
review: This is a fort like no other. You can stay in it, peer into the residences of the locals, walk its narrow alleys to shop for souvenirs, sit and talk with the locals, visit the Jain temples, eat at the cool cafes...admission is free and it is magical at night with its discreet but beautiful lighting.

title: Worth the visit
review: About 3,000 families stay in the fortress and is referred to as a living palace. not well maintained though - the responsibility lies on everyone from families, visitors and the government.

title: Golden city Jaisalmer rajasthan
review: It is a golden city.A easilly approachable from Jodhpur,and 575 km from Jaipur.A speciality is yellow sand & castle made of yellow stone.The name is derived from Maha ravalJaisalsingh.It is the biggest fort of Rajasthan.Best period to visit october to february.The famous Rajsthani Dancer,Musician plaing ravanhatha,,camel race.The famous food is Dalbati,Churma ladu.The sight seeing (1)Jaisalmer fort (2)Gadi sagar lake(3)Salem singh Haveli(4)Patva o ki haveliBest piece of carving in stone.(5)Jain temple(6)India -Pakistan border.Item to purchase Showl,Carpet,Bedsheet typical Rajasthani art,Silver ornaments.Be smart for bargaining.The jaisalmer is haven in desert.

title: Nice Fort to Visit
review: This fort is Unique in its own way. the roof of this fort give the insight of whole city which looks like gold.

title: Huge fort with a whole town in it
review: Not exactly like the usual empty forts, this has the whole old Jaisalmer fit into it.

title: Fairy tale fortress
review: Arriving at the town of Jaisalmer, my first impression of the Fortress was its fairy tale appearance, rising like a mirage in the desert.

title: Fort visit
review: Preferred Jain Temple over other areas of the fort. The walk up and down the fort is little tiring. The shops are OK but a lot of unreasonable bargaining is must.

title: Amazing fort
review: This is the one fort where you will see people staying in fort with lots of hotels, shopping option inside. Jain mandir is amazing. Must watch place.

title: Amazing living fort
review: Its a living fort with about 4000 people living within. The design is great. Get a diode who will explain the history and significance. The main palace museum is quite well maintained. The Jain temple has a very interesting history to it and is a must visit. The cannon point inside the Fort gives a panoramic view of the whole city of Jaisalmer.

title: a beautiful fort that creates nostalgia
review: this is a beautiful fort but really needs some better conservation efforts from all of us and by people living in it

title: Only Living Fort..
review: It is the only living fort...and perhaps one of the most maintained fort i have seen..Belonging from rajasthan i have perhaps seens almost all the major historically mentioned forts..but this one is one different from the others..And yeah the view from the top is simply breathtaking..Dont mind paying the guide 250 bucks for his services as the guy was nice...

title: wonderful. ...
review: Golden fort as the name suggest build entirely from yellow sandstone. One of a kind of fort where more than two thousand  people resides. You will find houses,markets and temples inside the fort. Really a wonderful place to visit.

title: Sonar Kella
review: One of most beautiful and biggest forts of Rajasthan!!

title: Jaisalmer fort
review: Worth going but hire a guide something you won't get to see in metropolitan cities see the bygone era in front of you but the tourism department should do something to keep the place clean alongwith  we tourists .

title: A different kind of fort!
review: Its not a regular fort... Families live here. There are shops, Hotels for your stay, eateries etc etc... Its one of the places to visit in Jaisalmer if you are not opting to stay inside the fort!

title: Another city of Rajasthan that comes to life with Bhawani Singh
review: The Jaisalmer Fortress is a living fort as people actually live in parts of the amazing golden fort.  It seems like there is nothing left but desert and then there arises a magnificent city that was part of the silk route to china.  The havalis (houses with stores) are very early and many have marvellous paintings.  The stores sell everything from silk, to silver all hand made into beautiful objects of art.  Most of the top goods are sold to the designers in Paris.  It is a city of narrow streets with cows wandering in the aisles and street vendors doing their best to sell goods.  If you are not interested in purchasing please just hold up your hand and say a firm' No Thankyou'.  Don't get into a discussion or make rude remarks as everyone is just trying to make a living.  This applies to the whole of India.  I have toured the fort and purchased wonderful handmade bedspreads and jackets and silver pieces such as thimbles.  Bhawani can help with any purchase and you will enjoy them greatly once you get home.  This is one of my favourite cities to explore as great history and still many adventures to be enjoyed. See you all there !  Susan

title: The golden Fort
review: The view from the top is fantastic. Also there are lot of things to buy, eat etc inside the fort. Its amazing to see still people (4000 will be an exaggeration) living inside the fort. The whole thing is a bit crowded but worth the time. Be prepared for a walk though.

title: Nice fort- but not maintained
review: Nice fort- but not maintained well. After seeing the Mehrangarh fort in jodhpur, this seemed to be a dull fort. But somehow it was  a shoppers paradise. Huge bargaining is done and you can get good rajasthani stuff here in cheap price. Though quality may vary. Small museum inside the fort is average. If it is maintained well, this is also a nice fort. The view of the fort from distance terraces is good.

title: Knockout sandstone fortress
review: Jaisalmer is one of the most fantastic sites in India, I think--in the middle of the dull and boring Thar Desert, it's like a sandstone oasis, and the fort's interior (it's still inhabited) is worth hours of exploration.  A great place!

title: What a place ..!
review: Jaisalmer is on of those places one shouldn't miss out if visiting to Rajasthan. The city still holds the flavour of old times. The roads, buildings and the people still some 10-15 years old. The Thar desert is absolute beauty and the jeep ride is awesome.

title: Massive & Golden.
review: I thought the hype might be misplaced but Jaisalmer Fort is indeed something to behold, huge & golden, perched above the City.

title: Nice fort
review: A very good fort walk, there are so many people staying inside. Tried to remember Satyajit Ray's Sonar Kella

title: must visit
review: it is one of the oldest fort, should surely see and feel proud of our culture. Its good to see how engineering worked at that time. amazing place. must visit

title: certainly one of its kind!
review: the fort is surely one of its kind. what makes it special? firstly the sand stone which lends it a golden color in soft sunlight. secondly, the large no of houses in the fort and add to it the innumerable guest house and haveli for tourist.

title: Worth visiting
review: It was worth visiting this place once. Huge fort area with lot of shops around and people staying nearby.

title: excellent
review: it was a nice palace. the rickshaw ride was great and one can get good guide too but they drive you mad as there are many but i think they are all good. need to dress decently if you wish to visit the temple. view was very nice too.

title: Living Fort
review: Brilliant and living fort. People actually stay inside the fort. It is a huge fort and you can imagine lots of residences inside the fort itself. Exceptional with lots of activities as people live inside. Must be proud people to actually live inside the fort. Golden fort as the name suggests is built from Gold coloured sand stones.

title: Ok for a look
review: Did find it all that great. The buildings are good to see, but the continually dodging animal pooh everywhere start to get annoying. Its ok for about 1 hour visit.

title: Good place to visit
review: People still live in the Jaisalmer Fort, so the place is full of rush. But, treat for the photography lovers, who want to capture true Rajsthani cultuere. You can get the whole package, people, food, clothes and everything.

title: Breathtaking!
review: Straight out of the Arabian Nights, only with a Rajhastani twist - this amazing golden fortress is well worth several visits. The ancient houses are architecturally wonderful, and along the narrow winding streets are colourful little stalls and shops where traders sell their wares. Visit one of the may roof top cafes and you'll be treated to a breathtaking view of the Golden City of jaisalmer. We loved this place.

title: Good but very crowded
review: This fort is different from most other forts that I have visited as this is a 'living' fort with over 4500 people who live inside it (as poer our guide). While this makes it different, it also makes it very crowded and I am not sure if its necessarily the right thing for a heritage monument. Otherwise very enjoyable to visit

title: Jaisalmer Fort, the golden fort
review: Jaisalmer Fort is one of the largest fortifications in the world that was built in 1156 AD by the Rajput ruler Rawal Jaisal , from whom it derives its name. The fort stands proudly amidst the golden stretches of the great Thar Desert, on Trikuta Hill. Its massive yellow sandstone walls are a tawny lion color during the day, fading to honey-gold as the sun sets, thereby camouflaging the fort in the yellow desert. For this reason, it is also known as the Sonar Quila or Golden Fort. The fort is located in the very heart the city, and is one of the most notable monuments in the locality. inside the wall, there are very nice intricately carved houses. Its a must visit! I live inside it (Mud Mirror guest house), feels like royalty!

title: Sonar Kella
review: Jaisalmer Golden Fort was one of the biggest attractions, why we have been to Rajasthan, and our wish was truly fulfilled. We have spent good time over there, and the market around, had lots of fun, and wish to go there again.

title: Sonar Kella!!
review: One of a kind! The living fort.It's almost unbelievable that people actually reside in the fort.Built with Golden sand stones,this majestic building is really interestingThe Jain temple inside is really a great piece of architecture. The palace is converted to a museum now.The market inside is also good.However we bought golden stone artifacts from the market nearby the fort as the price seemed pretty higher inside the fort.

title: golden fort in the desert
review: the entry area to the fort is full of shops and is very dirty.The local authorities should see that this portion is kept clear of hawkers and maintained clean.

title: Golden Fortress- 'Sonar Kella'
review: Thanks to Satyajit Ray Jaisalmer fort is on every Bengali tourist's must see list. But in reality the fort  did not seem to be as majestic as it was portrayed in the movie. From inside it looks like any other settlement..with scooties going past you in narrow lanes...there is nothing much to see except the jain temples which are marvelous. Efforts should be taken to keep the fort in good condition so that future generations can marvel at the golden fort!

title: Way too many vendors
review: It was very interesting from the outside, looking up.  But, the vendors began pushing hard on the way in and all the streets in the Fort were packed with touristy shops and more vendors.  It is a city inside the Fort and people need to make a living, but the experience was not at all like a visit to an old Fort, more like a giant outdoor flea market in a very old setting.  did like Jaisalmer though and the surrounding desert area.

title: A living fort!
review: The most amazing thing about Jaisalmer fort is how life exists as normal within those hundreds of years old delicately carved walls, as it would in any other rural setting. The unassuming nature of the lives of the locals living within Jaisalmer fort is quite striking. The brightly coloured patch-work bed spreads and wall hangings that traders sell on the narrow streets make the fort all the more charming. The only thing to watch out for are the open drains throughout the inner walls of the fort.

title: Impressive
review: The fort is full of people. It actually does not give feeling of a typical fort. Has antique Jain Temple that is full of carvings. Spread of modern Jaisalmer can be viewed. Majestic indeed.

title: great shopping place
review: the fort is still used by people to stay, so not much for a tourist to see except for the jain temples, top view of the golden city, king and queen sections. the great part of this place is the shopping in the many small lanes with proper prices if u get hold of a good shop. Time needed to explore depends on your shopping range.

title: Medium sized fort where people live inside the fort
review: Medium sized and  nice fort to visit in Jaisalmer, lots of shops inside the fort where you can buy so many traditional stuff and clothes, and most important the view of the Golden city from the top is a must.

title: Great Experience
review: During my recent visit to Jaisalmer - the golden city, I visited the Fort.

title: Get lost ...
review: ..., and I mean that in the polite sense, as you will then be able to find the more characterful parts of this amazing city

title: A living fort
review: Fort was average. Not as good or attractive as we expected. Most of the rooms were locked and we could hardly see any attractive decorations or work of architecture as can be seen in Junagarh Fort - bikaner. But yes, it can be visited once.

title: An awesome fortress
review: Its an awesome fortress. However too many shops and hotels are spoiling it and wreaking havoc. There is  a beautiful Jain temple inside the fortress.

title: Very different from the other Rajasthan forts
review: Very different because people still live here (4000 people!). So expect all the filth that you can imagine!!

title: The famous jaisalmer fort
review: fascinated to see the golden colour walls of the fort,unique that families still residing inside the age old Fort complex, beatiful view at night with all the lights projecting on the fort wall .Within the city,easy approach for visiting, can walk down to see it

title: fort visit
review: good. The fort is completely occupied by houses of local, shops and hotels. The palace is good and jain temples are good.

title: Crowded
review: The Jaisalmer's living fort was crowded with shop keepers noisily soliciting business. The shops are overflowing with identical wares and clothes and the noise was avoidable!

title: A fairytale
review: This wonderful place is magical, like a forgotten world from a fairytale or the Indian equivalent of Arabian Nights. You feel like you are walking in a time warp. A highlight of my entire travels.

title: LIVING FORT
review: The fort looks beautiful all throughout the day. Its golden yellow in color as it is made of yellow sandstone. There are more than 300 families residing in the fortress and so called a LOIVING FORT

title: Good living Fort
review: Nice Fort. Unique experience. People settled inside the fort. Apart from historical and architectural beauty, Good for bargain shopping also. Has many handicraft shops and small restaurants. Tourists must take guide at Rs 300/- for a small group. It is worth the payment. Entire city view can be seen from the fort.

title: A commercialised medieval experience on a grand scale
review: The moment you come through the gates to this towering living Fort all your senses come into play. Like walking onto a movie set back in time. If you can run the gauntlet of street sellers in the myriad of tiny cobbled laneways, your stay will be magical. Views from the many rooftop restaurants along the turrets are breathtaking. I would suggest a two to three day stay

title: Must Visit.Not Clean
review: The problem is its a living fort. its very dirty. The part that has ticket entry is good otherwise very dirty. Such a lovely place it should be better maintained.Over all its a must place to visit in jaiselmer

title: Deteriorating
review: People say there. Dirty. Overcrowded. Old historical areas are encroached and places of significance like for e.g. the area were Ray shot his film are converted into water tank. People here do not value tourists. I was asked to go "elsewhere" by a local when I was taking a picture because apparently the porch in front of a random fort house was his property.

title: Sonar Killa
review: Jaisalmer Fort or Sonar Killa due to golden hue from yellow sands stone is fantastic. The fort dates back to 1156 and highlights are the throne room, queen's chamber and a wooden horse toy of princes

title: Living Fort (Sonar Kila)
review: We went Jaisalmer fort at morning time after breakfast at Hotel. Don't forget to visit Golden Fort & Gadisagar Lake during you stay in Jaisalmer. Located near main market. Looked pretty at night time from hotel we stayed.

title: sonar kella
review: this is a well inhabited fortress where around 600 families live, palace is small,  kings palace has few items but queens is almost empty. Has got a beautiful Jain Temple. we aware of the guides tey try to cheat you. The guide said he we show us the Mukul Bari but never took us there. Palace is just near the entrance so you may not need a guide

title: Not the best fort in the area
review: Beautiful fort, but on the brim of collapsing at some points. Most of the outside walls are still in full use as public toilet and the small streets are crammed up with souvernir and tourist clothing shops. No fun to walk around being asked to spend your money every 10 meters.

title: Must visit
review: Honestly this is not the best fort in Rajasthan but this is the only living fort in India may be in the world. Approx 3000-4000 people stay inside the fort. You would love to roam around the narrow lane of the fort. You can buy some goods if you wish to. But bargain. Take a guide. Cost you approx 200.00 if your guide says inside shops are costly and take you to national handloom or RTDA shop then it's a trap. Your guide has a commission on these shops and these shops will charge you 10 times on stone items and 3 times on clothes.

title: A living fort!
review: This is the first fort we have seen where common people are actually living with their families from generations. This was quite amusing. But, You need a guide to take you  and show you around otherwise, you are lost. We paid Rs.600 to the guide to take us around the fort, the town, the temples and the Putvegars ki Havelis. On the way, there are some small time shops selling good stuff, antiques, clothes, jewellery etc. You may want to check out these shops. Stop by to pick up whatever you like, though the guide will dissuade you from buying on the way because he has a set of shops where he will probably be getting a cut off and recommends these shops highly. Over all, its an amazing fort. The Havelis are just superb. They exhibit the exquisite craftsmanship, imagination and logic. The detailing in gold and silver on the walls, roofs is amazing and reflects the wealth and the life style of the people. The carvings in the Jaisalmer stone to build these structures is simply superb. The jain temple is another place worth a visit. The carvings on the walls and pillars is breath taking. Do ensure to carry change in 10s and 20is for offering in the temple.

title: A very lively fort
review: this is a very nice fort and people actually live in this place.its good to roam around in the fort with quite a few monuments,restaurants and shops worth visiting.

title: SONAR KELLA
review: I read about this fortress in Satyajit Ray's Feluda story 'Sonar Kella' in my college days, later it was filmed by the famous famous film maker and after watching the movie several times, I had some high level of expectations before witnessing it.  But, to speak the truth, expectations has not fulfilled mainly due to crowd, congestion, noise and permanent inhabitants of the fort - inside a hertage monument existance of such village is not befitting at all.

title: Commercialization!!
review: All the shops in the fort have spoiled its beauty, but from top one can get the panoramic view of Jaisalmer.

title: Main attraction of the city
review: this fort is located in the center of the city on a hill, to reach within the fort you need to cross four doors which are not seen from below, once you reach inside, you can visit the Jain temples, Hindu temples, Canon point and do some shopping.. these temples reflect the art, architecture and the cultural heritage of Rajasthan

title: Ok to see
review: This is a privately maintained fort. There are shops and eataries around, within the fort itself. Beware of unscrouplous guides.

title: A most interesting fort
review: Many cities in India feature forts as popular tourist attractions. I have visited forts in at least 5 other cities and the Fort in Jaisalmer is by far the most interesting, due to the fact that it is a living fort. Seeing the colorful people, houses, temples, animals, vegetable markets, as well as shops throughout the alleyways was in my opinion a much better experience than other forts that are just museum/tourist attractions.

title: A good fort where life still thrives
review: This is the first fort I have seen where people still live inside. The view from cannon point is very good. We can see the whole city from there. There is too much to walk here but it is enjoyable. The cleanliness is not upto the mark for such a nice place. Authority should see to it and tourists should also not litter the place. Otherwise, good place to visit.

title: fort with people staying inside it
review: It would be just an average fort after you have seen grand structures like mehrangarh, ranthambore or kumbalgarh; very congestedand dirty lanes inside the fort; guides and beggars are another nuisance.

title: Must for "Sonar Kella" buffs; otherwise average
review: If you are a Bengali and want to relive the Sonar Kella experience, this is a must. BTW, this was the kella of Halla's raja as well (Goopi gyne Bagha byne). Otherwise, frankly it is not that great especially in comparison with Amber, Chitor, Udaipur or Mehrangarh.

title: Unique Live in Fort
review: Unlike other forts of Rajasthan, this fort has a population of 4000 living inside it. Second biggest fort in Rajasthan after the fort of Chittor Garh. The fort also houses the kings palace and a Jain temple inside.

title: Big fort
review: Nice fort built long back, more than 5000 people are housed inside the fort and lovely to walk inside to get the experience of history, nice marble carvings  lot of shopping can be done inside the fort. Best to buy a book on the fort and walk on your own.

title: fort jaiselmer
review: very nice fort...must visit and good to hire guide ...excellent work on stone....take around 4 hours...must buy pyramid and fossel glasses...shops are inside the fort...shall visit jain temple ..very excellent

title: Magnificent golden castle on sand!
review: This beautiful fort is the symbol of Jaisalmer. With curvilinear boundary and watch-tower all around it, This imposing Fort is one of the oldest living forts in the world. There is a Laxmi Narayan Temple and a beautiful complex of Jain Temples inside. But the best part is the Fort Palace. Audio Guide is highly recommended for this palace and the view from the rooftop is simply breath-taking. You get the full 360 degree view of the Golden City of Jaisalmer. You also come across beautiful presentation of Rajasthani Music and art while walking through the Fort. It is astonishing how this huge fort was built on the sand!

title: Disappointing
review: This was our least favourite fort in Rajasthan after Amber Fort in Jaipur and Mehrangarh Fort in Jodphur. The structure was striking and magnificent from afar but far from good up close. There was not much to see internally besides the palace and the Jain temple. It is a living fort with an overfill of tourist shops and hotels. The thoroughfares are crowded, filthy and ill-regulated. The noise pollution created by the honking cars and motorbikes resulted in a most stressful experience. Our guide informed us that the fort is collapsing due to excessive water seepage. Drastic measures are obviously needed to preserve what is the main tourist attraction in the area.

title: MUST VISIT
review: A stucture to adore. It is same as all other Rajasthan Palaces, but that yellow texture of Sonar Kella or Golden Fort.

title: Absolute magic. Transportation back hundreds of years.
review: My friend organised the trip here on short notice after a last minute decision to travel to Delhi. We took our time driving here over a few days. Im not going to spoil the experience for other by trying to describe the visit. Best piece of advice I can give is visit and pay a few hundred rupee for a personal guide. Magic.

title: Inhabitants have spoiled this place
review: A unique fort where the locals live inside !!

title: A living fort
review: Enjoyed seeing a fort that is a functioning, with many people living, working within its walls. This does make it very busy but well worth the visit.

title: Magnificent Living Fort
review: Looks amazing from both outside and inside. Its huge and inside has a whole township within its complex, numerous havelis, temples, residential complexes and a number of other structures.

title: Good but needs maintenance
review: The once glorious stone structures inside fort are, at places ,very poorly maintained and crumbling.it is slight disappointment after beautiful jain temples inside fortress.beware of uncertified guides.

title: Golden fort!
review: The jaisalmer fortress is the only fort in the world where around 4000 people still live inside it. Theres a beautiful jaisalmer palace at the centre of the fort where the royal family use to live, is now a museum and open for visitors. The fort is majestic from outside and from inside has several tiny back lanes, old cobbled streets. The fort is very old, golden, full of history, tourists, beautiful carvings on the palace and old haveli's and amazing restaurants serving japanese, italian, thai, korean, indian, rajasthani cuisines. Jaisalmer in itself is a very small city, about 5 km and can be covered on foot easily. I would not recommend jaisalmer to anyone who has knee problems and difficulty in climbing stairs. the staircases are mostly very steep and there are no ramps. Plenty of souvenirs can be picked up from the fort.

title: Must visit
review: its definitely a must visit. if possible please book a stay in one of the hotel which are inside the fort. it would make your stay even more memorable. do visit the museum, canon point and jain temple. though there are many shopping joints inside the fort, some of them are a bit steep. its advisable to shop from the outside local markets. another thing is that the climb is a bit uphill, so if you have elderly people with you, try taking an auto till inside. it always helps to reduce the walking tim

title: the reason for coming to jaisalmer
review: you need more than one day to truly see the living fort. one to wander around the fort and another to go through the old havelis. it is easy to wander around and get overwhelmed that there is just another old building,  you have to go into some of the haveli and see all that they have to offer as they are some of the best examples of authentic decorated houses on offer in Rajasthan.

title: Must Visit but Over crowded
review: Its a must visit while in Jaiselmer. A guide can be hired for as little as INR 300. Didn't shop for anything inside the fort and only staying for a hour to visit the major spots inside.

title: A fort that is still Alive
review: I found Jaisalmer fort very unique as its the only fort so far i have seen where so many people are living inside ... usually when you go to a fort its usually dead only tourists giudes etc but here there were shops ... hotels restraunts .. houses within the fort the experiene was good

title: Living Fortress
review: Quite a out of ordinary fort with families living inside. Do visit Pareekh ji's shop which is on all tourists radar.

title: Beautiful old fort
review: I really enjoyed exploring the little lanes and pathways of the old fort, and I took some lovely photos along the way. The whole place has a back-in-time feel, with beautiful architecture, great city views from the ramparts, and ladies in colourful saris sitting in the doorways. There are some lovely rooftop restaurants. Cows wander through the streets, and just be careful because although most are fine, one or two of them can be a bit nasty - give them right of way on narrow streets. The main drawback for me was all the hassle from shopkeepers, at every turn. I wasn't there to buy anything and it was really annoying, although I know that people need to make a living. Still, there are nice ways to do that, and then there are pushy, nasty, in-your-face ways. But overall, it's a wonderful place to be, and it lived up to all my expectations. It's particularly nice and quiet earlier in the morning, and later in the afternoon. It's great that it's a real, living fort, with somewhere between 2,000 and 4,000 people living within the walls, so it's not just a museum.

title: magnificent structure
review: sheer size and detailing of the reason why it was built that way is awesome. its very crowded though as many families stay in this fort besides the commercial establishments

title: Living fortress but the least keep it clean
review: While the sheer size of the fortress is amazing to see from far off or in the night with lights focusing on its gigantic walls, walking through the fortress is a different experience; all the way from chased by guides to street vendors...

title: Fort great maintained bad
review: The fort in reality a city built inside a fort.Over a period of time when Royalty faded in the background locals have taken up parts of the fort and its like cramped colony in well build compound wall of the fort. Certain sections and meuseum sorts are still nice to see. Most part of is converted by locals into small B & B if they hold a watch tower section of fort and built small rooms in it. The view from Watch towers of rising sun is spectacular. Fort is good for exploring but mostly hiding behind shanties and banners locals now occupying the fort have done to it. Be ready to walk around a bit to see the fort. Also, one can walk out of main gate in evening and check out the fort well lit in golden light and fading sunlight to live up to its name. Golden fort or Sonar Killa

title: Only Living Fort in the World
review: Its only living fort in the world. It has more than 5000 inhabitants inside campus. Palace of the king and queen is not so big, but in totality fort is quite big. People live inside fort, most of the houses are converted either into heritage hotels or shops. Chandni chowk of Delhi or Varanasi will come in your mind when you roam in bylanes inside the fort.
