People are simple and trustworthy at large. Fort was constructed with a detailed plan taking care of each and everything including drainage considering large population inside fort. Its a must visit fort for unique experience.

title: Nothing much to write home about
review: A living fort ... But poorly maintained. Fully commercial - guides, shops, restaurants, clutter...

title: The only inhabited fort we have seen
review: It was a very nice walk inside this fort occupied by people permanently settled inside it. Attended the evening aarti at the temple on the top of the fort.

title: Nice fort !!!
review: It is a good fort and you can get the information of Jaisalmer empire. Its worth to visit there. inside the fort there are some shops and restaurant.

title: The Magnificent Beauty Awaits its travelers!
review: The only liveable fort is a bliss to watch. With roof top restaurants, and affordable rooms at the roof top, one shall never miss an opportunity to see the entire city from up there. the beautiful sunset and sunrise will be a treat for the eyes.

title: Ancient Monument
review: Jaisalmer Fort is the only fort in Rajasthan that has people living in it, which makes it a unique experience.  Sadly most of the people are trying to sell you tourist tat and display it EVERYWHERE, which from a photographers perspective is highly irritating, because the city is truly beautiful.  Of course, people have to earn a living, so it is acceptable, I guess, but if the town were free of tourist tat it would be a 5-star review I'd be offering up here!  Despite trying to flog loads of tourist tat, I found the locals to be very friendly and some of them deeply philosophical... maybe something that comes out of living in a desert, miles from the nearest city!

title: Must Visit the Golden Castle of Jaisalmer
review: The castle / Fort is truly amazing and it will leave you mesmerized. This golden fort is one of most fascinating forts of India and the masculine built of this gigantic castle was breathtaking. The golden stone and golden past / history of this fort are unforgettable. I appreciate the efforts of ASI (ARCHEOLOGICAL SURVEY OF INDIA) for keeping the fort well maintained. We have taken a government approved “guide” who helped us to explore the “fort and temples”. It is quite economical as we had paid 200 Rs. for an 2 hrs guided tour. The brass cannon is still installed at the top of the fore which is still shining list its history. It’s a must visit place.

title: If only it were cleaner
review: When you expect to have a decent income for the city and its inhabitants from tourism...especially foreigners, the city fathers and the city people need to keep their place clean!

title: Stunning place
review: Very interesting place with 7 Jain temples inside the fort. They all have nice architectures. You need a guide if you have limited time for example two hours only. Local guide waiting there will charge only 100 rupees to take you around. There is Garth Jalsai hotel restaurant with rooftop terrace which has nice view to the city and excellent food. Markets everywhere there for shoppers but overpriced. Jalsalmer market in the city with haveli has better price. Quality of products in Jaisalmer is better than Jodhpurs market.

title: Great but I expected more
review: The fort is noisy, busy, dirty and smelly but amazing to spend time inside a living fort. The main purpose of this fort now is tourism and apart from the temples, the rest of the fort was taken over by shops, cafes and hotels. After visiting the city palace and the Jain temples there was little else to do but we enjoyed a quiet drink from various roof top locations, soaking up the ambience whilst watching a different aspect of fort life.

title: Excellent audio guide
review: Really made sense of the place. We learned a lot without being overburdened. Highly recommended. Beautiful too of course.

title: Ok if you have time.
review: After the fort of Amer in Jaipur almost every other fort feels small. The inner walk way is very narrow. We went in the evening around closing time, so I cannot imagine how people managed these walkways where there is a thriving bazaar and people coming and going during the day. The Jain temple was also closed by that time. So did not get to see inside. Though we did get to a vantage point from where we could see the city and it looked beautiful. Really, the golden city. Go if you have time. Otherwise enjoy the desert.

title: A Truly Living Fort - Reminiscent of Aladdin's Agrabah
review: Jaisalmer's Fort was the fifth we had seen on our trip, so I wasn't expecting anything special. I was wrong! The streets are strewn with tables showing off wares of all kinds, and the walls are covered with beautiful tapestries, carpets, scarves, and dresses in Rajasthani styles. The shopkeepers are friendly and reasonable with their prices (a highly appreciated thing as a foreigner). You walk through the fort complex and watch people doing laundry, shopkeepers rearranging their goods, villagers going to worship, men sipping chai on the stoops, and children playing in the water spouts. It's like stepping into another world - magical! (Note: There is no entrance fee for the Fort itself, but there are fees for the Palace and the Jain Temples.)

title: The place to be in Jaisalmer
review: Jaisalmer fort is royal heritage of rajasthan from centuries back, now a mini bustling town in itself. Though it could have been better maintained, but the rustic charm of the all the residential places, forts, shops selling antiques, artifacts, rajasthani bags and other stuffs etc make it for all. It was moderately crowded by tourist at the time we visited; therefore, the charm of an old city was retained; where you can imagine the glory of the place centuries back. The fort has several hotels,  you can see the whole golden city of Jaisalmer carved in yellow stone in panaromic view on top of it. This view of jaisalmer city from roof top of hotel in morning, evening and  also in the night with the whole city twinkling in lights would remain etched in my memory for years.

title: Good views
review: Good views. Lots of unsanitary rubbish. Avoid most restaurants. Some temples to see. Worth it for a visit.

title: Better from outside than inside
review: Well this is supposed to be THE thing to see in Jaisalmer.. But... I personally felt it looked more beautiful from the outside than inside the gates... We had the privilege of driving its perimeter at the night and it looked so pretty with all the lighting and rounded balconies..

title: Mesmerised !
review: Sonar kella revisited... this time in person. So beautiful and our guide, Gopal Chhangani, an MA student, was so very patient and helpful. Just loved our experience. You may look up Gopal at 99821 74601. Recommended at will. Thank you :)

title: Crowded place but good historical place
review: Very crowded place, its difficult to travel with Kids as we have 2 kids. So please avoid the crowd by visiting early or in afternoon.

title: A Live-in Fort in 2014?
review: Great History,wonderful structure  made of interlocked stones without use of cement and sand.Intricate carvings seen everywhere that makes you wonder about the skill of the artisans.5000 families living inside and carrying on their own business catering to tourists.The narrow lanes and the quaint restaurants perched on top that offer refreshments and great views of the city.

title: A Fort to visit...
review: The fort has 99 bastions and completely glitters like gold. The fort has a city based in itself. The fort has 11 Jain temples which are more or less worth a visit. The fort interiors which the visitors and travelers can visit are very well preserved and there is continuous effort to preserve it well. Avoid local guides. There are audio guides available on the fort premises which offer a complete know how of the fort which selected points. The audio guides cost less about a 100 rupee for 2 people (foreigners extra) and comes in 6 languages. There are 31 points that are asked to be visited as per the audio guide and the story telling too is of better quality and correctness to history. Must visit.

title: A rare of the Live Fort...
review: jaisalmer fortress aka Sonar Killa itself a Jaisalmer city and one of the rare live fort in India. A special salute to Maharawal jaisal singhji for build the fort not only for him but also for the people as most of the rulers in India have builded the forts for their own residence.

title: Living fort
review: This is a living fort where people still reside, it is like an old village in a fort, people do not respect the heritage and very dirty all over, roads have a lot of cattle and cow dung throughout... All Guides are fleeces and will try to extract money do not pay more than Rs. 250 as you will not spend more than 2 hrs here, do vosot the jain temple and patuwon ki haveli all have entry tickets ... one time visit only... after mehrangarh fort you will not like this place at all...

title: beautiful views from the top
review: This was one fort that is well worth the visit. We had a tour guide which gave us a better understanding of the history and the lives of the people who live in the fort. Climbing to the top offers fabulous views of the golden city.

title: Will always be the fort I remember...
review: This was the first of the forts that we visited in India, and when I think about forts, it will be the one that I remember.  Sure... Amber Fort, Red Fort, and so many others are bigger, or have certain distinctions.  But, Jaisalmer Fort was truly spectacular.  Made all the more significant because of the simplicity of the city (not so many high pressure hawkers), it's vantage at the top of the mount, and it's significantly "living" status.  It had so much to show us, and such a vibrant history.  We hired a guide before we travelled, and it was well spent.  He led us by the lake and abandoned village before leading us through the fort.  He also warned us about the fort, the state of the politics and push to get businesses to move out to save the fort, and so many other complexities that we were just caught up in it all and stunned.  I judged all other forts by this one after, and fondly remember our visit.

title: a visit worth experience
review: Only living fort in india. A good change compared to other forts. The visitors will enjoy the life inside the fort

title: must visit
review: Must visit place.. you would need 1-2 hours see this place... the fort is crowded but its still worth it.... do take the camera ticket and audio guide...

title: Majestic from outside, crowded inside
review: The fort looks majestic from a distance and will make you eager to get in. Unfortunately, it is an actual town inside that is bursting at the seams.  Crowded with even some vehicular traffic going up and down takes away some of the charm of the fort.  There are a few beautiful Jain temples that one must visit.  You get a beautiful view of the city from the fort.  Overall, a majestic fort that could have been better if it wasn't occupied.

title: Fort visit
review: The fort has become more of a residential place now, except a few landmarks . The old interlocked construction is worth seeing, the old gun lying in the fort looks good and ancient.Lof of hotels and restaurants in the fort now, overall an average experience.

title: Poor maintened, over populated, Poluted
review: Architecture is excellent. Sand stone work, Jafri work, and minute engraving works are really awesome. But due to over population inside the fort is very clumsy & noisy. So many places fort is getting damaged due to improper sewage & drainage system. But please visit the place, the fort is too beautiful, architectural design is also very good.

title: Not maintained
review: The Fort is not maintained at all. It is a beautiful fort but so dirty that you would like to go out of it as soon as possible.

title: Good fort minus poor maintenance
review: This is a huge fort which is unlike the other forts found in Rajasthan. The only drawback and a significant one is the over populated place. The place is full of commercial establishments and there is a continuous movement of vehicles in the fort blocking the way of tourists. Please avoid this place and instead spend quality time exploring other places within the city

title: Top View
review: Top viewing the complete city and houses all around. Its placed in city centre but lots of disturbance from the guides and locals. food was tasty shops inside the fort. love to visit the place again..

title: Interesting place to visit!
review: Must visit when in jaisalmer! The only living fort in world! It is buzzing with activity, still ihabited by over 5000 people. Plus the magnificent Jain temples & breathe taking view of city from the rooftop.

title: Beautiful Fortress
review: The view of the havelis from atop the Jaisalmer Fortress was quite breath-taking. The architecture was very intricate, it shows the level of intelligence and knowledge people of yesteryears are!!! The food in the havelis home restaurant is quite delectable :-) Can't wait to go back there again!!!

title: Interesting Fort
review: We stayed inside the fort at Hotel Ghar Jaisal and enjoyed walking around the streets and talking with the locals. This place has a peaceful atmosphere.

title: Great Historical monument!!
review: When you visit Jaisalmer, Jaisalmer Fort with its splendid architecture and Jain temples is the main attraction to visit.

title: very nice
review: very nice location, view from the hotel in nice.

title: the best fort in Rajasthan
review: This is a living fort the only one in India.Experience living in the fort for a night at least.What we loved the most was getting a motorbike ride lift through the fort late at night from a kind local as we were lost.It was like being in a 3d imax movie as we dodged cows,dogs and people making fast and sharp turns.Not quite ecofriendly but exhilarating.stay at Hotel Victoria owner is a great guy;food is lovely.

title: Fascinating fortress
review: This amazing habited fortress is amazing with its beautiful cobblestone narrow Ally ways .the view from the top of the fortress is so intimidating the colorful shops & beautiful temples is amazing .If you are planning to buy always bargain .

title: Stroll the streets and go back in time
review: Narrow streets/walks with interesting havelis or mansions.  Many with impressive carved facades.  Stroll around and enjoy the views.

title: Majestic.. Can spend hours here
review: The fort is huge and literally visible from every part of Jaisalmer city. A good tour guide is a must. There is so much to see that u can easily miss things if you do not have a guide who would also talk about thistorical and architecture of the fort. BTW it's a living fort, with houses, shops, hotels, restaurants everything inside.

title: Golden Fort lived up to its name
review: best part is that this is a still habited fort, more than 5000 people stay in the fort, this must be a sort of Guinness Record! The cute tucked in restaurants give excellent aerial view of the city from roof top and some value for money food @drinks etc.

title: Resident fort ...uninteresting
review: Looks majestic from outside but not great inside .. It is like a small city inside the fort .. No places of interest within I felt

title: Must watch Tourist Spot
review: The entire town of Jaisalmer revolves around the fort, so you can never miss the fort. The four gates of the fort are designed during the king rule, shows that they were prepared to protect the fort from any kind of attack. Instead of visiting the fort, I suggest staying in one of the guest houses to get a first hand feeling of the fort, and feel like a noble, albeit for a day or two. ATMs around that area frequently go out of stock, so have reserve cash while you head around the fort area.

title: Living fortress
review: The Sonar killa or the Jaisalmer fortress....was really a different experience as there were people living inside. it was not an empty fort. There were hotels, family homes, market, restaurants and yet the feeling of being inside a fort prevailed. The narrow bylanes, the edge of the fort from where could see the entire city....was really wonderful. Also inside were beautiful Jain temples and other temples. The carvings, the peace inside was really calming . I made 2 visits during my stayand each visit made me have a different experience.

title: Lots of stairs but very interesting.
review: A huge complex on top of the hill in Jaisalmer. As we had an experienced guide it was pleasure to climb to the top overlooking the city, and on our way visit royal chambers, the weaponry etc, and see the gallery of all the royals who had lived there since it was built in 1156. The history of this part of India and the close relations to Pakistan near the border is documented through the centuries just in this fort. On our way back to our transport we went through the market, a really thrilling experience as motorbikes and tuk tuks and sleeping cows by the number totally ignored traffic rules, so hold on to your hat, but enjoy the colourful aspect. And silver is definitely not silver in these quarters.

title: Impresive, desert fortress
review: Imrpessive fort, with beautiful havelis. Unfortunately, dirty, like everywhere in India. Can't blame the tourists, the locals need to be educated.

title: Sprawling medieval fort with incredible Jain Temples
review: Three places for expresso/lattes, lots of inexpensive shops, great views from the fort, fabulous restaurants, all reasonably priced

title: Satyajit Ray's Golden Fortress
review: The past charm of the fort city is lost to its commercial present. From cows defecating on the streets to people throwing trash everything from curious to fake artifacts are available here....

title: Beautiful Fort
review: I loved this fort, one of my favourites. Straight out of a fairytale rising from the desert. I loved walking within the fort down the little alleys, eating at the rooftop restaurants, taking in the little shops and everyday life.

title: SONAR KELLA
review: 2kms from the hotel.. must visit.. rick history of our brave rajputs. The very word Golden Fort is so very true. Good market in the fort is must see

title: Take a til tuk up. Walk down.
review: The fort is like a small town. Lots of residential and shopping and 2 excellent Jain Temples. (if your shoping for souvenirs the prices cheaper down the hill outside the wall).

title: Like Temples ? You'll like this
review: Amazing temples within this fort, for us ( My wife & I ) a few too many. But having said that, an amazing site with much decoration from many beliefs. A great photo opportunity.

title: Sonar Kella
review: During my childhood, I read & watched the critically acclaimed book & movie of Satyajit Ray's Sonar Kella. Since then Jaisalmer came around in my dreams & its characters were live in my heart. This November, I got the opportunity to visit this place at a very short notice.

title: Great fortress
review: Take your time and have a look around.  You will not be disappointed. Good idea to get a guide to show you some of the sights.

title: King's family and generations live here
review: It is one of the first fort where king's family and their generations live till date !! Its been inhabited by king's grand grand grand sons and their families !! It has unique golden color which comes from sand and sits on a cliff !! It is a good mix of architecture with modern facilities like shopping,, internet cafes ,, food cafes inside !!!!!

title: fantastic
review: Laxmi temple and Jain temple was fantastic and su set vew also so fantastic but only one problem at their lot of cow were there

title: a pearl of orient
review: every day is a party inside the citadel, decorated with the colorful rajastani merchandise exposed directly in the narrow streets, to welcome not only the tourists, but also stranded cows, local resident on motorbike struggling to get home, shoppers,peddlers and touts who try to sell you any thing, and lots of  children playing.

title: Ancient city in a fort...Awesone..
review: Its awesome place and very unique from any fort or palace.. This fort is a city in itself which showcase our golden Indian history.lanes and temples inside fort is great and staying in an hotel inside fort will be an amazing experience..But due to lots of shops and hotels its not that clean and require attention from govt and people to preserve its beauty and charm.Museum inside fort is ok and if you have visited Mehrangharh fort in Jodhpur it can be skipped..Would love to visit again.

title: A City in a Fort!
review: We travelled as friends and we had a beautiful stay in Jaisalmer city. The fort is not just a fort, it is a city in itself. Have a lot of things and people (around 300 families) actually live there .

title: Desert fort
review: The fort, which is at the centre of this small town, is made of stone coloured just like the desert sand. There is not much to see inside, except the museum and magnificently carved Jain temples. Guides are available but the money they charge is more than what it is worth. Museum and Jain temples are certainly good and the fort is worth visiting.

title: Sonar Kella. .really a golden fort
review: Being a Bengali you are bound to fall in love with this fort and will feel proud that Satyajit Ray made a movie based on this fort. .superb areal view of the entire city but retail shops inside the fort made it very congested. .

title: Fort was dirty!!
review: Lots of walk , a bit dirty but nice, we had a bit of struggle with kids as they did not want to walk but lots of cafes so good trek , enjoy rajasthani food and look at history

title: 800 years and still withstand with Glory
review: Like various other cities of Rajasthan, you will discover different facets of Jaisalmer as you explore this wonderful city with us. Tough there are historical monuments scattered all over the city but the Jaisalmer Fort will immediately command your attention. Made of sand stones and locally known as Sonar Quila, the Jaisalmer Fort is a dominating structure amidst sands. The Jaisalmer city is also known for its old mansions, better known as Havelis. Among many of them you will find Salim ji ki haveli and Nathmal ji ki haveli as the most striking. There are other monuments too, which are equally important because of their distinct and individual architecture. The amalgamation of ancient and the medieval era architecture will catch your fancy.

title: Nothing Great
review: The fort has not been well kept as its not under the control of the govt. or the maharaja. There are guest houses, shops, eateries etc within the fort which makes its upkeep difficult. The palace within the fort is much better maintained but still not that great.

title: Take a walk through history and religion
review: Excellent experience walking through the old city with Jain temples and elaborate havellis (merchants houses)

title: Rich History
review: It was one of the most enjoyed visits to the Fort & Surrounding Area, Just  loved it, it is amazing, the view outside the front door, inside buildings, Jain temples & walk  through its streets and enjoy the architecture, the local people which i  shall not forget

title: The Golden Fort in the middle of desert..
review: Being a fan of Satyajit Ray's movie "Sonal Kella" (the Golden fort), it was always my dream to visit this place. And I must say it lived up to my expectation. The collection is good, if you take the Audio Guide you can cover it in 1-1.5 hours. Try to avoid the guides as they usually rush you. Don't miss the view of the entire desert town from roof of the fort.

title: Spoilt by maniac drivers
review: The visually impressive fort of golden stone looms large over the city.

title: Not so great!
review: We visited it after we had visited Mehrangarh fort in Jodhpur.So it did not meet our expectations.There is no comparison.But since it has great rich history attached to it,it assumes historic importance.

title: Very Excellent
review: Very Excellent place to visit during November. The Camel Safari, The Fort and the Gadisagar lake are worth visiting.

title: unique fort
review: the fort has human habitation inside and that is what excited us the most.It has a unique character of its own unlike other forts.It is good to see local people going about their daily chores amidst the usual hustle bustle of tourists.The shooting spot of Satyajit Roy's Bengali film Sonar Kella is an added attraction.There is need to maintain the fort though to prevent it from further damage.We would like to visit the fort again if we happen to visit jaisalmer in future.

title: Beware of touts and guides
review: Worth visiting for a panoramic view of the city.  Beware of touts and so called guides which would in-turn fleece you dry.  No guide is required for this monument.  Do visit the restaurants overlooking the city within the fortress premises.

title: Old fort
review: Was quite a bit  cleaner than other places we'd been. Loved walking the narrow alleys. Views from tops over city stunning, great artistic shots.

title: Worth a visit
review: Must visit... this is a living fortress. Hence, most of the fort is occupied by local residents. One can look to stay at one of the hotels inside the palace for a 'once in a lifetime' experience.

title: Magnificient
review: Towering the city of Jaisalmer is the fortress popularly known as "Sonar Kella" - fortress of gold. A beautiful sight, our trip's last city tour started from this location. Since we were staying at walking distance from the fortress, our hotel receptionist suggested we walk down to the fort so as to save on parking hassles (which can be a lot).

title: "HUGEE"
review: jaisalmer fortress located just rt side when u enter from jodhpur side,its huge fort with plenty of spot located inside fort including jain and hindu temples,its town inside fort there r plenty of shops of local art work.

title: Must visit!
review: No trip to Jaisalmer is complete without a visit to this historical place. In fact we did stay inside the fortress for a night. Love the place! love the people here (except the annoying touts) oh and last but not least LOVE the view.Amazing place.

title: Okish
review: Okish. Esp if you have travelled to Jaipur and Udaipur. Does not give u the feel of a king's palace. Lots of shops inside.

title: A fort with a thriving city inside
review: The fort is awe inspiring. Must visit and would be nice to read up and hire a guide for keeping you entertained with titbits of the history of the royal family, the diwan family and the fort. Owing to the fact that people actually live inside, cleanliness and traffic are issues. Can imagine the chaos during peak tourist seasons.

title: Fortress or a Little Hamlet
review: The first thing that will catch your eye is the size of the fort. The second thing is people have established their houses, business inside the fort. The fort is not well maintained but the beauty of it covers the flaws. The fort has numerous little shops which sells stuff which thy term are authentic, antique. But we know better. Some how you might find something worthwhile.

title: Impressive
review: Beautiful and impressive fortress... a must visit for everyone.Totally loved the architecture and the history... the street shops are very colorful and lot of bargaining can be done.

title: Nothing great to see.. should be renamed as shopping gullies
review: It is a fort in which people live and shops do business. Nothing else to see really. It has a mahal inside which is decent.

title: what is it ??????
review: i have seen almost all major cities of rajasthan but it was totally a time and money wastage The fort attracts you from the outside. Once when you reach inside the lanes in the fort are too small. Ideally you need a guide to show you around the place. they charge anything between Rs. 150 to Rs. 200. and you need to go up by auto with charge of rs 100 Not worth while to spend more than one hour. the people live inside make it dirty the foul smell and traffic all the way upset you. if you see any other fort in state then no need to come here .

title: A lovely walk
review: we got in early in the morning, possibly the best time to do that. especially as there were no crowds and the sun was  much gentler.

title: Good place
review: A good place to visit. My opinion is that the place has lost charm due to commercialization by some people. Otherwise a nice place

title: The Living Fort
review: Amongst all the forts in Rajasthan this would perhaps be the one with hardly anything to see. The only attraction was the population which stays inside the fort giving it the name, The Living Fort. You can hardly walk around with the 2 wheelers honking behind you and the place is packed.If you have seen some of the other Rajasthan forts this is not worth it. The golden stone is a consolation

title: A Rare Experience...
review: Yes, Jaisalmer Fortress is indeed a very busy, bustling, crowded place, but that has to be expected in a living fort !  Unlike other Forts in Rajasthan it does provide accommodation for tourists, restaurants and retail merchants.... which all provide employment for the local inhabitants. Which in no way should negate from the grandeur of the fort which rises up out of the desert like a giant sandcastle, and is as full of history as any other. It also forms part of the city which has many other attractions, and a great local market.    If you just want to visit a monument, this is not for you, but if you want an experience then it is well worth it.

title: Must visit to see the Temples
review: Long walk up to the Fort. Infested  by residential accommodations of private families in the Fort. This makes it litteres

title: Steeped in history - and squalor
review: It should have been interesting - a 12th century fortified town - still lived in today. In a way it is magnificent, but it survives only on tourism which mans lots of tack, and it is extremely squalid even by Indian standards. We didn't think it was worth the 5 hour drive and back to Jodhpur.

title: Historical monument
review: Good architecture and good collection in museum. Enjoy local people who still lives inside the fort. You can do shopping from many boutique shops. Walk around on cobble stone and visit many temples.

title: jaisalmer Fort
review: I will describe in two words only i.e. 'MUST VISIT'

title: Live fort
review: For the first time I visited a fort which has 4000 people living in it.  Took me back in history to how Jaisalmer was before the population spilled out into what is now the city.  Fascinating sites of homes, homestays and restaurants within the fort.

title: Living thriving fortress!
review: Loved seeing a fort where over 30,000 people live and conduct business. Just walking around is a great cultural experience. We hired an english speaking guide who explained all the major sightseeing points. I would recommend hiring a guide to get the most out of your visit and to understand historical and cultural context.

title: The Fort
review: A unique heritage of the city, and its centre point, with its distinctive yellow stone.  However, it is not as well-maintained as it could be, as there are all kinds of occupants.  Maybe they need more awareness of their heritage and how to protect it!

title: Magic
review: We took the audio tour, and although not as good as others that we have used, it was still very worth while. Quite a few of the exhibits were missing due to unexplained circumstances (what a surprise). But the experience of walking through all these weird little connected areas and peering out at the surrounding fort and city from these exquisite windows, was spectacular.

title: A neglected world heritage site
review: A living breathing fort which has lost its heritage. You have everything inside the fort. Right from exquisitely carved Jain and Hindu temples, well preserved living quarters of the royalty, modern houses, restaurants, hotels, ruins of old houses, shops selling soveniers, clothes, bags, cold drinks, and everything else under the sun,  all jostle for space in the narrow gullies of the fort

title: living fort .
review: lovely fort with people living inside with all the history and stories feels like a small town inside the fort.

title: A Live Fort
review: Imagine the hustle & flurry of activity at the shops, & people still staying inside a 400 year old fort. Thats Jaiselmer Fort for you.

title: There is not much to see
review: The fort does not have much to see. There are only Jain temples that are worth visiting. We did not go in the museum as our guide recommended that there is nothing inside. Rest of the fort is full of hotels and shops.

title: OK as the lanes are small and people are staying.
review: The fort attracts you from the outside. Once when you reach inside the lanes in the fort are too small. Ideally you need a guide to show you around the place. they charge anything between Rs. 150 to Rs. 200. Not worthwhile to spend more than one hour.

title: Sonar Kella
review: Shopping and roaming... great place..!! You can hire an Autorickshaw to go up... Antique shops are good, but you can try 'MAASA'.

title: A living, breathing fort
review: This is a still living, breathing fort. Absolutely beautiful. Not everything in it is properly maintained, but it's not run down either.

title: Travel back in time
review: Big, beautiful, imposing. The place transports you to an era gone by. The only downside is that it is dirty and crowded.

title: Sonar Qila indeed
review: The only live - in fort in India is truly majestic not only because its so vast but the grandeur imparted by the stone used to build it. Golden sand stone changes hues with the sun and its indeed a treat to see families occupying the fortress over the years. However, what saddened me is the amount of dirt strewn all around and even inside the fort. Its true that without tourists the local people would lose out on their livelihood so does it not prick their conscience when they leave so much dirt around their livelihood earning spots? Cleaning job may be tardy but its upto the locals not to dirty their own place where people from all over the world come.

title: Golden Fort
review: Please Hire a Guide when you enter the fort. They will be charging us for Rs.50 per head. Don't even think to explore the fort without the help of guide. Their information is worth for money.

title: A living breathing fort
review: This fort was a living breathing location, some may not like the crowded streets, the hawkers and the hustle and bustle but for us it gave an atmosphere that made it more interesting and less like a sterile museum. It reminded me of Dobrovnik, in that sense, but it is even more rustic and is less developed, and falling down a bit more too !!!

title: Just Awesome
review: Went to the fort though I am least interested in visiting fort but was mesmerised by this fort. Fort is build on the hill top with families still living inside the fort. The view from the fort is just Awesome. Must visit place in Jaisalmer.

title: A Nice Fort
review: If you arrive Jaisalmer by car and don't want to drive the car in the city, please take a rickshaw and explore the city. You may take a rickshaw for an adult person to reach the  Fort. A world heritage site and built by Rajput ruler Rawal Jaisal. He was searching for a new capital because the first capital Loduvra was very much vulnerable to invasions. Lord Krishna's  Prediction proved correct when Rawal Jaisal, a descendent of the Yadav Clan and a Bhatti Rajput on advice of a local hermit Eesaal chose the Trikuta Hill  for his new Fort. First time  Ala-ud-din Khilji attacked it and hold it for 9 years, second time Mughal emperor Humayun attacked it.

title: It was OK
review: As people are living here, its quite cramped and crowded. We walked around once and there was nothing else to do. I think its different when you live inside in one of the hotels. We didnt go back in the rest of our 2 days in Jaisalmer.

title: nice
review: very nice to saw all the things.....wow such a super place to visit. my all family members and my friends enjoyed so much....i hope i will again come here to visit such nice places

title: Good experience
review: Wonderful history. Some of the most beautiful collection of cutlery and glassware of the king. Scenic view from top of the fort.

title: Magical!
review: Words fall short of defining the surrealist experience of this attraction. The desert, the golden fort and the untouched piece of Thar desert dwelling. Built almost a 1000 years ago, this is considered one of the largest fortification in the world. Sadly the growing pressure of civilization is beginning to take a toll on this piece of heritage, so as a responsible traveler make the hard choice of not staying inside the fort itself.

title: Very nice fortress
review: Definitely worth a guided tour visit. Especially if you like your Bollywood, get a guide who will tell you all the movies and which parts of the fort they have been shot in

title: jaisalmer the golden city and the golden fort
review: sonar fort in jaisalmer is an exception in forts in india .. its occupied by people .. even though efforts from government is on to get people vacated ..

title: Don't miss the Sunrise at This fort
review: The fort is the lived in fort as you would find all the annoyances(cows, dogs, traffic)  of small Indian town within this fort. The best time to visit the fort is at Sunrise. The view of the rising Sun over the city is amazing. There are a number of vantage points within the fort from which you could enjoy the sunrise. As Jaisalmer is in the west of the country sunrise is fairly late. We went in the first week of October and Sunrise was at 6.50 am. Got a good vantage point on the ramparts next to a restaurant. Had our morning tea at the Restaurant while enjoying the Sunrise. If you are walking from the Entrance of the fort give yourself 15-20 minutes to make it to the ramparts.

title: An all action working fort full of action
review: This fort is a hive of real activity and worth negotiating the cows and people clogging the narrow streets near the top. The spelling in the local signage is quaint. A child beer, means it is cold.

title: Living Fort
review: It was much better than expectation, a living fort.....golden indeed as it is of yellow sandstone

title: Beautiful architecture with poor maintenance
review: Its one of the living fort though what we thought ofvliving fort was different from what we saw. We thought of few familied living inside instead its whole city inside it. Beautiful architecture but poorly maintained. Though havelis are among some of the places which made are trip worth still can go once not more.

title: The Best
review: Jaisalmer is amazing. To walk around the fort is totally different from anything we have ever done. One of the highlights of our trip to India.

title: A good walk all the way up - good city views!
review: The fort is actually a living one. It is a small village setup inside. The fort never closes as such but the Jain Temple inside closes by 5:30. We went there twice - once during sunset and once in the morning to see around.

title: looks awesome from outside only
review: looks awesome from outside but very dirty and crowded from inside as local people has taken over the property, opened their own shops, restaurants etc....

title: Sonar QIla
review: The charm of this fort is awesome it actually attract u and the two sections inside, one for the king and other for the queens give a royal flavor to the tourist. Suggest going on days other than weekends to explore the best out of it. Although people say to keep distance from tour guides, I suggest to hire one after checking his credential coz that will provide the soul (story) to the body (to you tour) and help u take Photographs if you are a couple or even with friends :). At the end I say this to encourage you to buy some souvenir from the local people (who sell on corners/road side) and non fancy shops bcoz that will help them to earn their bread as well as give a reason to keep their art alive and the money will go directly to them.

title: well...
review: it is a fortress alright but people are living in it and have spoilt its beauty and aura. some parts are unoccupied and are lovely.

title: Bustling town
review: The entire town is situated within the fort. There is quite a lot of hustle-bustle and the place is not very clean.

title: A nice living fort
review: We did not take any nagging guides to see the fort. We strolled through some alleys and went to the edge of the fort and took some neat pictures.

title: Architectural beauty
review: It is amazing to see how a whole town has been built on this small hillock. All made with sandstone and intricately carved. Takes a good 2-3 hours to go around.

title: Best Fort in Rajasthan
review: Visited last month Jaisalmer and happened to be at the fort and it as an amazing experience to know about a fort that is entirely different from others forts of the state in color and formation. It has been built in a manner where one can see 80 hemispheres.

title: Jaisalmer - Camel Safari Day Tour
review: Jaisalmer is one of the most visited destination in Rajasthan, you can explore many things here culture & traditions, desert tour, sand dunes, Camel safari, forts & palaces. Every tourist who visit Rajasthan must Jaisalmer. We highly recommend this place.

title: Worthy of view "Excellent"
review: The fort was excellent.My warning to the travellers,beware of the touts in and around the fort.Government has fixed a rate for the guides dont pay any more.

title: A Fantastic tour with fort guide Bhawani Singh
review: Today our chakraborty family went to jaisalmer fort or the sonar killa in jaisalmer,Rajasthan.

title: Living fortress...beautiful but need maintenance
review: PRos:

title: Fantastic fortress area
review: We had shopping-clicking-and quite knowledgable place-with jain temples-haveli-food courts inside; Everything was good except where we had lunch-TIBETTAN KITCHEN-this place was pathetic ignore it please.

title: Must see
review: This is one of the major attractions of Jaisalmer The more than thousand year old structure in sandstone has a fascinating history surrounding it. Go in bright coloured attire if you want to catch a good contrast photograph

title: A living fort!!!
review: For the first time I saw a fort that is actually being lived in! There are houses inside the fort... amazingly the king is out but the public is still living in the fort!

title: Living Wonder
review: Locals live in this fortress and some parts are in need of restoration to prevent destroying the history of the place.

title: Not worth visiting
review: nothing to see. over crowded and dirty. can skip. since its a living fort and very poorly maintained. no good place to eat and restaurants available were crowded. sam sand dunes are also very dirty with trash all over (including beer bottles, plastic bottles and plastic) shamelessly thrown by visitors.

title: Good view from canon point
review: We visited this place during our stay

title: History could be preserved better!!
review: One big fort in the centre of Jaisalmer- definitely must visit!! But it pretty much houses an entire city amidst the crowded little shopping lanes, hotels & residential population.

title: Okay experience
review: The fortress is not that grand and well maintained as those in jaipur and jodhpur. Its a living fortress, with people having houses and shops in the fortress itself

title: live fort
review: yes this is a live fort ! 400 thousand people are living there. restaurant, market  even cattle! you will definitely enjoy that under the moon light.

title: The golden fort
review: One of the most impressive spot in Radjasthan !!! People aver friendly in this area, very open and not pushy, this fortis beautiful and the view amazing

title: Sonar Kella
review: Sonar Kella or Golden Fort is a nice place for tourist. I think this is the only Fort I ever seen people still live in. Good time to visit around holi, one can get some nice pictures of holi.

title: Amazing fort!
review: Although there are plenty of forts in India, this one is especially neat as there's so much going inside the walls. There's market stalls, temples, hotels, restaurants, animals, etc all around and tons of people. It really feels like you've stept into another world! It's well worth a couple of hours to look around!

title: A Must Visit
review: Loved exploring the Fortress and learning about its history. Always best to take a Government Guide who has good knowledge about the place to make your visit more meaningful. Although September was HOT the beauty of the monument made it worth the visit.

title: Living Fort of Jaisalmer
review: Its a big fort with 400 families living inside the fort. Museum is ok and jain temples are good  to watch.

title: Watch Where You Step!
review: This is a very impressive fort, but as it is a working, living fort, and depending on the day, can be very dirty. Cows Do Roam, so be forewarned.

title: Mixed feelings
review: From the rooftop restaurant of the hotel it looked very impressive but once you get inside it looks more like a bazaar than anything else....too many shops and hustling.

title: The outside is better than the inside
review: The problem with a "living fort" is exactly that - there are people living there. There is a little too much squalor to ignore, and it is NOT maintained well. It is mostly a bazaar selling touristy stuff. The few parts that are worth looking at are the rooms of the king/queen and the fort itself. The view of the city and the desert is quite nice. A guide is barely needed.

title: Beautiful Fort in a BEAUTIFUL City
review: Jaisalmer Fort is 800 years old and you can see all the City from the rooftop. You can see beautiful sunrise and sunset there. It was very hot when I visited but my friends with me didn't want to leave the City. Everyone should come for this experience

title: One of its kind
review: The golden fort is one of its kind. Made from the yellow stone it looks golden in the desert sun. The other unique thing about the fort is people are actually living on the fort. You can book hotel and spend night. The fort has fort palace , jain temple, cannon and numerous shops and hotels. This fort is street photographers dream. Eveything on fort is somthing unique. Take walk on fort arround sunset and at night. The yellow stone and the orange steet lights make amazing scenes.

title: Beautiful
review: jaisalmer fort is old and it still has the charm....many historical painting,statue,architecture can be seen .....from the rooftop i can see jaisalmer city beautifully and amazing....u can spend more time in side the fortress

title: unique fort
review: old time fort, families still lives inside, well maintained,

title: One of the best forts in Rajasthan
review: One of the best forts in Rajasthan. Unlike other forts, the Jaisalmer fort is filled with life. People are still staying there, their are businesses thriving inside the fort and all of this creates a unique aroma and experience. You dont feel that you are visiting a fort, instead it seems like that you are walking in an old city. Because this is a living fort with many businesses running inside their is a unique texture to the whole place. There are beautifully carved jain temples inside the fort, which is a must visit. One can experience all the vibrancy, culture and traditions of rajasthan at this place.

title: Nice place !!
review: This is nice place to spend some time. Just go around the fort . I think 2 hrs is good enough time to spend in this fort . Good fort

title: Beautiful ruin that stands strong, but gone to the dogs
review: With excitement we started our walk around the famous Jaisalmer Fort.. but disappointed to see it dotted with homes stretching forcefully out on to parts of the fort... making it difficult to tread or explore. Dirty, filth lying around... But from a distance.. it still looks magnificent.

title: Nice fortress, not very well taken care of
review: The fortress is nice, especially in the evening time from one of the roof-top terraces outside the fortress. The streets within the fortress are unfortunately not very well taken care of...

title: Lovely to explore
review: The most spectacular fort that I visited in India, a rabbits warren of shops, homes and hotels. Lovely to explore, you can even walk most of the way around the wall on the edge of the fort, though I'm not sure you're supposed to.

title: Sonar Killa
review: Was somewhat disappointed to see the Sonar Killa becoming more of a shopping mall and a housing society! The government and civil society of Jaisalmer need to stand up to the cause and protect the Golden Fort, and bring back it's earlier glory. It should look like a fort, and not what it is looking like nowadays.

title: Lovely historic fort
review: My husband and I hired a local guide to walk up and around the fort.  We learnt of the history and also about the mini city currently living inside the fort.  The top of the fort has a large cannon and an incredible view over the township.

title: The Golden Fort
review: The streets inside the fort, the houses, people living inside gives a feel of those olden golden days when the Rajputs ruled this part of the Hindustan. The Fort also has beautiful cafes, from where an astounding view of the city can be obtained.

title: The Golden Fortress
review: A place to enjoy beauty and perfection together. The town stands on a ridge of yellowish sandstone, crowned by a fort, which contains the palace and several ornate Jain temples. Many of the houses and temples are finely sculptured. It lies in the heart of the Thar Desert

title: Great place to spend a day or two!
review: Excellent shopping for trinkets, cheap clothes, scarves, etc.  Be ready to barter and look out for scams, but overall, pretty low-pressure and the shop-keeps were some of the nicest I've seen.  There are a few Havelis and other things to see in the fort, along with great views of the surrounding city and landscapes.  The fort is quiet, low traffic and not overcrowded.  We ventured into Jaisalmer for a meal and couldn't wait to get back in the calm and serenity of the fort!  Get a hotel/Haveli in the fort if you can.

title: A place to get gladly lost in!
review: Walk and walk and walk and you will find the most awesome sights, kind people who will even show their homes and ask you to take their pictures just to talk to you, great shops (though better prices are usually found outside), and lovely jewels like the temple hidden insight. Sleep outside but go there every time you can.

title: Living History
review: Loved the sense of history. People were friendly and great not to be harassed as a tourist. Loved the mirror work crafts.

title: Jaisalmer and Tanot
review: I have driven from Gurgaon to Jaisalmer I have taken Night halt at Bikaner both ways. My recommendation is that one should stay least two night stay at Jaisalmer.

title: Just walk around
review: Jaisalmer Fort is a place for explorers. You can just walk around and end up in little alleys, dead ends or at the edge of the fort with views over the surrounding areas. In August, it was relatively quiet and we were hardly hasseled by the shop owners. For evenings, head to Sunset Point or one of the many rooftop restaurants rather than staying in the fort itself.

title: Sonar Quila: Living History Unfolds!
review: The best place for explorers, photographers, painters, writers, bloggers...each stone, each wall, each alley, each architecture has a story to tell you...just keep your mind open..interact with fellow shop keepers...local residents...they are quite friendly! One tourist place where you can spend hours without being harassed! Go around...click some memories...eat yummy delicacies...

title: The Living Fort - a unique experience
review: Most forts one goes to, tend to be empty places, some well maintained with artefacts and others desolate empty places. Jaisalmer fort is unique in that there are about 4000 families that live within the fort walls. While most of these homes double up as shops selling trinkets and baubles and some others offer rooms to visitors, it still gives a glimpse of what life within the fort walls would have been in the olden ages

title: Interesting experience
review: Its interesting to see people living within the fort in the ancient and highly decorative buildings. The sandstone of Jaisalmer is very photogenic. The shops sell a wide variety of handicrafts and curios that suit every purse. Many buildings have been converted into hotels and guest houses. Hope they do not destroy the environs.

title: The Living Fort
review: Brilliant leaving fort with the stupendous architecture of the Jain Temple. Gives you scintillating views of the city of Jaisalmer from the top.

title: One of the peaceful forts of India
review: For some reason I got peaceful vibes from this fort. This is unusual compared to the rest of the forts I have seen in the country. Perhaps it is the low walls, calm yellow color, or its general open courtyards and cozy narrow alleyways, there is something calm about it.

title: Majestic heaven
review: The golden fort is the only fort still inhabited by people, and it is quite surreal. The fort is bustling with small shops, hotels and is full of treasures. If  you are visiting the magical city of Jaisalmer, I would highly recommend taking up a hotel/BnB inside the fort.

title: Jaisalmer in all its splendor
review: A Living vibrant fortress with all the color sights and history with living ,liv- in royalty ! Defiantly get a guide , Having a knowledgeable Guide brings the fort alive , Lots of views and vistas a photographers delight ! Museums are amazing If you can mange a tour of the Maharajahs Place all the better ,

title: Nice to see a working fort!
review: Although a working fort has its disadvantages (eg. the hordes of touts), it was nice to have a fort you could walk round and see people going about their lives. All the other forts had an emptiness about them so it was refreshing to meander through streets which were full of life.

title: Really marvellous architecture. Gem of Rajasthan. JP number 175235955
review: The fort of Jaiselmer is popularly known as Sonar fort. It is one of the living fort as people live inside the perimeter of Fort. The fort has four gates . The beauty of architecture is that no gate is visible from other one. This was done to secure the fort from attack. There are two palaces, one of king and other of queen. The entire fort is made of yellow sandstone which makes it quite beautiful . The roof of the fort is made of wood in order to keep the fort cool in the days of summer. The fort is managed by king of Jaisalmer . There is an entry fees for visitors and fees for photography too. After entering the fort , one can easily make out the sort of precision and architectural skill that the makers of fort have. One can see the beautiful view of the city and the desert from the roof of the palace. It is a Unesco site as the fort is built over dune and still strong than many of forts we presently have. The beauty can't be described in words. One should visit to experience it. Must visit for all who are in Rajasthan. A caution : the place is full of hawkers and therefore tourists must take care of that and do proper research before shopping anything in Jaiselmer .

title: One of the best attractions in Jaisalmer
review: It's hard to miss the fort because it dominates the cityscape. It's beautiful from the outside. Inside it's full of restaurants, shops, houses and winding streets. It's busy and a little dirty, so it depends on what you're looking for in a fort experience. The Jodphur fort is more classical and imposing, and, if you only have one to see, go there, but if you're looking for a way to spend a day in Jaisalmer, the city fort is a good place to start. I'd recommend walking the ramparts because they're quieter.

title: great view
review: almost everithin we needed were there.The alleys of the fort consists of souvenir shops. Starting from picture postcards,camel leather-ware,yellow stone crockery(native to Jaisalmer) and many other stuffs.

title: Beautiful fortress
review: This is a wonderful living fort, partly reconstructed but still magnificent. The rooms in the hotels and guest houses within offer stunning views. For a look behind the scenes, walk along the ramparts of the third tier and you will see how the fort is struggling to cope with its growing number of residents - locals and tourists alike. A fascinating place, warm people, beautiful sunrise and sunset views, and nice restaurants where you can get a panoramic view of the golden fort.

title: Safari
review: as my title suggest bst bst thing abt Jaisalmer was safari,

title: Major attraction in Jaisalmer
review: Must visit, since its famous.

title: Stay a while :)
review: If you are going to this fortress, I would have to assume you have been/are going to other fortress' within Rajasthan.

title: "Beautiful Fortress Town with great views"
review: The town inside is awesome lots of jain temples, havelis and tiny streets, the place is a unesco world heritage site and you can see why....if you like taking photos then don't miss this place, jaisalmer is a great town get a good guide and enjoy !

title: top view of city
review: overall good to see the city view from fort top.

title: A RARE LIVING FORT
review: This is one of the few forts in the country in which the locals stay within the premises. 1/4 of the population of the city of Jaisalmer stay within the fort. There are a great many hotels & restaurants which are run from within the fort premises. The fort affords a beautiful view of the city. Vehicles go to the entrance of the fort, but parking is a problem. Do take a guide, would do you a world of good. Dont miss the miniature model of the fort towards the end of the tour. There is a ticket for entrance and also for cameras. The view from the top of the fort is awesome.

title: beautiful fort i have ever seen in my life.
review: The town inside is awesome lots of jain temples, havelis and tiny streets, the place is a unesco world heritage site and you can see why....if you like taking photos then don't miss this place, jaisalmer is a great town get a good guide and enjoy !

title: Not the best in Rajasthan
review: Lot of building work. Impressive people still live inside the fort! But not the best I've seen in my travels in Rajasthan

title: Fantastic experience
review: The only inhabited fort in Rajasthan...full of life & colour.

title: A highlight in the desert
review: An absolutely stunning fort, well preserved, and surrounded by old Jailsalmer.  Plus the government Bhang shop is right near the fort gate

title: Heart of Golden City
review: This Fort is not just another tourist spot of Jaisalmer, its a lively town with old days structure but with all  amenities of modern time. This is the only fort in India which is still full of life in and outside equally. One can visit various temples, Palaces, antique markets, Canon Points as tourist points. This fort has many good restaurants and bakeries for food lovers. One can get very good deal out of bargain on leather goods and souvenirs here.

title: Jaisalmer Fortress
review: The fortess was the biggest fortress we have visited in Rajasthan and if you stay close to Jaisalmer you should go there. Lots of narrow streets and small temples. The people hold down their jobs and you get a great idea of how they have lived 30 years ago and how they live now. In some areas of that fortess it didn't change much. Very interesting!

title: Good fort
review: Inside fort is habitated. Along the roads shops and hotels are located. Not very well maintained. The perfomrnace of folk artists inside the fort are however very good. Outside fort one cab purchase the JAipuri turban and take photographs inside the fort. From the top the view of yellow city of Jaipur is really very good.

title: Like a mediaeval dream in the desert
review: I was there in the dry heat of June. Despite the heat the setting Is magic but instead of  aladdins Genies there are a many pleasant families living there in the gloriously carved luminously golden 14th C houses.

title: A Living Fortress
review: A living fortress, even to date & a must visit for travellers.

title: Best site in overhyped Jaisalmer
review: Being an avid traveler in India .. And a bit of abroad, I had heard a lot about the beauty of Jaisalmer. When I finally got to see the city, I did not find it engaging enough to stay there more than 2 days. Havelis are OK kinds, but one exception to the mundaneness around was the Jaisalmer fort. Loved the color and hugeness and also the lighting. It does give a European feeling inside with cool cafes and confectioners. Only if you are from Delhi, keep the buying side of you reserved for Dilli baat when you get back. Prices of even simple memoirs are overly high.

title: The gem of jaisalmer
review: We decided to visit the fort in the morning at 8 to avoid the harsh sun.

title: JAISALMEER-AKAL FOSSIL PARK
review: One visits jaisalmeer generally to see "sonar kella" and a glimpse of Tharr.

title: Jaisalmer - a true jewel
review: It is a living fort, one of the rare ones and that makes one appreciate the days gone and how it must have been.

title: Could do with some cleaning up
review: We spent hours wandering in and out of the alleys and behind the walls. This place suffers from a serious rubbish and maintenance problem.

title: Not Just a 'Living fort',  A lively fort too.
review: But for the cleanliness issue, the fort is really fantastic. Life goes on in a very leisurely pace in Jaisalmer. And life within the fort seems even leisurely. Walk around the palace, in the lanes and by-lanes and friendly elderly people would guide you to some view point or a small temple.

title: One can easily spend an entire morning wandering around this ancient fort
review: Plenty of interesting things to see just wandering around inside the fort and soaking up the atmosphere. Yes it can be dirty with animals and people crowding the narrow alleys, but there are also moments of tranquility to be found. It's also worth walking around the perimeter of the fort for excellent view: late afternoon is a good time for this.

title: Brilliant!!
review: Only living fort in India... cast in mesmerising golden sandstone.  Great experience walking through the many lanes, by-lanes and temples.

title: Fort visit
review: We had seen enough forts in the past so it was average. The temple inside the fort has impressive sculpture work.

title: People live in fort
review: This is a great fort I have seen yet. many people live in this fort. many shops, restaurants, hotels and guest house in the fort, you can see great view of old city from here.

title: An architectural marvel
review: Most beautiful fort i have visited so far. Truly an architectural marvel. Brilliant construction. You must hire a guide who can explain the history and the minute details of the fort.

title: Good audiguide
review: Interesting Fort. The audioguide was really helpful to really appreciate it. Good views from the top of the fort.

title: The only fort in India where people still live!
review: Its amazing to see people actually staying inside the fort. There are many souvenir shops and eateries like any other tourist place. One can get cups and collectibles made from fossil rock which is a novelty. There are a couple of view points which house cannons => they offer a good view of the golden city. The fort also houses a Jain temple and Maharaja's palace/museum which are worth giving a visit.

title: Golden City of Rajashthan
review: As all of us know, Rajashthan Tourism has got a different flavour than visiting other places. Here you won't find much rush, very calm though hot all around and very dry area. Even then, it fascinates the tourist from all over the world throughout year.

title: Needs a traffic policeman to check the pesky resident motorcycle riders!
review: From the outside, the Sonarkila, or the Golden Fortress (Jaisalmer Fortress) is an impressive & grand structure. It's very intimidating and important. However, once you are inside and walk those narrow lanes, you'll be constantly interrupted by the pesky resident motorcycle riders honking every two minutes until your ears and mind go crazy with those irritating 'trritts, tritts'!

title: Alleys of the Jaisalmer Fort
review: A whole city resides within the fort. Temples,bazaars,havelis,restaurants. The alleys of the fort consists of souvenir shops. Starting from picture postcards,camel leather-ware,yellow stone crockery(native to Jaisalmer) and many other stuffs.

title: BEST FORT LIKE GOLDEN FORT
review: Golden fort of jaisalmer always attaract you very much .It was built in 12th century but yellow stone attaches with each other with the help of two iron plate,no cement are used.You need guide ,they take rs.100 entry fee rs. 25 each,

title: A city within a Fort
review: Liked: A full fledged city inside the fort.

title: Filthy Fortress
review: A  fortress immortalised by the Satyajit Ray filmSonar Kella (The GoldenFort)looks very enchanting from a distance,but step in & the malaise which affect most Indian historic places hits you in the face.Dirt,filthy teeming with guides who would not leave you alone.The only clean well kept place seemed to be the Jain Temple.Worth one visit.

title: Golden city of Rajsthan
review: I had an occasion to visit Jaisalmer in Feb., 2014.  A concise but a pleasant trip of 2 days + 1 night stay at this place proved worth enjoying the natural Sand Dunes in Thar desert and the beautifully carved and sculptured insides of the palace rooms, walls and pillers, depicted with various attracting colors. A small city within a radious of 5 kms can be viewd nicely by bikes, cars, auto or morning evening walk.  Various Hotels in moderate budget with good facilities are also available in the city .  Yes, I found a  Restaurant, in front of the Mandir Palace,  nice  for vegetarian, snacks, lunch and dinner.

title: Jaislimer fort simply beautiful
review: The fort is beautiful, great to walk around the small lane ways , shop inside and eat at the different rooftop resturants! I would definitely recommend staying inside the fort for a night as it's a loyally different experience and there are great views to be seen.

title: Beautiful place!
review: Jaisalmer is remote compared to other places in Rajasthan and hence more enjoyable.  The fort is amazingly majestic and one of the few forts in India where people still live and have shops.  Not sure if that is a good thing though.  It is a must-see.  Jaisalmer is out of the way and that is what makes it so special and worth the trip.

title: A township inside a fort
review: An ancient desert fort , many centuries old. Has a vibrant little town inside it. Walk through the narrow streets of this town and experience the life here. The temples and the royal buildings are beautifully carved in wood and stone. Climb upto the upper ramparts of the fort to get a panoramic view of the desert country around.

title: It’s a whole world in itself
review: The whole fort and the complex should be a must on your trip to jaisalmer. What impressed me is the fact that the whole place has a whole city inside with narrow alley roads and houses and lots of small cafes and shops. The fort in itself is huge and breathtaking. Be a little prepared for physical activity as the place demands a whole lot of walking and climbing but is an experience all together.

title: Enchanting Jaisalmer Fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is simply one of the most unique monument. Its a blend of Marwar and west Asian design. The view of the fortress from Gadisar lake is worth seeing and you feel like keeping on admiring the majestic structure. It has endured the years of seering summers and storms. Still the structure is intact and emits the brightness of the Golden sand stone. At Jaisalmer all structures are sand stone and that's the reason the city is called as Golden city. The fortress supports many a families since many generations dependent on the tourist traffic for living. The Jain temples inside the fort are quite an attraction. Also we should vist the topmost point to see the view of Jaisalmer city. The museum inside is maintained well and all the things used by the king and queen are displayed. There are many a variety of artifact stalls, where you can by many interesting collections from Stamps, tiny trumpets, show pieces, puppets, carpets, shawls, dresses and etc. Do try the bhelpuri at the centre courtyard. Also the traditional Rajasthani turbans are a riot of colours which attract any seasoned tourist. Go enjoy the colour and peace at Jaisalmer and lose youself in the enchanted city.

title: Golden fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is also known as golden fort.This fort is made of yellow stones.When sunrays fall on  this stone it looks golden.This fort is one of the oldest fort of Rajasthan.There are mainly 4 gates for entering the fort.The 4 gates are Aakhee prol,Surya prol,Ganesh prol,Hawa prol.On the top of Ganesh prol one can observe the deity of Ganesh.At Hawa prol there is cold wind blowing all the time.There are many shops inside the fort.People can purchase many products.People still lives in this fort.There is a beautiful point in this fort which is known as Dussera chowk.At Dusshera chawk there are buildings where king,queen used to live.Inside the fort there is a Laxminarayan temple,a Jain temple.Inside the Jain temple one can can see the deity of 24 Jain Tirthankars. The majestic Rajasthani art and architectecture can be visible in every buildings of this fort.In most of the old buildings there are no use of sand,cement.The view of the city from the fort is simply outstanding.There is a museum inside the fort.The entrance for the museum is from Dusshera Chowk.In the museum there are clothes,utensils etc that was used by king during his lifetime.

title: Ajmer - Jaisalmer - Jaipur Trip
review: Hi guys,

title: Its excellent monument to visit
review: The fort was good. The sunset was nice from the fort. We been to cannon point and can see the whole Jaisalmer city. Overall it was good experience.

title: Jaisalmer fort and sand dunes
review: The fort was right inside the city and was worth a visit for 2 hrs-not as interesting as other forts in Rajasthan. Sand dunes were worth a visit; the experience was unique. It would be ideal to stay at camps close to the sand dunes and see the fort either on the day of arrival or departure at the city. The whole trip could be covered in one day and one night in order to get the desert experience.

title: Time travel experience
review: After I visited several forts across India, this is the only one that made feel the real fort Experience, opposite to the others that are limited to be museums of old ages, Jaisalmer Fort is still alive, and that is because the people still live there, so you can live for yourself how is the life inside the forts with the merchants, the family, the kids and of course the cows walking around.

title: worth a visit
review: Its definitely a must seething to do in jaisalmer, its so intresting to see and understand the intelligence and practicality of historical period. this will amaze you .

title: Beautiful Jain Temple inside
review: I visited Jaisalmer Fortress with Don't Complain Travel. It's a nice "desert fortress", easily accessible and fun to explore - also with a family. I'd like to point out an especially beautiful Jain Temple inside of the fortress.

title: okayish..
review: nothing major to see.. inside.. from the outside looks pretty impressive, but the inside tour can be skipped..there are better things to see in Jaisalmer..

title: Brilliant fort rising out of the desert sands
review: This whole town is dust-swept and sandy, and that's the way it's been for 100's of years. This trading and merchant stop on the old camel routes is a great view into the history of trade, europe, asia and the middle east gives you an excellent insight into what it all would have been like. The fort rises from the sand, surrounded by sandy mudbrick houses and shops and then desert. The fort is in good condition, and is an inspiring sight. It has houses, restaurants shops and hotels inside the hotel, though these can be ignored and the fort appreciated for its historical value. Glad I made the effort and visited.

title: Needs some TLC.
review: I had mixed feelings about this fort, but only because it is overshadowed by the amazing forts of Udaipur, Jodhpur and Jaipur.

title: Very bad show for tourism
review: The fortress is living town for many residents and houses many small hotels. Very poor upkeep due to this. Not worth a place to visit. Muck lying around in the lanes, garbage & open urinals on the way to the famous "view point". Rajasthan Tourism must do something to avoid getting BAD name from foreign tourists.

title: We loved staying in the fort.
review: We stayed at The Surja Guest House in the fort and loved it. Good food good room and great views. Not to be confused with Surya Guesthouse which is next door and more of a backpacker hostel.) Whilst staying at Surja we were invited to a family wedding and had a really marvellous time! The fort is not just historically interesting and beautiful it is still  alive.

title: This is one of the unique forts of india.
review: This must be the only fort in india where people are still staying inside. Fort is open all day, But there are timings for the places inside like jain temple and others.

title: Brilliant and Disturbing
review: Where else can you walk into a living 10th century fort, complete with ancient temples, living bazars, beggars and trades people all trying to make a living. The old fort is truly spectacular and yet because of its age and continuous occupation sometimes disturbing. One of our highlights of  a three week trip. Need a guide inside or you will soon get lst.

title: Sonar Kila - The Golden Fort
review: Made of Sand - an unrealistic world with beautifully crafted havelis and houses.A fort where people still live and streets have that vibe .Can't be compared to other forts which are just conserved to serve as art museums.As a resident of same state I feel amazed at our heritage.

title: Not the Sonar Kella I expected
review: This is not the empty Sonar Kella shown in the movie but 5000 people live in it.

title: Jaisalmere Fortress
review: Great to walk round the battlements--about 5 klm

title: Worth a visit
review: It's the only active fort with residents inside, so the experience is different from other forts throughout Rajasthan that have been converted into tourist sites.

title: What living inside a fort feels like
review: If there were no cows and dung heaps on the stone pathways inside this fort town, it would beat any ancient greek town. inspite of that it's an experience you shouldn't miss. Especially living inside the fort.

title: A sandcastle in the desert
review: What a fantastic place, with the most interesting guide who lived in the fort and was able to show us things away from the main tourist route. The Jain temples were fascinating as were the painted haveli. A shame about the large number of cattle roaming about, especially as I trod in one of their leavings!

title: Great
review: decided to construct house by using yellow stone from there

title: World's only inhabited fort!!
review: not too much about the fort itself but what makes is special is that it is inhabited by over 4000 families. With hotels inside, one a live the dream of staying inside a living fort.

title: loved this fort
review: Wander the streets or have a guide find nooks and crannies with wonderful views. Eat and people watch. Its so much more peaceful here than some other places.

title: nice fort
review: great from outside, nothing special from inside, specially if you compare it with Agra or Jodhpur forts.

title: Jaisalmer Fort - Kudos to the Administration
review: Overall, Jaisalmer is heart warming. Indeed, the fortress is one of a kind. It still has at least a few thousand residents staying within. And that makes it unique and memorable experience. Over the top, you are reminded of bollywood romance. Don't be surprised if you see couples posing together near the cliff where a royal canon is stationed. But, I suggest, be discreet and respect local customs. However, credit is due to the administration where they have been able to maintain the sanctity of the place; sort of a balance between both visitors and residents. You should have absolutely no problem with plenty of options around in case you feel hungry but my impression is that the entire approach and the meandering pathways within the castle are not buggy/stroller friendly. You'd definitely need a good pair of sneakers. Places like this, they need to be absorbed so don't get distracted by the crowds. Immerse yourself in the architecture, views and history of the place. I'd recommend guide specially if you are keen to know the place well but remember haggling is perfectly acceptable.

title: Best fort in Rajasthan
review: Very well preserved, not too crowded, full of life, as it is still inhabited by some 2000 people. Looks like a sandcastle in the dessert

title: Living history
review: Jaisalmer fort is the only fort in India which is still inhabited - so it's the only one which gives you a sense of what it would have been like in its hey day.

title: The only living fort in India
review: The Jaisalmer fort, or the Sonar Qila is built of yellow stone and glistens with a golden color when the sun's rays fall on it. It is the highlight of a visit to Jaisalmer. Walking around the fort's numerous little streets and homes is an experience in itself.

title: Interesting and Informative Guided Tour
review: A local guide is essential if you are to get the most from a visit. Ours was an ex-army sergeant named Kamal and we would thoroughly recommend him.

title: Excellent Visit for Historical Places
review: Museum & Historical things are very nice. It's Really Called "The Golden Fort" as city calls Golden City. It's only the fort where Local Public still lives in this fort & it's take care is still doing by King of Jaisalmer. So very well neat & Cleaned.

title: Revisiting Mewar History
review: Trip to Jaisalmer is incomplete without visitng this fort, its one of the main attractions there. To our surprise there were more than 3000 families staying inside the Fort and though I don't believe it fully was told that these are the descendent of ppl who used to live here during the rulers time. Fort has nice Jain temples and Hindu temple along with a Kings palace (which as typical for all Rajasthan palace, highlight the luxury and care for details during construction). One of the nice thing was Top of Jaisalmer i.e. the top most point in fort, from where one can see the whole city. The view was just too good to miss.

title: Working fort
review: Incredible! The only fort in the land that is still being used today. Tip: don't stay in it - you'll only be adding to the decline of the structure.

title: Royal Feeling
review: Standing at the fort and looking below the city jaisalmer gives the feeling of royal times.

title: Stunning
