review: There is no doubt that wandering through the narrow streets of the fort and looking at the superbly carved golden frontages of the havelis, palaces and temples induces the "wow!" factor but if you choose to pay to go inside the palace you may find it a bit of an anti-climax on the inside. It certainly can't live up to Jodhpur fort from that point of view. Stick to the free bits!

title: A beautiful beautiful fortress
review: Visited this place on my maiden Jaisalmer trip and my fascination for anything ancient has come to fore after just putting a step inside this palace. It's not just BIG, it's beautiful. the architecture is there for everyone to see. If you don't visit this place, you haven't visited Jaisalmer.

title: The residents have spoilt it
review: Such a grand golden fort, and the 1000s of residents and hotels inside it, have left no stone unturned to literally spoil it inside out. Felt bad, filthy and pity roaming inside the fort.

title: "Beautiful!!!!!!!"
review: really nice fort jaiselmer is having........it is well maintained & neat & clean .... we enjoyed while walking in the fort......  :)

title: Jaisalmer
review: Jaisalmer is a  truly wonderful place and the whole state of Ratisthan is amazing. I had no idea of so many temples, forts and palaces and  as I love heritage and history it was also very educational. This Fortress is one of many places to visit, but other towns like Pushkar, Jaipur, Pushkar, Udiapur are all worth while visiting. The other thing which is a culture shock is so many cows everywhere and they take priority and people and cars have to wait for them as they wander along the streets and do their business. It is the Hindu culture

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: Honestly I do not think there is a need to review an attraction such as the Jaisalmer fort, If you go to jaisalmer  you don’t to visit the fort as half of the city lives in the fort.

title: Living city in itself!!
review: This fort is always bustling with activity. From sight seeing to shopping and eating to relaxing, one can do almost about anything here! One does feel the need of a guide to explain the various parts of the fort in detail as there is so much to know about their history. And it is huge, so to cover it entirely one must be ready to walk quite a bit. Its pretty hot during the day, but the night air is a little chilly in December.

title: Not upto expectation
review: Though jaisalmer lived upto our expectations Soneri kila or the jaisalmer fortress wasnt upto the mark..though it looks amazing in sunlight especially at sunset time with its color the highlight The commercialisation and the fact that half of the place is residential has led to filth at many places...bad odour especially spoiling the experience...Forts structure also was not that grand either

title: A living history
review: Live experience of how life inside a fort is. Its buzzing with color and energy. Jain temple is a masterpiece of sculpture. Dont forget to learn about the fossils and purchase habur stone

title: Jaisalmer  fort...Superb
review: The fort gives a very nice view of golden city, the fort is well maintain, with wash room facilities and chips, cold drink, & the history behind this fort is very knowledgeable.

title: As an Indian, average experience
review: Had high hopes for the oldest living fort, etc. But was sorely disappointed when I entered.

title: A living Fortress
review: I have seen many forts in India as well as in European countries, but first time I saw a fort, in which people are still living. Best part is these people do not belong to a royal family, but these people are common man. So these people are still living there. That's why I called this a "Living Fortress". Small part of the fort is still with the king and tourist come to visit that area.

title: Fairytale place
review: This place is incredibly special - a sandcastle mirage in the middle of the Thar Dessert. It doesn't take too long to walk around within the living fort but the old streets are a delight to stroll through and sights include the famous Jain temple complex and the beautiful City Palace.

title: A living and thriving city within the fort
review: Its a huge huge fort that sits atop a hill. The fort has many buildings and havelis inside where locals have been living since the time it was built. There are few tourist attraction within the fort, like Patwano ki haveli and the markets. Other than that, its just narrow lanes with houses on either sides. The fort is spread across a km areas which is very time consuming if exploring on foot.

title: Nice fort, good tour.
review: The fort and the self guided tour was very good. After seeing other fort's in India, this one is not a splendid. Still worth a visit if in town.

title: Nothing Grt
review: entire fort area is now used for shopping or as hotel.. n do not take a guide...u can roam it on your own...just a small piece of land

title: Great fort
review: This fort is very different from many of the forts all across Rajasthan. It is a living fort and you can see people still going about their lives once in side the fort. For a fort that has people living inside it, it is in a great condition. Only problem is that there is too much traffic and noise from vehicles inside the fort. It is still a must if you are in Rajasthan.

title: Get that Audio Guide
review: Well worth getting the Audio Guide.  Makes the  visit interesting and personal as opposed to a Human Guide rushing you through.

title: Medieval feeling
review: Jaisalmer fort feels medieval. With its narrow streets the fort is like some medieval place ful of surprises. Especially if you spend the night inside its walls

title: Going back to the Middle Age
review: The golden fort of Jaisalmer is a wonderful experience. The Jain tample is unique! Really worthwhile.

title: (relatively) traffic free bliss
review: Only a handful of tuk-tuks and motorcycles can be found here, so it's really a small slice of paradise -- so much of India is plagued with thick traffic, at the expense of pedestrians. We actually enjoyed wandering these narrow streets. Especially after dark or in the morning. Very friendly locals. A special place and worth the effort to reach.

title: location is good
review: have people live in the fort very intersting

title: Nice fort!!
review: The golden fort of Jaisalmer is a very nice. Inside the fort you will find Jain temple which is amazing!

title: A city in a city
review: Yes, its a living fort as they call it, a fort which has restaurants, hotels, commercial establishment, tea stall owners and residents who have been staying with families for years.

title: Live fort
review: this is perhaps only fort where about 600 families still live right from the days it was build & ruled by kings of Jaisalmer, there is market of handicrafts, tea stalls, restaurants some of them are run by foreigners, hotels and residence of many, it take you to era of old kings while walking trough narrow lanes, marvelous architecture genius, seen many students still having there projects on these marvel build .....worth visiting

title: Living Fort
review: Jaisalmer fort is only fort in India where people live in. These people are decendents of the rulers and their workers. You can visit the Museum, Jain temple, the two cannons inside the fort. You can see the whole city from the cannon platform.

title: Magnificent
review: The fort is unique in structure, with its sandstone ramparts and double walls.  Gorgeous to look at from a distance and interesting when up close.  This is India, and the fort is inhabited, hence open sewers, cow dung, garbage and touts.  No worse than most other places, and no reason to miss out on the fort's splendour.

title: decent fort - packed with shops and touts
review: It was interesting to see a "living heritage site" - an ancient fort but people still live there today. Plenty of restaurants too. There are several Jain temples, at a fairly steep price you can visit them.

title: cool fort
review: fun to explore around, especially at night.  I thought the locals touted a bit too much.  The scenery over the village was impressive.

title: The only living Fortress.
review: I was extremely thrilled to see people living in those old houses. The old Fain temple was worth a visit. The view of the Jaiselmer city from the fort during the sunset was outstanding.

title: Grandeur at its best !
review: If u want to see grandeur at its best , visit Jaisalmer Fortress. One can not believe on his eyes to see that around 500 families are residing inside the fortress itself. It is a memorable event to watch the Jaisalmer city from roof top of the fortress at sunset. It seems that gold is sprinkled upon the whole city. Mesmerizing moment!

title: Bad tour guide ruined our experience
review: Unfortunately our experience of the fortress was ruined by having a bad tour guide. He didn't interact well with the group and we spent a lot of pointless time waiting in an awful restaurant.

title: Opulence and design.
review: Beautiful structure, great art in design and in the artefacts around. Great to know that someone bought it and restored before opening for visitors.

title: One of its kind
review: Its a unique fort experience and is more than just a sight seeing tourist spot. If you stay inside and spend time chatting with people and sipping tea at one of the multitude of cafes you become part of a civilization that's not changed much in the last 500 years. Yes trappings of modern world - motorcycles / pizzerias / cell phones / etc do spoil the charm but then the people here are most interesting. As usual the government has done little to make the place better. Civic maintenance is horrible - both inside and outside the fort. Its dirt and filth all around. Outside - you do not get even pavements to walk on. The nearby lake could be so much better with better up keep. But, overall - not to be missed..

title: It's different
review: Beautiful art work inside the temple. We hired a guide who showed us 5 Jain temples. It was a different experience. Can get a good view of the city of Jaisalmer from 2 places. The roads are narrow so have to walk carefully. It was interesting to see people living in the fort. One should have lots of time to explore the details of court. It's worth a visit. It gets a bit crowded sometime.

title: A true highlight of our trip!
review: You get a good sense of how one lived in the medieval era. Wonderful atmosphere among the locals, no harassing by beggars. Be careful of the street cows - the streets are narrow and they are big (and wide).

title: Great place to stroll around
review: One of the places that is visible from almost anywhere in Jaisalmer is the Fortress. It is place made only for walking, the lanes and streets are very narrow and no car can go, but watch out for fast moving Scooters and cycles. Watch out for cow-dung all though. There are shops galore selling all kinds of arts, chai, Bhang. Many of the haveli have fantastic looking facade.

title: Nice Fort -- could be maintained better
review: Travellers should note that if you are travelling in a car, you will be stopped in the parking lot, which is approx 1 kms away from the actual fort. From there one can hire a tuk tuk ( auto rickshaw) for approx Rs 60/- and travel upto the fort.

title: Dirty and Awful
review: Its quite surprising how such a great fort has been maintained so badly. There are gutters running in the fort and the whole place was smelling. It felt like i was walking through a garbage dump! They would perhaps do well to take a leaf off Mehrangarh fort, which in comparison... wait there is no comparison!

title: The only living fort in India
review: The Jaisalmer fort is the only fort in India where people still live - there may be other inhabited forts in India but those living there are most probably caretakers - the Jaisalmer fort is inhabited by common citizens. The fort is bustling and there is a lot to see - in particlar the Jain temples. There is also a museum which is average. Take a guide who will explain a lot of the history of Jailsamer to you - but please negotiate a price for the fort as well as the Havelis in one price. Be warned - the place gets extra crowded during the tourist season - particularly mid December to mid January.

title: Desert City
review: Jaisalmer fort is extraordinary, it is so homogenous with the desert it is built from. Magnificient cut stone decorated with wonderful filigree and pattern. The palace museum inside the fort is one of the most beautiful buildings I have ever seen.

title: Impressive and beautiful
review: The only "dislike" is the amount of gypsies inside the entry to the fort.  Too many pushing to sell something that is fake.

title: Great or Dirty : depends on how you look at it
review: Jaisalmer fort is the only fort in India where families are still staying. In some ways therefore it is like the old towns in European cities like Dubrovnik, Prague etc. However it is also very dirty. So you will love it or hate it, depending upon your mindset and perspective. The good parts are the Jain temples (must see with a guide), and the museums. Also the fascinating stones that are used in the fort, and are also available for sale in shops in the fort. The bad bits include the dirt, the two wheelers that run past you, the cows roaming around, and the touts. The combination of the good and bad make it a unique experience. A good guide will ensure you enjoy the tour.

title: Living Fort
review: A Living Fort where people live till date, gives a very good perspective of how people were living inside a self contained area, duly protected by thick walls and soldiers.

title: Sonar Kella
review: True to its name, the fort is worth visiting. it is massive at the outset and the construction is impressive. rarely does one see a living fort, where people live and flourish. yes, it is cramped and  congested. but then that is what it is supposed to be. it is very beautiful and needs about more than three hours to visit. it is commercialized and one needs to guard against getting fooled. buying products in the vicinity is not recommended. a guide is a must. the architecture of the fort and its height is mesmerizing. the fort provides an excellent view of the city. recommended for visit.

title: Impressive Construction
review: I would recommend to visit fort with guide. You need at least 3 hours to visit fort and taking pictures. The Jain temples closes in the morning. If you want to ‘darsan’ at temples then visit in the morning. The stairs in the fort are narrow. You have good city view from top.

title: Commercialised
review: Over exposed to commercialisation, yet interesting place. Audio guides included in entry price so worth the money.

title: Sonar Quila or Jaisalmer Fort is Must See in Jaisalmer!
review: Very old so much to see inside it. Without guide or proper information, this fort going to confuse the visitor. So many shops, even i think house and people live inside the fort complex itself.

title: Golden Fort
review: - Musuem was nice

title: Not upto expectation, but good
review: Being residential fort, it was not as we were expecting (like other forts of Rajasthan).

title: Jaisalmer Fort Visit
review: Walking through lanes and by lanes of the fort is really a soothing and a different type of experience

title: Different kind of fort
review: Unlike other forts in India, this fort is lived in by locals (apparently about 2000 people live here) as well as has lots of guesthouses/hotels with rooftop restaurants. The fort has a Hindu temple and a Jain temple to visit. You can do a lot of shopping in here but beware, prices are much higher and the shop owners will pull you in offering you items for 100 rupees (however everything is more expensive than this). Possibly worth buying outside of the fort and going into the fort to enjoy walking around and having drinks and dinner at the rooftop restaurants to watch the sunset.

title: Very large and habitable fort
review: The fort is very big and requires good amount of time to see the same. The Kings and Queen's palaces are very well maintained and has similarity with other palaces in Rajasthan. The fort is golden in colour and the famous Satyajit Roy's Bengali Movie "Sonar Kella" was made in this fort.

title: A living in fort
review: One fort in India people stil occupy the houses. Too many tourists and so some time it becomes difficult to appreciate the lovely carvings. The old Mahraja's residence has been converted into a museum. Cery colourful with all shops inside.

title: Poor man's fort.
review: After seeing so many excellent forts in Rajasthan, this fort was a let down. Over crowding. Squatters. Narrow lanes. Even the king's and queen's quarters are small.

title: Only living fort in India with a beautiful Jain temple
review: The fort is very big and requires good amount of time to see the same. The Fort is crowded and most of the passages were narrow.

title: nice
review: very different fort between Jodhpur.

title: Only Living Fort in India
review: The Fort is nice, but most of the residences are converted into guest houses and hotels now. Though its one of its kind experience for staying in the living fort.

title: A living Fort of Brahmins n Rajputs
review: Beautiful golden fort made of sandstone n habur rock both found only in Rajasthan n known for various medicinal properties,also people here set curds in this stone without any bacteria culture n drink water in the glasses made of these stones.part of fort which has ticket is clean n preserved but otherwise watch ur steps as ul bang into cows n cow dung .Fort is the hub of all activities ,good places to eat n German bakery serves good filter coffee n apple pie n sandwiches.

title: Unique but chaotic
review: People still live in the fort which truly makes it unique. The sheer chaos of bikes and auto-rickshaws honking can be frustrating.

title: Heritage preserved
review: I appriciate the heritage preserved in the 600 year old Jain temples at the jaisalmer fort. Advice : please confirm the temple opening / closing time before you leave from hotel

title: only living fort
review: jaisalmer fort is only living fo, and really nice place to visit , to stay there, nice and clean  roads, u can find hawelis, lods of hotels, mandir, museum inside, I would suggest to stay inside the fort to have a feel of the fort

title: Fort and Jain Temple
review: The Fort was crowded and most of the passages were narrow. Took quite a bit of time to cover the entire Palace. The Jain Temples where quite good.

title: Fort damaged by habitation and commerce
review: PROS

title: poor state of maintanence
review: such a huge fort being encroached by locales to carry out commercial activities. Was disheartened to find this fort being neglected

title: good place..
review: Very nice and interesting place to sightseeing. A lot of restaurants and hotels inside that's why the better options is stay outside fort. Overall Fort is beautiful ..Streets are the usual narrow, cow-infested alleys, yet you can hardly find a place to look down from the ramparts

title: Very nice place
review: Very nice and interesting   place to sightseeing.

title: attractive living fort.
review: The fort is attractive and  impressive from a distance and makes jaisalmer attractive.It is basically the old town,but high up.There is no charge,its  a living fort,part of the town.Once you are up past the entrance gates you are in a maze of narrow streets but apart from the occasional access to the ramparts ,with a cannon here and there, and some views from rooftop restaurants its a matter of tourist shops and separate attractions such as the jain temples (which now has a hefty charge) and the palace which is quite small.

title: You will just fall in love with this place!
review: Again, you will just fall in love with this place.. As soon as we entered the fort entrance we were amazed by this structure and the huge structure, and as soon as we went into the fort area which was open for tourists, we just fell in love with this place. In fact we started regretting that we did not stay in a hotel inside the fort complex.

title: Walk the Ramparts...
review: Jaisalmer truly is the Golden City... the havelis and fort area are truly stunning and great to walk around, if somewhat crowded with tour groups.

title: the fortress is beautiful when you see from a distance ....
review: The fortress is royally spoiled by people who live inside the fort . The fort is now full of hotels , restaurent , shops . the place is highly commercialized .

title: Great History
review: Good art work, Old statues of Jain tirthankar's. Local transport was well setup. I did not like the price difference for Indians and Foreigners. Price should be for activity not based on your origin. Stay away from the sellers of the old historic valuables.

title: Sonar Kella
review: The external view is simply majestic, however inside the ambience has been destroyed by putting up a large number of  shops and residences.

title: Very nice old town of Jaisalmer
review: Very nice old town of Jaisalmer with a lot of shops. The fort is very impressive. Try to avoid tourist guides. You will not need them.

title: Living fort
review: The jaisalmer fort is the only living fort in rajasthan as people actually stay inside the fort. The fort has 2 main areas to visit ..one is the museum which has awesome collection of old artifacts and the other one is the jain temple which is famous for its architecture.

title: One of the better forts we visited
review: Jaisalmer Fortress is more of a working town then a fortress,you tour around in a market obviously focussing on touristy time things but also food and a variety of other things. You have your normal thing walls cannons etc but it is more a market experience which we enjoyed. Fort is Huge and dominates the skyline when goin into Jaisalmer.

title: Beautiful
review: The fort is totally free to enter and fascinating to wander round. It is not large enough to worry about getting lost, you simply backtrack. The havelis are amazing with there intricate carved features. Dont bother about museums, just visit some that are now hotels. There are plenty of restaurants and guest houses to suit all budgets, and you feel part of a community due to the thousands living within the fort. One of the nicest places in India well worth going out of your way for.

title: Magnificent Fortress
review: Fabulous structure and beautiful temples inside. The fort is still home to many thousands of people. Unlike may other forts and palaces in Rajasthan there is relatively little to see inside.

title: Fab fort but tourtist trap
review: 99 bastions. Working fort with lots of alleyways. Very clean!!! Huge tourist trap - prices inflated. one guy said to me 'You look like you need some help in spending your money, Please allow me the privilege of ripping you off!!"

title: The living fort
review: The fort is very beautiful. It has 2 areas 7 Jain temples and a museum. The Jain temple are worth seeing. The museum houses the usual stuff as is expected. The museum is big and one has to walk a lot. The top of the fort gives a lovely view of the city......Its worth visiting if one wants to see the history of Jaisalmer. There are guides available for around Rs.100-200.....make sure to bargain....

title: Loved it!!
review: It's grand, fortress is built out of yellow sandstone, beautiful architecture.

title: Bello
review: The architecture is extroidinary and you can imagine the days where the elephants wandered freely.Lit up at night is a sight for sore eyes.

title: I Love this City and Fort
review: the living fort unbelievable

title: Only living fortress in India.
review: Narrow alleys, very dirty. Castle itself OK. Good

title: You can spend so much time here - it's awesome!
review: People are still living in the fort, the architecture gets intricate and amazing in some locations, you can find some really cheap and amazing artsy pieces and the rooftop restaurants ROCK!  We visited rooftop after rooftop between fort sites - grabbed lime sodas each time.  Views are gorgeous.

title: amazing stone work
review: jaisalmer, also known as golden city due to golden stone and the works on these stone is amazing. the stone work made my heart to build my house in that golden stone with finishing of that art. one must go to jaisalmer to see stone work and culture of rajasthan. The fort is built on a small hills and at the top of fort wind was amazing....... love the jaisalmer stone art work.

title: NICE EXPEREINCE
review: The fort is lovely and looks grand. The best part is that people live in the fort and the museum, the temple and the overall experience is good. Cleanliness needs to be improved so that the experience is more beautiful.

title: Beautiful... its stunning
review: It is a golden fort in the desert town of Jaisalmer. This fort is gorgeous. It can be seen from the town and really looks stunning. There is an entire township inside the fort. The places to see here are the museum, the palaces and the Jain temples. There are small lanes inside the fort with lots of shopping options( very costly though) please dont do any big shopping here. There are lots of rooftop restaurants inside to have food. It will take atleast 2-3 hours to cover the visit so plan accordingly. There are lot of places from where you can take nice photographs of the fort. It lookes amazing both in day as well as at night. The museum also has an audio guide for the visitors. There are some point from where you can see the town view. It is one of the must visit places when in Jaisalmer.

title: "Sonar Kella"
review: In one word 'Majestic'. Every Bengali child who is a great fan of Late Satyajit Ray and his novels and movies, has to be a great fan of 'Sonar Kella' too. I am not an exception either. When I first saw The fortress in front of my eyes for the first time, it seems like one of my childhood dreams has finally came true. Now the fortress itself became a shopping and residing spot. But overall a very satisfying tour of the whole fortress.

title: Not Impressive
review: After visiting the forts at Kumbhalgarh and Jodhpur, Jaisalmer fort was nothing much to write home about. It may be due to the reason that a large part of the fort is lived-in and cleanliness is lacking. Quite a few areas have a stench and maintenance is not up to the mark. ASI or the relevant authorities seem to negligent.

title: Awesome fort .... No where else
review: Built in 1155 AD.

title: Desert wonder
review: This is apparently the only lived in fort in the world. Crazy little winding streets with little shops and markets and a few restaurants. You can imagine times gone by.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: Superb sculptures madeout of yellow stones, the Jain temple is good, the city view from the top is amazing , they say the population is only 50000 but looking at the city view looks much larger than that . The various attire collection, small armoury collection of the kings who ruled.The guide was excellent but not very organised like Jodhpur fort guide service.

title: A Fascinating Place to Visit
review: We decided to spend an afternoon walking around the Fortress. In view of the size and different temples and other interesting buildings inside, also the magnificent views of the city from different locations,we had to return the next day to explore some more.

title: Nowhere else you cant find it
review: This is the place which is 8th wonder on this earth . when you see this you dont have words t o speak . seriously its 8th wonder .

title: Explore it!
review: It's really nice to walk through all the narrow alleys with all their shops and people who live there. Go and see some shops and probably buy something. But don't forget to bargain!

title: nice...
review: Nice fort... worth a visit, but definitely not as grand or well maintained as some other Forts and Palaces in Rajasthan. Too much litter.. far too many commercial establishments...

title: Stunning!!
review: The forts across Rajasthan are a sight to behold. Each one a unique experience in itself.This is no different and is a must visit.

title: Carelessness
review: Its not maintained, waste like used water bottles and poly bags are lying inside the fort area and not taken care of the valuable and beautiful art and architecture.

title: get lost!
review: Spent several days going back and exploring all the winding paths. You will always find something new if you take your time and stop to talk to the people living there. Reminded me of Fez.

title: Photo Opportunity
review: I went to the Fort 4 times as I just loved it - the people living there are great.  My photos are fabulous!!

title: fascinating! living fort!
review: In all my travels I have never seen anything quite like this - a living fort! So much history, so much culture, so many artifacts, yet it is still actively being used and lived in til this day...it is fascinating seeing this, witnessing this....seeing clearly the strain it is putting on the fort and how the fort is sinking. It is a delight to walk through...to experience architecture, the shops, the restaurants, the views of the city below. A absolute must see - do not miss! Try to stay at one of the havelis inside the fort for a special and unique experience!

title: Straight out of the Arabian Nights Tales
review: This is one of the most spectacular forts I have ever seen. Surrounded on all directions by desert. the Fort is located on top of a hillock with the entire town surrounding it. The population must be around 30-35000 and is not very congested. The fort is even more beautiful at night. You can spend hours and hours just roaming around the fort on foot.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: Not that much attractive as compared to the forts of chittorgarh & Jodhpur It is attractive just from outside only.There are no indicators which show the path from where to enter and where to exit.

title: kila in desert
review: to have a big killa with inside city is a unique feature of this city . the yellow stnes are just put so nicely that it has given  surprising stenght to this structure

title: Shadows of the past
review: There are numerous businesses outside the fortress, but staying

title: FOR ART LOVERS
review: At jaisalmer fortress ,in market, Near the city-view place ,There is a painter named "Mr Ramswaroup Rao" if you are a real art lover please visit his shop(his little art gallery) you will find his amazing paintings. A very great artist who has created beautiful paintings.you will love his art,his paintings .I've spent time with him near one hour & found him as a very beautiful hearted person.a very good artist but he has not got his platfrom ,So if u really are a art lover ,go and visit his small shop. You will really find it interesting.

title: Sonar Kella...!!!
review: The name aptly given by Great Satyajit Ray for this age old fortress...it looks golden and captivating at the time of Sunrise and Sun down...it is the only fort in the world with a hustling bustling population living inside it...fort is full of grand havellis... Bazaars...narrow lanes...honking bikers and many hotels and restaurants...old culture still prevails inside the fort...fort also houses some architectural delight in the form of Hindu and Jain temples...we found some small shops selling amazing art pieces...you must hire the services of a guide to enjoy the place to its utmost...view from the top is amazing...it took us approximately four hours to cover the fort...all has to be done by foot...an early morning visit will let you have the fort to explore by yourself away from the crowd ... An awesome example of Rajput Glory... The Golden Fort...Sonar Kella...!!!

title: quite nice, but no must see
review: The fort in Jaisalmer is quite nice and pretty. But after seeing a few forts all over Northern India, Jaisalmer Fort appears a little small and less impressive (particularly when you see Jaisalmer Fortress after the amazing fort in Jodhpur). However, it is nice to spend a couples of hours there if you are already in Jaisalmer. But I wouldn't consider the Fortress as a must see.

title: Great
review: In the chowk of the fort. Must Visit. All the old Haveli surrounding the place are picturesque. Staying in the fort area will give you memorable experience.

title: Good go late in the day
review: We enjoyed the fort, the fact that its a working fort, people live and run shops within it.  We went the first time in the afternoon and were hardly bothered by shop owners, we went the following morning and found people hassled us more and there were a lot more people there.

title: Reasonable
review: I don't think it's one of the most impressive forts in Rajasthan but perhaps if I had seen this one first my opinion might have been different.  Like many places in India, it can get crowded.  However, it's worth at least a 45 minute visit...more if you like strolling through its small alley ways and bazaars.

title: The living fort
review: The Jain temples inside are a must visit and numerous lanes with shops lined up make it very unique place

title: Sonar Kella
review: Too crowded. But if you ignore the crowd and consider the architecture, you won't be disappointed. Be aware of touts and shopkeepers at every corner.

title: A living fort
review: It's quaint, clean and quite beautiful. The cobbled lanes are lined with shops selling colourful clothes and craft items. You can spend hours wandering around, drinking coffee in the rooftop cafes with their spectacular views and browsing through the palace museum.

title: Back in time!
review: The place was like the clock had stopped. Surprisingly the alleys were very clean and well maintained

title: Visit to the fort with family
review: Great experience. The fort is massive from outside and within. we hired a local guide and it turned out to be a good experience. He was knowledgeable and guided us through the jain temple, laxminath temple, raja and rani palaces, shopping in the fort as well. This is a live fort as people continue to live within but at the same time, this is highly commercial with restaurants, shops all along the fort.

title: Beware of Fake people.....
review: Had a very bad Experience with this shop called SHREE ART PALACE owned by Mukesh Karwa(09414244089). It is on right side of First Gate of Jaisalmer Fort. DO NOT buy anything from this shop especially by prepaying and asking them to transport it later.You will be cheated for SURE.

title: First fort in my Life time where half of City leave
review: Great fort - Fort Interior . Very unique fort where half of Jaisalmer stay in fort and they have their houses in the fort and some person change there house in hotel . they provide rooms on very good price but unfortunately booked with Mandir Palace and these fort hotel are cheap and much better than mandir Palace

title: Sonar kella
review: Ever since childhood I dreamt of visiting Sonar Kella after seeing Mr. Satyajit Ray's film. On October 2013 my dreamt came true and I could not belief my eyes. There are many hotels inside the fort and one should stay to get an experience the fort.

title: Highlight of the city
review: This giant golden sandcastle was an amazing place to explore with stunning views over the city. A must see for anyone visiting.

title: good place to shop
review: very good place to see the sunset and many shops very beautiful Alibaba trousers. we spend two nights there watching the sunset. It is really beautiful.

title: Golden Fort
review: The Jain temple inside the fort is worth a visit, the fort itself is filled with narrow alleys and stalls, views of Jaisalmer and surrounds. Have a beer or a gin and tonic on a rooftop restaurant and watch the sunset...marvellous!

title: Don't miss it
review: it's the best thing to do in Jaisalmer besides the tour on the desert. There are many nice shops with real handmade things, some kind of clothes and quilts that i didn't find in Delhi, for example. We can feel the gypsy culture that remains until today, what gives a special feature to this place.

title: Too good
review: Jaisalmer Fortress was simply one of the best places I visited.The fort has temples, shops, hotels and restaurants inside. It is a very good place to shop as well. The Jain temple inside the fort is worth the visit. You can go to any of the roof top restaurant and will be able to get some amazing view of the city. The whole fort is built using sand stone and it is a real beauty. If you are visiting Jaisalmer, the Thar desert safari is a must go.

title: A Must-Visit!!!
review: While Jaisalmer Fortress is worth a visit, the fort at Jodhpur offers pieces of rich history more precisely and vividly!

title: Dirty area with commercials
review: The fort is now a more commercial stree with hawkers, vendors and Bat smell everywhere. The lusture of fort is not there, only the architecture from outside is worth looking at.

title: Jaisalmer
review: On my visit to India  (7 different cities) I could say that Jaisalmer is the most clean one. Their people really take care of it and try to maintain it as neat as possible. Is very easy to purchase a tour to the desert and is totally worth it!

title: Great place, very interesting day (or two!) out..
review: Really interesting place, containing many nice little rooftop restaurants, where you can have a cup of tea and admire the view.... plenty of shops selling various cloth as well and of course people living inside the fort.

title: wonderful city
review: the services rendered by total staff were ver excelent we will certainlly advice our connecteants to have stay in your hotel food was delicious with regards mrs mr p h joshi and mrs mr shrikant mokasdar room nos 104 107

title: Exquisite!
review: A living fort. Try and get Arun Purohit as your guide, for a trip that will be personalised and memorable!

title: a fantastic trip to silk route times
review: walking and seeing by the jaisalmer street's fort could transport you easily to the silk route times. Amaizing, unforgettable, special, magic, this city is one of the 'things' more diferent and spectacular I've ever seen in my trips.

title: Pretty cool, but the shops are annoying
review: Jaisalmer for was pretty rad, but the shops really are a double edged sword. While it's cool that all the little spaces are open with traders selling their wares, getting harassed while you're just trying to wander round is a massive pain and detracts from the experience.

title: JAISALMER FORT - A NEGLECTED BEAUTY
review: A wonderful rustic beauty but thoroughly neglected and manhandled by the people around as it is a living fort but puts you off by its present state. Feel saddened by the state it is in today

title: Great architecture but filled with touts
review: It is a beautiful fortress and the architecture is marvelous but it is in such a bad shape. The building is completely dilapidated and its beauty is totally ruined by the encroachment of touts.  People are living inside the fort and you feel like you are trespassing in somebody’s house. It was intriguing but very sad to see it in such a poor condition. The shops and temples inside are really nothing special. But for the unique experience of looking at people living and businesses thriving inside a fort, this one is definitely fascinating.

title: Majestic Fort
review: You will not help noticing how people can live inside palace. Approx1/4 popluation of Jaialmer leaves inside this palace and you can find many hostels and guesthouse inside it. BEautiful Rani - Raja ka Mahal

title: nice
review: the amazing living fort - feels like you are amongst history books. good shopping inside the fortress as well . the museum though can be better maintained

title: Old fort with a 'Filmy' touch
review: The fort was in quite good shape. Its great view along with its association with the masterpiece 'Sonar Kella' by Satyajit Ray made the visit a memorable one.

title: Best fort we have seen in India
review: We kept hearing how Agra fort was the best in India and we didnt find it particularly special so were werent too optimistic about the other forts we had planned to see. However, Jaisalmer fort is easily in my opinion the best in India. It is visually stunning on both the inside and the outside and the intricate designs on many of the buildings are beautiful. You can get some great views looking out over the city from inside and you can easily spend a couple of hours wandering around the streets.

title: Wonderful
review: You feel like a trip to the past. Nice people and wonderful sights of the city. The havelis is a must of old architecture!

title: Trip to Jaisalmer
review: Has a wonderful 2 day trip to Jaisalmer. It sure is one unique place to go to ... it is so mesmerizing to see this great fort coming out of sand plains all around. Tells you the whole story of an era gone past. The conservation of the Sand castle - must be a focus as many generations after us may not see this. I am told that two of the 100 bastions have already begun to fall due to drainage problems. Hope some one takes care of this ... We also had a Camp stay that was really out of the busy world we live in - serene, quiet and peaceful surroundings are so refreshing ...

title: A dream come true
review: My friend and I were in Jodhpur and was supposed to take the train from there to Jaisalmer.  We had been travelling by train since we started our tour and thought of rather getting a car.  We contacted friends who travelled through Rajasthan before and they gave us the phone number of Vimal Ballani of Royal Luxury tours.  He has an office inside the fort.  He was very helpful and sent a car with a very reliant driver to fetch us.  Arriving in Jaisalmer, Mr Ballani was waiting for us at the fort.  How wonderful it was to have someone who went out of his way to assist us in whatever we needed and wanted to know.  Staying in the fort was like a dream come true.  We had a very interesting trip to the desert arranged by Mr Ballani.  I loved every minute and will definitely go back and stay for much longer.

title: A wonderful place
review: a lovely place to visit in winter. a lovely jain temple and good view.you will have good experience to roam around.

title: A living fort
review: This fort is called the living fort and it sure breathes and exudes a lot of character. It's amazing to walk through the fortress and see the routine life of the locals unfold. Although we walked around as tourists, watching a boy brush his teeth on his front porch completely unfazed by us gawkers was fun! :-) A very different experience from the typical palaces and museums with the guards and somber signs keeping us away as we get channelled around.

title: A wonderful location!
review: A lovely place, walk it all. Give sellers short shrift of you'll be beseiged, however most of then are very good-natured. The Jain temples are expensive to view and I got bored with them after 10 minutes. They are only after your money for photographing the various shrines inside.

title: Full of History
review: Amazing place. Do check every nook and corner and learn everything you can from the guides there. They explain everything so well. Outside the Fort, you'll find shops where people sell traditional turbans, clothes, Jholas (cloth bags) and musical instruments.

title: Stay for a few days and explore!
review: We stayed inside the fort for three nights, wedged around a desert camp stay and a camel ride to the sunset on the Thar Desert. Poke around the alleys of the fort and talk to the friendly shopkeepers. Though mildly aggressive, they'll invite you in for tea and won't object (too strenuously) if you leave without buying. Savor the wonderful food in the many rooftop restaurants, and spend time talking to the locals. Incredible place, wonderful people, fabulous culture, history and food.

title: Jaisalmer
review: One of the final stops of the Marco Polo Silk Road. An incredible walled town suddenly raising up on a hill in the middle of the desert. Embroideries cut in sand stone to build houses. I went there several times since the 80's; not to be missed the possibility to lodge in one of the houses in the fortress. The word "romantic" is not enough to describe. From there, once, I witnessed a sand storm slowly "eating" everything except for the upper fortress where I was. It is not an attraction for a few hours visit; several days are a must, absolutely with no hurry, to absorb the real atmosphere of the place.

title: Straight out of a movie set
review: Perhaps go for the experience of visiting a fortress that is still inhabited and doing business besides the tourist business.

title: Gold everywhere!
review: A very spacious and beautiful fort full of temples and ramparts and houses all built from the same yellowish stones that comprise a mass of golden color, from which also comes Jaisalmer's nickname - the Golden City. It's very relaxing and enjoyable to roam around the little streets within the fort. During sunny days (that is, almost most of the time) it can get very hot and it is advisable to bring a hat or umbrella against the scorching sun. In the middle of August it is possible to catch also some rainy days, when the entrance to the Fort turns into a rapid stream of rain water coming from the upper streets and squares. Overall, this visit was a nice experience and it is worth to see this marvel.

title: Bustling with activity
review: The place is full of activity. The palace and fort are a good sight. The view from top of the fort is a must see.

title: good
review: just good but nothing different. the jaisalmer fort houses multiple hotels and shops inside . therefore it is more of a shopping experince

title: A must in India
review: Really nice fortress, one of my favorites in India. There are still people living in there so it's not just the typical fortress.

title: Wonderful fortress and city
review: Great atmosphere in the city, peaceful atmosphere after the rush of other tourist places. take the time to enjoy a stroll through the streets of the fort and the city

title: Unlike any other fort. The entire city is situated inside the fort
review: Jaisaler fortress is not very well maintained. Maybe because there is still an entire city that thrives inside the fort walls. Hardly any space to walk but there are cows, bikes, scooters, cycles and even 3-wheelers driving inside the fort premises.

title: Huge and Well Done
review: This is also a must see fort and hear to the stories. Very majestic and huge. You will take atleast 3 hours to cover the entire fort.

title: Can spend a day here, easily
review: Lots to shop, so much to see and know, many eateries, very good view points (near the Canon, from the top of the palace). Can be hectic on sunny days which is usually the case. Quite walk-able from any place within the city.

title: Inhabited fort - no cars
review: This sandstone gem dominating the landscape of Jaisalmer is probably the only inhabited fort in Rajasthan unlike most of the others which are museums.

title: jaisalmer do's n donts
review: This is all about what not to do so that you dont spend your money on meaningless things.

title: 'Jaisalmer Fort is a best  living fort in india'
review: t's an extraordinary, resonant experience to wander around the lanes inside this animated museum. The fort walls provide superb views over the old city and surrounding desert - it's especially enchanting to stroll around the outer fort ramparts at sunset or at night, when it's lit up under a clear sky full of stars.

title: Pretty, but a total tourist trap!
review: When we were arriving by autorickshaw up into the Jaisalmer Fort, I suddenly realised we were trapped, like tourists in a fishbowl. Immediately the rickshaw driver tried to get us to arrange to use him for all our transport, and on our way to our hotel someone tried to lead us astray, presumably to another hotel than the one we were heading for.

title: Awesome
review: This is the only fort in world where people are living in. This a alive fort. Really nice to see the old world and india culture. Give completely different feeling

title: A Bit Confusing But Worth A Visit
review: It is a "living" fort so people actually live there still.  I thought that would be interesting to see since most forts you visit are solely tourist attractions, but I found it utterly confusing.  I always felt like I was about to walk into someone's home accidentally.  It had some beautiful views of the city and desert though.

title: It was fun getting lost here, beautiful fort!
review: This was a beautiful fort. Entering was a bit busy, lots of people selling & advertising, but once you are in you can just wander around. People still live there which is beautiful. You get lost wandering through, running into little shops and sights to see from the outside of the fort. Very beautiful and you must visit :)

title: must visit - nice fort
review: all things in Jaisalmer fort is very good....so big "MAHAL" and also museum... it represents a great Indian culture..

title: Awesome Fortress
review: I really enjoyed wandering around the fortress getting little trinkets, a massage and listening to local music and seeing the odd street performance.  An excellent experience

title: A Living Fort
review: Jaisalmer Fort is simply amazing. You can spend a LOT of time exploring! It is a living fort with thousands of people living within the it's walls. There are some great little cafes & restaurants, plenty of shopping options, the Palace Museum, and a myriad of amazing & colourful narrow lanes to discover. There are some breathtaking views of the city & the surrounding countryside. If you are in Rajasthan and you love it's history, culture & people, then do not miss this brilliant link to this part of the World's exotic past.

title: Living history
review: Beautiful from a far and fascinating at close quarters, this unique fort is a slice of living history.  Wander the small streets admiring the havelis and just observing daily life in an Indian town. Look out for the beautiful wall paintings and Jain Temple.

title: Beautiful living fort - over 4,000 people live here!
review: We toured the 7Jain Temples which are inside the fort and very beautiful.  Go early as they close at noon and are only open to the public during the morning.  The Jain religion is very ingesting and an offshoot of Hinduism.  We did not take a guide but did talk to someone of the Jain faith who explained it to us.

title: an antique!
review: The architecture is breathtaking, with every breath I could only feel proud for the builders! The ancestry of this fort is complicated, as I had heard different versions from different guides. Part of it is museum where you can see some preserved furniture, utensils and the famous shatranj (pasha) played in Mahabharata. If you are a photographer, tripod is a must. This fort is in between residential area, not like other forts in Jaipur or Jodhpur.You will also get to see the local and vibrant life of Jaisalmer.

title: A must visit in Jaisalmer
review: Jaisalmer Fort is the main tourist attraction in the Jaisalmer. I personally loved the city view that I got from the top of the Fort.

title: sonar Fort
review: view of sonar fort is just like a gold at first ray of sunlight.

title: you will some good street views
review: the houses and the streets are good...but there could be a little more cleanliness..and more than the dwellers it's the tourists who are dirtying the place

title: A Place to be in Spare Time
review: The Fort is under restoration currently and is likely to ready for tourists in the coming season. The markets around are interesting including some local village craft, leather goods, ladies Lakh bangles and some street food in variety of restaurants at walkable distance. Was glad to see two ATS of State Bank of India and ICICI Bank.

title: One of the most authentic fortress in Rajasthan
review: One of the most authentic fortress in Rajasthan. The only one still inhabited where you can find hotels guesthouses restaurants handicraft shops.

title: Sonar kella
review: Its real golden and glows ...u can see this from all part of the city...A real life experience of how life in a fort could be...Shopping, eating and tour all in one place...The little tibet is a must visit for its yummy momos....

title: Probably the best fort in India...
review: and for a country full of forts, that's a mighty achievement! I love it becuase it is living... people live and work here so you see people going about their daily business, local kids playing cricket. It's full of haveli's all immacutely looked after. The jain temples within the fort are just incredible too.

title: not maintained
review: not at all maintained and filth every where , these forst are our heritage and glory of our past but this is apathy of our country that we cant keep them sutain for long time. This forts had made a pile of debris, its filth verey where you got to part of fort.

title: A fortress built in 17th century in inhabited with locales.
review: The only fort in the world where locals live. There's a beautiful Jain Temple inside the fort and locals have opened shops, hotels & restaurants inside the fortress. The fortress is built over an area of 5 sq km and is visible from every corner of the city.

title: Good views from high observatories
review: A huge Fort with many observatories points. Great for day and night pictures. Different from some other forts, people still living there what give a special scenario to the fort. You can also stay inside the fort, there are many haveli/guesthouse there.

title: Superb
review: Only Habitat fortress in the world lot of places to shop and explore amazing View from the top so many hotels, temples, museums loved it completely also don't miss the Gyan Bhandar at the jain temple

title: An imposing building over looking the town
review: The fort is almost like a city within a city. There are about two hundred families living within the walls of this imposing building. There are many streets full of homes, bazaars and temples, the Jain temple is well worth a visit, with an ample supply of restaurants. Some of these restaurants can be found up many steps which can give splendid panoramas of the city and the Thar desert beyond. Even just a drink at one of these restaurants in the early evening can give wonderful views of the sunset. The streets in the fort are very narrow and can be quite tricky if a cow is coming towards you!

title: The World's Most Populated Fort
review: Amazing place - it is the most populated fort in the world.   Really interesting to walk through town, temples and shops.

title: the golden city
review: Jaisalmer is incredibily beautiful and incredibily dirty.

title: Shonar Kella....a dream come true
review: Have had a life-time wish of visiting this place...a childhood dream after watching the great Satyajit Ray classic "Shonar Kella"....and this place was worth it...absolutely wonderful place...take your time and go around both within and outside the fort...

title: Sonar killa
review: Jaisalmer Fort is one of the biggest forts in the India which was built in 1156 AD by the Bhati Rajput ruler Rao Jaisal. The fort stands proudly, on Trikuta Hill. It is built with local yellow sandstone for this reason, it is also known as the "Golden Fort".This fort, popularly known as the 'Sonar quila'

title: A live fort one of only in India People live in this fort
review: Excellent carving in the golden yellow jaisalmer stone. The jain temples are wonderful. Also the palace interiors with paintings & all

title: Must See Place
review: We have been to Jaisalmer and I just like the city, the fort absolutely is a must see over there and if you are interested in photos make sure you go there early morning as the fort shines like Gold which is amazing to see, I was more impressed with the city though quite calm and the best thing you can see the entire city as its just 7 km radius

title: Jodhpur's fort is 100x better!
review: This fort is okay, but it's just filled with hotels, shops, and people harassing you with false friendships in annoying attempts to get you to spend your money. Alternatively, visit Jodhpur instead! Jodhpur's fort comes with a complimentary interesting audio tour, whereas Jaisalmer's fort is just irritating.

title: FORT WHICH IS ALIVE !
review: This is a breathtakingly beautiful palace and fort,in fact the only fort which is alive today,There are people who are living in this fort for generations.These residences were given to their ancestors by the thne King and since then they  hav e been living there !Certain parts of fort has been preserved as museum for arms and ammunitions of earstwhile era.THE fort has many sections and they are very beautiful.Local guides are available and they are of great use.The fort is so imposing and right in the middle of the city that you can see the fort from any part of the city.A MUST IF YOU ARE GOING TO JAISALMER.You will need  3 to 4 hours to see this entire monument.

title: Absolutely breathtaking
review: It was soo beautiful, truly a sonar kella (golden castle) as Satyajit Ray put it. The castle inside the fort was also nice, bustling with activities and life.

title: Living Fortress
review: one comes across many fortresses that open in the morning and close by sunset. But this is one fortress that lives even after centuries. You find temples where devotees worship daily, houses in which people reside, hotels where tourists stay, restaurants, shops and all signs of living in this small fortress with the royal quarters now a museum. A small but lovely and lively enchanting fortress.

title: Fascinating place
review: We stayed at Garh Jaisal which is actually within the fort so it was great to be able to explore.  The Jain Temple was especially interesting.

title: Overall an average experience
review: The hotels and commercialization inside fort have ruined the really beauty and meaning of fort!!! Overall- it was a good experience!

title: Fascinating......
review: We stayed with in the fortress walls so really got a good taste of how it must have been years ago living life in this close knit community. There is a definite mass tourist chaos during the day but staying local gave us the opportunity to see early morning and evening local life. Nice restaurants and hotels, guest houses available and the palace is well worth a visit.

title: Great
review: The Only Fort wid a City like environment and people living in it like any other city. People driving inside almost any of the vehicals and lots of shops and residential houses in it. Gud to see in the morning when a no. of ancient temples are open to see and enjoy

title: good
review: the fort is beatifull!!! in summer is a little bit hot!! but just in the midday! Its nice to see the sunrise because there is noone \in the street!!

title: Living fortress
review: This is quite a spectacular Living fortress.... It is dirty, thanks to the population living inside, but none the less, the history and the monument itself is very nice. A definite must visit when in Jaisalmer. There are some beautiful views from some heights.

title: a bit too touristic... but clean, nice...lovely!
review: Jaisalmer has converted in a very touristic place. I have been there 12 years ago... and now back. But, who can blame it? It's a fantastic place to spend a few days!

title: Living fortress
review: View from the ramparts is only a small reason to visit. The living fortress has its own charm with the hustle and bustle inside. Jain temple inside is fantastic ( note they close by 12.30 or so).

title: different from other
review: its good to see local people leaving in the palace but they need to maintain the cleanliness , apart from that its colorful .

title: Fun experience - One of the highlights of Jaisalmer.
review: This fort is fun to visit as it is strewn with Havelis & a variety of small shops and has a real buzz. Narrow walkways with friendly shopkeepers who are not over pushy like in a lot of other areas. It is worth trying to get to the top of one of the hotels within the walls as the views are great.

title: Magnificent
review: the fortress is very well conservated, loads of sinuous little streets with shops, magnificent havelis and other buldings, it is amazing!!

title: A living fort but for how long?
review: This is a most fascinating of places; its a living fort with families, shops, restaurants all jostling for space and making a living.  It's noisy in parts and very unclean, the incongruity between ancient Rajasthan, Jain Havelis and brash Australian bars, pizza restaurants is disturbing to say the least. No attempt appears to be made to reserve the heritage.

title: Amazing
review: Astonished that this is the only palace in India, wherein people live inside the fortress. From hotels to restaurants it is a town in itself.

title: An imposing Place
review: Entering the fort gates in like stepping into a theatre where so much is happening. Colourful stalls, hawkers, acrobats, cows, people, bikes all jostling together.  The fort had wonderful views across the desert as well as interesting rooms.

title: Like in a fairytale
review: Absolutly stunning, a place to take your time and enjoy every spot. Jaisalmer is by far the best of India. It's not so easy to get to Jaisalmer, but once you get there, you will not want to leave. It's like going back in time, living a fairytale of your childhood.

title: a shocker !
review: Probably the only fort in india where people stay inside and there is so much of commercialization . With litter all around , trust me it will repel you ...ironically even jaisalmer is one city which is an add exception to other clean cities in rajasthan  , i was shocked myself ..

title: A living fort
review: Fort life is alive and well. The stone roads, intricately carved facades, the radiating golden colors all in a desert setting. This place has a unique atmosphere and is easy to get lost in for a few days. Well worth more than a day trip.

title: Amit Jain
review: It is no more a Fort. It is a place of Jain Temples. These temples are very old and shows the richness of Jain culture.

title: fort visit
review: The fort is magnicicent and is housing hundreds of houses but the king's palace is not as recommendable as the few others we saw on our trip.

title: Beautiful Fort
review: Beautiful Fort/Palace Museum. An obvious reason for going to Jaisalmer. Within the fort walls is a small city of people so it is vibrant and dynamic. Sit at a tea shop and soak up the atmosphere

title: Medieval Fortress town
review: This is not really a Fort, more a fortified town within which can be found palaces, temples,houses and shops all of which are made of soft yellow sandstone, the houses with beautiful carvings.

title: Jaisalmer Fortress
review: Amazed to see such huge monumental space that is live. It was full of life with all sorts of shopping, food and people. I listened to a very good old street singer with his instrument. It was amazing experience.

title: A must when travelling in India
review: This fort as well as the old city is a very interesting place, All the stone-works, even on new or renovated buildings are remarcable.

title: A Lost Heritage.
review: Fort is chaotic and nothing much to see, its horded by shops which sell wall hangings and stuffs at an steep rates….bargain hard and rule of thumb here is quote 1/3 the price.

title: Nice surroundings & view
review: Great to walk around, exploring the living areas of the fort. Not too much hassle from shopkeepers, definitely more relaxing to walk around than some other cities in India.

title: Fascinating
review: We loved wandering through the fort and seeing the locals going about their day to day lives, off to school and Uni, visiting one another, having milk delivered, kids playing in the street, and the usual havoc of motorbikes, cows, etc!  Although it is in some ways "tourist central", people here as across Rajasthan are just so lovely and good natured.  Great place.

title: Wonderful
review: The life in the fort was nice because I saw how people really lived in the fort. I liked this as I have never seen a fort with people still living in it

title: A small city in a fort
review: It is a protected fort having a living small city inside. Vehicles runs inside the fort. Shops, hotels & business houses are there inside. Unique fort. Carving on walls and windows is amazing. All done on golden stone available in the area. So, Jaisalmer is called Golden City. Fort map resembles the map of India. View from the top of the fort is very good.

title: Around and around we went and all was good
review: Like many older buildings, the path leads around through many rooms and each contained something of interest. The views of the city were very nice as well!

title: Wow
review: Blew my mind, what a great place, so much to see! Fantastic audio tour, move on at your own pace, and re-trace your route if you want

title: ARCHITECT REBUILD
review: Less time and more travel made us exhausted. But it was worth watching. The Jain temple architecture is too good.

title: very beautiful fort
review: a real besutiful fort to wander along with many shops and restaurants, but also interesting buildings and temles

title: Filthy, full of cow patties
review: I enjoyed Jaisalmer in the residential areas but the fort was disappointing. There is no effort made to  clean up the streets of the fort area. Heritage is important in India so I do not understand why so little care is taken around the fort.

title: The "live" fort of Jaisalmer
review: We were lucky to have hired a smart guide (a B.Com student trying to earn pocket money over the weekend), without whom this structure would have been just another monument that we visited. The history associated with it is engaging and the stories make the fort come alive. Do not miss visiting the cannon located at the top for a stunning view of the city.

title: desert festival
review: fort is worth the watch.excellent.desert ok. food good.hotel victoria excellent/ a must.lots to buy eat and leisure.Excellent palce to be during this time of the year.

title: Remarkable Fort
review: One of the best forts in Rajasthan. Splendid look and architecture. You are certain to enjoy the narrow alleys – the fort lifestyle – the houses there and everything. Especially at night the lighting around the fort is overwhelming.

title: OK
review: It's big, Jain temple architecture good, 4000 people inside fort, motor cycles inside being driven, lot of garment art shops for a living, make sure to pick and choose

title: beautiful place
review: impressive architecture, lots of little streets to roam. merchants are incredibly annoying at first. You have to be prepared for their "warm welcome" otherwise it will take away lots of fortress' charm. The more they see you around the less intrusive they become, so make yourself visible from start.

title: Worth a visit.
review: This is an interesting fort. This is called the golden fort as it is built with yellow stones. A large number of people still live inside this fort which is interesting to see. The king's and the queen's palaces are worth a visit.

title: Its only about being "the only living fort"!
review: A visit is a must! However Rajasthan offers much grand forts and palaces.as my tittle says it has a huge township and thousands of people still reside in this massive fort.

title: Living, breathing history
review: Time travel is possible!! The beautiful fort of Jaisalmer has retained its historical charm and comes juxtaposed with all the modern amenities that a tourist will ask for...the ~900 year old fort is something unique which has to be experienced preferably by living in one of the several hotels/guest houses inside the fortress. We get to see some brilliant architecture and also experience the beautiful culture of the land of the Rajputs...

title: Horrible mark in beautiful city
review: The fort is uninteresting and filled with shop owners. They are aggressive and disrespectful.

title: a date with history!!
review: Constructed of yellow sandstone, the Jaisalmer Fort lies atop the Trikuta hill. It is the only fort to house around 9000 people(source from locals).The main attractions inside the fort are:Raj Mahal (Royal palace) ,Jain temples,Laxminath temple,4 massive gateways of Jaisalmer Fort,The mammoth Merchant Havelis.There is a  market place in the fort , known as the Manek Chowk. The fort is open day n night except for palaces inside whose timings are 9:00 AM to 7:00 PM. Its better to take a guide with you to cover the fort or take guidance from the locals. Autos and two wheelers are allowed inside the fort. Since i had less time so i covered only royal palace which costed me around Rs 50 + RS 100 for camera.Though palace+museum costs RS 300. Palaces are well kept though streets in fort are dirty. One can get a view of whole jaisalmer from top of the palace.

title: Jain Temple
review: It's perfect.

title: live fortress
review: After seeing many deserted ,more forbidding fortresses in Rajasthan, this fort looked alive. Living inside it even for two days made us fell part of a timeless history!.

title: a fort where commoners live has to be unique
review: the fort in yellow is huge and majestic. it has a rich history, but most guides are only interested to make u buy fossil stones because of the commision he could get from the dealer. question the guide about jauhar and if he knows about the 21/2 jauhars then only hre him. admire the sand stone and fossil stone strucures. dont bother to visit havelis for the pathway stinks. enjoy the fort, intricate works from inside and outside.

title: hands down the best fort in the country!
review: i can nothing that hasnt been already said about this fortress except that going to this fort is like time-traveling. You can almost feel the grandeur and magic of the eras gone by. dont miss it

title: The only living fort in India
review: We had a tour guide who provided us a detailed history of the fort and its present state of disrepair. It is considered the only living fort in India as people still live and do business within the walls of the fort - this has led to more strain on the sandstone structure and with bad drainage and inadeqaute sewerage infrastructure, the fort is literally sinking.  There are efforts to repair and mainatin what they have so it has been suggested that tourists stay outside the fort to avoid more pressure within the walls.

title: Jaisalmer's Golden Fort !!!
review: Its popularly known as 'Golden Fort' because of the yellow sandstone used in its architecture. Its situated at the center of Jaisalmer town and from its top, one can get full view of Jaisalmer town. Rs. 50 entry fees is charged from each visitor for the Raj Mahal[including the Fort's top and Museums] and Rs. 100 for a camera. Security officials keep a watchful eye on tourists from CCTV cameras, so better take a ticket if you want to click pictures. The best part is the view from top of the Royal palace. A Jain temple is also there having wonderful carvings embarked on its walls. One can hire a guide for Rs. 100-300 if they want to enquire about fort's history. On the whole its really the worth watching USP of Jaisalmer town.

title: Detailed designed fortress
review: Jaisalmer, especially Rajmandir changed my perspective toward India. It is about 20 hour far from New Delhi by train, worth to visit if you are willing to learn deep culture of West India. Full of exotic culture experience include Jaisalmer Fortress. Highly recommend for who love adventure, romantic moon shine, overnight in the desert with full of star.

title: Roof tops
review: Most things have already been said. This is a great fort an one of the older forts in India. If you can try and get yourself onto one of the roof tops where you can get great views of the Jain Temple and a panoramic view of the city and land below.

title: Worst Place Ever!!!
review: The fort is beautiful, however the trip is ruined by the constant stream of shop owners trying to sell anything they can. Unlike the rest of India, the people here make you feel unconfortable and unwanted.

title: well worth the distance to get here
review: The fort is really interesting, Lots of guide books say it is being spoiled by all the tourist tat, but thank goodness you get far less hassle here than most other places. people were really nice. Didn't think the places to eat were all that great so ate outside the fort instead. Well worth a couple of days here.

title: The Only Living Fort.
review: We were told by the guide that this is the only living fort in the sense that common people still live inside this fort.The King's and the Queen's palaces inside the fort have great carvings and are worth-visiting. From the roof-top one can see the city-view which is awesome.

title: Great fort, wonderful architecture
review: Jaisalmer is a magic place in the mids of the desert. Totally build out of yellow sand stone it reflects the light, so the color looks always different. Beautiful old palaces that evoke the splendor and magic of 1000 and one night tales. The city just should use some of the money the tourists bring to get rid of the garbage lying all around...

title: Timeless and full of life- The most unique Fort ever
review: I have been to many forts across India and europe but none like this.  I always wondered how people lived in the forts whenever we visited the ruins and I got to see this first hand when we visited the Jaisalmer Fort. It is one of rare living forts in India where the descendants of original inhabitants still live.

title: Stay in the fort!
review: To get to the heart of this fascinating city, I recommend you stay at a hotel inside the fort.  The maze of alleyways is always a delight, and enjoying sunset from a rooftop restaurant is highly recommended. There are plenty of restaurants to choose from. You really get a feel for the city by staying in the fort, rather than staying outside and visiting it.  Just walking throughout the fort is an endless pleasure.  Hawkers are everywhere....and can be aggressive, but you can deal with them easily.   I suggest you do your shopping outside the fort, however, as prices are lower.

title: The Living in Fort
review: The only Fort in India, which still has people living inside for years, is amazing. Apart from exploring the King's and the Queen's Palace, there is enough to spend a whole day in the fort. The view from the Cannon Point to the city of Jaisalmer is quite stunning and one can search and point other attractions of the city like Patwa ki Haveli, Nathmal ki Haveli and Salam Singh ki Haveli. An old Jain Derasar is the proof of this religion increasing its followers during those olden times. Also, exploring the narrow lanes of the Fort City is quite interesting and attractive.

title: Jaisalmer Trip
review: Awesome fort after it got name Sonar Kella the famous bengali movie from Satyajit Ray.........the o2nd largest port after chittorgarh, part from exploring the King's and the Queen's Palace, there is enough to spend a whole day in the fort. The view from the Cannon Point to the city of Jaisalmer is quite stunning

title: Nice view from guesthouse terrace
review: I saw the fort from the guesthouse terrace and thought it'd be great inside. To my disappointment, all there was inside were shops and stalls that sold local products. Dirty inside, because there are people living inside the fort, the only thing I really enjoyed was the Italian restaurant that is at the entrance.

title: Nice little fort
review: Lively and still inhabited fort with quite a few temples and good spots to see the sunset. The touts at the entrance gates can be a bit annoying.

title: Interesting experience
review: This Fort is very different than the Mehrangarh Fort, Jodhpur which exhibits grandeur and exquisite architecture. A truly royal place indeed.

title: Nice Place
review: Fort architecture is priceless.  Jaisalmer fort is huge and nice. But the maintenance is too bad. Jaisalmer Fort is the main attraction in jaisalmer.

title: Definitely worth a visit.
review: Unlike lots of the other forts, this one's occupied and has shops in it, so it's more of a living museum. The architecture is unbelievable lots of delicate carving everywhere. Fill up your memory card on this visit alone!

title: Better than many other forts in Rajasthan
review: You will need to hire a guide to understand the fort..You'll get one for around Rs. 400 who will take you around the fort, then the bylanes of the old market followed by Patwaon ki Haveli. Its a good fort, especially the view of the entire city from the top. Be careful of what you buy from within the fort - most of the stuff is fake(especially what are claimed as fossil stone artifacts).

title: worth a visit.
review: it has four gates and a superb jain temple. worth a visit. has a lot of shops . the jain temple is a must. there are 6666 statues in the temple. also shopping is really nice. really old stuff is avaible though expensive

title: the incredible land of maharajas
review: i liked the simplicity of its people, the vast cultural binding, the days of the past and beauty of the land but did not like the cleanniness of the area and the traffic and other unforscene things on the roads

title: I liked it :)
review: I don't how to be specific because the fort is huge with so many by-lanes, but there is this small corner in the one of the lanes where there are residential buildings (ethnic kind), which I will always remember. I loved that spot and sat there for more than an hour! Shifting to the shade when it got hot, and then to the sun when I needed to feel warm (yes! both shade and sun).You have a view of the city from there, and listening to something nice, or not listening to anything at all just soaking in the vastness and clay-iness of the city, will never be forgotten.

title: Great Heritage and History!!
review: Must Visit!! One of the places which is a must visit if in Jaisalmer. Take a guide as they know all the best dope on the fort.

title: Poorly maintained,crowded and a tourist trap!
review: Right from the moment you enter the gates of the fortress you will be pestered by the so called tourist guides to hire them.We had to keep telling them repeatedly that we didnot want a guide,which was very annoying.As soon as we entered the fort we began to feel extremly claustrophobic.There is no system for a queue to purchase a ticket and people keep elbowing you to get past.Once you have purchased a ticket and moved on to sightseeing you dont have a choice but to be swept along with the wave of people not really getting a chance to actually see anything.There is no crowd control what so ever and not much of a chance to see anything.

title: Beautiful and Historically Important Fort
review: An excellent restoration of a beautiful fort. Be sure to opt for the audio guide which will greatly enhance your visit and understanding of the rich history of the fort. Walking around the narrow streets of the fort is an awesome experience despite the aggressive shop keepers. One of the best restored forts of Rajasthan.

title: Beautiful but like a crowded township
review: This is a beautiful fortress. But homes have been built within the fort walls which leaves to thinking of walking through a crowded township with lovely homes. It is better to walk with a guide to be able to navigate through the place. Gadisar lake and patwaon ki haweli at within walking distance as well.
