title: Living history
review: We stayed within the fort and thoroughly enjoyed visiting the palace and Jain temples. We could only imagine how stunning it would have been when it stood as a solitary fort in the dessert.

title: Worth a watch, but not spectacular
review: If you've seen other palaces in Udaipur/Jaipur/Jodhpur, this one seems poor and shady. Lacks maintenance and grandeur. Worth a short visit still if you visit Jaisalmer. View from the terrace at the top is very nice, with clam breeze and full view of the town.

title: terrible
review: the fort is in a very bad shape, thanks to the human population that lives in it. the museum in the fort is also very average. Drastic steps need to be taken to save this heritage property.

title: Nice Historical Place to visit
review: It is a nice very old historical place one must visit when in Jaisalmer. This is the oldest place I found in Rajasthan as Jaipur and Jodhpur forts are not as old is this one.

title: Interesting Fort
review: I used the audio guide and it was very good. The Royal complex is very pretty. Jaisalmer fort is crumbling due to water shortage so visitors are asked to be careful and not waste water.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: The fort is very dirty and very very commercial.  There is cowdung everywhere.  This is a national treasure and should be maintained in a better way.  There are no wheelchairs for the elderly.  It can be skipped.

title: an oasis in desert
review: Not one of the best forts in Rajasthan but definitely amongst the best. It is amazing to watch this wonder in the middle of the desert with its intricacies and the city it holds inside its huge cavernous pit

title: Worth a visit
review: If you are in Jaisalmer it is worth a visit to the Fort. If you have seen the Mehranghar fort in Jodhpur, it is less grand and smaller in size but the place has its charm and the artifacts kept are interesting with stories and history all along.

title: A beautiful fort, a crying shame about the renovation
review: Jaisalmer fort isn't the biggest and probably wasn't the most secure back in the day when it's walls would have been put to you. It is, however, a really lovely, magical little place to explore. It's no more than a five minute walk from one end to the next, through beautiful little stone alleyways that carve through the stunning buildings. After Jodhpur it's also been good to have a decent choice of well priced restaurants.

title: Full of tourists but still a gem
review: It's a shame the fortress is so dominated by tourists but I don't see a solution.  The palace is worth a visit; the Jain temples are a must (make sure you note they're open only in the mornings; you can't take leather into two of them so leave bags, wallets and belts behind).  Please don't stay there - you're adding to the water problem.

title: Must see!
review: This is what is known as a "living fort". Fascinating place to visit and wander around. Make sure to enter at least one of the Jain Temples inside the fort. Very beautiful!

title: AMAZEMENT
review: Will mention only the things I din't like: BIKES, SCOOTERS AND COWS AND COW DUNG EVERYWHERE. Had these been taken into account, Jaisalmer would have been a pretty place to visit..

title: golden fort
review: it is old fort if not cared for , is destined for ruins. It looks wierd that people are still residing in the fort.

title: A deteriorating heritage fort
review: A beautiful, majestic fortress which will eventually die because of human abuse. Travelers should  boycott the hotels inside the fort and prevent the gradual deterioration of the place.

title: Lets protect our heritage !
review: A shame that this wonderful property is being allowed to rot ! Too many shops and hotels within the fort ! Absolutely no need for them ! The havelies are being destroyed as well . God knows what these politicians are doing !  Or sorry not doing !

title: A giant sand castle
review: This expansive fort dominates the desert city of Jaisalmer. Built from golden limestone it looks like a massive sandcastle. Inside people live their normal lives - the only living fort in Rajasthan.

title: A Landmark on an ancient caravan route
review: I loved the ambiance within the fort and the old preserved houses, and the little curio shops that sold beautiful hand made articles. I disliked the litter and the sewers that need urgent attention.

title: Inhabited fort and very dirty
review: The overall impression of the Jaisalmer city and the fort has been a sheer letdown, rather than we njoing the beauty were more worried that accidently we might step on some cow dung, it was very disappointing ....

title: Beautiful fort slowly draining out
review: Jaismel fort also known as Golden fort is a beautiful fort. It provides beautiful views of the city and the semi desert just outside the city. Unfortunately since its a living fort, it seems to be crumbling due to the human activity inside. Government should try to relocate the residents and conserve the beautiful fort.

title: Good Fort
review: Nice Fort, Jain temple is a must to see place. it has all the beautiful carvings all over the building

title: great voyage into history
review: if you can afford a guide, there is a lot to know about this fort and its history. the museum, the jain temple, the laxminarayan temple, the canon placed at the high point, bird's eye view of city and the rastaurant italiano (located prior to restaurant italiano Om) on second floor in vyas para are things not be missed

title: Nice place for a stroll
review: Nice place to spend two hours, since you have very few other places to see in Jaisalmer, so this becomes a must visit place

title: Beautiful to view
review: Mostly just shopping or restaurants inside the fort.  It is nice because it is still a used fort and people still live inside of it.

title: Excellent
review: Visit for the experience .... You feel transported back by centuries and at the same tinme see windmills all around , tibetan restaurants with roof top view .

title: Golden Fortress
review: Liked :It is one of the oldest living forts in the world with heritage buildings all around you. You get soaked in history and get a feel of lifestyles and culture of the people inside .

title: Very impressive fort
review: A very large and imposing fort well worth the trip to this city. This fort is a little different to most others within Rajasthan in that much of the population still lives within the fort. This makes the whole place come alive and adds colour to it; the only downside is the constant dangers and annoyances of the motorcycles driven by the residents.

title: Underwhelming, but interesting
review: The Jaisalmer fortress is quite underwhelming in terms of its size and grandeur when compared to other forts in Rajasthan. However, the history of the fort and the city is quite interesting, and the fact that it is a fort with a number of families and establishment still living in it makes it a little fascinating. The palace within the fort was not that great, but some of the temples were quite beautiful.

title: Great old living fort!
review: The fort is a great location to spend the day and there will be something for everyone to do in the town.  I’ve got to be honest though, after all of the rave reviews and hauling hundreds of km away from the nearest airport,  I guess my expectations were too high.

title: Charming
review: I really loved this place. It's a place of living history. People still live here, and make their living here too, quite literally. It was great walking through the narrow lanes, and just taking it all in.

title: Fantastic Living Fort
review: The Jaisalmer Fort/ress, immortalized by Satyajit Ray's Sonar Kella, is definitely worth a visit. It dominates the landscape, rising above the sand whose colour it mimics. This is a living fort, in with families which have been there for centuries, and have traditional rights. Walk up to through the main gate to the square on to which the king's apartments and coronation place, the queen's palace and other buildings face. These are all beautifully carved in sandstone in the Jaisalmer style.On the way here, your guide will show you the high balcony from which the king's announcements were made. There are narrow lanes with houses, some of which have shops, and temples. Watch out for motorcyclists who drive through the crowds with abandon. Our guide took us to a hotel within the fort (yes, there are places to stay here) which you gives you great views of the city from on top. There's even a "loo with a view"! For those who need it, you can get an auto-rickshaw from the main gate up to the square (be warned: the rates are reasonable from bottom to top but not in reverse).

title: Teeming with Life
review: Most of the forts that you might visit when touring through Rajasthan are notable for their royal or military building but the Jaisalmer fort is unusually still teeming with the everday life of its many remaining residents. It can be difficult to navigate through the winding laneways, amongst the crowds and the wandering cows, so in order to find the more spectacular houses and havelis it's probably a good idea to use a guide. In particular, don't miss visiting the Jain temples which have truly spectacular carvings.

title: An interesting tour
review: A very interesting tour we had of the fort. You should go there prepared to bargain at the various stores on the street and also with the tour guide. The fort can be cleaned up alot more which was pretty depressing to see how dirty and unkempt the streets were but on the contrary a trip well worth the effort

title: Average fort
review: Being Indian and a Rajasthani, having seen huge forts in Jaipur, Udaipur, jodhpur etc I did'nt find much exciting.

title: Very good fort
review: This is a very different fort. It is a living fort in the sense that about 40% if Jaisalmer town actually resides within the fort. It is a great experience to have snacks and tea in one of the many havelies there (especially with a view of the outside). Small and interesting lanes with daily activity on display makes the place very good to visit.

title: interesting and bustling
review: The fort is vibrant as it houses a city which is bustling with people and activity.Shops abound with antique feel goods. Way different from the mall culture

title: Ok fort
review: I was also curious to walk around a 'living' fort.  The fort is ok, there are many other forts in Rajasthan worth seeing, and honestly could have skipped this fort!  There is no entrance fee however I believe that there should be a small one because the fort is dirty and falling apart.  I found the people working in the markets to be very rude and pushy, more rude than other parts of India, the shopping is not even good and there honestly is really not much to see at the Fort.

title: Disappointing, given all the hype
review: We were wondering what a living fortress would actually mean - and having now visited it are rather disappointed. Clearly having 3000+ residents, hotels, etc does not do much for the longevity of the fort.

title: Mesmerising
review: Do the audio tour and just amble along. Do not have an agenda and you will have a good time walking through the Living Fort. Try and get to a restaurant on top of the various fort areas for great views

title: Nice Space but Too Many Vendors in the Fort Walls
review: The fort has too many vendors within the space. Everywhere you turn someone is trying to sell you something--fabric, jewelry, stoneware, etc. It has had an impact on the fort's structure and water system. It is good that the police have disallowed tuktuks into the fortress walls.

title: Dont compare to Udaipur, Jaipur or Jodhpur forts
review: Its a great fort...different architecture, and different view...go with a open mind...its a live fort with families still part of centuries of tradition. Go around at lea sure, have a cup of tea, go to the Jain Temples, look at the architecture. Hire a good Guide and ask lot of questions.

title: Dirtiest place on earth
review: There are a lot of stuff for foreign tourists such as a girl walking on rope, few dirty cows, cow dungs on road which might attract them. But for Indian tourists it could be the dirtiest place where guides and local people play dirtiest tricks to fool you. Recently I visited almost all the forts in Rajasthan and this one really left a very unpleasant experience in my mind.

title: Nice old world Charm
review: Likes :

title: liveliness waht u call it!!
review: its actually a living fort :) so many people so many eating joints and restros and full of activities..

title: Horribly maintained
review: It is a pity that a magnificent heritage structure like this is so ill maintained.

title: Amazing living fort-- the best i've seen in India
review: What a beautiful fort!    We walked all of the lanes, enjoyed talking with people, and were transported back in time by the charming atmosphere.   This is one of the few 'living' forts where people still live inside --- with lots of businesses, hotels, restaurants, etc.    Sunset views are amazing if you enter the last gate, go right, and walk to the end of the fort walls--- a few cafes/restaurants with roof terraces to choose from.    The fort museum is nicely done with a good audio tour.    From anywhere in town, the fort dominates the skyline, and it's easy to navigate back home to your hotel if in the fort.    Shops ranged from touristy to regular goods, and happily the shopkeerers were not pushy-- in fact, people are surprisingly friendly inside the fort, given that they have so many visitors.   This is the highlight of our travels to date in Rajasthan--and we've seen all of the major cities/sites.    Not to be missed-- and definitely try to stay in a haveli inside the fort (best is Killa Bhawan).

title: Fun times!
review: It was extremely different and a lot of fun to see. Lots of different shops, temples, restaurants and museums. A must visit if u go to Jaisalmer.

title: No more lighting
review: The fort is beautiful but very commercial now with shops till the very otside of the main palace. The palace is no more lit up at night which was the main attraction and made it look beautiful

title: Really a Sonar (made of gold) killa (fort)
review: A fort made of sand stones atop a hill, it is really wonderful. Being a "living fort", quite a large population lives within it. You can also stay in one of the hotels within this fort. It could surely do with some better maintenance. But it does take you back in time, walking thru its narrow lanes, seeing the historical houses, where people still stay. With lot of cows around, you may not find the lanes as clean as you may like, but overall this fort does provide you with an unique experience. I stayed within this fort for three days, and I really enjoyed a totally different experience. I have visited many castles and forts in India and in other countries, but I never had this type of an experience.

title: Inside fort
review: The Fort is great. Nice little shops who are worth looking in, although there is a problem with guides who ask commission . So please go on your one to visit shops

title: Amazing experience for all types of tourists
review: Hire a guide and spend some time in the fort. It is a living fort and you will be thrilled. Museum is average but the guide made it alive and kicking.

title: more like a city
review: more like a mini city. like a walled city charm.houses more than 4,000 people. not like mehran garh fort

title: Explore jaisalmer
review: Hi,

title: A highlight of India!!
review: Trying to decide whether or not to go to Jaisalmer.....do not hesitate! It is an incredible place that is well worth the hassle of getting there. It is a small town with a lively daily life, and the fortress itself--a stunning structure is lovely golden sandstone-- is a town within the town, with about 3000 residents, temples and so on. Take and extra day or two to relax and soak up the atmosphere. It is our favorite place in Rajasthan.

title: Excellent living fort!
review: This is a great living fort with more than 4000 people still living within the walls.  Great place to roam around with numerous twisting alleyways.  Unfortunately, they do still allow auto-rickshaws and scooters in here.  Without those, this place would be perfect.

title: Loved it!
review: Had an great day in the fortress.  The history and architecture is amazing.  Wonderful experience wandering around the rooms, buildings and streets.  A step into history that is still living.

title: The fort is crowded with local resident. Not clean enough or tourist friendly. It should have been preservedl like forts
review: The Jain temples, the jali work, the jharokhas are beautiful and unique. One must see the canon on the top of the fort. Taking guide is helpful to see the fort

title: Absolutely beautiful
review: The fort in Jaisalmer is really worth seeing- the whole town is lovely with beautiful architecture and clean desert air. The touts and handicraft shops (do I really need to see the same pair of ugly trousers in every tourist destination in India) can be tiring but overall it is a must see if you are in Rajasthan. Especially quiet and magical late at night or early in the morning.

title: Life in a fort
review: A large population of Jaisalmer lives in the Fort - Sonar Kella. Their live dwellings inside help one understand and appreciate the life in those years. There are many wonderful temples and havelis inside. An appreciation for architectural values, faith in the divine forces. A must see. And, why not ? Jaisalmer is synonymous to Sonar kella. The golden colour of the fort is replicated in all the buildings across jaisalmer.

title: not well maintained
review: not at all maintained and filth every where , these forst are our heritage and glory of our past but this is apathy of our country that we cant keep them sutain for long time.

title: Amazing "living" fortress
review: It is great to see a fortress as more than just a museum. Streets are action packed (mostly with tourists and gift shops), endearing in way that is memorable.

title: It's the reason people come to Jaisalmer
review: The fort's glory days are well and over. It's also not being helped by the thousands of people who make a living off it from all the tourists who come there.

title: The Only Fort with Habitat !
review: This fort has the old time traditional life style still being maintained. Temples and Traditional shops

title: Holding the fort at Jaisalmer
review: This can't and mustn't be missed.  A bonus apart from the historical setting is that you get away from the traffic!  A good place for lunch is the Desert Boys Guest House.

title: Nice forth
review: amazing forth, it takes you back in time.

title: Worth a visit and a walk about.
review: This is a fort built on a hill in the middle of Jaisalmer. The interior is crowded with narrow residential streets and shops, there are restaurants with rooftop terraces giving a great view over the surrounding area.

title: nice view
review: nice fort. Had a very nice view from the top. Worth watching. Would suggest to have a look. Had nice italian food at the entrance of fort

title: shonar qela
review: Just like the film, it was magical. I loved walking through the fort and exploring the nooks with their soaring views and old canons.

title: Not the best place to visit in Jaisalmer
review: The palace is ok ok since it is too confined and is like a museum.

title: Great place but need to be maintain .......
review: Great place to visit but need to be maintain ....... Best to visit at morning time . Desert & Fort are main attractions of Jaisalmer .

title: Incredible
review: Jaisalmer and the Jaisalmer Fortress is an incredible place to spend some days, especially with accommodation inside the fort. It really feels like a desert city. The fortress is still beautiful, and there are cheap guesthouses to stay in.

title: One of the best medieval cities in India.
review: Very cool with beautiful temples and amazing views of the countryside.  Make sure to get here early (8am) to miss the crowds and the touts. At this time, you'll be the only one in the Jain temples.

title: meh
review: Not the best thing to do in Jaisalmer, to be honest. It's incredibly touristy. It's beautiful but it's a huge tourist hustle and we felt pressured the whole time we were in there. Worth seeing - but don't make a day out of it.

title: Watch out for locals who befriend you at the Fort!
review: At the fort you get approached by people offering to guide you ,when you refuse a few,they leave you alone ,only later you get approached by an elderly man with reasonable english who just follows you and chats,but beware! there is a wellknown Brahmin family that seems to have the place in their pockets,with different members of the family placed around the town ,in the shops,internet caffes,restaurants,travel agents etc. So if anyone starts following around being friendly politely tell them to go away!

title: Stunning Fort and a must see
review: The place was hassle free, the Fort and labyrinth of alley ways stunning. prices were good and there are plenty of traditional gift shops and sights

title: bustling town centre area just the right size.
review: full of atmosphere with sellers and shops withih walls and surrounding streets. cleanest town centre come across really liked this place.

title: Very commercial
review: Of course, there's little else but tourism on which locals can live here but the explosion of trinket shops is pretty unattractive. Turn your back on that and there's still a fair bit of atmosphere.

title: majestic,magical, beautiful Sonar killa
review: This is amazing fort I ever seen in my life. Wow its feel like if I could have Aladin's magic carpet then fly arround this fort 100 times.

title: Must see along with jain temple
review: Magnificent monument with great great view of the city. May need guide if you are interested in history of the monument. Usually 100 rupees for guide which includes 30 minutes of explanation of fort.

title: buyer beware!
review: the fort is really amazing, and interesting to walk around, but beware. if you are staying, eating, or shopping inside the fort, you are contributing to its destruction. tourism (specifically drainage issues) is taking an inexorable toll on the fort and its rapid decay. staying, eating, shopping in jaisalmer is fine but it is better to do so outside the fort walls (where the majority of the city resides). regardless, yes, it's worth it, a very beautiful place, and also the camel safaris are a great time, as well.

title: An amazing place
review: I first visited Jaisalmer 25 years ago before it was known to the outside world as an amazing tourist destination. Although it has grown and become popular now, it still retains its charm and history. A must for any visit to India, like the Taj Mahal. Do not miss this desert gem.

title: Living fort is fun to stroll through
review: This fort is different, because still some 4000 people live inside the fort. You can stroll through, admire the beautiful havelis and do some souvenir shopping as everyone is quite relaxed here.

title: Dirty
review: This place is well built, looks good from Far to see but there being about 4000 people living in the fort, the upkeep is terrible and dirty, open gutters smelling and you have dirty cows brushing by you while you walk in. The meusium is really in shatters and very dim lit

title: amazing living fort
review: liked the lively atmosphere, very inlike the dead forts around the world , this one have actual people & houses living everyday lives

title: the golden fort(sonar killa)
review: the fortress was an amazing one!! mesmerizing with its own magnificent and historical places and architecture!!!

title: good fort with poor maintainance
review: fort is good but with no maintainance.people living in fort are making fort dirty.they have painted walls written names on fort,dump garbage in streets.

title: An Architecture from the Past!
review: We visited the Jaisalmer Fort along with a guide, as suggested by the Travel Agency.  It took about 3 to 4 hours. My main interest was to see how the community lived those days. It was partly met, because present day intrusions like TV antennae, mobile phones, electric gadgets etc. could not be avoided completely. The narrow lanes with the sun-shades of tall buildings providing shade was interesting; could not study in detail how the community was administered then; water-supply etc. The Archaeology guys need to put up a better show to guide and educate lay tourists.

title: Sonar Killa dwindling
review: People who have been living in this fort spoiling the beauty of a loverly living fort.Every house seems to be converted into business activity centre.People of that area sell their products on a very high rates and people have to bargain everytime.Buiding is very impressive and we should protect such kind of monuments by following the guide lines.

title: Good Museum inside the Fort
review: This is a living Fort, that means people live inside, do business. Perhaps why this may not be as well maintained than other forts of Rajasthan.

title: Wonderful Fort, insensitive people
review: The fort is a nice heritage site, but Hundreds of makeshift shops crowd the inside lanes of the fort, making it difficult for peoples and cows to walk side by side. Extremely noisy and dirty...

title: Golden fort
review: That's the name that comes to my mind, when I look at it. Built from the typical yellow jaisalmer stone, this fortress looks very golden in sunlight.

title: Wonderful place
review: Beautiful, enormous fort with a maze of winding streets & temples to explore. Rather smelly & expect to be gently hassled by all shop owners, this is a must on any visit to Rajasthan

title: Poor Show
review: The Indian Heritage is lost.  One can avoid the fort also. It is more of a city.  The government should forcibly evict people and take over the heritage.

title: Feel like 500 years ago
review: The first time we cross the huge doors of the fortress was in the middle of the night, nobody around, just the moon lighting our way, we felt like we were back in the 15th century.

title: Intact Architecture
review: simply beautiful...you can walk forever in the narrow little alleys of the fort, just allow yourself to get lost, you'll find all kinds of shops and bookstores, it is Rajasthan at it's best! I fell in love...

title: A Stunning Fort
review: I loved getting lost in this divine fort, wandering around beautiful lane ways with amazing old havelis and Jain Temples with intricate carving in the sandstone. Jaiselmer has been my favourite Rajasthan destination - well worth the trip. Dislikes - I find out difficult to find attractive food options within the fort.....but no big issue really - the beauty and relative serenity of the location more than compensate!

title: Wonderful
review: Take my advice and take a guide. Its worth his fees. He may push you not to visit the palace but you should.

title: Must See
review: Fort is great to walk round and soak up the atmosphere of the city, you absolutely must go in if you visit Jaisalmer to have a walk around - Sunset Lounge is a restaurant within the fort and has a great view and serves the most delicious Rajasthan Gatta

title: Wonderful Old Fort
review: Plan to spend a day up in the Fort. Many old walkways so much to photograf . Old doors and carvings. many little shops

title: pretty
review: Looks like the old city in jerusalem, but not worth the journey if you have seen the fort in jodhpur.

title: Historic Palace
review: A fortress built in 17th century in inhabited with locales. The only fort in the world where locals live. There's a beautiful Jain Temple inside the fort and locals have opened shops, hotels & restaurants inside the fortress. The fortress is built over an area of 5 sq km and is visible from every corner of the city.

title: Just another fort
review: You've seen one fort in India, you've seen them all. This one was fine. It wasn't completely run down like others have been, but there was nothing special about it either.

title: Very Approachable!
review: The fort is very approachable physically. Further the exhibits are displayed such that you can touch and feel many of the things. Though the collection may not be magnificent as other forts/palaces.

title: Picteresque fortress, could be better maintained
review: lovely fortress. The maintenance seems very poor. Non existent even. The temples are pretty. The guides dont do justice to the grandeur of the place. The museum could be better maintained. The constant throng of bikes is unbelievably frustrating. The lack of drainage cant be forgiven easily.  roads with open drains is a crime against sanitation and the olfactory senses. Much more could be done to improve the quality of life of the residents while ensuring this historical masterpiece survives another millenia or two

title: go early
review: go early and miss the rush. spend some time walking around aimlessly. be careful shopping as things that look great may not be of great quality.

title: Welcome to Paradise!
review: Jaisalmer has the only living Fort in India. The Fort made of Yellow Sand stone actually shines like Gold all day. The name Sonar Kella is apt for the Jaisalmer fort. The old Havelis around Jaisalmer are exceedingly beautiful in their architecture. The carvings, the painted and mirrored ceilings are still in such good condition. The Patwa Haveli is the prettiest. Around and close by is the Amar Sagar Jain Temple. The architecture and the carved pillars are a sight to behold! Jaisalmer is a place that one can live in for many days and keep discovering something new.

title: Top of the world
review: Great to walk around; a very vibrant place.  A little too much interation from the local stallholders who are very enthusiastic no matter how many times you pass by!  Great coffee stop we stumbled across in a back alley; Kuku Coffee Shop.  Don't be put off by the location which is quirky to say the least but the coffee and biscuits the best in Jaisalmer!

title: Must see Jaisalmer attraction!
review: This is the symbol of Golden Jaisalmir and for sure it is must see attraction. Walk trough narrow streets of still living fort... visit Jain temples... visit City Palace Museum... go for shoping... take a brak in numerous cafes or restaurants... This place is paradise for photographers - every corner of fort is hidding some beautiful details... Highly recomended!

title: it's great golden fort with gold color.
review: Before to come jaisalmer i was always thinking to visit golden fort and after to come here i come to know why people like this city and fort that much. yes some where it's dirty but over all it was great.

title: Living Heritage!
review: The only fortress I saw where vehicles are allowed, just because that's where old Jaisalmer lives. Lively and interesting.

title: Relaxed atmosphere and beautiful golden fort
review: We stayed in the fort also overnight, which I definitely recommend. Overall the atmosphere in the fort is quite relaxed and laid back. You have a lot of stores, but the owners don't hassle you. They ask once and if you are not interested they stop, plus they let you check out things without being all over you. The fort itself is beautiful - amazingly carved housed, an impressive Jain temple and the palace also looked beautiful from the outside. Unfortunately we could not visit due to the holidays around Diwali. Great celebration and fire works though.

title: Shonar Kella (the Golden Fort )
review: One of the reasons for our visit to JAISALMER , was to see this much talked about Golden Fortress. There is no gold here......just the yellow Rajasthani stone that this fort was built with. This is perhaps the only fort in India which is "lived in". There are hotels, restaurants, shops and people inside the fort . People who's ancestors perhaps worked for the then king.......have continued to live here through generations . Very frankly, once i got into the fort....and we chose to go inside post sunset......it was quite a let down. The fort lacks the charm and grandeur that many other forts in Rajasthan have. its very large and quaint in pockets. But the lived in rooms with fitted air conditioners, televisions and refrigerators steal the old world charm. There is a viewing point inside the fort, which sports a large canon.....you get a great view of the city of JAISALMER from here.

title: Wander through history
review: Its amazing that people are living in this fort even though most of them are now selling souvenirs to tourist. However it is still a great place to wander through the lanes. Try and go up the quiet deserted lanes as you can sometimes find a great peaceful spot with awesome views over the town, especially by the cannon sites. Every venue offers the 'best view' roof terrace so inspect and take your pick. Even though you are constantly harassed to visit shops it is generally done in a friendly way with lots of humour. Visit Babuart to see a talented artist.

title: Must See in Jaisalmer
review: Majestic& beautiful place. Reasonably maintained. Poor quality of Food and shops. The accessibility and road is horrible. Fails to give a premium look. Its as bad as reaching Jaisalmer.  Restaurant Italiano at enterance gate though vegetarian is only grace saving.

title: looks nice but dirty inside
review: though it looks awesome when u look up., when u look down it's very dirty and full of garbage thrown here and there. people living in the fort don't seem to care for it. but still u shouldn't miss this place in Jaisalmer.

title: Probably the only fort with people residing inside
review: After seeing Mehrangarh Fort at Jodhpur, this fort was a big let down. The paid entry into the Museum was not worth. The only thing which saves this visit is the uniqueness that people are residing inside the fort. Stone carvings in the Jain temple is oustanding. For carving lovers it is a must to see.

title: old fort
review: liked italian restaurants, Jain Temple , narrow lanes , museum , view from top is awesome. very old culture

title: A true living fort
review: We found that the fort was nice from far, but far from nice! Seeing as it is a living fort and there are over 3000 people living in it, it is incredibly dirty and really poorly maintained. When you aren't walking past/through someones house, all you see is geared towards tourists - shops, restaurants, hotels..it's really sad that something that was once to amazing now looks the way it does! On the other hand, the temples and the museum are quite interesting, but that's about it!

title: Just another fort
review: We were least impressed by this fort in Rajasthan. Perhaps because is was our last one and we'd seen enough! The inside of the fort is very dirty and smelly. I would not recommend getting a guide since its just Rs 200 down the drain.

title: Stay in the fort
review: Such at atmospheric place to just wander around in.  There are a few annoying hassling shop owners but just be firm and ignore them and enjoy living in a fort.  The views across the city and the desert beyond are stunning.

title: Very nice trip  by Ganesham Tours & Travels India Pvt. Ltd.
review: Awesome Fort view. Jaisalmer Fort say it's royal glory of Jaisalmer Kings. Thanks to Ganesham Tours & Travels India Pvt. Ltd. to make this amazing trip for me.

title: Awesome
review: This has got to be one of the biggest sand castles in the world.

title: Living inside a fort
review: This is a fort where people still own most of it and live there. Talk a walk down the alleys and just explore. Shops are overpriced and not worth it. Ignore the touts. Just soak in the whole ambience and sit on one of the cafes with a roof and look out at the golden city below.

title: the fortresses could have been neatly maintained
review: The Sonar quila being a living fort needs to be neatly maintained. A monument of such historical imp, needs better attention. The guides out there need to be a bit more professional instead of jumping on the visitors

title: Living fort
review: First thing that amazes you is the number of people staying inside the fort. That is why this is called the only living fort in the world. Sonar Kella is what we people from bengal refer it to based on the movie made by the legendaryfil maker Stayajit Ray. and it truly is a sonar kella ( Golden Fort )...there are a number of shops inside the fort but would suggest if you need to buy things do it from outside the fort. The amazing aspet of the fort was that its been made by keeping one brick on the other..there is no use of cement or any other bonding agent.

title: Colossal Living Fort
review: Jain Temple and other artifacts inside the fort are a must see. The view of Jaisalmer from the top is beautiful.

title: Touristy but charming
review: This place is wonderful, however many owners have opened shops to supplement their incomes. Advise to visit fast, after the airport opens in 2013 the tourist numbers will only increase.

title: Visiting here is like time travelling
review: We were in a state of shock as we had never experienced a place like this before. Really blown away that this place was inhabited by current day people when it truly is torn from the pages of the region's amazing history.

title: The only living fort in India
review: Full of atmosphere and a great way to see how locals live. Downside is it is very touristy but I guess you must expect that with a World Heritage site. Don't miss it.

title: A fabulous fort fallen from grace
review: Some portions tells you why it was called the Golden Fortress. The rest of the walls have green tinge of moss. The living fort inside is a mad house. Noisy, smelly and tourist unfriendly. Touts chase you and the entire area is defaced with cement, new stones that do not match the hue or color of the old ones. Worth a visit for the seven domed Jain temples inside and if if you can use ear plugs and pretend to be listening to music.

title: Atmospheric place to wander
review: Afternoon is best when people have started to go home.  The lanes are quieter then, but it does mean you are prey to the many invites 'to come in and have a look' - 'no obligation', some of which are quite insistent.

title: majestic fort
review: The fort is a majestic sight from the outside. Once inside, it is a dirty, littered market with sewerage  water everywhere. disappointing.

title: Beautiful and a living museum which was nice
review: Loved that it was both a museum, and archaelogical site and a living place - thought the combination made it pretty special

title: Huge scope there for improvement!!
review: The fortress is quite amazing, with the details of each and every aspect mentioned very well. But the maintenance is a huge problem. The stories differ from guide to guide. It is better to take an audio guide (cost Rs. 200 per head) though it is a bit expensive.

title: A fading glory
review: A beautiful fortress losing its glow because of the inhabitants. Most of the fort wall seemed to have been modified for hotels and other establishments. The audio guide provided is only for the king's place. Better forts are there in Rajasthan than this one.

title: The Golden Fort
review: Most of the fort is converted into hotels. Other than that, the unique feature of this fort is that it is completely occupied. Local people live there, there is a Bazaar inside the fort and ofcourse the hotels. Its golden stones look stunning in sunlight. However, the Fort is not very well maintained.

title: Excellent view and architecture.....
review: Staying inside fort itself is a life time experience....  Do walk around the fort in evening... Not much to buy inside the fort so just walk around visit jain temple and palace. Fort stinks at some places due to the bats hanging around....

title: Only living Fort in India
review: I'm told over 3,000 people live in this Fort.  It is dirty and smelly with rats running around the area but it has heaps of character and is totally vibrant.  A must see attraction where you can get sidetracked very easily in the narrow aisles and plenty of shops to keep you guessing!!!

title: Fort
review: Can be seen from anywhere in the city. Take a guide for the tour of fort. There are many things to see inside the fort. There are hotel, restaurants, shops also. There are Jain temples which you can visit. There is cannon for where you can see the entire city of jaisalmer and every thing looks golden

title: Imposing fort. Only small sections are open for public
review: Jaiselmer fort is an aweinspiring structure. I and my family fell in love with the fort. Please use the audio guide. But only small sections are open for public. You can go to the roof and have a breathtaking view of Jaisalmer. Must visit fort

title: I had no idea how much I would love this place!!
review: The inner 10-year old was screaming the whole time I was there.  Views are incredible from many hotels outside the fort, views are incredible from inside the fort.  Just amazing.

title: Über interesting
review: I will start by warning you - it is crowded and dirty and full of cowshit. But what an interesting place!

title: The best spicy snack at the Fort Jaisalmer
review: Finding a good spicy snack was surprisingly more difficult than expected whilst traveling in India; I enjoy very spicy food. The best was the Pakwan stall to the left, just outside the first gate facing the fort.

title: The old city is a fort
review: This fortress is different from the other Rajasthan forts, since it includes most of the old city; Situated on a hill, so marvelous views

title: Beautiful but dirty
review: The fort is nice but not well maintained (dirty and filthy). The jain caves were the main attraction.

title: Before die must to see
review: one of most magnificent alive in India.Known as the fourth wonder of India(by NDTV).All the monuments are achievable on waking distance.Jaislamer is the dream town for  walkers who want discovered the town by walk.Most long visit in India.each and every monument is different form others and every monument gives a wonderful stone carving.

title: Very nice to walk around
review: Jaisalmer is so different from the rest, less noisy, very dry, and you can walk in the fortress all you want doing siteseeing or shopping.

title: Get lost
review: We loved getting lost inside the Fortress, going around with locals, buying hand-made t-shirts in a shop close to the main square

title: Dont miss this if visiting Rajasthan
review: Amazing place amazing fort and city.  Its like a cross between a life size sandcastle and a medieval fort city but with people living in it in modern day.

title: It oozes history and atmosphere
review: Every time we walked through the gates up the cobbled road we were struck by this great architectural construction. And then arriving at the main square from which all these little roads and alleyways lead to smaller squares, shops, guesthouses, temples, etc. Highly recommended.

title: Amazing and fragile
review: The fortress is one most amazing thing we saw in our trip in Rajastan. It is majestic and really reminds of old caravn trails on the silk route. The golden colour of the sand stone becomes brilliant at sunset. Sadly, the fortress is in great peril. The impact of the numerous guesthouses, hotels and shops inside is weighing on the old and insufficient sewage system that is overflowing. The result is that the fortress is sinking, strongly damaged in many parts. In the past the ASI and some association had started a plan to save it but still this beautiful monument is in great peril. If you can, avoid to stay in one of the hotels inside and prefer to stay outside the fort. Besides, part of the magic of the place, as always, is faded by the incredible number of shops that crowd the narrow streets. Apart from this, the Jaisalmer Fortress really worth a visit. Better not in August 'cause the climate is unbelievably hot!

title: Overrated ...
review: The fortress was really great, but the many tourists made it a bit of a drag to do the tour. The audio guided wasn't so great either. I would rather have wandered around in the narrow streets inside the city walls.

title: Fort was ok
review: It was made great but People are spoiling it for their benefit. Find it quite ok...nothing great about it

title: walkaround inside
review: The fort is the biggest tourist attraction of the city, it houses a quarter of the population in this city, this effectively ensures that it is badly maintained, with cattle plying the narrow alleys as well as umpteen beggars!

title: Crumbling but still an experience
review: Several times during our 4 hour tour of the fort, our guide decried the lack of investment in its maintenance. He informed us that earthquakes had damaged many of the walls, and that people feared more structural damage at any time. Apparently, the government (local or national) has not put any money into preserving this historic site. I know it's not a shocker to hear in India, but sad nonetheless.

title: amazingly beautiful
review: walking through the lanes of the fort is a un-believable experience. This place is absolutely touristy, but people are friendly, indulge into chat with shopkeepers and they have fascinating stories to tell.

title: Maginficent fort
review: The fort with golden stone is fabulous. Views from the fort are wonderful. Walks in the lanes in the fort premises take you 200 years back.

title: well worth a visit
review: The best sight in Jaisalmer, do not miss this in case you are in town. Go early in the morning as it gets to hot after 10:00h.

title: Royal Heritage at its best
review: This fortress gives us a glimpse of Heritage of Rajasthan's yesteryear's. This is not just a fortress but an entire city, which seems to be lost in time. People still live in the age old houses (ofcourse they have embraced the modern technology) The twisting pathways through the city are quite tricky, you may get lost for a while. Inside you have a museum which you can visit to see. Also you get a 360 degree view of the city itself through many watchtowers.

title: second living fort of the country
review: no words to explain,glorious,great and unbelievable architect and thanks to idea to convert in museum also

title: Jaisalmer the golden city
review: A new year trip to the golden city  Jaisalmer Rajsthan India there are many interesting place to visit and keep very impress in remembrance ,riding camel and stay over night at desert camp was an incredible dream .

title: Their are so many homes inside the Fort
review: Fort is having a very good look from outside and when we go inside the fort, seen that their is so many homes and small hotels inside the fort. But Raja and Rani mahal is really beautiful

title: Amazing mystical fort
review: I went to Jaisalmer  on my honeymoon and stayed at a haveli facing the fort directly. The  fort is beautiful with intricate work all over it. There is an entire city inside the fort and some people still live in the houses iside the fort just as  their ancestors have for centuries. e had a chance to get invited to one of those houses(a kind local's who worked at our hotel). It was and different fascinating inside that home.I could literally smell the history iside that home!

title: this is why you'd come here
review: ...and its stunning - the only fort in India that's actually lived in and part of life. It has an air of Greece about it - winding lanes and shops similar to Mykonos or Santorini but very Indian.

title: Definitely worth the drive
review: We were torn about whether or not to drive all the way to Jaisalmer, but so glad we did.  As others describe, the fort is "living" and is still inhabited by locals (with a fair dose of tourism of course).  The views from the fort are really cool-- you can see for miles (probably to Pakistan!).

title: Beautiful architecture
review: Loved this! We had a guide who walked us through the fortress and took us around the back streets to the small shops. Many of the large buildings have interesting stories, and the place looks amazing at sunset. Wear comfortable walking shoes.

title: Stay in the fort
review: Given the Fort Rajwada hotel is not a choice go for something in the fort such as the Ganh Hotel. Far better and what an amazing location and views. Pity we chose Fort Rajwada.

title: Awesome Place
review: its an awesome place. the fort is full inhabitated. cars are not allowed. a wonderful atmosphere, feeling like out of time. i love it

title: Sonar Kella
review: The golden fort, its a brilliant place. Because it's a living fort (people live inside the fort complex) it was more enjoyable. Apart from the typical sights in any Rajasthani fort, what i liked most was the excellent bakeries right at the entrance of the fort - excellent cakes !!

title: A living piece of history
review: The charm of Jaisalmer is probably not in a specific site, but in the town as whole and experiencing a living fortress.

title: Poor maintenance everywhere
review: The famous Fort though brilliant to look at from a distance is actually a very unkempt affair from near.

title: Get there before it falls down!
review: Amazing fort - we stayed within it - and a remarkable place. Visually a treat and inside a warren of alleys and plazas with views from the battlements. In poor repair in many areas an dbeing over developed inside (new buidling!) it is a shock to most westerners... Streets full of flies and cattle roam as usual. Replete with havelis, guest houses and small museums it is always interesting - and of course busineses cheek and jowl tout to sell clothes and nik-naks.. Great IF you are there BUT would I travel IF I was not..... probably not.... ENJOY!

title: Beautiful fortress in an equally beautiful city
review: The fortress and city in general are a work of art.  My girlfriend and I stopped in Jaisalmer for two nights as part of a 3 week tour of Rajasthan.  Jaisalmer was by far our favourite city during our stay as it has a much more relaxed atmosphere about the place.  The sandstone structures are gorgeous.

title: Average
review: We have seen a few forts now and this was our least favorite it did have great views from the top but was not worth the 300 to go through the museum. If you have been to Jaipur, Jodhpur or Hyderabad forts you can afford to give this one a miss and just go for a wander through the alleys instead.

title: Compact but stunning
review: You will have to pay for an audio guide it seems - even if you don't want it

title: Sonaar Kella
review: For any bengali child growing up with Satyajit Ray's Feluda stories, Jaisalmer holds a special place in the heart. And even after the improper maintenance, it lives up to its exitence. Travelling by the Jaisalmer Express, the first look of the fort from the train is breathtaking.

title: A good Experience
review: Good food and good location. The overall experience was very good. Good service also

title: 100% TASTE OF INDIA
review: " THE YELLOW CITY"

title: Friendly folks
review: My best memories of Jaisalmer was the warmth of the people within the Fort. Just walking the streets my son & I became involved in a cricket game, and were invited into their homes to view the construction and the views! Thumbs up to such lovely people!

title: a must see
review: You don't necesarily need to visit Jaisalmer while visiting India, especially given its inconvenient location, but if you are there, you must check out this sand fort.  It is very cool.

title: Great place to visit
review: We had a great time wandering around the fort on our own,Views were amazing as was the architecture, we meet a guy who's family house was used for meeting between the ruling people in years gone by to resolve issues, and he showed us round, very interesting.

title: You can't miss this
review: This was a great experience. I like Jaisalmer because it's more laid-back and not so urbanized as compared to other places like Jaipur or Udaipur. Being Jain, I always wanted to check out the temples in the fort, I was really amazed when I came to know that there were a total of 8 temples in the fort and a total of 6666 statues of various Thirthankars. We took many pictures in the fort and the musuesm. Do not wait - go for it!!

title: Worth the trouble of traveling so far
review: This golden city was definitely worth the extra traveling and time.  A unique place, a living fort.

title: Surprising
review: Having seen a few forts in India, this is certainly different as it is occupied by the residents with tiny laneways everywhere. There is the usually number of people wanting to sell you stuff that you don't need but not too over the top.

title: The Living Fort
review: It was fun staying in the Fort. The view's are excellent from the fort. Nice cafes all around to have good snacks and chilled Beer.

title: Visit Here, But Don't Sleep Inside
review: Help preserve Jaisalmer's heritage by coming a bringing your tourist dollars to this beautiful fort, but don't come and add to the extraordinary burden that the hotels are placing on this amazing site.

title: jaisalmer fort
review: to walk in the fort is great but the visit of the museum is not really worth. just spend your time walking around and visit some unknown havelis

title: Jailsalmer Fort
review: This was my favourite fort of all the ones I saw on my trip. The reason is that it is not a museum, but an actual city, full of life. The architecture if wonderful.

title: Jaisalmer fort
review: There was very little to see at this desert fort, no attempt had been made to recreate the atmosphere for the lives of the people who lived there ...a pathetic doll dressed in a scrap of fabric with a bit of tinsel was the only 3-d offering, plus a wearying tape to accompany the visit.  why do you have to leave your passport in exchange for one of these cheap tapes?

title: You'll know a lot from it
review: A very well-managed museum that tells you interesting and important things about the fort. An audio guide is included in your ticket, buy a camera ticket and you will not regret when you get to the roof top.

title: it was ok
review: We saw alot of forts and this was one of the lesser memorables ones but did give a good view out onto the city

title: Beautiful but highly commercialised
review: It indeed is a live fort. It is said that till few years back, almost the entire population of Jasalmer used to live in the fort. Then it was opened for tourists and people were moved out, but a lot of them still live there. It is almost like the old days, except, there are no kings anymore. I did not like being asked to pay for taking pictures, but i think that's imperative for earning revenue.

title: the living fort!
review: yes.. its a living fort ... with a mini-city within the fort ...

title: Could have been better
review: Fort was nice but encroachement was really affecting the attractions. Its best to spend little time.

title: diffrent the best
review: the fort with hosues and still living people, also guesthosues, caffee, museums temples, necessary quide ,your price 100-150 rupia

title: nice
review: People is very very nice and helpful.

title: Excellent
review: Great restoration and presentation. Audioguide worth it.

title: The Indian Mall - explore it
review: Its one-of the kind living fort. It fascinated us with the concept. We did not purchase anything inside, since they were over-priced. Should see the sunset. If possible and if one can spare a complete day - you can explore the fort by urself. Its fun to explore around. Due to time shortage- we took a guide..it was ok, but they go on talking..Wouldnt suggest to take a guide.

title: Beautiful, but how long?
review: It's magnificent and full of life. But staying in the guest houses inside the fort is no longer sustainable option, mainly because of poor drainage. So make ethical choise and sleep elsewhere and make trips to the fort. Lots of shopping and eating options.

title: Not your typical Rajasthani fort
review: This fort is probably the only fort in which there are people staying permanently. The fort has about 3000 households within its walls which makes it feel more like a small town and less like a fort. The only place open to the public is the erstwhile Palace of the maharaja and that too is not well maintained. Worth a visit since you are already there but not a reason to visit Jaisalmer.

title: impressing - values kept
review: This is a place where you can truly feel that you are back in time. Maybe 100 or 200 years back. People still live there but the shops and restaurants, hotels etc... ruin the atmosphere.

title: A must visit place
review: Fort has many shops and jain temple in it. Jain Temple is only available for foreigners after 11am but it has the most beautiful carving in it. Do not miss it.

title: Beautiful and interesting
review: It is impossible to visit Jaisalmer and no go to the fort as it dominates the whole town. The yellow snadstone carving is excellent and the audio tour is well worth the money. Not only does the tour describe what can be seen but it also adds background facts.

title: Dangerous
review: Watch out for those damned motorbikes and careful where you step the ground is covered in you knw what.

title: Living (fort) da vida loca
review: fantastically maintained Living fort. People actually live inside. I did not like the fact that the government has done little to organise the "tourist guides" etc.

title: Fascinating
review: Beautiful old sandstone fort with a living town within it's walls, including temples, houses, restaurants, shops and a beautiful palace.  It's really fun to wander it's narrow lanes.

title: Excellent city view & dont miss jain temples
review: excellent fort, as you have to many of them in rajasthan. Excellent view of golden city from fort top. Good collection of things inside. What we really liked is jain temples and their structure. It was just amazing and breath taking kind of construction. you will feel like clicking every inch of the temple.

title: Wow
review: The Fort is positively fairy tale - the only problem is the issue with water seepage which if not addressed will ultimately destroy the structure.  Some areas have collapsed due to subsidence but until the powers that be move the residents out of the fort, it will only get worse.  The 900 year old fort was never intended for all those people.  Go soon.

title: strolling through havelis
review: carvings of old havelis, some shops, quiet walk, no hassle.

title: Beautiful work on Stone
review: Desert beauty is there in Jaisalmer and besides the fort the narrow alleys as well as the sun set is just perfect

title: Excellent
review: Jaisalmer Fort is still up and Build very brilliantly.

title: Must visit and impressive.
review: It is a remarkable place. It gives you some breathtaking views of the city of Jaisalmer from the various points of the fort. The museum in the fort complex is worth visiting. I stayed within the fort, so I could just take a stroll whenever I felt like walking inside a fort complex.

title: In seek of old indian culture
review: Architecture is as huge as refined.

title: Fort with difference
review: This is the only fort, where outsiders, visitors are staying within the Fort. The Fort planning and defence systems are impressive. A must visit.

title: Jaisalmer for awesome must see
review: Hi Guys.

title: A Living Fort
review: As well as the obvious tourist hot spots, It was great to see people going about their daily lives inside the fort  - it adds character and authenticity.  Also good to see some effort into dealing with the water/drainage issues, as well as some of the outer wall being maintained.  The audio guide for the fort palace was excellent. The artefacts and carving inside the Jain temple were exquisite, but  the guide, while quite informative and helpful, became very greedy and pushy at the end of the tour, which left a bit of a sour taste for us.

title: a honeycomb mirage shimmering and beckoning
review: now beautifully preserved and gleaming with the love of its inhabitants j is so enticing and romantic.i tink you could fal in love eith anybody here even wayne sheek rooney!!!the locals for the most part are fine but  thre is alo of hard sell j is so fab

title: poorly maintained
review: such a good fort not maintained well we do not treasure it

title: Magnifiasco...!
review: The Jaisalmer fort or the Golden fort Or the Sonar Kila.........Is a lovely place. Filled with grandeur, royalty and storing so many stories within itself! Its a place which you must visit, walk through the mystic bylanes, enjoy the views from differnt parts of the city, the rich culture and ravel in the company of loving people. Its so rich in its culture and gives so much of energy that you will instantly fall in love with it!

title: Straight from a fairy tale
review: A fine place to wander and get lost in the little streets.  Lovely things to buy and not too much hassle from the traders, but you can get the same stuff outside the fort for lower prices.

title: Lots of interesting things to see in the Fort Museum.
review: Some of the older forts in Rajhastan had just empty rooms.

title: Highlight of India
review: You will see the Taj Mahal on all India borchures and promotional materials, but trurth to be told, Jaisalmer fort is close second, it should be more prominent in the country's marketing. It is quite an effort to get there, but it is more than worth it. The best way IMHO is to take the overnight train, but you can also fly to Jodhpur, rent a car (with a chaffeur) and drive here.

title: almost like a shopping maze
review: while it is not big, it's not small either. it's enough to get you lost, but with loads of shops around, it is nv too difficult to figure your way out. shops here can either can pushy, or they can be very nice and patient. the buildings inside have a uniform jaisalmer architecture; i only noticed it after i uploaded the pictures onto my computer that building all look similar. perhaps this gave jaisalmer more character than i initially thought. if you can bargain well, prices in the shops are not always more expensive than those outside the fort despite the 'pricier' location of being inside the fort. have fun!

title: Away from the traffic
review: Great place to wander, drink chai and take in the local life and not being pestered to buy.

title: Living fort
review: Jaisalmer fort has been made famous by the film Sonar Kella or Golden Fort. Indeed, the sunset on its yellow sandstone walls makes it aglow with a golden sheen.

title: Sonar Kella
review: This historic fort has Jain Temples - the stone carvings are seen to be believed!

title: Breath taking palace.
review: Get a guide for fort only. Lake is not worth a visit. Nearby their is Jain temple, abandoned city (not worth it), Lodurva city, etc. Must visit market. Their are couple of shops that is endorse by lonely planet, they will rip you off. bargain a lot. A LOT. Their is this surya restaurant on top of Jaiselmer fort with a great view. One of the best lunch i had at the top with million $ view. I spend 3 hours sipping beer and almost ate my fingers. They will make food per your taste. ask for mild if you cannot eat spicy.

title: dirty, filthy fort with guides harassing all visitors
review: frankly, the only place to visit in jaisalmer are the sand dunes.

title: dirty, filthy fort with guides harassing all visitors
review: frankly, the only place to visit in jaisalmer are the sand dunes.

title: An Heritage Experience
review: Experience is good. One can really check the beautiful carvings done on wall. A lots of snap can be clicked.

title: Fantastic & alluring
review: The honey colored fort rising out of the desert won't look like its out of the Arabian Nights thanks to the fast growing town. But its worth every second of the visit.

title: Hassle-free Jaisalmer fort
review: Compared with jodhpur, Jaipur, Delhi and other cities, there is less hassle in Jaisalmer. The shop owners are less agressiv and are sometimes even very funny! Enjoy Jaisalmer.

title: Jaisalmer Fort
review: Very nice fort quite different to those in Jodhpur, Amber, Delhi and Agra. The fort is living city, made from sandstone is a magic place. There you can find nice palace, jain tamples, hindu tamples and many other nice spots sourounded by its habitants daily living.

title: Breathtaking
review: The old fort at the top of the hill is just stunning. It's like stepping back in time. Working your way there through the 'new' town surrounding the fort on the slopes of the hill is an experience, then the fort itself is another entirely.

title: Only Live fort! More than 5000 people still reside in the fort taking you to the ancient age in real.
review: The fort is a must see for all those who love ancient art and architecture. It is astonishing to find the amazing fine cut work & carvings on stone, which looks like wood.

title: Breathtaking
review: The old fort at the top of the hill is just stunning. It's like stepping back in time. Working your way there through the 'new' town surrounding the fort on the slopes of the hill is an experience, then the fort itself is another entirely.

title: Living Fort
review: I used to wonder how people lived in the forts whenever we visited the ruins of forts. We got an opportunity to see this first hand when we visited Jaisalmer Fort.It is one of two living forts in India where the decendants of original inhabitants still live, the other is Chittorgarh. Jaisalmer Fort is very well maintained as people still live there and the best way to explore it is leisurely on foot. There are many winding lanes lined with houses and shops and many restaurants offering fantastic views of the city from their terraces. They offer an amazing variety of local and international food. No one is in a hurry and you can sit as long as you like looking at the views.The daytime and nighttime views are both beautiful. The city has maintained its character and all buildings are made of the glowing yellow sandstone and have traditional architecture. There is not a single building with bright colors or steel and glass. It is charming and just wandering around the city is a visual treat. The people are friendly, honest and hardworking.A lot of hand embroidered bed sheets are available at really good prices ,only thing is they are heavy and you need space in your luggage to carry it back home . We had to pay excess baggage for the first time in our life at the airport but it was worth it.

title: living fort
review: The golden texture of the fort is worth the gold.

title: Over-hyped, better outside than in.
review: It's such a difficult place to get to that expectations are very high on arrival. Sure, it's picturesque, this huge fortress overlooking the low-level buildings in the city but the local people are some of the most aggressive that I've come across in India. From the moment you step out of your taxi/ rickshaw they surround you: camel trips, textiles, guided tours, massages and so on. Once inside it's no better. The pigeons compete with the cows to coat the streets in rancid slime. The locals drag you into their shops most of which sell the usual 'tat'.

title: Not to be missed
review: Mesmerising, Awe Inspiring and an Engineering feat. Definitely recommended!!!

title: The old fort is dying
review: This fort is the only one with 4500 people inside.there are many shops and restaurants inside but the ones outside are better. Do not shop at the fort instead take a walk to the main bazaar there are thousand shops where you can bargain and get the same stuff at 40% cheaper.

title: Beautiful
review: The fort is very beautiful..... On the way into the fort, they are many shops and they all carry beautiful Rajasthani stuff (starting from bags to bedsheets) that you can bring back as souvenirs. Inside the fort, there is an awesome 7-storeyed museum, which  is definitely worth a visit and the audio guides are very helpful. If you talk to the audio guide people nicely, they might give you an extra pair of headphones (the audio guides have two head phone outlets) that you can share with your friend, or just carry your own earphones!

title: Sonar kella
review: Yes satyajit ray made a film here.. Thats called sonar kella or the golden fortress n it is just articulate to name it so. Beautiful. But the only problem here is that its too crowded. Its residential as well. Plus loads of shops. One suggestion would be not to visit any shop within the fort. They charge u more than double and the shopkeepers are not all polite n stuff...if u start bargaining they could go to any extent insulting u. For yellw sandstone articles, there's a shop in the local market called nirmal stores, the person is very nice n prices r reasonable too. Good collection.

title: One of a kind
review: This is probably the only fort in India which is inhabited. There is a bustling town inside the fort and which was fascinating to me. The palace is good and have exquisite works on sandstone. The golden yellow look of the Jaisalmer sandstone itself is amazing. You can have a relaxing cup of coffee sitting in one of the hundreds cafes inside the fort.

title: fort
review: fort is very nice but  we have to cleen much if we want to have lot of viseter in this jaisalmer

title: Amazing Fort - the only living Fort
review: The Jaisalmer fort is one of the most amazing structures. What makes it more interesting is that there are more than 5000 families living inside the Fort.

title: Our first fort in India
review: This was the first of many forts we visited.  We enjoyed strolling around it very much and it was fun to look at the shops etc.

title: Spectacular Glimpse of the Rajputana Fervour
review: One of the most spectacular Forts in the world..teeming with life. Popularly named as 'Sonar kella' , the golden fort by Satyajit Ray, this fort sports an exquisite golden colour because of its pure sandstone. Beautiful museums, live music, terrific views makes it a must visit. Rajasthan trip is incomplete without a flavour of this exquisite attraction.

title: dont feel like as we are in fort
review: this fort is very old but right now some 4k(as said by local guide) people living in this fort ,so you will not feel like that u are roming in some heritage place, its more like a small city with lot of people , shops here and there, dirty, like a small town bazar.

title: An altogether different experience
review: Yes, you could say it's a crowded, dirty place, but it is also so full of history and heritage that the fort shouldn't be missed.  Therefore, put on a good pair of walking shoes, be prepared to dodge motorbikes and cows -- stay alert and keep a sense of humour -- you'll be rewarded with magnificent carved buildings, shops, restaurants, temples. Like other places we visited, I was constantly overwhelmed at how good natured the locals were towards us gawping foreigners!

title: Great location/history, good for souvenir shopping.
review: Great desert fortress rearing out of the sand. A place which should be seen and enjoyed at least once in life. A place to wander down lanes and alleyways, all of which will bring you back to your starting location at some point.

title: timeless
review: Must visit, spend a day in and around the fort and feel the place and how people live and manage their lives

title: Just take a stroll!
review: Enjoyed the historical setting and the quaint street. Disliked the hassle by guys wanting to be your guides & stall holders continually after your custom.  It was nice just to wander aimlessly around and breathe in the history & atmosphere. Also from the ramparts you can get great views of Jaisalmer down below!

title: a must see
review: great place with exotic surroundings...its huge and takes up most of the day

title: amazing
review: do not waste time outside the fort. this place is amazing. just chill put and walk and get lost in the fort! Bargain hard

title: Must visit
review: A very good picturesque location on top of a hill. One of the few forts which have a significant number (>4k) people living inside it. However the lack of maintenance is a dampner. It is something you will like if you not seen a lot of forts across Rajasthan, if that is not the case this particular fort will leave you wanting more. If you vist here do make it a point to vist the roof top restaurants as they offer a good view of the city below.

title: Fantastic view to and from the castle
review: Jaisalmer is a place to dream. One of those place you can easily fall in love with

title: Visit it for sure
review: a must visit for your jaisalmer itenerary..go by walk or take an auto for whole fort sight seeing..also take a guide who will exlain everything about the fort..nice place but currently in bad situation.

title: Fascinating, atmospheric
review: The guide books talk it up and it did not disappoint. The carved stonework on the buildings is out of this world. We were glad we had an outstanding guide called Lalu showing us around- ask for him!

title: Sonar Killa-truly radiating like gold
review: What a magnificent fort,and the world's only living fort as well! Truly,this is one amazing experience!Built in the 11th century,and in the 21st people live here,conduct business,worship deities in temples and attend to travelers.There are beautiful Hindu and Jain temples inside the fort,loads of shops selling souvenirs and handicrafts,many good restaurants,many good hotels to stay and the Palace of the King and the Queen with audio guide facility as well.

title: Mighty romantic
review: The visit to Jain temples was nice, though their schedule seemed a bit erratic... We also enjoyed the Palace very much. The view is very nice from the Palace's rooftop. The kids liked that a lot. The downside is getting a bit harrassed all the time. There is always someone to try to get you to do something or buy something or whatever...

title: badly maintained
review: There is nothing notable to see in the fortress.Its very badly maintained with nothing worth writing home about.It seems the royals ran away with all the worthy things and are using the palace as store room.After visiting Mehrangarh fort, its definitely a dampener!

title: Run Down and dirty
review: The fortress - when we visited 17 years ago - was completely different. It is now dirty and run down. Too many tourists, who continue to mess up the place and abuse the facilities. It was a disappointment for us. The shops sell some very nice stuff and one should find good bargains inside the fort.

title: Very impressive Fortress
review: It's a pleasure to just stroll around in the Fortress and get lost in all the tiny alleys. Lots of shopping and great restaurants.

title: Decaying, needs attention & awareness
review: Residents inside the fort litter the streets freely and open drains and pooping cows add to the mess.  Such a lovely fort is decaying and damaged sections are not being repaired. Wish this lasts another 50 years.

title: awesome
review: Fort is awesome and I also stayed in fort which was the best part of my journey. Jain temple is mind blowing.

title: Dont miss it !
review: This is a piece of history that nobody in the world should miss! Definitely worth many visits!

title: Best fort I saw in Rajasthan
review: Rajasthan palace fort is really beautiful and probably the best palace fort I saw in Rajasthan. The audio guide is also surprisingly informative.

title: Must-visit
review: Great place to shop with plenty of shops selling locally made decorative items and clothes. There is a nice view of the city from the top of the fortress. However, it can be too crowded during the tourist seasons.

title: good fort
review: fort is built in yelloe stone, just like the city. still people reside in the forts. lots of narrow lanes. good view of the city from the top. literally you feel its a golden city

title: Impressive building
review: Great fort, shame about the damage occurring. Good audio tour.

title: Excellent views
review: Nice views. I think the rough trip by bus from Mt Abu or by train from other cities in rajastan or from delhi is worthwhile

title: Truly amazing destination
review: A living city within a fort. Its high points are: (i) several "cannon points" from where one gets soaring views over the city, (ii) the palace museum, with stunning views from the top, (iii) the Jain temple complex. But most of all, the thrill is to just wander down the lanes and alleyways, encounter the occasional beautiful "haveli" (mansion) and experience the lifestyle. Some of the hotels inside the fort are excellent.

title: Almost Overwhelming
review: Jaisalmer Fort is massive and almost overwhelming but most forts are not as big as this one. There is basically a city inside the fort - it is a maze of alleyways and narrow streets. There are about 3,000 people living within the fort's walls. So it is very crowded and dirty. However there are good views of the city from the fort's rooftop. Within the fort there is the everyday life of the people plus things like a palace, Jain temples, shops etc. The Jain temples are quite interesting although very small. Visitors must adhere to strict entry requirements in the Jain temples - no shoes, no leather to be worn and people can't carry anything into the temple. That means having someone stay outside to take care of things like shoes, bags, backpacks, water, and anything else that is carried around to tourist sites. Part of the palace is open to the public and some of the rooms have mirrors and glass tiles everywhere. Wear good walking shoes when going to the fort. It is good to view it from a distance at sunset as the honey-coloured sandstone walls are highlighted by the setting sun.

title: Best fort in Rajasthan
review: I loved this fort because people were living in it and also the incredible carving on the sandstone buildings.  I liked walking through the narrow streets of a lived in fort.

title: Plan ahead.
review: Get there before 11am to check out the Jain Temples - some of them close at 11am, while others only open at 11. Do the Maharaja's palace in the afternoon.

title: Nice Live-in fort...but dirty!
review: The fort, an interesting piece of architecture  with 90+ citadels is an interesting visit, I had the opportunity of staying inside it so was able to observe it closely. While the fort architecture is grand and impressive there is nothing worthwile on a closer view. the population inside the fort has increased over the years and so have the problems associated with it. unfortunately the fort was not meant for so many inhabitants and today is killing it.

title: First Fort to have in habitants
review: Its more like a village view rather than fort. Entire jaisalmer town could be seen from top of the fort . Many shops /hotels and local residents makes it a lively place. Golden temple is most beautiful.

title: stunning place
review: A great place to spend a few days, away from the bustle of normal Indian cities, but still high in colour and emotion. Pity about the  motorbykes which are really out of place in the narrow streets, and the fact that they do not stop the traffic outside the gates. The place is definitely under heavy pressure by tourism, but still has lots of charm: go soon!

title: cheap places,
review: You find cheap places inside the fortress, perhaps 300 rps for three beds

title: Get lost in the narrow lanes
