review: Lovely lod city with beautiful old havelis to see and an incredible Jain Temple only slight problem are the motor bikes which you have to try and avoid when walking around the very narrow lanes

title: Very close to hotel - Atmospheric.
review: Interesting audio tour. Lovely and reasonable shop!

title: superb
review: it great to see in morning and at sunset . it is better to take guide with us.gates to enter the fortress are really unique. just take care of the cows.residents of the fortress have made it little dirty there.

title: Its only 650-700 meters away from Hotel
review: The fortress has many beautiful things to offer you but just be prepared for some garbage laying here and there on the way to the fortress

title: Not worth the effort
review: All souvenir shops and cows.  Compared to all the other Forts at Bikaner, Jodhpur, etc. not at all nice.  Very little but forcible discussions with vendors and guides.  Cows to be followed and be wary of.  Naturally much dirt to avoid.

title: beer at sunset
review: I liked it at night when there were very few people around,amazing sunsets.

title: Must visit
review: Great site with lots of historical importance, but definitely need more affectionate care. Its really unique to have people still leaving inside the fort, but why some measures cannot be taken to maintain it properly ? It deserves much better maintainance, and love from the people whose lives are dependent on this fort only!

title: Golden City brilliance
review: Lucky enough to stay inside the fortress, great views across the rooftops from our hotel restaurant, narrow alleyways packed with all the colour and vibrancy one expects from an Indian bazaar, mind the motorcycles, (and cows). Loads of bargains to be had and very friendly people.

title: Magnificient fort
review: The fort was beautiful from outside. The Jain temple in the fort is huge and marvelous. The crafting in the temple is amazing. The fort is like a village. The houses in the fort looks pleasing. The shopping in the fort is a experience. Everything is there in the fort whether is it shops, restaurant, hotels, parlors of anything.

title: Desert dreams
review: The only lived in fort made Jaisalmer unique. I loved the winding labrinyth-like alleys. There is a better vibe among the locals without the hostile traffic situation you experience everywhere else. Some great shopping to do and places to look down on the town and over the desert.

title: Beautiful Architecture
review: This is a living fort. Most of the buildings are of sandstones, with beautiful carved designs. The Jain temples are worth visiting. Avoid shopping inside the fort as the same articles are available at much cheaper rates in the city markets. How ever, if you decide to shop, bargain heavily.

title: Huge and full of life
review: This si a huge fortress with all the hustle and bustle of a town inside. Don't expect a castle, it's more like a mini city. Really lively and can be very busy. Plenty of hawkers, but all good natured. Jain temple should not be missed.

title: People Still Live here
review: Very Conjusted lane inside the Fort. Good Jain Temple. With out Guide, you will be lost. Worth seeing.

title: The Fort is a Must Visit
review: The fort is just beautiful and when one sees it in the Night all Lit up, it is just Gorgeous. I just wish though the Government would do something about all the Vehicles that are allowed to drive in and all the Shopkeepers that are allowed inside. The Maintenance of this Fort is sorely needed but as of now sadly all these drickshaw/taxi drivers, the shopkeepers who make money bacause of the fort do not seem to realize that if the fort is ruined, so is their income then.

title: living fort
review: We visited some Jain temples and old merchant houses. It was interesting to walk around the old streets.

title: What a dump
review: After visiting many other beautiful forts in Rajasthan, this one should be skipped. It is filthy beyond belief, cow dung everywhere so you can't even walk. Dead rats too. Inside the fort is a crowded village of hotels, shops and restaurants all vying for your money. The fort is not being managed, preserved or properly taken care of for the future. Save your time and spend an extra day in Udaipur or Jodhpur.

title: A unique fort
review: a unique fort which is still alive. Around 40000 people stay inside the fort. A very well architectured fort. built over 850 years ago. the stone carvings are spectacular. the bylanes inside the fort willl take in a different world altogether.

title: jesulmer very fantastic fort in Golden city
review: The Jaisalmer Fort is surrounded by a mud-colored wall, which looks golden when it is illuminated by the sun. Therefore, Jaisalmer is also called the "Golden City". The fort is situated on a hill above the town and is reached by four goals. Within the fort, the palace is found, which is also partly accessible. It is interesting to walk through the picturesque streets lined with shops, where you can watch the locals living there in the daily activities that take place mainly outside the building.

title: Majestic
review: Viewed from the outside it is truly majestic.  Once in the fort, the only living fort in India, it is dirty, crowded and no regard is given to one of the unique heritage monuments in India. What a pity. The Jain temples have intricate carvings- do not miss them. But the scant respect of the locals in matters of hygiene and preservation, leaves one very disillusioned and sad.

title: Impressive
review: Impressive castle, so rude as the reality of life in the desert.

title: Fort is quite wonderful
review: Fort is quite wonderful, a structure built over rough and tough wood !!!

title: Terrific place - visit while it's still standing
review: Touts abound here, try to make sure you get a proper guide.  As a living museum of back streets and alleys, a guide is very useful.  We found a cheeky young man who said he was only doing it to practice his English and no doubt he says the same to all nationalities.  Nonetheless, he was very knowledgeable about it's history and religion.  The stone carving in the Jain temples is quite amazing.

title: amazing, living fort
review: We loved the Jaisalmer Fort, as it was so vibrant and bursting with life. Had a great guide who really enriched our visit without giving us too much information. The Jain temple in the fort is a must,  then with our guide we did a walk through the old town, visiting the havelis and even stopping at a preschool where the children sang to us.

title: Jaisalmer
review: very beautiful desert fortress wint an amazing and peaceful sunset

title: Simply the best
review: What more could you want from an ancient fortress? Temples, a living city and the imaginations stetches back in time.

title: A Must See
review: The primary reason for visiting Jaisalmer is this place.

title: Jaisalmer SM
review: A fortress on an outcrop and you can't walk round the ramparts !!. There is only so much fascination in looking at other peoples houses in narrow alleyways, that were often very messy, and dingy. Not for me I'm afraid

title: Huge and very nice Fort
review: The fortress to me is comparable to the Edinburgh Palace in Scotland. Situated on top of the hill overlooking the city of Jaisalmer. Historically preserved and very interesting to spend an afternoon.

title: It's stunning
review: The Jaisalmer Fort is just amazing. We visited the Fort around three hours and it was stunning. There is no entrance fee, but there are a lot of fake or real guides around, they going to show you around for a small tip. But actually if you have a travel guide then you don’t need a guide. The fort is not just sightseeing it’s also shopping because the narrow little streets are full of little shops, which are selling scarf’s, antiques, books and many more things.  There are several places where you can climb up the wall from the fort and enjoying a wonderful view from Jaisalmer. Also if you are hungry or thirsty there are plenty of restaurants and coffees around. It a really nice sight and you shouldn’t miss it. It’s really to recommend.

title: a magic vision in the desert
review: Jaisalmer fortress is really special ,wonderful walled fortress , lived in ,but small enough to amble around and sit in moghul bay windows looking over the the landscape. I believe tourists using too much water are making the wonderful sandstone walls week , so it is important to stay outside the city , but tou can enjoy the feeling in restaurants like little italy ( wonderful cushions on a terrace and even a place to sit on a bastion!

title: living fort
review: Normally in India fort means monuments and memory of ancient time. But when you will come at jaisalmer. it is totally surprised  living fort. People lives here. It is really the golden fort and golden city.

title: Jaisalmer fort is not an attractive fort like any other fort in india
review: Once you take a autorickshaw and reach top ,you will be surprised It did not even give the feel of a fort. just the unmaintained palace with bad smell of pigeon litter.Not too good.Only three jain temples and canon worth viewing.

title: Nice but lots of people trying to get your business
review: As with anywhere remotely tourist like in India there where people trying to get your attention. One shop keeper even followed us into a restaurant and waited until we finished to try and take us to his shop! Views ok but spoilt by wind turbines... Nice old stone buildings though, worth a visit!

title: Chaos in desert
review: Actually the fort looks regal from the Jaisalmer town --resplendent in yellow sandstone. Another ingredient used is fossil stone. The fort can be visible from a distance and  numerous film shootings have made it famous. Satyajit Roy filmed Sonar Killa  here. But once you enter the fort, this one resembles a poor cousin to the other forts that we visited--Chittaurgarh, Amer, Mehrangarh, Kumbhalgarh. This is  like a village fair, and with so many families residing there, it has become a maze of dirty by lanes. Except for the Jain temple, and some Jaisalmer architecture on the walls, the major nuisance are the vendors--all selling  poor quality stuff. Better come outside in the main market and buy authentic stuff.

title: Jaislamer
review: It is not an easy thing to get to the Jaisalmer Fortress (journey takes about 18 hours by train  form Delhi), but it is definitely worth it. Jaislamer it self is quite a small town (especially by Indian standards), but still quite dirty, with plenty of trash lying all over the city.

title: Genuine Experience walking through the old fort
review: We spent a few days in the fort in November 2010, walking the side streets, stepping in and out of the little shops and visiting the very good fort museum and Jane temples.

title: wonderful attraction of Jaisalmer India
review: This is the beautful ancient fort  claimed to be more than 8oo years old, constructed  in the mid of city on the hillock in the triangle shape, one has to climb up crosing  four  big gates.

title: Heritage at its massive best!
review: This is one majestic must-see fortress..the labyrinth of stairs takes one in different rooms which preserve the rich heritage of rajasthan. The grandeur and opulence of the maharajas is strikingly evident as one walks through the pathways. The Jain temples within the fort complex are very beautiful as well with thier intricate carvings. You can easily spend 3-4 hours once inside this fort complex.

title: Magnificent and alive
review: Amazingly brilliant and still evident of the lives of the common people, the warriors, the priests, and the elite. One of the biggest forts in the world and yet so approachable. The insides of the fort are filled with historical and current livelihood and culture inhabiting this beautiful 3-layered piece of architecture and majesty.

title: Unique Fort
review: The only live in fort to visit in India. Providing an unique experience of history and culture. Jain Temples are exquisite. Carving all around the fort will leave you spellbound. Palace museum is worth visiting.

title: The living fort
review: Fort was bombastic,must experience it.The possibilities of endurence of old people was shown in a good manner.

title: Free fort good, paid for bit really poor
review: Careful - good reviews are for the lived in section of the fort. The Palace Museum (often called the fort) is a waste of time and money, and an expensive one! It looks pretty from outside, but there is little to see inside. No access to ramparts or views out except a small terrace at the top - where views are little better than from the many rooftop bars and restaurants. Overpriced, overcrowded, and underwhelming about sums it up.

title: Jaisal Fort: Confusing enough
review: Good and interesting fact: The whole fort is still alive and between the walls lives a city. The Part/Palace exists and seems very small from outside. The pieces which are on display makes one wonder whether this really was a palace at one time, or is it now turned into a small museum. Honestly, did not find anything in there which was impressive. The place is under control of the current royal heir and one can see that the place is not well kept.

title: The Marrakech of India !
review: This place is highly underrated. Indians pay a pretty penny to walk the quaint streets of Santorini and Morocco when they have an equivalent gem in their backyard. Windy streets, boutique cafes, street shops, smiling faces and 500 year old history come together in this fort !

title: Living Fort
review: The Golden City of India jaisalmer having Golden fort Sonar Kila. The whole fort made by yellow sandstone as well city. Stone polish used for painting. Lot of general house in city and inside fort function invitation painted for memories.

title:
Bewohnte Festung aus gelben Sandstein 
Fort made of Yellowstones sandstone
review: Crowded fort on top on the hill. Yellow sandstone with golden shine. Lot of small shops, but nice cafes also. Some of it offer a nice few over the old city ... and the far Dessert.

title: Golden fort
review: The fort has a gr8 view from the terrace top ,including restraunt view. The fort entrance is free but there is another mahal inside which has entry fee. Its a mini city where u can roam around & explore small shops ,artifacts & restro.

title: One of best golden fort
review: One of  best fort in jaisalmer

title: Overall okay but a bit pricy for what you got
review: The fort is okay, nothing really incredible... The audio-guide is a must as it tells you a lot of interesting things. The view is good tho. It's a bit expensive so not really a must,

title: Unique Fort
review: The only live in fort to visit in India. Providing an unique experience of history and culture. Jain Temples are exquisite. Carving all around the fort will leave you spellbound. Palace museum is worth visiting.

title: Jaisal Fort: Confusing enough
review: Good and interesting fact: The whole fort is still alive and between the walls lives a city. The Part/Palace exists and seems very small from outside. The pieces which are on display makes one wonder whether this really was a palace at one time, or is it now turned into a small museum. Honestly, did not find anything in there which was impressive. The place is under control of the current royal heir and one can see that the place is not well kept.

Overpriced, overcrowded, and underwhelming about sums it up.

title: Overall okay but a bit pricy for what you got
review: The fort is okay, nothing really incredible... The audio-guide is a must as it tells you a lot of interesting things. The view is good tho. It's a bit expensive so not really a must,

title: One of best golden fort
review: One of  best fort in jaisalmer

review: The only live in fort to visit in India. Providing an unique experience of history and culture. Jain Temples are exquisite. Carving all around the fort will leave you spellbound. Palace museum is worth visiting.

review: Careful - good reviews are for the lived in section of the fort. The Palace Museum (often called the fort) is a waste of time and money, and an expensive one! Overpriced, overcrowded, and underwhelming about sums it up.

title: Jaisal Fort: Confusing enough

title: Overall okay but a bit pricy for what you got
review: The fort is okay, nothing really incredible... The audio-guide is a must as it tells you a lot of interesting things. The view is good tho. It's a bit expensive so not really a must,

title: One of best golden fort
review: One of  best fort in jaisalmer

title: Unique Fort
review: The only live in fort to visit in India. Providing an unique experience of history and culture. Jain Temples are exquisite. Carving all around the fort will leave you spellbound. Palace museum is worth visiting.

title: The living fort
review: Fort was bombastic,must experience it.The possibilities of endurence of old people was shown in a good manner.

title: Free fort good, paid for bit really poor
review: Careful - good reviews are for the lived in section of the fort. The Palace Museum (often called the fort) is a waste of time and money, and an expensive one! It looks pretty from outside, but there is little to see inside. No access to ramparts or views out except a small terrace at the top - where views are little better than from the many rooftop bars and restaurants. Overpriced, overcrowded, and underwhelming about sums it up.

title: Living Fort
review: The Golden City of India jaisalmer having Golden fort Sonar Kila. The whole fort made by yellow sandstone as well city. Stone polish used for painting. Lot of general house in city and inside fort function invitation painted for memories.

title: The Marrakech of India !
review: This place is highly underrated. Indians pay a pretty penny to walk the quaint streets of Santorini and Morocco when they have an equivalent gem in their backyard. Windy streets, boutique cafes, street shops, smiling faces and 500 year old history come together in this fort !

title: Jaisal Fort: Confusing enough
review: Good and interesting fact: The whole fort is still alive and between the walls lives a city. The Part/Palace exists and seems very small from outside. The pieces which are on display makes one wonder whether this really was a palace at one time, or is it now turned into a small museum. Honestly, did not find anything in there which was impressive. The place is under control of the current royal heir and one can see that the place is not well kept.

title: Jaisal Fort: Confusing enough
review: Good and interesting fact: The whole fort is still alive and between the walls lives a city. The Part/Palace exists and seems very small from outside. The pieces which are on display makes one wonder whether this really was a palace at one time, or is it now turned into a small museum. Honestly, did not find anything in there which was impressive. The place is under control of the current royal heir and one can see that the place is not well kept.

title: The Marrakech of India !
review: This place is highly underrated. Indians pay a pretty penny to walk the quaint streets of Santorini and Morocco when they have an equivalent gem in their backyard. Windy streets, boutique cafes, street shops, smiling faces and 500 year old history come together in this fort !

title:

review: Crowded fort on top on the hill. Yellow sandstone with golden shine. Lot of small shops, but nice cafes also. Some of it offer a nice few over the old city ... and the far Dessert.

review: The fort is okay, nothing really incredible... The audio-guide is a must as it tells you a lot of interesting things. The view is good tho. It's a bit expensive so not really a must,

review: The only live in fort to visit in India. Providing an unique experience of history and culture. Jain Temples are exquisite. Carving all around the fort will leave you spellbound. Palace museum is worth visiting.

title: Free fort good, paid for bit really poor
review: Careful - good reviews are for the lived in section of the fort. The Palace Museum (often called the fort) is a waste of time and money, and an expensive one! It looks pretty from outside, but there is little to see inside. No access to ramparts or views out except a small terrace at the top - where views are little better than from the many rooftop bars and restaurants. Overpriced, overcrowded, and underwhelming about sums it up.

review: The Golden City of India jaisalmer having Golden fort Sonar Kila. The whole fort made by yellow sandstone as well city. Stone polish used for painting. Lot of general house in city and inside fort function invitation painted for memories.

title: Free fort good, paid for bit really poor
review: Careful - good reviews are for the lived in section of the fort. The Palace Museum (often called the fort) is a waste of time and money, and an expensive one! It looks pretty from outside, but there is little to see inside. No access to ramparts or views out except a small terrace at the top - where views are little better than from the many rooftop bars and restaurants. Overpriced, overcrowded, and underwhelming about sums it up.

title: Jaisal Fort: Confusing enough
review: Good and interesting fact: The whole fort is still alive and between the walls lives a city. The Part/Palace exists and seems very small from outside. The pieces which are on display makes one wonder whether this really was a palace at one time, or is it now turned into a small museum. Honestly, did not find anything in there which was impressive. The place is under control of the current royal heir and one can see that the place is not well kept.

title: The Marrakech of India !
review: This place is highly underrated. Indians pay a pretty penny to walk the quaint streets of Santorini and Morocco when they have an equivalent gem in their backyard. Windy streets, boutique cafes, street shops, smiling faces and 500 year old history come together in this fort !

review: Careful - good reviews are for the lived in section of the fort. The Palace Museum (often called the fort) is a waste of time and money, and an expensive one! It looks pretty from outside, but there is little to see inside. No access to ramparts or views out except a small terrace at the top - where views are little better than from the many rooftop bars and restaurants. Overpriced, overcrowded, and underwhelming about sums it up.

title: Overall okay but a bit pricy for what you got
review: The fort is okay, nothing really incredible... The audio-guide is a must as it tells you a lot of interesting things. The view is good tho. It's a bit expensive so not really a must,

title:
Bewohnte Festung aus gelben Sandstein 
Fort made of Yellowstones sandstone
review: Crowded fort on top on the hill. Yellow sandstone with golden shine. Lot of small shops, but nice cafes also. Some of it offer a nice few over the old city ... and the far Dessert.

title: The Marrakech of India !
review: This place is highly underrated. Indians pay a pretty penny to walk the quaint streets of Santorini and Morocco when they have an equivalent gem in their backyard. Windy streets, boutique cafes, street shops, smiling faces and 500 year old history come together in this fort !

title: Golden fort
review: The fort has a gr8 view from the terrace top ,including restraunt view. The fort entrance is free but there is another mahal inside which has entry fee. Its a mini city where u can roam around & explore small shops ,artifacts & restro.

title: The Marrakech of India !

title: Jaisal Fort: Confusing enough
review: Good and interesting fact: The whole fort is still alive and between the walls lives a city. The Part/Palace exists and seems very small from outside. The pieces which are on display makes one wonder whether this really was a palace at one time, or is it now turned into a small museum. Honestly, did not find anything in there which was impressive. The place is under control of the current royal heir and one can see that the place is not well kept.
